reviews: My five year old really likes these.

Innocent smoothies are a firm favourite in our house, with apple and blackcurrant the most popular. We're also fans of the environment and like paper straws, unfortunately they're not strong enough to get through the packaging making this useless as a kids lunch snack. I hope the packaging design is rectified soon to get these drinks back to 5 stars.
Really like buying these especially when on offer. They taste great. perfect for lunches etc..
I get these as a treat sometimes for the kids. They get very excited! So I guess that says it all.
This is his favourite flavour. Great little packaging. Perfect for lunch boxes.
These go down a treat and theyre a brilliant way to get fruit!
My five year old really likes these.

Innocent smoothies are a firm favourite in our house, with apple and blackcurrant the most popular. We're also fans of the environment and like paper straws, unfortunately they're not strong enough to get through the packaging making this useless as a kids lunch snack. I hope the packaging design is rectified soon to get these drinks back to 5 stars.
Really like buying these especially when on offer. They taste great. perfect for lunches etc..
I get these as a treat sometimes for the kids. They get very excited! So I guess that says it all.
This is his favourite flavour. Great little packaging. Perfect for lunch boxes.
These go down a treat and theyre a brilliant way to get fruit!
My daughter absolutely loves this! So do I, adults enjoy this too
Bit pricey if not on offer but you do get what you pay for. Fresh tasting

High in sugar but plenty of goodness in there. I actually bought them for my husband as he has to have blood taken regularly, and these give him a boost before the drive home. I tried one myself and they're very tasty, nice smooth texture and appealing colour. The packaging is attractive and convenient and has different games and puzzles on the back of each one for kids to play with.
Great way to get vitamins into a child who doesnt like fruit.  Still working on getting the fibre in!
I like the fact that there is no added sugar or artificial ingredients in the innocent smoothies and my kids love them, a good way to get extra fruit into them

Not my kind of thing, but a regular buy in my house for the children and they love them. Only criticism is the tricky packaging - hard to get the straw out of the cellophane, then into the little hole at the top.

my children love innocent smoothies and the tip on the packaging to freeze them was perfect last summer keep it in mind it will be here sooner than you think - time flies when your having innocent fun!
A great way of giving your kids one of their 5-a-day - especiallyas they come in many different flavours and have no additives or added sugar

I like this broth and I like garden peas, but I really dont think they go together. Edamame beans are a much better flavour fit for the Thai-style spicing. More edamame beans and ditch the peas, please!
Lots of chicken but way too spicy to enjoy.
So many peas, actually more than broth! Maybe got a third of a mug of broth. Slightly too sweet. Not balanced at all. Not spicy. Wouldnt but again. Happy to try others. Bailey and Sage is incredible

I buy several of these a week and my family love them, however I have noticed the amount of chicken has been reduced drastically. It used to be a filling soup with chunks of chicken, now just a few shreds.
Very tasty chicken soup. It helped me to recover from a nasty flu and get my energies back very quickly. Yum yum yum!
A wholesome super delicious fragrant soup with just the right amount of chicken and vegetables. This is all about the broth. I can eat this everyday.

I like this broth and I like garden peas, but I really dont think they go together. Edamame beans are a much better flavour fit for the Thai-style spicing. More edamame beans and ditch the peas, please!
Lots of chicken but way too spicy to enjoy.
So many peas, actually more than broth! Maybe got a third of a mug of broth. Slightly too sweet. Not balanced at all. Not spicy. Wouldnt but again. Happy to try others. Bailey and Sage is incredible

I buy several of these a week and my family love them, however I have noticed the amount of chicken has been reduced drastically. It used to be a filling soup with chunks of chicken, now just a few shreds.
Very tasty chicken soup. It helped me to recover from a nasty flu and get my energies back very quickly. Yum yum yum!
A wholesome super delicious fragrant soup with just the right amount of chicken and vegetables. This is all about the broth. I can eat this everyday.

I bought this soup based on the number of good reviews.  Oh, it also helped that it was on offer.
I was unimpressed. The quantity is stingy. Based on the nutrition info it looks as though this is meant for 2 people. There is not nearly enough for 2 people.
We added noodles to bulk it out into a decent lunch. 
The soup itself is pleasantly flavoured but quite unpleasant to look at. It has the appearance of a cheap tinned soup, dull and murky looking veg.
Disappointed!

Absolutely love this soup. Definite chilli kick but just right. Lots of veg and chicken, although the amounts of these can vary a bit between packs.  Easy to add some noodles to it if wanted, but portion size is just fine for me. . Its a bit pricey, but Ive bought lots when on offer and froze them. I probably have 3 packs a week. Do agree packaging could be looked at, as currently not recyclable.
Makes a lovely healthy lunch. Warming and delicious and packed with veggies

I was hesitant about trying this as sometimes broths are a bit bland and the veg just bulls it out, wrong! Its so delicious just the right amount of heat and the chicken and veg was very generous. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Great for a light meal. Feels nutritious and has a well balanced flavour.

It is a nice spice, you can feel it when you eat it.
Really good broth, crunchy veg. Lovely chicken. Excellent!
not worth creating waste that lasts hundreds of years, just for a convenient lunch. daylesford know about this as they print that the plastic is not recyclable on their packaging.

This is a very spicy soup, it has lots  flavour very filling and nourishing.  You can eat it straight up or make it a base for home-made soup.  I served it with some hot buttered toast, My husband said it was delicious and he loved the spiciness.  It was very filling and satisfying. Lots of uses for this bone broth. Can also be frozen.
Very much enjoyed this, a bit like hot and sour soup. Tasty chicken within, overall delicious and will buy again

This soup is just wonderful, you really feel it doing you good. It is clear and nutritious and surprisingly filling with lovely flavours and aromas. I will certainly stock up when on offer, as it is so useful to have on hand in the freezer for when illness strikes.
Deliciously comforting chicken broth.
A LOVELY SOUP. LIGHT, CLEAR AND A INTERESTING TASTE.  LOST ONE STAR BECAUSE I ONLY HAD THREE VERY VERY SMALL PIECES OF CHICKEN, WHICH I FIND A BIT MEAN CONSIDERING THE PRICE

This is beautiful! The chilli is like a mild white pepper taste. The lemongrass is ever so subtle it's like it's barely there. A lot of 'ruffage' in there to make it a substantial soup for lunch. I am looking forward to it popping up on a flash sale again but I will probably buy it as a treat as well. Thus review is from someone who eats vegetarian 90% of the time too!
An amazing nourishing soup that was all the family could manage when sick with the virus.... A life saver !!

I bought this in a flash sale and Im so glad I did! It is so tasty and has a depth of flavour I could never achieve making my own bone broth at home. The spice level is very minimal and just right for my tastes. Feel like its quite expensive to buy full price but would buy it again if on offer - lovely treat with some added noodles!
Fab flavour
Full of flavour, texture, earthy.

Would seriously live of these if I could. Perfect meal for one, just on its own. For two it can be boosted with some noodles and even a half tin of coconut milk. 

I make a lot of my own soups and asian-style broths but there is no way I could get this flavour without a serious kitchen team. The list of ingredients is exquisite and the taste really is beautiful. 

Have recommended this to so many people. Try and get it when it's on special. It freezes really well.
Bought this in a flash sale and husband proclaimed it the best soup ever! Delicious spicy broth lots of depth of flavour and good chunks of chicken. With noodles added would make a good meal.

This really is a quite marvellous soup with a fresh and unique flavour. A lovely beefy, slightly sour flavour with small pieces of chicken and lots of interesting herbs and spices. The only thing is it doesnt have much nutritional value for the money, it really is a broth rather than a meal.
This is wholesome and filling.
So satisfying and healthy! My favourite quick dinner
This is so tasty. Spicy  but great to have something handy in the fridge for when I don't have time to make lunch. It has no nasties or horrid preservatives it and the packaging is minimal.
I don't like too much spice but I do like a little bit of heat. This was perfect for me. The nicest bone broth I have eaten-  I just wish it wasn't so expensive.

Absolutely love this - even more when on offer!
Lovely and spicy - not plain and boring spicy - this is for proper chilli lovers.  Not too hot it'll burn for ages,  but a proper chilli kick.  Hope they keep doing this one.

I really enjoy this soup for lunch. Not too spicy for me, but my 5-year old didnt enjoy the chilli. I added one whole squeezed lime, salt and quinoa as I had some leftover (not necessary though) and it was delicious. Very pleasantly surprised and will buy this every week.
Broth for the soul
Recommended. Although one packet not really enough for two people! x
This is essentially a really spicy broth with not much other filling.  We found the chilli overpowering, and the soup just too watery.
Full of flavours. Delicious.
I regularly buy the chicken & gjnger broth thought we could give this a go. Yum! Loved the flavours! Warming and tasty. On this week's list!
Plenty of chicken and veg with beautiful flavours

I've put off buying any of these for ages because they're so expensive compared to other soup options. But now we're home so much I just wanted a treat. I got it! This is such a nice lunch. Flavours are well-balanced, loads of shredded chicken that actually looks like meat rather than weird lumps. Love them and will try more on the 3 for £12 deal.

We buy this most weeks. Adding rice noodles makes it a light, healthy and tasty meal for two.  The mix of vegetables varies, as does the amount of chicken, but the chicken is always nice (no ucky bits). There have been more peas than soya beans in the last couple of batches but it is fresh so guess it varies with seasonal availability.
I love Thai soup and I was thrilled when I bought this one ... taste is quite nice, not very Thai though ... and there is just too much peas .. would not buy again. Sorry Ocado.
Ordinary chicken broth with no kick whatsoever -
A delicious soup ruined by a nasty heap of mealy, grey, revolting peas.
We added some rice noodles to toss and it made for a delicious lunch. Great flavour!
Soup was full of flavour and lots of chicken and veg. Will definitely buy again. Bit expensive - so better with an offer!
This is delicious, I have a cold and feel it did me the world of good. However about 90% of the solid content were peas, a very cheap filler in an expensive soup so deducted a star
I really wanted to like the soup as I like the other Daylesford chicken soup but I was not keen in the flavours of this soup.
This is so good, really tasty.It does have a little spicy kick to it, mostly ginger though not heat.
Mine had nowhere near the amount of veg as in the picture hence the loss of a star, however tasted nice and will buy again hopefully the next one will have more vegetables then it will be perfect.
Delicious fragrant broth!  Worthy of five stars!
This is so good and very low calorie. Slight kick and love the lemongrass and ginger. Will be in my weekly shop.
This soup has just the right amount of heat for me. I thought that it was very tasty.

It was very tasty, right amount of salt for a hot and sour soup which is supposed to be fairly salty. Good veg and chicken and just the right hint of spice which really helped me breathe being as I was suffering from a cold. Will be buying it again, specially if I'm poorly.

All I did was wash it, placed on foil with several whole and unpeeled garlic cloves and a few sprigs of rosemary and thyme, rubbed with olive oil then added salt and pepper. I tighy wrapped it all in the foil and  roasted for 2.5 hours at 180 c fan. When everything else was ready, I cut the top and mashed in butter, salt and pepper, put the lid back on, wrapped it back up in the foil and took to the table. Everyone just spooned out what they wanted. It has a wow factor, was delicious and so easy to cook!!
Why??? Totally unnecessary, typical from M&S to plastic wrap, awful!
Why the need for plastic wrap?? M&S really need to get their act together on this issue
I order celeriac regularly and it usually arrives with a date shorter than the 3 days advertised.
Celeriac itself was fine but tiny! Not much bigger than your average grapefruit so had to go and buy another in order to make the meal I had planned.
Like everyone else, I'm annoyed and frustrated by the wholly unnecessary plastic wrapping... the celeriac itself, however, is excellent, and a decent size which is a relief when buying food online.

All I did was wash it, placed on foil with several whole and unpeeled garlic cloves and a few sprigs of rosemary and thyme, rubbed with olive oil then added salt and pepper. I tighy wrapped it all in the foil and  roasted for 2.5 hours at 180 c fan. When everything else was ready, I cut the top and mashed in butter, salt and pepper, put the lid back on, wrapped it back up in the foil and took to the table. Everyone just spooned out what they wanted. It has a wow factor, was delicious and so easy to cook!!
Why??? Totally unnecessary, typical from M&S to plastic wrap, awful!
Why the need for plastic wrap?? M&S really need to get their act together on this issue
I order celeriac regularly and it usually arrives with a date shorter than the 3 days advertised.
Celeriac itself was fine but tiny! Not much bigger than your average grapefruit so had to go and buy another in order to make the meal I had planned.
Like everyone else, I'm annoyed and frustrated by the wholly unnecessary plastic wrapping... the celeriac itself, however, is excellent, and a decent size which is a relief when buying food online.

The first celeriac I bought was fresh enough but for the price paid it was unacceptably small - about the size of a grapefruit. Tried again this month and it was slightly bigger but still only 760g in weight. In all the main supermarkets including Waitrose the celeriac is priced per Kg and I wish Ocado would do the same or at least guarantee a minimum weight as Morrisons do online (900g). The latest purchase does not look very fresh either - wrapped in plastic but already overly brown on the cut faces on day of delivery.  Due to the small size I had to go out to purchase a 2nd celeriac locally and it's far better in size and quality than the M&S offering. Tried M&S celeriac on Ocado twice now and there will not be a third time!

Fresh, crunchy, makes great low carb chips, even the teenager liked them.  However, after several weeks of buying this item it suddenly halved in size so I have re-written the review and deducted a star.  Like one of the other reviewers said, there really ought to be a minimum weight!
A VEGETABLE THAT CAN BE INCLUDED IN A NUMBER OF DISHES.
What can I say it is fresh crunchy and perfect
Always fresh and crunchy.  Good size.
Good size, and made a delicious soup. Will buy again.
This is just like back home. Essential for a good chicken soup.

My 7 year old, husband and myself really enjoyed this celeriac as an alternative to potoato in our stew and also roasted.  Absolutely delighted and cannot wait to order some more.  Lovely sweet and nutty flavour.
As per all the m&s veg, the quality is amazing - beautiful celeriac with which I created a great soup!
Made lovely celeriac soup will be buying again
I’ve bought this three times now and each time I’ve received a large, fresh celeriac. Season ends next month so will see how it goes.
Not worth it, extremely small and old
Great quality celeriac, well trimmed and easy to prepare. Love that it's usually from British farms.
The size is good. Its a celeriac. Minus points for plastic shrink wrap.
perfect size - not too small, not too big. The flavour was good and very fresh when I made remoulade.
Ocado's previous celeriac was often very small, but this lovely veg was a much better size. Perfect for roasting, soup, and a bubble and squeak ham hock hash!

Personally I love my celeriac roasted so I chopped this up in some olive oil salt and pepper and then in the oven for half an hour also until soft. I find you get quite a lot for one celeriac so I have any leftovers heated up and added to my lunchtime salad, which also works very well.
Agree these are quite expensive for what they are but they do last well.  Use mainly in mash and thai currys.
Wish the weight of these could be stated. Pretty expensive given its small size.
We bought two because of the other reviews which has left us with way more celeriac than we need. Both were the same size, around 750g, and very good quality
Unlike other reviewers, the one we received was a good size, fresh and tasty. Will buy again!
Very tasty celeriac - we had it mashed with swede and carrots- delicious.
I was astonished to find there is no minimum weight specified here. If you wonder why this is, it's tiny, about the size of a medium sized apple.
Absolutely delicious mashed! Wonderful flavour. Perfect for those on diets. Versatile side dish for almost anything.
Anybody else ever seen a celeriac for sale that is the size of a small person's palm?  Me neither! Difficult to imagine what will be left after peeling.  What's happened to M&S?
Inferior to the other MS products. The Waitrose Celeriac was much better.
I added lemonade to this, and it has a lovely fruity taste, but it does have a thicker texture than normal fruit juices, which means I'll probably stick to other juices.  Nice for every now and then.

This is more of a watery smoothie or a juice with too much gritty pulp. A sludge, if you will. Did not enjoy it and would not buy again. The bottle came noticeably puffed up like it had started to go off already, even though it had weeks on the date. Only thing good about it was the actual fruit flavour.
This has a nice flavour but the texture is a bit weird and is more smoothieish
This was not juice, it was a slightly watered down smoothie. Didn't enjoy it at all

The initial flavour is fruity but there is a strange, vegetal aftertaste which is very unpleasant and, to us, undrinkable. We opened a second container and that also had the same lingering taste of vegetable water. I tried a 50/50 mix with lemonade but that aftertaste was so strong it still came through. 
I would expect much better from M&S. There was nothing in the list of ingredients that could explain this flavour. 
I usually avoid buying anything in a container which cannot be either re-used or re-cycled but this product was supplied as a substitute. That's two reasons not to buy the product again.
I found this slightly more bitter than expected. Not unpleasant but was expecting a bit more mango.
I added lemonade to this, and it has a lovely fruity taste, but it does have a thicker texture than normal fruit juices, which means I'll probably stick to other juices.  Nice for every now and then.

This is more of a watery smoothie or a juice with too much gritty pulp. A sludge, if you will. Did not enjoy it and would not buy again. The bottle came noticeably puffed up like it had started to go off already, even though it had weeks on the date. Only thing good about it was the actual fruit flavour.
This has a nice flavour but the texture is a bit weird and is more smoothieish
This was not juice, it was a slightly watered down smoothie. Didn't enjoy it at all

The initial flavour is fruity but there is a strange, vegetal aftertaste which is very unpleasant and, to us, undrinkable. We opened a second container and that also had the same lingering taste of vegetable water. I tried a 50/50 mix with lemonade but that aftertaste was so strong it still came through. 
I would expect much better from M&S. There was nothing in the list of ingredients that could explain this flavour. 
I usually avoid buying anything in a container which cannot be either re-used or re-cycled but this product was supplied as a substitute. That's two reasons not to buy the product again.
I found this slightly more bitter than expected. Not unpleasant but was expecting a bit more mango.
love the new M&S juice collection - this one's an early favourite.  The 3 fruits complement each other well.  Tastes of summer!
Bought this when on offer. Enough for 4 people. Perfect with tzatziki, pitta bread and salad. Would I pay full price? Yes.
Tried this based on the reviews and was not disappointed. It has a spicy kick and was juicy and flavoursome. With pitta and a salad will serve 3.
..but the waitrose version is better!
takes far less time to cook than the packet suggested

I didnt expect this to be as good as it was, after oven cooking this we thinly sliced and served with salad and pitas.
 The flavours were stronger than expected, but worked perfectly with salad and the included dressing, perfect for a family of four.
This went down very well with spicy rice and salad! Definitely buy again!
Tried this after reading good reviews. Unfortunately the overall flavour of the spices was bitter and unappetising. Must vary from batch to batch
These are so over flavoured they were inedible... went straight from plate to bin..

The hype on the reviews here gave me high expectations , maybe I expected too much. 
It was ok , but I prefer more spice and seasoning.
One of the best dinners Ive ever had ,we got breads from Lebanese restaurant and loaded them up with this amazing chicken ,super value and taste and yoghurt and garlic sauce was so good too .
A bit pricey but still very good.

Really tasty with subtle spice flavour. Juicy and good value
Highly recommend
Really impressed with this product. So easy to cook; packed with delicious flavour; filling portions (enough for 3 or 4 people) and no waste. Winner-winner-chicken dinner.

I usually buy several different types of chicken to put in hot nanns and then saw this. My initial thought was it was expensive but when I received it is it really worth the money, It's moist and tastes amazing.

We love this spicy chicken kebab. Its easily enough for three and even four at a stretch with the addition of some sides like coleslaw, pitta bread, salsa and salad etc. Its made from thigh meat so is always moist and tasty. I cook it for about 35-40 minutes and turn it once. The only problem is that its so rarely in stock! Even when it shows as available to add to my basket it often doesnt actually arrive and theres never a sub offered. Not great when Im trying to plan a weeks suppers.
This is incredible, a really tasty easy dinner which Ill be ordering regularly from now on.

Firstly I love that this isnt breast meat which I find usually dry and tasteless anyway. This is really a big and fairly heavy portion that fed two adults with leftovers for the next day. The flavours were wonderful with a perfectly balanced spicing and it remained juicy as well as being so easy to cook. What more could you want.

After reading the reviews I thought I was missing something so bought these, which are very easy to prepare.  They, to me, were just simply boring.  I love the Collection Shish Kebabs though which are sensational.

Would probably do three people adequately with some rice etc. we didn't realise how big it was and couldn't quite manage it between two of us. The meat stayed moist in the Ninja Foodi, just over 40 minutes at 170. The outside was just starting to get very brown. We both found it spicy and a bit salty but still very tasty.

Looks expensive, but served as a Kebab with salad etc, enough for 4 ( £2.12 per person )

Ive probably jinxed it now because soon after I discover something, its promptly discontinued.

Pitta Bread, lemon pickled white cabbage, red onion, red pepper, cucumber, garlic yoghurt sauce and chillis/sauce.

Friday Night after the Pub !

We bought this for lunch after seeing the good reviews - which are well deserved.  This was easy to cook in the oven, packed with flavour, and the meat was very high quality thigh meat, which was all eaten.  Happy customers, will buy more for sure.

I've ordered this several times but it's always been a missing item - finally got to try it. Very impressive, although I pulled it out of the oven at the 30 minute mark, it would have been burnt to a crisp if I let it go for an hour. Really tender, really juicy. I am so pleased to see thigh used for this sort of thing - breast is so boring to eat.

I've ordered this once before and really liked it however I ordered 2 packets for this weeks shop for a family dinner I going to and they were not available! Why show them as being in stock when they are not? Had to go to the shops and get a load of thighs to make it myself which defeats the object of having a weekly home delivery. Annoying.

2nd attempt at ordering this. First one came with packaging ripped and leaked everywhere. Second we left this in the oven for way longer than needed and the meat was still incredibly red in parts. Im aware leg meat is sometimes slightly darker but this looked completely raw. Such a shame as it smelt lovey.
Absolutely gorgeous with chopped salad & chilli sauce in a pitta

If your looking for a quick Friday or Sat night cheat meal this is pretty good. Quite a bit of oil came off the cuts of meat which looked like chicken thigh. Season well with salt and pepper. I rubbed a few more spices on as some reviews commented on the poor flavour.  We gad with warm pitta bread and salad. Yoghurt sauce - didnt bother so cant comment
Perfect balance of spices, super tender chicken, perfect!
Very disappointing especially in view of the good reviews! 55min in the oven. Awful flavour.  Won't be buying again.
Cooks beautifully, extremely tender, but taste is just boring. Bland. But I guess a spicy salsa can elevate it.
Having read the reviews we were keen to try this.  We were not disappointed.  The chicken was delicious - tender and flavourfull.  We will definitely order again.
Thank goodness  this is made with chicken legs so it stays moist. You can slide pieces off for cooking instead of cooking the whole lot in one go. So much nicer than a takeaway.
Exceeded our expectations - perfect with crosta and mollica wraps.

Uses thighs thankfully, instead of dry breast meat, which is a really good start. Lovely spiced flavour. I served it with mini pittas, tzatziki, salad and a baked feta, which worked really well. Would recommend. Please make sure they are more regularly in stock, as its the first time I was able to try one. Will definitely buy when available.
Finally got one delivered and it was worth the wait. Great quality, good flavour and worth the money

I had these ordered to serve to visitors, I had bought everything else ready to go with them. Now I have to go out locally on a Saturday afternoon to try to find a substitute. Looks like a regular thing too from the reviews.
Excellent value for money. the meat is beautifully tender, seasoned very well with beautiful flavours, the yoghurt dressing works really well with the sharma too, so nice with salad an pitta

Every week Ocado allow me to add this to my trolly with the promise of it being available. But then come delivery day it has never been available. So Im left with empty wraps and a bounty of salad for my non existent kebab!!!! Im now doing a second shop with Waitrose to buy everything that Ocado promises but doesnt deliver. Not great value from a Smart Pass.
Bought this to cook on the bbq. Very tasty and moist. Lovely.

Bought this as I buy other middle eastern food from Waitrose. This was very good, tasty chicken which was tender and juicy.
Had with wraps and roast veg. Everyone enjoyed it.
Omg, this is actually amazing. Tender, juicy, tasty - its a thing of beauty. I have been to restaurants that havent served kebabs as good as this. Simply put - BUY IT!

Really enjoyed this. Loads of flavour, the chicken was soft and juicy  
I served with side salad, homemade tzatziki, and crinkle chips - defo a winner in our house.

Wow, this was delicious!!  The flavours are amazing.  I have tried to buy this for the last 2 months... it's always out of stock, but got lucky today.  Cooked it in the oven, but I think it would taste even better on a BBQ.  
The chicken connects both skewers together, they are not separate skewers.
Obviously popular as often out of stock. Absolutely delicious and worth the wait. Needs a bit more cooking than time suggested, otherwise meat can be pink.
Very tasty, good portion for 3. But more often than not it doesn't arrive after showing availability. Very frustrating.
Perfect on the bbq especially with a little bit of charring on the outside.
I bought this in the flash sale. Lots of meat and full of flavour.

Prefer chicken leg meat to breast so bought this on a whim and pleased I did. I dont cook meat using times on the packet, I use the internal temp as a guide and at 160c in a fan oven it took 50 minutes for the thickest part to reach 75c internal temp which is the temp chicken leg meat is safe at. Perfectly juicy and goes well with rice and peas, plain yoghurt and hot sauce on the side. Will be buying again.
succulent and tasty meat. we had mid week, cooked in the oven. really delicious, quite a lot of meat to enjoy!
Have ordered these twice and really enjoyed it. Moist and full of flavour.
Brilliant to buy and throw on the bbq as so easy to cook.  I serve mine with homemade tzatziki, salad and pittas.
Built my order just to buy more of these Shawarmas and they have gone out of stock. Great taste, great value but just cant get hold of them

All the herbs where overwhelming - we cooked these in the oven instead of on BBQ. I really didn't enjoy these at all. I do think a BBQ might have been a better option. I just found it to be greasy and not pleasant to eat. We also found small bits of bone which we found off putting. From a value perspective it was a good size portion for the price.

Having read the reviews of it being pink after an hour I cooked it for 75mins fan oven on 200. I turned it for the last 15 mins! It's so tasty. I'd definitely buy again. It was a flash sale when I bought it. I'd buy full price for a treat or special occasion!
Had these from store and they were gorgeous, I look for them weekly on Ocado and never in stock!! Nooooo, everyone stop buying them for a week pleeeaase :)
This is the best Shawarma i have had, easy to cook and enough for 4 people , thank you M&S😍
We got this in the flash sale and didnt have particularly high hopes. Served it with flatbreads and salad and my partner was WOWed by it as was I. Succulent and tasty. Full of flavour.

Was lovely and when put in a flatbread with Humous, salad, mint yogurt and chilli sauce it was just like the shawarmas from local Middle Eastern restaurant. Only issue was that I put it in the oven on a preheated oven tray for 1hour and it still came out very pink when I cut it down the middle. I know its dark meat and that can alter the colour but after another 5 minutes in the oven and a further 5mins diced up in a frying pan, it was no longer pink.

I can see why so many people enjoyed this. The meat is very tender and succulent, and you get a lot. However, for me, it was overpoweringly herby. The label made a big deal of how many spices it had been marinated in, so I expected it to have a real depth of flavour, but for me it just tasted like dry herbs. So whilst the idea and texture were good, you should only buy if you really dig the dried herb flavour. I wouldnt buy again but glad I tried it. The yogurt accompaniment is nice and garlicky, but again, they sprinkled dried herbs in it so you get these pops of overpowering, still dehydrated herb in your teeth. I think a development chef made something really great here and then someone came along and said Hmm, it needs more, and then shook a load of dried mixed herbs all over it and didnt bother tasting it again.

I usually love this style of food, and after seeing the M&S BBQ ad this was included in it looked really tasty and something I would enjoy. Sadly it didnt do it for me. It was really bland, couldnt taste the 14 spices and no heat, and I hadnt read the full description so didnt realise it was leg meat, which although I understand the use of for this type of dish, is not my favourite. The zesty yoghurt dressing was lovely and that added flavour, but I could of done with more of that, and there was plenty of meat on there. If I were to purchase again Id have to add some seasoning to it to liven it up for my taste, and I would still recommend to others to try.

My husband loved this...I did it with salad and flat bread which I thought would be a good idea but they fell apart to be honest!  So think I will do them with warmed pittas next time. I only had a bit and it was very tasty and my husband agrees. Yummy!

Very tasty, moist chicken with well marinated flavours. Cooked it in the oven, but keen to try on the bbq next time. Had with flatbread and salad for lunch. Easily serves 3 if not 4 depending on what you have with it. Definite buy again product.

We loved this so much, good quality dark meat, very flavourful and a big portion for 2 adults and a toddler. We had it in a pita wrap with salad, the sauce is really nice too. Definitely will order this again!
Make sure you have a back up meal planned because there is a good chance you won't be getting this.
Beautiful flavour. An easy meal. Great value for what you’re getting.
Great meal for at least four people. Good quality and delicious flavour. I oven baked and ate with bread and salad. Love it.

We shared this between the two of us and it was delicious. Very well seasoned and marinated. Tender chicken thighs that remained juicy and very garlicky. Only needed 45 mins in a 180c fan oven, I think if I let it cook for the recommended 55 mins it would have been over cooked. The sauce is not the star. Its very tart. Youd be better mixing some yoghurt with mint sauce for a quick sauce with a better flavour.

This tastes authentic and is not too hot. It is properly yummy and a generous portion. It’s also really easy as you just roast in the oven and end up with crispy edges and juicy chicken on the inside. Great in wraps with salad humous and pickled chillies for a family dinner.  These kind of ready meals don’t normally work well but this is the exception which proves the rule.

This with a nice bulgar salad was just perfect for the lovely summer weather this week. I'm usually disappointed when I get things like this rather than just seasoning the meat myself but will definitely be getting this again.

We have ordered this for the last 6 weeks and it is always out of stock and missing from our order
What’s going on Ocado it’s in stock when it’s ordered?
What’s going on M&S, I have ordered this item three times and each time it fails to arrive. But I would love to try it so please stock mote.

We had our chicken with salad, so ate more of it than if we'd had it with rice or flatbread. So would say it fed 3 comfortably our way. Would DEFINITELY get this again, it was tender and tasty and required no effort. Even my 8 year old loved it despite it tasting much spicier to her than to us. The yogurt that came with it was perfect. Our M&S treat used to be the Gastro chicken kievs, but now that we're following a keto diet this is the new favourite!

after reading other reviews i decided to bite the bullet and order. the price did put me off at first but so glad i ordered, really delicious and full of flavour. had ours with flat bread and salad. will definitely be buying again
I’m not usually keen on chicken thighs, but this was so good. The chicken was tender and extremely tasty. There is a huge amount of meat so really good value for money
What a great piece of tasty and succulent chicken! Made 4 portions , served with flat bread and salad. The sachet of sauce is very small so we added our own garlic sauce. Delicious.
This was so much better than expectedthe sauce is divine and chicken very moist. Highly recommended. Perfect with garlic naan.
Although at first glance this looks expensive there is loads of meat, which could serve four people easily. Lovely and spicy and tasty, perfect for a wrap or pitta bread.
Absolutely loved it just the thing with flat bread and salad lovely seasoning and easy to cook no waste and not dry
This is so easy to cook, and tastes mildly spicy and delicious. Although it's meant to serve 6 people, it does just 4 people. A bit expensive, but I'll buy it again.

Cooked this on 'grill' setting in my Air Fryer for around 40mins on low and it was perfect! Served with flatbreads, m&s pickled cabbage and salad. Very tasty and good portions, will buy again! Think it would be gorgeous on the BBQ too, will try that next time
Ordered this out of curiosity and was pleasantly surprised.  The marinade is very good, and the size is ample for 4.  I served this as part of a BBQ lunch and it was very popular.
Bit of kick and loads of flavour, this was delicious. Ive got left overs for lunch tomorrow in a salad. There is so much meat and its really juicy.
Delicious slow cooked on the BBQ and served with salad and flatbreads. Just a shame always out of stock online and had to find this in-store.
M&S have nailed this! The flavour is out of this world! Perfect amount of  spices and yummy tender chicken. Ten out of ten!
DELICIOUS
This was so worth it. Really nice, cooked well and full of flavour. I would suggest they include a bigger packet of yoghurt but other then that, amazing.
Nice spices , reminds me off Brazilian bbq chicken, not too spicy, nice with rice and salad coleslaw. Would reorder but its out of stock!

I cannot give a review on the taste of this item.  This was expensive but with the reviews saying how nice it was I thought I would try.  First the meat was exceptionally dark so I opened as I thought it did not look right.  It smelt disgusting, like a rotting food bin.  Not worth money if going to deliver bad food.
Absolutely delicious, feed 5 hungry humans! Served with salad and wraps!
This was great, moist and flavourful.

Flavoursome, moist and tender - this chicken shawarma is TO DIE FOR! I cooked it in the oven and was a bit worried it might dry out, but not in the slightest. The dressing is a perfect match to the spices with the chicken. Oh, and there is plenty to go around.  Will be a regular throughout the summer.
Lovely depth of flavours, great in a flatbread with salad
At first was little put off by price but its huge qnd fed loads it was super delicious huge hit all round and will be adding to next shop again qnd again
full of flavor didn't dry out at all I did add some chilli flakes' just for a bit of extra spice the second time I cooked it but was super tasty without too
Really delicious and succulent.
Tasty tender and full of flavour - did it in the oven but eager to try on BBQ will definitely have again

I absolutely love these burgers, though if i buy them I confess I normally slice them up (once cooked) and have them on a roast dinner with lashings of mint sauce, not 'meaty' really in flavour, but a lovely meaty savoury texture, flavour is gorgeous though I can't pinpoint any flavour. Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND AND ALWAYS BUY IF IN STOCK NOM NOM NOM
On the surface youd probably think these were dry and tasteless but quite the opposite. A lovely, almost juicy consistency and a lovely hint of mint. Will be buying again.

Tried on a whim as not a veggie but wanted something healthy and tasty. It's like a very good bean burger, nicely spiced and right amount of mint. Also not expensive- one is plenty filling in a bun with chips...

These are big burgers! The mint with the beetroot is an acquired taste. Sometimes it tastes like its a good marriage of flavours and in other bites Im still wondering.  But its vegan, healthy, big, gluten free and I would have these again for future meals. Such a great change from meat type food.  Great with a tomatoes and a vegan relish etc. Oh, let your hair down and go for it!!

I love these burgers. They are vegetable based rather than soya or meat substitute, and are full of tasty ingredients. I avoid anything with methylcellulose in it, which is a binder amongst other things, and as these burgers don't contain it, they are perfect for me. Really tasty, a good size and great value too.
It’s well made but the texture is a bit mushy. It could do with some spice or seasoning. Cooks nicely and looks good on the plate. I enjoyed it but I had expectations for something special.
Didn't get the hint of mint but overall a decent alternative to a meat burger.
Delicious good size and texture. We really enjoyed these good flavour and perfect for burgers in a bun.

I like the falafels in the Gosh range but unfortunately was underwhelmed by these. They are ok. They are edible but after the first couple of bites that were tasty they were a bit of a chore to get through. I baked them and the crispy outside was nice but inside they were mushy and bland. I had them with a vegan yogurt mint dressing. Without this I could not have eaten them. I could not taste any mint in the burger, which was what I was expecting. I think if they were cut in half, so they were thinner, they would be better but as a quick healthy convenience product I would not want to faff about with them.
Thought I'd give it a try as their falafel are quite nice but didn't like the flavour or texture, very disappointing
Good texture, taste and ingredients. No meatyflavour like lots of vegetarian burgers. Just honest vegetable flavour!

I buy this when I am cooking something else for family that I don't  want to eat. I like them, I agree that you don't get a very strong flavour of beetroot, but I like the look of it, the taste and it's easy to heat up.
Goes well with a big dollop of tzatziki!
These smelt brilliant when cooking. They even look like a meat version. On a burger with the usual accompaniments they are a nice lighter alternative.
These are really yummy. Slightly spiced and full of flavour. Theyre also a great size burger for such good nutritional value, perfect for summer BBQs!!

We tried these as an alternative to halloumi on a meze type platter sliced in wraps. 
We really liked them, the beetroot was subtle flavoured but it kept the patty quite moist. 
The mint was perhaps overpowering but it worked well with how we were using it.
Love the Gosh range but not this particular item. Texture is vile and tastes nothing like beetroot.

for some reason, these don't work properly. the machine gets very little water through it so you get just a tiny bit of coffee before it stops. First time I'm having problems so van only assume it's the pods
Not at all compatible with Nespresso machines, they get all mashed up and don’t dispense the coffee; messy and cheap, gross, AVOID AVOID
Not really compatible. Difficult and made a mess.
I have a citiz machine and it struggles with this pod. However on the plus side I love the taste of this coffee. Not too strong but strong enough for a Lungo
Waste of money - does not work with my nespresso machine
Only a dribble comes out of these capsules 9 out of 10 times. Tastes good and cheaper than nespresso but this is not a good deal

for some reason, these don't work properly. the machine gets very little water through it so you get just a tiny bit of coffee before it stops. First time I'm having problems so van only assume it's the pods
Not at all compatible with Nespresso machines, they get all mashed up and don’t dispense the coffee; messy and cheap, gross, AVOID AVOID
Not really compatible. Difficult and made a mess.

Waste of money - does not work with my nespresso machine
Only a dribble comes out of these capsules 9 out of 10 times. Tastes good and cheaper than nespresso but this is not a good deal
I dont usually drink decaf coffee but its good to have it - just in case. I tried it and it tastes very nice. Lovely smell and is great for an evening relax.
Decent for a decaf pod and works fine in Nespresso machine. Would buy again
Tasty coffee... for decaf. The pod isn't a perfect fit so you have to be careful positioning it. but I've not had any leaks using them. They work splendidly well in a latenight espresso martini!
The pods work fine with our Nespresso machine.  The coffee tastes good as well.
Impressed with the flavour for a decaf coffee. Worked fine with the machine.
Nice rich flavour for decaf pods.
Very nice decaf coffee, good flavour. Pods straightforward to use, no issues with machine.
Good flavour, pod fits machine well. Would buy again.
A very good decaf coffee, compatible with Nespresso machine.  No problem with pods.

I've had no compatibility issues with my Inissia machine. The coffee itself is very good for mass market, standard daily use. It's nowhere near as strong as a 10 strength rating on the original capsules, but it's very pleasant and not feeble, and wishywashy, like many generics and or decaffs are. With the exception of the expensive Nespresso capsules, these are definitely my favourite decaff ones.
Nice rounded flavour for a decaf !
I got these free to review but they will be a weekly regular now - by far the best tasting decaf & no issues with Nespresso machine
The taste of this decaf was good, but it seemed a bit grainy/gritty in texture compared to other pods weve tried.

The pods come in a neat, easy to open and store box.
We cannot fault this coffee. Lovely, full flavour, and the pods work fine in our Nespresso Inissia machine. I thought it was important to point this out as in the past we have bought other pods which claim to be compatible, but one of those got stuck in our machine and we had to send it away to be fixed. No problems at all with the Carte Noire ones, and we've used a lot. Carte Noire is made by Lavazza, so it's Italian coffee despite all the French words. We put these ahead of any Nespresso genuine pods on both taste and price.

These cheap plastic pods worked very poorly for the few 3 or 4 but they leaked and wouldnt slot down properly due to being light. Then they started sticking and then one got so stuck my machine completely broke trying to eject it. DO NOT BUY. I will be complaining to the manufacturer.
have stopped ordering because the capsules cannot be recycled.
Nice coffee, but half the capsules leaked as much into the machine as dispensed through them

Probably the best tasting decaf pod out there!
Fits my Nespresso machine, although you need to fiddle with it a bit to make it fit.
Combine with almond barista milk and youll have an amazing cup of coffee for those with intolerances.
The taste of this decaf was good, but it seemed a bit grainy/gritty in texture compared to other pods weve tried.

The pods come in a neat, easy to open and store box.
We cannot fault this coffee. Lovely, full flavour, and the pods work fine in our Nespresso Inissia machine. I thought it was important to point this out as in the past we have bought other pods which claim to be compatible, but one of those got stuck in our machine and we had to send it away to be fixed. No problems at all with the Carte Noire ones, and we've used a lot. Carte Noire is made by Lavazza, so it's Italian coffee despite all the French words. We put these ahead of any Nespresso genuine pods on both taste and price.
