have stopped ordering because the capsules cannot be recycled.
Nice coffee, but half the capsules leaked as much into the machine as dispensed through them

Probably the best tasting decaf pod out there!
Fits my Nespresso machine, although you need to fiddle with it a bit to make it fit.
Combine with almond barista milk and youll have an amazing cup of coffee for those with intolerances.
Bacon had no taste or smell plus the slices were so thin they were transparent and impossible to fry in pan and do nor recommend

Had to get this as my normal choices had run out. The slices were paper thin, pallid, full of water and didn't even cook a nice colour. All I could taste was the overpowering "smoke" flavour. Surprised at M&S, they do other much better options than this. One to avoid.
Used it in carbonara

Why is this 50p more expensive from Ocado than it is at my local M&S Food. Same applies to the unsmoked version.
Both products are very nice but this is Just another Ocado rip off.
Have been buying regularly. Sometimes the bacon appears to be dry cured and is very good. Other times the bacon is full of water and shrinks to half the size.
Really tasty and no water or white gunk came out while cooking.
Bacon had no taste or smell plus the slices were so thin they were transparent and impossible to fry in pan and do nor recommend

Had to get this as my normal choices had run out. The slices were paper thin, pallid, full of water and didn't even cook a nice colour. All I could taste was the overpowering "smoke" flavour. Surprised at M&S, they do other much better options than this. One to avoid.
Used it in carbonara

Why is this 50p more expensive from Ocado than it is at my local M&S Food. Same applies to the unsmoked version.
Both products are very nice but this is Just another Ocado rip off.
Have been buying regularly. Sometimes the bacon appears to be dry cured and is very good. Other times the bacon is full of water and shrinks to half the size.
Really tasty and no water or white gunk came out while cooking.
This is the tastiest supermarket bacon we've ever had. its shall become a regular purchase.
Water and sooo much of it! ....lacks flavour, salty but thats about it. Disappointing for M&S I certainly wont be purchasing their bacon again.
for a cheap pack of bacon this isn't bad and good size pack
this bacon is Good quality, have ordered this for the past few weeks and all packs have been very lean.
Taste is OK but too much water!
Little shrinkage, I would say medium thickness and not cooked perfectly. Shall make this a regular purchase and another handy online purchase instead of a trip to the butchers.
Found this super bland, didn’t have the lovely goo associated with barrata
Bought this for the lovely branding. It was very tasty indeed, a nice addition to my lunch.
It was pretty dry in the middle compared with others I have tried. It was ok but nothing amazing.
Nothing special, small pot and quite expensive
not the best burrata but makes a change from buffalo mozzarella, and good value if on flash sale! little dry in the middle but it's still quite nice.
The rind is a little thick, the inside is creamy, it has a slightly bitter taste.

We were dubious to receive this as a swap; based on more recent reviews… but it was delicious. Nothing not to dislike - a bit pricey for the size; but delicious as a treat. We piled fresh tomatoes on to really good toasted bread, and added the cheese. Delish!
Lacks the creaminess that you expect from a burrata. In the words of a friend, its like mozzarella....except its not!
Bought two, one the seal had gone and was starting to disintegrate. Not worth money and poor packaging.
We have bought some in the past which were much better but this time, they are just horrible.
Served two as a starter with roasted tomatoes.  Lovely and fresh, creamy middle just as it should be.
Smaller than the usual burrata.
Just as it should be creamy,runny in the middle a real delight
Not the best example you will find but perfectly serviceable

My youngest son loves Burrata but as vegetarians its been tricky finding a suitable one. We tried this for the first time this week as it was on offer and were very impressed. Nice flavour and that fantastic runny centre is exactly what we want from a burrata.
This is unpleasant. Odd flavour, solid centre and one went off 2 days before its use by.
It didnt run when cut into which I rather thought was the point!
Quite strange, not what I was expecting. Not for me
This is really lovely.  And it's great that it's veggie since most burrata isn't, unfortunately.  Thanks Ocado!

I was a bit anxious buying this given the reviews, including many commenting on how tiny it is etc. Yes, it is rather on a small side, but the actual size of burratina is same as what you get from Garofolo brand I normally, buy, here the packaging is smaller, but size similar. However, this is just no comparison in taste to other products, this is by far the best burratina I had outside of Italy. Absolutely fantastic. So glad I have tried it inspite the contrary views expressed on site. Will definitely buy again.
I tried this recently as the Natoora ones seem to be missing from my orders lately.  These are okay but not great.  Not that creamy and the flavour is a bit bland.  I won't be ordering again.
Really impressed. Id eaten an organic buffalo mozzarella the day before and it was a bit dry and tasteless. This burrata was creamy and tasty and I really enjoyed it.
I got this at 33 percent off and wasnt impressed.
First this arrives in a tiny plastic container- it does not look as big as it does in the picture AND it was off when opened - even though it was 1 week before the sell by date

First off, do read the size this tub comes in. It is tiny. The texture is pretty good, a bit more solid obviously than fresh burrata, but still decent. I was most disappointed with the lack of any flavour. There wasn't this richness that you normally have with fresh burrata, this one definitely required the addition of tomatoa, balsamico etc to make it work
Delicious mild and creamy will be buying again
creamy, delicate and in a perfect size. Yum.
Absolutely great.  Authentic, creamy, fantastic.  Only downside is it's tiny
No thanks, completely mediocre and overpriced
Very yummy creamy Burrata, simple as that.

I have a feeling that this was off although within date and 4 days to go.. I really wanted to like it as I really love burrata and was happy that Ocado stocks another type.. this was so sour and inedible so I had to throw away, I also tried the smoked one and that to was really sour.. I will not purchase this again and will stick to natoora burrata.
I've just struggled through this soup for lunch. It is unpleasant gruel. I wish Ocado would stock Covent Garden soup again.
We just didn't enjoy this. Very strange taste. Will not buy again. Disappointing.

Ive eaten and made alot of healthy soups,this has got to be the worst ive ever eaten. I dont like wasting food but i threw this away.    The smell and taste was disgusting,  i love garlic but the taste was awful.
I dont often give one star reviews, but in this case it really deserves it. It had the smell of overcooked greens before being heated, and then to taste was not very garlicky at all.

I'm very fussy with my soup and was apprehensive after reading the reviews... but I was really pleasantly surprised! This soup is creamy and delicious! A little overpowering with the garlic but I love garlic so it suited me fine.
This was tasteless and very thin with a watery consistency. I couldnt finish the bowl!
I've just struggled through this soup for lunch. It is unpleasant gruel. I wish Ocado would stock Covent Garden soup again.
We just didn't enjoy this. Very strange taste. Will not buy again. Disappointing.

Ive eaten and made alot of healthy soups,this has got to be the worst ive ever eaten. I dont like wasting food but i threw this away.    The smell and taste was disgusting,  i love garlic but the taste was awful.
I dont often give one star reviews, but in this case it really deserves it. It had the smell of overcooked greens before being heated, and then to taste was not very garlicky at all.

I'm very fussy with my soup and was apprehensive after reading the reviews... but I was really pleasantly surprised! This soup is creamy and delicious! A little overpowering with the garlic but I love garlic so it suited me fine.
This was tasteless and very thin with a watery consistency. I couldnt finish the bowl!
I love spinach and I love kale, but this soup was too offensive to my nose and tastebuds. Maybe I got a pot that was bad, but I couldnt eat it. I will not be buying again.
Really cant recommend this product. It tastes horrible like green water with thin texture.
Green water!

Lovely soup, which is flavoursome and perfectly balanced! It's quite light, so great paired with something else for a meal. Love how healthy it is and how distinctive it tastes compared to other branded soups

This soup sounds great and looks very healthy but sad to report that it really does lack flavour and also is very thin despite shaking it well before use. Hopefully it will be reformulated and some flavour will be packed in
Sick of tomato or milk based soups? Prefer more salty/savory/garlic flavours? This is the soup for you. Perfectly compliments bread and butter.
Almost porridge like-taste. Grim, especially for the price (even on offer).
As many of the reviews mention, this soup is too thin. It didn't leave us feeling satisfied at all, even for a light lunch.
Green sludge, it's food I suppose but can't think of much else good to say about it.
Full of flavour.

The soups were a bit thinner than I would have liked and I would also like the garlic flavour to have been a bit more prominent, but that said, It was very filling clean-tasting soup. I would buy this again. I thought the tub was perfect for two people to be able to share comfortably.
A tasty mix of healthy vegetables. Just the right amount of garlic. Enjoyable.
This is a really healthy soup with good ingredients but I felt it was a little too thin for my liking. It is delicious.
Tastes really good, though the salt content probably adds to the extra star.  Nonetheless one of the ways I would recommend to get your veg intake without pinching your nose
Very rarely don't eat something after we've cooked it, but truly awful.  Avoid.  Much nicer soups out there.
I like spinach. I like kale. I like garlic. You couldn't taste any of the three in this soup. It's an unidentifiable sludge!
This soup was so bland and uninspiring that I couldn’t eat the second half. I am not normally one to waste food, but this was just an awful product. Would never buy again.
A tasty way to get some of your 5 a day. It is also great that it is palm oil free.
Outstanding and tasty soup!
This looks and tastes like it's doing you good! Filling but healthy and low calorie.  Will definitely buy again.

Soupologie spinach & kale with garlic is absolutely delicious. The spinach flavour is the strongest but there are good hints of kale and garlic. 
Perfect consistency, not too thick. Overall a very tasty soup.

Please don't be put off by the mention of garlic in the product description - it's not overpowering but adds a layer of complexity and brightness. A little watery in texture for my liking but the flavour is bold and beautiful.

I have not tried this soup before ,I will be buying again it was lovely. This soup tasted so fresh like it was straight from the fields .It was delicious tasted so healthy the flavours were just right a wholesome combination of fresh spinach and kale with a hint of garlic it gave me a boost and I found it filling I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for healthy nutritious soup.

I bought this as Im trying to be healthier and eat more vegetables but is not the type of thing I would usually go for. 
When it arrived I wasnt reassured as it looks like green sludge. But be brave as it is delicious. The smell and taste of garlic gives it a glorious heartwarming,  comfort food taste. Much more satisfying than I would have thought too.
This used to be one of my faves and now tastes like pond water. Had to throw half of it away

I bought this to see if I could make this to expand my repertoire of home made soup. I was attracted by the Vegan nature of it. However, I couldn't eat more than 2 spoons as it has no flavour, not enough seasoning and, to be honest it looks like bile... I added more salt, some Parmesan and boursin just to try to improve the flavour. It repeated on me all afternoon (that's the garlic) and the rest went in the bin. I won't be buying again. The cauliflower version is much nicer.
Very thin and watery and horrible texture. Needs to be bllnded smoother. Overpowering garlic flavour.

I like the ingredients in this and the texture is fine, I liked the first couple of mouthfuls of this soup and the more I ate it the less I liked it. The garlic is extremely strong and I only have half at once and it's quite difficult to finish - I won't be getting it again
worst soup I've ever purchased
I ordered to use for lunch at work, I literally tried 2 spoonfuls and threw it in the bin. Worst soup ever! Taste, texture, everything...
I ordered to use for lunch at work, I literally tried 2 spoonfuls and threw it in the bin. Worst soup ever! Taste, texture, everything...
Really tasty, healthy soup :) very satisfied
Wonderful flavour and so healthy!
If you like watered down soup then this for you. It didn't taste that good..
I tried it cold and its really bad but after put on microwave l, it tasted really good!
I really enjoy this and it taste lovely and feels it must be doing you good.mmmmm,m
On the border of being rather unpleasant. I just don't understand how a concoction if spinach, kale and garlic, all ingredients I very much like, could go so wrong
I'm not a big fan of store bought soup, prefer homemade but this is very pleasant!
This soup tastes very healthy - i wouldnt say its really tasty but its ok if youre trying to be healthy. Some of the other soupologie flavours are better.
a favourite when I want to eat healthy quick food
Delicate tase, good combo of kale and shiitake mushroom. BPA free container too
Consistency was ok, but perhaps a little on the watery side, however I found this to be rather bland and I had to add a lot of seasoning to make this edible for me personally.

Being vegan, I'm used to some strange looking foodstuffs. However, this looks like the sludge on top of ponds in the Summer. It tastes ok, just ok, but every time I looked down at the bowl, I felt a bit icky and in the end couldn't finish, especially once it had separated. I've been unimpressed with all of the green soups from this range, deeply unappetising looking and generally bland. More like a chore eating them, than a pleasant experience - they're like the soup version of gruel, which is a shame because I don't want added garbage in soup. If they added some consistency ie chunks, these might be better. Life is too short for sludge, however healthy.
The consistency was unpleasant and I found it to be quite bland

Very little fiber or protein in this, I do not know why they advertise that this is a good source of these. 1g of protein/fiber for 100g is not a lot at all.

The taste is good, feels more like a drink than a vegetable soup though. It fills you up for 20 minutes but gets rapidly absorbed by your body, and the high amount of carbs and sugars make you feel hungry again.
A good balance of flavours here, think its just about right. Watery consistency which i like
Im a big fan of the soupologie soups. The courgette one is my favpurite. The spirulina has more taste than this. This was very unpleasant.
Really loved this. I usually cook everything myself and am very fussy. I didn't even have to season it.
But extremely tasty. The spinach flavour is the dominant one and it's a really lovely healthy soup. Lovely with bread and cheese for wintry lunches. Will buy again.

Absolutely love this Soupologie soup! I'm often seen with the tub and a spoon at my desk, ideal for hectic days. Perfect amount of garlic and greens, not too overpowering but still plenty of taste. Really recommend this for anyone with or without intolerance/dietary requirements. I'm a sucker for anything green but also love so many of their other flavours!

I try to stay away from dairy so Soupologie is always my soup of choice - I've literally tried all of their flavours. This is one that I never, ever tire of. I find people love it or hate it - it does have a strong spinach taste, and a bit of garlic, two flavours I adore and I think are blended really, really well in this soup. It definitely tastes like a dark greens soup, so if that's not your cup of tea, I would try another flavour. However it does make me feel like I'm getting my 2 of 5 day per serving, really, really thick and warming,  and it's really low in calories - something like 130 per serving. I often add pasta to it and drizzle with a little chili oil, and it makes a perfect, warming dinner. Very quick and convenient too.
Very nice i love the combination of the mix my cup of tea

I guess we all like different things because we can't understand the negative reviews. We love this soup along with the pea, cauliflower and grains varieties as well. Really different in a good way. We don't find it watery at all. Lovely flavour, perfect mix of ingredients and flavours. Great with a pitta when you don't want to have too much at lunchtime but still filling. We split it in two and have half each.
This is just too salty and I had it with my 7 year old for supper and something in it kept us awake till midnight. AVOID
I was looking for a healthy soup option and I enjoyed this spinach soup . The only thing there is a big list of ingredients I wish they would less sub ingredients.
DIdn;t like it at all, haven't tried their other range but i had to say something about this one. will give the others a go though

I think the negative reviews are unfair, this soup is NOT vile.  For me, the seasoning is just right and I like the taste very much.  It's a very healthy soup and as such it tastes and has the texture of a healthy soup.  Not sure what people expect of a spinach and kale soup if they are surprised by the texture.  It does taste very 'green', but would you want a green veg soup that didn't? It won't be everyone's cup of tea because not every likes eating their greens, of course.

I warmed this depite the overpowering smell of garlic and the vile appearance.  I managed 3 mouthfuls before tipping it in the sink. There is far too mucch salt ( although this is clear from the nutrition information)  and way, way, way too much garlic. Normally I love garlic but on this occasion it just turned my stomach.
Definitely a soup to avoid unless you really love garlic and green slime

I love these soups but this flavour is lacking something as it's pretty bland apart from the garlic taste. Also I understand why the texture puts people off as it's blended kale & spinach - not pretty looking but not a problem to me as I often make my own soups. Please improve this one by adding some more flavour, different texture and colour
Yummy but very filling!
My favourite soup. Tastes delicious and healthy, but also very tasty, unlike others I've tried, which seem more like an effort to get through. Best soup Soupologie make in my opinion.
taste is not great but most importantly will probably upset your stomach
Absolutely one of the worst soups I've tried. Sludgy and slimy and akin to pond water. Great if you're a duck.

Reading the reviews on here does remind you why it's important to try something yourself (and why reviews can't necessarily be trusted). Some say too garlicky, some say not garlicky enough, some love it, some hate it. I think it's a lovely soup - wonderful colour (it certainly looks healthy) and the right amount of garlic. Eating an entire tub is perhaps a bit too much garlic and greens for one sitting though!

It's pretty average. I think the flavour was good, but a little too oily, would have preferred it more green and light compared to how it tastes. It's fine for quick food and you have no time to cook/bring lunch but I wouldn't go and buy it again in particular.
Tastes good but why so much salt
Love the taste of this soup. Very well balanced, light, healthy and delicious.
Really lovely soup. Texture, taste, good for you. Ticks all the boxes!
Not too salty, not too garlicky. Well seasoned and tasty. No idea why they say it isn't suitable to freeze, because I ignored that and it thawed and heated beautifully.

This is a great low-calorie, thick, vegan green soup. I would like a bit more garlic and FAR less salt. One half-tub serving contains 1500 mg of sodium. That's your full daily intake in one whack, and it certainly tastes it! Don't think I can manage to choke down the second serving. At least I'll have no problem drinking my water today!
Full of flavour and heartier than expected, will definitely purchase again
Love the taste of this soup. The kale is very subtle and the garlic really adds flavour to it.
Love this soup- and please don't reduce the garlic in it...though a price reduction would be very welcome.
too much garlic for my taste... Pls reduce it!!!
A good soup, far better than most shop-bought soups, and it makes a nice, healthy lunch that, with a dash of salt, tastes pretty good too!
These are the best range of soups I've ever tried. Really fresh and tasty, they give you more vitality too!
I had half a carton with two slices of Rye bread and felt unexpectedly full. Very simple and clean tasting. Yummy....
Needed seasoning at the very least
Delicious! Great flavour!
Just had this for dinner and had to double check the label because we couldn't believe it doesn't have cream in it!! Deliciously thick, beautifully garlicky and perfectly seasoned.  Top shelf!!

No taste of garlic which it desperately needed !
Just a taste of mashed up watery green veg... very disappointing
Taste made me gag
Absolutely love this soup - has to be the best ever!  Thick and garlicky - and healthy to boot.  Wow!
Thought I would try this brand for a change. This flavour was just so delicious !
After reading reviews I tried this, but was disappointed.  I was expecting a really tasty soup with big garlic kick.  It wasn't the punchy flavours I was expecting...more garlic needed.

Probably the most bland and boring soup I have ever tried. Absolutely no taste of garlic, which I had been looking forward to. It tasted to me like some green veg whizzed up in a blender with some water added, with no hint of seasoning.
Packs a punch with the garlic and is very healthy to boot. A great soup.

I'm not a big fan of garlic but I love this soup. The flavours may not be what you expect them to be but its still super tasty and healthier than other pre-made soups. I buy this every week and only really found one of them 'watery' - most times you've just got to be sure to give it a good shake/stir. 
Goes well with a pinch of Parmesan, if it all gets too healthy for you.

This is a really tasty soup.  The ingredients necessarily make it a thin soup, and you can taste the garlic, though it does give it a sweetness as it says, but I found it very nice. Even if you do not like garlic I would give it a try as the flavour is quite different.  The ingredients are also very healthy for the body and I need to eat kale for its nutrients but do not like it boiled or in any other way so I think this is a really good way of getting useful nutrients for both young and old as it is in such a tasty form.

When I first tried this, I thought, "Mmmm, good, quite healthy", but then as I continued, I just got completely overwhelmed by the very strong taste of garlic.  Now I do like garlic, but it was all I could taste in this soup after a while.  Shame as the flavours of kale and spinach did not shine through at all.
I Bought this soup because I thought it would do me good. I was not expecting to eat one of the tastiest soups ever. Just ordered two more for next week!
Nice but very watery, too watery for me!! will not buy again because of this.
water, sludgy and too garlicky.  not smooth enough and the garlic flavour is overpowering.
Loved this thick dark green soup, tasted so good and healthy with a great kick of garlic, literally the best soup ever! Loved it.
Amazjng that other reviewers liked this, we thought it was horrible, thick and sludgy and not very tasty. Wondered if adding parmesan might help but decided to throw rest away instead.

I purchased this soup whilst on a health kick, its so difficult to find soups out there that aren't stuffed with cream or milk so I hit a jackpot with this, absolutely delicious, will definitely be trying other flavours! Ocado please get the carrot and ginger flavour in stock!
Best green soup, thick, garlicky and brimming with goodness!
A nice soup, although I did end up adding more Garlic myself. Partner enjoyed it too, we will be buying it again after we have tried all of their other flavours. So good to find more vegan soups!
Great flavour and taste, really thick soup and I could feel it doing me good!  I love that there are no processed foods in these soups.
Agree with previous reviewer, absolutely delicious.

Just had this delivered and immediately opened it for lunch and it is simply heaven.  So thick and creamy I had to double check the label to make sure there wasn't actually any cream in it!  Pure yum.

One star simply for being healthy. Really watery soup - very thin and totally lacking in flavour. Disappointing! Have a different soupologie in the fridge - hoping it's delicious because this one went down the sink!
Seriously green soup with strong kick of garlic, totally loved it. More please...
Delicious flavourful coffee with a hint of coconut.
Does actually taste of coconut - which is good - I hate it when you expect a flavour and end up with a 'hint'.  I think would work best in a latte

I received this coffee for free in return for a review and found that I really enjoyed the unusual coconut flavouring. It didn’t taste too artificial which I was worried about. Very enjoyable and would buy again

*free sample review* I've actually got a sample pack with all the flavours so I'd recommend that first if you're unsure about flavoured coffee but generally they're good. My only complaint is sometimes the smell is better than the taste. You can taste this coconut though, not super strongly in my opinion as coffee is a tad bitter sometimes. Think it would make good latte type bases.
Sent a sample to review. Not a big coffee fan but found this a nice change. Just the right amount of flavour. Great aroma too. Not sure if would purchase.

I was given this to review. I like coconut and like coffee and I liked this product. It won’t be to everyone’s taste though. I’m not sure I would want it as a replacement for my morning coffee but would drink during the day.
Delicious flavourful coffee with a hint of coconut.
Does actually taste of coconut - which is good - I hate it when you expect a flavour and end up with a 'hint'.  I think would work best in a latte

I received this coffee for free in return for a review and found that I really enjoyed the unusual coconut flavouring. It didn’t taste too artificial which I was worried about. Very enjoyable and would buy again

*free sample review* I've actually got a sample pack with all the flavours so I'd recommend that first if you're unsure about flavoured coffee but generally they're good. My only complaint is sometimes the smell is better than the taste. You can taste this coconut though, not super strongly in my opinion as coffee is a tad bitter sometimes. Think it would make good latte type bases.
Sent a sample to review. Not a big coffee fan but found this a nice change. Just the right amount of flavour. Great aroma too. Not sure if would purchase.

I was given this to review. I like coconut and like coffee and I liked this product. It won’t be to everyone’s taste though. I’m not sure I would want it as a replacement for my morning coffee but would drink during the day.
I was sent this to review. it was ok but I didn't enjoy it enough to recommend or buy again. Think I prefer my coffee straight and not messed about with added different flavours.

I received this as a sample to review for Ocado. I found it really nice with a subtle flavour that can be drunk without milk. This is great to have on hand especially at work where they only supply UHT milk of which I’m not keen!

I was sent a jar of this to review. I love coffee. I love coconut. I didnt love this! Ingredient is natural coconut flavour which could mean anything, but this coffee has never seen an actual coconut. It tastes highly artificial and isnt very pleasant.
Don't normally drink coffee but this has a lovely refreshing coconut-ty tang to it - like eating a coconut and coffee revel at the same time!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. As a big coconut fan who drinks instant coffee at home anyway I enjoyed it as an afternoon warmer. Coffee aficionados probably feel differently though! May well buy again.
asked to review.  Neither flavour works here and certainly not blended.

Smelly really good but seriously not nice at all 
Dont no who thought this would work
Was really excited to have this as it smells great - like coconut chocolates and coffee. Unfortunately, we felt it had an unpleasant taste and would not repurchase.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. A bit unusual taste and artificial but not a bad taste. it’s ok to enjoy occasionally. Not an everyday coffee for me. Good that they keep it to small portion and lower price as there’s little incentive to buy big jar.
I was given this as a free sample for review.  I was definitely happy about that.  This really reminded me of Hawaiian coffee.  A nice sweet edge.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I rarely drink instant coffee but keep some in the cupboard for once in a while. I have tried other flavours of Beanies and some are quite enjoyable, but I didn't care for this one. I found the coconut flavour quite artificial tasting, and don't really like the combination.

I'm not an instant coffee fan but was given this product to review. For fairness giving it 3 stars because it's drinkable, though the coconut aroma was off-putting at first it is not overpowering when you drink it. Unfortunately it did not convert me to an instant coffee fan.
Im not a huge coffee fan, and certainly not a coffee connoisseur, but I enjoyed this. It had an unusual taste but the more I drank the more I got used to it! Worth a try!
I was given this as a sample from Ocado. Absolutely agree with the previous review - very pleasant aroma and taste of coconut but I prefer coffee without a coconut flavouring.

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’
This coffee has a really pleasant aroma of coconut.  It is also smooth to drink and easy on the stomach.
Unfortunately I thought that coconut and coffee do not blend well in terms of taste and would actually have preferred the coffee without the coconut
The packaging states smoked, Ocado description does not.  These were really bad and I wouldnt have bought if it was clearly stated that they are smoked Paprika.
Picture is misleading- got 4 small peppers which were average at best
Pictures suggests 6 peppers. In my case it was four small peppers. Not great value.

These can be somewhat variable. For the price, I really think the seeds should be properly removed. These tasted as though all the seeds had been left in, resulting in a very unpleasant texture. This outweighed the reasonably pleasant taste. I will not be buying these again.
These arrived soggy and a bit shrivelled.  They really didn't look appertising and for the first time in my household some left over.

I have tasted a lot of stuffed peppers and for me these are by far the best. they are expensive for the amount you get in the pack, however that has not stopped me from just adding two packs to my basket.
such a great snack! disappeared very quickly
We found these very nice. We will be reordering
Such a treat.  I always buy 2 when on offer.
These were bought to eat with leftovers and grazing over Christmas. They were nice, but not worth 70p each
I have to limit myself to eating just half the pack at a time. These are full of flavour, creamy and crunchy.
These are super tasty and have a good long date. But they are very pricey for the amount you get in a packet.
I add these to salads or to decorate a cheeseboard. Or simply eat straight from the packet. These are very moreish
It just doesn’t taste good
Just 4 in the pack.  Had I known I wouldnt have purchased these.  They used to be good!

I normally love these when I have bought them from other supermarkets and do prefer the ricotta filled ones but thought I would give these a try.  

There were only SIX in the pack, making these ludicrously expensive.  I've paid the same for more than double that amount.  Madness.

The title says it all. Wasn't sure about the paprika but they are definitely the best stuffed peppers I have had.  Knocked a star off as they are very pricey so I only buy them when they are on offer.
Horrible burnt taste, had to throw away.

These are delicious, just the right amount of heat, went well with a tapas selection. They are very expensive compared to other similar pots of the same produce from other supermarkets. Not sure I would purchase again unless they were on an offer.
Too expensive won't buy again.

The receipt describes these as "Mixed filled peppers with ricotta and paprika".  They are actually very hot peppers, (not "mixed" in any way) filled with cream cheese, not ricotta, and SMOKED paprika not paprika.  The distinction is important for me as I bought them for my husband who likes the hot peppers but does NOT like SMOKED paprika.  There were only 5 peppers in the pack so at full price that's 70p each!  Never again.
I love these... I have to restrict myself to just two with a salad otherwise I'd eat the lot. Because of the price I tend to only treat myself when they are on offer.
These are really unpleasant. Paprika ruins them. Avoid.
not only expensive for what you get, but everyone had the same opinion that they were awful
Lovely little kick of sweet spice. Tasty addition to a salad

Bought as part of a wider spread of nibbles and they were polished off in no time. Nice sharp, sweet, creamy, paprika smoky balance. Not cheap, but I wouldnt be bothered to make them myself so happy to pay for someone else to stuff a tiny pepper!
The peppers are lovely and spicy but the cream cheese is too overpowering I think. Prefer the peppers on their own
Anyone who doesnt like these is just losing their sense of taste.

I love these kind of things. From elsewhere.
Was so looking forward to these as part of our cold picnic dinner. How disappointed I was though. They still had quite a few days to go before expiry date ran out however they tasted off, tart and sour somehow, not nice. I feel like trying them again, but I'm hesitant to be honest. They aren't cheap.

I used to buy these every so often, but stopped as I felt they were overpriced.  They are still in my favourites and I re-ordered in December for for a drinks party.  Unpacked delivery to find they now HALF the size as before but the same price!  Really annoyed at Ocado as these are NOT the same product that was saved in favourites earlier in the year.  More annoyed at Unearthed who have form for treating customers as mugs.  No more Unearthed products for me now.
I really liked these! Put them out with lots of other antipasti bits for a starter and went down well. Would buy again.
Really love these. Nice contrast of crisp sweet peppers, creamy ricotta, warm kick from smoked paprika

The 'smoked paprika', had a nasty artificial 'burnt' taste which was overpowering and not pleasant.

Smokey paprika should have a depth of flavour, this tasted of burnt plastic. Not good!
I just didn't like them.
Very nice peppers, and better than the equivalent from other supermarkets which tend to be very oily.

The pepper seeds weren't removed in the majority of these so the texture is not nice. Overall the flavour is the same as cheaper supermarket varieties and at least those don't have seeds in. The spicy kick is good in these and the creaminess of the cheese is OK but overall a very poor experience as you've got to crunch your way through the seeds.
I was dissapointed in these. They tasted very sharply  of vinegar with everything else being overwhelmed
I've already bought them several times and they have always been quite delicious. They aren't cheap but it's a quality purchase.
These are a bit pricey and you don't get many for your money but they are delicious and definitely worth buying when on offer.
Do not buy this. 12£ for few vegetables and sauce. This is a joke. The same plater home made would be 5/6£ max.

I normally do this simple snack myself but was pressed fro time with several other edibles I had to prepare. Sorely disappointed. Had to discard of the peppers and cucmber as they were mushy. Dips were delicious. Won't be buying again.

Really disappointed with this one - the veg was sat in water, which made it all very limp and slimy. Tasted awful and had to be put in the bin right when we put it out at a party - only thing that wasn't ruined was the dip. I'd avoid and just buy / chop your own veg - quality was poor.

These are good for entertaining. A little on the expensive side but saves time. The dips were lovely. Some cucumber sticks were just the peel and very thin. The guests asked where they were from. 
I might buy again if ever on offer.
Bought for family bbq..saved time, fresh and looked good..tasted fine would buy again but a little expensive

I had a barbecue at the weekend and this was the highlight. The guests were picking away at the crudites the whole duration. the dips were delicious and the vegetables were fresh. the packaging and everything was perfect very impressed and we'll be ordering again for my next party!
Do not buy this. 12£ for few vegetables and sauce. This is a joke. The same plater home made would be 5/6£ max.

I normally do this simple snack myself but was pressed fro time with several other edibles I had to prepare. Sorely disappointed. Had to discard of the peppers and cucmber as they were mushy. Dips were delicious. Won't be buying again.

I might buy again if ever on offer.
Bought for family bbq..saved time, fresh and looked good..tasted fine would buy again but a little expensive

I had a barbecue at the weekend and this was the highlight. The guests were picking away at the crudites the whole duration. the dips were delicious and the vegetables were fresh. the packaging and everything was perfect very impressed and we'll be ordering again for my next party!
Great taste not too sweet and recyclable cans - fair trade too. Great for cooking a ham in !
Not a cola drinker left a bad aftertaste but this stuff is beaut! I wouldn’t buy anything else can’t wait to try out the whole range.

I had ordered the Gingerella cans and this arrived as a substitute and I hadnt realised until the delivery man had left and I couldnt return it. To be honest I really didnt fancy it and its sat there for months, not being useful for the moscow mules I was craving. I have Finally tried it just now and its actually delicious! Its like a less chemically flavoured, slightly spicy coke. Im just annoyed that Ive been a snob about it for so long!
Love this stuff. Great flavour. I have always enjoyed more 'natural' cola drinks and this is one of the best.

I’m not a fan of fizzy drinks but my husband was a huge iron bru addict 
We had tried a few healthier alternatives to get him to stop drinking Pepsi/iron bru etc but they didn’t tickle his fancy 
So I thought we would give karma cola a try and we now order it with every shop!
He loves it and has ditched all the horrible sugary drinks he previously drank 
I tried it and found it had a lovely taste rather than the strange chemical after taste 
I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to treat themselves once in a while :)
As a treat this is a lovely drink. I love the new can size and the change to cardboard packaging.
Great taste not too sweet and recyclable cans - fair trade too. Great for cooking a ham in !
Not a cola drinker left a bad aftertaste but this stuff is beaut! I wouldn’t buy anything else can’t wait to try out the whole range.

I had ordered the Gingerella cans and this arrived as a substitute and I hadnt realised until the delivery man had left and I couldnt return it. Its like a less chemically flavoured, slightly spicy coke. Im just annoyed that Ive been a snob about it for so long!
Love this stuff. Great flavour. I have always enjoyed more 'natural' cola drinks and this is one of the best.

We had tried a few healthier alternatives to get him to stop drinking Pepsi/iron bru etc but they didn’t tickle his fancy 
So I thought we would give karma cola a try and we now order it with every shop!
He loves it and has ditched all the horrible sugary drinks he previously drank 
I tried it and found it had a lovely taste rather than the strange chemical after taste 
I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to treat themselves once in a while :)
As a treat this is a lovely drink. I love the new can size and the change to cardboard packaging.

I think the negative reviews and unfair and misleading. My husband loves this pate. It has a delicious full depth of flavour and gorgeous smooth texture. If you prefer chunky Ardennes style pate then this might not suit, but for a smooth pate it is excellent.
Despite being chilled, unopened and 4 days within its use by date it had gone off. Yuk
I love Brussels pate but this was disgusting

Didn't expect much because of the price point and it being part of the 3 for £7 deal, but I really enjoyed the flavour and the texture. Reminded me a lot of the heartier ones we eat a lot in Austria - will definitely buy again!

Wow, so glad I did not read the reviews before buying. It is a mildly flavoured smooth Brussels pate. The flavour seems bland at first bite, but then the flavour comes through gradually. I had the pate on a warmed bread roll. I added pepper for more bite. By the end of the snack I was enjoying it as the flavour was, by then, coming through properly. I rate this as a decent middle-of-the-road pate. I much prefer coarse Ardennes pate, but this one is part of the Deli meal deal. Don’t be afraid to give it a try, pate lovers. It is too pricey for what it is
It was bland and had a very strange consistency. Wont buy it again.

I think the negative reviews and unfair and misleading. My husband loves this pate. It has a delicious full depth of flavour and gorgeous smooth texture. If you prefer chunky Ardennes style pate then this might not suit, but for a smooth pate it is excellent.
Despite being chilled, unopened and 4 days within its use by date it had gone off. Yuk
I love Brussels pate but this was disgusting

It was bland and had a very strange consistency. Wont buy it again.
Yuk. Probably the worst pate I have ever had. Too strong a flavour. V weird taste. What a waste of money.
Knoow other people have said it's strong and a bit boozy but I like that.

As soon as I opened the container I thought how strong the smell was in comparison to the same style of pate I'd bought from Ocado pre-Sept. Slightly boozy, can't quite put my finger on it but the taste was not a hit with my child who used to love it. No other options now either Ocado?
Very strange and strong aftertaste:/
I love Brussels pate so thought this would be lovely from m&s. It was disgusting. It tasted like onion and left a really horrible taste. I threw it away.
Its horrible - has a strange plasticky taste and it got thrown in the bin. Sorry.
This and the chick pea one - delicious standby. Yum yum.
Was sent this to review. It's not completely tasteless but is very bland.

This smells and tastes great but I found the lentils a little hard and under-cooked and the sauce was very liquid.  It resembled a soup.  If the dhal had been cooked longer the lentils would have started to break down and they would then thicken up the sauce too.

I am reviewing this product as I was sent a free sample from ocado.  I was really looking forward to trying this because it smelt lovely when I opened it, but unfortunately I found it bland, tasteless and watery.  I won't be buying this.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. We love a spicy dhal in our house but it's usually homemade. My son loves dhal and is really not fussy at all but he couldn't even finish a quarter of this so it went in the bin and I hate wasting food! It had a very 1 dimensional flavour and was really very bland, even the texture was dry and not good. I hate to leave such a negative review but it just wasn't nice at all!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I was really looking forward to trying this and it smelt lovely whilst it was cooking but didn’t  taste of anything, tasted quite watery probably wouldn’t recommend of buy in the future.
This and the chick pea one - delicious standby. Yum yum.
Was sent this to review. It's not completely tasteless but is very bland.

This smells and tastes great but I found the lentils a little hard and under-cooked and the sauce was very liquid.  It resembled a soup.  If the dhal had been cooked longer the lentils would have started to break down and they would then thicken up the sauce too.

I am reviewing this product as I was sent a free sample from ocado.  I was really looking forward to trying this because it smelt lovely when I opened it, but unfortunately I found it bland, tasteless and watery.  I won't be buying this.

My son loves dhal and is really not fussy at all but he couldn't even finish a quarter of this so it went in the bin and I hate wasting food! It had a very 1 dimensional flavour and was really very bland, even the texture was dry and not good. I hate to leave such a negative review but it just wasn't nice at all!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I was really looking forward to trying this and it smelt lovely whilst it was cooking but didn’t  taste of anything, tasted quite watery probably wouldn’t recommend of buy in the future.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Had a nice level of spice/warmth but not a great deal of flavour, and not much texture from the lentils. All in all a bit bland and soupy.
I usually love tarka daal, but this wasn’t right. Not sure whether it’s the recipe or a particular batch. I’ll try again as I really like this company’s aubergine curry

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I gave this to my daughter and family to try as they are vegetarians, and they loved it. So they will be buying again as they are Ocado customers too.
‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ This is very thin, it has no texture. The lentils are barely visible. Taste-wise it is OK, but is a bit strong on the cumin.
It was ten out of ten with aromat and coriander
Am reviewing this as I received a sample from Ocado. It was fine. Nothing special. A little bit watery . Flavour okay. Ate happily but would not purchase again.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. It only takes a few minutes to warm up on the hob, and it tastes really good. It's not too spicy, maybe more peppery than anything else. A light and nice dinner for lazy nights.
My son makes and eats a lot of soup, we both tried this and honestly it was just ok, nothing special. We both feel it lacked a depth of flavour. Ok for a quick warm snack.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
I like Indian food, but never tried daal before, so thought I woul risk trying this one  I quite enjoyed it, was reasonably spicy but was a bit watery and not sure if daal should be. Will be intresting to try a different brand to compare to this

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ I love daal, and while this is perfectly edible, it isn't the nicest available. I found it a little watery and lacking in flavour. If the spices were upped a bit then this would be a lovely accompaniment to a curry.
Very bland and lacked seasoning. We tasted no smookyness at all. Disappointed
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Sadly, this Daal is just not good- you're better off buying from other brands, or just make it yourself! This is a pass.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
Sorry but this was just not very pleasant to eat. Perhaps just not right for me, however I found the concistantcy was sloppy and the taste was watery and bland. Not an item I would put on my shopping list again.

I love daal and eat it regularly, but this is just nasty. Wet and sloppy yet the lentils somehow manage to have a dry texture. Totally lacking in taste. There are far better options that taste good and cost a lot less.
Im reviewing this because I got a free sample from Ocado. Sadly I didnt like it at all. It was very bland and watery. I definitely wont be buying in future

I was sent a free sample to review.
This wasn't very good and on the bland side.  The worst was that it gave me a lot of gas!  Yikes, so I wouldn't order.

Im often quite limited with what Indian food I can eat, as I really do not like heat or chillis. 

Daal is one of the few dishes that I regularly have, and I was quite happy to receive a free sample from Ocado to review. 

This is quite possibly the worst I have ever had!

I love lentils and thought that this looked tempting to start with, as I could see large, whole lentils floating in the sauce. That was as far as being tempted went. 

There was no thickness at all my to the sauce, as though none of the lentils had broken down to thicken it it was really watery. 

and just to keep the watery theme running, this daal then followed suit with the taste. Flavourless and watery. 

I think if I had mixed some turmeric, water, cornflour and tinned lentils Id have probably made a fairly decent duplicate of this. 

I genuinely would not pay a single penny for this, and to be honest, wouldnt even eat it again if it was given to me.

This was more like Tarka Daal soup which btw is actually a thing now.  How much has the price of lentils skyrocketed that it needs to be watered down to this consistency.  Annoying because it then alters the rest of the meal.
I was sent this free to review. While it tastes less oily than restaurant/takeaway tarka daal, it's also missing a bit of flavour and salt. I'm on the fence with this one...
I was really looking forward to this product as I love Tarka Daal.  It was so disappointing, really bland and probably lacking seasoning.  Wouldn't buy again.
I was really looking forward to this as a quick, healthy lunch, but it needs more of a kick of flavour and some spice. Quite enjoyed it still, but wouldnt rush out and buy again

Im writing this review as I was sent a sample to try by Ocado.  We had it as a side dish to accompany a homemade chicken curry. It was really really bland and needed a lot of seasoning to make it edible. It was ok but its doubtful Id actually buy it.

Given product to review by Ocado

To be fair, the packaging looks good but sadly the daal is lacklustre.. the taste is mediocre at the best - but there are many other brands out there that are more flavourful and worth the purchase

Sorry would not consider buying this product

I was sent this by Ocado in exchange for an honest review.
Sadly this product was not for us. It was bland/tasteless, definitely needed something added to give it some flavour.

... as it has no junky ingredients in, but I found it dense and hard to digest, with quite a bland flavour. I will try some of the others in the range, as I see they have good reviews. However, as it stands, Easy Bean is still my favourite junk-free, quick-cook dahl.

Not overly smoked which is a good thing from my perspective. You know that very pervasive smoke smell and flavour you get in some products is just a chemical, right?  Anyway this is mild and perfect for sandwiches.
Got as a substitute. Ham tastes like its slightly off, no smoky flavour, is really dry and had seams of gristle running through it. Really not good compared to M&S brand.
Favourite packed lunch ham, but short date for large pack.
Very tasty ham and good quality slices

I try not to buy too much processed meat but toasted sandwiches are so much better with ham. All ham is processed so I guess it doesnt matter how much? This is smoky and cheap. Cooks well on pizza too as its thick enough.
Usually buy Brunswick but this is far, far tastier. It has a lovely flavour and is a big hit in my house!

Not overly smoked which is a good thing from my perspective. You know that very pervasive smoke smell and flavour you get in some products is just a chemical, right?  Anyway this is mild and perfect for sandwiches.
Got as a substitute. Ham tastes like its slightly off, no smoky flavour, is really dry and had seams of gristle running through it. Really not good compared to M&S brand.
Favourite packed lunch ham, but short date for large pack.
Very tasty ham and good quality slices

I try not to buy too much processed meat but toasted sandwiches are so much better with ham. All ham is processed so I guess it doesnt matter how much? This is smoky and cheap. Cooks well on pizza too as its thick enough.
Usually buy Brunswick but this is far, far tastier. It has a lovely flavour and is a big hit in my house!
Flavoursome ham and not too fatty. Good in sandwiches

This is a nice Brunswick ham. It is thicker than the wafer one we usually get but very tasty and good for the diet (high protein, low fat).

Some might say it is a bit rubbery but if you like thick cut Brunswick then this is a good product for you (and us).
Really nice. I got it for half price in a flash sale and hence it is good value for money too.
This is a really nice tasting smoked ham. Really good in anything not just a sandwich.
Enjoyed this ham, tasty and not a lot of fat. Only drawback was that the pack was difficult to get into.
enjoyed this in a roll for my lunch. will order again

This is one of our favourite smoked hams, it has a rich smoked flavour yet it is not overpowering like some smoked products. We have had this product many times now and the quality is consistently excellent.
No added sugars which is perfect for me..dense and lovely flavour
Lean & tasty. I dont like wet ham  & love the smoky flavour
This is going in my regulars!
Liked this smoked ham a lot.  Good subtle flavour ideal for quesadillas or served with poached egg and avocado on a toasted muffin.  Good value too.
Good quality, reasonably thick cut ham that doesnt taste overly salty either. Clearly specified as reformed so with that expectation its 5 star.
I prefer this ham so much more than the Waitrose Brunswick ham! I hope that Ocado has not decided to discontinue it!
I tried this instead of waitrose Brunswick ham and although it is a cheaper version it was still and tasty and more wafer thin. good in sandwiches and in salads.

To the previous reviewer - All cured pork products must contain nitrites as they inhibit Clostridium botulinum growth. Take nitrites away and you will have a deadly case of botulism. If you can't abide nitrites then no cured pork for you!

Oh, forgot to say, not a bad product but not great.
Nice but won't buy again as it contains nitrates

Rubbery and not like the Waitrose Brunswick ham 
Don't buy
This ham is not worth buying. It is very rubbery and has no ham texture at all. Better off buying the Brunswick ham from waitrose for a bit more.
This is average ham and water product, with pieces of ham glued together into an oval shape. I bought this because I mistook it for a higher quality ham in a similar package

Bought this as the reviews were good.  Sorry cannot bring myself to eat this product looks awful.  Better to pay a bit more and buy the more expensive one.  Had that one before and it is really really nice.
I wasn't sure whether to give a great feedback as I don't want ocado to put the price up, but with all honesty, it is a delicious ham
A really tasty ham, never any fatty or chewy bits as is so common in ham. Just such a shame that it is not always in stock. It is so popular, maybe you should think about getting more in.

My husband really enjoys this, it's very good value. His parents were also very impressed with this when we served it up in sandwiches one afternoon. It tastes better than more expensive packs and always has an excellent shelf life, normally at least a few weeks. It's very handy to have a pack in the fridge in case we need sandwiches.
NA
This is how I remember banana milkshakes tasting. I've tried other premade protein drinks and found they tasted weak. No weird aftertaste.
This tastes good and not as artificial as some other brands taste. The ingredient seem ok. It has 12g carbs and 24 mg protein. I like this one a lot.

I found this to have quite nice banana flavour.  It was refreshing but a little too sweet for me.  However, if you are looking for convenience as far as grabbing protein without any hassle,  it’s great.
Wouldnt have this all the time, but it tasted very nice, so would buy again
This shake had a nice banana taste.  However l found it a bit too sweet.

As nice as most other banana flavoured milks, which I can never get enough of.  Tasty and refreshing.  Losing a star because, while it might not have added sugar a bottle is still more than 1/3 of your recommend sugar intake.

(Free in exchange for this review)
No preparation, easy to heat and good flavour.   Very convenient when in a rush.  Will definitely buy again.
I like this chicken but am getting 3 for 7 in the M&S stores.
I heated them up in the oven and they were very tasty, no issues.

Wow, these are good. My pack contained five pieces. Enough food for two large, or three small meals. Heated in the oven for about 12 mins each side at 160 or 170. They were super tasty. You can eat the skins or discard them, as you see fit. The meat is tender, moist and flavoursome. Two pieces with spuds and veg made a lovely lunch. Well done M&S. Bought as part of the Cooked Meat deal, great value.
I love these chicken thighs. They are great for a quick and tasty lunch or dinner. I have never been disappointed - it's always tender and full of flavour!
When I opened the package I was absolutely amazed. Awful! Inferior! Will not be buying this again.
Very Rubbery, No Taste, lll stick to the 1/2 Cooked Chicken.
My daughter loves these in a wrap with salad.
Not sure what seasoning is used but it doesnt do the chicken any favours. Apart from that I found the meat quite rubbery
Tasty but full of fragments of bone.  Not jointed properly by a butcher.

These chicken thighs used to be great & really moist chicken - this is now the 3rd time in the last few months when they have been really dry and flavourless and I am finally going to stop buying them.
Dry, old with some weird chemical flavour.  Managed to bite just few times . Don't recommend
The chicken was tough dry and grey in colour, old poultry is grey in colour. It was JUST about in date.  Didnt even look right tasted  absolutely disgusting.  Threw it in the bin.
Certainly better than the half chicken they do, good meat content and nice and moist.

Other half has these every week, just wished they weren't in a sugar coating, otherwise would be 5*. Always seems to be part of the 3 for £7 deal. Great these are british, so many of the precooked chicken seems to come from halfway round the world.
Highly recommend these chicken thighs ,will defiantly be buying again .So tasty and plenty of chicken on them
Im wondering if this would be more appealing if cooked at a lower temperature for longer?
This is the fourth pack in a row that has been of terrible quality - undercooked, pink, and some raw in this pack. We will not but this again.

I wasn't expecting much, in fact, I mainly got these for a bit of chicken for a pasta dish and the rest for dog treats. The dog was very upset watching me eat her treats as I was cutting it up.

Has a lovely flavour (I would say just pull off the skin and don't eat it). Was moist and reheated into a dishes well.

I always like to have cooked chicken in the house but these have been getting worse week by week until I feel I just had to place an unfavourable review. They are small, almost grey looking and tasteless. The area around the bone is brown and most unappetising. I will definitely not be buying these again.
These were a hit with us. We had four good size chicken thighs which we heated in the oven, they were tasty & succulent. Have already purchased again.

I took a risk and ordered these again after my last delivery of shrivelled up floor sweepings.  I am delighted to say that, after that serious wobble, these chicken thighs are back to their tasty and succulent standard.  Phew!
I found these thighs very tough and bony.  Would not buy again

I've had these before and they have been ok but this time round I recieved a pack of thighs that were more bone and skin than meat.  Whoever butchered these chickens need to go back to learn their skills.  The thighs were still connected to part of the the backbone. I tried to eat around the bone but it was not a pleasant experience as I kept getting slithers of bone in my mouth.  Yuk.  I certainly would not have picked up the pack if I was in an M&S store.
As others have stated the thighs are tiny and very dried out and tough- almost jerky like- I wont be buying them again.
Large juicy thighs - always in my fridge for those peckish moments!

These used to be a regular purchase, 4 maybe 5 succulent thighs in a pack great for meals.  The last two packs have been 6 or 7 scrawny dried out pieces that have no resemblance to the picture or description. Certainly not what they used to be.
Have had these before and used to be lovely. The last pack was dire, smallest thighs every (like a sparrows wing) - and lots of random pieces of skin and zero meat

This is normally a great product. Good value and tasty, however our most recent delivery (delivered Friday 29th jan) was lots of tiny pieces that were really dry/over cooked. Normally you get 4-6 pieces. This had c9 - which by the time skin was removed left v little chicken abc what there was poor quality. Hopefully this was a one off but sort our your quality control M&S/Ocado!

I regularly buy these from an M&S store but now and then I order off Ocado.  This week I got 2 small thighs and 8 scraps of overcooked and shrivelled chicken. I have noticed the difference in quality in a few items off Ocado compared to the store so won't be purchasing these again.
These were a regular in my basket, usually I get 4-5 nice juicy thighs. This week I received a pack with 10-12 chunks that were dried up and more skin and bone than chicken. Very disappointed.
Tiny horrid dry overcooked pieces with sharp bone fragments, no surprise that the package arrived punctured. Absolutely dreadful - Ive never seen such poor quality from M&S.
Nice when deboned and added to salads. The skin is tasty but there isn't any flavour added to the meat do you'll need a dressing to pizazz your salads.

This is the 4th M&S processed meat product that has slipped in standard. Yes, the product is tasty, convenient and good value in the offer but itsnot worth dying for! 
Please check the pieces before you serve as whoever butchered these pieces needs a talking to. Shards of bone where you least expect it with inconsistent cuts. 

It's not good enough and it needs to be looked at.
They were delicious in our lunch wraps one day when feeling so lazy and just in need of a quick but good food during homeschooling....
A lot more meat on these than I was expecting, these were tasty and a new regular in my shop.
We love this chicken cooked and  served with salad and coleslaw for a tasty dinner.

I look forward to the day when they are in stock and it coincides with me actually being able to book a slot. I think the truth is the fat cats running Ocado care more about the share price than anything.

I've bought these twice, hoping the first time was a one-off but both times the emat around the bone was pink. I had to throw it away as even my cats wouldn't touch it. Obviously the M&S supplier is saving themselves money by cutting the cooking time.

one pack damaged - split in the middle but unfortunately didn't notice till was going to use them (seems to be a recurring issue at the moment sadly) but  more worrying that a pack was slimy and the meat inside near the bone was visibly pink. Not very happy and definitely wouldn't buy again, It's made me very wary of their chicken products.

Used to regularly buy Waitrose roast chicken thighs. Pleased to say these are a good alternative. In fact, they are better, in as much as the packaging appears to be stronger. My last two Waitrose deliveries had to be thrown away as the packaging had split. Will be buying these regularly.
Average Chicken, certainly nothing to write home about.
Decent value for money, not bad tasting, but a bit slimy and more bone than meat on some of them.

We pull the meat from the bones, whilst the skin goes to the dogs as a treat.. mix with onion, peas and your favourtie chinese curry paste.. mine is the goldfish one(not sold by Ocado) and you got a great takeaway tasting Curry in less than 10 mins. Oh yeah.. tastes great!
Pre-roasted with a mild, sweet marinade that mainly adds colour. I got five evenly sized, properly trimmed, skin covered thighs in my pack. Succulent. A handy. tasty standby.
I microwaved mine just to heat up & add to a salad. They were so moist, had a lovely flavour & were super convenient. Am now going to buy them again to add to a stir fry.
Well worth it as part of 3 for £7 deal. So easy to prepare just 5 mins in the microwave

I buy roast chicken thighs on a regular basis as they are so versatile, and the quality is very good.   To save money I have attempted to roast chicken thighs but they are never as succulent as these.
Decent value for money, not bad tasting, but a bit slimy and more bone than meat on some of them.

We pull the meat from the bones, whilst the skin goes to the dogs as a treat.. mix with onion, peas and your favourtie chinese curry paste.. mine is the goldfish one(not sold by Ocado) and you got a great takeaway tasting Curry in less than 10 mins. Oh yeah.. tastes great!
Pre-roasted with a mild, sweet marinade that mainly adds colour. I got five evenly sized, properly trimmed, skin covered thighs in my pack. Succulent. A handy. tasty standby.
I microwaved mine just to heat up & add to a salad. They were so moist, had a lovely flavour & were super convenient. Am now going to buy them again to add to a stir fry.
Well worth it as part of 3 for £7 deal. So easy to prepare just 5 mins in the microwave

I buy roast chicken thighs on a regular basis as they are so versatile, and the quality is very good.   To save money I have attempted to roast chicken thighs but they are never as succulent as these.
This used to have crushed fruit in but have now changed to puree whi h gives them a fake fruit flavour. Will now be switching to innocent smoothies

My children love the banana and strawberry smoothies. They don’t like the other flavours as they have said they are sour. Such a good price. They now have paper straws which is good for the environment but sometimes is difficult to push through the hole as it bends and gets soggy very quickly.
Kids love them, so Im happy.
Daughter enjoys them

Tried this based on an advertisement in the Ocado magazine, but the smoothies are overly sweet and not nearly as nice as the Innocent smoothies which we normally buy. This Happy Monkey will certainly not make me switch from my usual brand.

These taste great and the kids (and adults) like them. A touch expensive for the amount of liquid in them though.  We make our own at home, no need for any fruit from concentrate. Would prefer them to be from whole fruit.....
