I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I gave to my teenagers so slighlty older than the intended market but they really enjoyed them when chilled in the fridge. A good way of getting fruit into reluctant children in a healthier form.
I was sent these by Ocado to review. They are very nice and marketed as  healthy but I found them almost unbearably sweet.  The 10 and 11 year olds I shared them with had no such qualms.
Has become a firm favourite with my teenage kids, especially the strawberry / banana flavour although the others are great too. A regular in my basket.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
My children love it, just love it and I am happy with the ingridients. good quality!
Kids love these and I think it’s a good price. But It’s mainly apple juice and banana. I would like to see more strawberries etc
I received this for review. My daughter enjoyed it. Good ingredients and no added sugar. Would recommend it

I am reviewing this product as I received a free sample from Ocado. These divided opinion in my household , I wouldn’t call them a smoothie but as a fruit drink they are pleasant enough. They do contain a portion of fruit so in that sense they are great and probably better than other drinks but not the best strawberry and banana flavour we have tried .
I received these from Ocado to review and my children were delighted - they love them thank you!

Both kids enjoyed these smoothie drinks, with the main flavour being strawberry. A good size carton without being too sickly.  Other flavour Happy Monkey do is Orange and mango which is just as great.
Children loved this, great for picnics!
Pure fruit, no sugar and kids love the, Great!
My boy took these to school with his morning snack. He’s really enjoyed them!
These went down well with my nieces. Very tasty and moreish. Would definitely recommend!

The children all had one each and enjoyed them all saying it was a tasty milkshake. The fact these are made from fruit is great. They would be useful in lunchboxes once the children actually start going back to school!
I received these free to review, my son loves them so we have continued buying them. He describes them as scrummy yummy!
I was sent these to review and my daughters loved them. They enjoyed them alongside their breakfast and said they were really tasty and would be happy to have them again, so thumbs up from us!

I was given these to review, unfortunately I didn't get to try any as my children drank them so quickly! As a treat I thought they were great and the children both stated they were yummy and they'd like them again.
i'm reviewing this product because i got a free sample from ocado my son 16 loves these :)
Great little smoothie. My kids love them as a treat. Would buy again.
Got sent these to review.  The kids loved them and wolfed them down!
A hit with my daughter but I found it rather sweet.
Nice flavour, we all tried and enjoyed them

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I have a super fussy eater, that refuses to eat fruit and is picky about juices etc. I wasn’t sure if these would be a hit or a miss, but he loved them. A good way of getting (albeit more sugary) fruit into kids. I didn’t get a chance to try one and they disappeared very quickly from the fridge

I was given these to review. My 2-year-old loved them and drank each one in minutes. Great that there was no added sugar and full of fruit but I'd still rather make most smoothies using some sort of milk too so the fruit acids aren't as harsh on tiny teeth. Convenient packaging for on the go too.
I was sent these to review, pleasantly surprised, nice tasting, kids drank them up and bonus has real fruit.
I received this as a gift to review. My children aged 7 and 4 really enjoyed these so they’d gone in two days. Ingredients look fine, there is no added sugar so nice as a treat.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Both my children liked these smoothies. Would consider buying them.
My 6 year old loves them; they taste good!

My daughter really enjoyed these and I have already bought them again.  They were not too sweet and she drank all of it which doesn't usually happen with carton drinks.  I would say it was more like a thick juice than a smoothie but definitely went down well here.
Sent this as a review item, our little one loved these.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Both my girls really enjoyed these smoothies as an after school snack. Price is good and they have a good shelf life. I would consider buying again.
I was given a pack of these to review and really enjoyed them[ even though I am a lot older than a kid ] Real fruit ingredients and no added sugar is a bonus.
I was given this by Ocado to review, Kids loved it and so did husband.  They both said it was really tasty no bitter after taste.
My daughter really enjoyed these as they weren't so thick. They were hard to pierce with the straw.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. My nephews loved these smoothies. nice packaging The only negative was they are not easy to open.
I was sent these to review. Even though they both claim not to like bananas, my children really loved these.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I tried one first and then I gave one to my four-year-old who was very excited and called it monkey drink so the illustration on it is working very well. Good taste and a nice occasional treat. I don't like the plastic straw though.
I was given  this to review by Ocado Loved by the whole family. Will definitely buy again
We got this for a review and my kids absolutely loved it! It has no added sugar which is great !

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I don't have kids but I gave these a try, they are really tasty and you can taste that it's real fruit and not just flavourings. The price isn't bad either. Only reason I'm marking them down slightly is the sugar content is quite high, although it states there is no added sugar.
I was sent these to review....I didn’t taste them personally but the kids knocked them right back and said they were lovely, good value for the price, will get them again
Both my children polished it off quickly. Very sweet though.

I received this to review and my 2 girls were very excited to try them, I only normally let them drink water or milk so this was a special treat for them and it didnt last long they both liked it (my girls are ages 3 and 5) I had a little taste and it was pleasant. I would buy again as a special treat
This has the texture of juice, not smoothie. My kids thought the flavour was ok.
the flavour of strawberry and banana needs to be more defined, hard to tell what flavour it was. Sweet and smooth smoothie.

Received this free to review. 
Kept in fridge although you don’t need to. Find it a bit strange though that for something with such a long shelf life there are no preservatives.... kids loved it, found it fresh and fruity and tasty. I would buy again but it seems to contain more apple juice that anything else so the banana / strawberry feels a bit misleading.

3yrs old loved this drink and polished it off in one sitting. I would agree with other reviewers that it’s more of a juice than smoothie consistency. We received this free to review and I didn’t check the nutritional content. We won’t be buying in future as sugar content at 5teaspoons per drink is a bit much for us. Not that this brand is any higher in sugar content than other brands just these types of drinks in general!
Both children really liked this smoothie, it wasn't thick or floppy, more like a juice drink, kids drank every last drop and said it was amazing.

Sent these to review and my two daughters had very different opinions. One took one sip and wouldn't drink the rest and the other thought they were amazing and probably would have drunk all four in one sitting if allowed. Personally not to my taste as mostly tasted of banana. So great if you have a child who loves banana, not so great otherwise.
My children love these and we were sent them to review. They loved the sweetness of them however their consistency is more like a fruit juice than a smoothie.
My daughter thoroughly enjoyed these. They were very sweet and fruity, quite a treat!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. My 2 year old absolutely loved this. He sat and drank it all and said nice at the end of each sip. He can be fairly picky (what toddler isn't?!) but he really enjoyed this drink. Will be purchasing again.
I was sent this for free to review. My daughter enjoys these, but does prefer the Innocent smoothies. However these are good value for money.
My daughter loved it, I though it was too sweet.

The reviews are very confusing, all the parents say that their kids hate it and all the grown-ups love it. 
Im 23 years old and this is a staple in my everyday lunchbox. Perfect quantity, perfect consistency.
Too sweet and it doesnt taste like smoothie at all!
As an adult, I still enjoy these. Try one with a shot of Malibu for a really tasty summery cocktail!
Im not a big fan of thick, goopy smoothies but I like these. Refreshing burst of juices. Have been reaching for them through the hot days. Nice.

Perhaps my family are different but we enjoy this. It is more juice-like than pureed fruit, but that means you are more likely to get all the juice to drink, rather than leaving a load of heavy puree at the bottom of your carton. 
Having said that, they could do with a slightly longer straw supplied with each carton to get all the juice out!
I tried happy monkey for a change and i find this flavour very sweet and not natural
My daughter drunk it, but after initially dropping it in disgusted shock. Definitely not a smoothie.
Not thick like a puree, a juice from concentrate. Children didn't like although they like normal smoothies and other juices. Poor product.

Doesn't even deserve one star.  If you're expecting puréed fruit (which is what I think a smoothie is) don't buy this product. It's made mainly from juice and worse still that juice is from concentrate. My kids didn't even like the taste.

My son loves these and has one with every dinner!  As other people have said in their reviews, these are not as thick as smoothies but that makes them appeal to children more in my opinion.  Great value as well compared to the innocent smoothies.
My son loves Happy Monkey smoothies Strawberry and Banana flavour.  He prefers this to Innocent smoothies.
Bought these as a change from the Innocent ones and one son refused to drink them due to their 'yucky taste' and the other son drunk one under sufference.
incredibly sweet, and tastes like a juice drink. It is not thick like a smoothie, so why is it called that?  not liked at all by my kids.
These are made of 85% apple juice from concentrate.
These were really awful, they are not a smoothie as the name suggests, they are merely a fruit juice/squash type drink that tastes just like artificial sweeteners. Definitely would not recommend.

As the title suggests, the kids love them. They're not pure fruit smoothies, but not packed with sugar and preservatives either. More like a juice than a smoothie, so good for kids who don't like the thickness of most smoothies.
Whilst some might like this flavour I absolutely found it revolting in fact the taste reminded me of cherry cough medicine and not pleasant at all.
This is my absolute favourite pepsi flavour. Great price for them too! Max taste, no cal.
Great flavour
A family favourite
Unsure about this cream. It melts very fast on top of drinks which I dont find with the M&S version (which is actually unsweetened too) - Very very sweet
i love thisss! instead of fearing the additional calories this is so great. for toppings n pies its so yummy and creamy

Shake as you would normally do with spray cream and it comes out with fluffy, velvet, creamy deliciousness. it is absolutely divine. There is no way to know it is the lighter version as the taste is spot on. We use for desserts, milkshakes and hot chocolate. Amazing stuff.
You would never know it’s the light cream, a must for anyone on a low cal eating plan!
We all enjoy this, but its often out of stock. In my opinion, just as good as the full fat version.
Best before date end of Jan 2021. Has been kept in the fridge and nozzle washed after each use. Completely gone off. Hope Im not sick..

As previous reviewer said this is a great product but Ocado is always out of stock. Like many other items recently. Come on guys sort yourselves out!
I love this but can never buy it! Please sort it out Ocado
Please re stock! Been out of stock for ages now!
A really good product which enliven any pudding/fruit/cake/ice cream, etc.  For a while it was the only way my kids would eat fruit!
Tasty and less unhealthy!

We had way too much fun with this when I was younger and it's still too tempting now I'm in my 40s. Light fluffy and ever so slightly sweet, I found myself buying puddings just to use this. Very bad but oh so much fun :-)
A nice looking cake but so sweet and rich we could hardly eat it. We should have stuck with Colin the Caterpillar

This was lovely for my little boys birthday. Yes it's sickly but it's a birthday cake and I don't think the fondant ones are exactly easy to eat. This is nicely decorated with a nice light sponge and lots going on with the toppings. It's a really nice, playful cake and I would recommend and buy again myself.
Got this as a cake for my daughters birthday and every last slice was eaten which made a change - everyone loved the taste and highly recommend!!

We were impressed with the actual look of the look, but the flavour was so disappointing. I had to double check if it was actually from M&S as I wouldnt have thought it would pass their taste quality.

There's only one word to describe this cake - nasty!

For me it was beyond sickly....my husband said it made the back of his throat feel like it was burning and couldn't believe it came from M&S. Even the kids didn't like it very much and they have a very sweet tooth.
Not trying to be dramatic but I dont even really like cake but this was unbelievable. Good chance Ill buy one just to celebrate a Wednesday at some point in the future.
Bought this cake for a family birthday recently - adults & kids alike enjoyed it - moist & light. The taste reminded me of ice cream !

Wowthis ticked every box for my son! He loved every bite and hes a fussy kid! He declared it was the best cake ever eaten!

It was as described a cookie dough cake, from the cookie bites and cookie crumbles  in the cake , to the icing, to the sprinkles and fudge balls on the top.
It is sweet, but what iced cake isnt?

if the thought of making your own fresh pasta feels daunting, you might think again once you have tried separating these lasagne sheets. not practical to use and the quality in general is pretty average.

This was diabolical to use.  All the sheets were stuck together in a congealed lump.  

Marginally bettered itself by making a decent lasagne once I'd hacked it to bits.  

Don't buy if you want sheets of lasagne, rather than a making a mosaic.

This is one of the few products I have bought that is better than the Waitrose equivalent.  The sheets are much thinner (so you get many more for the same weight). My lasagna  was much more elegant,  with both flavour and texture improved.

Good sized sheets & plenty of them. Don't just use them for lasagne...make good nachos...cut them in to squares/triangles, spread on baking sheets, spritz with a spray oil, sprinkle with salt(or other flavour) and cook for 10mins or until crispy, serve with pulled pork/soured cream or whatever takes your fancy.

Tried this for a superb lasagne at the weekend for my family, put olive oil (to stop sheets sticking) and salt into a large bowl and poured over boiling water. Left for 3 mins and plunged into cold water (with more olive oil) and used when needed - perfect!!!! Thank you.

All sheets welded together, the few I managed to prise apart were cracked and pretty much useless. Not sure what happened, this used to be good but the past two packs have been useless - waste of time and money. Wont buy again!

Why are these so small? Cooked okay, but not brilliant. Wont be buying again!
A good italian lasagna has thin sheets of pasta inter layered with meat/veg/cheese. This pasta is just right ,cooks soft ,providing it is covered with liquid.5*****
Very thin sheets that were stuck together down one side. Worst fresh lasagne sheets Ive purchased

These sheets are not very pliable and parts break off when you are trying to get it out of the pack. However, during the week I was able to make two medium lasagnas for two (mince, tomato and cheese sauce and roasting vegetables and ham) and still had pasta sheets left. They require a reasonably liquid cheese sauce (I dilute M&S' 4 Cheese Sauce with fresh milk to get a more liquid consistency). Just hoped they might have been more pliable so that I could have also make some cannelloni (but I suspect that, if I tried to roll them, they would break up given that they are quite dry).
Nice big sheets of lasagne, which were thinner than the Waitrose ones.   They were so light after they were cooked. Going to be a regular buy.
I am allergic to tomatoes so have to mashed white lasagne and have to use fresh. This was excellent. We had smoked salmon and leek lasagne and it was delicious.
Lovely and fresh. very tasty, cooked evenly. Would buy again!
They dont look fresh at all. Very small sheets, very dry, arrived in broken bits therefore unusable.

Have just made a lovely lasagna with these sheets. Many of these fresh sheets can be quite thick and stiff and break when you try to separate them, but these sheets are soft and pliable and a little thinner than usual too so cooked nicely. No need to pre-cook, just pop straight in to a lasagna dish and layer up. Big pack too so I will be able to make another whole meal with the remainder. Will definitely buy these again.

received as as substitute item. 
terrible lemonade, homeopathic levels of lemon flavour, just tastes like sweet fizzy soda water. Avoid
Do yourself a favour and buy any other lemonade, might be the worst I’ve ever had
Family thought it tasted flat!
Perhaps an aquired taste - did not like it enough to try.
Just disgusting

This is the oddest lemonade I've tasted. Has a bizarre aniseed taste! Even when used as a mixer, the unpleasant tang comes through... wouldn't recommend as a lemonade drink unless aniseed is your thing!

Just disgusting

This is the oddest lemonade I've tasted. Has a bizarre aniseed taste! Even when used as a mixer, the unpleasant tang comes through... wouldn't recommend as a lemonade drink unless aniseed is your thing!
Texture was okish but was expecting more of a mushroom taste or any taste at really. Bland and disappointing.
Not exactly quiche like but a lovely little tart. It's great hot or cold. I had one recently on a long train journey and it was perfect and not messy to eat at all.

A nice quiche - I get this when it's on offer. Ideal on those days you don't feel like cooking. It's not the best vegan quiche I've had but I think it's the best one I can get online, so I always like to get one. A nice rich creamy centre, lots of veggies, good taste balance, nice pastry - really good.
Surprised me, somemushroom products are over powering. This was just right all family all different ages enjoyed
Very creamy. Great with a fresh salad.

I’m not vegan but thought I’d give them a go. The pastry was surprisingly good. Very light and crisp and more tasty than I expected. The filling was mushroom and spinach - it tasted of mushroom and spinach. Good. We both enjoyed them. I shall buy them again.
Texture was okish but was expecting more of a mushroom taste or any taste at really. Bland and disappointing.
Not exactly quiche like but a lovely little tart. It's great hot or cold. I had one recently on a long train journey and it was perfect and not messy to eat at all.

A nice quiche - I get this when it's on offer. Ideal on those days you don't feel like cooking. It's not the best vegan quiche I've had but I think it's the best one I can get online, so I always like to get one. A nice rich creamy centre, lots of veggies, good taste balance, nice pastry - really good.
Surprised me, somemushroom products are over powering. This was just right all family all different ages enjoyed
Very creamy. Great with a fresh salad.

I’m not vegan but thought I’d give them a go. The pastry was surprisingly good. Very light and crisp and more tasty than I expected. The filling was mushroom and spinach - it tasted of mushroom and spinach. Good. We both enjoyed them. I shall buy them again.

Received this in exchange for a review.   This is a nice,  tasty quiche, tasted better than most of the other higgidy products we've tried tbh.  Wouldn't have known it was vegan if  it wasn't on the packaging.  Would definitely consider purchasing in future.

I was given this to review but since I avoid carbs I gave it too my husband. He found the case too floury, but the filling had a good mushroom flavour. He did however miss the traditional quiche consistency which is achieved with eggs.
received free of charge to review. This quiche was ok, but I would not re-oder.
I was sent this to review. I found the texture a little slimy and the taste was a little bland.
I was given this product as part of a star reviewer program.  The quiche was rather tasty and nice to know that it was plant based, however it was very small for the price.

I am reviewing this product because I received a free sample from Ocado.  So I am not vegan but was pleasantly surprised with this quiche. The pastry was lovely and with just the right amount of spinach and mushrooms - delicious! I will be buying this again.

I received this as a free sample and I have to be honest, I didn't expect much. It was actually quite tasty and comes with a fragrant mushroomy taste. I'd strongly recommend to heat it in the oven so you can enjoy the full flavour. We're not vegans, nor vegetarians, but this may indeed pop into our shopping cart again.

I was asked to review this by Ocado. I am not vegan and found the quiche a bit bland. I would imagine if you are vegan it would be a good option as there is plenty of filling. I like spinach & mushrooms but neither flavour stood out. the vegan pastry was good but I probably wouldn't indulge again.

This quiche obviously contains lots of vegetables, and its taste is quite balanced; a bit spicy, but not too much. It doesn't have the texture of a quiche, though: it is much softer and the crust is very thin. I'm also disappointed that it contains palm oil, as I always hope for vegan food to also be eco-friendly.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I could not taste anything at all. Wouldn’t have it again.

I received this free to review.  I'm not a vegan and  so probably would never have tried this but I'm glad I did.   I warmed this up in the oven as per the recommendations and was pleasantly surprised at the crunch of the pastry and the plentiful mushroom filling, which was very tasty.  I wouldn't buy this regularly at it's current price as I felt it was small for the price. Perhaps just for an occasional treat....
Found this very nice for lunch Lots of mushroom flavour

I was sent this to review from Ocado. It was smaller than I was expecting but it was still tasty. The pastry was a nice texture and it didn't fall apart when the quiche was sliced. I had it cold with salad and although it was nice, I think it would have been better if it was warm. Definitely have these again.

I was sent this free by Ocado to review. What a great individual quiche-Im not vegan so was intrigued to try this-and I wasnt disappointed the flavours were outstanding. I see these are now on offer at 2 x £4 I will be adding them to my trolley.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Nice crunchy pastry and a good mushroom flavour. More sloppy than I like my quiche to be but it tastes good so happy to promote

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I am not a vegan but I am a vegetarian. I love quiche and couldnt imagine a quiche without eggs but this was delicious. Lovely taste of mushrooms and delicate spinach. Pastry was a nice texture and it was quite low in calorific value for a quiche. Very nice and would buy again. I do buy some of their other products.

I was sent this free from ocado to review.  I'm not a vegan but i did find this to be very tasty.  I did try it both hot and cold, and would definitely recommend it hot. Not sure if i would buy it again, as it's a bit expensive for the size

I was sent this to try, Im not a vegan but do enjoy a lot of vegan products and dont eat much meat. This was really delicious! The flavour was so full and rich, tasted very good quality! Pastry was light and again tasted beautiful! Will definitely buy this again as makes a great little meal with a salad or veg!
Bit expensive and didn't really enjoy it. I know this is vegan but prefer cheese and egg in a quiche. Wouldn't buy again.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I am a mushroom lover, so this could be biased.... Absolutely loved the flavours and textures of this little beauty. Quite high in calories for the size, but all that flavour must come at a cost ;-)
I was give to his product by Ocado to review.  This quiche is great for a vegan version that was full of tasty flavours and textures.  Im a fan of mushrooms so it was yummy.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. It isn't really quiche but more of a tart, and very tasty too! Lovely mushroom chunks & the spinach is just right. The pastry crisped up well. Quite filling. Very impressed.

Was asked to review this. Very nearly didnt as it contains my nemesis, spinach. Im really glad I had it. The size was enough for me but packed full of flavour. The mushrooms balanced out the spinach. Well worth the money!
I was given a free sample of this product to review by Ocado.  Quite expensive for what it is but tasty. Not really a quiche - more a mushroom flan. Bit high in calories/Syns for its size
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  This was really delicious- warmed in the airfryer and made a perfect lunch

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ I sampled this warmed up, since the blurb on the side said best enjoyed warm and I'm glad I did as it was delicious heated. The mushrooms were packed with flavour, the spinach added texture and the crust was crisp and tasty. As a non-vegan I can eat a regular egg-containing quiche cold quite happily, not sure how much I'd enjoy this "variant" cold, so recommend you heat up as instructed to enjoy it as I did.
Really tasty, suprised it wasn't more calories. Will buy these again!

Gave this to a friend to try & feedback was positive...ie...Tasty...
Reviewed after receiving a free sample from the wonderful people at Ocado...

Firstly, this is absolutely not a quiche. It has a somewhat runny, sticky filling holding together all of the mushrooms. Think unset custard. The flavour is okay, lots and lots of slightly wet mushrooms and a salty, yeast type flavour to the gloop. We did not really enjoy it and would not order again, but if you are vegan and have completely forgotten what a quiche is like or never had one, you might enjoy this.
I was sent this to review. The pastry was light and crisp and the filling was delicious, thick and creamy with lots of  mushrooms.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. It was tasty but for me slightly lacking in flavour and could have done with a bit more of a cheesy touch - however as vegan options go it was perfectly edible

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This was very tasty. The base was rich and cooked well. The filling was very nice, the taste of mushroom really came through. The texture of the filling was different than the quiches I normally eat but was not unpleasant.

I was sent this item by Ocado to review. Albeit, we are not vegan, it offers a tasty alternative for those who are. A substantial portion of creamy mushroom filling. Though the crispy topping didn’t live up to its claim, which isn’t that important. Only criticism? Needed a little seasoning.

I was given this by Ocado to review. This tasted as cute as it looks. I am recently trying to go more vegan/veggie so that was a bonus but I would happily eat this as a meat eater too. Lovely flavour, super warm and comforting now it's getting older. It's the perfect WFH winter lunch. They've got me hooked now!

I was sent this by Ocado in exchange for a fair review. 
Whilst I'm an omnivore, I'm also lactose intolerant, so always interested in trying dairy-free food. I was very impressed at how tasty this is! The pastry, whilst not the best shortcrust I've tried, is better than many of the shop-bought quiche pastries around, and has seeds for extra texture. The filling is delicious: moist, fresh, and with a good whack of black pepper to give it a kick.
Whilst one could argue the semantics of calling something without eggs a quiche, I'm happy  to just enjoy eating this .I tried it cold this time, but will give it a go hot when I next buy one (and there will be a next time). The only concern is that it tastes healthier than I suspect it is!
Absolutely delicious, perfect for light lunches and picnics. Seriously, even my Omni husband doesn't miss the cheese and eggs from this one!

This is pretty good for a vegan quiche with excellent crispy pastry. I found the filling slightly bland and had to add herbs and cheese to give it flavour.  I wish Ocado would bring back the M&S mushroom quiche which was packed with flavour.
This is packed with mushrooms and has a lovely flavour, but it really should be called a pie or a tart as its definitely not like a quiche. Really nice though and I would buy again.
Nice pastry and a good amount of tasty filling
I really enjoy this, Spinach and mushroom are two of my favourite things, getting them in crisp pastry with a creamy filling is a real treat.

It arrived quickly, made from pure coconut oil.
I don't know if I'm benefiting from the diet but it's easy to consume as there's not taste.

I always try to shop organic so I really love this product and the glass bottle is brilliant, both for the product and the environment. I take a spoonful a day in my coffee and often another just straight, theres no taste to it and I haven’t had any stomach issues (which I have in the past with other brands). This is definitely a premium MCT oil and I can really feel the benefits of using it.

I love this so much! I use it in my coffee everyday. After the first couple of days you will notice a difference with mental clarity. I also give it to my senior wheaten in his food, and it helps him stay sharp, along with helping with his seizures.

I mix this with my coffee in the AM. I can say I get more energy, it mixes nicely and has no taste. It gives my coffee more bulk which helps me feel full.
As for dosage, I mix about a tablespoon and a half with my coffee. The recommendation is 3 tbs, which I think would be a little much for my digestion. It does help with your "go" but I've not had any unpleasant side effects in that area. Just a gentle stimulation and an easy go.

Two days using and immediately you can feel a difference! Add it to your coffee, it doesn't change the taste. You'll feel energized and alert! Not just because of the coffee. But you'll feel different. Better. Not hyped. Just focused.

Most MCT oil tends to have no flavour at all, which is good if eaten with certain food. I find this MCT oil has a very slight coconut oil taste, goes great with many foods but especially love this on pancakes. Great quality, in a glass bottle, good for energy. Love it.

These are literally like rubber and almost taste like it too. I wouldn't give these to a dog.
Tried many hotdog sausages .These are the best and most authentic yet
Bin fodder.
These were very unpleasant and we had to throw them away.  They had chewy bits of gristle and had an awful taste similar to smell of chlorine.

Tried these because we wanted a jumbo sized authentic frank, but they were a bit too big which meant having to cut them which defeated the object. That would have been fine but they were way too soft and mushy and had a salty bland taste. Appreciate that might be the American style but if it is Im going back to European style.
Had high hopes for these but after chewing on gristle I won't be buying them again.
These are literally like rubber and almost taste like it too. I wouldn't give these to a dog.
Tried many hotdog sausages .These are the best and most authentic yet
Bin fodder.
These were very unpleasant and we had to throw them away.  They had chewy bits of gristle and had an awful taste similar to smell of chlorine.

Tried these because we wanted a jumbo sized authentic frank, but they were a bit too big which meant having to cut them which defeated the object. That would have been fine but they were way too soft and mushy and had a salty bland taste. Appreciate that might be the American style but if it is Im going back to European style.
Had high hopes for these but after chewing on gristle I won't be buying them again.

I love this hotdog. They are made from proper meat. Taste nice . It’s big for a hotdog bun so I eat half with a bun. Try it with french’s mustard sauce😍 my husband also love this and last time he made sure that I add this to my order.
Husband loves these, new favourite sausage for him. They are big and bit too "meaty" for me, so I only eat like a half at a time. Taste is nice.
My hubby is American so he is picky about them and these are his favourite, great taste, and not too salty.
DELICIOUS!!!
Delicious sausages, like in NYC!
I really liked these- nice, beefy meaty flavour. Each one is very big so I cut them in half to fit in normal finger rolls. Will be buying again.
you don't like frankfurters.  These are genuine, authentic original frankfurters with a good balance of seasoning and good texture.

Really surprised by negative reviews.  These are very tasty and authentic, and not as processed as other brands.  They are expensive though - we only tried them the first time because they were substituted for a cheaper version.
I love this product, the fact that it is big size and suitable for American style hotdog, that was lovely

These the the most real US beef franks I have had in the UK to date. Taste just like hot dogs in Chicago. Bad reviews must obvi be British and/or used to eating the horrendous sausages/franks you get in the UK.
After a couple of bites they turned on me. Found them nauseating after that.
Got them as a substitute for normal Frankfurters. Not at all nice.
Not nice at all, we ended up throwing them away after a couple of bites.
Had these as the pork versions were unavailable...the texture is horrible and the taste is no better..they made my son GIP and we threw them away
They tasted so bad that we threw them away after one bite. Would definitely not recommend.
Got these as a substitute and they were truly awful, couldn’t eat them!
Odd textured prefer normal frankfurters
Very tasty hot dog, but the texture was very odd like rubber.
Got these on flash sale and had in a brioche hot dog roll. We loved these- tastes like the real McCoy and will buy again. Very large with a high beef content and worth the extra money imo.

Ive never been to the US, so I dont know how authentic these are to be able to compare.
My sons (who arent particularly fussy) didnt appreciate the stringy texture of the skins. 
We dont eat a lot of processed meat, but I thought wed give these a whirl, given that they had positive reviews and because they were on offer. I wouldnt chose to buy these again.
Like some other reviewers I found the skins to be very tough and off putting.

Had some friends over with teenage fussy eaters. Didn't realise how big they are. Enough left over for adults to try. Great taste and best of all, not made with mechanically separated meat. Will buy again even at full price

Strangely tough and difficult to chew. Hot dogs should be juicy and soft! Thought I was treating myself by getting the more expensive ones, but I guess Ill go cheap next time. By the way, if you could stock a nitrate free hot dog that would be great Ocado! Lessen the guilt of this guilty pleasure.
An indulgence when wrapped in good quality streaky bacon and loaded with onions and Dijon mustard or chilli. Needs a bun at least 8 inches long and preferably steamed for an authentic chew.
skins were tough and unpleasant and the taste awful.  I sat up half the night feeling ill.
I didn't like these at all. Skin too tough & I found the overall texture very unpleasant - hard & squeaky is the only way I can describe it!
The best. They are big and tasty but not too many calories. They need to be cut in half if using uk size rolls.
Really enjoyed these.  Usually get the brioche buns.
These jumbo frankfurters are really tasty and big. Very Different from other hot dogs we have tried before.
They are also very tasty. Nice in a baguette with all the toppings!
All the family loved these and asked for more
lived many years in germany and i can say these are very close to the original. definitely can recommend. great taste

We loved these last summer after coming back from a trip to Canada but the quality of the last pack in July 18 was awful. Gristly and less flavour than standard supermarket frankfurters. Hardly tasted smoked at all.

I love these and it is so annoying that they are hard to find.

Like all good US-style dogs, they are good and meaty, my need all the extras like you get in Central Park. So, make yourself great chilli sauce, good thick mustard, some homemade garlic mayo, and spread it all over. Shove them in a baguette or something chewy - our UK hot dog rolls ain't good!
These are tasteless and a horrible texture, even the dog turned his nose up at them!
Legit American-style hot dogs for flavour. Theyre huge, but cut them in half to fit UK sized buns. Delish and will buy again.
A good sturdy frankfurter, not as flabby as others. Had to cut off at least an inch to semi-detached a good-sized hot dog roll. Flavour and texture stands up well to sauerkraut or chilli.

These taste horrible.  I couldn't eat them.
Maybe they taste ok to regular eaters of Frankfurters, I don't eat them regularly.
But why is the packaging not recyclable?
absolutely cracking weiners that microwave well with a smokey germanic kind of flavour.  robust and meaty. These are the dogs your buns yearn for.

I'm picky about hot dogs and won't buy any old junk (like the ones in tins) and I thought I'd give these a go. first of they are huge! they really do only fit well in a sub roll. reading the ingredients I'm pleased to see no fillers or mechanically recovered rubbish. I cooked them in a deep sided roasting dish filled with hot water on 200.c (fan) for 12 mins then let them rest. we had them with French's  yellow mustard and the French's crispy onions. delicious. I will be getting them again.

Delicious quarter pound hotdogs. Had with an essential Waitrose submarine roll. Fits well, and good hotdog to roll ratio. The hotdog flavour is substantial enough to go well with a thick slice of Ocado Large Malted Wheat Farmhouse loaf. Lots of mustard and sauerkraut. Enjoyed as a nostalgic treat.

These are monsters in terms of size, but they fry beautifully and are the only hot dogs I've had in the UK that even come close to the kind you can buy in any shop in the US. Very meaty, flavourful and tasty. Definitely worth the extra cost. Anyone who prefers Hertas or any other brand doesn't know anything about what a real American hot dog should taste like.
Loved them.

after reading the reviews on how great they was decided to purchase, thought they would be tasty..especially at A£4.99 but was very disappointed..very salty and rubbery prefer the Hertas jumbo Hot-dogs wont be getting these again,
I read reviews before purchasing and have to agree that these are excellent.  Only downside is they are too big for hot dog buns !!
I fry these with lots of onions, and then put on a panini roll about the only rolls that fit the size of dog... I add american hot dog relish and mayo, yum great meal.....

These are the closest you will get to the hotdogs served in USA. Very fat and meaty. I don't put them in hot water, I fry them on a low heat for about 8 minutes with lots of onions and turn them frequently. The smell is divine. 
The only downside is that they are so ridiculously long, there is no bun to fit them, but I suppose it's ok to cut them in half and put one half on top of the other and hold tight! Great served with shredded slow cooked chilli beef, slaw and cucumber, but you won't want to eat for a week after that.
Another reviewer said they don't freeze well. On superfreeze setting they freeze fine. Never had a problem. It's the buns that don't freeze well!
Delicious! I dry fry mine in a pan for about 5 mins, slow cooked onions and some mustard and ketchup... yummy!
American here, great dogs. HUGE. good luck finding buns for these guys. might be better than American bought hot dogs.
These are perfect for making chilli dogs! Great value too.

Great stadium style kosher hot dogs. Yes they are processed and not good to eat on a regular basis but they give that authentic taste which I have not found in any of the other supermarket brands in the UK. It is a 5 star based on what they are claiming to be. It is not a gourmet product. Also some posters complained about it being rubbery and split, you need to be careful and use a large enough pot not to bend them and also to simmer these and not boil them
I love these! Don't add ketchup try pickles and mustard instead.

I don't mind salt, doctor didn't say don't eat it.
But these seem to be just a bit too salty.
You have to have it with tomato to lessen the salty taste.
Makes you thirsty.
But they are the best hot dog frankfurters in this shop.

o0o

It has been difficult finding decent hotdogs in the UK. Do not touch the ones in a tin or jar with a bargepole! These have the right flavour and texture to warrant being called a hot dog. Yes, they are big, but we ate them all up.

A little hint. Do not boil hot dogs. Bring the water to the boil, turn the heat  down to minimum and let the hot dogs sit in the hot water for a few minutes. They have a good flavour so DO NOT SMOTHER with ketchup.

These are so huge they're kind of disgusting. I also rarely get through a whole package of hotdogs in a week and tend to freeze them. As this was my first time of trying these, I tossed them in the freezer as I do my normal ones, but they came out all mottled looking.  They tasted ok, but very rubbery. Have to say I don't trust these and won't buy them again.
Tastes great, and has no horrid colours added, no MSG either, hurrah!  Please bring them back in stock!

...at last I have found a giant hot dog sausage that tastes similar to those you get at the German markets at Christmas. To my surprise, they are made of beef and not pork which is perhaps where I kept going wrong in my previous searches. I lightly fry them in a griddle pan as I think boiling or grilling them would not do the taste justice. Oh, and the standard hot dog rolls are way too small. Submarine rolls are the right size or try a baguette with the middle hollowed out to fit the sausage into.
5 x 1/4 pound hot dogs. Nice smoky flavour. Huge!

I had read other reviews by our cousins across the pond on how good these were. I was hugely dissapointed. Split too easily on cooking & FLAVOURLESS. I will not be buying these again, I'll stick to the 'cheap European' version.

As a Canadian I probably don't have the credentials of the US reviewers :-) However in my opinion also these are the best Hot Dogs I have tasted in the UK. They are a little on the large size as has been said, but taste is truly authentic - they blow all the pork-based tiny german pork frankfurters out of the water!

The Warburton sandwich 'rolls' work quite well with these size-wise.
As a transplanted New Yorker I have very high standards, and these are great. Now if I could only find decent bagels, I'd be truly happy here!
I was raised in Chicago, and these beat all the other pork-based hot dogs I can find in England!
Good quality frankfurter, similar to those i've had while in Chicago. A touch on the large size for the std hot dog roll, good with mustard relish and onion Chicago style.
These are excellent. We eat organic vegetarian food, mostly home cooked, but these are a favourite for those nights when someone else can do the work. Delicious
I've enjoyed quite a few of Clive's pies but this one was dreadful. I don't know if it's new, but I won't be buying it again,
I just love these pies. so creamy. the pastry is gorgeous. best pies I've ever eaten.

Weird pastry, strange flavour filling.  I'm not vegan or vegetarian but I eat a lot of these foods as not a massive meat eater.  I will stick with Higgidy and Pieminster ranges as I've not had a bad pie yet.  This really wasn't nice, I couldn't finish it.
As a flexitarian trying to eat less meat this type of plant based food really helps . I indulged and ate with chip shop chips ..... indulgent tasty and satisfying !!
Were generally a fan of Clives pies but this was horrible. Grey gelatinous gloop in the middle - not at all creamy or tasty. Not sure if it was a an off one but was within date.
These are excellent. We eat organic vegetarian food, mostly home cooked, but these are a favourite for those nights when someone else can do the work. Delicious
I've enjoyed quite a few of Clive's pies but this one was dreadful. I don't know if it's new, but I won't be buying it again,
I just love these pies. so creamy. the pastry is gorgeous. best pies I've ever eaten.

Weird pastry, strange flavour filling.  I'm not vegan or vegetarian but I eat a lot of these foods as not a massive meat eater.  I will stick with Higgidy and Pieminster ranges as I've not had a bad pie yet.  This really wasn't nice, I couldn't finish it.
As a flexitarian trying to eat less meat this type of plant based food really helps . I indulged and ate with chip shop chips ..... indulgent tasty and satisfying !!
Were generally a fan of Clives pies but this was horrible. Grey gelatinous gloop in the middle - not at all creamy or tasty. Not sure if it was a an off one but was within date.

I don't particularly like mushroom but these pies are really tasty. I like the wholemeal pastry, and plastic free packaging. shelf life is quite good too. not the cheapest but worth the money. for a family it would be a bit expensive though.
Check your pies before you eat them as on a few occasions there has been human hair in mine!
Had a lot of these in the colder months. Possibly the best vegan pie I've bought!
Tasty pastry and filling.

Didn't realise it was for 1. I had it. Thought it strange at first, yes pastry is wholemeal and crispy, but I was surprised I found it tasty. Filling substantial. I would buy it again. Not greasy at all.
the mushroom filling is great, really tasty and plenty of it. the wholemeal pastry is thin, dry and cardboardy. If I was to have it again, which I won't, I would add gravy.
If you like pies and you like mushrooms, I dont see how you cant like these. Surprisingly yummy!
A lovely filling pie with plenty of flavour. Delicious with veggie gravy. I will certainly buy this again.
Really didn't like the pastry. Reminded me of cardboard. The filling was nice enough but for the price and taste, it's not worth it.
Didn't notice that this was wholemeal "pastry" when I bought it and it was not very nice at all.

I’m a big fan of wholewheat pastry and love having one of these pies in the freezer. Great with a mushroom stroganoff poured over and served with steamed samphire and garlic rosemary roast new potatoes.
Packed full of tasty mushrooms in a light sauce. Wholemeal pastry can be soggy and heavy but this was light and crisp. A lovely pie - will definitely but again.

So often pies can, after much promise,  be a real let down. This one is full of flavour, full of filling and has a crust that isn't half the pie. I've now got my pie-averse daughter eating it and my grandson too. Now a staple in the basket.
We love these pies, the pastry is wholesome and the filling so mushroomy! Even my toddler loves this, excellent with some mash and steamed or stir fried kale or spinach.
The strangest pie I’ve ever had. Too dry and no flavour so I will not buy this again.

Lots of mushrooms. Not creamy, but it doesn’t need to be. The crust is quite dry, in a nice way (i.e. not greasy). For someone who likes mushrooms and organic food this is a nice easy option to keep in the freezer for a fuss free tea.
could not taste the mushrooms and the pastry is like crunchy cardboard... don't think I would buy again

I'd never tried a product from this brand before and I think this pie was fantastic! Didn't leak in the oven at all, the pastry was the perfect thickness and the pie was completely filled with delicious creamy mushroom goodness. Will definitely be buying again!

I didn't really look at its weight when buying, I thought maybe it would feed two but only if you serve it with chips. The taste was very nice though, my toddler and my husband enjoyed it too. Will buy it again for lunch.
Very small for price. Crispy pastry tastes more like a digestive biscuit and I couldn't taste any tarragon.
Vegan pies that are full of tasty mushrooms encased in a lovely pastry.
I was really looking forward to this but was it was something of nothing. The pie was very small, the pastry bland and not enough filling. I really wanted to like it but just didn't. Sorry.
Magical little pie. Delicious, nutritious and kind.
Nice crispy wholemeal crust along with creamy filling. Not too large or heavy nice with new potatoes on the side.

It is enough for one with veg to make a substantial dinner. The pastry is wholemeal, light and crisp but also substantial. The filling is generous, thick, creamy and tastes entirely natural (re the earlier review) and mushroomy. I will be buying this on a regular basis now for sure. And all vegan. Fantastic.
Hard pastry and unappealing brown filling with an odd artificial taste. Really disappointing.
Just so delicious! So mushroomy! Love it
I really enjoyed this pie. Will purchase again.
Best vegan pie Ive had that wasnt home made!!!

This is a really tasty, filling pie, with a rich, generously mushroomy filling. I usually go for a meat pie but really didnt miss the meat in this one. Plus the bonus is the packaging is entirely recyclable and free of single-use plastics.
Really nice pie and vegan too!

Unfortunately the pastry didn't crisp up much - my fault I'm sure - but the edges were lovely... So I ended up abandoning the pastry and just ate the filling. It was tasty, but seemed quite white peppery. Am sure that with proper baking the combination works well.

This is the sort of product that gives vegetarian food a reputation for being brown.  The crust is brown, very thin and firm.  The contents are a darker brown.  The mushroom filling is moist and there's plenty of it, but I didn't really enjoy it.  If you prefer the slightly sour taste of brown bread over the slightly sweet taste of white bread, then you'd probably really like this pie.
Rather large for one. Rather small shared between two.

this pie is put together well, the crust is short rather than flaky. the filling is VERY mushroomy (which sounds silly) but it can be a little off putting if you arent pairing your pie with something else. the quality is good and bakes well as per recommendation. this however, an acquired taste for sure. I'm glad I tried it but will only buy again should I have a very strong craving for mushrooms!

I love mushrooms but this had a very specific mushroom flavour like wild mushroom maybe that i don't like quite a mushy texture. Crust was alright but bit bland. Might be personal taste but we really didn't like.
The pastry is fine for a vegan wholemeal bought pie, but the filling tastes more of flour than of mushrooms. I'm sure it used to be better.
Really nice pie and vegan too!

Unfortunately the pastry didn't crisp up much - my fault I'm sure - but the edges were lovely... So I ended up abandoning the pastry and just ate the filling. It was tasty, but seemed quite white peppery. Am sure that with proper baking the combination works well.

This is the sort of product that gives vegetarian food a reputation for being brown.  The crust is brown, very thin and firm.  The contents are a darker brown.  The mushroom filling is moist and there's plenty of it, but I didn't really enjoy it.  If you prefer the slightly sour taste of brown bread over the slightly sweet taste of white bread, then you'd probably really like this pie.
Rather large for one. Rather small shared between two.

this pie is put together well, the crust is short rather than flaky. the filling is VERY mushroomy (which sounds silly) but it can be a little off putting if you arent pairing your pie with something else. the quality is good and bakes well as per recommendation. this however, an acquired taste for sure. I'm glad I tried it but will only buy again should I have a very strong craving for mushrooms!

I love mushrooms but this had a very specific mushroom flavour like wild mushroom maybe that i don't like quite a mushy texture. Crust was alright but bit bland. Might be personal taste but we really didn't like.
The pastry is fine for a vegan wholemeal bought pie, but the filling tastes more of flour than of mushrooms. I'm sure it used to be better.
Really tasty, love it! Love the cute box it comes in too and no plastic.

I loved this pie. I was a bit put off buying it to start with seeing some of the reviews. However, Im glad i brought this pie. Lovely wholemeal pastry and plenty of lovely, creamy filling. As a vegan it is hard to find good pies for a treat. I will definitely be buying this pie again.
Really love this pie. Is quickly become a staple at my house even for my non vegan friends
Nice outside to inside
Lovely pastry and filling good
This pie has potential but the pastry let it down.

I bought two of these pies for the week end as I had a friend over for lunch. I don't usually like wholemeal but these pies were absolutely delicious.  I was skeptical of the pie crust as it was thin but it was lovely as it was slighty crispy when cooked and the filling was sooo tasty and the consistency of the filling was thick.  Certainly deserves my 5 star rating and I'm usually really fussy! especially with Vegan food.
Really delicious pie. Great crust and super tasty filling. Definitely worth a try
creamy.  nutty,  loads of flavour.  what's not to like.
Initially with the wholewheat pastry it didnt look particularly attractive. However really full filling and pastry crisped up nicely.
This pie came up in Ocados list of vegan main meals, but if you check the ingredients it contains milk.
A nice hollow pie! Flavoursome pastry but the filling was just non-existent.
Really tasty pie, Im not a vegetarian but I really enjoyed this and the whole meal pastry was very light.
Small item, thick stodgy crust on the outside, mushroomy brown ooze inside, underwhelming even on offer

Never been a wholemeal pastry fan but this was crisp and thin and quite lovely. Filling thick and creamy, bit light on mushrooms......for a mushroom only pie, but the salt was way over the top. Won't have another,shame.
It tasted great until I found a small stone, very disappointed.....

Delicious pie thats really tasty and loaded with creamy mushrooms. Nice and homely.  I find it a touch too peppery but its not stopping me order some more so I guess its not a dealbreaker for me! Love the wholewheat crust which was neither dry or bland.  Just very delicious.  Want to try others in the range while its now on offer but it was so good that Im opting for mushroom again.
A simple wholewheat pastry witha slightly chunky, creamy mushroom filing. Just a bit too salty for me

I feel disloyal but this pie has won me over from my usual one ( still very good though!) Love the pastry which is drier but soft which compliments the filling plus theres a really good pepper kick to it
I was hoping for something really yummy but it was just OK. I don't think I'd buy it again.
Very nice
Very nice but the filling is a little bit on the mean side, especially for the cost.
Id eat again.
Taste good, gluten free, vegan and plastic free wrapping. Knocked two stars off due to use of palm oil ("sustainable" or not) and won't buy again due to this.
Loved this, absolutely yummy
Cooked from frozen and still tastes amazing. Will absolutely be ordering more and trying all the flavours!
Both crust and filling are very tasty. worth warming up through for a crumbly crust
I've eaten all the pies in Clive's range and this is the champion. Great thin pastry and tasty filling.
I so love this pie, its delicious. So tasty would highly recommend.

So impressed to find that this was plastic free - the pie comes just in a card box. We need more food packaged like this. The pie is crammed full of a creamy mushroom mixture, and combined with the wholewheat pasty it makes for a very earthy taste. Knocked a star off just because it wasnt herby enough for me, I think a tweak to the recipe would lift the flavour slightly. But overall a great pie.
Love these pies. Great taste.
I like all Clives pies but this is the favourite. Lovely crisp pastry and a creamy mushroom filling. A regular purchase.
The pastry was thin and crisp, so I can't understand other reviews. Filling tasty, creamy and just the right consistency. Will certainly buy again.
virtually all crust/pastry which is heavy and tasteless. about a tablespoon of filling which is ok. bought two and threw the second away without eating. so disappointed.

I like this one so much and order it all the time. Odd how some people dislike the pastry, as it's one of the things I particularly like about it! The wholemealiness of it makes it extra yummy and flavoursome IMHO. I've tried all of the Pieminister veggie pies too and their fillings are great, but I much prefer the pastry of Clives pies. Wish they did more pies like this one that aren't stuffed with even more carbs.
This is very tasty
My husband recently became vegan. My daughter is gluten intolerant. This range of pies is superb. They are delicious and we love them.
Love this pie. Thin wholemeal crust and delicious and generous filling
We all love our comfort food and was so pleased I tried Clive's pies. Will definitely buy them again, generous filling and nice pastry.

disappointed with this pie - hard pastry, filling quite bland, too much sauce and not enough mushrooms.

as a vegetarian there are better similar products so I won't be buying again.
The mushroom filling was delicious - bursting with flavour. Great texture. Pastry was horrible though - like cardboard.
I first discovered these when I lived in Devon where they are made. All Clive's pies are delicious but these are my melt in the mouth favourites, & totally healthy & nutritious.
The mushroom filling was generous and so good - I'm not normally the biggest fan of mushrooms! The pastry was delicious too.
just because its vegan doesnt mean it has to be heavy and due to the pastry, it was heavy going
Sometimes in the winter, you just want to have pie... these are lovely.  Husband was particularly a fan of the mushroom one.
It's hard to find tasty vegan pies. This one is lovely. Definitely the best pie I've had from the Clive's range. I add this to most of my orders.
Wow . Just had this pie for my dinner . Plenty of filling . Pastry not stodgy . Loved it . Highly recommended
Simply delicious after a long day at work. Bonus of no plastic packaging and the box can compost.
Not a bad pie, but not very exciting. Fillings all sauce but a few thinnly chopped mushrooms. Nothing chunky. Crust is ok but not for me.
Mash potatoes, green beans & Gravy. Vegan comfort food!!
this is a great product, highly recommend

This is a very nice pie, used it as a meat alternative for a vegetarian Sunday lunch. Found it tasted better than the quorn one that I usually buy. Nice creamy mushroom taste and light pastry. Would buy again.

Really surprised by the wholewheat pastry, very nice. However the pie filling was full of black pepper, absolutely awful. Why these veggie products have to be packed full of the stuff when people can just add it themselves to their taste I don't know, threw the majority away, it was awful.
I'm not a pie lover or a veggie, but this was lovely. Very tasty filling and the pastry was nice too. The best bit - it came as a freebie. Thanks Ocado!

This pie is DELICIOUS. It was slightly crushed when it arrived, so I could see the filling inside (which isn't a pretty sight) but don't be put off by the appearance because it tastes amazing!! Definitely my new favourite. Surprised about how calorific it is but it's definitely worth the calories.

I'm a vegan and was sceptical about this pie.  How creamy could it really be without dairy? 

The pastry is lovely, and the fact that it is made with wholemeal flour is good by me.  The filling is ample and is creamy.  It's herby too, but not too over the top, I think.  It's just over 14% fat, which is pretty good for a shop bought pie.
I'll definitely be buying it again.  I would also serve it to meat eating friends - but then again, they'll get no dead animal out of my kitchen, so I guess they get no choice in that!

I almost sneaked the fact that these were meat free, organic, and whole wheat past my husband. In his words, "I don't mind the whole wheat pastry". 

These have nice and very different pie flavours, but I found them very dry. Some sauciness would be nice.

The complete lack of protective packaging means they are difficult to deliver in one pie shaped piece. I get that they are hippy pies, but really a piece of protective cardboard can be recycled...

At almost 650 calories a pie I was expecting this to be luxurious and positively indulgent. It wasn't. It was very tasty, there is no denying that, but it is not worth blowing a HUGE percentage of your daily calorie allowance in it and it's not special enough in my opinion to be a treat either. 

All said and done, if you don't mind the calories or that it's just an average midweek meal quality, go for it. It is genuinely tasty.

I really enjoyed this pie. It's difficult to find vegetarian pies that are dairy free. It has a gorgeous crust and delicious filling. I can honestly say it is the best pie I have had for a very long time.

Really tasty and fab pie! One of the best pies I have ever eaten, will be buying more for sure. 

Keep them coming!

I've had my eye on these for a while but have been put off due to the price. They were on offer recently so decided to try them, and wow - what a find! Ridiculously tasty, full to the top - not stingy like Fry's pies - with a really creamy filling. The pastry was gorgeous too. I would say they are too expensive for a regular buy though, just an occasional treat. Hopefully they will make family size, more cost-effective pies in the future!
I love this pie! The only drawback is how calorific it is. It doesn't look overly appetising inside but it tastes so good. Really filling and tasty. I will buy again.
As good as any meat pie - and we aren't veggies!

All Clive's pies are great and contain good vegan ingredients. I prefer them cold, but they are good warmed through as well. I think the reviewer below who suggests putting butter in the pastry is missing the point about these piece being cruelty free, ethical pies. Please Clive, NEVER put dairy anywhere near these pies. Dairy is there cruellest industry of all.
Rich, full of flavour, lovely crust and yummy mushrooms.

The mushrooms were OK and pastry was crisp, but there was an odd after-flavour which spoilt the pie.  I think it was due to use of margarine in pastry. It always comes through to spoil flavour in pastries and cakes.  I am sure butter would have improved taste.  The Pieminster asparagus and mushroom pies have far superior taste in the pastry and filling.
crisp pastry filled to the brim with delicious creamy mushrooms......I will definitely be buying this again - delicious.

Now sadly mine was victim to the occasional bad bagging and was underneath everything and squashed flat. Couldn't heat it up as was flat but was tempted to try it anyway. It was so tasty, great pastry and filling. I'm lactose intolerant so look for vegan foods as they avoid what I can't eat and I have to say this was the best ever. Can't wait to order again and hopefully get a whole unsquashed one to eat hot as I miss pies and pastry. Will try others too.

My first try of a Clive pie - how have I missed these until now? Good meat free pies are hard to find and this is a great tasting pie generously filled with a creamy mushroom mixture with pastry that has a pleasant crunch. Looking forward to trying the others in this range and eating this one again.
I really enjoyed this pie. Nice mushroom taste and texture and the wholemeal pastry is thin and not in the least bit soggy. I'm inspired to try another variety of Clive's pies in my next shop!
This is the best mushroom pie ever.  The wholemeal pastry is just perfect - crisp, firm to hold the magnificent filling inside, but light and thin at the same time.  Delicious.

I like all of the Clive's range of foods, but this is by far the best pie. It is absolutely delicious. Good wholemeal pastry & the filling is creamy with a good balance of subtle flavours. Carnivores will love it too.
Love these pies - crunchy wholewheat pastry and creamy, mushroomy filling - delicious!

This has a great amount of filling, is creamy with big chunks of mushroom and simple healthy ingredients. Rather than bothering to oven cook it, I microwaved it for two mins - it's already baked - and was delicious.
In my opinion this is the champion of Clive's pies! Delicious, creamy filling.
Lovely pie with loads of filling in! Great comfort food, and vegan!!!
I did love this ,  looked fab, very mild and was lovely in a salad.  However it’s still pricey for essentially a mildly pleasant bitter lettuce.
Fresh, beautiful to look at, and although on the small side I cannot criticise this.

This was a substitution, which I accepted, for our usual Rosa del Veneto, assuming it would be equally good. The ends of the leaves were brown, one day ahead of the use by date, and the leaves were limp and tasteless. We threw it away

I ordered this radicchio several times and most of the times was very small, half rotten and with the expiring date the day after the delivery. In the rare occasions in which it was fresh, it was really good but it’s literally a bet! It’s not worth the risk, it seems that they can’t deliver the quality that they promise.  I will not order it anymore.

wasn't as pretty as expected and mild flavour, nothing special, went floppy really quickly and stalk brown, trimmed tight to the base so standing in bowl water didn't help, it was too damaged to take any up.
Winter radicchio is the best, so healthy.
I did love this ,  looked fab, very mild and was lovely in a salad.  However it’s still pricey for essentially a mildly pleasant bitter lettuce.
Fresh, beautiful to look at, and although on the small side I cannot criticise this.

This was a substitution, which I accepted, for our usual Rosa del Veneto, assuming it would be equally good. The ends of the leaves were brown, one day ahead of the use by date, and the leaves were limp and tasteless. We threw it away

I ordered this radicchio several times and most of the times was very small, half rotten and with the expiring date the day after the delivery. In the rare occasions in which it was fresh, it was really good but it’s literally a bet! It’s not worth the risk, it seems that they can’t deliver the quality that they promise.  I will not order it anymore.

wasn't as pretty as expected and mild flavour, nothing special, went floppy really quickly and stalk brown, trimmed tight to the base so standing in bowl water didn't help, it was too damaged to take any up.
Winter radicchio is the best, so healthy.

We all loved this lovely lettuce so much.yes it needed washing but so what - it was like going back to my childhood and preparing the home grown stuff.
We all loved it and it will be a regular order while its available .
No idea how you grow a tough lettuce but...50% had to be thrown out.  And it arrived squashed. Also it had no heart:almost bolted!

Bears no resemblance to the light 'buttery' lettuce experienced in France.  The outer leaves had brown edges and even the inner crown was crunchy, rather than light.  Oh for some sweet strawberries that can be hulled and some so called ripe and ready' fruit the skin of which does not wrinkle before it's edible.  I expect too much, I know.

Great buttery taste and texture compared to most other lettuce.  It is a soft head of lettuce so needs careful handling to avoid breakage.  Yes a couple of slugs and some dirt present but no big problem cleaning the leaves.

Very good quality and amazing taste.
Expensive but so worth it.

This is such a gorgeous lettuce but you really have to work for it. Every single leaf needs to be thoroughly washed because there's sand all the way through. I hate washing lettuce but it's worth it for a lovely delicate salad.
Bad quality, full of bugs and dirt - not a bit here and there - a lot! Ended up throwing half the salad. Taste is OK - nothing special.

At last, lettuce which tastes of lettuce! This lettuce holds its own even in a salad Niçoise and it made my last plain green salad so good that even my teenager had second helpings voluntarily! It's true that my last lettuce contained enough wildlife that I wouldn't have been surprised if David Attenborough had popped up to comment on it, but hey, washing off some harmless beetles and a spot of mud only took a minute and at least it proves it wasn't blitzed with pesticide. So farmers' market quality and flavour (and yes, admittedly some farmers' market style mud) in a supermarket shop....
Don’t mind a bit of mud on my lettuce but this was absolutely full of mud and flies. Have never seen a lettuce quite so dirty and most of it was inedible as a result.

This is great, arrived firm and in a big size, plenty of leaves for a big family meal and more (not to mention how beautiful it looks in a bowl of salad). Stays well in the fridge upto a week, and even if the outer leaves go soft, the inner ones are still nice and firm. This is delicate flavor, no need to worry about bitterness, I like to grill it with a bit of salt and olive oil and add to meals or wraps. Would prefer paper packaging though please.
This lettuce is really delicious on its own!

I bought this, Occado informs me, on 18 Feb despite the high price and mixed reviews. I was bored with the usual and it looked so pretty in the photo, pretty in real life, too. I am happy to report that it was still fresh yesterday, weeks not days later! As usual with me, I put it in the crisper drawer and forgot about it for the first week - bear in mind it is only guaranteed for 3 days - so I had to cut off 2 rotted patches at the base of the outermost leaves. Had I thought about it, of course, I would have wrapped it in paper towel and put it back in the bag and perhaps avoided this. Happily, the rest of the leaves were fine and I made a further salad yesterday. I still have enough left for 2 more salads as I only use a few leaves per salad. So, my experience is that it looks pretty, lasts really well and suits me as it's only slightly bitter. I am adding it to this week's order in the hope that my second purchase is as happy.
What came in my shopping was a completely white, completely tasteless thing that was rotten in the middle....
Outer leaves already had patches of rot. Full refund given.
Delicate and fresh, no biterness. Kept well in the fridge. Will order again! The

Crisp and fresh but much more bitter than other radicchio Ive ordered from Ocado in the past. Paired it with avocado to mellow it out a bit but I imagine it would also be good in a salad with soft cheese or a creamy dip. I bought it mostly for the appearance so I was disappointed that the surface pattern was quite subtle with just a few flecks of the plum colour. Overall ok as a product but disappointing appearance for the price so I would be unlikely to purchase again.

Never had this before but thought Id try it out.  Looks amazing and of very good quality.  Lasted over a week in the fridge.  Slightly bitter but refreshingly different and took my salads to another level. Aesthetically very pleasing and they do say you eat with your eyes first. I find this to be true, so, overall, I was very pleased with these leaves. Would buy again.

Not something you could eat everyday, but I buy it every year when it's in stock. Beautiful radicchio that works nicely in an admittedly bitter salad in combination with other types of radicchio.

There's an amazing salad in the Bocca Di Lupo cookbook that uses this and tardivo with a red wine and hazelnut dressing, highly recommended.

Don't listen to the negative reviews here. Yes, this is definitely a lot milder than your average blue, but if you're looking for an intense blue cheese that makes you writhe on the floor as though you've just shoved a Haribo Tangfastic up your bottom, then this probably isn't for you.
This blue cheese has a wonderful balance of flavour and texture. Nice and creamy, perfectly versatile for many uses. It's a win for me.
…the M&S one is much better. Creamy, just like a rich Brie, with just the right balance of blue acidity - delicious and the packaging is delightful and fully recyclable.
This was expensive for a small piece of bland cheese.
They should have stayed with the previous blue daffinois. This is nowhere near as good as the prior version, and why the extra wasteful packaging?
Creamy but with no flavour whatsoever.  The Waitrose version was delicious.
Similar to other reviewers, we used to really enjoy the Waitrose version of this cheese.  The M&S version is tasteless in comparison.  It also lacks the texture of the excellent Waitrose equivalent.

These are undoubtedly a naughty treat, and as such we only have them now and again. The biscuity part is softer and more crumbly than a normal biscuit, but tastes just fine to me. Small and sweet, a perfectly nice treat. Great price.
Love these handy bars, especially when they are straight from the fridge, gives them a completely different taste
Got these reduced price, found them oddly fatty and oversweet, with a synthetic aftertaste.  Like a really cheap, long life, greasy, gritty flapjack.
Tiny. Ftw
Taste like digestives that have been left out for two days.
These just taste like an average chocolate digestive biscuit with extra biscuit.  Nice enough and handy they are individually wrapped but wouldnt buy again unless on offer

These are undoubtedly a naughty treat, and as such we only have them now and again. The biscuity part is softer and more crumbly than a normal biscuit, but tastes just fine to me. Small and sweet, a perfectly nice treat. Great price.
Love these handy bars, especially when they are straight from the fridge, gives them a completely different taste

Taste like digestives that have been left out for two days.

I was asked to review this product. It is now a regular on my shopping list!
These are so good, they taste just like a tray bake my mum makes, a yummy treat!

I have tried all of the Creations flavours and liked them so thought I would try this, but it is not good. It tastes like overpoweringly fake orange and has a dusty/powdery texture that coats the back of the throat and makes it feel dry. I then end up feeling more thirsty than when I started.
But I found the sweetners overtook the taste a bit.
Great flavour, drink this all summer.
A nice change from the usual squash flavours, lovely with ice and sparkling water
Really enjoyed the mix of raspberry and peach it was very refreshing and pleasant

I purchased this based on what it says on the label - Peach and Raspberry squash. Only when I tasted it, then looked at the ingredients on the back I found that there is more orange juice than both peach and raspberry juice combined!. Now I find myself with a bottle of squash I cannot drink as, due to digestive problems, citrus juice gives me violent indigestion. I must remember to read the ingredients in EVERYTHING.

I have tried all of the Creations flavours and liked them so thought I would try this, but it is not good. It tastes like overpoweringly fake orange and has a dusty/powdery texture that coats the back of the throat and makes it feel dry. I then end up feeling more thirsty than when I started.
But I found the sweetners overtook the taste a bit.
Great flavour, drink this all summer.
A nice change from the usual squash flavours, lovely with ice and sparkling water
Really enjoyed the mix of raspberry and peach it was very refreshing and pleasant
