Only when I tasted it, then looked at the ingredients on the back I found that there is more orange juice than both peach and raspberry juice combined!. Now I find myself with a bottle of squash I cannot drink as, due to digestive problems, citrus juice gives me violent indigestion. I must remember to read the ingredients in EVERYTHING.
not my taste won't be buying again
lovely meaty pie, lots of filling. No complaints would buy again :)
Absolutely no puff in the pastry at all.  Meat gristle and not enjoyable  .

I hardly ever leave reviews but this is truly the worst pie I have ever tried to serve my family. It was pure gristle and pastry, there was not one edible piece of meat. A complete waste of money and time.

Bearing in mind that this is sold at a budget price I still think that the meat appeared to be of a poor quality and there was a distinct lack of gravy. The pastry base and puff pastry lid were ok but I would not want to buy this again. Incidentally I always ignore reviews when the product has been given free, I prefer the genuine opinion of those who have actually parted with their own money.

I'm reviewing these because I received a free sample from Ocado.

Really nice crispy puff pastry and the filling has a generous amount of meat. Absolutely love the steak pies from M&S.
The meat quality seemed ok and there was plenty of it. However there was not enough gravy which made for a dry experience
lovely meaty pie, lots of filling. No complaints would buy again :)
Absolutely no puff in the pastry at all.  Meat gristle and not enjoyable  .

I hardly ever leave reviews but this is truly the worst pie I have ever tried to serve my family. It was pure gristle and pastry, there was not one edible piece of meat. A complete waste of money and time.

Bearing in mind that this is sold at a budget price I still think that the meat appeared to be of a poor quality and there was a distinct lack of gravy. The pastry base and puff pastry lid were ok but I would not want to buy this again. Incidentally I always ignore reviews when the product has been given free, I prefer the genuine opinion of those who have actually parted with their own money.

I'm reviewing these because I received a free sample from Ocado.

Really nice crispy puff pastry and the filling has a generous amount of meat. Absolutely love the steak pies from M&S.
The meat quality seemed ok and there was plenty of it. However there was not enough gravy which made for a dry experience

I bought this in the flash sale, but I would pay full price. Very nice shortcrust pastry base, tender filling, puff pastry top came up nice and crispy. But make room, it is very filling, we had it between 2.
Just the right ratios of beef and gravy/sauce and pastry.  Latter has a lovely texture.  Will buy again and again.
I have had this pie a number of times. I have had no gristle and like the gravy taste. There is not much meat, but at this price it's what I expect.
Not enamoured, pastry is nice but gravy overpowers meat, gravy is quite thick and gloppy. £4 for this quality is poor value. I'm struggling to find any M&S food I like.
really looking forward to this but was all pastry and beef really fatty!

We tried this yesterday and it was really nice for a shop pie,  The puff pastry was lovely and the base was nice and not hard.  Nice bits of beef that were well cooked and not chewy, and pleasant gravy.  It fed two adults well.  We will be trying the more expensive M&S versions at some time to see if they are worth the extra in price.  Would buy this again, very pleased.
Youd never know its a diet drink, honestly its gorgeous
Not sure what the difference is between this and remix???? Anyway it's good, nice flavours and refreshing.
These stick together in the packet and just disintegrated when removed.
Not at all like parathas - not buttery or layered or flaky. Wont buy again.
These were more like a flat bread really. They tasted good but not what we were expecting.
Wont buy again as couldnt get paratha taste

I buy these most weeks. They aren't paratha's. You can tell from the ingredients - wheatflour and water. Paratha's are layered and use ghee to fluff up the layers. However, these make great warm flatbreads. The ingredients are clean. No palm oils, humecants or E numbers. I put these on a griddel pan or to warm on top of a turned on taoster so they get a little charred in places and that makes them tasty. They work especially well with middle eastern food. Great for scooping and a bit thicket than a tortilla type wrap and not stretchy like the Nishaan rotis and chappatis which I don't like.
Maybe its because I didnt fry them? Back to nann breads it is
These stick together in the packet and just disintegrated when removed.
Not at all like parathas - not buttery or layered or flaky. Wont buy again.
These were more like a flat bread really. They tasted good but not what we were expecting.
Wont buy again as couldnt get paratha taste

I buy these most weeks. They aren't paratha's. You can tell from the ingredients - wheatflour and water. Paratha's are layered and use ghee to fluff up the layers. However, these make great warm flatbreads. The ingredients are clean. No palm oils, humecants or E numbers. I put these on a griddel pan or to warm on top of a turned on taoster so they get a little charred in places and that makes them tasty. They work especially well with middle eastern food. Great for scooping and a bit thicket than a tortilla type wrap and not stretchy like the Nishaan rotis and chappatis which I don't like.
Maybe its because I didnt fry them? Back to nann breads it is
they taste ok. they're chapatis really--a bit dry. but nothing like the crispy, buttery, gorgeous flatbread that is a paratha.

Awful things. Not like any paratha I have ever tasted and nowhere near as good as the frozen ones from Shana. Shana would be happy to supply Ocado but they chooseNishaan with larger profit margins but inedible.

Awful things. Not like any paratha I have ever tasted and no where near as good as the frozen ones that I buy from another supermarket. Both my husband and I managed about a couple of bites of these and then the  whole lot went in the bin.
These are really good grilled. Long life store cupboard item for when you just feel like whipping up a tasty dal.
Great value and really tummt
Not like other parathas that we have had, more like flat breads but very tasty.

I'm not sure how these are sold as parathas. They are just like chapattis. I was really hoping for proper parathas, which contain butter and cook to a crispy, greasy, buttery finish that tastes delicious. These appeared to be missing the butter so were dry like chapattis!

We are quite particular about Indian breads from the supermarket as theyre often heavy and bland. These were really tasty with curry or as a breakfast with honey. We cooked in a pan without oil for about a minute on both sides.
Was surprised at how much worse these were than the usual frozen ones we pick up. Ocado please start carrying frozen parathas!
These are great with curries. I warm them up for longer than the instructions to warm all the way through.

parathas arrived covered in green mold. package was sealed and the sell by date several months away. this means there is a problem at source _ very worrying! not satisfied with the response from ocado on complaining.

I love that these are accidentally vegan so I dont have to pay the usual vegan tax! I wrap in foil and pop in the oven for 8 minutes and they are delicious with any curry. Ive just realised theyre quite calorific but given they dont contain any nasties I think thats ok! More power to plants!!

They're obviously not going to be as tasty as the ones from the takeaway, especially as I live in Tooting, but they aren't bad at all. i keep a pack in the freezer, they cook well wrapped in foil in the oven, or if defrosted then fried.

These ones contain rapeseed oil. Although obvs not like my mother in laws homemade ones, they are actually very good. Sadly in their other roti, Nishaan do use palm oil. I do not understand why. Explain yourselves, Nishaan!

My husband and I really like these! Definitely best fried, or if you grill them, sprinkle/brush them with oil (doesn't say this in the instructions, but is much nicer). I especially like the fact they don't have loads of ingreedients and aren't stuffed with sugar, like so many supermarket Indian breads.
l was surprised how nice these were...high in calories but worth it...fill and fold

Throw Fushi Ghee or Kerrygold Butter on it, it will not make any difference. Saps always all the taste of your food. What a horrible, horrible product. My sympathies are with the tastebuds of those who find this palatable.
These are delicious ! I have been frying them in a little oil as reviews suggest and they are amazing
these are a staple in our household. Dry fry them in a pan, no need for butter or similar, and use as a wrap. However they are sometimes mouldy, so be sure to check the packet.

The commenter who said they heat them in a frying pan with butter both sides was right. We did this and they were utterly delicious. I’ve not had Parathas before, I can’t gauge how authentic they are but I can say they’re a lovely bread that made a great wrap alternative.
We love these in my house. I used to oven bake them wrapped in foil but I tried frying then in a little olive oil last week and they were elevated from nice to amazing!
Cheap and tasty. Best done in a pan.
The whole family loved these. Will purchase ahead of naans in future. Recommended.

OK, so these aren't quite what you get from a fresh paratha in a restaurant, as they dint have the flakeyness/layering, but they're a good convenient home alternative, but at 4 for £1, and super quick to prepare, I'm happy.
So much better than naan bread, these are buttery flaky and delicious!

Purchased them twice and each time disappointed because it is no where near a paratha, even a simple one, as one expects. It needs to have to be fried with more oil/ghee/butter to make them edible.
The reason Asians would try them would be simply for convenience otherwise genuine parathas are cooked in each household without much effort.
I would try some other brand to compare but these ones are a definite no no. Sorry.
Really nice alternative to naan or chappati- cook under grill for authentic taste and consistency
The last time I got these they were mouldy. Wouldn't waste my time on these. The frozen ones are the tastiest
These are so good, so glad I found them!
Once revived in a hot frying pan, these parathas almost taste like fresh from the oven. Far superior to many supermarket naans. Recommended.

I have finally found a soft delicious bread to accompany a variety of dishes. These are soft, slightly chewy with an excellent density. They are much better as wraps for fajitas or delicious with humus. So versatile and as they have a fairly long shelf life I always have a pack in the cupboard.
We dry fry these (ie. Nothing in the pan with the paratha) and we actually prefer them to the ones from the restaurant. Yummy, crispy and not too fatty
We taste the tesco forzen ones ready to cook and are very delicious, but this ones are so dry and old taste.
i like paratha and i like these but  last week order they were mouldy
Bought 3 times recently. 2 were lovely, but the latest pack was mouldy despite a use by date of 2018! Parathas are my favourite indian bread but the mould has put me off these

Like other reviewers - really love this product but there is no way the use by dates are correct. 2 of 4 in my pack had mouldy patches within days of arriving when they should have been shelf stable for a month more. Someone needs to get the quality control in order here as it seems like a persistent issue.
We normally take these ourselves, but decided to make life a bit easier for ourselves this week. They taste great. Will be buying again.
Had to throw away immediately after delivery. Found green fungus at the sides of the paratha
Lovely taste and easy to cook, a restaurant taste at home-
I found these too thick and chewy. Even after warming them through. Slightly doughy taste and texture
These have arrived mouldy several times even though they were well within date.  There is obviously a quality control issue
Despite cooking as per instructions they were rather doughy and without the flakiness that a paratha should have. Disappointing.

Parathas should be lightly fried in a little oil. The instructions do not say that which makes these no different from thick chapattis.
Also bought 2 packs of these and both packs contained only THREE 'parathas' instead of four.
Authentic taste
Cheap. Long shelf life. Absolutely delish when put in hot dry frying pan for a minute
Use these for fajitas and wraps. Nice and thick and a decent taste
These are heavy, thick and gorgeous. They are great with curries and also with soups. Not as good as the stuffed parathas from the Indian, but the next best thing at 25p each. We buy these regularly.
These are probably pretty darn bad for you, but they are delicious. I toast them in a dry pan as I like it when the edges go crispy and burnt. Perfect for mopping up a curry.

Thanks Ocado for continuing to stock the Nishaan products as they are the best.  I find that keeping them in the fridge or freezer does prevent mould from creeping in.  We rebuy these week after week. Tasty and moist.
Great alternative to naan and makes our curries feel just a little bit more authentic!
Best Indian bread on the market, and we have tried a few.
Put under a hot grill for couple mins before meal ready until just before beginning to burn in patches - yummy.
Had to throw it away.
These are nice, but a little tough and not flaky like a fresh paratha
Folder them in half and stick them in the toaster - excellent with everything

...and not really a paratha. Sorry to be the lone decenter here. While these are a decent substitute, if you're after a proper, flaky and buttery paratha, go to any Indian or South Asia market and buy the frozen ones. Same price, better quality.
These are really tasty.  Heated for 30 seconds each side in a dry frying pan these are my favourite with a curry.

These are so tasty and at such a good price. 
They are a regular on our weekly shop!
Love love love these! I'm useless at making my own but those are very very close to how my aunties from back home make them even the husband loves this especially with lamb curry!
Perfect with curries or anything barbecue. A new addition to the weekly shop.
Really tasty and not as unhealthy as the real thing.

I had high hopes for these given the reviews but disappointing to say the least. They are nothing like the crispy, flaky, buttery parathas that you get from other ranges (Shaan frozen range is an excellent example). These were doughy and bland and I was embarrassed to have served these up to my guests last night. I'll stick to my usual purchase from Tesco for parathas in future.
great change from naan bread and super long shelf life is very convenient.
Taste really good.  Will be buying these again.
I usually heat these in a dry pan and they are non-greasy and delicious. We chucked them on the BBQ in the summer to have with grilled chicken tikka and they were even better. Love them.
This is the real thing.  pan fry in dry non-stick pan or wrap in foil and heat in oven.  freezes really well and easy to separate
Great produce and freeze well. Very handy and good price
I usually make my own but decided to try these and I wasn't disappointed .  Used the oven with mine .

I bought this product as an alternative to Waitrose own which I find very greasy.  This one however is not greasy, which gives customers the option to add more oil if they desire.  I dry heated mine in the frying pan and they were excellent.  They are a very good quality paratha indeed, and very enjoyable. 

I used them with Waitrose Burmese Chicken Soup as it is more like a thick curry, and it was delicious.

Well done Ocado for sourcing and stocking these.

Well no mould on mine & I thought they were really good. I followed the  cooking instructions by introducing them briefly to a very hot cast-iron pan & they were delicious, better than most take-aways I have had.

Definitely can’t taste coconut. Strange flavour / aftertaste. As if the sauce contained a hint of cheap alcohol. 
This is not my favourite and I won’t buy again…
But their choc shot version I do like a lot and will get more of!

Exceptionally rich texture, with an irresistible chocolatey appearance, and a smooth subtle coconut flavour. Overall a great product which tastes how I expected it to, and works well as a drizzle and in hot drinks. Compared to the other flavours in the range (excluding the plain chocolate) it's perhaps the most versastile flavour in my opinion. Boosts crepes really nicely!
This is not on my favourite list. The taste is a little weird. It is Slimming World friendly hense I got it however I prefer the plain style chocolate flavour.

For those who haven't tried choc shot, be warned it doesn't taste like Cadbury chocolate, however it is low in calories and 1/2 syn a teaspoon which means added to hot milk it makes a delicious Bounty hot chocolate. I'll be adding it to yogurts and baked oats. In my opinion, it's wonderful
The product is ok but I think if I wanted a sauce I would by a different one or if I wanted chocolate I would buy a spread. Good to try but will not have again
Me and my little boy had this on pancakes and werent keen. It's very rich and more of tang than a coconut flavour. Not one for us.

Definitely can’t taste coconut. Strange flavour / aftertaste. As if the sauce contained a hint of cheap alcohol. 
This is not my favourite and I won’t buy again…
But their choc shot version I do like a lot and will get more of!

Exceptionally rich texture, with an irresistible chocolatey appearance, and a smooth subtle coconut flavour. Overall a great product which tastes how I expected it to, and works well as a drizzle and in hot drinks. Compared to the other flavours in the range (excluding the plain chocolate) it's perhaps the most versastile flavour in my opinion. Boosts crepes really nicely!
This is not on my favourite list. The taste is a little weird. It is Slimming World friendly hense I got it however I prefer the plain style chocolate flavour.

For those who haven't tried choc shot, be warned it doesn't taste like Cadbury chocolate, however it is low in calories and 1/2 syn a teaspoon which means added to hot milk it makes a delicious Bounty hot chocolate. I'll be adding it to yogurts and baked oats. In my opinion, it's wonderful
The product is ok but I think if I wanted a sauce I would by a different one or if I wanted chocolate I would buy a spread. Good to try but will not have again
Me and my little boy had this on pancakes and werent keen. It's very rich and more of tang than a coconut flavour. Not one for us.
The product was nice although it had an unusual flavour. It wouldn't be my go to treat but it is a good alternative for those looking for a healthier alternative.
Lovely with oat pancakes and ice cream, without all the sugar and calories. The coconut flavour was a tad strong but I still liked it

I love the idea of this, but found the taste was not to my liking. I think it's the carob. To me, it doesn't really taste chocolatey, although the coconut flavour did come through. It's the sort of thing I might use if on a restricted diet, but wouldn't choose to buy it otherwise.
So versatile and tastes delicious
The younger ones in the family loved this but the older ones found it strange. Great on ice cream.
really delicious on pancakes!
Lovely family favourite - guilt free with a lovely taste of the chocolate and coconut - children love it - great over ice cream, topping with puddings etc

Perfect over ice cream and the kids loved the taste. 
A bit expensive compared to other toppings you can buy, so ok for a treat.
A great guilt free chocolate product. I enjoyed as sauce/drink and dipping pot. The coconut adds a nice sweet flavour.
I love this product - delicious and guilt free!

Made nice alternative to usual hot chocolate and also enjoyed over porridge. Nice to have a 'refined-sugar' free alternative but don't think it is superior in taste to my usual products. Would consider buying again if on offer.
This has an unusual flavour. You get the rich chocolate flavour first then the coconut comes in at the end to finish. Very  enjoyable.
Non of the family liked this even the coconut and chocolate lovers so it's not something I would buy.
This is loved by all my family.  Very chocolaty with a really authentic but not overpowering coconut flavour.  Absolutely delicious!
Just like all the other Sweet Freedom products, I absolutely looove Choc Shot Coconut. You can use it in so many ways. I drizzle some on my porridge, with fruit, use it whilst baking!! Amazing!

I found it quite an ok tasting energy drink, quite refreshing but also very sweet. I drank the whole can and later on felt quite ill, like I'd had too much sugar. I have no idea why because it doesn't appear to have sugar. I think I would have been better off having half a can. I asked the company whether it's vegetarian, and they replied promptly saying that it's vegan, which is good.
use it instead of a usual water bottle in the gym or as a PWO - either way it works just fine and the taste is really nice.
We were sent this to review so my husband had it & was pleasantly surprised. Found it tasty & refreshing
My son was not overly impressed with the taste
Didn't like this at all, tasted like medicine
This one was not for me
We were sent this to review. My husband tried it first I wasnt interested but had a drink and it taste nice. Expensive though

I quite liked the taste and that it was sugar free. I couldn't drink the whole can though - just a bit too much for me. I got this on review but if I was buying there are cheaper alternatives that taste as good.
Was ok but also felt a bit sugary even though there is none. I took it pre gym and it worked ok for that. Will try again and see.

Its okay-refreshing and packs a bit of a punch, but also leaves a bit of an aftertaste.
I dont drink energy drinks, so I cant compare it with anything else, but there are probably better and cheaper drinks out there.
I might buy it but it would have to be on offer.

Was sent a can as a free trial to review and it's ok. The passion fruit flavour is very subtle and I probably wouldn't have known it was passion fruit had it not been stamped on the can! It's less sickly sweet than the most famous brand, but I prefer the flavour of others on the market that are a bit cheaper. That said, it's quite refreshing and contains the necessary ingredients for an energy drink so I'm sure it does the job!

Better flavour than red bull (if you like passion fruit), used on a night shift and seemed to give some energy for rest of shift. 

Given free to review, would never normally buy energy drinks, husband would but not at this price, but would recommend.

Was given this to review.  Was pleasantly surprised at how refreshing it was but there was a slight after-taste which I presume was the sucralose.  Didnt make me feel jittery but I did feel alert after just 4 hours sleep.   Probably would buy again if on offer.

This was a free review item.  The stated price is more expensive than my usual energy drink. The taste was not unpleasant but there was a "sweetener" aftertaste.  I would drink it again if it was free, but I would stick to my usual brand if I was paying,
This drink is OK. It is less sweet thanks some of the other drinks on the market and lacks real flavour. I would not get again.

This was a review item.
I don't normally buy energy drinks and I didn't notice anything special about this drink.
As this is quite an expensive at its regular price, I wouldn't buy again or recommend to others.

I was sent this to review but unfortunately I am unable to as the can had been pierced and leaked all over my shopping in one of the carrier bags. The Ocado driver kindly said he would take the item off my bill but I told him it was a freebie! I was looking forward to trying it actually as I am a big fan of energy drinks as I suffer from anaemia and drink them often. Sadly, I will never know what this tastes like now. Unless I buy one of course which I may do if they are on offer.
Not for me unfortunately fat too expensive when theres other similar products on the market that are cheaper.

First time ever tried these drinks, didnt like the taste.
Feel could be more tastier.

sent to review. It was ok, nothing amazing and a bit pricey at full price. Tasted a bit like weak orange squash. If cheap enough i may consider purchasing again, but would probably go for the usual suspect if i wanted a decent energy drink.
This just tasted like a standard energy drink.  I could not taste any passion fruit and I am not sure there was anything distinctive about it that warrants paying over £2 a can.

Tastes just like the winged product but you get much more of it. Sucralose is not my favorite sweetener though, it has been implicated in health issues long term, perhaps the maker could use stevia instead.
Was sent this to review. Taste was ok, not unpleasant. It did the job like any other caffeine fuelled drink. Wouldnt personally buy as seems over priced and prefer other brands.
I was sent this to review. I liked the taste, and the caffeine hit, it didn't make me feel jittery either like coffee does. not sure I would purchase again, just due to the cost.
Unfortunately this product was not for me, while sugar free, it tasted rather too artificial for my liking.
This is just flavoured fizzy water in a can. Very expensive for just a but of fizzy water. You pay for the packaging.

I feel this product is a little over priced for what it is. The caffeine content is high and its sugar free which is great if that's what your looking for. The taste is fine, but personally I wouldn't say it stands out from any of the other energy drinks available in the shops. It is for that reason I wouldn't recommend it.
I can't agree with other reviews. Maybe I was lucky but it was lovely and no complaints at all.
These are never as good as the foodhall packs used to be for some reason. Even the packaging seems cheaper and poor quality! I hope M&S don’t start to sacrifice the quality of their products

Bought this for their first time and have just had to submit a refund request. On removing the fillets from the packet several were visibly very poor cuts of meat before I even tried to cut them. I tried to cut the rest but every single one of them had sinew running right through them, with no meat salvageable. Sadly the whole lot had to be binned as none was usable.

These mini fillets are not the same as the packaging suggests, if you are familiar with them from M&S. It’s like they have been torn out of the chicken by a wolf and bear no resemblance to the carefully cut out ones you get from M&S in the same range. Clearly these come from a different supplier, looks more like something Tesco/Asda would sell. Won’t be buying again. Such a shame!!
Really lovely chicken.
M and S need to have a bigger choice of free range chicken
I can't agree with other reviews. Maybe I was lucky but it was lovely and no complaints at all.
These are never as good as the foodhall packs used to be for some reason. Even the packaging seems cheaper and poor quality! I hope M&S don’t start to sacrifice the quality of their products

Clearly these come from a different supplier, looks more like something Tesco/Asda would sell. Won’t be buying again. Such a shame!!
Really lovely chicken.

We absolutely loved this yogurt, so creamy and a gorgeous lemon flavour. It was more reminiscent to a luxury desert rather than just a yogurt. We very easily polished this off between the two of us in one sitting.
Tasty yoghurt, I add frozen raspberries which gives a lovely balance, may be yoo sweet on it's own.
not  a fan of this at all, try it and you may love it, if you like really sweet things
this addition spoils the natural presentation of this yoghurt. I definitely do not want carbohydrate added to my diet -

As an organic yoghurt was disappointed to find glucose syrup as an ingredient- why not just stick to organic sugar?! Feels like an unnecessary processed ingredient, will be sticking to Yeo valley in future
Just a bit thinner than the usual greek yogurt,i love the Lemon and the Coconut from Rachels
I was hoping for more of a really thick Greek yoghurt consistency which this doesn't have. Not bad but I prefer the flavour of the Yeo Valley lemon curd.
This is divine!  Creamy and thick, perfect balance of sweetness and sharpness - it tastes far more indulgent than it is. And it's organic - perfect!!

My husband chose this flavour and I must say I reluctantly added it to the trolley as I LOVED the coconut yogurt best. Although I like lemon flavour things I would definitely not have not picked lemon flavour yogurt but OMG it is so delicious and so satisfying, this and the coconut is now our regular purchase as we both love both flavours, healthy delicious pudding, yum, yum.
Really hits the spot! Yummy!
I eat this everyday as a treat it's really delicious the texture is perfect too. Nice lemon flavour with just the right amount of tang
Didn't realise lemon yoghurt could be so tasty. Tastes like lemon meringue pie.
This yoghurt is so delicious! I really like the coconut one by Rachel's too, but this is definitely the best yoghurt I've ever tasted. Strongly recommend!
just love it
Just the perfect texture and taste... And healthy too
Lovely flavour and consistency.  Will be a regular purchase.
Very smooth greek style yogurt - best of the range. just the right sweetness, refreshing lemon flavour. love it.
The apricot flavour was quite subtle and it wasn't sweet enough to compensate for this. it was fine with yoghurt but not exceptional.
Understand there is little sugar but it is just way to sour
this is one of the tastiest apricot compotes I've ever had. The first one that taste like real fruit and it's not too sweet.

Wonderful in every way, I love this compote - beautiful flavour and colour, just the right level of tang. So rare to find fruit stuff like this with such a lovely clean list of ingredients (thank you, Daylesford, for keeping it free of the dreaded manufactured citric acid).

I do not understand the good reviews... It taste horrible.
I bought this  because there were  so many good reviews. I wonder how?
It taste sour and nothing like a good apricot jam.
I think they put citric acid as the main ingredients.( even if it is not written on it.
It is very unpleasant, never gonna buy again.
I bought first time a week ago and is so tasty.  I add one spoon to my porridge every morning.
The apricot flavour was quite subtle and it wasn't sweet enough to compensate for this. it was fine with yoghurt but not exceptional.
Understand there is little sugar but it is just way to sour
this is one of the tastiest apricot compotes I've ever had. The first one that taste like real fruit and it's not too sweet.

Wonderful in every way, I love this compote - beautiful flavour and colour, just the right level of tang. So rare to find fruit stuff like this with such a lovely clean list of ingredients (thank you, Daylesford, for keeping it free of the dreaded manufactured citric acid).

I do not understand the good reviews... It taste horrible.
I bought this  because there were  so many good reviews. I wonder how?
It taste sour and nothing like a good apricot jam.
I think they put citric acid as the main ingredients.( even if it is not written on it.
It is very unpleasant, never gonna buy again.
I bought first time a week ago and is so tasty.  I add one spoon to my porridge every morning.
Pure fruit, not too sweet. This stuff is amazing and well worth the money.

Only pure organic fruit, which explains the chunks and fibre others who only know chemicals and over processed food complain about. Also, being an organic 100% natural product, it will go off soon after opening the seal, people who had natural preserve made by grandma' with real fruit from the garden would know this. I refrigerate it after opening but we usually finish a jar in less than a week. The sealed ones last for a long time. 
Sadly I notice every day that many people have no idea what natural and real quality is like, because they grew up in the world of chemicals and preservatives.
For me, after having grown up in the countryside having a 100% natural healthy pantry, this is the best preserve I could find on the market. My whole family loves it!
No junk or extras. Allot of fruit inside. A bit sour but things is not perfect. Really nice organic real jam.

Fibre. Thats the trouble...yes, it tastes of apricot but every other mouthful, some sort of fibrous material ...not sure what that is but its definitely not nice. Spoils the whole thing. So despite the taste, I wont buy this again...not good.
Has a lovely taste but went off too quickly had mould on the top soon after purchase. If i bought it again would need to eat soon after purchase. It does say use within a week though!
Delicious on Greek yoghurt with a few raspberries.

Unfortunately this is ruinously expensive, as it is one of the nicest things I've bought in ages. We have it on porridge in the morning and get through a jar in just over a week...oh dear.
It's not too sweet, has a lovely tang to it and is perfect with porridge and cream.
Bonne Maman is watery sad nonsense compared with this deliciousness. Get some.
I've tried both and this one has far more fruit, is more tart and less syruppy. I can eat it all, like another reviewer, in one sitting.

This is the best apricot compote I have tasted so far, not over sweet and with big bits of apricots in it.
Lovely on bread or added to yoghurt. O just eaten out of the pot .
Absolutely yummy.

So+bland,+a+tasteless+paste,+not+a+patch+on+its+French+rival+Bonne+Mamamn,+despite+the+fact+that+the+Daylesford+variety+is+also+produced+in+France.++This+comment+is+obviously+in+direct+contrast+to+the+review+of+24/2/11,+and+is+also+the+first+negative+one+
This is absolutely delicious...85% apricots so tart. Could eat the entire jar in a sitting.
We had this for lunch today, made as an apricot crumble. Everyone thought it was absolutely delicious.
Nice and fruity natural flavour not sickly.  Expensive but worth it.

This is the best apricot compote I have ever tasted and much thicker than the Bonne Maman variety. Pricey, yes, but if you're an apricot aficionado you'll appreciate its unsurpassed fruitiness and wonderfully rich scent of apricot. The next best thing to eating apricots directly from the tree in summertime!
Absolutely delicious - rich and tasty and not over-sweet so perfect with something like vanilla icecream, sponge cake etc

The advertised photo shows nice lean cubes of pork. The pack I received looked more like mechanically separated meat with lots of very small fatty ragged pieces. Have emailed Ocado with photos because this really was VERY poor quality meat.

I usually love Packington products, so tasty, and have bought this diced pork before. However, having had this in the freezer and needing to use up, I was so disappointed when I opened the packet only to find a few ‘even’  and small dices. Along with scrappy and flat pieces . Not the usual high quality! Hope this packet was a one off, but also hope Packington have a word with their ‘dicer’ !

Decided to give this a go and marinated it with greek yogurt added some spices and left in fridge for a few hours used it the ninja grill and was very tasty and soft so needs to be marinated to get the best

Not easy to find diced pork and I know this is a good brand, the chops are lovely. Diced and trimmed of all fat and enough for two. I made a pork and prune casserole which was delicious even if I say so myself. My little cat had a bit too he loved it. Highly recommended.
Made a tasty pork casserole, nice and tender. Unevenly diced but not a massive problem.
I don't understand the poor reviews. I bought 3 packs on flash sale and all were good and made a lovely, flavoursome stew. Will buy again.
I was disappointed with this pork. It was very stringy and fatty and made me feel queasy cooking it. Not diced properly, looked like lots of nasty off cuts. Had to throw a lot away, such a waste.
This is really poor quality. A selection of scraps that are so full of water that it takes a good 10 mins in a frying pan for them to stop boiling and start browning. Will not buy again.
Should be described as pork shavings not diced. We only got a few cubes in two packs. Most were very small and not what could be described as hand cut.

I recently bought two pack of these and wanted to cook them a couple of days before the best before date but the meat had changed its colour and smelled sour. It happened twice. I am not buying it again.

Love these pork cubes. We cook them with peppers, garlic, paprika and Just a Splash sherry to make a Spanish style dish - delicious! The quality of the meat is excellent, very little excess fat which means you can chuck straight into the pan. Only 400g but it goes a long way and feeds our family of 4. Also good to know the pigs have had a happy life!

Title says it all. Got it as a replacement and god it was bad. From the off smell to the bad taste. Also, for that price, do a decent butchering and cut the pieces to a similar size....what I got was from bite size to flakes.
Turned out tough stir fried, maybe better suited to slow cooking. Meat was lean with mostly medium sized pieces and a few small bits.
This has gone to my dog. The meat was full of stringy fat that I could not handle to even look at.
This is lovely tasting pork but the pieces can be extremely small Not great for threading onto kebab sticks

I'm normally a bit reluctant to order diced pork online without getting to look at the pack first, but I recently took a gamble on this and got some surprisingly nice pork delivered. Not too much fat or gristle, just nice meaty chunks.
Tender pork, very tasty slow cooked as casserole. Most impressed.
Started out great a couple of months ago but is now getting gristly unfortunately
Tender, fresh and full of flavour.
Arrived with a good use by date, nicely packaged and was fresh when I opened the pack. When cooked the pork had so much flavour and impressed with the tenderness of it. A good purchase.
Fancied a change from chicken and beef in a casserole and this did not disappoint. Really good quality pork, good sized pieces, and stayed tender and full of flavour after slow cooking.
Great quality free range pork. Tastes good and high welfare - so I'm happy. Good sized pieces, used for a stew and pork was lovely and tender.
Tender and tasty meat, which was perfect for my casserole. Good choice.
Used this is a stir fry and it was delicious - the pork was tender and full of flavour. Happily buy again.
No edible it was all fat & gristle
I bought this because it was on offer and and so glad I did. Great flavour! Nice size pieces and free range! I will definitely be buying again.
This was tough, tasteless and the smell was horrid.  It was thrown straight in the bin after cooking as was completely inedible.
Very strong and bad taste

This was very lean not a gram of fat on it and very tender.   Last time I bought it it was in chunks but this time it was a mixture of very small pieces. This didn't really matter as I casseroled it with vegetables in the oven. Will definitely buy again.

Very disappointing product considering meant to be free range. Pieces far too small and I threw a third of it away in fat! I would have been better buying a whole joint of meat and cutting it up myself!

The meat itself is good but it is very badly and unevenly cut up! I was expecting casserole sized lumps not tiny little pieces mixed with all shapes and sizes - none bigger than 1cmx2cm. Not up to normal Packington standard!
There were very few pieces of meat one could call diced, it was mostly small pieces that resembled a corse mince.
Sorry but this product is very disappointing, it is fatty and full of water so spoils your casserole!  Waitrose product is far superior.

Bought twice before and was very happy. Nice even sized pieces of good quality meat but third purchase was awful! Lots of fat and gristle and really scraggy pieces of meat. Seems from other reviews too that this is not a consistent quality buy.
Bought two packs and cut off just over 100gms of fat from each pack. Some pieces were all fat. Will not buy again.
Not sure if we got a bad packet but we found this really fatty and had to spend some time trimming it off. Won't buy again.

I bought these and the pork strips in the same week, thought I'd try something new.  These were so fab, quick and easily turned in to pork and apple stew with cider which took me about 10 mins tops.  The pork was really tasty - this free-range stuff is so much tastier than the stuff I used to buy.  It was also nice, no fatty gristly bits.  Definitely recommended.
NA
nice selection
Gorgeous, decadent and unctuous.  Shame about the fat, but a wonderful treat.
Thick and creamy but contains no live bacteria. Live bacteria are essential for gut health so I won't buy this again.
I love the taste of this yoghurt. It's nice and creamy, not sour at all. I would recommend.
I like the taste of this yogurt but it is not a Greek style as I would expect it to be thicker but ok if you want a nice yogurt
lovely creamy taste
very good yogurt
Gorgeous, decadent and unctuous.  Shame about the fat, but a wonderful treat.
Thick and creamy but contains no live bacteria. Live bacteria are essential for gut health so I won't buy this again.
I love the taste of this yoghurt. It's nice and creamy, not sour at all. I would recommend.
I like the taste of this yogurt but it is not a Greek style as I would expect it to be thicker but ok if you want a nice yogurt
lovely creamy taste
very good yogurt

These are lovely eggs and have a lovely very large yolk, however all my dozen eggs had a very large yellow yolk and not the deep orange yolk I've come to expect from other Clarence breeds. They're good eggs, but I think there are better ones out there.
Lovely and very fresh white shelled eggs with a bright yolk. Mixed size, but all of mine were large. Great quality and will buy these again.

I used to think one egg was pretty much like another, until I ordered these - sooo much better - scrambled eggs have now become a taste sensation - I'd actually thought I was going off eggs until I ordered these.
These eggs have a lovely creamy yolk which just cries out to be poached. Delicious!
Gorgeous looking eggs
Not gone back since we found these….even better when on the 2for offer!

These are lovely eggs and have a lovely very large yolk, however all my dozen eggs had a very large yellow yolk and not the deep orange yolk I've come to expect from other Clarence breeds. They're good eggs, but I think there are better ones out there.
Lovely and very fresh white shelled eggs with a bright yolk. Mixed size, but all of mine were large. Great quality and will buy these again.

I used to think one egg was pretty much like another, until I ordered these - sooo much better - scrambled eggs have now become a taste sensation - I'd actually thought I was going off eggs until I ordered these.
These eggs have a lovely creamy yolk which just cries out to be poached. Delicious!
Gorgeous looking eggs
Not gone back since we found these….even better when on the 2for offer!
Love these eggs, not too expensive and great taste

These eggs are good, the yolks are darker than most, which means more lutein content /good for eyesight/. I find they taste better than other eggs I have purchased from Ocado or elsewhere.
Update: latest boxes have unpleasant imagery on them instead of the usual pleasant images. I will not be buying these eggs again until they revert back to normal box images.

I eat a lot of eggs and have come to realise that they ate not all created equal.  Fabulous with lovely large rich yolks.  Great boiled, scrambled or fried and if you are going to the effort of baking something then these are a great choice.
Always brilliant quality. Beautiful yolk and fresh eggs.
These eggs really are lovely, and no red spots to pick out. Mine always seem to get damaged in delivery. But the ones I manage to rescue out of a broken box really are tasty.
All Clarence Court eggs are the best eggs ever!! Just lucky to get all eggs in tact

These are some of the best eggs I have ever tried, just like all the other Clarence Court eggs.  Always full golden yolks, full of flavour, nothing like ordinary eggs.  You can really taste the difference!  I always buy when they are on offer.
Never fail to impress.   The quality of these eggs are second to none.   Beautiful golden yoke.   A little more expensive than some but you absolutely get what you pay for with these.

Gave these a try as they were on offer. Agree with many of the reviews. Lovely rich, orange yolks, very fresh and full of flavour. Like most of Clarence Court eggs. Had these scrambled and soft-boiled. Velvetty scrambled egg, sparkling of Morden salt flakes and President butter on Crosta & Mollica Pane Pugliese Toasting Bread. Pure heaven. Just as lovely soft boiled with soldiers. Some were a little small but the quality more than made up for it.

Free range, consistently excellent flavour with golden
yolks and NO red spots in them.   One wish, that the
hens would lay larger eggs, other than that, no complaints.

I always buy these eggs because they taste the best.  They have a dark golden yolk and never have any brown or red spots inside.  They vary in size and sometimes, when they're very big, they have double yolks.
But too small for me, disappear inside the egg cup!

Unlike the majority of non-specialist eggs where there is just a round lump of yolk in the centre surrounded by a disproportionate amount of albumen, in these Leghorn's the yolk extends right to the tip of both ends, at least for those in the box I received. The deep orange colour of the yolks was an added bonus.
These are delicious eggs. Quality is always good and the yolks are so vibrant in colour. Would highly recommend.

A delight for the eyes and the palate. The rich yolks are equally wonderful for dipping homemade soda bread soldiers into, dripping with seasalt President butter, or mashed lightly with the tines of a fork and devilled. To devil my eggs, I add mayo, zingy salad cream, hot smoked paprika, a spritz of lime juice, a generous grind of pepper, turmeric, a good glug of Frank's buffalo sauce, and sweet American mustard. To finish, I scatter the eggs with a flourish of fragrant dried chervil, a pinch of smoked paprika and a spike of fiery Habanero Tabasco, which has a lovely fruity hint of sweet paw paw, banana and mango.
White eggs remind me of Spain which is the closest Ill get for a while.  Lovely yellow yolks and make the best scrambled eggs.

Had these several times when on sale, but having discovered a nicer brand, we have decided to stop getting these. They are definitely not as nice as our new favourites. Might get them occasionally for a bit of variety.

I’m fed up of seeing and taking out those yucky blood spots you get around the yolk in brown shelled eggs. These are perfect, taste great and happy to stick these directly to pan as never seen a blood spot in these, rather then brown eggs which I have to crack into a bowl first  just to clean out blood spots from eggs. Why other smaller shops don’t sell white shelled eggs instead of brown eggs like the rest of the world does, is beyond me...

Have ordered these twice now as they seem to be the only white ones which are handy for Easter decorations.  But both deliveries (4 boxes in total) had a large number of broken or partially broken eggs, therefore unusable for decorating purposes (and the mushy cartons were not pleasant to recycle either).
I know how to boil an egg, and half these break on boiling. Waste of money
Amazing yoke colour, bright yellow....worth the premium for scrambled or poached but I wouldn’t both paying the premium for baking. I did not notice a difference.
These eggs are really tasty with lovely golden yolks. They make delicious scrambled eggs and taste like eggs used to taste!!
These eggs are bigger than rest of Clarence courts chicken eggs. Lovely flavour. Prefer it to their blue box. Deep orangey yellow yolk
Rich tasty york like blue eggs and bigger
Love these eggs, big and lovely coloured yolk. The shells are a bit more delicate than brown eggs so require careful cracking!

These eggs are the best taste wise.  I have been buying organic eggs for years and recently had these as poached eggs at a neighbours house.  They taste better than any organic eggs I've found and having searched Clarence Court's welfare I was happy to buy non-organic from this company.  The improved taste is notable.
Bright yellow yolks and actually taste like eggs! Delighted to have found these little gems!
Nice and fresh eggs that sit up nicely on the albumen ! I luvvv these as boiled/dippy eggs luvvvly flavour
Tasty. But they get smaller and smaller every week.
I've been buying these for a few weeks and although they are nice quality I'm sure they are getting smaller and smaller!  So have taken them off my regular order.
Even a pullet wouldn't want to own up to these!. Needed five of them for one omelette for one person. Won't  be buying again.

These were the tiniest eggs I have ever seen sold as chicken eggs. They were rattling around in the packet. 
More like to size of a bantam.
These make delicious soft boiled eggs. My kiddo would have it for breakfast every morning if she could
These eggs taste lovely, arrived undamaged and with super long shelf life. Thumbs up!!
The best tasting eggs I've bought from Ocado, bonus that they are often on offer!
Just the best eggs. We buy these time and time again. Great flavour and great these are proper free range (much higher welfare standard) as supposed to some free range eggs.

The Clarence Court eggs are simply worth paying the extra money for. Yolks are always a vibrant colour, and incredibly tasty. The shells are always strong, suggesting healthy rearing (unlike cheap supermarket eggs where the shell will just shatter and lose all structure just by being tapped to break). These Leghorn Whites are reliably good, just like the Burford Browns.
By far the best supermarket eggs. Bright orange yolks and fresh enough to poach. They taste amazing – the only eggs we buy.
Very lovely eggs a must once a week on our order
So nice dark yolks firm whites she's that don't end up in your food we really enjoyed them on our breakfast but they are expensive of you go through a lot of eggs but very good quality

Originally bought these on a whim.
Glad I did as it was a great decision.
Absolutely fabulous tasting eggs :)
eggs how they were in the 70s, white shells, tasty, fresh, deep orange yolks, ( the darker the yolk the better the egg )white shell hen eggs are a rarity now, just as brown shell eggs were in the 70s
Maybe I got a bad box, but I weighed them and all of them were small sized eggs. Tasted nice - but I certainly won't pay this much for a box of small eggs again.
These are great eggs. A lovely rich yolk.
we love these eggs can taste the difference between these and brown eggs.

Lovely fresh eggs with lovely coloured yolks. We purchased as the hens are allowed to roam free from dawn to dusk and I think if we are going to enjoy their eggs we should at least make sure they have a good old life. Free roam tastes miles better too

I love these, they are clean, fresh, zero blood spots and the yolks are delicious. I’ve never had an issue with smashed or cracked eggs, they always arrive in perfect condition. They are pricey but are usually on offer.
These are the best eggs I have tasted in a long time, I urge you to try, you won’t be disappointed.
Great alternative if Burfords are out of stock

I have started buying these since hearing that hens laying brown eggs have sharp beaks, which need to be cut - causing them pain and distress - to prevent them pecking at an damaging other chickens.  Apparently white laying birds' beaks don't need to be cut.  Who knew.
Lovely fresh eggs, beautiful coloured yolks, great for baking.

Without doubt, our favourite eggs.  Deep coloured almost red yolk, nice firm shells (a sign of well cared for hens), nice thick whites.  Not watery like some brands.  Very tasty eggs.  Reminds me of eggs of bygone times when all eggs were from free ranging hens direct from the farm shops.
First time Ive had these eggs! Best flavour really yellow!
They were good. But husband preferred burford browns for the really golden yolks
Amazing eggs.
No other eggs taste as good as these
Make the most beautiful boiled eggs, cant fault Clarence court eggs
These are my favourite eggs, I will always buy them when they come up on offer. Rich and tasty...yummy!
Lovely yellow yolks & very tasty

Beautiful fresh eggs 
Love this range
These make the nicest scrambled eggs, the yolks are consistently a deep orange and never disappoint
I buy them every time they are on offer - constant, reliable quality and lovely tasting yoke.
Lovely eggs, worth the price.
These are wonderful eggs, and I will continue to buy them, but be aware that they may vary in size - in my last purchase of 18 eggs, the smallest was 51gm and the largest, 67gm.
These are the BEST eggs ive eaten in ages! won't be buying any other eggs from now on!
My new favourite eggs. Lovely tasting yolk.

I'd forgotten how eggs should taste! As they did in my childhood.
Large orange yolk with firm whites. From now on I will only buy these eggs.

I cant go back to eating normal eggs now Ive tried these and the burford brown eggs by Clarence Court. Amazing in taste, texture and yolk colour. You can tell the chickens are higher welfare so I dont mind paying a bit more for this and the taste of the eggs. Amazing poached.
Highest quality eggs, love the taste!

They really do taste different. You realise that when you eat any other supplier's eggs. The yolks are just richer and creamier - they taste of something! Other eggs seem really watery and bland, in comparison. Fantastic products.
I bought these on offer. They taste lovely but are quite small, not so good for baking.
I love Clarence court eggs as the yolks are lovely and big and they always arrive very fresh.
As good as the other eggs from this brand. Deep orange yolks and super quality. Great scrambled, in cakes, in anything!
I love these eggs and they are now a regular on my shopping list.  They taste much nicer than brown eggs with a deep orange yolk.  We eat a lot of eggs so notice the difference.

"The" perfect eggs for me, as they taste like eggs my Mum gave us in the 60s.
A sunshine golden yolk that starts my day with a smile, followed by the delectable flavour added to my soldiers as I dip them in, or the richness of flavour added to my omelettes.
I'm in heaven.. please don't stop stocking these! 
I definitely recommend to everyone so you don't miss out on real eggs
Yum

I bought these after trying leghorn white in the ocado mixed box. They are delicious. Lovely orange yolks and a not rubbery moist tasty white. Whole family really like them. Good price too compared to some other quality eggs.

These eggs are the best I have ever had!
Highly recommend!
Proper dark yellow yolk- no words to describe it just the best
Good shells, satisfying to crack. Look and taste nice
The perfect eggs wouldn’t have any others!
Yolk is nice and thick , has beautiful colour.So much better than other brands, the yolk is actually bigger than Waitrose organic very large eggs!!!

Massive yolk. Yolk is bright yellow full of flavour. Soft thin shell. 

These are incredible and if youre making egg soldiers, do not look any further! Only can afford when on offer but love them still!!
These eggs taste like the eggs of my childhood. Every time they are amazing

These had such beautiful yolks. Smaller than some eggs but think that may be because smaller chickens(?) 
Nevertheless they were beautifully yellow yolks full of flavour. A real bargain on a flash sale. Perfect dippy eggs and a soft hard-boil on a salad.
Good taste, good size, would buy again.

Lovely large pure white eggs, with a robust yet fairly thin shell, which makes for easy cracking. The shell is pointed and chalky-looking, very charming to look at in the egg rack. Large orange yolks, very tasty overall. Though they don't quite top the Burford Browns!
I alternate between all of the Clarence Court eggs but prefer these even if they're a little more expensive. They are the biggest by weight and have the most orange yolks. Winners in every way
Really small eggs wafer thin shells all broken on delivery. Blue Clarence court much better!

I keep chickens so I know what a good quality fresh egg looks and tastes like.  My girls are getting old now and so I need to top up my egg supplies from the supermarket in the winter.  The best thing about a really fresh egg is how perky and 'tight' it is when you crack it into the pan.  Sometimes higher than it is wide!  Some supermarket eggs are thin and watery and clearly not fresh at all.  These are really good, a lovely colour and pretty perky...almost as good as my own.
Look great, taste okay but very brittle shells and all extremely small

Have purchased Clarence Court eggs for years and they were always lovely good sized tasty eggs. For months now they have arrived tiny and literally rattle in the box. It seems the tiny eggs you currently supply is now the norm, yet there has been no reduction in price for the smaller product. Time to vote with my feet. Such a shame as your eggs used to be perfect.
Simply the best eggs, but it now says that Ocado no longer sells them. Why???
Delighted to have the chance to buy white eggs in my Ocado order without having to go to a specialist shop to find them.  Excellent, please keep supplying them.
Amazing eggs, really fresh and delicious. Beautiful big yellow fresh yolks and pretty white shell. I will never buy anything else now. Once you've tasted these you'll never want to try anything else.
These made tasty Omlettes mmm
These eggs are very delicious, will keep on buying them.
Very good eggs!
Don't know why I just like white shell eggs a lot rather than brown/yellowish shell ones. They always come out with a lovely orange yolk... Egg cravings sorted!
Love these eggs. plump yellow yolks everytime

The leghorn whites are my favourite from the Clarence court range. The yolks are always a bright healthy colour and are just delicious whichever way they are cooked. Loyal to this brand, hope Ocado continues to stock them.
We only ever buy Clarence eggs. They're they best!
fed on natural diet and free to roam - the best eggs!
I love Clarence Court and specially this GREEN box one. Yellow yolk is much more creamy rather than another in same brand. There is red/blue/cream box. My favorite is this GREEN box.
These have lovely yellow/orangey yolks and tastes like proper eggs should. Love these and so happy when they are on offer
I only buy Clarence Court eggs now-definitely better quality.
Nice flavour but impossible to use for anything other than boiling as the shells disintegrate. Very disappointed
These are my morning treat. Like all the Clarence house eggs they have lovely orangey/yellow yolks and taste like eggs should. They are a nice biggish size too. Love them.

Fantastically tasty, well worth the money. Yolks are dark orange. And as a bonus, they are the only white shell eggs I ever found in the UK, looked great when we dyed them in pastel colours for Easter.
Great quality as always for Clarence Court eggs. All their varieties are tasty.
I brought all series of clearance eggs. This green package is not fresh at all. Shell is very thin, egg whites like water.
Best eggs around. They look and taste as eggs should.

I usually buy the Legbar variety but tried these too, agree with previous review that these, being slightly larger are great for baking but still very tasty for general use... I still prefer the Legbar for poaching but honestly, all varieties of Clarence Court Eggs are top notch... If you don't have access to fresh farm eggs locally then there are no better eggs you can buy in my opinion.
After eating these consistently good eggs we couldn't possibly go back to ordinary ones. The yolks are always a deep yellow colour and taste lovely.

All of the Clarence Court eggs are eggcellent - what? if it's good enough for Saturday Kitchen each week? - but this variety are slightly larger than the others, so a little more useful for baking... It doesn't hurt that also look beautiful...

One of the main reasons I shop on Ocado is for great but hard to find products like these eggs, the blue Clarence Court are nice also but these are better, wish more supermarkets stocked them. They are consistent in their quality, a great size and delicious whether fried, boiled or scrambled. You can really taste the difference between these and normal eggs, I'd say they're as tasty as organic eggs. I love foods that are 'different' to the normal aka white eggs, purple carrots etc so will continue to buy these. I understand why so many celeb chefs use Clarence Court eggs!
Rich tasting and perfect yellow yolks. Once you've tried Clarence Court eggs you won't want to go back to any other!
I've always buy Clarence Court eggs and this is my favourite variety. Large tasty eggs perfect for scramble or quiche.
These really are amazing eggs, we've been trying to perfect egg poaching for a while and these deliver the most consistent and delicious eggs we have had. Really rich and tasty yokes too.
used to have other clarence court and thought they were good  but these are great
White eggs are known for not having the usual blood spots that are found often with brown eggs.  So please that Ocado has decided to stock these.  Great taste
Impressed by these.  Nice even size too
By far the best eggs for flavour . Would defiantly recommend
Clarance court great
Not only do they look beautiful in the egg basket, they taste great too and have wonderful bright yolks.
More delicious, top quality eggs from Clarence Court - can't beat them!

Another fine offering from Clarence court !
Can't beat this range of eggs , when we've  run out between ocado shops and have bought another brand they get wasted as the difference in taste is so noticeable .
 It's lovely to have a new choice from Clarence court & these will be a regular in our basket !
fresh tasty eggs lovely yolk
Pretty bad. Tough, dense and dry meat. Texture of liver. Fridge Raiders are much better.

These chicken bites are so delicious. 
Great when you need a filling snack straight from the fridge.
Even better as on offer so end up stocking up,no complaints here!
I love these as a healthy, high protein and low sugar savoury snack. They are much nicer than similar products as they are made with breast meat so less greasy
The kids love a salad when these are present - can't complain as inexpensive on offer and a decent taste. A regular for us.
awful texture, very dense and pellet-y. bland taste.

I cannot even explain how bad these were. It was like they were trying to do fridge raiders and it really didnt work. They are not edible and you couldnt even get through the whole bag. Wouldnt buy again or recommend to others
