Pleasantly surprised moist & tasty snack, expensive for just 50 Grams but reasonable low calorie snack ,would buy again when on offer

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. These are fairly nice a lightly spiced coating on some chicken bits. The bag was smaller than it looked and wasn't particularly full. The warm spiced flavour is nice but when on the chilled chicken wasn't my favourite flavour combination but it was certainly alright.
Was sent these to review. Very tasty, nice coating and not overpowering but too expensive for so few

I was sent these to review.
My husband ate them and thought they were a great snack until I told him the price. 50g pack with 85 % chicken
We love them!

Won't be buying these again - they've got the brand name - but that's all - they were like eating pieces of dry cardboard. Not sure which poor chicken breast they used - maybe it had been freeze dried or something. Plenty of other tasty healthy chicken options out there - avoid these.
Really tough/chewy and dry
Love these juicy prawns and tangy sauce. Get these every time I order and whenever I go past a Marks and Spencer!
Put black pepper on sauce, served with little gem lettuce, cucumber, tomato and brown bread.
Definitely an occasional purchase as quite expensive for the portion size. Found the sauce this time had a slight metallic taste which was a bit off putting.
The sauce was very creamy
Really enjoyed these..with salad and some smoked salmon..we bought in flash sake, so good value..small portion, so expensive at full price..
I buy these every week, really lovely
Love these juicy prawns and tangy sauce. Get these every time I order and whenever I go past a Marks and Spencer!
Put black pepper on sauce, served with little gem lettuce, cucumber, tomato and brown bread.
Definitely an occasional purchase as quite expensive for the portion size. Found the sauce this time had a slight metallic taste which was a bit off putting.
The sauce was very creamy
Really enjoyed these..with salad and some smoked salmon..we bought in flash sake, so good value..small portion, so expensive at full price..
I buy these every week, really lovely
I love fevertree mixers, and I love this light version as less sugar. Yay
I absolutely love this tonic. I love a good G&T and this goes down a treat, super refreshing and no weird ingredients. Good size glass bottle - makes two good G&Ts.
Not too overpowering

Our new favourite mixer for our Gin and Tonics. It definitely makes the Gin delightful to drink. Trying other flavours but they all contain too much sugar. This is the lightest as far as sugar content.
I am a diabetic type 2 and was recommended this by my diabetic nurse. It tastes natural and not too sweet and it isn't too fizzy. I love the fact its in a glass bottle too
This low sugar tonic has a crisp, clean taste with no artificial notes. Other brands cannot compare. Pricey but worth it
I love fevertree mixers, and I love this light version as less sugar. Yay
I absolutely love this tonic. I love a good G&T and this goes down a treat, super refreshing and no weird ingredients. Good size glass bottle - makes two good G&Ts.
Not too overpowering

Our new favourite mixer for our Gin and Tonics. It definitely makes the Gin delightful to drink. Trying other flavours but they all contain too much sugar. This is the lightest as far as sugar content.
I am a diabetic type 2 and was recommended this by my diabetic nurse. It tastes natural and not too sweet and it isn't too fizzy. I love the fact its in a glass bottle too
This low sugar tonic has a crisp, clean taste with no artificial notes. Other brands cannot compare. Pricey but worth it
Makes the G&T...!
this stuff is so good - no nasties and not packed with sugar like most. I drink it on its own.
simply the  best tonic to go with gin or vodka - no nasty after tastes...
Best tonic on the market in my opinion.Great mixer..

I actually prefer this to the 'full fat' fever tree tonic, it's so crisp and doesn't have a horrible sweetener taste to it. It has such a natural flavour, not too bitter. I just wish ocado always had it in stock.
Love this. It's naturally low in sugar without all the horrible artificial sweeteners.

This tonic doesn't taste like others light ones.
No horrible aftertastes, it works great in G&T.
Great with or without the gin and far nicer than the traditional brand!  The one with elderflower is lovely as well.
A great tasting tonic - makes the perfect G&T
No aspartame, the chemical killer in this tonic, such a great flavour and lower in calories and not  sweet tasting like Schweppes.
I brought this to try something new and it has totally changed the taste of my gun and tonics for the better. I would do not use anything else now.
Usually have Schweppes Slimline tonic, this was not as good.
Fewer calories, no artificial sweetener, tastes great! Only tonic water I would consider buying now.

There is no better tonic water for Gin, this is virtually flavourless so you can taste the flavours of your Gin. 
I originally tried this to pair with St. George's Terroir Gin and now I can drink no other tonic, they are all too sweet with a weird aftertaste that you just do not get from Fever Tree.

...and only 3g/100 sugar. Yes, it's a bit expensive. But why in heaven's name is fever tree the only manufacturer who makes a decent, healthier tonic water? I've been using this as an experiment for the past month and have really got hooked on its drier, cleaner taste. Splendid! Just a pity about the price.

So refreshing, love that it is low in sugar and pretty much the same calories as coconut water. It's got a really well composed flavour - you don't even need the gin. I don't mix it with anything. Wish it was cheaper; would have it every day!
Delicious, not too sweet, no nasties. We normally get 8 bottles of this just for two of us every week!
Tastes good and doesn't contain sweeteners, my favourite tonic water by a long way.

Lacked flavour and was very disappointing. Bought it after reading a review of the product in a newspaper. Tried a couple of bottles but have to say I prefer The established brand - schs you know who!

I hate the cloying taste of artificial sweeteners in supermarket and branded tonic waters. This one tastes fresh and natural. I don't understand why other manufacturers put so many artificial additives in their products - Fever Tree demonstrates you just don't need them. Please get this back in stock soon so I can have my G&T again!

After trying this, you will never go back to other tonic waters. It's less sweet and doesn't overpower the drink. It's great with gin, and I also like it with dry vermouth to make a long drink. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but why spoil good gin with anything less? It's also more healthy as it is lower in calories as it contains fructose and no horrible artificial sweeteners.
glass bottle and no nasty sweeteners - go out of my way to get this - as it is better than any other
Delicious and low in calories. Recommended.
Brilliant tonic water. Have already recommended it to loads of people. I'm only worried they'll stop making it, because I don't think I could face going back to the other brands after trying this.
No other tonic water comes near. In particular, this makes the one with the yellow label (Ssshhh! You know which one...) taste like chemical soup.

whoever would have thought that someone could come up with a better mixer than............well they have! Really refreshing - the light variety has no 'aftertaste' and is perfect with ice and a slice with or without the requisite gin!
for supermarket bread

Love this bread but every week it always has a short use by date, so much so that we have to put half in the freezer as it doesn't last, Our local supermarket has just started stocking this bread and I noticed it is not only cheaper but has a longer use by date.
My husband is a daily toast eater and this fits in the slot well and makes decent toast. The loaf also keeps well. I prefer unscliced , fresh bread and find this a bit under whelming.
Thankfully I got this in a flash sale, otherwise I'd be a bit miffed. Didn't find it any different from other wholemeal loaves.

I have enjoyed Allinson's wholemeal bread for over 30yrs.
The fine, rustic soft and malty quality of their bread is the closest you will get to home-made, Without a doubt.

Over the years, the delicious taste and texture have never faltered.
A weekly must-buy for me. 
Only Hovis's offering comes a fairly distant second. 

Having tried various other brands over time, it has to be Allinson every time.

Highly recommended.
Allinson's has been our wholemeal loaf of choice for years now. Unless you're undone by a short date it's consistently very good supermarket bread.
for supermarket bread

Love this bread but every week it always has a short use by date, so much so that we have to put half in the freezer as it doesn't last, Our local supermarket has just started stocking this bread and I noticed it is not only cheaper but has a longer use by date.
My husband is a daily toast eater and this fits in the slot well and makes decent toast. The loaf also keeps well. I prefer unscliced , fresh bread and find this a bit under whelming.
Thankfully I got this in a flash sale, otherwise I'd be a bit miffed. Didn't find it any different from other wholemeal loaves.

I have enjoyed Allinson's wholemeal bread for over 30yrs.
The fine, rustic soft and malty quality of their bread is the closest you will get to home-made, Without a doubt.

Over the years, the delicious taste and texture have never faltered.
A weekly must-buy for me. 
Only Hovis's offering comes a fairly distant second. 

Having tried various other brands over time, it has to be Allinson every time.

Highly recommended.
Allinson's has been our wholemeal loaf of choice for years now. Unless you're undone by a short date it's consistently very good supermarket bread.
The bread is lovely, but there's little point in ordering a weekly shop for a loaf of bread to go off in two days. It will normally have mould by the expiration date. Much prefer burgen linseed loaf
Bought when on offer. Surprisingly soft and flavoursome- a regular now

I really wanted to like this bread but I found it doughy and rather bland. It didn't taste good with peanut butter or other spreads. It tasted better toasted and I was then able to eat it with houmous. I much prefer Vogel bread and wouldn't buy this again.
Often on offer, this loaf is yummy and good value! Toasts really well crispy on the outside and lush on the inside, butter soaks in really well. Lovely flavour and a regular order!
Our favourite is waitrose multigrain but we settle for this without too many complaints. Its tasty enough that thd kids will eat it without too much fuss

This is lovely bread - thick slices and the packaging makes it easy to reseal which I appreciate. It came with about five days' date, which is good. However, its a bit smaller than a full size load so do be aware of that - they're not hiding this fact, the weight is 650g rather than the usual 800g, but it does definitely look a bit small if you're expecting a full loaf. We find that, because the slices are thick, it still makes great filling sandwiches despite the reduced size. I would buy this again.
I like it.
Wether its for toast in the morning or a sandwich during the day, this a nice tasting soft but firm textured bread.

Im getting so annoyed by the quality of Ocado products when they arrive, particularly in the warmer weather. And the use by dates are getting shorter and shorter. This product was mouldy even though it was still in date, and I suspect there is something going wrong with the supply chain. So disappointing and a real shame because this bread is lovely.
Am sure these loaves used to be larger, was shocked at how small they are now. Still tasty, make the best toast.
This bread is really good but I found after about 6 days or so it starts to go mouldy. Its really good up until then.
I used to buy this a lot for my kids as it is wholemeal,  but disappointingly it contains sugar so I have stopped buying it. Disappointing
This is probably the best wholemeal I've tasted. It is lovely for sandwiches and great for toasting.

I love this bread!
This is the best whole meal bread that I have ever tasted!

Lovely fir sandwiches and toasts well!

Got this on flash sale, and honestly I’ve not had a wholemeal I’d describe as bitter before.  It’s not like rye bread, or sourdough, maybe it has too much malt in it?  Don’t really like the flavour, although the bread itself has good texture and toasts well.
this is my partners favourite bread. not too strong a wholemeal flavour which can be overpowering in some brands
Came as a substitution. Wow, really delicious, thick slices of tasty wholemeal. Have ordered again.
So glad Ocado stock this. So soft and fluffy even if left for a few days. High recommend!
Tastes as bread should. Great texture, not doughy and makes lovely sandwiches and toast
Lovely flavour, quality bread.  Ordered weekly and never disappoints.
This bread has been my favourite fro years now. It’s really soft and tasty yet the slices hold together when you butter them

This is tasty, fresh tasting bread which makes a change from the usual supermarket sliced bread. Ive always found the shelf life really good (so far). Its slightly smaller than other loaves which suits me fine. Good for toast or sandwiches.
Didn't think I'd like this but it's surprisingly quite tasty and would buy again.
This bread is absolutely the most like ‘real’ bread (for commercial bread), texture is fab, few ingredients
This is my favourite bread, so tasty, lovely texture and stores well.
Tasty and durable.
Good tasting wholemeal bread
Great tasting. However, smaller than others so doesn't last as long.  But, this is now my favourite.
The best sliced wholemeal on Ocado.  It actually does taste of wholemeal bread.  And probably the cheapest too.
Gorgeous bread, really tasty. Thick, lovely toasted too.
Fewer ingredients than other bread available (less artificial). The expiration date is sooner due to its freshness.  Will be buying more.

I’ve bought this a few times & really like it but couldn’t work out why it went so fast & then realised that it’s a 650g loaf rather than a full size 800g one. So if you’re looking for an in between sized loaf it’s a good option but doesn’t last quite long enough if you’re used to a full sized one.
Every time this has a use by date of the next day. I would never pick bread with such a short life in store. A pity as it is really nice,but a bit thick.

Twice within the last fortnight Ocado have delivered this bread with a use-by date of the following day. The first time they apologised, saying 'we didn't get it right this time'. Well, to repeat this so soon is indictive of a poor stock management system and disdain for their customers by not actually doing anything about this. At this difficult time when many of us who self-isolate are dependent on a weekly delivery, this is exceedingly unhelpful. Ocado - please step up to the mark and actually do something about this.
Love this, tastes like a baker's loaf
Lovely quality for a sliced loaf
Great bread, regular in our house
very tasty
But seriously what is the point of bread with one days shelf life? Had it delivered at 10am one day and stale by the next.

Tasty, a great size for someone on their own, and it freezes perfectly. But the best thing about it is the contents - it has the lowest proportions of fat and carbs, and the highest of protein, that Ive found in normal bread. So its a perfect way to feel a little less guilty about eating bread.
Perfect thickness - really good.

Good thick slices for sandwiches or toast, it is a little drier than some pre-sliced bread but not in a bad way. It freezes well, I tend to freeze half of the loaf straight away in resealable bags of two slices as this loaf often arrives with only a days best before date. Easy enough to take out a small freezer bag and defrost two slices inside 5/10 mins. This bread has a good flavour. I also like the size being slightly smaller than the usual 800g loaves, the perfect weekly size for me.

I got this bread as I fancied a change, I chose it on the food reviews!
Wow was I disappointed! The bread tasted stale and dry and had the most horrid dense texture. Will not be buying again.
Recommend. Lovely taste and texture.
Of this kind of bread. Great staple for the freezer. Actually tastes of something.

I really love this bread. Great texture and in my opinion it's the best wholemeal bread on the market. So as a product it receives 5 stars. 
What I do find strangely confusing is Ocado can only offer a few days life and this has always been the case when I order it. My confusion comes when I purchase the same loaf elsewhere I get 4-5 days life.

Really good flavour, good texture. I liked the resealable packaging and liked it even more for being recyclable. I prefer thinner slices but that's just personal preference, not criticism.
It's only 650g whereas most large loaves are 800g. This could be a disadvantage for a large family but might be an advantage for a small one. It means, though, that the bread's comparatively expensive. I reckon it's worth it.

I always buy this bread for years now,  but now moving to another brand as the manufacturers have changed the packaging which I don't like and also the size of the loaf which now doesn't last as long.  The old packaging was better and kept the bread fresher.  So goodbye to Allinson's bread with regret.
husband complained it was hard to eat his sandwiches, very dry despite the filling. Plus bread arrived with just 1 say to consume. Perhaps this was why, it was already past its best?
My 2 year old loves this toasted and I love this bread too!
Lovely, thick cut tasty sliced bread. Makes great toast - is a little on the thick side for me personally for sandwiches but I mainly use it for toast so happy days!!

We decided to swap from our good quality white bread to this wholemeal.  Even my son who avoids all healthy alternatives really loves this bread.  It keeps and freezes very well. We think it is delicious!
Really impressed by this loaf. Lovely taste and texture and kept fresh too
Really impressed with this. Kept well and tasted great.
I decided to give this one a go since the reviews are so positive, but was a little disappointed. Taste is just average and the loaf had a very dark and too thick crust. Won't be buying again!
This is excellent bread which actually has some taste, and a pleasant one at that.
By far one of the better sliced loaves I've had.  Quite tasty.

One of the few loaves that actually tastes like bread and isnt too wet or sugary. And it doesnt rip when you spread butter on it. I had no idea it wasnt supposed to be frozen. Many of mine have been in the freezer and left to defrost overnight and have been absolutely fine.

Shame it arrived on the 29th and best before date was the 30th. When I bought this from a different supplier I had 4 days life on it.It is only the length of shelf life that loses it the 5th star. The bread itself is really good,  like mother used to make, and a nice thickness for toast.
However I did contact Allinson's about the "Do not freeze" part.  It appears that the bread is fine to freeze, but the wrapping isn't, so If you want to freeze the entire loaf you need to transfer it to a proper freezing bag.
This is just cut too thick for me, but it does taste nice. As a sandwich its a beast! But nice as toast.
Tastes great and keeps well.   Established fave in our house.   Smaller than normal loaves - not a value option

Allinsons used to make a great  tasting brown with added Bran loaf and I still hanker for it. This is the nearest to it and it's delicious.  The seeded loaf is also nice, just a tiny shame that these loaves are smaller than most at 650grams.
Very good option for sliced bread and I find it lives beyond its best before date.

I bought this bread for the first time last week and put it in my freezer before reading the storage info, but I have to say that I removed it from the freezer overnight and toasted a couple of slices this morning and it was just as fresh as it was when purchased. Beautiful flavour and will be my 1st choice wholemeal now .....

I want to like this bread BUT it has a sweet taste which I neither want nor expect from my loaf. Please remove the sugar so that we can enjoy a proper savoury sandwich. I like cake and I like bread one is meant to be sweet and one isn't.

Allinson recently made their loaves smaller with shrinkflation like many others.  This now makes this a very expensive loaf but we have always bought it because it tastes so good, even though we only use it for our morning toast.  However, they have now also changed the packaging and the last two loaves I bought had a large doorstep of a crust at either end which makes this bread even more expensive.  I need to buy a new wider slot toaster and a different brand of wholemeal bread.
Love love this bread, but the packaging has been changed. My bread packaging delivered today was split  looked like someones fingers had gone through it
Bought this when on offer to try it out and will now consider it every time. Good fresh and toasted, and lasts a good while too.
Thick slices - just the way we like it. Lovely taste.

I will not be buying this again as it now contains Palm Fat.
I used to really like it.
I am fed up that the food industry is using so much palm oil there only seems to be morrisons sliced bread that doesnt
This is just personal preference but the bread is thick sliced. It is too filling for childrens sandwiches, otherwise its ok but not great
very nice bread but 35p cheaper at tesco

I have tried all types of bread. Love, love, love this.  Not heavy nor light.  Just right for sandwiches, toast et all. Love it.  From all breads tasted, this is the best to date.  No cardboard, artificial, sugar, salt after taste.  I hope Ocado continue to stock.  Also could you please let me know about aubergine curry
Lovely bread very tasty, smaller than usual size.
Really appreciate this. Thanks Ocado
Nice and moist, not too dry as some brown bread can be. Slices are a little thick, just means if you are making sandwiches you just need to make sure you have a decent amount of filling.
a really nice wholemeal loaf,great for sandwiches
Just had this as toast - admittedly it's a few days since it was delivered - and it had a really horrible spongy texture. Almost couldn't eat it - and I'm not a fussy eater.
I usually buy the Waitrose organic bread but this has been out of stock for such a long time I've been trying lots of other breads. This one is a new favourite
This was the 1st wholemeal bread the whole family enjoyed with out complaint. Nice and thick and moist slices. Did not feel like you're eating dry dust as other wholemeal bread often taste like.
think we don't notice!
Have tried many bread brands, this one went mouldy the quickest - within 3 days. Bought this once before, never again I'm afraid.
Nice flavour.
Not my usual brand.. it didn't disappoint though. It tasted fresh and made lovely sandwiches and tasted good toasted too. It stayed fresh for several days too.
A fantastic loaf of bread. Beautifully thick slices. Although slightly expensive for what it is.

I love this wholemeal bread! Other wholemeal breads are much heavier and do not have the fantastic taste this bread has.  I was SO pleasantly surprised as I was looking for a wholemeal that didn't have the customary denseness and lack of flavour and just by chance 
thought I'd give this one a go.  Great, will stick with this now. Recommended it to my family already!!!

Received this to try and found it to be a good loaf, nice soft bread, fairly thick slices. Being wholemeal it is slightly heavy and makes fairly dense sandwiches, we preferred it for toast. Nice enough but not going to tempt us away from the bread maker.
Tried this on offer instead of my usual brand. Very impressed. Tasted like real bread, but with the benefit of being sliced.
Not dry like some other wholemeal bread - and really delicious when toasted
Soft tasty whole meal bread. Yum!
We were given this to review and we thoroughly enjoyed this bread. Good for sandwiches and perfect to fit in the toaster. Kept well and tasted delicious.
Soft enough for sandwiches, also makes good toast.  Really tasty and stayed soft for a long time too.
Thought I would try something new and this is a really tasty brown bread. Lovely thick slices which make great sandwiches - we are now converted!

Perfect wholemeal bread. 
Its not dry and not hard like many bread with wholesome ingredients. 
Its not my everyday bread, but would buy again.
This tastes how bread should taste. It toasts well my only gripe is it tends to be a bit chewy and claggy when not toasted. The slices are nice and thick. It's great for dipping in soft boiled eggs.

I tried this first when it came on offer and have bought it every week since. We don't eat very much bread but this keeps really well, a full week even longer!
Nice texture fresh or toasted.

I usually buy another brand but as ocado had sold out I thought I'd try this. 
it's really nice and so much better than all of the other breads.
it tastes lovely and toaster well and doesn't leave you feeling hungry other like you've eaten a brick.
It is like an old fashioned home made bread.
Great texture, it was evem commented on when I took sandwiches to a picnic
Nice, soft, tasty bread. Took a long time to toast, I guess because it's thick, but I don't mind soft toast. No complaints from my 18 month old either!
Delicious bread with a hint of honey. My three year old loved it too! Tasty bread.
Delicious!

Lovely, soft and wholesome. I really like this bread and so does my 15 month old. The crusts are soft too despite it being a wholesome brown loaf. Usually I get "real" bread from our local farm bakery to avoid the nasties but when I don't get that this is my go-to bread. It's great.
Admittedly sounds like a review for a mattress but it's a good firm slice of bread for toast and sarnies, but surprisingly soft at the same time!
Very soft loaf, great in sandwiches as well as toasted.
I bought this just for a change & was really surprised at how good it is. It has a nice springy texture & is very tasty.
Got this free to review. Lovely thick soft bread. My almost three year ate it too!
We were sent this as a free sample and it was loved by every member of the family. Best bread we've had in ages and will definitely buy weekly
All the family like this which is a plus.  Even texture and not dry.  Didn't fall apart when buttering it either.
I'm not a big fan of wholemeal because it's a bit dry but this was very good. I put it in the freezer and toasted it from frozen and it's perfect.
Lovely tasty bread lasted well, would buy again
Not mindblowing but pretty good.
First time try this bread, it's so nice and soft, would recommend!
Lovely wholemeal bread. The best by a mile. I highly recommend it.
This bread makes a good sandwich, toasts well and freezes well. A large loaf is too much from me when the man is of the Atkins diet so being able to freeze part loaf is useful
Love this toasted or for a nice fresh salad sandwich. Feels full of goodness but not boring!
We really liked this loaf.  We're not normally fans of wholemeal bread as they tend to be dry.  This was an exception. Robust flavour and nice and soft
Has a nice yeasty, malty aroma and good texture - just like home made.
Tasty bread but slices are quite fragile, with crusts falling off on some of them.  Probably wouldn't choose to buy again as much better wholemeal loaves out there.
Really nice taste but gave 4 stars because loaf smaller than usual loaf and more expensive.
This is a tasty bread but the slices were thicker than what I like. My family enjoyed.
A decent loaf that worked for toast and sandwiches.
Nice and soft for sandwiches
Good flavour, soft and keeps for quite a while.
Nice bread, better toasted
Excellent sliced bread. Tasty as a sandwich - stays whole and doesn't break up too easily. Toasts evenly and is a good texture.   Will buy again.
Makes ashy toast that the kids liked. Less keen as plain bread. Has a slight eye taste that I like.
I was surprised at how soft the bread was - but it held up really well in the toaster and eaten as it was. very tasty.
lovely fresh bread. great for sandwiches and toast. good flavour .
This bread tasted good and toasted well.
This was a really nice loaf - very fresh, even the kids wanted it!
This is really tasty and tastes good for you. Kids love it too
would order again, tried to order again but out of stock, maybe next week. kept fresh for a few days soft and green toast. Received for review from Ocado.
I prefer a smaller loaf - I tend to find they stay fresher. nice when toasted as still tastes like bread and doesn't morph to cardboard like so many other brands.
Great bread with a nice fresh taste - would recommend this!

The loaf arrived crushed and never regained its shape. I don't think this would have ever been possible as it was really rather too moist. It was strangely sweet and made awful sandwiches and when toasted it wasn't great. In summary there are much nicer wholemeal loaves available and I wouldn't get this again.

Stayed fresh for a few days, tasted nice and good for sandwiches and toast. However be aware that the loaf is slightly smaller in size than the standard 800g loaves. Somewhere between the small 400g loaves and the standard ones.
Very fresh loaf and stayed nice for a few days after opening and didn't dry out. Made fantastic toast crusty on the outside and soft inside.
I liked this bread - it's very light and has a nice taste and texture. It toasts very well and makes a nice sandwich.
A good wholemeal bread with a lot of flavour and texture for a sliced loaf.

I always used to buy this bread in its heavier 800g form at £1. The bread itself is very good and unique for its taste and texture. However, the 800g version disappeared a while ago and has recently been replaced with a repackaged, 650g version of its former self, with a price increase to boot. A patronising affair that will ultimately lead to me going elsewhere for my weekly loaf. I am not against price increases, in a logically presented, honest and fair manner. But this is smoke and mirrors from a brand I once trusted.
This bread is good but not amazing. It tastes too sweet. I prefer the Duchy equivalent over this, will not be buying it again.
By some margin, the very best wholemeal bread for sale at Ocado. Stays fresh longest due to good wrapper, superb quality and texture bread, nice chunky slices, usually superb value...
Have no idea why these have had negative reviews. Not particularly nutty, agreed, but chocolatey and delicious.
Wow, these are surprisingly great.. light, fluffy, chocolatey and animal free. A regular from now on.
loved it and definitely buying again! The texture is so good, feels like a proper dessert
These are one of my favourite vegan mousses! They are really chocolatey and from the taste you would not know they are vegan. My only criticism is that they are a bit sloppy.
Never seen a nut, just awful.

Lovely dessert! Rich, chocolatey   and plenty in a pot. Wouldn't know it was Vegan. I bought it as I'm reducing dairy and am also gluten-free. Would be even happier if they eliminated refined sugar and used eg coconut sugar. Would buy again.
Have no idea why these have had negative reviews. Not particularly nutty, agreed, but chocolatey and delicious.
Wow, these are surprisingly great.. light, fluffy, chocolatey and animal free. A regular from now on.
loved it and definitely buying again! The texture is so good, feels like a proper dessert
These are one of my favourite vegan mousses! They are really chocolatey and from the taste you would not know they are vegan. My only criticism is that they are a bit sloppy.
Never seen a nut, just awful.

Lovely dessert! Rich, chocolatey   and plenty in a pot. Wouldn't know it was Vegan. I bought it as I'm reducing dairy and am also gluten-free. Would be even happier if they eliminated refined sugar and used eg coconut sugar. Would buy again.
This was delivered as a substitute to an out of stock item. It had a strange texture, accompanied by a very strange taste, would definitely not recommend.

Texture, flavour, quality and quantity - just right!  The temperature is down to you Dont leave in the fridge but pull out to acclimatise at least half an hour hour before consuming!
Can only otherwise explain the poor reviews as temporary loss of taste and smell : symptoms of Covid? !
This is ok, had a nice texture to it, but lacks in flavour.
This is a much nicer pate than the Brussels version. This is smooth and tasty and without the medicinal taste of their Brussels pate. this is worth a try. it also freezes.
Hard to believe that you can make a pate that tastes of nothing!
This is a great Pate either on toast or crispbread

Hard to believe that you can make a pate that tastes of nothing!
This is a great Pate either on toast or crispbread
Tasteless
This pate was not very nice. Waitrose pate is far superior. Can’t say what it was we didn’t like. Just underwhelmed
Although a little more pricey than some pates out there I really love this one. Really tasty
Tried for the first time and found very tasty.
Awful. Cheap and awful. Maybe got a bad tub. Thank goodness for findlaters but it's so expensive
We really like this pate. If you don't like smooth tasty pate, then don't buy this! I am so pleased that I was not put off by some of the previous reviews. I will be ordering this weekly.
Was looking for a replacement for the excellent and reasonably priced Waitrose Brussels pate, this isnt it. Strong liver taste, did not go down well in our house at all.
Too much garlic- not a patch on usual Waitrose purchase.
It is smooth, but I am not overwhelmed by the taste. Lacks something.
This beats any other pate I’ve had
OK texture, but a slightly fishy after taste - would not buy it again. Fine as sandwich filling, but not on crackers
This paté is OK, but compared to the Waitrose equivalent we used to get, it's got a sweeter taste and isn't as buttery. I think it's slightly blander. Preferred the old one.
Will be buying this very regularly from now on. Savoury, garlicky, and perfect with crackers or melba toast.  My new favourite.

Bought on offer aand arrived with less life than promised.
Tasty but very difficult to handle as it is unleaved.
Wouldn't bother again even on offer
Delighted with this charcuterie, delivered this morning and eaten for lunch.  Definitely buying again.
Very nice texture with good nuttiness. Cut nicely too.
Worth it's price, on another level !
Tasty, moist, rich but not fatty - really you need a packet each....

I know people may roll their eyes at this review as I've never had jambon before (plenty of other types of cured ham though) but i found this product overly moist and fatty, dare i say slimy? It honestly made me a bit nauseous as it had an uncooked quality combined with a really salty flavour honestly don't think i can finish it and so disappointed for the price. Also why on earth does it say wash before using in the preparation instructions? I didn't do that, should i have done that? It seems wrong. I really hated this but I'll never know if this is a bad batch, a bad product or if this is how jambon is supposed to be. If it's normal then disregard my review but if you haven't tried it and this sounds off-putting then maybe avoid.

Bought on offer aand arrived with less life than promised.
Tasty but very difficult to handle as it is unleaved.
Wouldn't bother again even on offer
Delighted with this charcuterie, delivered this morning and eaten for lunch.  Definitely buying again.
Very nice texture with good nuttiness. Cut nicely too.
Worth it's price, on another level !
Tasty, moist, rich but not fatty - really you need a packet each....

Its sweet, not overly salty and the cuts are nice and thin. Like butter melts in he mouth,  its simply so yummy. Got this in deal and would definitely buy again at full price. Well worth it.
Got this on a deal but certainly worth its original price, very tasty, better than expected
why to use chemical preservatives? I'll just stick to San Daniele which is made just with natural sea salt and nothing else!

Bought in flash sale. Forgot about it. Hubby had with some crusty bread a day or two after the best before. Oops. 
Said it was very good though so clearly it states fresh for long.

This is really lovely ham, tastes very authentic. 
Fabulous for starter or supper! 
Try this!
this has to be best dried ham ever. melts in the mouth.
Really enjoyed this. Well packed, tasty.
Easily the best product I've had from here. Would buy again.
Intense flavour, perfect and on offer - couldn't be better!
There is nothing I could find fault with. It's delicious
Despite its saltiness, this is truly delicious. Very intense flavour and a nice texture. The strips are very thin.
Really tasty.
Absolutely delicious! This one is not to be missed. Awesome flavour.
The best in the natoora range. Much better than San Daniele and Laghirano! Please put it back on offer!!!!

OMG this is just divine, if you love air dried hams you will really adore this one, tender, sweet, melts on your tongue, terribly moreish... one packet feeds one greedy person and you will never be impressed with serrano or parma again.  This is the one!
One of my favourite lunch meats -- on well-buttered sourdough French bread.
Hardly any fat. Really good flavour. I had it both cold and grilled. If you grill it goes quite crispy. Very thinly sliced.
Lovely flavour and texture  - much prefer to proscuitto or parma ham.
Good flavour but the quite ragged end pieces were almost too dried out and tough to eat. A shame as the Natoora salamis are especially delicious.
Tried this and could not stop eating it.  Such a lovely flavour and texture to this wonderful meat.  Great to snack on, as Tapas, starter, pretty much anything....
Lovely - worth the extra
Urgh yuck horrible and dry. Unfortunately I had to buy these as theres no normal ones. If like me you just want blueberry muffins dont bother with these.
Synthetic flavour. Utterly grim. Another sad coeliac find. Dry too.

When I was first introduced to M&S GF range they had Blueberry Muffins which came in a pack of 2.

They were by far the best GF Muffins on the market. 

I was very disappointed when they were discontinued and replaced by these synthetic tasting ones.

A few years ago, they did these in a pack of two and they were the best commercially made, gluten free cake I’d eaten. Then they revamped the gluten free range. They are now synthetic and grim. Not befitting the M&S brand.
These muffins are amazing. They were sent as a substitute but they will be a regular on my shopping list.  Light in texture not too sweet. They went perfect with a cup of tea.
Makes a lovely afternoon treat with a cuppa, nice and soft and great taste.
Urgh yuck horrible and dry. Unfortunately I had to buy these as theres no normal ones. If like me you just want blueberry muffins dont bother with these.
Synthetic flavour. Utterly grim. Another sad coeliac find. Dry too.

They were by far the best GF Muffins on the market.

These muffins are amazing. They were sent as a substitute but they will be a regular on my shopping list.  Light in texture not too sweet. They went perfect with a cup of tea.
Makes a lovely afternoon treat with a cuppa, nice and soft and great taste.
This bread did not live up to it's cost. It tasted horrible, was rock hard around the edges and undercooked sponge texture inside.

Ive bought this bread for several years, but in recent months it has really declined in quality.
The loaves have been rock hard and often with half the loaf full of air. Making it even more expensive for half a loaf.
Tunnelling on the top half, undercooked mess on the bottom half.

Beautiful, full of goodness, fully packed loaf! I thoroughly enjoy this brown bread as well as charcoal one from this company. One thing -wish it was sliced already. Otherwise texture is fantastic, never underbaked, very earthy and healthy for me. Only eat it toasted, it has a very pleasant middle and crunchy crust done that way. I cut all the bread soon as it arrived and pop into freezer as out of five im only one who eats gluten free. Then I take couple slices at a time and pop in toaster when I need/want them :)

I don’t usually write reviews but I do not recommend. Unfortunately it was so dry and dense. There was a huge air pocket/hole between the crust and the actual dough. Waste of money and no flavour at all!
rock hard, massive hole, dont bother.
This bread did not live up to it's cost. It tasted horrible, was rock hard around the edges and undercooked sponge texture inside.

The loaves have been rock hard and often with half the loaf full of air. Making it even more expensive for half a loaf.

I don’t usually write reviews but I do not recommend. Unfortunately it was so dry and dense. There was a huge air pocket/hole between the crust and the actual dough. Waste of money and no flavour at all!
rock hard, massive hole, dont bother.

Upon receiving I pop it into the freezer and toast each time I want it. Some reviews say the crust is too hard, it doesn't bother me, but if it does just cut it off? It's so healthy and delicious I don't see how that would be a big deal. Definitely the best GF bread I ever had, can't wait to try others by the same brand.
Thinly sliced and toasted this is probably the best of the gluten-free breads, I was delighted to discover. Untoasted, though, it’s like eating a sponge. Bit pricey, would buy in a flash sale.
this bread is the best GF bread I've tried. once toasted is the perfect combination of crunchiness outside and softness inside. I don't know what I'd do without it!!

I had a slice when it arrived and it was nice. I sliced and froze the rest and toasted it when needed but it tastes so awful I won’t ever buy it again. Usually GF bread is best when toasted but this turned into a dry and stale tasting disaster.

So 2 out of 3 of our family have coeliac disease, so need to avoid gluten. I am lucky enough not to have that - but we keep a GF house. Finally we have found this bread which is tasty and organic, no nasty stuff - which ALL of us LOVE. We use it for toast, most mornings - (mmm, toast) and it makes fantastic toast. With just butter (mmm butter) or anything you fancy. It freezes well too. We sometimes slice it up and freeze it, and you can just toast a frozen slice whenever the need strikes... so good. Recommended.

Sadly I was not able to eat this loaf as it arrived in an unsealed and open bag. I have no idea who had handled this loaf in the delivery chain, and I am not prepared to take the risk for hygiene and Covid reasons.

I love this bread and order one loaf a week. I only eat it toasted and it takes longer to toast than traditional bread, but it is absolutely delicious and would recommend and have recommended to others on a GF diet. Definitely a 5 star product :-)

Eating this loaf was like travelling back in time when gluten free bread was more like a solid cake than a loaf. That would be OK if the dough didn't become gluey and sticky as you chew it.  I'm afraid we had to throw it away as feeding it the birds would have been cruel.
So yummy!

This is the best gluten free bread to date - makes the most yummy crunchy toast perfect with every kind of topping ! We love it as a weekend treat :) no awful preservatives or sugars either - regular buy for us! Keep stocking this please Ocado :)
I slice it on arrival, freeze it and toast it when needed. Yes it is pricier, but its worth it for me as it tastes wholesome, moreish and has no chemicals in.
I love this bread, my regular. Can't fault it.Just the price is an issue

I love this bread and order one loaf a week. I only eat it toasted and it takes longer to toast than traditional bread, but it is absolutely delicious and would recommend and have recommended to others on a GF diet. Definitely a 5 star product :-)

Eating this loaf was like travelling back in time when gluten free bread was more like a solid cake than a loaf. That would be OK if the dough didn't become gluey and sticky as you chew it.  I'm afraid we had to throw it away as feeding it the birds would have been cruel.
So yummy!

This is the best gluten free bread to date - makes the most yummy crunchy toast perfect with every kind of topping ! We love it as a weekend treat :) no awful preservatives or sugars either - regular buy for us! Keep stocking this please Ocado :)
I slice it on arrival, freeze it and toast it when needed. Yes it is pricier, but its worth it for me as it tastes wholesome, moreish and has no chemicals in.
I love this bread, my regular. Can't fault it.Just the price is an issue

It needs to be thinly sliced and then toasted.
OCADO PLEAE CAN YOU GET IT BACK IN STOCK

This is one of the best GF bread that I have tried. 
It is a shame it is often unavailable as I cannot substitute it with any other bread sold from Ocado as they all contain sugar and other not very healthy ingredients.
This was as solid and heavy as a brick. Insipid looking. Could barely slice it as so hard (Despite being in date). Had a couple of mouthfuls was so hard to swallow. Went straight  in the bin
Really disappointing, the loaf was like a brick. I tried slicing it anyway but it was inedible. The crust around the edges was so thick and hard.
This is nice but never in stock so it's pointless ordering. What is really annoying is that they let you know at short notice when it's too late to cancel the order.

When I first bought it for my husband,  he wasn't to keen on it until he toasted it! OH MY GOD! This toasted will beat any taste of any gluten or gluten free bread you have ever tried! Just toast it, trust me! You shall be amazed!
I sliced and tried this on the day I bought it. It has little smell, is hard, dry and tasteless. The crust had an almost greasy texture. I wont be buying again!

I was so excited to find a loaf of bread with no hidden sugars, no gluten and a recipe list I could understand. This was my last ditch attempt to but before trying to work out how to make it myself...looks like Ill be getting into baking. Its so dry & hard...maybe good for a bread & butter pudding? Expensive though especially given how small it is, less than half the size of a regular loaf.

This bread was on offer so I thought Id give it a go. Initial impression was very hard. I sliced it up to go in the freezer for toasting. It tasted good, but squeaked against my teeth. Would recommend but would only buy again if it was cheaper.
Rock solid, tasteless, no colour, didnt toast well, awful taste...

I bought this to try as it's appears to be low FODMAP and doesn't contain all the additives that gluten-free breads normally do. It tasted OK when toasted with butter - and slightly better with peanut butter. However, spelt sourdough is much tastier as a low FODMAP option and is 'real bread', so I will be sticking with that! Having said that, if someone could only eat gluten-free bread, I would suggest they try this.
This makes the best gf toast Ive had.
stale....hard... small ..gross

If you like dense, 100% rye bread, then you'll like this. If, however, you're expecting a soft fresh loaf, like other gluten free brown breads on offer, then you'll be sorely disappointed, as was I. I thought it would be much larger, because the weight is comparable to the other above mentioned loaves, but it is small and dense. On the plus side, I wouldn't know if it went stale, because it's already hard & dry.
Sent as a substitute for beautiful ( but out of stock) heart of nature bread. Not even similar. Brick like, cardboard like. Disgusting.
The whole family really enjoyed this toasted. Great to find a gluten free bread that is also organic and tasty
Otherwise go for something better. Having said that, it wasn't completely unpleasant.

Completely agree with the others, eating this as bread isn't great cold. But put it in the toaster for longer than you would normal bread, then spread something on top, and hey presto its quite simply delicious and very moorish. Once I discovered this, I went through a whole loaf in a day.

This was terrible, the loaf was the weight of a stone/brick.  I toasted it (cold is just not an option) and even then I needed to add more butter than was good for me, and it still tasted like sand in your mouth  Cold or hot is simply not an option, there are so many other good tasting GF options on the market now this is most certainly not one of them,
dry and doughy and inedible

But thats the best that can be said for it. Its an unwanted flashback to the gf days of old, when the only options were tasteless bricks that settled in your stomach like a lead balloon. There are so many better options out there now. Dont settle for this one.
any pleasing taste or texture sensations

Ive been eating GF food for 15 years and its got better overall but sadly not this bread. Its lifeless, the texture is tight and somewhat gluey and theres little flavour to speak of. It doesnt colour when toasted and there is nothing brown about it. Its a pale beige colour too - not at all like the photo advertising it. There are better options on the market.

Try eating this as it is and youll enjoy the flavour and texture of a dried out old bath sponge.  Cut it thinly and toast it and it transforms into delicious.  Checked the label and couldnt see any instructions to heat it, but this is absolutely what this bread needs.  As other reviewers have already said, Disgusting cold, divine cooked.  How weird is that?
Just received this and sliced only to find half is taken up by a huge bubble - what a waste
Stale, tasteless bread, if you can call it that. The worst texture I've ever encountered in a vegan baked good. Like trying to eat a kitchen sponge.

Yes this does need to be toasted or grilled but once it is it is actually soft and it doesn't have all the sugar and crap in it that other brands do!! I prefer this so much to the foamy stuff warburtons and schar sell and actually want to eat it. It's not the best gluten free bread out there, you'd have to head to a London bakery for that, but it's certainly the best bread orderable online through all the main supermarket chains. 100% recommend this as a treat once a month.
My husband, son and I all absolutely love this bread. I genuinely think it's the best gf option I have tried, particularly as it doesn't have all the preservatives that normally seem to be included.
Very small loaf and very dense. The bread tastes ok if toasted. Expensive for what you get.
I've just tried their seeded bread .. excellent - also like the brown.
Warm it up to soften...read the label moaners. The best gf loaf and beats most non gf!
Quality ingredients, lovely taste... I cut a couple of thin slices and pop in the toaster for a short while, and voila...great tasting soft, fresh bread! Tastes homemade and a regular buy for me!
Not the best GF bread out there - I could have a bad batch but found it quite dry and hard the day after delivery.

This is the bread we've been eating for the last 4 months, no regrets. Gluten free, vegan, organic. If you heat/toast, it's perfect texture. Most of times, we don't use any spread on it. We buy 3-4 loaf every week, slice them and freeze. During the week, just need to grab some slices and heat at the toaster. Perfect! Very conveniente. Happy that we found it. The only bad point is the price...

A little lacking in flavour but only because I yearn for proper break. I enjoy it though. The texture when toasted is like a proper crumpet so that's pretty cool. Will definitely buy more. 4 stars instead of 5 only because of the price.
Toasting this is a must and then it is delicious. It's the only gluten free bread I can say I truly enjoy. Un-toasted it is hard as a brick very dry.
Pretty solid so best for toasting.  Wasn't quite as brown as I was expecting, but was really lovely with just a little bit of butter...
first of all, it's not brown and it's extremely dry and almost unedible it didn't even get disgested in my stomach I felt really unwell after eating it.

There aren't many gluten free vegan breads around but still this is the best tasting glutenfree bread I have ever had! It's the closest in tasting to regular bread I have found. Will be buying more for my next bready treat!

This is even nicer than our usual sourdough artisan bread. It is tasty, light and moist and toasted it is delicious. We have given up gluten and this is not a deprivation at all. Only  problem is, it doesn't hang around long and I have deducted a star because it is quite small and very expensive so my food bill is going up..

I ate this as it is and thought it was ok, so I sliced it up and put it in the freezer. Just toasted some for breakfast with peanut butter and banana and it's amazing you wouldn't at all think it's gluten free, feels very indulgent!
I wouldn't recommend this to eat as is, but when toasted, it's delicious, especially with almond butter or the pip and nut crunchy maple peanut butter
This bread is better toasted than as sandwiches. But is it the best toast I have eaten in 8 years of a gluten free diet, chewy, tasty and feels like I am actually eating something proper!

I really enjoyed this bread.  I keep it in the freezer and then toast whenever I need it.  It is really delicious.  I tried other brands, but have come back to this one.  
My favourite is to toast a slice straight from the freezer and then make french toast ,with whisked egg all over and cinnamon, fry on little coconut oil and serve with banana and maple syrup.  Yummy!

This bread felt very underbaked. No matter how many times we toasted the slices over and over again felt wet doughy. I suggest them to bake their loaves more even the crust was so light in colour. I had tasted better gluten free bread in the past so would not buy again.
Tastes okay but a bit artificial - will stick to the original version.
Best cherry flavor drink out there. Wish they made a Zero version, even a caffeine free one

I don't really drink juice but Cranberry juice is good for you. I bought this one because it is pure and it is delicious, tart, fairly low in sugar for a juice. Will definitely buy again...expensive but worth it..
Its far too sour to drink on its own and very expensive. Not for me.
so expensive, it should be maximum £3
nice favour, and it is organic
I keep a couple of bottles in the fridge as suffer from kidney infections and UTI... it literally helps settle within a day. Swear by it.  Forget the fake sugar versions!!

I buy this cranberry juice regularly, to add some flavour to my water.  You only need a little bit to dilute with water, as this is very strong and tart.  It's excellent, as it contains no sweeteners, sugars or flavourings added like other brands.  Lower in sugar too!

I don't really drink juice but Cranberry juice is good for you. I bought this one because it is pure and it is delicious, tart, fairly low in sugar for a juice. Will definitely buy again...expensive but worth it..
Its far too sour to drink on its own and very expensive. Not for me.
so expensive, it should be maximum £3
nice favour, and it is organic
I keep a couple of bottles in the fridge as suffer from kidney infections and UTI... it literally helps settle within a day. Swear by it.  Forget the fake sugar versions!!

I buy this cranberry juice regularly, to add some flavour to my water.  You only need a little bit to dilute with water, as this is very strong and tart.  It's excellent, as it contains no sweeteners, sugars or flavourings added like other brands.  Lower in sugar too!
Pure
Delicious and pure
Finally a pure cranberry juice with no added sugar or any other additives or dilutes  - great product!

For the hardcore in our midst, I tip my hat to you. Even diluted three parts water one part cranberry this is still a challenge to get down my gullet. This is where a spoonful of maple syrup helps the medicine go down (I'm sure Mary Poppins wouldn't advocate cane sugar these days). Pokey, but it works.

I have been wanting to buy this drink for a while as I adore cranberry juice but I could not have been disappointed. It is so tart and the small taste that accompanies that is not at all like cranberries. Even my four year old, who has never refused fruit juice before, couldn’t drink it.

Have been having this mixed with water and its not particularly tart. It's quite a nice drink which makes me wonder why some manufacturers feel the need to add sugar to cranberry juice drinks. Sticking to this sugar/sweetner free one!
I guess it's medicine
As it contains no sugar, the juice is very tart. Refreshingly crisp!Good quality pure cranberry juice but needs to be diluted.
I dilute this with 3 or 4 parts water. It's delicious  and crisp. I also think it has helped to ward off cystitis a couple of times - I try to keep a bottle handy in the cupboard
Pricey but recommended by doctor to get rid of cystitis. You can dilute as appropriate

I cannot recommend this highly enough. Pure cranberry juice with no added nasties, wonderful sharp refreshing taste, beautiful colour. Goes well in cocktails, homemade juices/smoothies, orange juice, soda water, or just on its own. Yes it's expensive, but so worth it. I mix it with Ocean Spray Light cranberry juice to make it go further- 1 part Biona to 4 parts Ocean Spray. Brilliant for cystitis too.

This drink is amazing. My mum was having a lot of uti problems, after just 2 days of drinking this shes noticed a huge difference. I bought this after reading the reviews for this and other brands, this was the right choice.

Really delicious and healthful for 'the ladies'. Mixed with water, drank once a day, lasts for 2 weeks. The other cranberry juice brand appears cheaper but drinking it everyday for 2 weeks comes to about the same price as Biona BUT it has very little cranberry in and has an unpleasant taste...probably doesn't do the trick either.
Tastes really nice but could definitely do with a bigger bottle for the price x
As others have said this is wonderful for stemming UTIs. Expensive but well worth the price for what it does.

I'm still laughing at myself for thinking this must be a large bottle for the price. I burst out laughing at my own foolishness when I unpacked my shopping. Sure, it might taste great, but£5.49 for a bottle the size of a can of Coke!
Not sweet. Nor yet sour. Absolutely delicious. Beware as possible to develop a rather wallet busting addiction to this.

I added this last minute to my shopping trolly after realising I was starting with a uti. It was the snow weekend and the chemist and drs were closed early. This help SO much!! It took the painful symptoms away for w days until I could get to the gp. It made such a big difference! It is very expensive for the amount but it has no added junk/sugar which important to me. I mixed it with water which made it last over the weekend.
As others have said great to sort out utis and I havent found another without added ingredients. Expensive but you get what you pay for 100% cranberry - 5 star without a doubt.
This is the only organic 100% cranberry juice I have found. It has a very nice strong tart flavour. I use it watered down instead of cordial.
If you love cranberries, this will work for you.  I've used it for lots of things; cocktails, strawberry jam, livening up fruit juices.  Acerbic in a lovely way.
very tart but added to orange juice the most refreshing drink , totally addictive wake up

This product is natural organic cranberry juice -- no added sugar. May seem pricy but lasts quite a while as only a tiny amount is required to make a drink. After swapping to this, the sweetened juice drinks just taste too sweet and artificial.
Just the ticket. Pure cranberry juice but without the usual ghastly sugar. Refreshing just diluted with water.
If you have ever suffered from UTI's and you've been told to drink cranberry juice, this stuff certainly works, unlike the sugar laden, diluted competition. Also organic, which is a must to me.

Wonderfully sharp unsweetened juice - essential ingredient of a Cosmo - double vodka, single Cointreau, one-and-a-half of unsweetened cranberry juice, single lime juice, shaken, serve with a slice of lime.

Cranberry juice with nothing added. Extremely tart - but that's what I wanted. Wonderfully refreshing in a way the sweetened cranberries juices never are for me. Neat, or in ice cold water - terrific! But be warned - it really is as tart as pure lemon juice would be.
I have been looking for a cranberry juice that is simply cranberry juice. Not a juice drink or mixed with other fruit.

So glad to have found this. I drink cranberry juice every morning for its health properties but had been drinking the stuff from concentrate with sweetener rather than sugar. In California it's easy to buy the proper stuff so after a couple of weeks of only drinking the unsweetened when I returned I searched here for it. Hey! Ocado stock this!!!!
I thought it expensive in the US but this one is extortionate. But I'll pay the price. I dilute with water. Please realise that unsweetened cranberries will be very very tart - but you get used to it & it's so much better health wise

I too have been searching in vain for a while for a pure cranberry juice. I drink mine like a cordial too with San Pellegrino. I hate added sugar products, this tastes sooo good for you and I agree with other reviewers very refreshing. I have been ill this week and it has perked me up. Thanks for stocking this.
Lovely with some sparkling water over ice - one of the healthiest, easiest ways to enjoy a soda substitute and get health benefits of cranberries.

Excellent juice - very tart but as you would expect if you are looking for pure cranberry juice without all the added sugar. Makes a great cold remedy with some added honey mixed with a little warm water.
No fruity or sweet taste - just extremely tart - disgusting! Sensation of burning my throat going down too.

Took a bottle of this to a friend's on New Year's Eve when still recovering from flu and driving. Could drink all night as not sweet, and the dry, slightly tart taste is very refreshing. Getting through a bottle every few days while  ill to keep up fluids when water gets boring. Great for non-drinkers and just a refreshing alternative to water.

This tastes great. Just add a little water or drink neat. My children have spotted the difference with sweetened juice, but I can't. Expensive for a small bottle, but after a recent UTI, won't be without it for prevention.

I just use it as I would do with cordial.  It's not sweet it's beautifully tart as cranberries are in their natural state, so if you like sweet use it with oj or coconut water etc and it's bliss.  Will try the blueberry and cherry drinks next.

Fantastic product. Sugar free, pure juice. It's goes a long way as you dilute it as you wish so I think it's no more expensive than the watered down sugary versions. I also loved the taste, just added water and I preferred it to any other cranberry juice I've tried.

Bought this thinking I could dilute it or add it to fruit juice. Neither worked for me, as you have to be a die-hard cranberry fan to tolerate the taste.  Tart doesn't begin to describe it. To be fair, it's natural and a lovely smooth texture so I expect its a good product - if you know how to use it!

This is PURE cranberry juice, so its quite intense and sharp, especially compared to other cranberry "juice drinks" which have only a tiny % of cranberry juice. So you can dilute it and mix it however you like and a little goes a long way. Good value from that perspective. I make milkshake with 1/4 glass of this cranberry juice and 3/4 coconut milk drink.  You can add your own choice of type of sugar or sweetner, which makes it suitable for fructose intollerant or diabetic people. And thank goodness for no added rubbish.
Best ever
I love this product but you can find it cheaper by almost £2  at your local health food shops.
even tested on kids, they loved it.
Untreated cranberry juice is tough to take -- you have to be REALLY into organic, raw cranberry.
Sugar free, with no sweetener, grown up cordial - with a cold can of soda water - thanks for stocking this!!
no sugar, no sweeteners or anything else weird. It has a very 'dry' taste and makes a wonderful refreshing cold drink mixed with water
Fruity but quite sour, I add it to sparkling water for a refreshing drink. Very zingy, would probably help as a hangover cure too !
We think this is the best vintage cheddar! It's crumbly and sharp. Don't understand the bad reviews!
Purchased this to try when on offer.  Nice texture, slightly crumbly and a nice taste, wouldn't say vintage but a good mature cheese.   Perfect for sandwiches.

when first launched on the market this was a mile above pigrinms choice and cathedral city- strong, nutty flavour. Recently its become more like them - bland and uninteresting. Its more of a sheep than a cow
Your standard British hard cheddar cheese.  It is that typical, generic, mass-marketed cheddar cheese flavour, similar in taste to other major cheddar cheese brands in the UK.
I was very disappointed with the lack of taste and texture of this. It was a million miles away from delicious.

I love the taste of this cheese. Its one of my favourites. Its strong in flavour. I love its crumbly texture. I love it in sandwiches, macaroni, as a snack with fresh and dried fruit or simply on its own. I will continue to buy.
We think this is the best vintage cheddar! It's crumbly and sharp. Don't understand the bad reviews!
Purchased this to try when on offer.  Nice texture, slightly crumbly and a nice taste, wouldn't say vintage but a good mature cheese.   Perfect for sandwiches.

when first launched on the market this was a mile above pigrinms choice and cathedral city- strong, nutty flavour. Recently its become more like them - bland and uninteresting. Its more of a sheep than a cow
Your standard British hard cheddar cheese.  It is that typical, generic, mass-marketed cheddar cheese flavour, similar in taste to other major cheddar cheese brands in the UK.
I was very disappointed with the lack of taste and texture of this. It was a million miles away from delicious.

I love the taste of this cheese. Its one of my favourites. Its strong in flavour. I love its crumbly texture. I love it in sandwiches, macaroni, as a snack with fresh and dried fruit or simply on its own. I will continue to buy.

Wasn’t a fan of this 
Wasn’t what I was expecting it to be from nessquik

Okay, so admittedly I was a little nervous about introducing this hot chocolate to the family as I was expecting to be full of sugar. However, it has the right amount of sweetness where I don’t feel like I am overloading the kids every morning with their breakfast hot chocolate. The packaging is also cute and doesn’t take up too much room in out kitchen and be stored away.

This is my first time trying nesquick hot chocolate and i must say i'm quite impressed. I never new this existed. It's very smooth and has a proeminent chocolate taste. It doesnt taste like any other hot chocolates i've tried, which we're very fade.

Havent had nesquik since I was a child but this makes a lovely trash drink. Dont waste time with heating up milk just go with the red neck and put four teaspoons of nesquik and four teaspoons of coffee mate in a mug and add hot water.
Reminds me of French hot chocolate as a  child. Make with milk. Good treat
Its ok, very thin and found that the chocolate seems to settle onto the bottom of the cup after you've drank it all. Not one I'm likely to buy again but the kids seem to like it!

Wasn’t a fan of this 
Wasn’t what I was expecting it to be from nessquik

Okay, so admittedly I was a little nervous about introducing this hot chocolate to the family as I was expecting to be full of sugar. However, it has the right amount of sweetness where I don’t feel like I am overloading the kids every morning with their breakfast hot chocolate. The packaging is also cute and doesn’t take up too much room in out kitchen and be stored away.

This is my first time trying nesquick hot chocolate and i must say i'm quite impressed. I never new this existed. It's very smooth and has a proeminent chocolate taste. It doesnt taste like any other hot chocolates i've tried, which we're very fade.

Havent had nesquik since I was a child but this makes a lovely trash drink. Dont waste time with heating up milk just go with the red neck and put four teaspoons of nesquik and four teaspoons of coffee mate in a mug and add hot water.
Reminds me of French hot chocolate as a  child. Make with milk. Good treat
Its ok, very thin and found that the chocolate seems to settle onto the bottom of the cup after you've drank it all. Not one I'm likely to buy again but the kids seem to like it!
Does not really taste of chocolate - just powdered sweetener. I even increased the teaspoons to 7 and still Awful. Total waste of money as straight in the bin.

We got into a habit of making hot chocolates with cream and marshmallows after an afternoon school run on cold and/or wet days. This works great; it melts into warm milk beautifully, much better than some other luxurious brands out there.
amazing
and I like it too. Lovely chocolate flavour. easy to make. Win!
My kids love this brand
I love it
The kids love these. I know they are filled with sugar but once in a while they are good. Lovely and moist.
I like serving these cakes when I have guests at home, goes well with fruity teas
If you can’t handle sweet things, these may be overwhelming. However, if you can then these are perfect sized cakes which are nice tasting.
Classic angel cakes which I really like. Great moist but light sponge and sweet icing for a great treat
These are one of my favourite little cakes as I have a sweet tooth and love the extra icing on top of them. Reminds me of childhood and the flavour brings back memories
Delicious slices, very sweet and moist. Perfect with cup of coffee.
I have memories of these since time began. Tasty sponge, with a sweet icing topping. Great with a cup of tea.
The texture is nice but I do struggle with the sweetness as it "puts my teeth on edge".
Classic Mr K slice, full of flavour and nicely packaged individually so the slices stay fresh.  These take the edge off my cravings.
Yummy but claggy
Still tastes the same as when I was a child although feels smaller. Individually sealed and great for lunch boxes.
classic mr kipling angel slice, perfect sponge treat.  great for staying fresh as individually wrapped.  perfect for taking to work/school.
A lovely little sweet treat and the individual packets mean they are perfect for lunch boxes and stay nice and fresh.
I love these and they adorn any afternoon tea but am disappointed that they are so expensive compared to other supermarkets.

Mr kiplings Angel slices are a cult classic they have a unique sweet taste. These are perfect for lunchboxes or on the go due to the individual wrapping which also means they stay fresher for longer. …would highly recommend
Mr. Kipling knows how to bake cakes. These are sweet and moist and look pretty served up at a kids party, definitely a favourite with my grandchildren
The original and still the greatest! Delicious sponge cake snack portioned individually for kid’s snacks. Adults love them too.
Love these so much!
I would always recommend angel slices, the best

Old fashioned spongy cakes.
Shame there's so much plastic packaging, just no need for it.
These are perfect for snacks, school lunches and even to put on the side at a party.
Love an Angel slice, they are fab and great for lunchboxes
Delicious individually wrapped little bars of yumminess. Perfect for lunch boxes and snack time, sweet, soft and fluffy sponge topped with icing what more could you want?!
Light and moist cakes. A delicious sweet treat.
Delicious little cakes! Moist and fluffy with a lovely taste of vanilla - enjoyed by all the family. Very handy, perfect for lunch boxes as they are individually wrapped. Would recommend.
Tasting, soft and just what I want from a little snack.
Can't believe the bad reviews! Bishes be crazy! These are ruddy delicious! More for me I guess. Yum yum.

What a disappointment. I opened these on a cool day and they immediately seemed sweaty (overly moist may be a better description). They are overly sweet and had a weird, rubbery texture. Not nice at all. Wont be buying again.
Kids love these. bit expensive at full price
Individually wrapped which is good, sweet tasting but the icing is sometimes hard and cake is dry. The twin pack angel slices by mr Kipling (in the long flat box) are much nicer and moist.
These are over over over sweet!  There is no flavour, just sugar!  No they are not nice!

This cake has been my little girls favourite treat for at least a year. She just cant get bored of it. Im personally not a fan, although it is not unpleasant. I like that the slices are packed individually in a way she can open them herself. It fits nicely in her after school sports club snack box.
For reasons I fail to understand, my son loves these. I personally think they resemble plastic food.
Have to always have these in the house, kids are addicted to them! Individual wrap for each cake better than the twin packs so they can just have one at a time

I find these a great snack at work, but recently the packaging has been incredibly poor. The perforations allowing you to tear off one portion at a time have been worse than useless, causing the packaging to rip on all sides and rendering the individual packages basically useless. I've taken to decanting slices of cake into a food bag, doubling the waste and use of plastics.
At the price today. The 6 pack is cheaper. Buyer beware.

Ever since they introduced this new 8-pack - for the same price as the previous 9-pack, oddly - detaching a slice has been a nightmare. The airtight seal on both sides of the perforation always bursts and the pack splits wide open.
Unbeatable!
NA
Cannot believe this is so hard to buy it really is delicious
These are fab for my sons lunchbox

It was meant to be for my little one but I ended up carrying with me during +10k run to rehydrate and blast my energy levels. It is so small and handy so I can carry it and consume during my workout with no need to stop. No nasties plus tastes good.
My little one loves these jellies!  Really tasty and all good ingredients
all natural flavours and toddler loves them

The family and i enjoy this brand, they taste fresh, not artificial in taste at all. We as a family would love a 1 Litre  Milk Carton, as the sucky bit is annoying, we're not able to get all the jelly out.
My 18 month old sucked this down in a minute! There wasnt a drop left in the pouch.
My 27 month old loves these, I asked her if she liked it and she said its yummy mummy. Will definitely buy again.

I received this as freebie, my 5 year old and 3 year old tried it. They both like jelly and yogurt pouches but neither really liked this.  I tried a bit, tastes like runny jelly, perhaps not as sweet as standard jelly.  Convenient snack to take out but I wouldn't buy.
According to my little girl - who's 3, so not a baby! She still enjoys pouches and these got the thumbs up.
Nice for a treat and very convenient with no mess. All natural ingredients too.
Our 3 old enjoyed this. The ingredients list reads a lot better than some of the other jellies.
My daughter loved this Jelly Juice.  It has a great taste and the pouch makes it very convenient.  The only downside is the high price.

I only got this as it was free if I reviewed it, so I tested it on my children.  Both enjoyed it, but my son - the jam lover, liked it the best.  It smelled very sweet, not sure how much added sugar is in it.
Not keen on the funny texture or insipid flavour.
My little one liked this juicy jelly and I liked the more natural approach to a kids' snack.
My kids loved this, gave it as a treat after tea and was happy that it was relatively healthy. Would definitely buy again as it was such a hit with the kids.

Our toddler loved this & she certainly won't touch any other jelly so I was totally surprised she slurped this all up. Helped I think by the fact it's in a pouch. Will buy again as it's really natural & not an E number in sight
This tasted pleasant enough, but my kids weren't sure about the texture. I tried some, and I could see their point - it was like lumpy juice. It's fine, if that doesn't bother you.
This went down well with my grandson but I thought it was more of a drink rather than a snack as stated on the pouch. I liked it was natural ingredients.
Perfect snack to have on the go. My girls love them, added bonus that they are healthy and guilt free!
went down well
The kids love this. Handy snack to have in and take out.

We were given this to review and my little boy really enjoyed it, I had a little taste and thought it had a nice flavour, just like liquid strawberry jelly. Doesn't have any added sugar and is natural ingredients so I would buy again.
My daughter loved this. A good, easy snack and mess free!
Very popular with my toddler, great for an out & about snack
Judging from the speed man Granddaughter made this disappear this I'd say it was a hit.
Received this to review and little boy took to school and came home asking me to buy again as he said they were really tasty, also no need for a spoon, quick, easy and mess free
This is a lovely fruity drink which was wolfed down by my granddaughter. She loved it and I trust her judgement.

I got this as a free sample to try and my daughter thought it was delicious. She thought it was fruitier than other brand of jelly pouch with the benefit of no added sugar. I have now bought it again.
Mixed reviews in our house- son loved it but myself and daughter really did liked it. It's got a weird slimy texture. Wont buy again, will just stick to yogurts.
Easy to open. Quite a sweet taste of various summer fruits, with a smooth and thicker consistency.
Easy to take out for a quick snack or put in lunch boxes.
My kids love this Naturelly in their lunch box. They've tried all the flavours and they love them all.

I bought these products a while back, my kids love them. So tasty and so healthy!! So glad they are now on Ocado! 
You must try!!

I was given a sample from Ocado to review (lucky me huh!).

Being a user of some balsamic vinegar with my salads, I found this better than I expected. 

The spray spreads well, and sometimes I used half a spray.

To be honest it has been a good way to get kids into eating more salad in their meals, just give it a spray (you don't more than one).

If you're looking for super duper top of the range balsamic then this isn't for you.

However if you want something handy, fun to use popping one of these in the fridge won't hurt.
Received this to review.  Low in calories which is great. Easy to use. Some of us found it too sweet.

I thought this seemed like a good idea for our daily salads. The spray works very well and you can direct it successfully where you want it. But the flavour was horrible, so sweet, not any tang of balsamic. It would work well on Eton mess dessert more than salad I think!
As a retired Home Economist, I make my own dressing but was attracted to this because of the low calorie. Pleasantly surprised, I tended to use less anyway and the flavour was fine.
