I was sent this by Ocado to review. I really couldn't taste anything balsamic or raspberry but quite liked the fact that it was a low calorie dressing and made me look at what other options Heinz made that I might like.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I was put off by the colour but when I tried it I found it made a pleasant change.  As a low calorie option it is good and I would definitely use it occasionally going forward.
I received this a free sample to review, It is different, quite tangy I would buy again
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Easy to dispense, nice flavour, spruced up a bland salad nicely.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
Presumably the idea was to add an even nicer taste to the already successful balsamic dressing. Instead it made it sweet and sickly.
It might work on ice cream, but someone else can review that!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I would normally just buy a normal Balsamic and thought the flavour of the Raspberry and the Balsamic may clash. However this is surprisingly good and is a very good low calorie way of adding some additional flavour.
Nice and tangy on salads . Really nice taste.  Good for slimmers.
Got as part of an Ocado review. Concerned it would taste artifical but I can say it is pretty good. Would I buy it again, not sure, but will use it up
Didn’t think I’d like this, but the raspberry adds a nice fruity tang. Quite acidic, but goes really well on a crispy salad!

Im reviewing this as I was given it by Ocado. I think it is really good . It tasted lovely on my salad, fresh and zingy, a change from my usual dressing. I would definitely recommend this and being a spray is perfect

I am reviewing this because I got a free sample from Ocado. I really liked it, it added a very nice different touch to the salad. I actually liked that it's mild, I was fearing a strong raspberry or vinegar flavour that would kill off the flavour of the vegetables, but it was not the case. Some reviews were complaining about being mild and for me that was the best thing about it!
I was sent this for review, i found this a bit watery with a hint of raspberry for my liking and would have preferred a stronger taste dressing.

I was sent a free sample of this by Ocado to review. As another review has already stated, getting the plastic film off is not easy. But once I got to taste it I really like it. A lovely fresh raspberry flavour and doesn't take much to dress a salad. I would like to try the other flavours now.

I received this to review, I found it to be a bit bland and needed more to get a bit of flavour but then again it is low calories so it is to be expected. I normally dress my salad with stronger vinegars but it might work if you prefer it lighter.

I am reviewing this product as Ocado gave me a sample. Im currently on a diet to shift this lockdown weight and this product is a step in the right direction for that purpose. The flavour was watery to me and I didnt feel I gained much enhancement to my salad but I was grateful to have a healthy option.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I love balsamic vinegar with raspberry and use it all the time to drizzle on strawberries, salads etc.  I was surprised to discover that the main ingredient in this was water not balsamic vinegar!  Whilst I found it was quite handy to be able to spray it over my tomato salad, and it was ok to eat the salad. I wasn’t impressed and don’t really want to eat it again. I shall stick to my twelve year aged raspberry balsamic vinegar.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I must admit, I rarely put any dressing on my salad but I was very pleasantly surprised how much I liked this.  It's not too sweet (as I feared) but has a good balance of balsamic with the raspberry hint.  I'm a convert and will continue to use it.
A little too fierce, and over powering, also very difficult to remove seal

I received this free to review. I’d ignored this because of the colour and opted for the lemon one, but taste wise this is much better. A little goes a long way and you get a large dressed salad for a couple of squirts. More balsamic than raspberry. I’ll buy in future.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. We're not really big fans of salad dressings and this did not convince me otherwise. It's alright - a bit too sharp and zingy for my taste. I think I'd rather stick to a simple drizzle of oil, salt and pepper or no dressing at all

Ocado gave me this to review. I would never have considered ordering it under normal circumstances, so I am pleased I could take up the offer.
At only 2 calories a spray it is a pleasant light dressing which really perks up salad leaves. It comes in a compact spray bottle which is a handy size for transporting for picnics. I will definitely be reordering.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I didn't have much hope for this but used it in a salad, which everyone seemed to enjoy. The flavours somehow work.

Its really hard to find tasty salad dressing that isnt calorie heavy so when I heard Heinz was launching these I was so excited. Ive waited through weeks of out of stocks and finally got this!

Firstly, find another raspberry vinaigrette in the supermarketyou cant! This is a great alternative flavour to the typical honey mustards and really zingy. 

Sometimes I look at things that have 2kcals per spray and think yeah but you need 20 pumps to get any flavour. Not so with this one. It took 4 pumps for one big salad and it was the perfect amount. 8kcals for a dressed salad!! 

This will be sticking firmly in my basket. If you want a low cal salad dressing, give this range (I think there are 4 in total) a go.
This is a nice yogurt but a bit too sweet for my taste.   Less sugar to allow more of the flavour of the rhubarb to come through and it would be much improved, imo.
Thick and creamy and not too sweet or too sour

We used to buy Activia yoghurt mixed packages and then realized that the rhubarb flavor was by far our favorite. Now we just buy these, theyre so flavorful (and not too sweet like the other rhubarb yoghurt brands).

While the taste is not too sweet there is a lot of sugar in the pot. Its possible its just my imagination however I also feel the fruit content is not as much as it used to be - there used to be reasonable chunks of fruit, recently only very small pieces?
My husband loves these
If you like rhubarb, you will love this. Not too sweet or sour, perfect.
Love the taste of these but would prefer them to have less sugar. Its actually quite worrying how much sugar is in them
A creamy yogurt, with good taste of rhubarb - seemed to be a slight graininess to the texture, as though the sugar wasn't fully dissolved
Great for those who cant have sweeteners. Not too sweet, yes some sugar but not awful. So creamy and tasty.
Do not agree that there is a metallic taste, these are lovely. both me and hubby loved them and we are fussy, will  buy again
I love the creamy texture and taste of this yogurt, however I find that there is slightly metallic after taste. I prefer the Rachel's organic rhubarb yogurt.
This rubarb flavour is dreamy; creamy with and intense rubarb taste. Reminiscent of my mother's beautiful Rubarb Fool!
This really does make you feel less bloated. I have one every day! And they taste good.
Spreads easily straight from the fridge. No complaints
This size & brand is a firm family favourite but, recently, something has changed. I keep telling myself it can't have (changed) because it's butter but it tastes more like margarine lately.
spreads and tastes great!

Usually buy Lurpak when its on offer but it hasnt been recently and this came up as a suggestion so tried it. Tastes nice enough and actually spreads straight from the fridge so will be swapping if price is comparable. Much superior to Anchor spreadable which doesnt spread from fridge.
Regular purchase. Tastes good and creamy and works really well on toast
Had to choose an alternative when my usual lurpak was unavailable. I found it really unpleasant in taste and texture. I put it down to the vegetable fat ingredient.
This tastes nothing like butter. Wont buy again.
We always buy this butter, it spreads easily and is tasty and good value for money
It is what it is but for some reason I'm lately finding all 'spreadable' butter is hard to spread as it slides off the knife.
Which is fine if you like margarine, which I don't. It is easily spreadable but I'm guessing it's cheaper because the oil content is higher than other brands.

I agree that this has a more watery texture but i guess that makes it far easier and quick to spread on sandwiches etc- especially when Im in a rush. Some other spreadable butters just dont spread well and tear the bread. The flavour is lovely and very buttery. My whole family really enjoys this spread- we prefer it to Anchor.
I was always an Anchor butter kinda chick,  but I've now developed a taste for this, so my long love affair with Anchor is officially over!

Tastes of nothing and is like greasy margarine. I noticed that the butter content has been greatly reduced. Will not
be buying anymore.
This is no longer butter, but reminiscent of the cheap spread from my childhood. White, greasy and a horrible mouth feel. Nothing like it used to be.
From one week to the next the formula changed. We checked the ingredients. It's now too watery and just makes your toast soggy.  Nasty.
Very milky and hard to spread. bland and tasteless aswell. Going back to anchor.
The only spreadable butter I will very occasionally buy. It is the purest, no palm oil or other vile unnecessary ingredients! Well done!
Very very hard butter, cannot spread it on bread, it just clumps up and pulls the bread with it.
No palm oil and made from UK milk
This is a regular on my shopping list. Spreads really well and tastes good. Added bonus its from the UK.
Spreads easily and has a creamy taste without any real flavour.  Doesnt taste like a good butter, disappointing.
Aside from block butter, this is the only spread I have found that doesn't include palm oil.  Lovely flavour too!
This product is spreadable and tastes so buttery.  A real good buy for those that love a butter that spreads easily.  Delicious melted on hot crumpets.

Really happy with this. I've munched Anchor butter my entire life, but the price was getting silly. I've tried many (disappointing) alternatives, but only this is an equal substitute. Feeling very chuffed to have found this.
Tastes so goooood! Love this on crumpets in the morning ! Never fails straight from the fridge
I always but this. Spreads straight from the fridge. Buttery taste. Even better when on offer
This is by far the best butter available.
This is the only butter I now buy. Pretty much as good as real butter, with the convenience of being stored in the fridge.
Wouldn't buy anything else, full of flavour and delicious.
Cant do without. On my shopping list every time.
Lovely taste and spreads much better than other brands.
Delicious, lighter than straight butter and not full of unpronounceable chemicals.
I have been using Kerrygold but decided to try this whilst it was on offer,  Must say it spreads easier and is a little lighter and I prefer it.
The best

You really can't put a better bit of butter on your knife.

Love this butter, nothing else comes close to the lovely buttery taste of country life.
I am a bit of a butter nerd. can not stand marg at all or butter that has been left out in the heat to make it spread.this tastes great and spreads.perfect
This is very tasty and spreads quite easilty from the fridge.  Good on toast and for sandwiches.
Lovely tasting butter, spreads easily from the fridge. Decided to swap from another brand I had used for years and found that this is much better.

This is so much better in flavour and texture than some other spreadables.

I find that there is no difference in taste or quality compared to the hard block version.

However, I'm convinced both versions have less salt than when I first started buying Country Life, which is very annoying. Or maybe I've just got too used to the taste. It happens sometimes, with some products.
It is the best in the market but pricey.

This is our go to feta ever since they discontinued the Ocado Gold Barrel Aged Feta which was great and much cheaper. Deducting a start as you can get this cheaper at most of the local shops.  Not sure why it's marked up on Ocado.
Lovely tangy feta.

weighs less now, costs more! WHY??
Cheeky

It is lovely, my favourite feta by far as it's so creamy and smooth, but I thought it was costly before and now the price has increased even more.  It's a shame but I may need to look for another brand for my weekly shop.
the feta is lovely but the packaging is terrible- doesn't seal so it constantly leaks brine everywhere. been the same with every pack. PLEASE sort it out!
Lovely creamy feta with just the right amount of tartness. Just great!
Lovely crumbly feta, tastes good and keeps for ages in the tub.
I never had better feta from a UK supermarket. Texture is so much nicer than the regular brand, so is the flavour.
Love this tasty, organic feta. I use in salads and to make shakshuka. Last for quite a while as long as you keep your hands out of brine else it goes off.

Very tasty and authentic feta. Unfortunately it is let down by poor packaging. This is the second time I've had the cheese go off within 2 weeks of purchase. This cheese should last many weeks in the brine so I'm not sure why this has happened, but from now on I'll be purchasing individual packs.

I am a cheese person , i love cheese and tried so many different cheeses. People who know me call me a cheese expert. This feta is amazingggg. I eat it just alone . First i ordered 1. The next time that i was close to ran out , i ordered 5 small and 1 big . The expiry is until 2021 but im sure i’ll finish them earlier.
This is the best feta I have had in the UK. The box is great for storing in the fridge and can be recycled afterwards. The feta is firm but creamy, so delicious.
Fabulous cheese, just a great alternative to normal cow milk.
The colour is lots of fun. The taste is very mild delicate earthy.
Nice, subtle flavour, not sweet on its own, allowing sweetening to personal taste. Definitely improves with the addition of lemon juice. Kids really enjoyed watching the colour change.

This got mostly positive votes from the people I shared it with - mostly due to the incredible colour.  Sweetened with honey and lemon, it tastes mostly just of honey and lemon.  Mild shot of anthocyanines?
This is a bit of a novelty being bright blue and changing to purple.  The taste is ok.  I wouldn't rush out to buy it again but there's nothing wrong with it as such. It's just not my cup of tea.
Interesting concept, and i love the way the tea changes colour, but you do need to add a sweetener of some sort, and is is too sweet for my personal taste. If you like sweet iced tea, give it a go.

The colour, an intense blue/violet makes this drink rather off putting upon first appearance. The flavour is most unusual and is certainly enhanced by adding lemon, honey and sugar as suggested on the box. It just wasn't for me though. I can't recommend and wouldn't buy it again.
The colour of this tea is off putting. The flavour is rather different but much better with honey and lemon.
The colour is beautiful. The taste is not!
This was very weird. Really tasteless but bright blue. Wouldn't recommend at all!

Despite blue not being a very appealing colour for food and drink, it was so vivid you just had to try out of pure interest. 

I definitely needed the honey and lemon in the tea, which enhanced the flavour significantly. 

Certainly nice for a change but not sure it's something I'd buy regularly.

I'm not that keen on the taste, a bit bland, kind of how I expected petals to taste really. However the colour is wonderful.  I have accidentally found a natural substitute for blue food colouring in icing!  If you make the tea up very strong then a little of the liquid can be used to make a lovely pale blue icing that doesn't cause headaches.
Both unique in colour and unique in taste, this tea was really quite pleasant to drink and with some lemon it was quite refreshing. Pricey though.
Taste was ok with lemon, sugar and honey but nothing special. Blue colour made it look like ink, really not that appealing to drink.
Very smooth tasting - a bright blue colour that turns purple when I added lemon. Makes a change from the usual herb teas.
I was really looking forward to eating these as they looked really good but sadly they were tasteless. My dogs seemed to enjoy them though.
These may be smaller than other brands of scallop but they are so lovely and sweet. Cook for 2 mins on each side and they are perfect. Would highly recommend
My wife likes scallops, these scallops are pretty good. She likes then which makes me happy and so I equally like them. Quite small but very tasty.
Small but delicious
Really enjoyed these. Small, but a nice texture and flavour. Fried in olive oil, tossed in vinaigrette, served with chorizo, semi-sun dried tomatoes, cannellini bean puree and a few rocket leaves.

They're small, which is obvious from the image, but still have good texture and flavour - bought two times now and will buy again.
An excellent alternative option to paying twice the price for the same weight, providing you're flexible about size.
These were lovely. Really fresh and sweet tasting.
These are the smallest scallops Ive ever seen, no wonder they were so much cheaper than other brands, taste ok but each one not even a morsel!
These were incredible. Sauteed for a few minutes and served on toast in their buttery jus they made for the best lunch I've had all year.
This used to be great and a weekly purchase. However, something happened to this product and now several times in a row there is a smell of ammonia when cooked before the use by date.
We buy these every week - great treat. Price is very reasonable. Quality is good. I season them with salt and pepper and sear them on a cast iron pan with avocado oil. Relatively quick and delicious.

love these small queenie scallops, idea for use in a luxury fish pie  but just as brilliant on there own cooked in a little butter , we love these are are often in our basket at little luxury at a fraction of the cost
We love small scallops as they are tastier than the large scallops which can taste like lard. Four stars for the image as in reality the box isn't that full:)
Very tasty scallops, which I brine before cooking in butter and a little olive oil. Excellent flavour! Will buy again.
Good value and good quality. A regular buy.

These are very tasty and great with chilli and cream.  By the way, they are suitable for freezing (the previous reviewer is totally incorrect).   They have been defrosted but, kept below 5 degrees (so kept chilled). You can therefore, re - freeze.  Many fresh fish counter products are like this ie cod, haddock etc.  Its only if, the fish has been above 5 degrees for MORE than two hours will it start to grow bacteria.  Supermarkets rarely get this wrong and its also on the Foodsafety.gov website.

Reading the description it states that the product is defrosted, but further down it says suitable for freezing! I'm sure most people already know that you shouldn't re-freeze a defrosted food item. Please clarify on your packaging that IF its defrosted that it ISN'T  suitable for freezing. I was about to buy them for freezing!
Small sized scallops but perfectly sweet. They only need a quick flash fry on the hob with some butter and then added to some butter for a quick, tasty meal.

How does this work?
Info
A well-managed and sustainable fishery?
Trawling?
scallops caught in the South West Atlantic FAO 41 using trawls?

I am a big fan of M&S Canadian Frozen Scallops,  however they were not right for the meal I was making (Paella) so I thought I would try these - glad I did!  Added them to the Paella mix 3 mins  at the end and they were just cooked. They are on the smaller size but they didnt lose the size or shape when cooked and the flavour was lovely and tender.  Would buy these again
Used these in a pasta dish wrapped in prosciutto. They’re so tasty, I’ll definitely be cooking with these again soon.

I had considered giving four stars because each scallop is quite small, but when I factored in the freshnes, taste and price the only way to go was five stars. It was a bit fiddly trying to caramelise them evenly because of the sizes and number in the pan, but that's a first world problem!
fresh, meaty, adequate amount and comparably greater value for price
These little scallops had a lovely, delicate sweet flavour. They were really fresh and delicious. These will likely become a weekly staple.
briefly cooked with a mornay sauce.  Delicious.  They are small, but are a good price and good quality.
Always good, these have been a staple for a long time. Recommended!

We have never had scallops before, so nothing to compare with..really enjoyed, as part of seafood platter..and a bowl of chips, some nice leaves..we got two packets, in flash sale..so a real bargain and a nice meal at home, during Lockdown..
Lovely treat with some pasta
They are lovely! Tasty, affordable and fresh. It will be in my every delivery from now on.
Tasty quick and healthy! On my shopping again next week!
These have become a regular order. They mix well in a stir fry, maybe with chorizo or lardons. Comparable value to other options here is great
They are tiny but yummmy.  The portion size is small, good for one person.
Size wise they are pretty small, and a few were broken so maybe not the best for a fancy presentation... but they tasted good and fresh, would recommend
These scallops were very tasty, lightly pan fried in a little butter with a splash of lemon. A little skinny and on the small side, perhaps, but well worth a small treat.
Cooked these last night with pancetta, following the recipe for Josh Eggletons scallop pops and they were delicious, sweet and succulent.

Perfect when quickly pan fried in butter with a little cream , asparagus and spinach, then tossed with some fresh pasta and a sprinkle of parmigiana. One star off for the slightly hard bits where theyve been attached to the shell
3 minutes each side  add salad or pasta or chorizo and bosh you have yourself a lovely meal.

I make this delicious scallop dish called Creamy Bay Scallop Spaghetti which you can google for the recipe and had run out of my usual scallops to tried these. They worked well in the dish, it actually was good to have lots of smaller scallops rather than a few large ones. Losing a star as have to pick a few bits of residual stuff off the sides of a few which is a faff.
Great taste and lots in the packet. we really enjoyed these and would buy again
They are small so adjust your cooking time, sear on one side then just a few seconds on the other. Delicious

Purchased these for a seafood risotto, pan fried just to colour then added to the risotto with prawns and pollack about 5-10 minutes from the end of cooking along with some peas. Sweet and very enjoyable.
these scallops are =< the size of a 20p coin. It's ridiculous not sure this is sustainable if they are harvesting under developed scallops? I've never seen them so small before
Delicious pan fried with some prawns, garlic and tomatoes and served with pasta. Yum! Recommended.
Good
Very disappointed. No taste whatsoever
Bought this as a filling for dimsum dumplings and it turned out great. They were fresh and the texture was springy. Great steamed with some chives and sesame oil
Good scallops, not as tasty as from fish monger with roes but good shelf life and good for the price
These little scallops are just so tasty flash fried with a little garlic! Considering they are without the roe, I feel its not bad value for money too.
These are really nice, sweet scallops. I would definitely buy them again!
Juicy sweet scallops they are tiny but very tasty will purchase again
Sautéed very quickly in garlicky butter - were lovely & soft & sweet. Will definitely purchase again.
They are firm and fresh, but just completely tasteless.
Will order again. They are minuscule but they were sweet. Perfect for fried noodle and rice dishes in Chinese cooking.
Smaller the more flavoursome

These scallops are tiny but packed with flavour. 

I used then as part of an entree and everyone loved them. 

3-4 of these tiny scallops ones would be equivalent to 1 regular sized scallop. 

Would buy again.

We've purchased these a fair few times, admittedly usually on flash sale, and they've always been full of flavour and no grit. Very tempting to give 5 stars but they are tiny little 1cm scallops, ample amount, but still feels a tad high a price point for the tininess. They're consistently good though and not extortionate for the quality.
I used these to make a scallop and chorizo pasta sauce... lovely would definitely purchase again
These scallops are smaller but Ive ordered them a few times and theyve always had great flavour. Just be careful not to overcook them!
These scallops are tiny! Maybe 10mm in diameter each. Definitely bear this in mind when purchasing.
Very poor with no flavour.
Waste of money. Tasteless and tiny. Bought the frozen ones last time which were much nicer and meatier
These we really nice and full of flavour
Small scallops but perfect for stir flies. Tasty will def buy again
These were very sandy.
I lightly fry these in a little sunflower oil with paprika, along with Birdseye Steamfresh rice and veg for a quick and tasty midweek meal.
Oh dear. Two problems with these. First and worst - they are caught by trawling which wrecks the seabed and decimates sealife. And secondly they are teeny tiny. Avoid!
These scallops are tiny but works a treat in a stirfry with some added king prawns. A frequent buy.
Great product
good taste, but too small
These scallops were soft and tasteless. But most of all, they were caught by trawling.
These are absolutely tiny. Bought them for a New Years Eve dinner party starter but theres no way I can serve these. Now going to have to go hunting the supermarkets for decent sized scallops.

I wanted to use these on Christmas day in a cerviche so planned to freeze them for a couple days and thaw the night before to my disappointment they were previously frozen and there not suitable for refreezing... Tiny things which makes you question whether they are genuine but tasted fine.
If you love scallops and dont mind small ones, these are perfect!

These really are very small, but we enjoyed them. Just fried them briefly, served with grilled broccoli, miso peas and pangrattato. However, would probably only buy them on offer - they're too small to serve at a dinner party, and a bit pricey as an everyday meal.
These are unfortunately absolutely tasteless,  they don't taste like any scallops I have had before therefore would not recommend or buy again.  Shame because they are not cheap.
Perfect for miso noodles jars as a healthy lunch. Cook almost instantly when hot water poured over with sauce and noodles. Delicious.
They are definitely scallops. But packaging is ridiculously excessive. Could have fit in a package 1/3 the size, possibly 1/4. OCADO, please sort it out.

The size of these scallops were perfect for my chinese dish of scallops & asparagus in XO sauce because you can toss them quickly over high heat. They were not punched out of another fish. These small Bay scallops are common in America.
Wouldn't normally buy small scallops but these were lovely.   Have them fried with some rice.  Yum.

they are so small and regular in shape that I suspect they are not really scallops. Read they punch fake scallops out of other flesh (rays I think) and these make me wonder. Hope it's not the case but won't buy again.
These baby scallops are delicious. Homemade Coquille St Jacques were out of this world with these sweet tasty beauties. Highly recommend. Gold star!
Pan fried in butter  with garlic and bacon then finished with lemon and parsley... superb treat for 2.
Honestly they are barely the size of 10p coin. Not enough to feed two people. Let's hope they taste good!
Lovely when pan fried with crushed garlic and chilli. Added a drop of wine vinegar to bring out the flavour.
Diddy little scallops packed with flavour. Delicious flat fried with chorizo, chilli and tomato and served with spaghetti.
These were great in my Peruvian ceviche. They are small but that suited my recipe.
Agree with the other reviewers - not too sweet or sour. Quite a subtle raspberry flavour. Nice health drink I actually enjoyed so will buy again

Tastes exactly like raspberry yoghurt. Not too sweet or sour, just creamy with a well-balanced fruitiness. The texture can vary, as with all kefir. Sometimes it's thick and rich, sometimes it's thinner and almost fizzy, but it's always tasty, and packed full of probiotics. Drinking 2-3 small bottles a week has really helped a family member's skin complaint.
Enjoyed this very much, not too sweet or tart, just a lovely fresh tasting raspberry flavour. I wish they did this in larger sizes.

The cake is quite stodgy and contains gluten. You can't really taste the cake that much, as it is filled far too abundantly with dried fruit. The added handfuls of currants, sultanas and raisins on top is just way too much. Shame as love a fruit cake but this is too much fruit and not enough cake.
It was not possible to cut a slice, far too expensive for a load of crumbs and loose fruit.

A beautiful loaf cake, very moist, full of fruit. 
Dangerously moreish!

Really enjoyed the cake.  Very rich and moist but I think a little less sugar would be nicer as the amount of fruit provides plenty of sweetness.  I sliced it and froze some and it froze well.  

I wouldn't buy again unless it was on offer as the price appears to have increased significantly since I purchased 2 weeks ago.
This and a number of other cakes from Daylesford have wheat flour in them, but are not flagged.  The cake looks delicious, but it should be properly flagged
I absolutely loved this cake, it was delightfully moist, fruit laden and tasted delicious. I wouldn’t buy again at full price but when offered in a flash sale then I would with no hesitation.
WHY DO DAYLESFORD CALL THIS EARL GREY CAKE? WHEN IT'S 2% EARL GREY AND 92%  BLACK TEA. SURELY THAT CAN NOT BE RIGHT. STILL, IT'S NICE CAKE.
We didn't find this overly sweet like other reviews say. It is sweet as it has so much fruit in but not too sweet. Very nice on half price but we wouldn't pay full price for it.

Bought in flash sale thinking it would be the usual sort of dried up but ok cakes. Extremely attractive, utterly delicious and fed 4 (ravenous) people for tea and cake.  Everybody loved it without fail. I can understand why Daylesford commands a higher price tag, but even taking that into consideration the full price tag is beyond me even for special occassions. If it's within your budget, it's just a no brainer.  Get it and enjoy it.

I think Daylesford need to review the recipe - tea-soaked fruit is lovely in some cakes but this one is not nice.  Overall this cake is just a soggy wet mess, with the texture of the whole cake having been dunked in a very sweet cup of very weak tea.  It completely falls apart and tastes sugary above any fruit or tea actual flavours.  Very disappointing, and I only rarely have cake, and that is ony ever fruit cake.  I think it will be fed to the chickens.

This cake doesn’t have even a slight hint of Earl Grey.  Also the definition of a fruit cake isn’t to plop a few raisins on top with some sticky peel. Terrible dry but crumbly texture. Threw it in the bin. Don’t waste your money. Here is a brand that overcharges and under delivers. Very poorly developed recipe.

This was disappointing for me. I love Daylesford's carrot cake and ginger cake but this, to me, has an odd taste. I couldn't taste Earl Grey, which I love. I can't decide exactly what the flavouring is that I don't like but I've never tasted a fruit cake quite like it. I usually like all fruit cake with varying degrees of passion, but I don't like this one. I would still recommend it to others because, from the reviews, others love it.

Im not a fan of fruit cake, this is my husbands opinion. 
Packed with fruit, light taste of Earl Grey, fresh and crumbly. Like your Nan would make. 
Organic too. No criticisms.
Sickly sweet. Crumbly and too much fruit. No Earl Grey.

Fully loaded with fruit and larger than the old version. 
Organic, quality ingredients and looks good.
The cake is packed with flavours but it feels like eating sugar out of a sugar bowl.  Hence plenty of scope for improvement.

Another winning cake from Daylesford…Completely organic and tastes amazing, perfect for an afternoon treat with a cup of your favourite tea. It’s a big cake so you can put half of it in the freezer for next week which makes it great value. 

It’s moist, it’s light, it’s full of currants, raisins, sultanas, cherries, flaked almonds and topped with lemon and orange peel. Far superior than the version of this cake with similar ingredients that Daylesford made previously.

I’m really looking forward to trying the two other new flavours “carrot and walnut” and “sticky ginger”…

Thank you Daylesford for making such great organic cakes !
Love these. Really like how much flavour the tubes carry. There is more than enough of the cheese too. I usually run out of tubes before cheese so give the rest to the dog.
This is a firm favourite in our house. I genuinely don't understand the bad reviews.

Would have been happier to be hit by the delivery truck than have this substitution after trying it.
Its not cheese, its not even a proper breadstick, don't tempt the kidney problems...
I buy these for my kids but I also end up eating a pack of two.
So good
My favourite dunkers

Bought them originally for the kids (4&2), both of which love them ... if they can get them before I eat them all!! I love them! So tasty and a decent snack - I grab these rather than a pack of crisps as more filling. Great crunchy tubes with great flavour and a dairylea dip - cant go wrong!! Yes the cheese  is a little artificial but thats any cheese spread. We all love them!

The tubes are nicely flavoured and crunchy, but how can anyone call the tasteless gloopy concoction cheese dip is beyond me. It tastes more like wallpaper paste!
Daughter is happy to eat the tubes but wouldnt touch the gloop (and after tasting it I know why!)
I buy these for my toddlers but usually end up having a pack myself! They're more tasty than the breadstick version and there's plenty of tubes and cheese for a decent snack.
my partner loves it , he has it takes really cheese

Ok, a thirty something woman shouldn't love these quite as much as I do. But they're so tasty! Contrary to other reviews, I don't find either the tubes or the dip too salty, and I don't add salt to food so can usually taste when something is overly salty. Great 'grab and go' with a piece of fruit for a quick lunch.
I love these :-)
Ok so I agree with the other reviewer - they are pretty salty - more like crisps than breadsticks. However - I quite like them - a guilty snack perhaps!
Very salty, really bad and unnatural taste. Definitely not suitable for children, according to my opinion
I don't think trifle is supposed to be so crunchy.
No sponge. Custard a little runny but passable, don't mind the crunchy fruit. Rather expensive compered to other supermarket brands(guess paying for M&S name)
Very nice
My kids love all M&S puddings and mind, they don’t have a sweet tooth and they never ask for puddings. It’s so convenient for me to have this in the fridge.
These are pretty average puds. The fruit is quite tinned fruit cocktail. My hubby did not like them. Cream and custard quite thin.
We really enjoy these as a treat. The trifle reminds us of the great family trifles we used to have at Grandma's.
A perfectly balanced little treat that's full of flavour. My only complaint, which comes from a place of pure greed, is that they are quite short-dated and can't be frozen, otherwise I'd buy more!

I wish I had checked the reviews before buying - the fruit was hard and tasteless and made a bland trifle bad. 
Also the promo picture is misleading: there is hardly any sponge in this trifle, which is a disappointment for me because the sponge is the best bit in a trifle as far as I'm concerned.
My mother gave up eating one as could not chew the hard bits of fruit, very disappointed
not a wow trifle, a little too light but pleasant for a quick dessert. price not bad for three, but I like a little more densest. miss the sponge.
Husband loves them
What can I say...mum is very disappointed if these aren't available. I love them too, not to sweet or sharp, good quality trifles.
Very hard pieces of fruit, some very woody and unpleasant. Also lacking  in flavour. Wont buy again.

Love this trifle! 

A regular buy
Well presented with generous amount but a fake, peach flavour at the bottom ruined the enjoyment. Might be ok if you do not mind peach flavoured items but I only like fresh or tinned peaches.
Nice but would opt for red berries next time.

Just trying out the M&S items. Very nice and light, not too sweet and just enough. Some of the fruit is a little crunchy but better than being soggy imho. I would buy again as a quick after lunch dessert.
They're OK, not sure I'd buy them again. Fruit a bit too crunchy, not real taste in the jelly, bit of a flat experience
Not a bad taste but everything is too runny.

The M&S "Our Best Ever" Trifle, 150 g, is so much better than this trifle. On this one I didn't enjoy the bottom layer - the pear, peach & pineapple cocktail in fruit jelly is too wet & crunchy - not a good contrast with the other layers which were excellent: sponge, custard & fresh cream. This is good value if you like crunchy fruit cocktail, but I prefer a compote layer.
Nice size and balance of layers. I don't have a sweet tooth do these are just right for me.
These trifles are delicious. A very good amount of delicious tasting custard and cream, plenty of nice refreshing fruit, the sponge was tasty as well.
The custard was tasty.  The fruit was cut in small pieces which made it pleasant to eat.  I would buy this again.
delicious trifle with sponge that isn’t dry.
Was pleased to discovery the refill option, works out cheaper and less glass wastage
I only buy these little beauties when on offer.  As others have stated, at full price they are more expensive than buying  a jar.  Regardless, the coffee is superb.
The pricing is bizarre. Significantly more than buying a jar.

I love Douwe Egberts coffee and like how there's a refill option but, what's the point in buying this when the jars work out cheaper per 100g?
The jars are so useful for storing other things that, I'll stick with those. Shame, as these refills are a good idea.
Why would I pay significantly more for a refil when the jar is less cost? The whole point is reducing the cost due to less glass/packaging.
Why is the cost of the refill over 40% more expensive per 100g than the glass jar!
This was nice enough for an instant coffee - I didn't experience the bitter aftertaste some of the other reviewers have mentioned and the overall taste was pleasant.
nice coffee but nothing special at the price
Nice, but nothing overly special!

I received this to review - I was delighted to receive some coffee as we get through an awful lot of it in our household! This is a good quality, robust coffee with plenty of flavour but, compared to our usual brand, thought it had a slightly bitter aftertaste. Perhaps it was an inferior batch as Ive had this brand before and had no issues. Husband said the same so not just me!
Sent this as a reviewer, not a lot to say about it except this is a quality cup of coffee which delivers good flavour and is nice to drink and delivers a well rounded cup of coffee
I don’t really drink instant coffee but I have it in for Frappes which I love especially at this time of year and as far as instant coffee goes this is good and makes a really tasty frappe :)
As far as an instant goes, this will do! Definitely need the jar to decant into to retain freshness
I was sent this coffee to review for Ocado , it has a lovely mellow taste and would certainly buy it again. I like the refill packaging although it is more expensive than the jar
Great clear coffee taste easy to drink and great to have in hand for a quick coffee gifted to review
Loved this coffee I was sent to review.Great price for 150gms and also as it is a refill pack. I would definitely recommend this lovely.
Classic quality from Douwe Egberts. A decent instant coffee for an easy, mellow cup during the day.
Good quality instant coffee with pleasant aroma and smooth taste
I was very happy to receive this product to review for Ocado. Its a lovely smooth tasty instant. Would definitely buy again!

We were sent this to review. I usually use the coffee that comes in tins if we aren't having 'proper' coffee, but this is delicious! Much prefer it; it is really smooth and not at all bitter. Will be buying this in the future. Having a refill to put into a jar rather than buying a new jar each time is a good idea too.
I was sent this to review. Overall a nice smooth coffee, personally I prefer a stronger blend but visitors loved it.
We were asked to review this product by Ocado. Convenient packaging and easy to decant into a tin or jar. Tastes really nice strong not bitter. Reasonably priced. Would buy.

I was sent this product to review and I can honestly say it is wonderful.
Great smell and wonderful taste. i would recommend it to anyone.

I was delighted to receive this product as a gift to review. This our favourite instant coffee brand and our go to coffee when we don’t use freshly ground. A great daily coffee, not bittter. Would definitely recommend, especially in a refill pack

This is the first time I have tried this product, I drink my coffee black and found it to be strong but not bitter, with great aroma. Disappointed to see the refill pack comes in packaging that cannot be recycled. I am more likely to buy the glass jar in the future.
First time trying the gold blend, very impressed will buy in future
I was sent this by Ocado to review. For instant coffee it have a lovely smoothed flavour making it a good choice for a quick coffee, I like that it’s a refillable package for the glass jars.
I was sent this free from Ocado in exchange for a review.Like this coffee very much its smooth to taste and smells delicious. Easy to use and more environmentally friendly.
Really love this coffee it’s smooth and tastes like coffee I would recommend this to all my family and friends to try

I was sent this product by Ocado to review.  I'm not normally an instant coffee drinker, however, this is actually very nice.  Normally I would love that a company has made a refill pack because of how eco friendly that is but on this occasion I find it dissapointing.  They have made a pouch that doesn't appear to be very recyclable to refill their glass jars which are infinitely recyclable. I have knocked a star off for this.
We enjoyed this coffee it has a good flavour and I found the packet great value.

It is a good quality roast coffee, just too pricy for 150g of golden roast coffee. I would expect that it would have been cheaper as a refill. I do like the coffee but for the price I would then rather choose Ocado own golden roast coffee.

I was sent a free sample of this by ocado to review. This makes a nice instant coffee, but can't say that it's anything amazing (but then instant coffee rarely is!). I think it's pretty expensive for what it is though, so doubt I'd buy again.

I was sent this to review. As far as instant coffee goes this is one of my favourites in terms of taste and flavour. However, when I buy coffee I go for organic and fairtrade so I wouldn't probably buy this one myself.
Very pleasant!
I was sent this product to review which was a bonus as I normally buy this product anyway- after trying many instant brands this has become our go to instant coffee - a good flavour.
I was sent this to review but I do actually have the large jar of Douwe Egberts so it was an easy and effective way of topping up without buying a new jar.

I was sent this to review by Ocado. A good, pure taste without any bitterness which we enjoyed. The idea of a refill is great, but don't understand why the refill price is higher than buying the coffee in a jar.
I usually drink nespresso coffee but was given this to review.  I think this is very good instant coffee.
I love this coffee and the fact it is a refill pack, but as other comments have said why is it more expensive for being a refill
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Same coffee. Which is not bad for instant with far less packaging. Win win.
the best instant coffee
Brilliant Instant Coffee. My friends always say 'nice coffee'.

As instant coffees go, this is our favourite.   Not bitter, rounded flavour.  

At full price, the refills are more expensive, per 100g,  than the jars, which is odd, but is not just Ocado, same pricing at other retailers. 

It has a long shelf-life, so we stock up when it's on special offer.
The same size much cheaper elsehwhere!
It really annoys me that the refill is more per 100g than the jar... sort it out Ocado!!
How can the refil be more expensive Per ml Ryan the jar?
This refill costs £4.50 at Sainsburys. Good product but I suggest that shop elsewhere.
I love this coffee and would prefer to buy the refill packets but WHY do Ocado charge more per 100gms for the refill, than buying the jar? Bad practice methinks.

I bought this based on reviews but it was binned straight after my first taste. Very weak with an odd flavour that tasted vaguely perfumed.
I drink Kenco Milicano normally and this was a very poor substitute.
almost just as good as from the coffee shop...
Little dark bits left in the bottom of the cup which didn't dissolve. Tastes alright.
cheaper when u buy as refill...
I love this. No other instant comes close. Last week Ocado subbed this with Nescafé. It may as well have been cat litter. Please don't do this again Ocado! -)
Really pleased with this, takes less space storing and costs less.

We usually buy another brand dragonfly.
This tetley one is not as strong.
My son absolutely loves this brand as it has a milder taste, and has a cup most evenings.
I find I have to seep the bag for long time but still a pleasant drink.
Received as s substitute for Dragonfly brand. It has a good taste award, and is cheaper, so thought I'd give it a go. But no, weird chemical peach-like flavour. Gave the box away.
If youre used to the dragonfly vanilla tea this is horrible - artificial and nasty. Cant drink it, going to have to bin
Substituted item that I wish Id returned. Nothing like redbush tea.  Has an artificial taste more like fruit
This tea tastes of artificial apple flavour rather than vanilla. Won't be buying again.
Love this tea. Calming . Caffeine free so let children early teens have it for hot evening beverage. They love it. Also can flavour/soak fruit in it for fruit loaf and it really works!

Full of flavour, especially if you seal in the flavour by popping a small plate on top of your mug whilst it's brewing, which makes it more aromatic. We occasionally add a dash of milk for a puddingy feel.
I think Im addicted to this now. We cant imagine an evening without having one!

This is so amazingly flavored. I have these with 2 tablespoon of full fat coconut milk and wow it is so tasty and it almost has this banana flavor to it for some reason when you mix coconut milk with it. Almond milk is divine with it too. I love this and the earl gray flavored one
Much cheaper than alternatives and a nice refreshing cup but Im afraid I much prefer the vanilla flavouring in other products.

Surprisingly better than more expensive brands.
Sweet vanilla taste
Horrendous, veg old and dry - most of it ended up in the bin. Could've been something dreamt up by the losing team on The Apprentice.
Not a good thai green curry taste then just loads of hard horrible cheap bits of veg. Ended up throwing half in bin.
This is so great as a healthy lunch option - packed full of veg and has a lovely aromatic Thai flavour. Will definitely be buying again!
Really did not like the taste of this. I used to really like the BOL veg pots but this has a strange taste and is too spicy. The veg stays hard and is just not pleasant to eat.
Taste absolutely horrible! Yuk …do not buy AVOID!
Massive stalks of hard kale type stuff is the primary problem, but apart from that its just not nice.
veg takes longer to cook and is half full when cooked..but tastes really good and flash sale price excellent

Urging people to reuse the packaging does not count as being ecologically friendly. If you're going to use plastic packaging, just own it and try your best for it to be 100% recycled or something. Calling packing '100% up-cyclable' is the equivalent of a carton of eggs saying you can built fort made from egg cartons instead of throwing them away. It doesn't mean anything and it's just irritating.
A lot of chunks of raw carrot. Wouldn't buy again
This 'curry' is horrible. Cabbage that's impossible to chew, hardly any sauce and an overwhelming taste of lemongrass. Yuck.
One of my favourite easy meals by far! Just fling it in the micro and you’re good to go filled with nutrients and it tastes amazing
It wasnt creamy and although full of carrots they didnt sweeten the  taste. It was very dry and bitter
Came as a substitution but we ended up throwing both pots away after a few bites. The lemongrass flavour is really overpowering and made it rather unpleasant.

This is definitely one of the better flavours alongside the Katsu curry. It has a strong flavour with a hint of spice at the back of your throat and there is a very strong flavour of lemongrass however the creamy coconut green curry flavour definitely comes through and it is a very filling lunchtime dish I would buy again
Blech
Took this to the office for lunch, very easy to heat up and filled me up so much.
I love to try all of the different BOL veg pots, but always come back to the thai green curry. So satisfying!
Enjoyed this for lunch. Will buy again.
This must be my favourite veg pot.  I cooked it on the hob, and added a dollop of mango chutney plus a little extra water, and heated.  It really finished the flavours off!  Thank you Bol
Lovely flavours would def buy again

Tastes VERY little like any kind of Thai curry, has an odd mix of spice + blandness + too-much MSG.  Barely half a potfull once cooked - so LOTS of waste plastic: don't kid yourself you're doing any kind of environmental good eating this stuff.
I love Thai green curry, this tastes nice and coconutty and is a healthy option for a light lunch.
Low calorie. Cooked on hob. I added Quorn pieces and was alright for a quick meal.

I think BOL must have made some changes to the recipe as this was not vinegary or sour at all.  It was spicy (and I love things super hot) but that seems to be all that's going for it.  There was a lack of depth and aromatics to the curry which is a shame.  That said, its does fill me up and is passable.  Would I buy again?  Yes for the convenience.  Could it be better?  Yes, it could be so much better if they look to balancing out the other spices in the curry.

Incredibly bad. Tasted really strongly of vinegar and the flavour was off. I love thai green curry it is one of my all time fav meals but this one is far from what it should be. I ordered a few and they were all thrown out. I liked the concept behind it but no....just no!
I’m always rushing about during the week and sick of grabbing a sandwich for lunch so gave this a try and will defo be trying the other flavours! Quick and tasty !
Tasted extremely sour, no resemblance to Thai Green Curry... inedible.
it, basically, is a pudding with chilli and lemongrass. its far too sweet to be enjoyable. had to throw it away. if there was a no star rating this horrible food would definately qualify for it!
One of the rare meal that went directly to the bin - flavor are badly balanced. Just bad.
Great lunch option this veg pot, super tasty and plant based as well. Really delicious!
Nothing special and there were some really big chunks of veg compared and some small so uneven for cooking so in turn either under cooked or over cooked
This pot was very fresh and easy to cook. If you like lemongrass, this is deffo for you, but was edging on soapy-tasting for my husband and me, as we found the lemongrass a bit too overpowering.
Very tasty, very nice! Really creamy and had a lovely little kick. Had it with a piece of salmon after a long day for a quick and healthy dinner
I loved this veg pot, it is actually like a Thai Green curry I have had in Thailand before, fresh veg takes centre stage!

I was sent this as a substitution and looking forward to giving it a go. As other reviewers have said, it’s not a Thai green curry.

You might like this if you like strong greens and lots of carrots with a slightly odd spicy taste, but that’s not Thai green curry and I didn’t like it at all! I’m really disappointed as this could have become a staple for me. Instead it was the most disappointing two of my five a day I can remember and I won’t accept it if substituted again.
Really enjoyed this Thai Green curry for lunch, felt super healthy, veg was fresh and made a proper meal. Delicious!
When on offer, it is so good to have for lunches. Great taste and really healthy.
Sadly they feel the need to add sugar! Please stop adding sugar to food that is not a pudding or a sweet. So disappointing. It's pretending to be heathy .

Absolutely nothing creamy about this at all. Nothing. Nothing Thai about it. Nothing Thai curry about it. It's a bunch of vegetables and rice (which remain crunchy and under-cooked after the allotted cooking time) in a pot, in a watery juice. It's also too spicy for a Thai green curry for mass-production and for a dish that is otherwise forgettable. MUUUUUUUCH prefer Soulful as a range and their Thai Green Curry is delicious.

Firstly, the Thai flavour was ok, a little spicy and creamy. 
But, the front label says the veg is corn and peppers. I has half a piece of corn, 4 slices of pepper and a VAST amount of carrot which I dislike. Once I’d picked it out, along with the rotten greens on top there was little left. 
Should have read the actual ingredient list!
Tried this as it was on special offer.  Not a vegan in the slightest but very much enjoyed this and a great idea for a quick and healthy lunch
tasted healthy and quick if in a hurry for lunch. didn't have a lot of flavor, definitely not spicy, tasted mostly of carrots and greens.
Easy to prepare and eat and tastes as fresh as if you've made it yourself. Well done bol!
We bought these for our lunch, but we really didnt like them. They smelt very strange when we opened them, and even worse as they heated up. Not for us Im afraid, they went in the bin!
Creamy as anything, was really fresh and perfect for a quick lunch. Absolute favourite. Nice amount of heat, not too spicy but enough for me.

As others have said, it's a sharp sauce that probably needs more coconut milk to take the edge off it but the flavour is good and it's not too spicy. There is a bit too much carrot in it for my liking, which is very crunchy given the short cooking time.
Nice and filling thanks to the rice, and great blend of Thai flavours, especially the lemongrass
I thought this was lovely and will order again. It has a strong flavour of lemongrass and a little kick of heat. It was quick and easy to make - perfect t when youve got a baby.
Nice flavour, so many different fresh ingredients would definitely buy again!
We both tried and could not get through it.

At last! A range of vegan ready meals full to the brim with vegetables, rather than endless beige and tomato. I really enjoyed this  a nice amount of spice-heat and natural sweetness with no need to add any salt. I can see that I will become a regular consumer of these!
This is such a time saver for lunches & they're so filling and with great taste
Love the creaminess of the sauce and lemongrass flavours coming through. Packed full of veggies and great as a quick, healthy dinner

Loved this curry. I brought it for lunch when I didn't have time to food prep. It was delicious and had some really nice fresh flavours. I actually really liked the lemon grass, I thought it was the best part and got a lot of comments on how great it smelled. Would definitely buy again! Also, under 400kcal? SOLD
heavy on the lemongrass! agree with others, sour taste. would not buy again.

I bought for lunch at the office and was hoping for a nice Thai style veggie curry. It tastes nothing like Thai curry which in itself wasnt too much of a problem but I found this had a really disgusting vinegary sour taste, I never throw away food but this was inedible!
SO ACIDIC. I get they need it to extend the shelf life but its inedible
Didn't really like. Bland taste. If had taste it been nice. Will not buy again
Love to bring these for lunch when I need something good and quick.
I have had this range before but this one is sour and really not nice
Dont expect this to taste like a take away as it is super healthy. Very tasty, 2 of your 5 a day. Cant go wrong for a light lunch

We got this in a flash sale, and these BOL meals are a great easy lunch.  I have liked all of them, and they are a super easy way to get a veggie heavy meal that’s hot.  You can also chuck in a bit of precooked chicken in the second heating if you want a little meat.
I got this in the flash sale, I didnt have high hopes for it but I was pleasantly surprised. Made a nice quick lunch on a busy day. Not sure I would pay full price though
I find it really hard to find Veggie thai food as everything seems to have fish sauce/shrimp paste in but this has Thai flavour and is Vegan!! Great
I like the Bol range but this was nothing like a real Thai, it had an awful strong fake lime taste to it. Shame as the ingredients seemed to be nice and fresh
I have been shopping for BOL for a long time and whenever I find the Thai Green Coconut Curry I have to purchase it! My favourite and have never been disappointed.
I thoroughly enjoyed this. With crunchy veg and filling rice, it made a perfect and easy lunch. Not at all hot like a green Thai curry, but it does have scrummy aromatic Thai flavours.
I love this Thai sensation. Tastes great, cooks quickly, and its healthy!!
Title says it all really, any Thai would be ashamed. It was edible I suppose . .
Perhaps one of the best microwave meals you can get

This is very bland. Some warmth in terms of chilli but none of those distinct fresh flavours you get from a green curry which is a disappointment as the vegetables  in the pot look very fresh. Even they tasted of nothing.
Good easy - and tasty! - way for me to get more veg in my diet. like the flavours and fact it is so fresh.
my go to healthy lunch/dinner. Very healthy and tasty thai dish. I do add a little salt to season and sometimes chicken if I eat for tea.

It does not taste anything like Thai curry. Very lemony and sour.
I won’t buy this again.
Love having these bol pots in the fridge for them I dont have time to cook dinner. Super quick and they taste awesome too
BOL is always part of my work lunches. Really tasty and healthy. Lunches at work have never been the same!
Despite the, mostly, good things in it, this was completely tasteless and without flavour as a curry. I couldn't finish it, and it also made my husband ill.

Looks very pretty in the pot, shrinks to half the size when cooked, but still filing. Had an authentic Thai taste, only comment is that it was a bit sweet and needed salt, and the kale was a bit chewy.
Just tried this for first time as was pushed for time and would not normally by a prepped meal - however it was delicious and I am a convert. Will define buying more Bol salads etc
honestly it was way too difficult to eat this, and I am an eat my veggies, fruit etc, healthy eating person. What I forced myself to eat was very filling though
Felt very fresh but also very tasty. Good flavours and was pretty filling which i suprised about. Really enjoyed!
Mostly not very tasty peas.  Tiny amount of spinach and didn't find any samphire.  Not good value for money.  Only gave 3 stars as husband quite enjoyed them.
Only bought as part of a meal deal. Some of the cabbage leaves were yellow and the peas nowhere near as nice as frozen ones!
The veg was fresh tasting, crunchy (to my liking) and easy to prepare. The dressing was nice too
I liked both the dressing and the vegetables. No complaints here!!

This is a great way to buy mixed green veg when you're in a hurry. It would get more stars if there was a better ratio of peas to other veg. There's definitely not enough samphire and way too many peas. Also the dressing is a bit sweet for my taste.
Pease slimy and rotten - didn't notice as they were hidden at the bottom. Ruined a meal. Won't buy again.
Always in my weekly basket. Very healthy and easy to prepare. I also love the sauce it comes with (which you can use or use your own).
It is an expensive way to buy a bit of veg but it was nice not to have to cook and the sauce was lovely! Minty and fresh!
Probably the worst pre packaged vegetable dish I have had the misfortune to eat. Went straight in the bin
I really enjoyed this. Nice and quick and really tasty. Good to have something different
This was nice, didnt use all the dressing though, ate the best bits for just me, had loads of peas left! Very expensive peas going to waste!

Lovely to have a 'green side' that's a little different! Was worried the dressing was going to be too strong but it was light and tasty.  Love the addition of samphire to the mix.  I added a tsp capers to the mix before microwaving, as it was a side to fish - it was delicious!
Not sure about the dressing though

A great selection of green veg, very tasty and the samphire adds a zest. Very easy to microwave when we dont feel like preparing veg. I don't always add the dressing, but save it for a side salad later.

If this dressing is lightly minted Id hate to try heavily minted?!! The heavy taste overpowered everything in the dish.
The greens wilt down to virtually nothing. 
I wouldnt buy this again
A really expensive way of buying peas! There is hardly any samphire or anything else in with this mix, rip-off!
I served this as a side alongside homemade fish pie. It was just the right amount for two people. The samphire was a nice addition. The dressing is pleasant but I think it would be nice without too.

I originally bought this as part of a meal deal and forgot about it.  I spotted it in my fridge on a veggie day.  I made the most amazing omelette with it adding a few sliced leftover new potatoes.  It easily fed 3 of us using 6 eggs and a little seasoning.
Really enjoyed this with some baked Sea Bass. Knocked off a star as would have preferred a knob of garlic butter than the dressing. Would buy again.

I really liked this selection of vegetables and the dressing was really nice. I had it with salmon.
Was fresh and healthy.
Samphire and dressing with this is delicious on the veg
I wasnt expecting much after reading some reviews but I always like to try things and make my own mind up. It was mainly peas but I found it really fresh and a great accompaniment with new potatoes
Right combo of vegetables and perfect for 2
Really tasty
Completely without redeeming feature. Beyond disgusting, went in the bin after one bite.
Didn’t like this at all, mushy and flavour not great
Really poor, barely any other constituent part! Only bought it as the standalone samphire was out of stock... which I note it still is!
I didn't microwave it, ate it fresh with the dressing and it was lovely! Will be buying and doing this again. Enough for two!
Loved the idea of this and unusual mix of veggies. Unfortunately not sure they work as a quick microwave option, felt very microwaved- soggy and limp. Would be nicer if time taken to flash fry in pan

Bought because ocado did not have any samphire. Thought that this was a bit tasteless and was mainly peas. Wasnt horrible but I had to add salt, pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice. Wont bother buying again.
Too many peas. I wanted more greens.
Not worth the money, was a pile of mush after cooking
There is a little spring greens and samphire - very nice and tasty but the awful peas ruin the pot . They are hard and tasteless like peas used to be years and years ago
Love the addition of the samphire for a bit of saltiness Great accompaniment to a salmon fillet!
OK, but too much vanilla taste and hardly any coffee.
Received as a product to review from Ocado, tasted quite weak and didnt really enjoy it..expensive for what it is.
I was sent this by Ocado to review .  Fairly strong taste for latte and has a very unpleasant aftertaste like evaporated milk . Wouldnt buy again
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Lovely tasting coffee best served ice cold. The vanilla wasn’t too overpowering either
I was given this free to review.  Although I like coffee I didn't like this, not sure why.  I think perhaps it was the vanilla.
I was sent this as a review product. It’s great as an instant iced coffee- good flavour and nice sweetness
Such a lovely creamy coffee, I don’t really like white coffee but that is amazing

I got this from Ocado to review and I enjoyed it ice cold .It could be a little bit sweeter for me but that is because I usually use maple syrup when I make my own.
Would I buy it again ? Yes, but only for a picnic or a day out.

This was very watery and had a weird taste to it. It's the first canned iced coffee I have actually poured down the sink, it was that awful! I am going to stick to the other makes in future, just thought I would try this as Costa is meant to be a good make. Very disappointed!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really enjoyed drinking this coffee, surprisingly it tasted barista-made and was delicious ice cold. It's not sweet (I thought it would be because of the vanilla). I would drink and buy again, but I think the price is a bit too expensive.
I was sent this item to review. It was OK but wouldn’t buy. I found it watery and lacking in flavour and no discernible vanilla flavour.

Was sent this to review.  I'm not a huge fan of vanilla flavour, so it was a little too much for me.  But, served over ice was a little better, and much improved after I'd added some coffee syrup.
If you like vanilla, go for it, and if not, go for another flavour!
This was sent free from Ocado to review. It arrived just when it was time for morning coffee. I’ve never tried cold coffee before, but found this very tasty. Would buy again
Not too bad, a tad too much on the vanilla side than I'd like but drinkable.
I was sent this by Ocado to review. I love coffee but not a fan of iced coffees. This was undrinkable and drowning in vanilla taste. Definitely would not recommend.

Sent for free by Ocado to try. Other half really enjoyed this, said it was a nice treat and not to sweet, if not for price it would be a regular, unfortunately this would just be a rare treat otherwise

I was given this by Ocado to review - I prefer a strong coffee without milk so was curious to taste this.  Too milky and not enough coffee taste for me but for someone who likes a milky coffee, this is probably perfect!
This was perfect if you want that coffee kick on a warm day.loved it!
Received this item to review. my husband had this drink at work and thought it was really good. Would buy again
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I wouldn't usually drink a latte as I like strong coffee, this is ok as a one off but I wouldn't buy it again.

'I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocao'
This drink has milk overwhelming the coffee to leave it weak and tasteless.

I received this free from Ocado to review and I have to admit that it's really quite good with a hit of vinilla balancing well with a  reasonably good coffee flavour. Would I buy it? Probably not, I'll stick to my bean-to-cup with my favourite beans and add my own vanilla. At £1.70 for 250ml, it's a bit pricey for what it is.
Love Costa coffee and this doesn’t disappoint. The vanilla is not overpowering, very subtle. Delicious chilled but remember to shake well before!

Great size portion, I find one does two water biscuits.
3 syns each on Slimming World.
love this in individual portions because I find the original package a bit gross.this is perfect! Garlicky and creamy with some herbs taste to it, love it

Fairly strong garlic aftertaste but that's garlic for you & we like it.  Good herb & garlic flavour. Good melted on top of boiled or jacket spuds & on any bread, crumpet, crackers. Medium thick spready consistency.  Separate portions help stop you having too much & there's no messiness of spread & foil to handle when returning the rest to the fridge.
We love it. Weekly order!
Love boursin but always end up wasting it.These individual packs are just the right size
Absolutely delicious!
I love boursin.  These are great to have in.
Convenient portion control... lovely. All mine ha.
Handy portions, nice garlic cheese
So delicious
Just love the garlic  flavour.  Great on Rude Health rice cakes.
So convenient to be able to have a fresh portion of la belle Boursin
Really lovely and tasty
Beautiful garlic creamy cheese and so much better in these portion control packs.Love it.
a smooth easy to spread cheese bursting with flavours
In convenient little portions. Perfect for travel when you need a satisfying snack. I take two portions to spread on six Cornish wafers. Just right.
I use these to stuff bacon wrapped chicken breasts, lovely creamy herby goodness! Better than other brands of soft cheese.
It's a pleasure to find this product in the UK.
Ooh these were fab, even the fussy relatives loved them on the cheese board and one is perfect on a jacket potato too.
I can't believe I just found these! Love them,  keeps me from eating a whole pot!
Use this to stuff breast of chicken then wrap in bacon and cook in oven smells lovely when cooking and tastes even better on your plate

Yummy could eat all day lovely tastes just quite small
Portions.

These taste delicious and I purchased because I don't use a whole tub and the tub has to be consumed within three days.

These last 9 days my last batch and so still ended up throwing half away!
Great with separate portion size lasts longer and cleaner
Much easier than buying a large cheese. Great for kids' sandwiches or to mix into a portion of pasta.

Very delicious  and garlicky. Lovely with Nairns oatcakes. or baked potatoes. Portion pack means no waste. I was buying full pack before and throwing it away but this means less waste  and keeps longer.
Really creamy and lovely flavour. The 6 individually wrapped portions are very convenient too.
I keep this in the fridge or freezer for cooking. Handy size so as not to waste any. Perfect for muffins and French toast mixture.
Nice and chocolate, good calorie-wise!
Delicious and low calorie. Barely noticed the difference. Love the travel packs, really handy.
I used to buy this when counting calories however I recently learnt it has palm oil in. Please do not purchase and put pressure on Cadburys to stop using palm oil. Google palm oil/ orangutans.
This has a very bad aftertaste. Yuck.

Normally I cannot stand hot chocolate made with water but this really was very nice. Did not taste watered down like often low calorie hot chocolates do. At only 38 kcal per mug I'd say this is a definite winner.
It's watery and a bit too sweet but it's one of the best of the low calorie instant hot chocolates. OK if you're slimming but I wouldn't bother otherwise.
Really delicious mixed with a little milk before pouring the hot water in. It does not taste like a low calorie hot chocolate!
Not bad and does have a slight after taste which doesn't appeal to me. it is clean tasting and I like the fact it contains no plastic.

This organic white tea is fair-trade and organic, so I bought it. I love the taste, as it is closer to black tea than to white tea and I would love to drink it regularly. It has a strong, warm and a bit sweet and lightly smokey flavour like English breakfast, but much richer.  If I was not looking for a tea low on oxalate, I would have kept drinking it daily (green and white tea are much lower on oxalate than black one). But as it tastes not as delicate as white tea tends to taste, but closer to a black tea, I fear there will be more oxalate in it. I am not giving 5 stars, because I assume people who want white tea buy it for the white tea taste and this would be a misleading rating. Regarding the price and it nevertheless being organic and fair-trade, one can't expect a white tea made from the finest and youngest leaves, I guess, so the stronger taste and it being in between white and black tea was most likely to be expected and for this I am thinking it is a very good tea.
I’ve been drinking this one for years and think it tastes delicious. Of course it’s better as a loose leaf tea, but this is less fuss
The white tea I know is supposed to have a subtle sweetness to it. This tastes like ash
This hasn't got the delicacy expected from white tea. Going back to Dragonfly

The portions are very small and you really need to have juice on hand to make them otherwise they are a bit tasteless - the sweetness of apple juice brings out the flavour. 
You can put your own ingredients together much more cheaply. These packs of 4 have just gone up by a pound and so I cant justify it anymore
Tastes great, has a good selection of fruit and it's very convenient to use.

I bought the Pack'd Energy Smoothie kit as a regular smoothie drinker, but to try something new instead of buying chilled ones. I was happy with the portioned bags of fruit and I chose to just add water. It made a tasty smoothie in seconds.

Really easy to put into the blender and add liquid, making it like 2 mins to make a smoothie.  Not overly sweet, mellow flavours but I liked that as meant not one domineering taste.  I used lacto free milk and it was a thick consistency but still drinkable through a straw.

These are the ultimate in healthy but lazy smoothies, in our house time is short but we all grab one of these for a breakfast healthy option, (we use half almond milk half raw coconut water & I add collagen powder to mine too) all the flavours are great & its lovely to have the 3 new flavours in the range, the superfood mix saves so much time as well... fabulous.. please keep them in stock regularly ocado
We were not impressed at all with this dish. The pasta was hard, it was tasteless and personally I think massively overpriced. Over £7 for this?! Will not be purchasing again, Im afraid
Even my fussy husband seemed to enjoy it, zero hassle to prepare and made a nice comforting bowl with some ciabatta bread.
Not gourmet but easy and satisfying for a family
Lovely easy meal and very nice. These big packs are great I’d say it feeds 2 adults and two small children. It would be brilliant if there were more of the family sized meals on M&S ranges.
For £6 I cant complain. Not saying its the best ever but a huge portion. Such an easy tea. Had it with rocket garlic bread and Parmesan. Would buy again if too busy to cook
Great snack size so good for kids lunch without being too heavy on pastry
The only thing about this less crust quiche that could be improved is removing palm oil as an ingredient. Not needed.
First of yes it is very small but I got this in a flash sale and have to say it's the perfect lunch, Very tasty and would buy again
Fantastic little quiche , lovely flavours
I thought this was lovely, better heated and then left to cook at room temperature

This is a tasty quiche but it is miniscule. I bought it as an easy meal for myself - but ending up having to prep and cook so many extra things to my plate in order to make a proper meal that i won't bother again. Shame. Even as a single portion, it is very small.
absolutely delicious, so much flavour and loved the no crust! base was just right and filling so good. will be buying again!

I oven baked this little quiche and it was delicious. It looked very small but it is quite rich so it was a perfect portion with some asparagus and salad.
It was very buttery and cheesy with a nice salty hit from the ham. It has minimal pastry with just a base but it didnt feel like a diet dish or like it was lacking anything.
I will certainly be buying this again.
Like many crustless quiches, this does have a disk of pastry as the base which didnt bother me. The egg part was pleasant but rather bland. Will probably buy again as a quick breakfast.
It tasted good and was gret texture but I am on a keto diet and this S NOT CRUSTLESS. IT HAS A CRUST OF THICK PASTRY ON THE BOTTOM OS IT NEEDS A NAME CHANGE.   i LIKE IT BUT REALLY ....

'Don't care much for shortcrust especially crisped or well done so no qualms cooking my quiche in the microwave. . It kept its shape & tasted good, alhough the small pieces of ham were a bit sweet for my taste. Consistency & cheese flavour was fine. . Served with cooked fresh tomatoes it made a surprisingly satisfying meal. Disappointed I don't see more 'crustless' savouries are available in this size.

Delicious! Normally serve hot- in oven or microwave.
Love without the crust! Mmmm
Never again

Not an ounce of taste.
I will be going back to buying fresh and cooking myself
Poor shelf life once opened
Went to use these today (still had one day on the best before) but the bag was ready to explode and I had to Chuck them all away, I think they were off and didnt want to risk it

These were great when I first purchased it but subsequently bag puffs up before use by date. Taste also not been consistent. Really like beetroot and thought this was a great product and better than the longer life ones but end up wasting it due to puffiness. Have phoned customer services to report the issue, hope they pass it on to the manufacturers.
Doesn't taste or feel like fresh but lasts no longer. Not good
We went to use this with a salad and the bag seemed overly inflated. Opened and yes it was already off, even though well before sell by date.

Beetroot freezes very well so I always take these straight out of the bag and freeze individually. They defrost fairly quickly so can be used exactly as needed on each occasion. Lovely with melted goats cheese and other savoury dishes as well as salads.
The bag puffed up and beetroots went bad before expiry date, twice in a row.
I had one of these a while back and was good but recently the beets are very solid and are not enjoyable to eat

I bought these as I hate the thick, messy to open plastic packs of the other beetroot.  However these were tasteless and had such a short life before the bag puffed up tight which I took to mean, they were fermented.  I shall not buy these again.

I have had these beetroot for at least 9 months every week. The last 3 weeks they are horrible. The packet looks like it is going to explode when delivered, the out of date is still 3 to 4 days away but when you open they are mouldy and furry. Poor quality
