I bought 2 bags and both were swollen.  Beetroot had gone off before sell by date.  Had to throw it all away.   What a waste!
Same as previous review bag swelled up and was fit to burst. This was before the best before date too.. had to open bag so it didnt explode in the wheelie bin! Smelt awful

Weve been buying these regularly for over a year, and usually enjoy them. However, with the last batch received this week, we had exactly the same issue as the reviewer below - the bag was seriously inflated days before the Use By date. I did open the bag and have a look and taste out of curiosity, and they were slimy in appearance and also slightly fizzy to the taste! Not right at all. I had to bin the whole lot, even though it was two days before the Use By date (and only a couple of days after delivery). They are not normally like this,  maybe a recent batch has got warm at the warehouse in the recent hot weather?

Despite being refrigerated immediately after delivery, in a couple of days the 2 packets I had ordered swelled up and looked about to explode several days before their use by date.
So I was not prepared to risk eating them and threw them straight in the bin. That was the first and last time I had bought this product.
These are so good! Nice to add into a salad or to just eat one daily if youre trying to up your beetroot intake. Very sweet and a nice change from pickled.
Amazing! I wish I knew about these earlier! I bought them on a whim and I'm so glad I did. Fresh, crispy and not overly sour.

Have tried all other fresh beetroot packs and this is ultimately my favourite. Only downside is that it doesnt last long in the fridge  even though it is sealed, after about 3 days it starts to go funny.
Lovely beetroot. My daughter enjoys this so much. Great for soups and salads.
Had a couple of bags of these now, but I tend to find they do not last.  Think I stick to pickled

The beetroot are cooked perfectly with a good texture, and I didn't see any peel in our bags. They lasted well for a few days in the fridge. The first bag we had was delicious, very tasty. The second was a little bland which was a bit disappointing.

I find this to be the best cooked beetroot that Ocado
stock but would much prefer if it was peeled as the
outer part can be very rough.  Would certainly be
willing to pay a few pence more for it.

I've previously used the Gefen vacuum packed beetroot which is great. Unfortunately on this occasion that was out of stock so I was forced to use Florette despite some of the bad reviews. I wondered how bad it could possibly be. Very bad it turned out. The beetroot is devoid of any taste whatsoever and the texture is slightly odd as well. The recipe I used it in was lovely, but marred sadly by this poor excuse for beetroot.
It's handy to have the beetroot preprepared like this, but this one doesn't taste of much. Ocado stocks a different pre-prepared beetroot that tastes much nicer.
I have bought this a few times. The last package was really bad - the beetroot was dry and tasteless. Will not buy again.
Tasteless and odd texture.  Was a substitution for fresh beetroot.  Would definitely not buy again.
Love that these beetroot are so conveniently packaged, easy to get just the correct amount and reseal without drying out or juice leaking everywhere.
I use these for baking, salads, juices etc, very versatile and delicious
I get this in from time to time and Im very happy with this product. I use in tray bakes or on the side.  Lovely flavour.

I very disappointed with these beetroot.   I love ffreshly  cooked beetroot just as they come, warm from the water, but these have no flavour, and a slightly rough surface ( dont know what causes that, )   In desperation i served them in a very well seasoned white sauce.    I will try serving the remainder in some kind of salad dressing - hoping to give them some flavour.  OCADO PLEASE NOTE PLEASE STOCK BEETROOT TO COOK AT HOME!
These go off in the fridge quicker that the vacuum packed organic ones.  OK if you're going to finish in a day or two but I need longer. Won't buy again.

Slimy and beyond it long before date.
Fibrous

These are OK but I am missing fresh beetroot. I used the first packet in soup and it was fine. I was going to try the second packet in a salad but they had gone slimy and revolting even though they were still in date so they went in the bin. Texture is pretty soggy so fine for soup but not sure how they would be in a salad
This beetroot is excellent. Ready to eat with no vinegar, so you cannot expect it to last long. The bag is great, easy to open and easy to seal.

Dont really understand all the poor reviews for this. We have only had good quality beetroot sent. It does go off quickly once opened but I guess this is to be expected for cooked beetroot that isnt pickled.

Only purchased because Ocado no longer stock raw red beetroot. These were not to my taste, being overcooked (way too soft and squishy) and a very strange texture. PLEASE Ocado stock normal raw beetroot at a sensible price. I don't want heritage ones that have a completely different taste, or this mush.
Great that it is just steamed and no vinegar or spices, so I could make Borscht with it quickly and easily
Great product - clean fresh taste - however only lasted for one more day then started to go soft and flavour deteriorated
Definitely my favourite if I can't get hold of raw.  However,  I tried freezing it - which was not a success,

gave up the lengthy home cooking of beetroot long ago. This is the best tasting cooked, non pickled beetroot I've been able to find and so glad to see that Ocado have started stocking it. The other non pickled beets I've tried are old, bland tasting and soggy in comparison. THIS ONE IS STEAMED NOT BOILED like others I've tried. If you've used both methods in your home cooking you'll know how much of the beet root ends up in the boiled water and how much better steaming is... but how lengthy. I pop these bags in the freezer and take out one, two or three beets for my daily smoothy depending on size and what I feel like having.. I'm on medication that causes indigestion and reflux. My beetroot smoothies absolutely help control this well. I use after dinner and don't crave antacids a while after eating. Please keep selling this brand Ocado. I can't stand the boiled beets and its great they can be frozen and easily separated.
Lovely moist beetroots. Love the handy bag and it hasn't got vinegar etc on them. Delicious.

I have been buying fresh raw bunches of beetroot for months but Ocado you have now stopped selling it...why...as this packed beetroot has absolutely no flavour. 
Please bring back the raw bunches
Ends arent cut off properly and unless eaten straight away they go off very quickly in packet once open.
When I opened the packet, the beetroots were soft and slimy rather than firm. I thought it was just the one in the bag but all of them felt the same, so had to chuck the whole lot away.
I sometimes have it on their own with oil + vinegar, or mixed in a salad. Great taste!
Not sure what it is with these beetroots, but like others have said, the package bloats and the content goes off very quickly. I have thrown the second one away and am not going to get them again
Our bag exploded in the fridge 🤷‍♂️ Not sure why
Don’t buy these beetroots, delivered expired !!! Waste of money, I bought two packs and both were same expired, straight away to rubbish bin....
Lovely cooked beetroot without additives, in an easy resealable pack which stands upright in the fridge to avoid spills. Perfect!

These would be lovely beetroot if you actually got the chance to eat them before the packaging inflates like a balloon within 24/48 hrs of purchase causing the beets to become slimy and inedible.
Having only managed to eat 4 individual beets from a total of 3 puchases, I won't be buying these again.

this is not a bad product but it never comes with much of a shelf life and it becomes really slimey. If you are buying it to eat on the day of delivery or maybe a day or 2 after then its good otherwise do not buy at all!

I went to get the beetroot out for our salad lunch. The beetroot had gone manky. I had only opened it a couple of days previously and it was kept in the fridge. Fortunately I had some Waitrose Baby Beets in vinegar. Will always buy these in future. They are in a glass bottle unlike M&S’s beetroot which is now in a plastic container. What will happen when Ocado & M&S merge?? I’ll have to continue shopping with Waitrose for certain items.

The first couple of times I purchased these they had a great use by of almost a week. But ever since the use by has been a few days, which simply isn't good enough. Aside from that a pretty good product quality wise, but frankly other than being less wet, no better than vacuum packed plain beets at a third of the cost with months shelf life.

Received on a Monday with a Use By date of Friday.  There are lots of little beetroots in this bag and it was really nice beetroot,  but it became inedible very quickly compared to the vacuum packed type.  I had no chance to eat them all in time, sadly.

I thought this was really nice. I might even eat it all in one go!
Just read the other reviews. I can’t believe the bad ones. 
Have just put it in my next order. 
Is the best beetroot I’ve ever had!!
Tastes good and price fair when on offer. However on my 3 times of ordering I find the Best Before End date is within about 4 days not giving us much time to eat it all.
There was something wrong with these beets. Woody texture and mildly rotten taste.
Very good quality, and it's very healthy. Now on my weekly list

Have never had such awful beetroot, not even trimmed.
Will not be purchasing again.

Though the use by date looked decent, the packet blew up like a balloon well before that. Literally on the second day post delivery. Smelt ok, so i washed them and just in case, warmed them up on bbq, it was off inside soured and awful. Certainly no substitute to raw beets, leave alone when it is clearly off despite what the packet label says!
This beetroot taste fresh and more firm to touch, i like the idea that it doesnt have a long span of life, hence no preservative.

Tasteless and hard - awful substitute for bunched beets.  I received this as a substitute for the delicious, sweet, bunched beets from Spain we have enjoyed every week - never again!  There is absolutely no comparison.

Ordered 2 packs, ate the first one which was tasteless and threw away the 2nd one as the consumption date was very close.
Will  not buy again.
I agree with the last few reviews. I accepted this as a substitute for my usual Waitrose bunched beetroot. Never again. It was completely tasteless!
First time I've ever thrown away beetroot
no taste at all.
You can't even make soup with this. This is so inferior to normal bunched beetroot I boil and bake. No taste at all! Even I'd say unpleasant.
This beetroot is disappointing. The texture is coarse and the beetroot lacks sweetness and flavour
Love these quick and easy to use and full of flavour plus with the resealable packet they last a lot longer
The most tasteless beetroot I have tasted. Disappointing. Will never buy this brand again.
These used to be really tasty but the last two packets we received were hard and tasteless. Unfortunately we will now be changing to another brand.
Looks and tastes like old beets , not fully cooked far to firm . Tried several times all the same hence this review

Always tastes fresh and sweet - yes it's a bit bland, but it's a steamed, unseasoned beetroot, what do you expect?! Never had any problem with them being mushy, under or overcooked. The perfect blank canvas!

Really did not enjoy this beetroot. It was very bland and also undercooked. The packaging is great, much better than the vacuum packed versions. Shame the packaging is let down by the product inside. Will not repurchase.
They’ve managed to make beetroot taste of nothing, horrible!

I added this beetroot to my salad and I think it tastes really lovely and fresh. So much nicer than beetroot soaked in vinegar. It lasts a long time in the fridge too. I’ll be adding this to my weekly shop.
Cooked at right level. This Beetroot+walnuts+garlic+mayonnaise = Great salad

This is a brilliant product and so useful. The seal bag keeps it fresh, it’s lovely unadulterated beetroot with no vinegar, sugar or salt and ready to eat. So useful to have in the fridge to whip up easy, tasty meals or salads without the faff, mess and purple staining of cooking actual beetroot. Lovely with goats cheese or feta and even vegan cheese but also brilliant in risotto and I’ve also used them in a vegan Dahl
It is absolutely tasteless, like nothing in your mouth. I guess if you mix it with something else you don’t feel it, but It doesn’t have any taste by itself.

What a find. I love making a smoothie with apple, ginger, beetroot, and greens.. but cant really be bothered to cook and peel beetroots. No fuss, no mess, tasty and versatile. I freeze them after opening as the shelf life isnt too long. Will but every week!
Tasted delicious and v easy to prepare. Would echo what other reviewers have said about it not being in vinegar! I had them in a smoked mackerel and kale salad and they were so easy to prepare.
Finally cooked beetroot that is not pickled in vinegar!
Useful extra veg and salad ingredient. Not wonderful, but quite good when dressed.
Nice to find precooked beetroot not in vinegar but flavour doesn't quite match up to boiling fresh ones and not organic
A very earthy flavour, more than usual. And even after another 1.5 hours of cooking, they remained too hard to cut with a fork.

Love fresh beetroot and this is the best pre packaged stuff Ive found, no overpowering vinegar taste just pure beetroot! Soooo good. Only downside is it doesnt keep for long so consume within a couple of days!
Delicious beetroot simply steamed nothing else, excellent with some feta cheese and a balsamic dressing. Size of beetroots varies from medium to small but that's ok.
Love the resealable bag. I put these in salads, smoothies, or serve as a side dish to just about anything when we need a dose of purple veg!
Nearly as good as home cooked. Great for salads and smoothies
This is the best beetroot we have bought. It is eaten within 1 day as it is so lovely. Recommend.
Loved the flavour.
Lovely beetroot, no vinegar and sweet and tasty.
I love fresh cooked beetroot, without vinegar.  This fails to hit the spot on all levels however.  It's dry, hard and completely tasteless.  So bad, I had to bin it, which I hate doing.
Great product, really helpful packaging

Loved this beetroot, great fresh taste
The bag it comes in stands up in the fridge! And reseals
No leaks or putting it in a bowl it then stains! Brilliant
At last, earthy, fresh, firm cooked beetroot without vinegar.
best cooked beetroot. yum

I discovered these by accident when my usual brand were out of stock. What a find! They are good even sized beetroots that are very versatile as there is no added vinegar. Moreover, they are sweet and very, very tasty. I usually have to go to all the trouble of roasting and peeling my own to get such a yummy result. They are now a regular purchase as we all love beetroot.
Great to make a beetroot and feta salad, or for soup. We buy this regularly since discovering it.
So nice to get vinegar-free beetroot. Love these!
Naturally sweet and delicious ! Really happy to find steamed beetroot and NO vinegar! Delicious

much prefer these to beetroot in vinegar
very tasty
have bought several times and never been disappointed
Nice to be able to buy cooked beetroot without vinegar.  However mine were coated in a thick layer of deep purple slime so went into the bin.

I prefer to the vacuum packed ones and boiling your own is a chore. You can add herbs and spices to them if desired. If they are near their use by date then just slice them up and put in a container with vinegar which will lengthen their life.
I have bought these before and they were good. This time I can only describe them as slimy and soft, I won't be buying them again.
These are pretty much as good as home baked ones, and much nicer than the vacuum packed ones. Full of earthy flavour and a firm texture.
Tried and added these ready cooked beets today to a salad and they were absolutely fine and tasty. I dont understand the negative reviews, maybe the quality is inconsistent, time will tell.

I cannot find anything good to say about this product sort from the packaging. The beetroot were tasteless and had no flavour whatsoever. The texture is also quite odd. I ended up throwing away the remaining products in the pack.
Had this as part of a salad, had high hopes but was pretty much tasteless.

I often find when buying vacuum packed beetroot that it is not peeled very well, there's often bits of skin and root left on. All of the beets in the pack were perfectly prepared. It tasted ok but it wasn't the best I have had, it didn't taste as fresh as other brands I have had. I don't think I will pay £1.50 for a pack, mine was 50p as it was on special offer with a coupon as well.
Bland and tasteless

Lacking any sort of beetroot taste or sweetness.
Bland! Will not buy again.
Just cut this babies and mix with some feta cheese, mint and warm chickpeas. Delicious. I dont understand the bad reviews. They are perfect and thanks God no vinegar!!!
Very disappointed with this beetroot. Went in the bin as it was really slimy and had an odd taste.
I love beetroot and eat it usually vacuumed packed from all the major supermarkets for between 60p-1.00. This is awful soft weird and not just tasteless but strange taste, threw away.

My delivery was Thursday afternoon and the use by date was Monday. I didnt have a chance to eat these, so I have no idea if they were nice or not! The use by date was obviously really short for a vegetable. I wont be buying again as I will get beetroot with a longer shelf life.
good quality beets, good price and vinegar free
My husband really liked this, saying it was some of the tastiest beetroot that he has had.
Taste nice but hard to get past the strange slime coating them.  I can't work out what it is because the ingredients list is "beetroot" but I probably wouldn't pay full price for them.

I have tried almost all beetroots without vinegar at Ocado and prior to this one, have been using duchy organic which used to be nice, but since December comes overcooked and mashy. So this one was great discovery. It is not overcooked or mashy, is full of flavour and taste.

Nice product, less mess than the other cooked beetroot that comes in water/beetroot juice, because of this they taste just slightly less. Had open for a few days and didnt feel the product dried out any more, would buy again if on offer.

It's nice to see cooked beetroot available without vinegar. This was a nice addition to a salad. I also added some to a meat pasta sauce and went down well with our young children. Always nice to sneak some more vegetables into their food!
Im surprised that others didnt like these. I thought they were very nice. I ate them with green salad, feta and nuts. Tasty!!
Bought on a flash sale....enjoyed, was firm, tasty and fresh
I really enjoyed this, not too vinegary, still crunchy, great taste.
Agree with other reviewers that the beetroots lacked flavour.
cooked beetroot is usually sweet, this variety / product is entirely bland. doubt I will purchase again. back to cooking and steaming it myself

I got a packet of Florette beetroot delivered yesterday and it had a date of 20/1/18 and opened the packet today. Some of the beetroot was slimy and mushy, while others were hard and it smelt off.  The beets vary in size. I don't think I would buy these again.

Used in a filter machine, found this to have a very strange, astringent aftertaste.

You get hints of chocolate, but that's the only positive I can give for this coffee.
I tried this coffee but its not for me not strong enough and slightly bitter

This is by far the best coffee in the Cafe Direct range, i have tried all of the others that they do and most of them are pretty average, it's organic and a very well balanced flavour, very nice coffee 5 stars.

This might be my new default supermarket coffee.
I'm looking forward to it being on offer again, & hope Ocado start selling this in larger bags as whole beans.

An intense coffee full of flavour without any bitter undernotes usual for Mexican Coffee , tastes more like an Indonesian Coffee with caramel chocolatey flavours .
I taste a lot of coffees through my job and this is the coffee I drink at home.
This coffee is beautiful, rich tasting without the bitterness, my new favorite and on special offer right now! Try it you won't regret it
Really love this coffee
No fault with this coffee, i used it everyday on my coffee machine and will buy it again
I received this free sample, and enjoyed drinking it. Good robust flavour, and would consider buying it again.
I have received the product for a review. I usually use coffee beans so I am probably biased. It is an ok coffee, makes a nice cup and the aroma is pleasant, that is as much as I can say, really.

We were long time drinkers of Waitrose own brand Mocha coffee and were really disappointed when it was discontinued. We have finally found our replacement with Mayan Gold. Its full bodied with rounded flavour but smooth at the same time, and not harsh or astringent like some strong coffees can be.
Received this coffee free to review and I really like it - smooth & rich.
try it! you won’t regret

I received this to review. I am an avid coffee drinker and have tried many brands and I have to say this is one of the best yet. Full bodied yet no bitterness. The other reviewers are right, the caramel notes are easier to smell than taste but then again if you’re after caramel coffee you can always add syrup or use one of those caramel flavoured instant coffees. If you like your coffee robust and flavoursome however, then this is for you. I only wished it had been a pack of beans not grounds so I could have poured it into my machine instead of having to use a cafetière!

I was given a pack by Ocado to review. I added plenty of coffee to my cafetiere and it produced a good full bodied brew which I quite enjoyed. I had to try hard to detect a hint of the caramel sweetness advertised on the packet.
I did not enjoy this coffee. To get a decent strength (I do not enjoy particularly strong coffee) I found I had to use a lot of it and it still came out weak and tasting like burnt coffee.
I was given this to review by Ocado and enjoyed it. However, I couldn't taste the "caramel sweetness". I think the packaging should make more of the organic angle.
I was given this by Ocado to review and I was really pleased to do so.Lovely smooth taste particularly liked the caramel flavouring which was not too overpowering.
Decided to try as I’m intending to switch to organic coffee. It’s nice and smooth, but, for me, it doesn’t have that oomph I was hoping for. The search continues.

I received this coffee to review. It was ok but not as full favoured as I like. I usually buy an espresso blend and have my favourites, so was comparing this to those. Pretty good but not quite for me.
Quite a good brew. But nothing too special. There was a certain nuttiness that came through.
Not the most amazing coffee but a good decent everyday one that one can enjoy with nice aroma and not too strong body.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
This was a perfectly good, full flavoured coffee but I expected more. The promise of caramel notes didn’t really deliver and I didn’t enjoy it enough, to want to switch from my regular ground coffee.

I was asked by Ocado to review this and sent a free sample.  It is a very rich and nutty flavoured coffee.  I really enjoyed it and will be buying more.  Also good to know it's fairtrade.  Everyone deserves to be paid fairly for their work.
Gratefully received this product for free to review. Lovely coffee, and fair-trade too! Nice and strong with a definite hazelnut note. I will buy this again.
I was sent this free to review by Ocado. It is a decent coffee: smooth but not particularly memorable.
A really nice coffee, smells lovely as it is brewing.  Normally have Italian Ocado blend but will have this for a change now and again
I received this free in return for a review. It was good coffee, not sure I would switch from my normal brand but will happily drink it.

Received this to review from Ocado
Great tasting coffee, smooth and rich in flavour. Would buy again.

I was pleased to be offered this coffee to review by Ocado as I love coffee. I really enjoyed the strong flavour this coffee has, its smooth and rich and made a lovely start to the day. Ill definitely be buying it in the future and exploring the range.
Delightful aroma and full flavour. Can be a bit bitter if left to brew too long. But overall great coffee for a good price.
I'm reviewing this product because I received a free sample from Ocado. I love strong coffee and this fits the bill. It's rich and smooth.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really lovely coffee - strong and rich in flavour.
Lovely rich coffee, with just the right hint of bitterness. Not too drying in flavour whilst still remaining quite bold.
Rich, satisfying flavour, and smelled wonderful. I'd buy again.

I got sent this to review by Ocado and had my doubts but it made a lovely rich cup of coffee and filled the kitchen with a warm, enticing coffee aroma. Would recommend and buy again as a treat as still a bit more expensive than my usual Lavazza option.
Good quality coffee from a brand with a good reputation
Received this from Ocado to review. Its a nice smooth coffee, the caramel flavour is pleasant and not too strong. The packaging isnt recyclable which is a shame.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. We usually buy Cafedirect organic coffee, so were interested in trying this. It's a balanced, smooth and well-rounded coffee for discerning coffee drinkers.

I was sent this for free in exchange for an honest review. It's good coffee with a lovely aroma on opening and a nice rich flavour. That said, I am solidly loyal to Lavazza Qualita Rosso and this wasn't quite good enough to tempt me away.
Excellent coffee. Will be buying regularly
Has a really interesting flavour, which I don't usually find with strong coffees. Makes a great espresso as well!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Completely surprised by how nice this coffee was! Smooth, well-rounded flavour and didn't find it bitter like some other brands that I've tried. Would purchase again!

Delicious coffee
I would but again, good flavour though no overt caramel overtones

I was given this free to review. I love filter coffee, especially first thing. This is rich without being heavy, it’s flavour reduces the need for added sweetness although I wouldn’t call it sweet or fruity at all. It gives you that hit of Aah! or Ooh Lovely! that you want from every good cuppa. Would happily buy regularly. It’s a crowded market but this is in my top 5 go-to’s.
I was sent this by Ocado to review, A bit stronger than our usual coffee, but really nice. Very smooth and would buy again. We brewed in cafetière

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I usually purchase stronger Italian espresso coffee as I find some filter coffee weak and flavourless... this was a very pleasant surprise. It's smooth, sweet, full of flavour and nice smell. I liked it, I will definitely buy it again.

We were given this to review. My husband's favorite coffee is the Cafe Direct Machu Picchu. On tasting the Mayan Gold, he said it was even nicer than his usual coffee.  He brews his coffee using a Chemex Coffee Maker.

I was sent this to review and was very happy to receive it. A lovely strong flavour, similar to this brand's other 'level 5' but a bit smoother and sweeter. The best brand for strong filter coffee in my opinion!

I was sent this to review by Ocado and it's not bad. Normally I don't drink filter coffee preferring espresso but this was sent my way so why not try it? Decently strong and not over-roasted (a problem with almost all coffees in my opinion) it was one of the better filter coffees I've tried.  I'd certainly consider the brand if I needed to buy again.

We received this to review. A really
Nice smooth and tasty flavour. Not too strong or over powering. Just right. Would buy again.
I was sent this to review my husband is a total coffee snob and won't usual buy ground but commented how nice this was!

My husband likes strong coffee and was expecting great things from this as it sounded lovely from the packet. Sadly the actual taste was nothing like promised, no caramel sweetness as started on the packet. Not smooth, almost stale, despite following the instructions to give a fair review. But not for him.
I received a free sample from Ocado to review. We usually buy Lavazza coffee and this was just as good. A smooth rich flavour. Will buy again.
Great flavour and ethical

I was sent this to review. Can't say I'm a coffee connoisseur so I can't speak to the tasting notes etc, but it's a nice coffee! Perhaps a little expensive, but I love Cafedirect as a company and their ethics, so would be happy to pay a bit more.

I was sent this free to review. I really enjoyed it and would definitely buy again. I usually buy Lavazza Qualita Rossa and this is similar in strength and quality, rich and really delicious. And with the added bonus of being fair trade. I would buy it in future.
I was given this coffee in return for a review. Very nice coffee, smooth and strong. Will certainly buy again.

I was given this as a free sample to review by Ocado. 
We enjoyed this coffee - a lovely flavour, not too bitter!
Most of all I am pleased to see Ocado stocking this brand as, unlike so many others, buying this product supports the farmers / growers, rather than exploiting them. 
We would definitely recommend both the flavour and the ethics!!
I was sent this to review and really enjoyed it! It was rich and full of flavour. Lovely coffee. I really like the company’s ethics too
Was sent this to review and took a while to try it but when I did I wasn’t disappointed! Smooth mellow flavour and not too strong and overpowering- highly recommend.

We received this free from Ocado to review. 
We really enjoyed this coffee. We used it with a stove top coffee maker and the coffee was lovely and smooth, really delicious. 
The fact it is Fair-trade is also a big plus for me.

I was sent a sample of this to review, and it's a very good coffee - lots of rich, dark notes, but not at all bitter. The Organic & Fairtrade certifications added in make it a really attractive option at a decent price. I'll definitely be buying this.

I’m a bit of a cheapskate when it comes to coffee, so I probably wouldn’t have tried this had Ocado not asked me for an unbiased review. I can see that it is worth paying a bit more - this definitely tastes better than my usual brand. I know that coffee growing can be a precarious business, so I like the fact that the suppliers invest over 50% of their profits back into the producer communities. I may well order this in the future and can happily recommend it.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I have a tendency to stick to branded filter coffee, like Starbucks, Costa etc and I am adding this Mayan Gold blend to my list of regulars. I find coffee flavours very subtle, and I often can't taste the nuances, but this label calls it smooth and I agree - it is smooth and easy to drink. It's not bitter at all and I will definitely get this again.
Delicious coffee, smooth and not too strong. We were given this to review and I would certainly recommend it. We will buy again.
I chose to review this for Ocado. It works well with Bialetti or similar stove-top coffee makers. Not sure it's suited for espresso.

I received this as a free sample from Ocado for review.  
I like coffee that is smooth with no bitterness - but still with lots of flavour - and this was exactly that.  Best coffee I have tasted in a long while.  Would definitely buy again.
We were given this by Ocado in exchange for a review. Were always happy to buy Fairtrade and this was a perfectly good coffee - flavourful (but not strong), smooth, with a very pleasant aftertaste.
I was sent this coffee to review. It's great that it is Fair Trade and had a smooth, good all-round taste.  Nice coffee would buy again.

I was sent a free sample of this to review . Wow ! Loved it. Even more delicious and aromatic than my usual favourite 100% arabica ( Lidl ), strong but smooth, kept its tase and aroma even when my coffee was beginning to get cold
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Found the coffee had a nice flavour with no bad aftertaste. Would have these again.
I was sent this product free to review. I always try to buy fair trade and this coffee had a lovely full smooth flavour so it’s a win for me.
We really enjoyed this coffee. Very smooth and not too strong. We’ll be ordering again ❤️
Lovely smooth coffee with good flavour and strength.  Great in the aeropress
Was sent this free to review and very pleasantly surprised. It makes a full bodied delicious cup of coffee. I would get this again.

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. 
We tend to like a fairly strong, rich roast blend of coffee. This sits more in the middle strength wise, with a lovely smooth mellow flavour. 
It was possible to vary the strength from a level scoop to a heaped one without any bitter notes. 
A good rounded coffee.
My husband, the resident coffee connoisseur, loved this. So thats a win.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I like strong coffee so was pleased to be offered this to review.  It is smooth. mellow and definitely drinkable although it does feel like it's missing some oomph!

I was sent this to review by Ocado.  I don't drink a lot of coffee and often dislike the strong, bitter taste that regular coffee drinkers seem to love.  This one I did enjoy though.  It didn't seem weak (to me) but had a lovely mellow flavour with no bitterness.  I would order it again.
Nice strong coffees, really enjoyed drinking this.

Lucky enough to get a bag to review, we found this nice enough for breakfast coffee. As other people have said, it is smooth and mellow rather than knock out strong and made for easy drinking. It just lacked a certain something to make us want to buy it on a regular basis.
I was given this to review by Ocado and am usually a Lavazza fan but would happily drink this instead. I like strong coffee and this definitely had ‘a kick’

Was asked to review this coffee.  Our usual coffee is Cafe Direct Machu Pichu so it was great to try a different blend.  Hubby really liked this blend, I found it nice to drink but got a slight bitter after taste.  The jury is out on this one, will we change blend?  On balance think it will be Machu Pichu for us. Still a good coffee though.
I was sent this to review. Nice smooth mild coffee.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I found it too strong for my morning coffee but superb for after dinner. I normally use our bean machine in the evening but thought this smelt and tasted just as good. My husband thought it was good for filter coffee as well.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I’m not a huge coffee fan, often finding it too strong and bitter. This coffee suited my taste perfectly. Coffee often describes itself as smooth and disappoints me but this is definitely smooth with a slight hint of sweetness. I use it in a one cup filter on top of a mug and use a rounded dessert spoon per mug. Spot of for me.
I was given this to review.  I prefer a stronger and more robust coffee.  This coffee though is smooth and medium and would appeal to those who prefer their coffee mild.
I was sent this to review. Made it in my cafeteria and the smell was lovely as it brewed on the hob. The coffee has hints of caramel and perfect to drink. I had mine white with oatly barista.

I received a free sample of this product to review. It's a milder coffee than I'm used to, but nice and smooth. Lovely in my latte or a less punchy espresso. I normally have strong Italian coffee so my benchmark might be skewed somewhat, but I think it's a nice middle of the road coffee that's easy to drink. Gets bonus points for being organic.

I was given this to review. It's good that it's organic but I, and another friend who tried it, found it boring -  and nothing like as dark a roast as the '5' led me to expect. I used the same amount in the cafetiere as I use for my 'Union' coffee but it seemed nothing like as strong - in caffeine - and, as I said, not a dark roast. I think it might suit those who prefer their coffee not to be too strong or to have too strong a taste.

I was given this coffee by Ocado to review and I have to say I love it. My husband drinks fresh ground coffee at home all the time and I find that too bitter.  This is smooth, a nice strong flavour, and with a slight hint of sweetness. Would definitely recommend it.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  The flavour is smooth and not bitter but if you like the strong coffee hit this is probably not the one for you.  No caramel undertones.  Nice flavour but had better.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. My husband tried this and loved it. He likes a cafetiere and found it smooth and not too strong. He said he'd be very happy to buy this.

I got this for my husband who likes strong coffee and he said there was no real flavour to this coffee and not as strong as the intense blend by the same brand.  Wouldnt buy again but others may like it if they prefer a weaker strength coffee

I bought this as a standby, but hoping it would have some depth of flavour being a 5, (and Mexican, never been let down by Mexican coffee before) but no, it's a really sweet and for my palate quite mild coffee. I really didn't enjoy it. Back to the Algerian Coffee store in Soho for my next order ! Should have known better I guess.
very limited lemon taste. Icing stuck to packaging. Sponge had a weird aftertaste.  If it was a third of the price you'd say it was so so. But at this price it is terrible.

Cake was nice and lemony and the icing was good too - not the nasty wet sugary version you sometimes get on lemon drizzle cakes. However at £6.75 for a small loaf cake, the price is a bit of an insult - I only bought it as it was on a flash sale. There are lemon drizzle cakes out there that are on a par with, or even better than this one, for half the price.
Cake tastes like first class classic French birthday cake . Just like the ones my grandmother used to bake when I was a child. Highly recommended.
All the family really enjoyed this cake. It was moist with a lovely tang to it. Yum!
£6.75 ? Someone's coining it
I am a huge fan of lemon drizzle and this was the nicest one ever. My friends and I devoured in one sitting. Super moist, delicate lemon flavour, wonderful drizzle. Nothing not to love.
Excellent, like home made
Lemon drizzle cake should have drizzle running down through it, not just a bit of glazed icing on top of it. I expected much better from such an expensive cake. Save your money and buy one elsewhere.
Lemon glaze was perfectly nice but cake left a pool of oil on our cutting board. The oiliness overwhelmed any other flavour. We threw the rest in the bin - it was inedible.
Moist lemon cake, kept well and tasted great
moist, lemony and perfect.
Very lemony, with lovely moist texture. Wanted more frosting. Quite expensive and arrived crushed.
Lovely, lemony and moist.

You just couldn't leave well alone, could you?  You had a really good recipe and you had to go mess with it adding potassium sorbate - and at these prices!!!????
Take no notice of the listed ingredients here, 21 May 2017 the packet I received listed potassium sorbate.  They sold out to cheap and nasty - without the cheap!!!! Chisellers.
A moist sponge with lemon hint. Would buy again. I took one star off as it is expensive.

A dryish cake with  texture from very finely grated peel throughout. The icing is sparse, but it's just enough to provide a balance to the cake. Overall, not harshly lemony, or overwhelmingly sweet, and all the better for it.

I should have heeded the other reviews and avoided. For this price I expected perfection and that included a lovely moist morsel. Very dry sponge opened the day after delivery. I will say the drizzle aspect was very good and fresh tasting shame it didn't penetrate the sponge a bit more.
Slightly dry, with bitter lemon taste. Won't be buying again.

After reading the other reviews and seeing the picture of the cake on the website, I was expecting a fairly dry, plain cake, but decided to try it on flash sales anyway. Wow. What a lovely experience. This is a seriously good quality cake where the outer layer is rich with soaked in lemon drizzle. Absolutely delicious.

I bought this cake when on offer, thinking it would be a nice gift to leave in my holiday cottages as a arrival gift. When I came to try it myself I was most disappointed, very little lemon taste, not the best texture either, I don't mind things being expensive if they are good, but sadly the best thing about this cake is the packaging.

My guilty pleasure is a really good lemon drizzle cake, preferably prepared by someone else.  So this week I decided to try this one.

So, Melrose and Morgan Lemon Drizzle Loaf Cake...

The pros ~  the cake arrived in good condition, and looked quite wholesome and homemade.  The ingredients list reflected a simple recipe made using the same foods as I use to make my own. My friends liked it, thinking that it was a Madeira cake, and polished it off.  

The cons ~ the lemon flavour was barely perceptible, and there was no characteristic crunch of sugar on top.  Neither was there the typical moist texture of a lemon drizzle cake, in fact it was rather dry.  The price was that of a luxury cake, however, it was, in fact, rather basic and disappointing.

Overall avoid
Just right - not too sweet, perfect texture and not too lemony.  A big hit with the family.
Quite pricey - bought on special offer - but really very nice texture, lovely flavour and very nice drizzle icing, what's not to like? - smiley face
Yes I know should have read the size but come on!! I mean it was nice but tiny. No way on earth it was worth the price.

We had this on toast instead of bacon.  It was actually really tasty and around half of the calories per slice compared to bacon.  Id swap anyway but my husband said he still would rather have bacon.  I guess it depends how keen you are to reduce your calories.  Ill definitely buy it again.
This is a heathy alternative to pork, less calories but very tasty if cooked well
A staple for those who don't eat pork. Great flavour and texture.
Tasted good in hot baguettes with loads of salady bits. A few iffy ingredients, but will buy these for an occasional treat - the children loved them.
Good flavour, lower fat alternative.  Don't overcook though. Great with cranberry jelly as an alternative to the bacon butty.
They go rubbery if you overcook them, really only needs a minute to cook tops. Yummy.

I have tried other brands of turkey rashers and found then to be dry, rubbery and bland. This however was really tasty and didn’t turn to rubber. I would happily always purchase this. I cannot comment on price as I have only ever purchased them from Ocado and haven’t found them anywhere else.
Brought this as I have to watch my calorie intake. It was like eating rubber with no taste. Went in the bin.
I thought Ocado was price matched to Tesco? This is considerably cheaper in other supermarkets, currently £2 in Tesco. I havent eaten red meat and this is a very welcome alternate to pork bacon.

I was looking for a good, healthier replacement for that great evil of our time - bacon. I tried all the veggie and vegan products and was desperately disappointed. Then I remembered my mum giving me Turkey bacon as a kid. it was not a fond memory. I'm glad to say things have moved forward over the last 30 years and these rashers are excellent. Extremely bacony, very easy and quick to cook, no annoying rind and low in calories and carcinogens. my wife is the real bacon lover and even she is taken. if you didn't expect the contents of your BLT you really would be none the wiser!
Check any of the competing supermarkets and you will see they are £1.50 to £1.75 per pack, this is an insane price for the exact same products and brand.

I enjoy bacon but I've been using these turkey rashers as substitutes as they are healthier and I must say, I got used to them quickly and now I look forward to my high protein, low fat rashers! Very nice

I havent had bacon at home for years due to being married to a Jewish man. I had always thought that turkey bacon wasnt worth the bother so never bought it. Thought Id give it a try this weekend and oh my goodness I am so pleased I did! Had it in an avocado bagel and it was heaven! Even better than pork. We all love it, wish wed bought two packs! This will be on our shopping list every week now:)
Good alternative to pork bacon. Nice for a quick snack of a lunch baguette.

Yummy healthy alternative to pork.
Great for egg ham cheese crepes
Received as a sub for cooked sliced turkey - not a very sensible substitution, given these are raw and require cooking.  Didn't enjoy them and will refuse if offered again.

I started using this as I was dieting and four rashers have just 128kcal and 25.2g of protein. 

It has a nice smoky bacon flavour but the key is not to overcook it. 1 minute 30 seconds each side under the grill and it comes out perfectly. Any more and it goes a bit dry. 

I regularly buy this product and will continue to do so
Healthier option etc. But it just tasted like hot, thick, processed, turkey ham. Its not that I dont like turkey ham, just not hot, and not in place of a bacon sandwich!
Tried so many other brands but they end up left uneaten cos they aren’t as good as these

I tried this as I realised I was eating a lot of bacon - not great health wise. Look, it’s not going to replace a crispy rasher in your bacon sarnie but it’s much better than I thought. If you’re watching you weight or need to cut back a bit it’s a decent substitute if you are realistic in your expectations. Will gladly have again.
I liked the flavour, but these were cut really thick and were very chewy.

in the past I remember these to be thin, crispy and a great part of a breakfast or a 'buttie' You have probably guessed that this doesn't do the business for me and maybe real bacon rashers are so popular for a reason. I'm not ordering this again..
If you want a healthier option to traditional bacon, try this. Super quick to cook and very low fat.
great
Tasty and easy bacon alternative.

Turkey bacon gets a bad rap, and rightly so! Many of the examples I've tried taste like the Turkey rotted slightly before they baconised it! Either that or the meat falls apart in your hand. This is tough, tasty and a good size. The rashers are salted and taste excellent. An english muffin, an egg, some light mayonnaise and a rasher of Mattessons lightly smoked turkey bacon is a breakfast of champions!
Really not sure why you would buy these they are nothing like bacon and really dont taste great
Gave this a reluctant try and its now a regular item in my basket. Really good taste and easy to quick without any fat to take off
Tasty and really enjoy as a bacon replacement
Highly recommend!

The flavour is excellent. It doesnt crisp well when grilling and doesnt have the texture of bacon so if your expecting that you will be disappointed . However its very low in fat and tastes really good. Grills in no time at all too.
Its not bad at all really. I cook it as crispy as I can. I find it soggy otherwise. High in protein, good alternative
I think this tastes the exact same as pork bacon and its low fat too so a bonus. I'm presuming its a little healthier than bacon too so I would buy again.
This is essentially sliced boiled turkey. Gross

I didnt know what to expect with this, but trying to lose weight I decided it was time to try a healthier bacon alternative. The rashers were bigger than I expected and tasted very similar to smoked bacon to me, without the salt.
I would prefer there were less nasties in it ! But still tastes amazing
Is it cured cooked or cured raw?
For me these were the first turkey rashers I tried and having tried other brands including own brands, I consider them to be the original and the best.
Absolutely delicious and frys well , much quicker and less messy than normal pork bacon...plus a healthier alternative Id assume.
These are very tasty and a nice alternative to bacon
So low in fat and fine fried with a spray of Fry Lite. Alternative to bacon in fry up or delicious in a hot sandwich/wrap

Fried lightly till had  bit of colour, surprised that I actualy liked it! Obviously nothing can replace real bacon but this is a good alternative, leaves a bacon flavour after taste. It's  on  the regulars list.
On a very strict medical diet and this is a great alternative to bacon in a sandwich. Tasty.
Very nice in the sandwich. good flavor, too.
Great for breakfast sandwiches (with brown sauce) and also as a substitute for bacon when cooking. Would recommend.

After seeing these in an eat well tv programme, I thought I'd give them a go, and was surprised how good they were. It has the salty/cured flavour of bacon without the fat etc. Can't beat real bacon, but this is a good, healthier alternative.

Very low in fat and not too bad tasting (obviously real bacon is far tastier) but when trying to lose weight an excellent option. 

TIP: let it burn slightly in the pan for more of a 'bacon feel'
This is an excellent, delicately smoked alternative to bacon.  It is also much healthier and less fattening.  I am surprised that some shops no longer stock it.  OCADO PLEASE CONTINUE TO STOCK IT!
I'll always buy when on offer, they're a great for following a low calorie diet, very meaty and tasty.

What happened to Dalehead organic turkey bacon? It was luscious and thick and even preferable to pork, on more than health grounds. This is not a substitute for pork bacon and this is not a substitute for Dalehead turkey bacon. I am not alone in my views, there are a great many of us and we are made unhappy and hungry in the absence of our favourite breakfast. A favourite breakfast is a mighty tool wielded in the the right hands and we might only ask that you restore it to us, so we can restore our days and in turn this universe to it's previous balance.. It is imperative to the success of this planet that this plea is not overlooked.
Very dry and tasteless. I will rather go without than use this as a low calorie   option.
These are so quick to cook and low in fat, they make a week day breakfast  with eggs easy to do.
High in Protein, Low in Fat - can't complain!
These were very dry, and didn't really seem to taste like much. I've had turkey bacon before that far surpassed this.

Look - for around 30 cals per rasher and with it being perfectly edible, this product features regularly in my trolley. If I want a perfect taste and texture then I will splash out on good smokey bacon rashers.

I know some of the other reviewers have not been very kind in their assessments, but having 2 VERY discerning connoisseurs in my household, I was very pleased to find a turkey version of bacon which had any flavour.  


Having been spoiled in America with many different versions of turkey bacon, this is the best and pretty much ONLY version of turkey bacon we have found other than Dalehead for non-smoked flavour for people who aren't able to eat pork.



Highly recommended!  and brilliant for bacon sandwiches or chopped and added to items you would normally add bacon to.


One suggestion, is to get your non-stick or griddle pan VERY hot, brush with a groundnut oil and fry for only a minute a side as it carries on cooking.  Make sure to use a pan where you don't crowd the bacon, as it boils instead of fries.  Hope this helps!

I really did not like these, and I am usually a big fan of turkey bacon. I just found the texture to be like eating a shoe -- absurdly chewy and hard. And the flavour was nothing great. I wouldn't buy this again.
i quite like these but only need a minute or 2 in pan. Great to cut out bacon and still have something with eggs.

I have tried these twice now and draw the conclusion that if one wants to cut fat there are tastier ways of doing it than buying turkey rashers.

They do not have much taste and what there is I found rather artificial tasting, like somkey bacon crisps but only a fraction of the flavour.

If your diet does not include pork, like my wife and son, but you like recipies that include bacon, try these turkey reashers. They only take minutes to cook, and are a great substitute for bacon - try quiché lorraine with turkey rashers replacing lbacon ardons. All the flavour, no pork!
The sauce was ok, but the ‘chicken’ was unedible, it was disgusting and made me gag.  I was really looking forward to not cooking after a stressful day at work, only to have a hungry family 😞

My partner and I both really enjoyed this microwave curry. I added some grilled peppers to the curry and also had a side of stir fried cauliflower with cumin. There was plenty of sauce - probably too much without the additional veg. 
The chicken was juicy and came in lovely large pieces.
Disgusting rubber-like chicken! We couldnt eat it. Avoid!
Awful
I am a bit of a lightweight when it comes to spicy food, this is a bit spicy but manageable. I really enjoyed it and will definitely buy it again.

I'm sorry but this curry is absolutely disgusting and went straight in the bin, sauce was OK but way too much of it. I have no idea where they got this chicken from but I've never tasted anything like it in my life, it has a texture I can't even describe it actually made me gag, unfortunately wasn't just me because my partner said the same thing. We hate wasting food but this had to go in the bin, what a waste of £10, very upset with M&S for even putting this on the shelves, it should be removed to avoid anymore dissapointment from their loyal customers. Quality check needed on this ASAP.

come on M&S you can do better than this, the flavours are lovely but the chicken is awful £5.25 for this really??? Such a shame we would buy every week if the quality was better but not this... we live in hope !

I never do reviews, but felt like doing one for this. I was so looking forward to a nice chicken tikka meal, and thought you couldn’t go wrong with an M&S brand. I was very wrong sadly, the sauce was very nice, but it ends there! 
The huge chunks of hard chicken does not absorb any flavour, it tastes like carcass! Might as well have boiled it in water and added to the sauce at the end, same effect. 
Plz change your chicken recipe, marinate it for 24 hrs at least ,  slow cook or something, anything but the current recipe; made me gag.

I am always disappointed with cook at home curries as they just can't live upto authentic Indian dishes, however this wasn't too bad and had a substantial amount of meat in. we enjoyed the texture and flavour and actually found it enough shared between two with some side dishes. Would buy again if in need of a quick meal.

Really enjoyed this the first time we tried it but the last few times have not been a pleasant experience. Yes there are big chunks of chicken but many have a weird texture. Its almost crunchy like the meat isn't properly cooked. I can't tell if this is reformed chicken or actual chunks of breast. I suspect the former given the weird texture. Also some of the pieces aren't fully coated in sauce and have a horrible flavour like they're not fresh. The sauce tastes ok and has plenty of spices but the quality of the meat is really disappointing. We won't be buying again.

Im surprised by how divided the comments are. I think it taste great! You can smell it when its being microwave. Lots of spices in the sauce. Generous portion too compared to other ready meals. Chicken is ok for me, not rubbery. But I agree its more on the creamy side with lots of single cream, which may not be authentic Indian cooking.
Rubber chicken.  Awful. Straight in the bin. I never do food reviews on here but couldnt ignore the hideousness and of this .
The sauce was nice but the chicken was a disgusting rubber texture
I've had loads of curries in my time and this is as good as you'd get in an Indian restaurant. The cardamom seeds are the best bit!  I wish it could be frozen.
too thick and sweet, large chunks of rubbery chicken, no flavour at all
Nothing resembling curry here unfortunately, just overly creamy chicken. No Tikka taste no curry taste. Very poor. Shame.

Lovely big pieces of chicken and great sauce but - I chewed into something, thought it was a bone and found out it was a whole cardamon pod and the inside was horrid.   Despite looking for these - which is nigh impossible in the sauce - there were another four which I chewed into by mistake.   Not nice.   Please remove.  At least if you have the Chicken Tikka Masala with rice any cloves, bay leaves and cardamon pods are visible in the rice.

i cannot recommend this.
The sauce is average to good , however the chicken pieces tasted odd and rubbery , almost like they had been in a deep freeze for year .

M&S produce some amazing food, unfortunately this is not one of them.
This is the worst tikka masala I have ever had. The chicken had a false smoked taste to it and the sauce apart from being a bit hot was tasteless and more like gravy than a curry sauce.
Cannot believe this ever passed any king of taste test, and does not warrant being called our best ever.
Very disappointed.

I bought this in the sale and wished I hadn't. Chicken was tough and had slimy skin attached. The sauce was mediocre at best and there were lots of cardamon pods that needed weeding out. Worst shop bought curry I have ever had.
Looks amazing but chicken has horrible texture.
Up there with the nicest takeaway, authentic charcoal taste with big pieces of chicken and plenty of sauce.

I am not a fan of chicken tikka masala or ready meals in general and bought this for hubby when I work nights as it is something easy he can prepare without making a complete mess of my kitchen! He enjoyed it and so wanted another. I happened to still be home when he was about to eat it and I thought it actually looked and smelled nice so I had a little bit. I was rather impressed. The chicken was tender and the sauce really flavoursome. Dont buy this thinking it will feed two though because it wont, even with other side dishes it will still be a very small portion for two. Still worth 4 stars though, you wouldnt get much better in an Indian restaurant.

considering it costs just slightly less than a takeaway curry portion it's nothing special. Doesn't really taste like tikka masala, just tastes like an extra creamy generic microwave curry. Some of the chicken pieces were tender and others were tough... wouldn't buy again
Would not buy it again poor Quality

I have only had this one so perhaps I purchased from a bad batch but it was honestly one of the worst curries Ive ever had. Tasted absolutely nothing like a tikka masala and the chicken was really crunchy and the most dreadful texture. I barely ate any and will not be purchasing again.

It tastes nothing like chicken tikka masala and has a weird taste to it. 

Also it appears to be meant for 2 people judging by the nutrition info which would’ve given us 2.5 pieces of chicken each which is poor for £5
Got this as a replacement for the often out of stock chicken Biryani. Pleasantly surprised with how flavourful this was. Great spice balance and good portions of chicken. Will definitely buy again.
This is now our favourite, unfortunately it's often out of stock, it's a shame it's not suitable for freezing.
Quite possibly the worst curry I have eaten. It had an odd smell. The chicken had a very odd texture. It made me feel sick.
This is my fav curry - and I've had lots. The flavor is better   than restaurant curries. I add a little chili pepper - just my taste. Please never ever change the recipe.
we have just purchased our second only M&S best ever chicken tika masala. couldn't have been more different from the first, chicken tough and very gristly.
best  curry that we have bought for a long time-  always a good meal to have in the freezer lots of good chunks of chicken   add rice  and a  perfect quick meal

£5 for this? ‘Best ever’ was possibly the worst ever curry I’ve ever had! Tasted absolutely vile and had a strange smell even when cooking. When it was ready it had like an off odour smell and I was instantly put off. I tried a mouthful and it tasted absolutely vile! Went straight into the bin! Avoid it

Surely best ever would be organic, free range? I see no argument for using intensively reared barn chickens these days, esp as M&S claims to be a pioneer in chicken welfare. Please put your money where your mouth is.
Shame about the rapeseed oil, otherwise these would be a regular for my family and I!
Too much sauce, hardly any chicken
Lovely big bits of quality chicken, lovely thick creamy sauce, but a bit too salty.

This is an authentic version of this popular dish.  In fact, as good if not better than a good quality Indian takeaway.  Cant agree with some of the very odd one star reviews, suggest they might even be fake.

I got this in the flash sale. I hadnt been willing to risk paying full price based on some previous reviews. However I was really surprised by the quality. Loved the sauce and the chicken was pleasingly garlicky and very tender. Would definitely buy again, even at full price.
This is the worst chicken tikka masala I’ve ever had! Couldn’t eat it! The flavours awful! Cheaper one is much better

I’ve had this many times now. It used to have a cardamom pod in which you would sometimes accidentally chew which was awful but they seem to have got rid of that. It’s certainly the best chicken tikka masala ready meal I’ve had, it’s probably better than the majority of properly freshly prepared versions I’ve had too.

Just eaten this product and it does not appear to be as good as it was .
Should be according to the packaging flame grilled tandoori chicken ( whilst I accept 
that is not the same as cooked in a proper tandoor oven )
It did have a flamed finish to some of the meat .
Is this just a one off or have the  “ bean counters “ trimmed back on some of the production costs ?
This would be a shame as this was a better alternative than some of the local “ Indian “  restaurants own interpretation of this British inspired dish .
This is absolutely revolting.  Enormous chunks of chicken that have come from God knows where.  Chewy and tasted funny. Went straight in the bin. I would never buy this again.
Can't believe M&S even put their name to this! Wouldn't call it a curry. Slimy, rancid chicken, probably slaughtered in some back street halal! Terrible food.
Far too creamy and the chicken texture was very strange and unpleasant
Strange taste, slightly bitter. Large pieces of chicken but awful texture/quality. Prefer Waitrose chicken tikka masala any day.

I have a good sense of taste for Asian cuisine as my in-laws are from Pakistan and I must say this is one of the the best masalas I have tasted. Very authentic, lots of flavours. Not too hot. I had it with white rice and chips and enjoyed every mouthful! Definitely recommend and will definitely be having again. Well worth the money!

This is the best Indian ready meal I have ever bought. The pieces of chicken are large and succulent, and the masala sauce is creamy and rich in flavour. Its also so much more cost-effective to buy only the curry and make your own pilau rice. I found three cardamom pods, but I cant see why anyone would complain about this as they add so much flavour to the dish.

This contained large pieces of tender chicken in lots of tasty sauce. Very ample, aromatic dish aside from the very hard (mustard?) Seeds, which were reminiscent of small bits of gravel or small shot..disconcerting to bite on ..lose them and I would buy this again.
Sauce nice but chicken is really poor quality and some prices inedible
A lovely creamy curry, and not too hot. Just right for people who don't obsess about curries to the point of tedium. I will buy again.

The best I can say about this curry is that the pieces of chicken are fairly large - but that's not such a good thing when the texture of the chicken is strange and the flavour of the sauce is so unpleasant. It's strong, bitter, salty and garlicky, but with no discernible flavour of tomatoes or individual spices. Just unpleasant-tasting gloop; we threw most of it away. Really disappointing.
well done, M&S great curry, just right nice chicken and lovely flavour, please don't change it

This is the best Indian ready meal I have ever bought. The pieces of chicken are large and succulent, and the masala sauce is creamy and rich in flavour. Its also so much more cost-effective to buy only the curry and make your own pilau rice. I found three cardamom pods, but I cant see why anyone would complain about this as they add so much flavour to the dish.

This contained large pieces of tender chicken in lots of tasty sauce. Very ample, aromatic dish aside from the very hard (mustard?) Seeds, which were reminiscent of small bits of gravel or small shot..disconcerting to bite on ..lose them and I would buy this again.
Sauce nice but chicken is really poor quality and some prices inedible

It's strong, bitter, salty and garlicky, but with no discernible flavour of tomatoes or individual spices. Just unpleasant-tasting gloop; we threw most of it away. Really disappointing.

Its also so much more cost-effective to buy only the curry and make your own pilau rice. I found three cardamom pods, but I cant see why anyone would complain about this as they add so much flavour to the dish.

This contained large pieces of tender chicken in lots of tasty sauce. Very ample, aromatic dish aside from the very hard (mustard?) Seeds, which were reminiscent of small bits of gravel or small shot..disconcerting to bite on ..lose them and I would buy this again.
Sauce nice but chicken is really poor quality and some prices inedible
A lovely creamy curry, and not too hot. Just right for people who don't obsess about curries to the point of tedium. I will buy again.

The best I can say about this curry is that the pieces of chicken are fairly large - but that's not such a good thing when the texture of the chicken is strange and the flavour of the sauce is so unpleasant. It's strong, bitter, salty and garlicky, but with no discernible flavour of tomatoes or individual spices. Just unpleasant-tasting gloop; we threw most of it away. Really disappointing.
well done, M&S great curry, just right nice chicken and lovely flavour, please don't change it
Delicate and delicious without a hint of bitterness.
Really pleased to find that Ocado stocks this premium grade tea. No bitterness, just like I used to drink in Japan. Simply the best.

I ordered the 100g bag but this is the same stuff apparently - had a matcha in Shoreditch Grind and it was amazing so asked what it was and was told about Taiki Tea - ordered some to make at home and it was just as great. Not bitter like loads of other matchas you can buy and doesn't have any yucky sweetners or mint additives like the matcha in Starbucks - this is the real deal like in Japan.
A bit expensive, even for matcha, but you only need a small amount, mix into a liquid paste in water then add frothy hot or cold milk for a delicious matcha latte
Delicious
The milk itself is good. The issue I have is the packaging. 60% of it is made of plastic and the whole packaging goes to the bin once milk is over. Will nor repurchase until reusable glass is used.

This is so tasty, it's usually a treat as I normally only drink semi-skimmed milk. 
I am not a big fan of the packaging because it just stays open in the fridge and the milk can acquire a kind of fridge-taste, but if you drink it asap - it's super!

This is good quality milk and the packaging is more environmentally friendly than plastic bottles. It’s also easy to freeze. One star taken off because it can be messy to pour. It would be great if we could buy a special reusable jug designed to fit the packaging (as they have in Portugal).
Very nice milk but use a bottle to store as the packet can sometimes flop over

Firstly, shame on Ocado for not stoking any other unhomogeneised milk.
This milk is flavoursome  and agrees with my tummy better than anything else Ocado sells; but the packaging is poorly designed, wasteful, and frankly, annoying. The spout does not open up unless you stick your fingers or the end of a knife in it to separate it out (contamination much), and then you end up with more milk down the side of your cup and on the counter than where you need it.

I am very much in favour of milk - especially organic milk - but the packaging is very poor. Please consider changing the 'plastic bag' container. You cannot seal/close it once opened as you just cut off the corner to open it. Very awkward to control the flow of milk - all or nothing. Such a shame as organic milk is the best.

This is is flavoursome, I sense that the amino acids in this are strong and healthy. Unfortunately I have recently got a pain in my stomach from adding this to my tea. Something isnt right for me so Ive sadly stopped adding it to the trolley.
Lovely Milk

Normally, I really do not like skimmed milk.  However, this is the only skimmed milk I can drink.  It has such a lovely flavour compared to homogenised skimmed milk. It taste like the milk we had as children before the supermarkets decided to homogenise everything (to extend shelf life).  It’s still pasteurised so, there is really no need for homogenisation.  I’m so glad the Daylesford Brand is still sold on Ocado.  Give it a try it’s worth it.

I always have a couple of backup litres stored away in the freezer.  Moreover I shall be more loyal to Daylesford now that theirs seems to be the only unhomogenised milk on offer from Ocado. Duchy from Waitrose does unhomogenised organic milk, but the M&S organic version is homogenised. It is only recently that I have realised that I appreciate the fresh flavour of milk where the cream separates out.
Unlike the Waitrose and Yeo Valley cartons this doesn't say it is freeze-able. Where can I put 8 litres of it then?! I think the milk within the bag is fine, but why not freeze-able?

This was sent as a sub, and I really wanted to like it, because (a) it's organic and (b) it looked like thought had gone into the packaging. My main concern was with the packaging; first and foremost, it is NOT recyclable. It may have used environmentally friendly techniques and materials, but if the end result is landfill, then it it is no better, in fact worse, than plastic type 2 bottles. Secondly, no closure after opening meant I had to use a klippit to keep it fresh, this meant that the opening stuck together, making pouring and reusing awkward and messy. I would not choose to buy this milk again.

Was worried about milk in a bag, but wanted to try it due to the lower-plastic content of the packaging. I assumed I would have to decant it, but the bag is designed well to stand up and to be poured.
No issues with the taste - tastes exactly as it should! But it is organic and it uses less plastic, so that is two extra positives for me.

This is by far the best organic skimmed milk I’ve ever used, it makes great frothy milk for lattes. I’ve found it much easier to store in the fridge and the freezer. The package takes some getting used to but I’ve had no problems so far. Oh and did I forget to mention that it’s not homogenised! It’s a winner for me.

Ocado sent us this milk as an alternative for the milk we ordered. The packaging is unusual and wobbly and not even recyclable so really don’t get what is the point? The milk itself is fine, organic skimmed milk, as we wanted. But the packaging makes it difficult to pour and store in the fridge. I hope manufacturer can improve the design! Thanks

Given several of these as a substitute. The milk is ok but you have to cut off the top of the pouch, find a container that fits in the fridge and decant the milk, which needs a steady hand to avoid mess. Irritating. Lots of writing on the pouch saying how wonderful the company is but they should focus on ease of use for the customer rather than themselves. Good products don't need lots of explanation.

The packaging is plastic and can't be recycled - stated on the packet itself. YET the manufacturer details why it's environmentally friendly milk. 

Very space wasteful and awkward to store in fridge.

I can only review the packaging as i never got to try the milk. It split in the carrier bag and the milk leaked into the other bags in the tray. It's really annoying having to wipe milk off your shopping before you can put it away.  After this experience, i wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

This is the most ridiculous packaging ever invented for domestic storage of liquids. I do not want an unstable package of milk I my fridge, thanks, not should I have to find a suitable container to decant it into. Utter rubbish. Plus it was used as a 'substitute' for a one pint carton. One litre is not the same as 1pint by a long shot, and as I can only drink limited amounts of milk at the minute, would have meant lots of waste.
Have tried every one of the Daylesford milks and they are all amazing. I have no problem with the packaging if it is any better for the environment.
This milk is great. Love the packaging too. It doesn't spill and takes up much less space than a plastic bottle in the waste bin

Unless you have a jug that you can pour the entire contents into before refrigerating once opened, don't buy. This was delivered as a substitute and is laughable in it's presumption that everyone will have an appropriate vessel available in which to store once opened. If you want to be super green Daylesford, package in a re-sealable, universally recyclable package.
not sure re the non recyclable packaging, it has been made in a very environmentally friendly way, does that compensate for having to throw away? no idea...
What is the point of selling your product as organic, pure, from cows that are read to at night if the packaging it comes in is not possible to recycle?
Nothing wrong with the delicious milk, but hated the pack. Found it difficult to pour accurately, and one pack split in the freezer. Sorry not for me.

I have tried all brands of skimmed milk, some very watery, some less so but this has to be far and away the best tasting skimmed milk out there.  Yes, the plastic jug type container is fiddly but hey buy a fridge jug (Addis) which seals and is ready to pour, easy to wash  and great for your fridge door!
This is great tasting milk. Container is quite sturdy, sits in the fridge door fine. Occasionally drips when pouring but have had that with bottles too. I also find it easier to fit in the freezer.

We were sent this as a substitute as the Duchy milk I ordered was out of stock.

I cant comment on the milk, Im too irritated by the packaging. 
It doesnt pour, it spills (no matter how carefully I handle it). 

Why plastic thats not recyclable? 
I will never order this & future substitutions will be returned.

The Ocado description suggests that the packaging is recyclable. the package clearly states that it isn't. Is rather not be adding to landfill of I can help it but that's the only place these "jugs" can go. So no, I shan't be buying these again.

We got this in a flash sale, and the milk was nice.  No problems with the bag except when my partner needed to be reminded how to use it.  But how do you have unhomogenised skim milk?  I thought the fat was what you homogenise, and there is none.
I might have missed it somewhere but I think this tastes like buffalo milk. Cool packaging but adventurous taste...
Tastes fresh and delicious!

It fits so nice on our refrigerator door and is easy to pour. Nice to be able to throw away a flat package with no cap and not see the film of milk on the inside of the container. Milk tastes good as well. - probably should have said that first! We drink it in less than a week so it never goes off.

I don't normally write reviews on Ocado but having read since of the previous comments on the packaging I really felt that I needed to add my comments. It's true, the packaging is different and can't be recycled but I think it's absolutely amazing! It is basically a plastic bag but when the corner is cut off and some milk is poured out, I find that 'bag' creates a seal by sticking together and therefore keeps the milk fresh and stops basic accidental spills. It also allows you to squeeze the 'bottle' in to a space that may not otherwise be big enough for a normal bottle and then when it's empty, you can pierce the handle, deflate it and throw it away, albeit in the normal waste. I find that my recycling bin is always too full anyway and so this is a great help. 

And by the way, the milk tastes great too!!
Brilliant unhomogenised milk. Must decant into a bottle once opened.
All I buy now.

Purchased this because my usual Duchy was unavailable.  Taste was undistinguishable from Duchy.  However the bag, made to look like a jug is a complete nonsense.  Whilst trying to decant it flops and splashes everywhere.  When empty it collapses in on itself making it impossible to rinse out, and my council do not accept bags for recycling, so into general waste.
I like the milk, but the packaging is terrible. The sides get stuck together and then the milk burst out causing spills. It's just happened again and I'm removing it from my basket.
Just tastes like any other skimmed milk to me! The 'jug' is a bit of a faff. It's a plastic pouch folks and pouring can cause spills and waste. Perhaps there is a course I can attend locally...

I used to get my milk delivered fresh from a local farm. I now use this, it's so creamy and tastes amazing. Like others I prefer to decant into v cheap glass jugs I bought from Ocado. I buy 2 per week for 2 us, and freeze one for a few days. Never have any problems with freshness at all. One of the best products I can get from Ocado!
The milk tastes great and it's organic so no nasties. The packaging is great! We really love it!
Have used both skimmed and semi skimmed and they are great!

Good milk excellent taste,I put in a lidded jug because first time I used it, it spilt everywhere...it lasted only two days, there was thick creamy ring round the top of the milk/jug, I stirred the milk up, but as it was the first time using this milk, I didn't know if this was ok to drink, so I gave it to the stray cat and fox I feed, they both liked it... Have got some more milk coming, so this time will leave it's own container..maybe I did wrong by  putting into a jug....
A really clean tasting fresh product.  Would not know this was skimmed milk.  Fab

I tried Daylesford whole milk and semi, both of which are amazing, then was thrilled to find they did skimmed too. I now never ever want any other milk than that from Daylesford.
