The packaging is brilliant, feels wonderful, looks wonderful, sustainable and lovingly made AND is amazingly designed. Having milk from a container like this feels so unique and natural, but I was concerned about it being stable in the fridge and how I would keep it fresh upon opening. But thanks to Daylesford ingenuity, it stays completely stable!! It has a solid handle in a way. And then it only needs a little snip to open it and make it great for pouring. So as to not worry about an open top, I've been using those little clippy things around the opening. These inexpensive wonders work brilliantly for the milk and give peace of mind that it's sealed. So wonderful to be able to keep it in its lovely and living, farm feel packet. The taste as well as the look is amazing. Thankyou Daylesford and Ocado.
This skimmed milk is so good I can use it even to make my own kefir. It is not homogenised, which might explain why it works so well with kefir. But it is great all around in tea, baking etc.

This is the only non homogenised skimmed milk I've come across - it's really nice, different packaging but the spout self seals between uses and it doesn't spill providing you hold it by the squishy handle. Will def buy again. Perfect !

I have been buying Daylesford milk to make a delicious coffee every morning on my GAGIA for the past year and I have never been disappointed.It makes an excellent froth and it tastes delicious plus it is not homogenised. Also never had any problems with the packaging. We all love it in our house.
This is good quality milk and especially great if you want alot of it, as when you pour, it suddenly comes gushing out as the plastic opening finally parts.

I have bought this milk for a few weeks however this week, (as stated in other reviews) the milk leaked over half of my shopping plus the driveway when it was delivered. Real shame as I love the milk but won't be buying again due to the inconvenience
Not enough didn't  last more than 2 days,the taste  was horrible ,it changed my coffee and tea into drink nightmare.... never again !

I've been having Daylesford milk for quite a while now (full cream, semi and skimmed), I was quite surprised to open my latest package of skimmed milk to find it contained full cream milk...it's very nice but not what I was expecting!
not a traditional falafel, but really really tasty so who cares
I buy these for when I don't want to eat meat with the feast of the family. Easy to heat up, tasty not or cold. Great standby.
Sweet with a mix of spices which didn't work.
Reading other reviews I wonder if these vary alot as our pack were bland with no hint of spice or apricot. Perfectly acceptable to eat but I wouldn't choose them again.
We eat only vegan things as better for our health and the planet. We tried these, but found them to be very bland- a real shame.
I had these as a substitute for the M&S falafels and am really satisfied with the substitution.  Lovely flavour and nicely moist

The apricots were a surprise.  But added an interesting sweetness which was rather tasty. 
Not a bad texture and not too dry but disintegrated quickly on heating.
Still searching for the perfect falafel...
Just a bit too spicy for me, prefer the original variety, which is unavailabe now.
I really wanted to like these, but didn't.  We found them to be dry and they seemed, if not burnt, definitely overcooked.  In fairness, they were a lot more palatable when heated.
I love these in wraps but didn't realise Ocado is selling a smaller pack (about 2/3 in size compared to other stores) for the same price.  Not good value for money.

Have tried couldron, biona even chikP bites sofar since the original couldron falafel stopped being available. My quest to find a falafel that taste good straight from packet (without having to heat) continues although these are nicer than the rest. They look like they will be dry but on eating them they arent. They arent laden with chilly but the spices are nice and were actually tasty snack. I would probably order them again over the others if I wanted to get falafel.
Did not see that these contained red pepper and apricot or would not have purchased. Sweet, tasteless and not what I would call felafel. Very disappointed but too mean to bin them!
We get this every week, it goes well with Ocado houmous.
I love these falafels as the texture is great, not too dry like other brands I’ve tasted, I also like the fact there are apricots inside it gives them a lovely sweet flavour!
I had these warmed in a wrap with hummus and spinach and was great, nice flavour, really enjoyed them.
The best, so yummy, so fruity

Hadnt eaten any other falafels in ages so no real expectations or comparisons to other brands but we thought they were delicious heated and served in a wrap with humous and salad. Not too dry or spicy.
Tasty, the right amount of moisture - a firm favourite. Work really well in a nice falafel wrap with so salad and hummus or tahini
Too dry. Baffled by the positive reviews !?
Had to buy an alternative as cauldron out of stock and so happy they were, love these gosh falafels, will be buying more
Nice and tasty, easy for lunch boxes

I frequently have falafel for lunch and sometimes find they can be a bit dry. However with the addition of pepper and apricots I find these stay very moist. The flavour is also very good. These are now a regular purchase.

I would recommend them to people who love the sweetness of the apricot blended with the hint of spice. I found those falafels crumbly and dry (needed a lot of hummus). My 1/2 Moroccan child did not like them at all.
nicely spiced - not too harsh and not too dry
Definitely a cut above the rest. Plenty of taste and not too dry. Recommended
We always have these in the fridge. Super handy as a snack or to throw together in a meal. Great shelf life too
These are just lovely - in a wrap with salad and humous, theyre so tasty! Quite sweet and with a good selection of spices, and when oven baked are moist.

We love these falafel.  They're really tasty and we use them for lunches at home and at work alongside good humous and salad.  We like the whole Gosh range of falafel and bites and especially happy that they are gluten free too.
We love these falafel - great to take with salad to work for a meat free lunch - lovely flavour and not dry. Working our way through the rest of the range.
Very satisfying falafels that are mildly spiced and contain little pieces of dried fruit which add to their lovely texture.
Lovely falafel in pitta with humous and salad. Or even just in a salad with a dressing.
These are really nice and tasty. If eaten cold, they can feel a bit dry, but not when heated a short time in the microwave.

The flavour is delicious with a slight sweetness from the apricot and pepper. Not your authentic falafel flavour (purists may be disappointed) but very tasty. 
Also they are moist, which seems a rarity in shop bought falafel. Got away with microwaving them quickly to top a salad.
So surprised by the quality of these and the other Gosh! foods I've tried thus far. Please keep these on offer, Ocado. :)

Much better hot and I cook for a few mins more to get nice and crispy on the outside but still soft and tasty inside. Really good flavour and decent price. Now a regular in my order

Try with avocado and raita in a bagel!
These were very tasty, flavoursome and moist.
Really tasty and not dry at all. Great in wraps. More flavours please!
Absolutely love these! Great flavour and texture, not even remotely dry like some falafel can be. Will definitely be ordering again!

I love the flavour of these falafel. Either served warm with a salad and oven chips, or stuffed into a pitta with spinach leaves, grated carrot, a dot or two of natural yoghurt and sprinkled with pomegranate seeds.
I really wanted to try more flavours but when I type Gosh into the search bar I only found three products. Type Falafel and you see all the flavours!  Ill be trying them all now.
Ditched the meatballs for these! YUM
light, soft snack. moist chunks of apricot. hint of sweetness. great flavour
Really good flavour, not dry but a bit too sweet for me with over 6% sugar from the dried fruit which is a shame.
Love the taste of these, both as a warm snack on their own or accompanied by a small simple salad. Perfect for this time of year!
Moist and delicious flavour. Best ones I've tried and I've tried a lot. These ones are really good, easy to cook and taste delicious. Stock up when on offer, as great out of the freezer too.
Wasnt very keen on these, they tasted very sweet  and quite crumbly and dry.
Nice and tasty falafel
really enjoyed these warmed through. They are baked, not fried which is fantastic.

but a shame the heating instructions aren't quite correct. 4 to 5 minutes is not at all adequate. At least 10 mins. When food is reheated it should be piping hot in the middle and not just warm. Some caveat that 'appliances can differ' in this case does not quite cut it.
falafel it is not a moroccan dish !!!!!!! wondering on what basis this product is named???? its a put off before even bying it.

I usually buy Cauldron Moroccan Falafels but decided to give these a try. I thought they were pretty tasty with a reasonable amount of moroccan spice and good texture. Great in a wholemeal pitta with lots of lettuce and a little mayonnaise. My husband thinks they're nicer than our usual but personally I'd happily eat either.
I hadn't had falafel in quite a while but these are just as I remember if not better, they have certainly become a weekly staple - highly recommend!!
I like these. They are slightly dry in texture but I dip them in a bit of houmous and then I find them really yummy.

bought for a gluten free vegetarian Christmas guest and after a lot were left on the buffet table, I tried them and honestly they were so dry I felt awful having given them to her! same with another item from this range. never again.
like cardboard and threw away. not nice
Didn't enjoy these. They seemed overcooked dry and unappealing. A disappointment as the Great Food sweet potato pakora were such a hit with us.

I'm a vegan, so I know about falafel.  I've probably eaten more falafel than is safe.  I love falafel.
These ones are not like your usual dry textured falafel, which is something I like about falafel.  They're just a little looser, but they make up for this by their absolute wonderful fruity and spicy flavour.  Easy to cook to.
My only criticism is that there's not many in one packet, nine small ones, so I have to buy a couple of packs at a time.  Maybe a bumper pack will be produced soon.
Definitely buying again
These are so much better than plain falafel and were amazing in a wrap

Can't decide which of these delicious little balls of Great Food I like best.. not too salty, not tasteless, nor dry.. heat them up for a few secs in the microwave and they are a fabulous mini snack!  I like to dip them mayo or sour cream.. defeats the low fat label but hey!..  I LOVE them!
I bought because of positive reviews, but found them tasteless and rather like eating crumbled cardboard
tasty, not dry I put them in the microwave for less than 1 minute to serve warm with dips and pitta bread makes a really good stand by for friends coming round.  definitely buying more!
Wouldn't buy these again as they were so dry which was a shame
Good size, good taste, my only complaint is that they're a bit on the dry side.

I tried a number of this brands dishes. Most were thrown away - dry, bland or even unpleasant - but this is one they got right.  Good texture, moist and great flavour.  Does need something like natural yoghurt as a dip, though. I used the gorgeous Coyo coconut one that Ocado sells & it was lovely.  Will buy again.
A very strong taste in my humble opinion, I would not have guessed that these were the fruity Moroccan version for the brand, as I could not detect fruity overtones.
Juicy and tasty - recommended
Pure juice great taste. Healthy and organic!

The flavour is lovely , but the straw wont go in easily, as other reviewers have said. So I thought Id cut the corner off with scissors, er, no, first it spills as I cut, and then it spills all over my hand as I tip towards the glass. 
And yes, it is exceedingly expensive, which I could possibly overlook if it werent spilled all over the place!
Little one loves these, nice treat. Great product, fresh fruity taste and organic!
I must say I had one for myself after sipping my toddlers. We both loved it! Absolutely delicious!
Had these on free trial, would buy in future as the taste was lovely, and my children thoroughly enjoyed them!!

We were given these to review. Gave them to our 5 and 3 year olds, and they loved the taste. Only downside is they are recommended to be kept refrigerated, which means we can't easily store them long term as standard drink cartons, and were wary of using them on days out which is why we usually buy these type of pouches.
Very tasty and enjoyable.
The grandchildren really loved these. Very fruity and not too sweet because theres no added sugar.  The carton shape is great for little hands to hold too. Perfect for the lunch box.
My three year old really enjoyed this. Ideal for kids, days out etc. Had a taste myself and it was really pleasant.
My small grandchildren aged from 4 to 7 love these drinks! Its great that they are organic and have no additives or added sugar too!
he says they are 'sic' which apparently means they are good.
Apparently these taste as if they have been freshly made - great for lunchboxes, or snacks on the go.  Straws pierce the packaging easily, so no mess!
Healthy and if rather pay the extra than pump additives into the kids they are quite tasty and good for lunch box also I love the straws !!!!!!! Prevents those squirt spills all mums hate
My 4yr old takes them in his lunchbox, no complaints
Fantastic replacement for RDA Organic drinks which we were missing terribly!  These are great for early morning commute on the train.
fizzy and good
This is quite sweet obviously but it seems to have a more natural orange taste to me than Tango
Really great tried these first time as my favourite can no longer available, delicious refreshing drink ,wish I had purchased  long ago ,very generous pack and on offer ,give these a try .
Good orangey taste.
Perfect alternative to coke and tastes great - wouldn't know the difference.  I wish it came in the larger card multipacks of 30 cans.
Can’t tell the difference between this and regular Fanta. Perfect for watching calories
It seems as of Coca Cola (inlcuding Fanta) have followed Pepsi's example of saving on packaging. I've had leaking cans of either Coke, Fanta, or Pepsi nearly every other delivery.
I normally cant stand diet sodas due to the aftertaste. But when I drink this ice cold I get no aftertaste at all. Absolutely lovely light orange flavour without the calories. My new favourite drink!
Love these. Tastes just like the original. Refreshing when served super cold.
Refreshing and tasty, easy to drink and zero sugar! Cant beat a cold can of this at the end of a long day!
Love this fizzy orange, diet but doesnt taste of sweetener. When icy cold really refreshes. Great value on offer, ta Ocado!

Yes I know, not natural, artificial additives, but when cold on a hot day it is really tangy and tasty
 Strong orange flavour
Got to control my consumption of these!
Thirst quenching without any calories
These radishes are the tastiest Ive ever eaten, I would definitely recommend them to people who are looking for a strong tasty radish
Variety of three different kinds of radishes. All tastes nice. I wish it was more in a pack.
A great 50/50 selection of tasty radishes. Buy them, they taste great!

Yes they were mixed but I was hoping for more than 2 varieties and more of a equal mix.
There were about 8 radishes of which 2 were purple and the rest were the long radish variety.
Surely there are more varieties than just these 2?

the title says it all - the ingredients label said produce of UK and Senegal. I am astonished that, if radishes are available from the UK, M&S also choose to source them from the other side of the world. Bad show.

Bought these from the seasonal selection- turns out theyre from Senegal. Appreciate that they might be in season there but wish Ocado would make more of an effort to state country of origin as never would have picked these up if Id seen that on pack in store.
We had two long radishes, the rest were all the same. Not quite what we expected.

I like the convenience of them being in good size slices perfect for sandwiches and cheese on toast. The same good flavour as the block of cheese. I use a knife to separate the slices as there is no paper between and if you use your hands they normally break as they are stuck to each other.
These were fairly nice. Thinner and more flexible slices than some other brands, but the taste was fine.
Dense/thick with little flavour. So many M&S things have gone down in quality, sadly.
Slices stuck together, might as well have bought a block of cheese.  Doesn't taste that good either...

Nice enough flavour, albeit not as strong or tangy as a number 5 should be. The problem is the slices are stuck together and fall apart when you try to pick them up with your hands. You need a knife or something to lift them with.
This is tasty sliced cheese. Kids love it. Absolutely does the job. So many Waitrose did it better reviews atm. But im loving the M&s products!
Salty, rubbery texture with no creamy taste like the Waitrose cheese slices. Disappointing
This is just a salty cheese but doesn't taste like cheddar at all. The texture is nowhere near a level 5 cheddar either. Bears no resemblence to the Waitrose sliced cheddar.
For the quickest cheese sandwich youll ever make. Good mature cheese.
Got this as a free gift at checkout. We drink a lot of ice tea and cold brews and loved this. Fruity and flavourful.
Tastes great, just discovered Baobab via Nigella, apparently it's a great source of natural fiber and vitamins, much better than taking a supplement.

I never knew about. Baobab 
It seems a very special fruit. 
Love  these shots as they seem to work as well as taste good

I’ve been getting these regularly all year and they were amazing. Very tender, beautifully trimmed and lovely taste. Used to get 4 or 5 breasts but the last couple months it’s been 3 massive pieces instead that are very tough, not well trimmed and just not nice to eat. Stopped buying them which is such a shame as 6 months ago I was raving about how good they are :(

We intended to cook this chicken on the same day as delivery. When opened the smell was enough to turn our stomachs. The colour was also very off putting. It was clearly rotten, but be really careful because this packet still had 4 days remaining before its use-by date!
So expensive- opened packet on day 1, chicken was grey, pink and green - so gross !

This is on my weekly shopping list but something has changed about it. On my last two deliveries the chicken had unpleasant/slightly gone off smell even if it was well within the date. Not sure what changes have caused this problem but if it happens again I will request a refund because its already too much to pay for this organic chicken let alone if it doesnt arrive fresh.

Opened the pack less than 48 hours after purchase and within date: well what a smell and the undersides (which you couldn’t see before taking them out the pack) were green and slimy 

Something must have gone wrong in the packing stage I assume given they had plenty of date left on them!

Bought two packets. It states that is a 4 pack – so expecting 4 chicken breast in the packet.  Upon opening both packets, it contained two HUGE chicken breasts per packet, one of the breasts was a dark red colour and it is obvious that some bruising must have occurred before the chicken was slaughtered.  In my view not fit for human consumption, so fed it to my pets.  Also who eats a 400g chicken breast??  I have always bought this brands chicken, but in my view their quality has gone downhill and really not worth the money anymore.  I will also be complaining to Daylesford as this is unacceptable and they definitely have quality control issues when it comes to their supplier as this is a sub standard product.  If I knew the dismal quality of the product on the delivery, I would have returned it, but unfortunately not possible to see until opening the packets.
tried this at friends dinner, nice texture

This really is the best chicken we have had.  Clean, perfect breasts that cook beautifully in slow cooker or stir fried with veg.  So tasty and tender.  A little expensive but worth the extra when you compare it to non-organic chicken which is often tough and nowhere near as nice.

Very disappointed in my last purchase as it was smelly on opening & had white mottled appearance. I had to throw it away. Usually it is lovely its our staple for my kids to. I dont mind paying the inflated £21 even. Awaiting a refund still this time around.

After buying this organic chicken for several months and having no issues with it & despite the pack price increase of £3 from £18 to £21 I still bought it and even recommended it to friends. I have however in the last 3 weeks had to request a refund twice as the chicken was very discoloured and definitely not fresh despite the fact that I opened it to use only a few hours after delivery. I have decided not to buy this Brand again.
The most expensive chicken you'll find on Ocado, and the best.

I struggle to find good quality organic chicken in supermarkets - sometimes theyre tough, chewy or just plain horrible, but these are absolutely lovely. Huge breasts, tender and extremely tasty. They are very expensive but I do think theyre worth it!

I appreciate how beautifully trimmed and packaged these are. I buy these regularly. Always fresh and delicious. I especially love Daylesford high welfare practices all the way through from start to finish.
Large chicken breasts and often get 3 rather than 4 in the pack, which is inconvenient. Also the price has shot up by £2 very recently, so Im discouraged from buying these again.

The mostly very good reviews persuaded me to try this chicken. Sadly, when I opened the pack a full day before the 'use by' date it smelt awful - really 'off'. Couldn't risk it obviously so had to throw the lot away.

These are advertised as a 4-pack and whilst I suspect that the weight of chicken might have exceeded the 800g stated, it's no good when you are cooking a meal that requires a whole chicken breast per person

This is absolutely gorgeous chook, the best I have tasted since I was a kid back in the 60's.
I had a 400g pack and was going to order an 800g this time. But as this has suddenly went up in price by £3:00 overnight I will not be buying it any more.

Good chicken, and a good substitute for the thoughtful producer, which unfortunately is hard to get now on Ocado. 
This week a £2 price rise as a result I will no longer buy.

This is nice chicken but I was disappointed that they put 3 large breasts in a pack and not 4 as advertised. It's quite annoying when you've planned your meals out for the week and needed 4 whole breasts.

These chicken breasts are great, quite large and always cook well. They are a regular in my shopping basket now. The only downside is that they run out of stock online quite a bit. Definitely worth trying them if you havent already.
Best organic chicken on ocado.
Hated the cheap chicken you can buy. These taste fine and are better than normal cheaper chicken. But theyre not that big. Better to just go to the butcher
These are lovely chicken breasts, just the way they should be, grown and fed naturally, outdoors. The extra cost is well worth it. No growth hormones or antibiotics used. Would recommend this company
These chicken breasts are really worth the extra.  Large and succulent, they are delicious gently poached for 10 minutes.  I don't buy any other chicken now.
Worth paying more.

Bit on the pricey side but well worth it.  These are great sized tender tasty chicken breasts.  I buy them regularly  because I am fed up serving chicken thats like rubber.    4 big sizes that you could be split to go around more people or chop up and put into a curry would definitely feed more than 4. You will not be disappointed if you buy these.
Incredible breasts. Three huge fillets in my pack. Could easily half each portion.  I bought these on a flash sale.  Roasted mine up with lemon and thyme. Stunning.

Wonderful pack of 5 large organic chicken breasts. The best chicken I have purchased for 3 years!!
Immediately went to reorder but alas out of stock - I am not surprised. OCADO please make it always available
These chicken breasts are the best. We managed to make several Chicken Kiev’s and were very cost effective,
Really good quality well flavoured organic chicken breasts. Nicely trimmed and prepared. Expensive but will buy again
Cooked this in a curry and turned out brilliantly. Hardly anything to trim off. Expensive but I make the curry with veg so it turns into two nights dinner for the family.

We got this on flash sale a while ago, and as I recall, it was 7 breasts, absolutely perfectly sized for one portion each (4 oz or so).  None of the weird texture issues that chicken can have nowadays, good flavour, and super easy to split up and freeze for later.

Received 5 small breasts and s couple of bits assumably to make up weight. 
None of the breasts large enough to make as an individual meal e. g. Chicken Parm, chicken Kiev. OK for cutting up if you don't want a whole breast per person. 
No fat or gristle. Nothing to cut off. 
Too expensive for me, especially as you can't use as  a centrepiece for a meal.
Tried several, these are the best by far.

I must say I was sceptical at first given the price of this chicken but it definitely is worth it! They're really delicious chicken breasts that have been excellently trimmed so all I had to do was slice them. It's also quite a large pack. I got 5 medium-to-large chicken breasts in mine. I'll be ordering again.
I was lucky to get this on flash sale so bought 2 packs. The pieces of chicken were a good size and good flavour.

Most expensive chicken I’ve ever brought but there’s no going back to the watery supermarket chicken. This is so plump and the box is clean, no water at all. I shop with Ocado now that I’ve found this chicken! No other supermarkets seem to stock it. Shame but it’s fine with me, I love Ocado , just wish the delivery staff weren’t so grumpy.
Great quality, expensive but worth it
Though not a brexit supporter Ive enjoyed these chicken breasts throughly including family too!
This chicken was really unpleasant. Cooked for adequate time and it was so tough and chewy. Overpriced and poor quality
Juicy and tender without any stringy bits. The pack came with 6 breasts, which is the perfect amount for three meals for the two of us. Freezes well.

Fed up with chicken that had been plumped up with water and hormones we changed to Organic chicken a long time ago.
Daylesford chicken comes at a premium price but in return you get high welfare chicken that actually tastes of chicken and doesnt release a ton of liquid when you cook it!
Keep your cooking times accurate and short, check with a thermometer, and you are rewarded with a delicious meal.

Clean, no nasty stringy bits or lots of water. Baked in the oven. I probably overcooked so they were a bit dry but still tasty and I have eaten them cold in salads. Am ordering again!

I also like that they have higher levels of animal welfare
These taste great, were quite juicy for breast meat. I'm a repeat buyer now.

Worth the extra money for tasty chicken, that didnt give off lots of water when cooked, unlike most chicken these days. Slightly annoyed that we received 7 small breasts rather than 4, which is how this pack is advertised. On this occasion It wasnt a problem,but if I had ordered this for a dinner party, I would have been quite annoyed. Technically false advertising Ocado...
Very succulent and full of flavour. Quite expensive but worth every penny.

My recent order contained seven small chicken breasts rather than four large ones. Not a problem on this occasion but it would be helpful if the description covered this possibility. Good quality chicken however and I would buy again. Long usage date which often isn’t the case with Daylesford meat
A slightly uneven mix of sizes was more than made up for by flavour.  This is the nicest chook I've bought from a supermarket.  Tender, with a beautiful flavour. Definitely worth the price.
Lovely chicken breasts.  When cooked they were tender and very tasty.  The best organic chicken breasts I have had.
Tasty, very generous size.

Large white chicken breasts
Succulent, tasty filling

First time order I got 4 very nice chicken breast, they was juicy and just lovely to eat. Second time I order I got some 1 cenimiter thin chicken breast and 5 small mini chicken breast fillets. Very very disappointed as I order chicken breast and pay more money for chicken that has lived  61-70 days. I expect for this  price £23.74/kg,  to get at least 3-4 nice big chicken breast and not small pices.

At last, I've found tasty succulent chicken. Ever since my local butcher retired I've been trying lots of different brands and this is the first time I've found chicken breasts that match his quality.
Tasty, juicy chicken with very generously sized pieces.  Expensive but worth every penny.
Really, really good.

Im basing this review on one purchase which I made this week- they really were great: large, no sinew or unusable bits and with a relatively long use by date. I used them to make a curry and the chicken was moist, flavoursome and better than most Ive bought recently. Yes, they are expensive but you certainly get what you pay for. Ill be buying these again.

For me these were great. Even better as we bought them in the flash sale but the chicken was still perfectly fresh. I thought they were really good quality as well and better than the Dutchys. I dont think I can justify full price for them but would def buy again in the flash sales.
Good refreshing flavour
Truly the best apple juice on Ocado, fresh, crisps flavour, not too sweet or sour, not ruin by additives, just how it should be.
This is the only juice my son will drink. I suppose he like the fact its sweeter and less acidic than other juices.
I found this apple juice unpleasantly sweet and will not buy again. The Pink Lady apple juice in a carton is the one for me, as less sweet and costs almost half the price of these cold pressed ones.
More expensive, but really nice.
No complaints, good apple juice as how it should be.
We received this as a substitution and were very positively surprised. Even the kids remarked on the taste and loved it!
I personally really like this apple juice,  it has a very subtle and clean taste!  I will buy again for sure.
Weird coloring but great taste

It looked like wee, I gave it to my husband who drank it and I didnt say anything to him about the drink. He spat it out and said it tasted like wee and smelt like it. I thought it was weird. Threw it away!
I only really buy this when on offer. Nice sweet flavour. Different each time I have brought but that is to be expected with a fresh produce.
Great taste, better if larger bottle
Goes into my morning vitamin shots. Lovely clean taste.

This Pink Lady is very refreshing but I can see why others want a stronger apple juice. To me, it's quite light in taste and has less full-bodied apple like other juices (particularly cox's for example). I like it for that, but I have had nicer apple juices. However, if you want something light and refreshing this is lovely.
All depends what you want from a juice really.

I'm pretty sure that this juice didn't use to have anything added. Now it has a whole bunch of vitamins in the ingredient list. No thanks! If I wanted to buy a vitamin supplement I'd do that. What I want is a bottle of apple juice. I guess I have to look elsewhere.
A little fragrant just like pink lady apples but far too sweet
I didnt think this tasted very much of apple. There are better juices out there.
Sweet light and refreshing with the delicate flavour of pink lady apples. Excellent straight from the fridge.
The juice is ok, but quite expensive for apple juice. Very sweet too.

I'm not sure if I got an off batch, but it didn't taste of much - sugary water with a hint of apple. I was expecting something a bit more akin to fresh apple juice, but the juice we got tasted the same as cheapy processed apple juice. Very dissapointed
Its eye watering expensive for 750ml. However it is worth the try and occasional treat. ColdPress really have done an excellent job. 5 stars.

I love this brand, as it is one of the few coldpress fruit juices on the market. Most fruit juices on the market arent cold pressed, so due to the processes they use such as pasteurisation, a lot of the nutritional value is lost. But with coldpress, they dont do that and you get more nutritional value. It is delicious mixed with soda water.
Even my daughter who doesn't like strong flavours found this bland.  Really quite unpleasant.
The best best best best ever apple juice
I like the fact that it is cold pressed and was really looking forward to it. I found it disappointing. Very, very sweet, but virtually no discernible apple flavour.

Delivered as a replacement for Waitrose Pink Lady Apple Juice. The almost clear colour and taste of this juice reminds me of the cheaper concentrate brands you got years ago before they started selling fresh apple juice in cartons. Tastes far too sweet and sugary. Not happy with this replacement especially the price as the Waitrose Pink Lady Apple Juice was on a 3 for A£5 offer.

When I first had this, it was very much like advertised, but last time it arrived, it was all but clear - the colour has been changing for months. When it is good it is great, but had a hard time getting the family to drink it this last time - please feed back that a year ago it was a better product, and we'd like to see that back.
We love apple juice and often buy organic brands. The Coldpress Pink Lady is a mere shadow of a juice; more like flavoured water. Won't be buying again.
Expensive but so delicious!
apple juice ever.
very refreshing!

Not better taste, as written on the label.  I shall not be buying this as there is an AFTERTASTE as mentioned by other reviewers, on these pages.   The best Pink Lady apple juice, is Waitrose own brand !
Ever since they changed the packaging, the taste has changed also. No longer the best tasting apple juice
Really nice, very tasty and refreshing
I am amazed how beautiful this juice is.
This actually tastes of apples - lovely.

I agree with the reviewer who found the quality of this product inconsistent. I bought one a couple of months ago and it was delicious, refreshing and very appley. However, I recently purchased two more bottles, within a fortnight of eachother, both of which had an odd, chemical taste, a little like root beer. It's quite expensive, so won't risk buying again.
I am a complete convert to cold pressed juices so this ticks all the boxes. Pink Lady's are the tastiest apple and make the most delicious juice!

I don't generally like apple juice but this is lovely, fresh and delicious just like...well an apple! Mixed with fizzy water it's a great alternative to wine.  I can't wait to try the other varieties.
Our family loves this juice.  Order 2 of them each week.
Foul aftertaste. Grim. Avoid!
Kept in the fridge for 2 days after opening and it found it had fermented and gone fizzy. Very disappointed as contents had to be thrown away and had only and one glass out of the bottle.

I don't normally reach for fruit juices, especially during the day. I tried this as it was on offer & like the Pink Lady apples. It's very refreshing, actually tastes like the apple, I know that sounds daft but....Shall definitely buy again. Will try it with the gin later, maybe.

Really+like+their+juices+but+their+quality+is+very+up+and+down.+As+others+have+said,+very+authentic,+fresh+juice+taste+but+on+several+occasions+I+have+bought+pink+lady+and+orange+juices+which+tasted+off+and+artificial.+Unfortunately+they+dont+have+customer+service+contact+details+anywhere+to+give+feedback

Don't be put off by the packaging - this isn't a sports drink but a really delicious pure juice. A friend introduced me to this brand & I'm glad they did. A pure apple taste exactly like the fruit itself.

This is a clear coloured juice but packed full of Pink Lady flavour and has become a favourite since OCADO provided us with a free sample of the 250ml size.  Arguably on the expensive side but does tend to come up on offer from time to time.
My son really likes this, and it is nice to have specific apples juiced - we also like bramley apple and cox juice.

normal sized lemons. shiny pale yellow one green tinged. juicy ,few pips.taste of lemon.
only two days left before best before date but that seems unimportant as obviously they have at least a week of freshness left just looking at them.
Arrived in good condition. Slightly green, medium-sized rather beautiful lemons. More difficult to zest as not as firm as usual supermarket lemons, but we managed. Nice product.
Same experience as others. Wrinkly and dark patches. 1 days life, so best before is tomorrow. I would say best before was a week ago. Disappointing.
The lemons were wrinkled with black patches. Somewhat unsatisfactory. They were advertised as having a shelf life of one day. You have to like lemons a lot to use three in a day.
Three tiny lemons. Although bought in a flash sale, these worked out at about 45p each.  Soft and fit for the bin.

They were really, really tiny. However, they tasted like they were recently taken off from the lemon tree branches. Compared to those other unwaxed organic lemons I got from Ocado, these lemons did taste more fresh and slightly more fragrant. Of course not as nice as very expensive selections from Natoora which I got on Flash Sale in the distant past and was impressed by. 

Not the very best but I would rather have these small but more fresh lemons than those huge lemons but obviously stored for months after picking.
These lemons were tiny and although I have been refunded by Ocado on close inspection all three  lemons were bad.  They should not have been allowed out of the warehouse.  Dreadful.
Three absolutely tiny lemons, one with a rotten patch. I've requested a refund as I've never seen such sub-standard lemons from a supermarket.
3 tiny lemons, 2 were green, yellow one was mouldy looking, had to ask for refund
3 tiny lemons, 2 of which had already gone brown and soft.

Husband unpacked shopping so I didnt notice these until too late.  Had to check they were what Id ordered.  Would hav e requested a refund. Tiny, awful lemons that are more expensive than much better lemons available in little local shop.  Dont be tempted to buy these.
Last order contained two very good lemons and one that had gone very mouldy
These lemons were tiny and although I have been refunded by Ocado on close inspection all three  lemons were bad.  They should not have been allowed out of the warehouse.  Dreadful.
Three absolutely tiny lemons, one with a rotten patch. I've requested a refund as I've never seen such sub-standard lemons from a supermarket.
3 tiny lemons, 2 were green, yellow one was mouldy looking, had to ask for refund
3 tiny lemons, 2 of which had already gone brown and soft.

Husband unpacked shopping so I didnt notice these until too late.  Had to check they were what Id ordered.  Would hav e requested a refund. Tiny, awful lemons that are more expensive than much better lemons available in little local shop.  Dont be tempted to buy these.
Last order contained two very good lemons and one that had gone very mouldy

Ordered these due to the reviews as making a lemon ricotta cake and needed good lemons - but really disappointed. These were really poor - delivered 25/07/20 PM and use by date of 26/07/20 . One lemon pale & rock hard, one teeny tiny and had a very mottled skin, not nice. Only one  suitable for zesting/use in the recipe. Won't be buying again

Very disappointed with the quality of these lemons - not only were they very very small, they were green and underripe. I would expect far more of a geniune Italian lemon. I think we were sold very very short. Won't be buying again.
unwaxed & organic so naturally short shelflife but 1 worth 3 regular lemons
We had them for one day and when I went to use them they had mould all over the underside, didn't even get to try a single one.
Ok, the lemons do look a bit off on the outside, but on the inside theyre some of the best lemons.
These may not look very nice, but they are very juicy and slightly sweeter than normal lemons.  Just because they don't look perfect doesn't mean they don't taste nice.
these are delicious
These are lovely! Very decadent desert for special occasions.
Bought in flash sale, but found them too stodgy and rich. Not for us. Sorry.
Took a while to cook sand was too rich for my taste. Lovely soft texture and nice with raspberries. I added vanilla custard
Very rich and delicious, you do need some cream with them or ice cream would be even better.  They are a little over priced in my opinion, I wouldnt pay full price.
It is the most yummy which I have taste.
disappointed, poor texture and taste

I bought these as part of a meal deal, but I was so full at the end of the meal I was perplexed.  Then I checked the calories of these, over 500 each!  I did like the taste but next time we will share a pudding and have over 2 nights.  Nice melty middle when cooked in the oven as instructed, just too much of a good thing!  If you’re a big eater and/or like a v filling pud you will probably think differently!
Tried these for the second time ( just to make sure! ) and threw the second one out. These are so sickly. Never again!
Best desert

These are a really lovely rich chocolate pudding. A good mix of chocolate sponge and sauce. Easy to cook, we oven baked but you can also cook in the microwave.  Perfect with a good quality vanilla ice cream.

These puddings have a mouth feel that is both too dry and too wet at the same time. 
The sponge is dry and sacrifices texture and taste for its structural capabilities. 
The melty middle starts promisingly, with a rich chocolate flavour, but is then overwhelmed by greasiness, and an artificial chemically aftertaste.
Suck up the extra cost, and buy the Gu ones instead.
Nice flavour but killed by the sweetness...
Bought as part of a meal deal - really tasty choc pud with a lovely melting middle. Ive tried to make these before but when they are as good as these why bother!

These are a great quick pudding. Microwaved in a minute and cake like on the outside with the melted chocolate inside. These are difficult to make from scratch so a perfect cheat. They are quite rich so do need something like ice cream with them in my opinion
Best desert ever! Only 50 seconds in a microwave too! Amazing with custard ! Our 5 year old loves this treat so much! We share one together its the best!
decadent
Cooked in the oven, didnt need the full time. It was ok, but really not chocolatey enough. Lots chocolatey but seems they replaced some chocolate in the recipe with sugar.
Unpleasant, fine, grainy texture and sickly sweet. 2nd one went  in the bin.
I really wanted to like this but the sweetness levels are so overpowering . Surely they can be cut down? I wouldnt buy them again
It really was too sugary for us to enjoy.
Horrible - couldn't eat the first one and the second went in the bin. It's far too sweet and flavourless - it's just sugar in a pot.

I buy a pack of these each week so I can have two 'treats'. They are so quick and easy in the microwave and cook perfectly, I keep an eye and do an extra few seconds until it looks about to bubble over. It's piping hot so have to be careful then but it's so good when the sauce oozes out and softens up the sponge further. They really have become a staple and I am not a dessert person I started with them from the two dine meal deal.
Easy to cook, lovely treat, very indulgent and expensive.

haven't always had the best of luck nuking melt in the middle puds, with the desserts coming out either still gooey throughout or else as a hot cake, but these worked well in our (weak) microwave just following the directions (even though oven heating is the recommended method for these, not going to go through all that hassle in summer)
These are delicious, my daughter raves about them
Not too large or small. Not too sweet. Melting middle  is gorgeous. Recommended

I absolutely love dark chocolate and the flavour of the dark chocolate is the only thing that saves these cakes. The texture of the cake is so cloying and the melting middle is underwhelming. its a shame as this isn't M&S' usual standard
Cooked exactly to instructions but sponge was dry and had an unpleasant flavour. The chocolate in the middle was poor as well, over sweet and cloying. Am amazed it has 4 stars overall.
Not very gooey in the middle, I was a bit underwhelmed.  Didn't bother to finish it because it wasn't nice enough to justify the 500+ calories.
Delicious dessert, come out perfect every time.
Of all the fondants on the market these are easily the best. Extremely moreish.
Lovely but I struggled to finish one as it was extremely rich. Some might love that though, so I can't fault it!

I was really looking forward to these but they are really horrible! Apart from a slight salty taste they are completely tasteless! The melting middle is watery and there is not much of it. The cake has a horrible dry texture and just doesn't taste of anything. So disappointed in the quality of a lot of these M&S foods. Expected so much better for the price!
We had these and they were too sickly. They also made us unable to sleep for some strange reason. Wouldnt buy again as each one is 500cals!
I bought these as part of the NYE dine in for £15 and they were absolutely delicious with a rich gooey chocolate sauce.  They will be a regular buy for me now, god help my waistline!!
Really rich, big hit of chocolate, centre runs well. Everything I wanted.

I cant fault this pudding, which has a strong chocolate taste and generous chocolate sauce.  Not too sweet, the pudding is the perfect dessert.  In my view, the pudding is as good as homemade and I will certainly buy again.  When I enjoy the next chocolate pudding, fresh cream or ice cream might be a nice accompaniment.
I have always loved these and so happy to have them in my weekly shop. Great with fresh thick cream. Lovely dense rich flavour.
This is a very rich, chocolate sponge with nice melted middle.  However, it still managed to be pretty tasteless, not sure how! There are nicer puddings out there at this price point.
Oka-ay, but if you want a real chocolate taste, as I do, you have to go the extra mile… to Gu or Picard, for example.
Bakes well with a gooey melting middle, but it contains palm oil, never again
A*

For me, there are better ones out there. I love the GU melt in middle ones (as they remind me of the ones from a popular Italian chain dessert!!) I think I would be happy with a less expensive and more simple chocolate pudding over this. It is indulgent though and I wouldn’t turn it down! Just not my cup of tea for the money it costs
Lots of chocolate sauce and a light sponge. Delicious
Years since I had Irn-Bru so I thought I give this a go in a moment of madness - not sure how different it is to the original but it still tates deliciously of girders to me!
Good taste.  Does not taste overly sweet or like diet.  Would buy again.
Hubby loves the stuff - even better without all the calories!
Am not a fan of fizzy pop but this is a classic and a sugar free version is a no brainer choice.
We like the standard irn bru but know its full of sugar so its an infrequent treat. Really liked this sugar free version. Hard to tell the difference so would recommend.
Haven't had Irn Bru for ages, this sugar free version is delicious.

My god-daughter's favourite drink is irn bru, despite me trying to steer her away from fizzy drink,  so this is great to keep in the fridge to indulge her taste without the sugar...she didn't notice the difference so that's a thumbs up.
Having not had this for at least 20 years, I was pleasantly reminded of what a great taste it has! I didn't notice any strange after taste being sugar free. The pack is very handy to store too.

There isn't too much change from the sugar version, which is normally what would put me off. I'm not the biggest fan of Irn Bru, but if I got it to drink it without sugar, I don't think I'd be disappointed.
Got this on review and forgot how nice it tastes. Great that a sugar free version is available will be purchasing again.
Tastes like the original but sugar-free. If you like Irn-Bru, you'll like this.
Hopefully it will keep until Burns Night!
My son only drinks zero sugar drinks and enjoyed these as a change to coke
Tastes horribly fake. The sweeteners taste even more fake in this than other drinks. Not recommended.
Ok for my husband but too sweet for me.  I didn't like it but that's my own personal taste.
Tastes much like the full-sugar drink. Best drunk out of the can than a glass given its non-natural colour!
Really strong distinctive taste just like full sugar cans. No after taste and refreshing when well chilled.
Tastes a bit like cream soda, bright orange and an oversweet artificial taste.
Gave a can to my Godson and was horrified when his dad read out the ingredient list...after he had drunk it all. Not for me I'm afraid but my Godson loved it.
Was very popular with the family and also zero sugar
Enjoyed this, a refreshing, light fruity taste.
Goes down well chilled at BBQ.
Not had this product before but I have to say I was truly surprised had a great flavour and definitely was refreshing straight from the fridge.
I haven't had irn-bru for years but I quite enjoyed this. A bit of a nostalgic moment really.
Thrist quenching and delicious
Slightly different than the normal taste, or at least the taste I remember! Quite enjoyed it though definitely a blast from the past.
Tastes like iron bru quite sweet tasting not my choice but received free to review
lovely unique drink - nice change from the usual suspects...

I am a regular consumer of a wide range of soft drinks both regular and low, or no, sugar. I sometimes prefer the taste of the lower sugar version. Not the case here I'm afraid. This version is sickeningly sweet to the point where I could only manage to drink a third of a can. I'll definitely stick to the original version in future.
I don't drink this but my husband did and said it took him right back to his childhood
The sugar free version is even more artificial and 'agent orange' than the original stuff I think. Not for us!

I haven't had irn bru for years, so wasn't sure what to expect. But tasty and refreshing fruit drink. 
Knocked stars off for the addition of sunset yellow which makes it a no no for the children.
Nothing special for the price Im afraid
Got this meal in a flash sale. Very tasty indeed. We served with garlic bread and a side salad, plenty for 2.
Big tortelloni filled with proper meat. They arrived with a portion of grated Parmesan cheese and the sauce. Really good.
This is not flagged as containing gluten but the ingredients list WHEAT.

I'm surprised that some people say that the filling was bland...it was lovely! Very tender beef, with a light buttery sauce. The portion for two was great and with a side salad, we weren't reaching for more. The pasta itself is great taste and texture and I would ge this again on a flash sale.

I know, the pasta is the star, Brits put too much sauce on etc. Plus points. Good portion size for two, well-filled chunky tortellini, nice savoury beef filling. However the truffle butter was missing in action, very subtle. Just needs something extra to lift it.

A lot of the issues have already been covered but just to add. Beef dry and tasteless (was just like having a slice of yesterdays roast beef in your pasta-odd!), pasta tough and ordinary, butter not truffle-y enough (I had to add more).. whole meal made me reach for another LFT wondering if Id lost my sense of taste! Ive often resisted ordering these products considering them a bit expensive. Lesson learned they are!
I bought this when it was on offer.  The pasta has a lovely texture, but the overall flavour and texture is lacking somehow.  Disappointing.

Pasta lovely but filling dry and tasteless, packaging is lovely and the truffle butter smelt amazing, shame the filling is so poor, also noticed the packaging doesn’t confirm where the beef is produced which concerned me a bit, usually most meat products now contain the country of origin for the animal

Weve had a few portions from Pasta Evangelists before and theyve always been decent, but this was dreadful.. literally the only flavour inside the tortellini was overpowering rosemary, when there was no mention of rosemary on the description. If theyd been described as rosemary tortellini with a texture of beef that would have been fair.. the beef had zero flavour and even the truffle butter was only detectable as a waft from the pan when it was being heated up. No taste of it on the finished plate. Im giving them two stars because the pasta was nice and thin and the cooking instructions delivered a correctly cooked plate of food (albeit one that only tasted of rosemary).

In flash sale.
Looks small but doubles in size when cooked. That is the best you can say about this kit. Beef over flavored so you could be eating any protein, much the same with the butter and adding the chesse was far to much for the pasta. Went in the bin.

Beautifully packaged pasta, I was sure this would be a huge hit. It wasnt for us . overwhelming rosemary and thyme flavour to the filling, dry paste-like beef and the pasta remained quite hard in places (not the beautiful velvety pasta you would eat in Italy).  This was a half price offer, so glad I didnt pay the full price !
Terrible taste
Me and my husband both said this was the best pasta we have ever eaten, we had it with a spinach and Parmesan salad and garlic bread x

This is the second batch of tortelloni I've tried from here.  I can only assume that the person making them is NOT the person supplying the cooking instructions - they arrive much flatter than the photo, more oblong than triangular, so there is a thick layer of overlapping pasta.  I cooked for 8 minutes using a slotted spoon to ensure the thick folded bits were constantly submerged and they were still unpleasantly hard.  

Maybe I'll try again in a couple of years' time, but not for now.

Amazing! Bought this in a flash sale & Im so glad I did. The meal is beautifully packaged & thought out. The pasta was extremely authentic & the beef in red wine filling was perfect. You could taste every individual flavour. I eat ALOT, and there was the perfect amount for two people, I added a tomato side salad. Will definitely be ordering some more meals for a date night at home! Yum!

Bought this on flash sale- very glad I didn’t pay full price for it.. 14 pieces of tortelloni, so quite a small dinner between 2 people. The pasta was nice enough but the beef centre was overwhelmingly flavoured with rosemary & quite dry so needed the butter which is flavoured with truffle.. so 2 strong flavours that didn’t work particularly well together on top of a smallish,  dryish dinner…..

I tried these on a flash sale as a good midweek supper, they were ok,,,, some of the more folded tortellini seemed to stay quite hard - I was conscious of not overcooking them and them falling apart. They also tasted quite herby rather than tasting the beef. 
Think well try the other varieties not these again

Like all pasta evangelists products - v tasty and great portion for 2.

I have no idea how you can have it as a single portion - when it cooks its a big pile of pasta, easily enough for 2 and be happily full.

Superb - will order more in future
Most issues well covered by others… pasta was hard and the filling grey, unappetising & tasteless.

I was sent this to review, and not for me I'm afraid. Had an overpowering sage twang and with only 13 in the box not enough for 2. I did some garlic bread to go with it to help make it enough of a meal for 2.  Very expensive and not imho worth it.

We found it quite filling but a bit odd tasting - overwhelming herb taste and really lacking something - the inside of the pasta was a thick beef paste and not appealing and overall it was quite dry.  We had 7 each there seemed more in the advertised picture.
Was given this to review,  husband loved it, almost bought it again til I realised the price!!
Really lovely restaurant quality pasta. Keeps shape well on cooking. Delicious butter
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Convenient and lovely presentation Taste was ok, but not enough for two people.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I thought this was okay, the packaging is clever and everything is well presented but it's very expensive for what it is.

I bought this on a flash sale and it was still too expensive. I cooked for the recommended time and it was tough and dry in parts, not al denté, tough. Two of us had really painful stomach cramps after eating it, I don't think it was bad as much as indigestible. I cannot fathom the good reviews, it's like they received an entirely different product. The Soli brand is far better and a fraction of the price. I won't be swayed again

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I did enjoy the convenience of having all the ingredients and instructions in a nice packet but this has an impact on the cost of the final product . The ingredients were of good quality and the result was great but portion wise , you cannot feed 2 people out of what is in the box unless you are talking about a starter for 2 . Premium price for a great convenient product that can introduce you safely into the pasta making world .
Very nice pasta and filling. Tad on the expensive side but nice for a change

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.., well I would have done, but it was out of stock so they sent the Nduja one. Disappointed as I was quite excited about trying this one, nevermind..! I liked the experience, and it felt special with the box, little booklet and pasta cooking guide, however did think it was quite expensive. Plenty of nice quality pasta though.

I got sent this to review. The presentation and detail are great. Packaging is terrible and one flimsy sticker does not make it tamper proof. Really concerned me. The pasta itself was quite good. Would have been so much better if the meat was shredded/pulled and not ground down to a goey consistency. The price point is too high. I would try other flavours only if they were on offer.
Not a lot of filling, pasta too thick. Not enough butter to coat pasta. Cheese was nice though.

Ocado kindly sent this Pasta Evangelists tortellini free for review. I’ve never bought this brand before, but do buy other fresh tortellini. This was certainly a cut above the rest! Beautiful pasta, rich meaty filling with a natural herby flavour. The ingredients set it apart as good quality and it’s so fresh that they label the day of making it (which was only 2 days before I received it). It had an expiry date of 4 days from delivery and we left it until the last day before eating- it was still fresh and in perfect condition. 

None of the torteloni were broken - the lovely eco friendly cardboard box it arrives in protects it from all squashing and mishaps.

I thought it wouldn’t be enough for two with my husband’s hearty appetite! But it’s very satisfying and with some green salad and/or some bread it’s plenty filling enough for us. The truffle butter was the right amount for us, but we added a little more Parmesan. Oh and we cooked it 30 seconds longer than said, just to make sure the thicker bits of pasta were cooked.
  
Yes it’s pricier than other fresh tortellini we buy, but this did feel way more special. We would definitely buy it again for a treat.
I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This is my first time tried this kind of dinner. It is delicious and easy to cook, for the value, I think will be a treat sometimes
We were sent this to try by Ocado. We tried it out on non-veggie relatives and the verdict was delicious - and it was easy to prepare.
I was sent this by Ocado to review.  I found it quick and easy to prepare, tasted ok and I may buy again if it is on offer.   Quite expensive at normal price.
Oh my goodness! These pasta ingredients are those of restaurant quality hence the most gorgeous mouth watering pasta. A bit pricey but well worth it for a treat.

Not my words but the words of my wife who ate half for her tea and took the rest to work with her the following day.

Piece of cake to prepare and the pasta pieces are much bigger than I imagined.

I’m not sure i/the wife would pay £11 for it but she was suitably impressed nonetheless.

I’m reviewing this as I received a free sample from Ocado. This is a quick and easy to make and a decent size portion. We added some peas which went quite well. Expensive but we do buy this range occasionally
The beef is really rich, the truffle butter isnt too strong and the cheese isnt too overpowering. Very nice.
I got this to review and was very pleased I did! The pasta was full of filling absolutely delicious.

I'm reviewing this because Ocado sent me a free sample.
The filling was tasty and full of flavour but the truffle butter would have been overbearing (truffles not eaten in our house)
The pasta was quite wet after cooking and water pooled due to the shapes. The quantity was just enough for 2 of us as it was very filling. Def not worth the usual expensive price tag, although prob nice to try some others when on offer
Great for a quick and easy tasty meal. Good size portions for 2. Really enjoyed the rich braised beef tortellini and creamy butter sauce made a green salad to accompany. Delicious

I was sent this by Ocado to review and Im really glad I got it for free rather than pay for it. After eyeing up Pasta Evangelists for some time online, I was delighted to receive this for review. The package was lovely, containing 13 perfectly crafted pieces, a perfectly formed blob of truffle butter and a cute little pot of cheese. 
Cooked exactly as instructed on the packaging and was hugely disappointed that the pasta was still hard once cooked (not al dente, it was hard). There was an overwhelming aftershave type taste to the pasta which led to us stopping eating it after just 1 piece each. 
Unfortunately I wont be looking to purchase this again.

I brought this as the reviews were great and I really liked the idea of the assembly  and that you could potentially modify it (my son doesn’t like oil on pasta so I  could leave it off his portion). It looked beautiful. Nice packaging, clear instructions, I thought I was in for a real treat. However we found the cooked dish somewhat lacking in flavour. The pasta to protein ration was way off with very little filling so it felt like just chewing on bland pasta. Disappointing, as for the price I expected so much more.

I was sent this to review by Ocado. The beef filling was lovely but rather rich after a few. I could see it being used for a special meal but for me it would be better serving four as a starter. And yes it is expensive!!
I was sent this to review and I was dubious after seeing the other reviews but I thought it was nice! The pasta was soft and buttery, the filling was generous and the flavours were so delicious!

I was given these to review. It was a very quick meal; less than 10 mins from reading the instructions to serving. The large tortellini were well filled with shredded beef but the pasta was thick and dry. Not enough truffle butter or cheese. Very expensive for a pasta dish.
Pasta Evangelists are such a good brand and this is a lovely easy dinner that feels a bit more of a treat than your standard stuffed pasta.

I was given this to review. I normally make meals from scratch and was expecting to be disappointed. I really enjoyed it. It's a bit expensive, but as I would have it instead of a takeaway, for me it was worth it
Really nice flavour and a real handmade appearance, expensive but worth it for a treat. The truffle butter and Parmesan finished the dish perfectly.

Was excited to try this as we have loved other kits from Pasta Evangelists. Bought 2 boxes to feed 4, and had to throw some tortelloni away as the filling was exposed before I even took some of it out of the box. What I did cook was was thick, dry pasta that needs sauce, not a tiny amount of butter. Even when I cut the thick, folded pasta edges away from my tortelloni the braised beef filling and pasta I was left with was dry and unpleasant. The other 3 in the family didn’t eat much either. Not the special supper I had hoped for.

I bought this in a flash sale so bought two boxes to feed 4. The filling was very bland and there really wasn't enough of the butter sauce to coat the pasta too well so what you end up with are partially dry pieces of pasta filled with a bland and not very generous meat filling. My husband barely touched his, my son left a fair bit (and he barely leaves the pattern on a plate normally), I tried to eat mine to 'encourage' the others but accepted defeat and I knew the fourth person wasn't going to touch there's with someone else's bargepole so saved the aggro and binned theirs.
Loved the pasta it was delicious, the only downside was the Parmesan provided it tasted like cardboard.

Got this on offer and even at a reduced price we didn't consider it value for money. The tortelloni were well-filled, the pasta was nice and the filling was quite flavoursome, but my wife remarked that it reminded her of cheap sandwich beef paste! Nowhere near enough truffle butter - which was also totally underpowered - and a measly portion of very average grated parmesan.
The portion sizes were fine for us. But we probably won't try this brand again.
Just enough for 2 if you add a side dish. Lost one star for value for money.
very nice, the tortelloni filling is meaty and is a nice meal for 2, you will need some extras to complete the meal. would suggest this would be good for a lunch or light dinner

This pasta was my first try at pasta evangelists and it was great, the pasta was so fresh it felt like I was in Italy! Wasn’t sure if I would be a fan of the beef filling but it was great and not overpowering, and the truffle butter sauce gave a lovely rich feel. Personally I would see this as a one person meal rather than 2 portions as it seems quite small for 2 portions, however did get a bit too rich towards the end of finishing the whole pack, would defo get this again.

I'm a big fan of Pasta Evangelists, and this is probably my favourite yet. Really juicy and rich beef tortelloni and the truffle butter makes it extra indulgent and flavoursome. Bought on a meal deal with my favourite Remeo Mango Sorbet. Yum

Nowhere near the quality of Nonna Tonda and the same price. If Nonna Tonda (not stocked by Ocado, buy direct), are top of the Premier League then this experience puts PE struggling in the Championship.

I have always wanted to try the Pasta Evangelists product but, in all honesty, I was deterred by the price tag. However, I got the chance to buy this one and the pea and mint raviolini in a flash sale. All I can say is 'WOW'! They are worth every penny of the price tag and then some! Beautifully made pasta and delicious generous filling, coupled with flavoursome butters and oils. LOVE THESE! I will be buying these in the future even at the full price. Quality restaurant standard pasta in the comfort of your home! I can't tell you how impressed I am by these pastas. p.s 1 kit comfortably feeds 2 people, we had ours with nice fresh veg on the side and a bottle of red! Perfect date night food!
A family member described these as divine. Full of flavour and extra delicious with the added cheese topping liberally sprinkled over the top. Another winner from Pasta Evangelists  !
Tasted really bitter, not sweet in the slightest. Took a while to make and is definitely not worth £6.
best hot chocolate I ever had. what a privilege to be able to enjoy at home!

It takes some time to master the technique of making hot chocolate with these but in the meantime you get to nibble on some delicious chocolate. I suspect that if I kept a packet in the cupboard 75% would be victim to chocolate fiends stealing a piece to eat.
This makes a decent hot chocolate, but it is not as chocolatey as I was hoping and it is a little fiddly to make. It's worth trying, but not for me.

I chose this one with the highest percentage of cocoa so it was not a surprise that it was not too sweet. It had a quality fruity taste. As I was making a lot I made it in a pan, first melting gently in some hot water and then slowly adding milk on a gentle heat. This is not instant hot chocolate, but well worth the wait for a treat. I added a squeeze of honey for my children and they loved it too. They are used to dark chocolate though.
A bit of an effort to make but the taste is worth it! Not too sweet and feel less guilty consuming it - yum!

I had high hopes for this hot chocolate but unfortunately didn't think it lived up to it. It was a bit of a faff to make, which I don't mind if it's worth it!, but after trying a few different methods the chocolate discs didn't properly dissolve and often left little lumps. The flavour is nice and not too sweet but is a bit pricey for what it is.

This chocolate drink is fantastic!  I found myself eating at least a couple out the packet whilst making the luxuriously, self indulgent hot chocolate drink. A mighty fine taste I'd say and you'd be hard pushed to beat it. It really is pure chocolate diluted with the milk of your choice. Can't praise it enough! A+
Makes a delicious hot chocolate drink. If you're in a hurry, the chocolate medallions are good to eat too!

Not too sweet but it takes a lot of stirring to get it all dissolved. Their suggestion of covering in boiling water to melt before making the drink felt like a bit too much work so my method was covering with milk and nuking in the microwave. Lovely. Its hard to beat green and blacks hot chocolate which is much easier to make but this comes close.
A bit more effort required but worth it as the hot chocolate is delicious.
The taste is nice and rich, but it's a lot of faff to make. Perhaps if the pieces were smaller it would melt with just hot milk like some other brands.

Melting the chocolate first is a pit of a pain, the hot chocolate made is nice, not sweet, which I like and the monster size buttons taste great as they are, but it is quite expensive. Overall a quality product.

I tried this both 'raw' and made into a hot chocolate drink. If you enjoy very high cocoa content chocolate then you might enjoy this, but I found that eaten it is  bitter and I didn't like the slightly powdery aftertaste.  To make the drink following the instructions takes more effort than with a standard premium hot chocolate - my favourite is Charbonnel et Walker - and both my husband and I found that it had a pronounced and unplesant aftertaste. This could be because I used the maximum suggested number of 'buttons' in a large mug.  I might try melting the rest and using it in baking,
Excellent chocolate taste but a bit fiddly to make.

I used to love hot chocolate when I was younger but my tastebuds gave out grown the sweetness of it. I decided to try this and had quite low expectations. Boy I was wrong! This chocolate is dark and scrumptious straight out of the packet and makes the best hot chocolate I've had! I had given up on hot chocolate but suspect this is going to be a regular treat!
Have to admit that I didn't make hot chocolate. As a lover of dark chocolate the pieces were too nice to melt so I ate them.
Haven't tried the drink, there's powders for that, but it makes excellent cake.

I tried this & was sure I wouldn't like it very much. However, I do quite like it, especially with a drop of rum in it. Because it's so bitter, my son won't drink it, which makes it Mum's treat. So making it in a pan, which would usually be a hassle, is just a part of the treat ritual. Feels indulgent but I'm not sure I'd pay the full price.

I tend to only drink hot chocolate when I'm feeling poorly and I don't have a sweet tooth so when I was offered this free to review I chose the darkest option. I don't like the instant sugary stuff. I took the microwave option to reduce faff and added the boiling milk. That makes a very nice drink. I'd use it for guests.
This was very strong at bitter, had to add loads of sugar to make it drinkable for me! Not quick or easy to make either, not worth the faff!

I thought it was a lot of money for what you got! Fortunately I didn't buy it, it was a freebie! I don't really drink hot chocolate but my daughter does and she wasn't too keen as it was quite bitter compared to her usual Cadburys! Also a bit of a faff on to make it..!
Made lovely hot chocolate
A better class of drinking chocolate if your willing to put the extra effort in to make it
Really lovely hot chocolate. Not too sweet. A bit of a faff to make, but worth it. Nice to eat as it is too.
This is great to eat on its own as well as a drink. The packaging is attractive and perfect to put in a hamper for a gift.
Really nice hot chocolate, makes a change to have one that's not too sweet.  I would buy this again.
Excellent and earthy tasting chocolate. Highly recommended.

It tastes good, when you have worked out the measures to suit. 

Not sure it is so special that the price is justified.

I was warming the kettle to make this to try it for reviewing purposes and was tempted to try a piece to eat... and then I couldn't stop! Delicious if you like the bitterness of really dark chocolate. The flavour was less intense when made into the drink with milk, so I think i'll stick with eating it!

I like the packaging, the fact it is 'real', it is less sweet, it makes you feel wholesome and is rather tasty. Oh, another like, you can use it in baking, though not tried their recipe ideas yet. However, it is a bit of an effort getting the balance and consistency right and isn't that cheap.
I eventually got a nice hot chocolate, it wasn't amazing, but was nice for something homemade. However, it's a faff to make it!
really enjoyed this, not too sweet

I suspect it is going to be trial and error to find the right proportion of chocolate drops and milk to suit your taste. I like the fact it's not drenched in sugar, but my end drink had a funny after taste and it was quite a faff following the instructions for a fairly disappointing result.

Given free to review and it's a good job as I certainly wouldn't pay for it. Awkward to make and not worth the effort. The chocolate just breaks up and never mixes with milk to make hot chocolate, you just get warm milk with very small bits of bitter chocolate in it. There are many many instant hot chocolates that are much nicer than this.
My husband found this a little bitter but I think it made the most amazing hot chocolate. More for me I guess!!

This hot chocolate is stunning and easy to make, simply microwave three pieces of choc for 30 seconds then add warm milk. Tastes absolutely stunning with no sugar required. I've tried a lot of premium hot chocolates but this one is hands down the best for flavour and ease of making. Recommended.
Def high end but special treat hot chocolate.  My husband eats them straight out of the bag!  Bit bitter for me but v good quality.

Following the instructions ensured that the hot chocolate was easy to make and produced a very satisfying drink. The 82% cocoa was rather bitter, but with the addition of half a tea spoon of sugar it was perfect - it transformed it into a delicious, sophisticated drink. It is also lovely with the addition of a drop of amaretto on a cold morning.
Try it, perfect in the morning when the weather isn't great. It's not too sweet which is a bonus for sugar haters .

If you want a little bit of luxury this is the product for you. If you follow the instructions you do get a lovely drink. Yes it is more of a faff than the instant versions but there really is no comparison. Indulgence in a cup.

Really, really good bitter chocolate flavour. I had to add quite a bit of sugar to suit my taste. However... A faff to make and very very pricey. So as delicious as it was not sure I'm converted to buying it.
Worth the price; these make a decadent hot chocolate or are great in brownies!

A bit severe for me, but my husband who normally drinks hot chocolate made from cocoa powder & milk, no sugar, thought it was great. Seemed a bit acidic in the way that e.g. Kenyan coffee can be? Might try a lower % cocoa solids from this range
as hot chocolate it's pretty good, but the rrp is far too high in my opinion. also a bit of a faff to make, but then that's just me being lazy.
I absolutely love dark chocolate so this is perfect for me, the portion size is easy to control too as you just add a few chocolate buttons to get the right taste.  Perfect for cold winter days!

This does make very rich hc, dark but with a better taste than hc made with cocoa which I always have to add sugar to.  I would hope it is very ethically traded for the price which does seem a tad steep.  Very lovely drink as a treat though.

This is the kind of hot chocolate that is served in the very best hotels. Whilst it is a lengthy process to make the drink, the end result is worth it and the cost per cup isn't that bad. However, upon first glance the bag does resemble a pack of dog treats!
not managed to make the drink yet, as they are too delicious when eaten on their own - giant choc buttons - delicious.
Bit off a faff compared to powdered versions, but worth it for a special treat

I usually eat 90% chocolate so chose the 82% to make hot chocolate at home.  I wanted a nice creamy drink so used 3 tablets and made up according to instructions.  Maybe because I am used to 90% chocolate I found the drink a little thin and not with as much flavour as I hoped.  I solved this by adding in a square of my 90% bar and the taste was amazing.  Probably only an occasional treat though
I don't have a sweet tooth so this hot choc is perfect...full of nuanced non-sugary flavour. Pricey though so an occasional treat.
Very good product. Real chocolate!
These hot chocolate is absolutely delicious. The chocolate pieces are even nice enough to eat on their own! Making the drink is more difficult than your standard powder, but it is worth it!

Makes thick and strong dark hot chocolate. Very yummy and the perfect thing for a cold night. However, for the price, I do wonder if I can get something similar with using dark eating chocolate that's far cheaper.
Lovely and smooth but needed sigar for my tastes as too dark.

This is not a 'throw a teaspoon into a cup of water/milk' HC but one that takes a little extra time to prepare and instructions to follow. It is however well worth it as the results are divine.I still think it is overpriced though as there are other similar, cheaper worthy contenders on the market.
