This is the best hot chocolate I have ever tasted. I love dark chocolate so these pellets are a hit with me. They also taste nice on their own as a quick nibble.

I have been on a low sugar diet for months now and this is the first chocolate I've allowed myself.  It is a serious chocolate taste and a treat to be savoured.  Very easy to make but agree with other reviewers that it is expensive, but it does taste like a quality product.  However, as a very occasional treat it certainly hits the spot and is plenty for 12 medium sized cups.  Would be perfect on a cold evening.  Would have been five stars if a slightly lower price.
It was nice, but expensive. Prefer Green & Blacks cocoa powder, less expensive and more a chocolatey taste. That said it wasn't bad, just wouldn't buy it again at A£5.99.
This was a nice posh hot chocolate and easy to make.

Don't get me wrong, I really like hot chocolate made with cocoa powder - and would highly recommend Green & Blacks cocoa powder - but this is a different beast entirely.  To avoid graininess I found I needed to follow the instructions carefully instead of chucking in everything together and nuking it in the microwave like I normally would - apologies to the culinary purists reading this.  Made carefully this is seriously rich and chocolatey.  The red fruit tang is very noticeable with distinct cherry and redcurrant like flavours.  I think this would be great to cook with, particularly used with fruit like raspberries or cherries.  Definitely one for the dark chocolate fans, milk chocolate fans need not apply!

Have nearly finished packet in just a few days, nice and rich, bitter without being too bitter, 
Nothing like powder hot choc, but good for those of us who like dark choc

You have to like dark chocolate to enjoy this....which I do! Not too sweet like a lot of hot chocolate drinks.
I preferred this to the white chocolate version.
It was too much faff to prepare and although it tasted good as I was slurping it, there was an unpleasant aftertaste. I also find the mouthfeel a bit cloggy.
There is no better hot chocolate
Got chocolatey chocolate in, made of chocolate. Really tastes of chocolate, too, not just sugar.

You probably need to really like dark, bitter chocolate to appreciate this - it's a million miles away from 'normal' powdered hot chocolate - not very sweet but very satisfying.  Using three 'lumps' makes it a bit grainy, two is better.  And a great 'chocolate' fix if you just want to melt one in your mouth.

This makes delicious hot chocolate - not too sweet, but very satisfying even when made with skimmed milk (so quite healthy too, sort of). The chocolate "pellets" also taste delicious if you just eat a few while the milk is boiling...
surprisingly loved the flavour, wasn't sure about decaf tea, but did like these
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Not sure you can expect too much from a decaf tea but this quite pleasant and drinkable

I am reviewing as I received a free sample from Ocado. These tea bags were ok, but didn't make a cuppa as strong in colour or flavour as I prefer, even with lots of stirring and squeezing. Not a bad option as a caffeine-free cuppa in the afternoons if you've had your fill of herbal teas.

This used to be my regular decaf until it was repackaged into Tasty Decaf and the flavour changed -it seemed a little perfumed and I no longer liked it.  I found another from Ocado which I am very happy with for taste, strength and colour. I received this free from Ocado in order to review it and was keen to do so in case it had changed back to what it used to be - it's cheaper than my current one.  I have tried it many times to give it a fair go, finally making two cups at once today to compare them.  I can still taste the slightly perfumed flavour in the PG and trying them side by side confirmed to me that my current favourite, although it costs more, is much better for me in taste and colour. Sorry PG, although one of us prefers PG Gold, I will not be going back to PG Decaf for me

have been drinking decaf pg tips for years, but lately noticed they are weaker and often need to use 2 teabags for a decent mug! is there a change in formula? Still the best taste, but value is diminishing

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from ocado.  I do take me tea very weak but have to say I couldn't really tell the difference from the regular PG tips. Think I'll be buying these again.
A lovely blend of tea

I was sent this to review by Ocado. 
Great flavour although you need let it  
brew for long than non-decaf tea 
its light and refreshing tea, I will be adding this to my favourites for the future.

I was sent this tea by Ocado to review..
I found it extremely nice and refreshing, and could not really taste any difference between this and ordinary non decaf tea.well done PG

I am reviewing this as I was given it by Ocado . Wasnt sure if I would like this and I was pleasantly surprised! Nice flavour and very drinkable. Its nice that I can have a drink before bed but with no caffeine. I would recommend this as it is quite good and I will definitely be buying again
Cannot taste any difference to normal tea - great alternative.
I was given this free by Ocado to review and enjoyed the taste, would not have noticed that these were decaf, however I prefer stronger tea. Good for the evening cuppa.
Never would guess its decaf from the taste  seems identical to me!  And this means I can keep drinking tea into the evening to keep warm and cosy
Lovely yea bags definitely buy again
These are great tasting decaf teabags and love that the bags are biodegradable and can be disposed of in the food bin!

All tea producers should be responsible and offer biodegradable teabags like PG.  Who wants plastic tea bags?  This tea tastes good and helps the planet  For a few pence more: that has to be worth it.
not a fan
I drink a lot of tea. I use decaf from mid afternoon onwards. I have tried quite a few brands and this is the one I like the best.
Put on a no caffeine diet and after trying a few brands, he loves this. Hes such a tea addict and says you cannot tell the difference to his old Yorkshire tea brand. Not too pricey either.
Taste really good, if I don't tell my husband doesn't notice!
Used to be my go-to decaf tea but its changed and now more fruity / flowery. Have switched to Waitrose own brand and its excellent.

I used to have ordinary decaf and tried this and wasnt keen at first. It's a new blend so you can taste lots if different flavours. When I bought the normal decaf it tasted bland by comparison so this is our new unexpected favourite.

I've always been really disappointed with decaf tea - it often lacks any flavour at all, and certainly doesn't keep the satisfying bitterness of a good strong cuppa. These have much more of the proper tea flavour though - I'm surprised by some of the negative comments, it's the most tea-like decaf tea I've found!
Nearly as good as the standard pg tips!

I am surprised at the negative reviews for this product!

I have been trying to find a caffeine free brand I liked with varying amounts of success. 

Only tried these because Ocado had a good offer, wish I had tried them sooner. 

I am not a fan of ultra strong builders brew, so these are perfect for me.
Extremely disappointing, no flavour at all. Apparently the amount of tea per bag has been reduced, will not be buying it anymore and do not recommend it. Waste of money
I never finish this tea. Ive tried it with different types of plant based milks and it never quite delivers a satisfactory level. This is obviously my personal taste, which is also a vegan one.
Horrible taste, almost herbal.
Not the same flavour as the original decaf tea bags in any way. Very strong lemon / floral scent and taste.
Hot water and milk. Is pretty much what you get here, I tried this instead of the usual Yorkshire decafe because it was labelled tasty. It isnt! Dont wast your money.

Whilst I agree that it is tasty and you get a good strong cup of tea, I personally dont like it. Ive been on decaf for over 10 years and have always been a PG Tips fan. However these are too floral, soapy almost. The smell is one of perfume too. Ive bought a few boxes of the original decaf to keep me going and then Ill switch to another brand when the originals are no longer available

I like a good, strong cup of tea and was very pleasantly surprised that these teabags produce a “proper” mug of tea without having to let it stew! The flavour is excellent and no one would guess that they are caffeine-free. The packaging is well-designed too, if you want to keep them in the box in the cupboard.
Nice alternative to caffeinated tea.

Yuk! Awful!! 
Dont buy. Wish I knew how to get my money back!
Really enjoyed a late night cuppa. Tastes great, really couldnt tell the difference from full caff.
As someone who like to keep a cup on the go, I have been enjoying this brew a lot. No noticeable taste difference to a caff tea.

Got these to review. My husband is an avid tea drinker & these have worked brilliantly for him to have of an evening before going to bed as they don't keep him awake. They don't taste any different from normal PG tips which is even better
This is especially handy just before bed time, you fancy a nice cup of tea but dont want the caffeine, so this is ideal and tastes just as good as regular pg tips.

I got this product to review. My favourite brand of tea is PG Tips which I have been using for years. I cant say I noticed a big difference between the tasty decaf and the regular decaf. It is just a nice cup of tea.

Had this product to review  and I have had PG in the past and they have always been at the forefront of a good cuppa but in this case they come second to Waitrose Essential Decaf teabags. Saying that, the PG  makes a decent refreshing cup of tea but prefer Waitrose.
I was pleasantly surprised that there was no real difference between the decaf and ordinary. Just a lovely cuppa but a little more healthy!
good decaf  taste a bit sented could be the natural flavour

I drink decaf tea as Im pregnant and have tried so many different brands with no luck, these are really flavoursome and make a lovely tasting strong cup of tea. Theyre even nicer than some normal teabags Ive tried - highly recommend!
These teabags are as close to full caffeinated tea as decaf gets. It has a strength of tea flavour and speed of brewing which I don't usually get having switch to decaf drinks last year.
No, it doesnt taste the same, but it still tastes good and I find it easier to spread.

You can't have it all. This is undoubtedly a compromise against real butter - you gain in that its lower calorie and spreads easily, but you lose in that it clearly can never taste quite the same. For what it is it works well, spreading easily on toast and not being unpleasant by any means. I'd buy again.

Strangest thing I noticed when using a pack of this recently, that there are little water pockets in the spead. Almost like it has been defrosted. Tastes okay but separates when spreading, which was slightly off-putting. Not sure Ill buy this lighter alternative originally suggested by Ocado, in future.
love this lighter option
buy this everytime really nice
Really nice & light.

Totally agree with previous reviewer, as I have done
the same. Nothing against the taste of other brands, just the fact that I like to be able to spread mine straight
from the fridge. This may be more expensive, but a
small price to pay for something I like.
I buy all sorts of brands of butter but always return back to this one as its soft straight from the fridge and tastes just like normal lurpak.
Nothing like the regular Lurpak Spreadable, this is much too soft, I know it is nice to be able to spread from the fridge but this is ridiculous, like some sort of cheap margarine.
Great taste and a doddle to spread. Prefer it to the standard Lurpak too!

Can't go far wrong with Lurpak, even this lighter version. Tried all other brands but I now stick to this as it is so tasty and spreadable from the fridge which is a bonus when you need to make a packed lunch in a hurry when you are running late !
Definitely the best spreadable butter on the market, I have used it for years now and won't use anything else!
Absolutely my favourite lucozade by miles!!
This is vile, fruit punch evokes tropical flavours in my mind, not apple and raspberry! Artificial apple flavour really doesn’t work.
Tasted too synthetic not for me.

I am a big fan of Lucozade, have been since I was a child. Some of the flavours they have brought out over the years have been a bit vile though, just all wrong. This isnt one of them though, I really like it. I doubt Anthony Joshua is a regular consumer however, but advertising endorsements aside, it is a very nice drink and pick me up. I would recommend.

I enjoyed these Marmite Pinwheels, they're quite crispy & flaky when warmed, like a biscuit texture rather than the soft bread-like consistency I was expecting. They're also pretty tiny but you do get 8 in a pack. The flavour is certainly Marmite, delicious if you ask me! They're an unusual little snack, not my favourite but I'd buy again.

If I ever got these again Id warm them in the air fryer. I ate mine cold and although the taste was pleasant they were really stale. They come in a cardboard box with a loose seal and no inner packaging which explains why theyre stale on arrival, so heating is recommended. The best before date was 4 days after mine arrived, which was a little surprising but short shelf life is rarely a bad sign.
Lovely snack, tangy cheesy pastry bitesguilty secret having a box of these by my computer when working
Gently warmed in the air fryer I'm in umami heaven, a tasy treat!
I bought these ready to eat over Christmas, but they were very hard and seemed stale. They were in date, so I don't know if I just got a bad batch. I've had to throw them.

I think these might be improved if eaten warm - when I ate them cold, they were a little dry and stodgy, but the flavour was nice. I had no trouble finishing the pack, but when eaten cold they are not quite there. (Close though)
Ate day bought and although well within use by date, seemed dry/stale.  Packaging not sealed - gap in cardboard box allowing air in, not faulty/damaged box, probable design fault.
They are so delicious and moorish.

It was my own fault I suppose - I added these at the last minute, seduced by the flash sale or special offer screen on the way to the check-out. Anyway, I didn't notice that these have a very short shelf life  so they ended up being one of those things you have to eat up (and then regret the calories) rather than something kept for an occasion. They were quite nice but pricey for what they are as there aren't many in the packet.  I'd have to buy several packets if I were entertaining so probably wouldn't bother.
These are quite tasty but I agree with another reviewer who felt the balance is not quite right. Nice snack but I wasn't bowled over.
Very nice but my husband have had heartburn after eating  couple of pieces 😏

I had higher hopes from these. Overpriced and underwhelming. These are very strong in taste. I like marmite but the balance of pastry to cheese and everything was just off. Two bites my face is frowning. Just not enjoyable especially for the price :(
Really good
Youll either really,really like these or youll hate them. A bit like Bovril.
These are love or hate. I'm not usually a marmite fan, but gave these a try anyway - and they are phenomenal. 10/10 on a picnic.
I'm willing to pay over the odds for these as they're so damn good. I actually like the dinky size, and don't feel too guilty if I finish the box. I love them heated.
Nice taste of marmite but dry and a smaller pack than expected. Could have been so much better but quite disappointing.
I love the marmite taste but the pastry wasnt crisp

These are sooooo good.  However, my first bite I was very unsure, took another bite and was hooked!
Tried one in one mouthful but it does not work, take two, or even three to savour the flavour :-)
Disappointing. I love most of M&S products and I love marmite but these were just horrid--sorry! Soggy and over flavoured. I took one bite expecting a tasty treat and threw the packet in the bin.

These are amazing. I bought them for a party, I tried one to make sure they were ok to serve my guests. I ate the whole packet! They’re so moreish! If I could ask for one improvement it would be for larger packs with more in
Cheesy, marmitey and crisp after oven heating- but sooooooooo expensive, considering the actual ingredients of pastry, cheese and marmite!!
These are super tasty and everyone in the household loves them! The box is gone as soon as it is opened. Its a bit pricey for the amount you get. Must try making my own.

normally Im put off marmite stuff.. not because i dont like marmite, i suppose Im just a purist. also i had an idea to sell pre-mixed butter and marmite many, many years ago in a traffic jam so slightly upset ive never made any money from any of it. but anyway! these are very good, definitely marmitey. small and expensive yes but what are you expecting at this point in your journey?
These are fab! Though I guess they are a bit expensive. More of a treat. Definitely better hot, I pop them in the toaster on its lowest setting which saves the oven.
nice and tasty but expensive for what you get.  8 in the box, about 4cms round.  five stars for taste.
Buttery pastry, tangy cheese and a Marmite kick. These are absolutely amazing!
These really are quite small and for the price Im not sure Id buy again but they are delicious, especially heated.
Love these, they have a good coating of Marmite too! I just heated them up and theyre even more divine :) So eat some cold whilst you wait for some to heat up!!
So glad that there aren't many in a box as I'd just sit eating them,  Great mix of Marmite and cheese, right texture and mouthfeel
These are so tasty we finished the pocket in what felt like seconds! Rich and tasty.

Very nice, I got these for my brother as a little surprise and he ate the whole that evening, they didn't help his diet but they are very morish! recommend as a treat, I wouldn't say they were too marmite-y, I am not a marmite fan but I liked these.
With a very savoury - umami-  flavour of Marmite and cheese, these are absolutely delicious. There are 8 in a pack. We had them warm and will definitely buy them again.

I love cheese and pastry and marmite so thought these would be a winner but sadly not for me. Pastry wasn't great and the marmite overpowered everything. Lots of great reviews though so maybe I'm just fussy!

Oh my…
If you love Marmite you will adore these! I was a bit slow and was left with the last 2 in the box. The monsters I live with got to them first, the swines! Will definitely add these to my next shop but this time I’ll have to write my name on the box in black marker pen lol. I didn’t try them cold as I’d read other reviews saying they are nicer warmed up. Yummy!
They are great perfect mix! My only problem with them is that they are smaller than you think they would be, I would still buy them again.
Best after 10 seconds in the microwave, all cheesy and Marmitey and divine
Sadly,  I have ordered these seven weeks running and have yet to receive them as always out of stock when my order arrives. Disappointing as I so want to try these pinwheels!

I really liked these, I only had them cold as I was too impatient to heat them up. They are VERY strong in flavour which suits me well. My only issue was that they went rock solid very fast in my fridge so I think I'll move them into an airtight container next time.

We are all marmite fans but these had a 50/50 split. They taste a cross between, cheese twists and cold marmite on toast. The for opinion of the house was they were yummy. So its a house split decision.
Such a lovely savoury treat. They are small but full of flavour and very moorish. I haven’t tried heated yet as I eat them all before I have a chance! If you like umami flavours this is for you.
I love these, theyre little flavour bombsvery cheesy and very marmitey. Wanted to try them warmed up but they disappeared too fast! Maybe next time
Lovely flavour and cooked nicely. 10 in a box which is plenty. Made a great addition to a cheese board
I dont even like marmite but the whole family love these. Nice little snack or starter. Needs heating.

You will need to like Marmite to like these as there is a good strong marmite flavour. I ate one cold while I was heating the rest and they are so much nicer when heated. I ate the lot but you could serve 2 people ok.

very small for the price, though there was more in the box than I thought there might be.
Good marmite and cheese flavour but the pastry is tasteless and somehow both dry and greasy. Won't buy again
These were nice but not worth the money as they are tiny.

i was very disappointed with this product. i love marmite and it definitely tastes of marmite. but the items are very flat and there's not much to them. it just feels like you're eating something unhealthy that isn't worth the calories

These are a tasty little treat, but really expensive for what you get, 8 thin pinwheels. 
Ill continue to make my own with ready rolled puff pastry, spread with marmite and coated with grated cheese. Simple but delicious and keep in a tin for a few days if you can resist them that long!
If you like marmite you'll love this

I like marmite especially strong marmite. Really liked these just wish I'd heated them up for a taste comparison.
Will buy again when on offer

Flavour wise they are a hit for me, as I love the strong flavour that seems not to be a win with some other reviewers. One star down only because theres not that much of it... I somehow thought the pack will be bigger, but then realised its only 88g, which Im not sure is worth the money.
Although I like marmite, these are overwhelmingly so, cannot taste any cheese at all. Wont be rebuying.
I bought these in M&S and they were absolutely delicious.  The perfect amount of marmitey-ness! They will now be a regular addition to my Ocado order
Tried for the first time today - My husband & I cannot get enough of these, will just have to try not to eat them so quickly. Definitely a regular purchase.
These are incredible! If you love marmite, you will adore these!
It's like a cheese straw smothered in Marmite, absolutely delicious.  You can really taste the Marmite.

Sorry team marmite ... these were hard
Too marmitey.... they felt fake .... love marmite stuff
I really like most Belvoir drinks. This one not so much. To me it seems very watery with just a slight fruit flavour... not really recognizable as passion fruit at all, imo.
Packs a fruity punch, but any vanilla taste or smell was hidden. Admittedly I'd prefer an uncarbonated version for a less bitter taste, thereby needing less added sugar too.
This is a nice soft drink option for those who dont imbibe alcohol.  Theres a good passion fruit flavour to it, without it being too overwhelming.
I adore Belvoir drinks, but this didnt taste like psssionfruit at all. It had hardly any flavour, certainly not fruity, there was just a hint of cold black tea.  Not pleasant.
Bursting with flavour and gentle fizziness. I found it very refreshing. Definite passionfruit taste but not overpoweringly so but I like this fruit a lot.

I love vanilla but felt it was a bit strong here. I also sadly wouldn't have know it was passion fruit which is what I was so looking forward to. it's also strange as it's a bit fizzy but not that fizzy... somewhere in between. honestly it was like old fashioned orange squash..I love this company's drinks usually but this one isn't for me.
I found this pleasant but not quite what I was expecting. I would prefer if it wasn't sparkling and the vanilla was a little over powering for my taste.
Nice passionfruit flavour, not too sweet, can taste the subtle hint of vanilla
This was ok - but a little too sweet for me
I got this sample free from Ocado. Really enjoyed it - it is so but I like to dilute mine with a bit of water and ice - lovely and refreshing!
The taste was ok but a bit too much like fizzy orange pop so I won’t be spending the extra to buy this again
The flavour is pleasant but too sweet for me to drink often.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I found the drink a bit too sweet, perhaps as I usually buy sugar free drinks. Quite fresh and nice to have something for non-drinkers.
Pleasant tasting drink but not. My sort of drink.  A bit sweet for me but I do like the passion fruit taste. Would be refreshing very old on a warm day

I received this to review for Ocado.  I really liked the idea.  As a soft drink it was quite nice but didn't quite seem like a cocktail.  There is quite a bit of fizz.  With a bit of lemon it gave a bit more zing.  It also worked with Vodka.. but probably against the main plan.  I really like the idea of such non alcoholic cocktails.  Personally I would prefer something a bit more dry.
I was asked to review this by Ocado and thought it was a good tasting (if a little sweet) alcohol free drink. Reasonably priced good product
its ok nothing amazing very sticky sweet I did like the fizz levels
Pleasant and refreshing drink just add ice and a hot summers day!
Name is misleading.  This is a pleasant non-alcoholic fruit drink.   Not a strong taste of passionfruit.

I was sent a free sample to review. Nice passion fruit taste, slightly fizzy but not too much. Not much like the real cocktail in terms of taste but nice never the less. I’d buy as an alcohol alternative.
We were given this free to review by Ocado. A not unpleasant passionfruit drink. Too sweet for us. Would not buy.
I was sent this to review and I am very impressed - really refreshing and tasty. Will be perfect on a summers day!

I was sent this product by Ocado, free of charge, as a trial. I agree with other reviewers that this drink is pleasant enough but calling it a martini - even a non-alcoholic one - is a stretch, and I think a marketing error which can only lead to disappointment in the purchaser! Still, I love passionfruit and whilst this could have had a stronger flavour, it makes a nice addition to the Belvoir range.

I received a free sample to review and was excited to try this. Unfortunately I found it lacking, it was too watery and didn’t pack the punch I was expecting. Perhaps because it’s marketed as an alcohol free cocktail rather than just a soft drink I was hoping for a good alternative. However it’s a pleasant soft drink but not sure I’d reorder.
A really refreshing drink, flavour could be a bit more intense.

We were given this to review by Ocado. 
You can definitely taste the passion fruit and (thankfully!) - unlike so many fizzy fruit drinks - its not too sweet. We could not taste any alcohol type flavour not that the lack of Martini flavour mattered. Wed be happy too drink this on a summer day!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. A lot of these alcohol free drinks are super sweet. But this was really pleasant and very drinkable. Had a nice hint of passionfruit. A good alternative if you are off the alcohol.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  Tastes more like soda water and generic tropical fruit than spring water with passion fruit.  I don't get the vanilla at all. Or the Martini reference.  I imagine that it would be enjoyable in the garden on a summer's afternoon rather than this chilly, damp March evening.  Roll on Summer!

Reading the label conjured up a romantic picture of an alcohol free martini.  In reality it was a sparkling passion fruit juice.  Disappointed- nothing wrong with the product but wrong description.  It’s definitely not a martini.

I was sent this by Ocado to review. Its ok but Im not sure this really can be classed as an alcohol free version of a martini. 

Its quite fizzy but lacking any strong depth of flavour. The flavour is more subtle than that. However, if you want a fruit flavoured, fizzy soft drink, thats not too sweet and you like passionfruit then its probably worth a try. It was pleasant but not outstanding.
Sent to review. Really nice drink, lovely taste and refreshing. So good I’ve added it to my next shop!
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Its very refreshing, lightly sparkling & deliciously fruity.

I got this free to review from ocardo. I found this a very pleasant drink and could definitely taste the passion fruit in it. I would probably buy it as I don't drink alcohol ,and I am always looking for new alcohol free drinks to try.

Putting artificial sweeteners into everything cured me of my sporadic fizzy drink habit, this is like upmarket Fanta. Knocked a star off as its just not convincing as an alternative to alcohol. Its been years since I had a **** star martini that this drink aims to emulate so cant comment on the similarity in taste, but it lacks the depth of flavour of alcohol (and dealcoholised drinks) . Nice as a drink in its own right though, if you like that sort of thing.

I was sent this to review.  I don't especially favour fruity alternatives to alcohol - I prefer a non-alcoholic beer or less sweet option.  However, if you prefer a sweeter, fruity drink in place of alcohol (or any time!) then this is a nice option.
i was sent this to review and was very happy with flavour! it tastes good and is a perfect alternative to alcohol !

I was asked to review this by Ocado and I loved it.
I drank it over the course of an afternoon whilst wfh and it definitely brightened up the afternoon. Fruity and refreshing. Wasnt particularly cocktail like. Will buy again

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

I was quite excited by the flavours described on the bottle passion fruit and vanilla pods but when I tasted it, it was fizzy, watery tasting, lacking fruit or vanilla and I could taste sugar. 
Not for me.

Im reviewing this as I was sent a free sample by Ocado.
Served it to a non drinking friend and she was very pleased with it. Tasted good not too sweet and went down very well. May well buy again
I was sent this to review for Ocado and it's a refreshing alternative to alcohol. Not too sweet and not too fizzy with a good flavour. Would buy again.
Nice to have a fun alternative to alcohol but I'm not sure that I would actually buy this (sent to review).

I was asked to review this. It’s a decent, not too sweet, slightly effervescent tropical drink DEFINITELY no martini element or passion fruit. Pleasant enough but not my first choice for a non alcoholic beverage.

I am reviewing this item as I got a few sample from Ocado to review. It was a nice, refreshing, light drink. It doesnt have a lot of carbs compared to other drinks with this amount of fruit. I would recommend to give it a try but wasnt as nice as some other fruity non alcoholic drinks I have tried.

I'm reviewing this as I received a free sample from Ocado. I usually love Belvoir drinks (both ready mixed and cordials) but I agree with other reviewers - odd taste - not very strong passionfruit, an artificial back note (probably the vanilla). It felt simply like a slightly sparkling fruit drink and a bit too sweet too. There are other better alcohol-free alternatives.

Received for free from Ocado for a review. 
I don't love it. It's gently fizzy which is nice but other than that it doesn't really taste of anything. Faint taste of passionfruit and a weird artificial vanilla aftertaste. If I was the designated driver and had this instead of a cocktail I'd be disappointed. I wouldn't buy this again.
I received this as a free sample, it was ok for something different and you could mix with vodka to make a real cocktail

I received this free to review and whilst I’m normally a massive fan of Belvoir drinks this was slightly disappointing. It’s perfectly pleasant but I’d prefer a stronger passion fruit flavour, will be sticking to other products in the Belvoir range for now

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. It's a pleasant fruit drink but you could get a similar drink by adding sparkling water to fruit squash or cordial. Overall, I was disappointed as I expected better from Belvoir.

I received this to review & was pleased to try as having an alcohol free week or so . 
Good ingredients with a lovely passionfruit flavour would have like the lime to come through more but i did enjoy it although i  didnt get a martini vibe . Overall for the price & ingredients i would purchase & think i will squeeze more lime in have it on ice next time but was a nice treat !

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This is a pleasant, refreshing fizzy passionfruit drink. I think calling it a martini is a bit of a misnomer though, as there is not really enough passionfruit and the vanilla is not noticeable. Out of curiosity I tried adding vodka, but the flavours are not strong enough to hold it. Nice as a non-alcoholic summer drink.
I received this to review and found it really refreshing served over ice, although just a little too sweet.

I received this to review. I had high hopes for this but it was just too weak. I wasn't expecting anything like a martini, just a pleasant soft drink, but it wasn't even that. It tasted like squash that had been watered down too much. This was the first Belvoir product that I haven't enjoyed.

Received a sample to review. Nice light flavour, we could definitely taste the vanilla. Would be a good alcohol free cocktail over ice in the summer. Knocked off a star for the high price because it costs 50p less at Sainsburys

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

This is surprisingly good - the passion fruit flavour is present but no overbearing and it somehow has the effect of being slightly dry.

Delicate aftertaste of vanilla too which is also nice.

Good value alternative to alcohol
Nice for a week night drink (currently avoiding alcohol mon to thur) however very expensive for what it is, juice & tonic will suffice
I love passionfruit but was really disappointed by this as it didn't taste of passionfruit and had a weird aftertaste. I don't usually throw food and drinks away but most of this went down the sink.
You can taste the vanilla, but not the passion fruit, and nothing like a Martini.  Just overall a very bland, sweet flavour. One to avoid.
Love Belvoir cordials but didn't like this at all. Not enough passion fruit flavour, didn't like the vanilla and the sediment was very unappealing.

Just sparkling water with juice. Doesn't taste anything special
Screwtop cannot be sealed properly so leaks if stored sideways
I love passionfruit, this is definitely one of my favourites from Belvoir range.
We enjoyed this. It was quite sweet but very drinkable and will be buying again!

I love passion fruit and was excited to try this. However I am disappointed at the lack of flavour. I tend to think passion fruit is a strong flavour, yet this is just weak. It’s almost like a well diluted cordial that has fizz in it. I’m really not sure how to describe the taste, it’s not unpleasant at all but I think there needs to be more passion in the passion fruit! It’s fruity and that’s about it.

I'm not quite sure what to make of this. It doesn't have much taste - I can only vaguely taste passionfruit, there's also a hint of vanilla. It's very sweet. To me it tastes quite like a Snowball (the type you drink that is!).
Mildly sweet / vanilla taste. Slightly sweeter than cows milk but similar taste. Great with hot drinks and cereal. Prefer this slightly to Sproud, our favourite two.

Yes, as a low carb non milk thing this is absolutely great.  I could drink on it's own or have over cereal (that's if I was allowed cereal, lol).  It froths great in my machine to add to coffee, tea is fine too and it's great that it doesn't curdle.
I havent tried the milk alone, normally coconut milk is the only milk I drink alone or in cereal but this milk is great in coffee, tea and cooking!

I use both this and the unsweetened version interchangeablly for my morning cappucino as it froths up like a dream.  It's never split in my tea, either, which is more than I can say for other not-milks.  I'd describe the flavour as mild and inoffensive, which, at first glance, might seem like a barbed compliment.  That's really not my intent, however.  If your expectations for this not-milk run to the exact replication of dairy, you're naturally going to be disappointed.  However, if you're looking for a dairy alternative that's good to cook with and that doesn't alter the flavour of hot bevvies, then this is a great candidate.  For little ol' lactose intolerant me, this stuff is a game-changer.
this is not a milk substitute- tastes actively unpleasant

We tend to opt for oat milk, but decided to give this a try on the intro offer price, but really not fans, has a slightly bitter edge to the taste, along with being sweeter than most plant milks we use, so wouldnt be suitable for savoury sauces and didnt like it in tea. Sad to leave a negative review as we are normally so easily thrilled with more vegan options, but this one is not for us.
so happy to finally see this on Ocado. Great in coffee & I like the unsweetened  one for cooking.
the biggest problem is ripping us off by 50ml on a ltr carton. Thats about as mean and snidey as it gets so we wont be buying again.

These cakes are definitely NOT the same as they once were!
They were a lovely tangy blackcurrant taste and the buttercream
was soft and creamy.
These are awful and I could taste the difference straight away.
Yuk. Wont be buying them again.

Very much the same comments I made when reviewing the similar M&S strawberry and clotted cream sundaes.
Delicious.
Great Taste!
Disappointing flavours, will not buy again.
What's not to like, great texture and flavour.
These blackcurrant sundaes are excellent. Absolutely love them, but Im reluctant to re order as do not arrive in good condition.

These were a childhood favourite (a very long time ago) So, I like the new shape, with vertical sides and I think the blackcurrant filling is tasty without being too sharp. On the downside, the filling is too jelly like and the butter cream has lost the iconic flavour which made me love them so much. Still a nice treat though.

I usually buy blackcurrant sundaes from a large supermarket chain so I'm comparing M&S sundaes with those. These are twice the price, smaller and neither my husband nor I could taste the blackcurrant filling at all, it was overwhelmed by the buttercream. They also arrived rather battered in my Ocado delivery. The only positive I can give is that the pastry was very nice, it was slightly crumbly and melted in the mouth. The 3 stars are for the pastry. Won't buy again.

I do like these as a teatime treat.  The buttercream is very sweet, but this is offset beautifully by the tartness of the blackcurrant purée/jam at the bottom.  The 'pastry' is a delicious buttery Viennoise affair - and lovely.  
-
If you don't have a sweet tooth, you won't like these, as they are quite sweet.  They also last well in the pantry without going stale, so long as you put them in an airtight container.

I've had these before when I've bought in store so popped them onto my order as a rare sweet treat. However, these are not what they once were! The blackcurrant filling was like an overly hardened jelly...very stringy and gel like. The buttercream also quite hard. They used to be deliciously moist and fruity but these were most definitely not. As someone who is only allowed occasional sweet treats I was annoyed that I'd wasted my sugar allowance on them!
I really like these. Tasty blackcurrant filling, crisp pastry and a generous dollop of buttercream plus a vienesse biscuit on top! A great indulgence
Contains palm oil, as do a lot m&s long life pastry products.

We used to love these from M&S but now shadow of their former self.  Miserly thin layer of blackcurrant, fake taste and texture of buttercream and the general comfort factor of the old cake as a whole has gone.  Boo!

The highlight of my weekly shop! I'm obsessed with these. I'm a massive buttercream fan and the mix of vanilla buttercream and tangy blackcurrant jam is just the best thing since sliced bread. Constantly out of stock in my local Food store so no idea what the mediocre reviews are about.
These taste good, very sweet, but I would not call them sundaes. The cream isn’t very much like cream and instead quite hard. It is more of a jam tart with a hard cream on top.

A blackcurrant sundae from M&S was always a highlight of a family Sunday tea. The shiny foil case, the delicate cream topping, the oozey filling that would drip over your fingers. 

I haven't bought them for a few years and won't again now....the pastry is too thick, the filling completely artificial and solid, the topping is hard like buttercream. oh dear M&S..... such a shame. 

On the other hand....if you've never had one before and like pastry you might enjoy it.
It needs more blackcurrant and fresh cream rather than the synthetic stuff that’s on it and then it would be amazing
Im glad they were recommended and that I didnt let the negative reviews affect my purchase.   Taste is subjective, so some wont like them, but I thought the whole thing was delightful.
I love these. They are not too sweet, and a nice treat to have with a cup of tea.
Not quite as sweet as the strawberry tarts. I would definitely buy these again as they have a good blackcurrant flavour and crisp pastry. The strawberry flavour are my favourite, though!

Received these as a substitute but would certainly not purchase these.  I would not consider them sundaes but tartlets.  The pastry was extremely thick.  About 50% of this was the funny tasting mock cream and the jam was scraped on with a toothbrush.
Needs a bit more fruit filling but a lovely mix and pastry cases are different form most small tart/pies and this was a welcome change. Yum.
These were so well-balanced, the sharp blackcurrant, the soothing cream and the texture of the pastry. Absolutely delicious!
Just overall nasty. Very dry hard casing with a greasy topping. Nothing to like really. Overall impression was, stale.
i highly recommend this product. I find the taste to be just right, not too sweet. such a great little treat.
I've always loved these cakes, not too sweet and really "blackcurranty" . It would have been 5 stars of they hadn't shrunk in size since the last time I treated myself.
Had high hopes for these. Sadly disappointed. Dry pastry followed by a just ok filling. Tasted processed and not fresh. Won,t be buying again.
An indulgent tea timetreat, crisp pastry with a generous amount of filling.  My only complaint, much smaller now.

Been a fave of mine for many years! 
Rich pastry & biscuit, creamy sweet buttercream and tangy blackcurrant. Perfect combination ❤️
pale soggy pastry, fruit tasteless, biscuit topper damp - very stodgy.

Lovely blackcurrent tartlets, but for me it's the addition of buttercream that makes them especially great!  I can never have enough of that stuff and it works perfectly here with tart blackcurrants.  I think the biscuit on the top could be better but that's a very minor thing.
These were even better than the strawberry ones which were also delicious...

Nice pastry and cream filling. The blackcurrants are hard but aren’t they always. The biscuit was lacking in buttery flavour but a nice addition. Please make the same pastry cases with this cream filling but a lemon curd jam, with a crispy meringue top.
Very small cakes with a filling full of hard tough blackcurrants. Disappointing.

Bought these to try but was worried the buttercream would make them sickly. However, pleasantly surprised as they are divine. Light crumbly almost biscuity pastry case filled with not too tart slightly chewy black currant filling and a light buttercream. Will definitely buy again as we all loved them.
These are not too large . three bites and they are gone. Absolutely delicious. May have to restrict my intake to two boxes a week.
Beautiful tasting tarts. One of my favourite desserts, along with the strawberry ones. Have been buying these for years!

bought as a treat  as dieting as i love blackcurrant. on the other hand  hubby is the cake every day person in our household and he loved them,  i going to have to be careful as they definitely a diet breaker for me

I agree with all the previous reviewers who thought this was a great loaf. It has all the benefits of a decent sourdough without the problem of how to get  artisan-shaped loaf slices into your toaster. It justifies the cost and nothing is wasted if you freeze whatever you can't get through in one go (though it lasts well even without freezing). Highly recommend.

I've been searching for a good sliced loaf without lots of ultra-processed ingredients since Vogels disappeared from Ocado. I saw this advertised in the magazine and thought I'd try it given the short ingredient list. It's really good and probably the best sliced loaf I've bought with loads of flavour and a proper crust when toasted. It's pricey (about double the price of Vogels) but the loaf is about 300g bigger.  We put in straight in the freezer and use it as toast. Highly recommended!
Delicious bread but please make ORGANIC Sourdough. Sadly I refrain from buying because it is not Organic. If Celtic Bread Company can do it, so can Bertinet.
I keep this in the freezer to reduce waste. We toast as we need it. Great taste!
Great tasting bread! Specially love how there are no preservatives nasty additives!
This sourdough is delicious. A family favourite. Good quality even when frozen.

Unlike some brands I have tasted, this sourdough bread actually tastes like sourdough. The seeds are not only sprinkled on the outside, but run through the loaf as well. I don't worry about eating it all before it goes off, as it keeps very well in the freezer and toasts up beautifully. A very tasty loaf indeed. It's a pity that it's a bit expensive, as that means that I limit my purchases to when it's on special offer.

All 3 of the sourdough are in a class of their own imo. Freeze the large loaves immediately and take slices as needed. please never stop sticking these 3 big loaves Ocado! You've discontinued too many of my vegan face so leave my bread alone please lol!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Best Sourdough loaf outside of homemade.  Expensive but worth it.
I got this on a flash sale and it toasts beautifully, but I wouldn't pay full price as I think it costs too much.

I echo the review left by MrsTurner, as it is almost word for word what I was going to say!  In addition, as well as the very high price, the other downside for me is that, at only 4g per 100g, it isn't high enough in fibre. I have given it 4* as it is tasty, but unlikely to buy again, even on offer.

I received this as a free gift.  I have never tried sour dough bread before so at first I was shocked how heavy the loaf is and wasnt sure whether I wanted that lying in my stomach!  However, I tried it toasted and was impressed with the taste.  It did take a lot longer to toast in the toaster and I had to turn the toaster up quite a lot.  I did like the taste though and the seeds are a nice addition.  The main downside for me is the price.  I cant justify nearly £4 for a loaf of bread!  If this was on offer I would consider buying it in future as a treat.
This tastes like how sourdough should and the slices are a decent size that can easily fit in the toaster. Also love the simple ingredients. My families fave bread!
The bread itself is fine, but the small seeds ?linseed present through out make it an unpleasant eating experience.  I like seeds in bread, but wasn't expecting this.

We love this bread and were getting through two of the 500g loaves a week, so I'm happy to discover Ocado now stock this larger size. Often breads labelled as sourdough aren't the real thing. They have lots of additives and are not made the traditional way (M&S is one example). Bertinet bread is the real thing and tastes great. I just wish Ocado would stock a genuine, pure spelt sourdough to replace the Waitrose pne ...
I received this as a free gift but felt compelled to leave a review because it is just SO GOOD.  Docked a star only because its also expensive, so would be a treat purchase I think..

I received this from Ocado as a free gift to try and I was pleasantly surprised. The loaf is large and the slices are small enough for a toaster, unlike some other brands which I normally have to cut each slice in half. The flavour is nice, and you can really taste the sourness. The seeds add a nice nutty flavour. The downsides are: I found it took a while to crisp up in the toaster, but that may be more to do with the quality of my toaster rather than the bread! Also the price is high, so not sure I would purchase this regularly, but maybe for a weekend treat.
HEAVY DOUGHY AND TASTELESS SO DISSAPOINTED

So this is proper sourdough. So if you dont like sourdough you might find it a little too, well, sour. But if you do I think youll find it truly delicious. The seeds give it a nutty taste and texture and it has some malt sweetness to offset the sourdough savoury. Also comes in a sensible rectangle shape for toaster convenience. Its a big loaf, you might want to freeze a bit and its not cheap but would definitely recommend.

Cheesecake itself was delicious, lovely base and creamy cheesecake but was spoilt by the rock hard layer of chocolate at the top.  This may suit some, but made the cheesecake difficult to cut and split, so presentation wasn't ideal.  It was also tiny... it may say serves 6 but if you try to cut six slices it's a mess and you might get one mouthful.  Better value to buy cheesecake slices.  However, when served for 4 people, it was perfectly lovely but just need to lose the top chocolate and perhaps marble it through instead which would make it perfect!
Disappointing, not chocolatey in the slightest.
Over powering white chocolate makes this cheesecake stick to the inside of the mouth and the base needs an hammer to break, not good at all!

The cheesecake filling is nice and represents cheesecake but the biscuit base was thin and brick hard to cut.  The topping separated from the cheesecake and didnt taste particularly chocolatey.   Such a shame as the texture of the cheesecake was good and tasty to eat.
Must be the worst dessert we’ve ever had from m&s - base was like concrete and the top 2 layers separated so it was so difficult to eat - don’t go near!,

I have always purchased my cheesecake from M & S as they offer the best, delicious, crunchy base cheesecake I have ever tasted. The chocolate biscuit has a good thickness which is very different to other cheesecakes I have tasted with minimal biscuit base. It offers a good balance of biscuit and cheese. It blends well to give a melting, crunchy, creamy flavour that is not overwhelming in sweetness. This is an improved cheesecake to the previous M & S produced, although I love sugar, I found their other chocolate cheesecake to be too sweet with the current one being toned down perfectly, great taste!!!😊👍❤️

There's a thin layer of marbled chocolate on top which isn't particularly nice to eat, the filling itself is actually quite nice but the base is extremely hard and thick, difficult to cut, gritty and crumbly, overwhelming any positive the filling had.

Simply dreadful. Hard to know where to start. The base is sand, inedible chocolate coloured sand. The middle has no noticeable flavour of anything other than sweetness and then the chocolate on top is nothing special. Try anything other than this basically!

Has to be the most disappointing chocolate cheesecake ever.
The base requires a jack hammer to get through. And has a very unpleasant, gritty texture when in the mouth. The chocolate top is so thin you can hardly taste it. As for the cheese it was a case of "hunt the chocolate chips". It was as bland as eating cottage cheese. The packaging makes it look delicious and I bought it as a family treat. At £4.25 I expected more for my money. Definitely won't buy it again.
Very very disappointing SOLID base will not cut at all and the chocolate top just breaks up.  Could not possibly serve to guests.  I think other reviewers got a different cheesecake!!!
Best chocolate cheesecake I've tasted!

It tastes quite nice but not as good as it should. The hard chocolate disc on top and thick, hard base made it a challenge to eat. The middle is creamy but bland. It is a bit dry for me. I'd have preferred it to have had marbling throughout and more chocolate chips, maybe chocolate sauce in there. I'll eat it but I won't buy it again.
overly bland, hard to cut, the chocolate on top just slides off and the cream part tastes of nothing!
Delicious and family favourite
Bought this for dinner guests who absolutely loved it. It definitely tastes like white chocolate!

Not really chocolate cheesecake.  Base was chocolate but very crumbly, middle just vanilla and top a disk of chocolate that was separated from the rest.  My husband says 3 stars dips generous.  It was nice but it is not a triple chocolate cheesecake.

Couldn't taste any white chocolate flavour in the cheesecake itself and it's meant to have chunks of chocolate in it too but mine didn't have any, super disappointing, plus the base was just dry and crumbled

Brought this for after our Easter Sunday roast and it was lovely. Quite rich so actually got 6 servings instead of 4. The base was rather crumbly, but still nice. I thought the marbling was throughout the cheesecake, but it was just a big disk coverings the top, hence the 4 stars. Would recommend
for special treat

...but delicious, so worth the extra effort. The Chocolate  base is a bit too crumbly and topping doesn’t stay on top, but I am happy to kid myself that chasing cheesecake round a plate is a work out, so I deserve to consume the calories.

Not the same cheesecake any more.
Previously was chocolate throughout with lots of chocolate chunks. Just so different now. Sad.
Was a little too sweet and also the chocolate marble slab just slips off ... expected better.
Looks great but also tastes really good. A firm favourite with all of our family. Perfect crunch base, creamy texture then all topped with chocolate
This was a quality cheesecake. Lovely flavours and a good biscuit base. I cut into thirds and froze 2 portions. I served with squirty cream and really enjoyed it.
This is one of the best cheesecakes we've tasted from ocado.  Recommend.
A rich, dense baked cheesecake which reflects exactly my idea of what a cheesecake should be. Lovely flavour, firm chocolate slab top and a base which is not too hard or crumbly. Simply divine!
This was pretty tasteless. I thought the chocolate marbling would be through the cheesecake mix but it was just a disc on top. I wouldn’t buy again.
The whole family loved it. Tastes great. Will definitely buy again.
We found this absolutely delicious, and loved by all family members.

A rich cheesecake.  Starting with the fantastic bourbon biscuit base followed by the rich and creamy baked cheesecake and topped with a delicious light and dark topping.  Hubby says my homemade cheesecake is not nearly as good!

A perfectly acceptable dessert, but I was really looking forward to getting an M&S chocolate cheesecake. I was so disappointed, this has a very hard biscuit base a plain filling and a thin layer of chocolate on top. Not M&S quality.

Initially disappointed as it is mainly a white cheesecake with darker chocolate as a swirl on the top but once I started eating it, well it was gorgeous, so creamy. The swirly top has a lovely texture and the base is very firm and crunchy unlike a lot of powdery crumbly ones you get nowadays that let many other cheesecakes down. It is sweet but I didn't find it overly so and I can't eat a lot of very sweet things. Very pleasurable and definitely an M&S winner. My family agreed even though I'm pretty sure their pieces were slightly smaller! 😋
I have to agree with the previous review. The base was rock hard  I couldn't cut it or get a spoon in, the filling was tasteless really and I found the solidified chocolate topping strange.

Apart from the base being rock hard, the solid chocolate top was too so it was very awkward to cut neatly. It looked a mess on the plate and everyone struggled to eat it. It was freshly delivered, not frozen so no excuse. Very disappointed.
My 8 year old says this is the nicest apple juice. I tried and have to agree - you can taste that slightly sharp but sweet freshness of Golden Delicious. Lovely

Glad to feedback that the bottle which arrived with last months order was the clear crisp version, not the cloudy unpleasant one. I saw that seasonal variation disclaimer has now been added to the product details, so looks like its going to be pot luck with what you get if you do order. I would hope that the image is changed accordingly, but for now, its as it should be. Yummers!
changed it used to be good ( and clear )
They’ve changed this from a clear liquid to a foil cloudy liquid. It’s horrible and I wouldn’t have it at 90 percent off now. DO NOT BUY THIS!

They've changed this and it really is bad. Used to be a clear refreshing apple juice with a slight hint of tartness which gave it a great balance and was 5 stars. Now it's a cloudy disgusting liquid which tastes metallic like the dregs from the bottom of a crushed apple barrel. Initially thought it was contaminated but seems manufacturer has ruined this. Will not buy again as it's undrinkable.

I purchased this thinking it is as in the picture. However, I was sent cloudy not clear apple juice. Have tried the clear one before and it was amazing. This is just awful. Contacted Ocado, before opening the juice, who would not agree that the juice itself is different and argued it is just different packaging. Any refund offered meant I had to hang on to the drink until my next order which I told them was not happening for a long time/prior to the drink's expiry date. Got stuck with this and, as suspected, it tastes awful (to me). 

Contacted Coldpress and they confirmed the below:

"Apologies for this occurrence – Under our latest brand refresh our Golden Delicious Apple juice is being relaunched as a cloudy apple juice it would seem this has got through the gate earlier than expected". 

Surely, this must fall under false advertisement, Ocado?
This is superior juice - it feels like thicker water and has none of the over sugared taste of regular apple juice.
Nothing wrong tastes nice good for smoothies
We tried this one as a change and it tasted like cheap apple juice you buy in cartons from the basic supermarket brand. We will stick to other ones in future.
NA

I know this is expensive, when you do the per teabag maths, but it is well presented and the box is strong enough to use again. I have given it as a gift to friends who have enjoyed the variety of teas. I replenish mine from the usual boxes and it sits on the kichen counter so I always have a good choice to hand. I drink Pukka teas a lot and they are one of the best.
Was about to buy this as I love Pukka teas, then I noticed that the price per tea bag (33.3p) is more than double that of the standard boxes (15p).
I've only just received this and have only tried 3 of the teas but they were all lovely. I normally drink Teapigs peppermint and liquorice tea but the Pucca version is actually nicer.
Quite chewy, so I cooked then and then they were great. Probably less calories too.
It tastes almost as good as fresh chorizo so it's now my picnic favourite.
They almost seem like chorizo that needs to be cooked, v soft, stringy, and oily. Not my bag.
Just enough for a portion for one person, dog loves them too!
A workout for your jaw! I thought these would be more like eating pepperami but they're sooooo chewy. Taste good though
Delicious bite size snacks.  Quality meat, great flavour.
Not finding this nice at all. Maybe with rum as another review suggests it would improve but Ill live without any wings thanks. Cant taste coconut at all, and only fake berry, sorry
Ill leave you to discover the fun surprise when you pour this. Putting that aside its really tasty. Coconut and berry. Serve over masses of ice, and with a tot of white rum if its adult time.
Although I wouldn't drink this regularly it is nice for a change for something a bit unusual. I also like to drink this just with ice as a tasty, non-alcoholic drink.
This is a great savoury alternative to a lot of very sweet mixers and spirits. With pink pepper gin this makes a lovely savoury note and serve with pink peppercorns in the glass for an added twist.
I loved this with Ophir in.
I've really tried with this. I've bought it several times, and I just can't make it taste of anything other than a perfectly decent plain tonic water.
Really horrid - tastes like those awful lemonade concentrates served in pubs where the balance isnt right - ruined a lovely G&T and was using King of Soho gin too - grrr!

Really didn't like this at all. An unpleasant musty stale note on the nose that followed through on to the palate. I  would put this on an equal footing to Britvic Tonic, just awful. I will stick to Fever Tree, Fentimans or BTW
Really disappointing. Average tonic, nicely packaged but tasted rather synthetic. Much nicer flavoured tonic water available and this one has a premium price tag. Not worth the money.
Great mixer with a lovely little twist, smells amazing
What a discovery, subtly spicy and fragrant. Very different from anything else on the market. It's become my tonic of choice. Fantastic with Martin Millers for a really refreshing G & T

Absolutely love this tonic. 
Subtle taste of pink peppercorn. 
Fresh & very different 
One to try & savour
I can't say I could taste any pink peppercorn. This is a perfectly pleasant tonic but I will stick to Fever Tree.

Had great expectations, especially as Simon Difford rated this tonic water. I'm a fairly discerning mixologist, but couldn't really detect the pink peppercorn. I'll stick to the Waitrose tonic water, which I prefer to Fever Tree
So good with a nice botanical gin or on its own.

I really love this tonic water. It has a wonderful spicy edge that really makes a great g&t with Sipsmith or Hendricks. Fever tree certainly raised the bar in the past but it now feels ordinary in comparison to the merchants heart tonics. We're working our way across their range of mixers and so far so good!

Such a beautiful tasting tonic. Tasted it with gin and vodka and both drinks were as lovely as each other!
So smooth but with a slight peppery kick at the end. Will be buying again.

This is a nice change to plain peppermint, with the strawberry flavour being subtle, but the fruity kick is pleasant.  The black peppercorn I do wish had been left out though.  Once I got down to the bottom of my cup, it began to burn and was too hot for me.  Also I contacted Twinings about what was in their natural flavours, as I'm sensitive to many things.  They confirmed that there is citric acid in these and also stevia.  I'll have to avoid these in future, as I have endocrine/hormonal problems and stevia has been shown to alter hormones.  So if you have hormonal issues, especially if female, please read a bit more into stevia.  I do wish Twinings would have been more honest and just list it on the ingridents, rather then people having to go to them and ask, as there are people that need to avoid certain things.

We tried all of the new twinnings herb teas, and this was my partner’s favourite.  He didn’t even notice there was pepper in this at first, so it was hardly overwhelming.  The fruit with the peppermint flavour smells great and blends nicely.

These smell absolutely amazing and I really wanted to try the drink however this pack seems to be a bad batch and when you detach the teabag from the handle to make the drink it creates a hole in the tea bag every single time and your tea fills with the contents. They smell so lovely though that I will purchase again and hope for the best.
Compared to the pineapple and lychee ones which were awful and I threw away!! These were quite refreshing. It's quite subtle, minty and peppery which I'd say was a nice taste combo
Really tasty, fresh tasting tea with subtle pepper kick

Ow... I wish I have read the reviews before. Very peppery! I couldn't taste anything else, I was expecting mint and strawberry taste, so you can imagine how disappointed I was when I had my first and last cup.
now its a pepper drink in the bin.

Should be called Black Pepper tea with a hint of strawberry and mint.  Shame because it should be a lovely, refreshing tea but I might as well grind some pepper into a cup of boiling water - I don't like pepper on food, it's even worse in tea.  I really hate it when manufacturers mislabel foods, it's silly and inconsiderate.
I never throw away food, but these I just couldn't stand. Tasted like a mug of hot water with cracked black pepper.
Not a herbal tea drinker, but really enjoyed this tea.
Really enjoyed these. Would buy again.
Makes a refreshing cup of tea, with the slight sweetness of strawberry blending with peppermint.  Neither flavour dominant.  Cardboard box with no plastic or cellophane liner.

I was sent this to review. I drink only herbal teas, and normally prefer chamomile type teas, but love peppermint tea too. But fresh mint is so superior, I usually just get it from the garden. My husband likes pink tea, but not so keen on peppermint, so it took us a while to get around to open this packet. However, I discovered that it is a lovely refreshing minty strawberry blend, quite spicy, but very nice. I like it more than my husband. Its nearly all gone now, so will probably buy a packet now.
Makes a change from normal mint tea a slight hint of strawberry
I was sent this to review. i found this very refreshing maybe more minty than fruity but a nice flavour and i would buy again

I was offered this to review. Peppery and the strawberry is subtle. I think there are nicer fruit teas on the market, though this does the trick for something to cleanse the palate and provide a change from the usual tea and coffee options esp at work.
Received these to review and they were perfect for me. I love peppermint tea and fruity teas so they were a perfect combination
If you like peppermint tea you will like, no discernible taste or small of strawberry that I would detect unfortunately
Found the flavour mix a little artificial
Minty with an undertone of fruitiness
I dont normally drink fruit tea but was asked to review- really enjoyed it.

I got this to review and as I am regular drinker of peppermint and other herbal teas I was happy to try it. Slightly fruity and minty and there is a definite black pepper hit there but for me Im not sure it works although Im sure many others would enjoy it. I dont think I would buy it.

Yes, they are termed 'natural' flavourings but they really are no better than artificial. Ask yourself why so many. If you are after a herbal tea then spend a little more for one with a variety of true natural ingredients with perhaps just one entry at the very end of the ingredients list (meaning the least ingredient by volume) stating 'natural flavourings'.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really like this tea, a nice change to just peppermint tea. The strawberry adds a nice fruity note to the tea and really good on a summer's day when you still want a hot drink but something a bit more refreshing.

After my favourite chamomile and spearmint teabags have just been discontinued by Twinings, I was looking for a replacement and were sent these to review.  It is an unusual combination but I really enjoyed it, both hot and chilled - the pepper brings out the strawberry and also gives it a little spicy heat at the end, which is different from the usual array of fruity teas.
Received this free to review. Wasn’t sure what to expect. Tried it both hot and cold. Found it refreshing cold And quite enjoyed it. Less keen hot, the combination of flavours didn’t work for me.
Different and interesting, nice for an occasional cup.
I was sent this by Ocado to review. Lovely and refreshing on a hot day when chilled in the fridge
I loved the fruity flavour with the slight black pepper kick. I will definitely try the other teas in the range.

I was asked to review this tea by Ocado.  I do drink a lot of herbal tea, but not usually fruit tea.  The peppermint and strawberry are an interesting combination, but the black pepper after kick is too much for me in a hot drink.  I do love black pepper and smother my food in it, but in a hot drink it's overpowering.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This is a very interesting taste, in the best possible way. Great summer drink!
A great tasting tea - initially you taste the mint and then the strawberry and lastly the pepper kick. Would buy again

I was sent a free sample to review.
These were ok. I agree with other reviews, couldnt really taste the strawberry and the pepper was too much for me.

I was given this tea free for review. 
Since the day was too hot to try hot tea, I slowly brew in a litre of cold water for an hour or so then add some ice. It was soooo good and you can def. taste mellow strawberry with minty flavor. Even though we are not big fans of fruit tea, we are drinking this iced cold brew everyday now.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This tea was really enjoyable, lovely combination. I normally drink pure mint tea so this was a nice change. I’m sure it would make a really nice ice tea too. Will buy again, and will look at the others in the range.
I was asked to review this, not sure if I like this enough to drink again. Mint flavour is okay but would prefer it without the pepper flavour.
Was sent these to review.  I could not taste the strawberry, just a slight taste of mint and an overpowering peppery aftertaste that catches you out.  Not for me.

I was sent this free to review. It has a very pleasant flavour. However,  I think I prefer my mint tea to just taste of mint. This has a slightly sweet taste and I dont think its as refreshing as pure peppermint tea but it is definitely worth trying.

I received this from Ocado to review, not being a fruit tea fan was a bit dubious about it. Surprised to say really enjoyed it, especially the pepper taste.  will certainly finish  using them and buy them in the future.
Received from Ocado to review. I’m not a fruit tea drinker and I thought this didn’t taste of strawberries at all but there was a very overpowering spicy pepper flavour.
I was sent this to review. I’m not a big fan of fruit teas but the pepper helped take the edge off. Overall, it was a refreshing drink.

Received this to review. Love mint teas, but find some fruit teas can be too artificial and sweet, was pleasantly surprised by this tea. It is a delightful mix of mint and delicate strawberry, very refreshing. A new favourite

I received these free from Ocado to review. I don’t usually like fruit teas but enjoy peppermint tea so was interested to try these. The peppermint is the dominant flavour, with the strawberry just coming through, not too sweet. The black pepper was just a hint. Overall, I really enjoyed this tea, although marking down one star as there was a bit of a sediment in the mug.

I regularly drink Peppermint Tea and generally dislike the really fruity sweet teas there is. This is a perfect balance of each, its a gentle peppermint tea with a slight strawberry flavour. Really refreshing and well balanaced
A pleasant tea, not overpowering. Strawberry is more of an aftertaste. Overall, a nice mint tea.
I love a fruit tea and this one is summer in a mug. I love the hint of spice from the black pepper and a good balance of the other flavours.
Lovely blend of strawberry and mint with a slight peppery kick. Light, refreshing and a bit zingy. One of my favourite fruit tea blends.

Was sent these free to review and was pleasantly surprised. I usually find fruit teas a bit insipid but I could taste all the flavours advertised along with a hint of spice from the black pepper. Enjoyable and refreshing!

I received these from Ocado to review. I don't normally buy the fruit teas because I find them abit weak in flavour but these were lovely, a soft strawberry taste with a mint hit and slight kick of peppercorn coming through, a taste of Summer. Lovely.
strong mint and delicate strawberry, great mix for summer
So nice and strong - unlike the pukka teas which used to be great but are now a bit insipid
This tea is for those who put black pepper on their strawberries! I could not taste any mint, but rather too much pepper for me, and a hint of strawberry.
Organic and added sugar free
Definitely worth the extra money, tastes great and no nasties!
Im now a regular buyer of this decaf for my drip through. If has a nice acidity about it and a good strength of flavour
Delighted to have found this great coffee.  Smooth and flavourful.
Very mellow, not bitter, chocolate my and caramel, perfect cafetière coffee for me after 4 mins brew.
This decaf coffee smells and tastes delicious! Pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed this!
If you like a mild and particularly smooth coffee you may like this but I prefer my coffee with a stronger, fuller flavour.
I enjoyed this as it wasnt too strong and had a mild taste. Some coffee can be quite bitter in taste, but this wasnt which made it easy to drink.
Received this for a review. Well balanced and I liked it
Quite an unusual taste. It was too fruity, too acidic and made a weaker coffee than I'm used to. Not for me.
Good,not too strong.Well balanced
I liked this decaf coffee but not sure the price belies it’s taste. I am reviewing as I was sent a free sample
Ideal for a decaf tiramisu

I dont usually like decaf coffees but I bought this for my mum. I was surprised how good it tasted, even nicer than most caffeinated variants. It has a strong mildly sweet flavour, will buy this regularly from now on to have in the evenings
I made a round of decaf coffees for a few friends but didnt tell them it was decaf and they didnt realise. Enjoyed by all.

Thank you to Ocado for sending this to me to try, I prepared using a french press, but next time I will try my moka express on the hob.
I am not a great drinker of decaf, but my parents left some freeze dried decaf from staying over, this is pretty comparable but with a sweeter taste that might be a result of the extract of sugarcane de-caffienation process, I liked it, but my aeropress owning husband said it didnt really compare.
I really liked this mix. Rather unusual but very satisfying

Thank you Ocado for sending me this product to try.  Because it is decaf and non organic, meaning that a solvent is used in the decaf process, I took the bag in to work and asked colleagues to trial it for me.  This product did not go down well... at all.  For obvious reasons already noted  (non organic and use of solvent), the lack of Fairtrade is also a major no no for everyone, but nearly a dozen people did try it regardless.  Unfortunately, absolutely no one could drink a full cup, complaining at how fowl the taste was.  I was told it was, bitter, rank, had an odd almost fruity taste to it, weak... etc.  They were a bit upset with me... so I gave them choc covered Oreos and was forgiven!  The bag of coffee was thrown in the bin.  A very costly coffee that couldnt be given away for free.
This coffee is very nice and doesn't have the weird decaf taste that some have.  It is smooth and very pleasant.  Quite a small pack but it made 3 percolator jugs full of quite strong coffee.
Normally prefer a regular coffee, but this is very pleasant tasting and makes a good change from my normal coffee in the morning!

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  This is certainly fruity (pear and melon) and sweet (honey roast peanut), which is a strange mix in ground coffee. Not to my taste.  Would be very expensive for such a small bag.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  We use a decaf coffee regularly and really liked this blend. The coffee is well balanced and delicious. I would definitely buy again.

A lovely smooth coffee. Still wakes me up in the monring even though its decaf. I have to have at least 2 or 3 cups of any coffee in the monring to feel awake, which isn't good for me. So to find a decaf that is still lovely is a winner for me.

Nice to find a decaf coffee that doesn't taste like a decaf. This is a smooth decaf from an independent roastery which also appears to care about the environment. I would recommend it if you're looking for a milder, less intense decaf.
Sweet tasting coffee but still wakes you up!

The tasting note on the package of melon and pear drop is accurate, this is very fruity and a bit floral. Which is fine if you like that sort of thing but I don't. I kept thinking the milk was off but it was just the coffee. My husband thought it was OK though.
One if the great British butters. Pricey, but then what butter isn't these days...?
Lovely and creamy with just enough salt.
Absolutely delicious.  The flavour is yummmmmmm!  So moreish!
I tried this butter because it was on special offer. Glad I did it is creamy and tasty and has slightly more salt than other butters which I prefer.  Will buy again.
We have been enjoying this butter for years. It is creamy, keeps well and is not too salty. There are plenty of cheaper brands but this one is often on offer if you buy two. A very good product.

I was a bit hesitant because some reviews said the inner paper stuck to the butter! This was certainly not the case. I unwrapped and immediately placed it in my butter dish. No sticking at all. The butter is delicious.
Used to be golden and creamy, now pale and waxy. What happened?

Delicious - quite salty, perfect for my requirement to make salted Scottish tablet.  Very rich in flavour and colour, a deep cream compared to other butters, as if it's been made with Guernsey milk.  It's a good replacement for my usual President butter.

Many salted butters seem to lack a decent amount of salt, this butter is what it states it is. My one complaint is that if kept in the freezer for a while the thin inner paper wrapping sticks to the butter like tissue paper.

I have been buying this butter for quite a while now but lately when you take it out of the paper it is leaving a thin film of paper all over the butter which is hard to get off you have to scrap it off
Yes paper sticks a bit but that doesnt mean the product isnt delicious. Take it out of the wrapper carefully and put it in a butter dish. Tasty butter with salt pieces in it. Lovely.
The butter is OK, but the wrapping is dreadful! A thin layer of paper sticks to the butter, making every usage fiddly, messy and very wasteful of butter. Avoid this.
A great all rounder.
This is my favourite butter, so tasty and delicious. Just as good melted n hot toast as it is cold on a piece of crusty bread. Great balance of flavours, love it!
Best tasting butter we have found, right balance of salt too.
I am a butter fan and I have tried a lot in my time. I'm very happy that Ocado stock this as it is simply the best.
