The butter itself is fine but after buying it multiple times and having the scrape all the paper stuck to the butter off all the way around every single time I have decided that I will not  be buying it again unless the packaging is changed as not only do I lose a fair bit of the butter trying to get the paper off that is stuck to the butter all the way around but it is also a time consuming nuisance every time.
It's a really great blend with just the right amount of salt
I found it very bland
Proper farm butter - lovely rich yellow colour - delicious!
We got this as a substitute- lovely tasting butter
It tastes very good, has a nice color

I love this butter, especially when it's on offer, but it can be overly salty if you're not used to it.
I don't have a problem with the salt, but if you read other reviews and you are told it has crystals of salt in it don't buy it and then moan. Move on to a less salty product.
I love the overall taste and will continue to use it.....I already have 4 packs coming in my next order on Wednesday !!

Only supermarket butter that reminds me the one grandparents used to hand craft in their farm. 
Only issue it is expensive. When not on offer, by as a treat

I have always bought this butter and always bulk buy as it used to be the best butter around very yellow and creamy and very very tasty( how butter should taste) but must say the batch I bought before Christmas I’ve not been able to eat  it’s full of salt had to throw my toast away on several occasions now cause all I can taste is salt very disappointing I’m hesitant as to buy more just in case it tastes the same. Been buying lots of different butters to see if any match up to this butter but can’t find any 🙁
Lovely rich butter full of flavor with a beautiful deep yellow colour.

I bought 2 packs on special and both ended up in the bin. 
Both seemed to have been incorrectly stored and looked and smelled rancid. 
Will not buy again.
Very nice butter.  So creamy and salty.  It's just perfect on toast.

What's happened to my favourite butter? It was worth paying for that rich golden yellow buttery flavour. If today's delivery is the new standard I feel let down. It is pale and indifferent. What have Lye Cross done? Is it blended with a lesser quality batch? Is it overchurned? Whatever is the reason, a delicious product is ruined!

Have been buying this butter for years, but finally admitting defeat and will find another brand. As other reviews have stated, it has become inconsistent - sometimes as good as usual, at others it has been crumbly and even rancid. The last 2 packs I bought I have just thrown out, well before their use by dates. Both smelled rancid, and tasted off.
Horrible butter, at room temperature turns really yellow and texture and look is oily. Tastes disgusting
love this yellow butter but I would like the wrapper not to have foil in it so i can recycle!

hard to find butter with a good salt content as I like salty butter for toast use a olive oil spread for sandwiches so as not to overdo it .this butter is creamy tasty and really dark yellow. just what butter should be .it's always in our  butter dish now
Dark yellow colour, rich flavour, just lovely - like I remember butter being when I was young.

After years of being loyal to this butter Ive stopped buying it. The reason I loved it was it was so lovely and salty (which I like) but its become so inconsistent recently.  Its either over salted or overchurned which makes the texture crumbly and the taste a bit rancid. Ive had one too many packets which have a streaky colour and are almost inedible. Shame!
would love to be able to buy this butter again - but sometimes it is just too salty. ruins home baking and tastes awful on bread. we all have refridgerators! we do not need over salted butter!

We found that this butter tasted ok - nothing to write home about but not bad either. My problem, however, was with the texture of it. It didn't seem to go soft/melt and is almost crumbly...reminds me more of cheese. I tried baking with it and it was tricky to mix well with sugar. Will stick to other brands...
We love this butter for jackets, toast etc -never tried for baking -  it has the texture of being very slightly whipped and is nicely salty for use on its own - delicious!
Excellent very salty butter which we love on toast! Keeps well in the butter dish (not in fridge).
The best butter yummmmy
I THINK SOME PEOPLE HAVE FORGOTTEN WHAT PROPER BUTTER SHOULD TASTE LIKE. WELL IT SHOULD TASTE LIKE THIS.
Like others I was moved to review this product because it is so bad. It is very salty, has an odd smell and will not cream with sugar to make a cake. I shall not buy again.
Very salty, that's all I could taste..

Ive never written a grocery review ever! But was moved to by this butter. 

I always buy own brand or Anchor. This butter was on special offer so thought Id try. Oh.My.Word.

Just totally different gravy. Unbelievable taste - creamier, saltier, and the colour! Gorgeous stuff.

This is proper farmhouse butter like we used to make. A lovely golden colour, a little salt to make it taste and it keeps well so it's spreadable even if not refrigerated. Delicious on toasted crumpets, homegrown asparagus and homemade scones. What's not to like? Excellent value even if not on offer.

I've been raving about this butter.  I noticed Ocado do Trewithen Dairy too which I also love but this was on offer so tried it.   Great for cooking and so nice you can eat it on it's own.
My feeling is that people honestly don't know what real butter is meant to taste like anymore hence the negative reviews
Very weird yellow colour and salty. Used it to make cupcakes and icing and children complained about how salty it was
Love the bright yellow colour and creamy salty flavour. Superior to supermarket basic butter.

Contrary to other negative comments this is how a butter should be and taste! the dark yellow natural colour shows its a nutrient dense flavoursome butter which proves the cows have been fed on grass not grain and cattle feed unlike other bland pale looking brands

Not sure whats happened here but this butter is the hue of motorway diversion signs. The paper was stained almost like there was added colour. I used it in a sponge cake and it looked very artificial. Maybe the cows have been fed something thats affected the milk? Very odd.

I don't know what has happened to this butter but it is well inside its sell by date. It is very dark Yellow, tastes terrible, rancid. bought in the past and it has been okay. I will throw them away and not buy again.

I recently was sent this as a substitution to my usual brand, and I've now switched over.
This butter has a nice natural yellow colour, creamy taste and just the right amount of salt. The blocks shaped this way fit my fridge door better as well.

What have they done?  There is so much salt in this it's rendered inedible. 
Won't be buying again.

Bought two of these because they were on special offer, and I've had Lye Cross Farm cheese many times with no complaints.   But these will be going in the bin.  Still well in date, both packets are dark yellow and have a funny taste, like butter that has been around too long.  Really disappointing and won't be buying again.
I will go back to Waitrose own next time
We bought 2 packs of this and it’s put me off butter. Far too salty and so yellow I actually wondered if it was off. Swapped back to my usual brand.
Very odd.  The packaging was watery and was peeling open so it was exposed to elements.

I dont usually do reviews but this is an exception because it is such a poor product. Because of increases in prices I switched from my usual Waitrose salted butter to this product which is on offer. It is grainy, very salty, and doesnt keep well out of the fridge, which suggests to me that it has been frozen for a period of time and the emulsion has been affected. Not good......switched back and paid the extra 20p!
So so salty.  Doesnt keep in my butter dish overnight as other butters do.  Funny, almost grainy, texture.  Had to chuck away as was sent 3 as a substitution.
Was put off by some of the reviews, but glad we tried it! Lovely and tasty as it should be!
We love this butter and made fairly locally to us.  Perfect on toast!
as other reviewers have said this softens really quickly. It tastes like spread though to our family, it's pretty tasteless on toast but fine for baking

Tastes like butter but is very yellow compared to most others on the market. Also is too soft for a butter dish and separates in not very high room temperature. I wouldn't recommend just for the aesthetics of it but it tastes ok.

This reminds me of our home churned butter : a good flavour though some may find it a little salty. 
We really like it and it's worth the few pence extra compared to the "essentials" branded version.
A rich tasting butter from Somerset, I switched from a wall known Irish butter purely for taste. Well worth trying.
its been practically cold for aug but this butter melts like its 30 degrees in my kitchen. Can't buy again

Bought on basis of such good reviews but found this extremely salty (and I am someone who does like salt in my food - arguably a bit too much!)  Used it to make scrambled egg and didn't need to add extra salt at all. Shan't purchase again.

The flavour of this butter is fine but it went rancid overnight in my butter dish.  This is the only butter that has done this  and it wasn't a one off as I bought 4 packs when it was on special offer and they all did the same.

I usually buy Waitrose essential but as this was on offer I thought I'd give it a go.  It tastes good and is slightly softer and creamier than the Waitrose so easier to spread from the fridge.  
I am stocking up so will find out how it behaves after freezing!
I use butter for baking, and I found this butter difficult to work with compared with Waitrose butter for eg. On the plus sides, it tastes great on toast.

Ordinarily I'd purchase Ocado's own butter, but as it was out of stock I gave this a go. It's surprisingly good! Quite creamy, not too salty - if anything I'd like more salt, but I enjoy buying salt crystal butter so that's subjective! Would buy it again.
I use both unsalted and slightly salted I desperately want to give up French and Danish butter but all the English/Welsh butters have more salt - please reduce down to at least 1.5%!
I like this butter very much for the times when you want salted butter. It tastes very good.
Excellent flavour and perfect level of saltiness!
Too yellow , shan't buy again

Read the reviews and purchased but having sampled many brands, this did not compete well. The taste is bland and the butter always remains hard and doesn't spread well, ( I always keep my butter out in a dish regardless of season). Will not buy again.
This is really lovely butter and so spreadable. Will definitely buy again.
Lovely taste. Order every week.
Great all round proper tasting butter & the whole family love it!
You won't find a tastier butter at this price, love!!!
Tasty and salty. difficult to spread.
Strange yellow colour and no were near as nice tasting as premium brands.
really tasty butter, good price, will buy this again
Easy to spread and tasty. But a sticky consistency for my liking

This block butter is flavourful and is neither sour nor does it have a margerine-like greasiness. Most spreadable butters are not butter, but a BLEND of marge/veg oil and butter. For those who wish to avoid margerine/spreads... Never mind the brand name,  if it doesn't have the word BUTTER on the pack it isn't.
This is fab. Not buying anything else from now on. Very impressed. There was me thinking butter is butter. But it's not!
This tastes like a proper salted creamy farmhouse butter. Just how we like it.

I've been impressed by Lye Cross's cheeses and I'm always looking to support West Country producers, but in truth this is a bland butter. Good value when it's on offer, but can't compete with the French stuff.

Grainy and did not deliver the heat I expected from the chillis.  Overall flavour is tomato.

Didn't enjoy the grainy texture in this dip although this is not something I dislike in other dips like hummous.  Bought on a flash sale but still disappointed and thought it very overpriced for what it was.  Threw over half away.
I’ve not tried this before but I did like it. I didn’t just use it as a dip but also as a topping for chicken and fish

Bought on flash sales. Tasty and lovely texture , not overpowering, nutty. Used as a dip, as a filling in pitta bread with cheese, and the best of all try generously coating a salmon fillet with this and baking without foil for 15 minutes at around 200 degrees C. It makes a lovely savoury and crusted topping with the peppers and crushed nuts. Gamble paid off! There would be enough to easily coat a whole side of salmon or 8 fillets in this tub, please give it a go!
I'm really not sure what to do with most of the tub. Its too bland to eat on its own as a dip and everything I tried it with tastes better without it.
Bought in a flash sale. None of liked this, it was grainy with an odd almost bitter aftertaste. Unfortunately we had to bin it, something we rarely do with food.

Very tasty dip. I tend to get easily bored of products like this and you can often find half-eaten pots of dips/condiments/sauces in my fridge...not this time, I ate it all within a couple of days! I had it with breadsticks and crudités, pitta bread, crisps, spread into a toastie...yum!
A delicious mix of spices, rich and colourful. Perfect with flatbread, mini pitta and fresh vegetables.
Almost a fiver a pot, but extraordinary.

First time I had muhammara it was on a holiday, tried making it myself, but wasnt the same as I remembered. This one hits the spot. Would love it to be a bit cheaper though, but will definitely treat myself from time to time.
I didnt know what to what to expect but decided to give it a try when on sale. Its really versatile, nice flavour. Will buy again and recommend to others to try

I bought this in a flash sale. Wasn’t sure what to expect, because I’ve never had this before, but it’s really lovely. My only negative comment is that I’d like it to be far less salty. Most things like this and hummus, dips etc. are always over salted. We’re all trying to eat less salt these days and as I don’t eat much myself, this is way too salty for me, which is a shame because I would buy it regularly otherwise. 
The flavours are really intense, you can detect walnuts as a texture and as a flavour, which is a definite bonus. Rich roasted red peppers tomato paste and spices, with pomegranate molasses make this a nicely indulgent dish. I had it with roasted cauliflower and some lightly toasted rice cakes to add something bland! Overall I think this is a lovely dip for raw veg or roasted veg or to spread on crackers, Melba toast etc. definitely recommended.

Lovely taste for just a dip or side sauce. I also used this to make a delicious breakfast dish. Fry onions first and then mushrooms, and then continue cooking with a spoonful of this sauce together.  Serve with eggs to your liking (or scrambled silken tofu) and Strong Roots cauliflower hash browns. If you happen to have Belazu roasted aubergine mezze, add that on the side to serve with.
Not sure why the negative review about rapeseed. I think the previous reviewer is confusing with palm oil. Nothing wrong with rapeseed.
So flavourful, and great as either a dip or spooned over a piece of fish.  Yum!
Surprised to see rapeseed oil in a Natoora product.  Won't be buying again!
I like it and so does our toddler, great with crusty bread
It tastes great and has a pesto like texture. However, I don't think I'll order this again.
I don't know if it's authentic , as have never eaten muhammara before . But it is very tasty !! And will be buying again .
We’ve made this dip ourselves a few times so great to be able to buy an easier option. Very decent. Lovely texture. Slight spice. Yum.

I am so glad I tried this dip as an alternative to butter on sandwiches.  The taste is amazing. I have also used it in wraps with salad and fish and also with burgers and fries, it is very versatile and very yummy! Will be buying again.
Got on a flash sale but like other review will happily pay full price. Used as a dip with chopped peppers and as a side next to a salad . Great !
I initially bought this product in a flash sale. We liked it so much, it is becoming a regular purchase. You can taste the nuttiness. I particularly like it as a snack, spread on some rye bread.
Delicious garlicky, spicy, nutty dip. Great with pitta bread. Easy to get addictive to.
Really lovely tasting and unusual dip.
We are vegan to help our health and planet and saw this on flash sale with good reviews- so tried it. We both enjoy it and wil buy again- but it is quite pricy.
This is quite tasty but a bit too heavy with the pepper taste and a little to watery. It is also not like any muhamarra that I have tasted. Ocado/Natoora why not try to list an actual muhamarra.

I get a bit bored of hummus and creamy dips and this is a nice alternative. its not too spicy and its actually hard to pick out any particular flavour for me. Its quite expensive though so probably would only buy when on offer
A nice change from hummus. Maybe a smidgen too much cumin but great texture and nice to dollop on a salad or baked potato
Move over, hummus!

Full of flavour. The walnuts provided the texture and aren't an obvious flavour if you don't like them. This is spicy and garlicky. One point off as no dietary information. I ate the whole pot and don't know the calorie content!
Absolutely loved this dip! so much flavour and great texture.
Delicious with veg or tortilla chips - best dip from Natoora
This is a really tasty dip. Nicer than any other shop bought dip Ive tried- tasted v fresh. We couldnt stop eating it!
Made a great change from humous. Really tasty combination and loved the walnut. On the spicy side. Terrific on good bread and lovely to dip tortilla in.

Completely overwhelmed by garlic and no discernible trace of the pomegranate molasses which should be an essential ingredient. The texture was not great and erred on the gritty side. Middle Eastern food is way more subtle than this, what should have been smoky and sweet was a one note salsa. Will stick to making my own Muhammara in future.
Spicy and very very moreish.

I had this for lunch, but i did add some low fat cheese.  The flavour is good and it is convenient in the plastic container.  A lunch that can be easily transported.  The negative is the price, I bought this on flash sale but I certainly would not pay full price for it.

Very tasty and great textures.

Even the leaves remained crunchy, which is impressive when pre-packed like this.
Loved it.  Yes, couldnt be asked to chew through the kale stalks but the rest was great.  Interesting selection of vegetables, capers added a nice zing, nice creamy dressing.
really tasty.
For me it was perfect for a quick meal that didnt need any cooking or any prep! I loved the flavour of the sauce and thought the onions really made it too. Yum!

It's not a bad salad exactly, but if you'd just read the front of the jar and not gone through the full ingredients list then you'd be very disappointed. Only a few capers, and a few tiny pieces of red onion which didn't taste pickled at all, just raw. My cauliflower didn't seem charred either. Lots of chickpeas, and quite a bit of carrot (neither is listed on the front). Still, I like chickpeas and it tasted ok - I thought the dressing was alright as vegan 'mayo' sauces go. I wouldn't get it again unless it was heavily reduced.
Really not very nice, hardly any Caesar flavour, tough thick inedible kale stalks & butternut had a horrible slightly slimy texture.
Its not fresh obviously.  And it shows. It looks nice in picture but in real life underwhelming.
Adding the dressing makes the difference and it does taste great.  However, the way this product is packaged makes me feel guilty for buying so I won't be again.

I quite like the Bol microwave efforts. This is awful. A huge plastic pot literally a quarter full of massive chunks of mostly raw vegetables, the cauli in the title consisted entirely of hunks of raw stalk, not a floret to be seen. The plastic pot of slightly rancid tasting dressing was a real pain to open and in the process I spilt half of it ... which probably improved the end result.

I should have read more of the reviews - bland veg. I was looking forward to the cauliflower and it was flavourless - definitely not chargrilled. Stars given only for nutritional content, not any pleasure in eating.

I wont be doing that again. I opened it a day before its use by date and it smelled vaguely of rotting veg. On eating it it was very bland and nothing tasted chargrilled. I didnt finish it because the rotting smell was quite off putting.
I really enjoyed this. Fresh & tasty, nice crunchy cauliflower and a bit of zing from the capers. Easy to eat straight from the jar (I didn't use the little wooden fork, used a normal one)

If you read the reviews there's lots of feedback about whether the name of the salad is accurate. Well who cares if the product is fresh, healthy and most importantly absolutely delicious!    
It's really good and I shall pop it in my trolley on a regular basis. Yum yum.
I bought this on a flash sale to try. Firstly the jar was only half full. It wasn't horrible but just not very tasty and far too expensive for what is was
Only purchase when on offer otherwise very expensive but good quality salad with a really useful jar you can use again and again!
So good, the dressing especially makes this! Thoroughly recommend

This looked great and smelt very fresh. It was colourful and looked very appetising.Very fresh tasting with the lovely soft carrot pieces contrasting with the texture of the quinoa and the satisfying crunch of the cauliflower and the chickpeas. This lovely balance was finished off by the caeser dressing which had just the right amount of bite. I really enjoyed this and would buy again.
Love BOL salads and this one doesn't disappoint. Dressing is delicious and the mix of cauli and grains give a great texture. Perfect lunch option!

Really like these, only crit, well two... firstly, really only a serving for one, and.  It pricy for that. Get two with dinner for two and that is a ,out of money on salad!
Secondly...  the little grainy bits? Seem to meany. Dont know what they are. Ok, but ..not really needed?
Nice enough salad pot for a quick lunch. Wanted to love it but was average and a completely misleading description as the Cauliflower has definitely not been near a chargrill!
Absolutely love this salad pot - buy it all the time for lunch. The Caesar dressing is the best - hoping they bring out a bottled version of it!
Just OK and had cauliflower rice no chargrilled anything. Small portion I thought, not that exciting and overpriced. Wont be buying again.
Tastes so and so. Cant find the word. Bland and sad. Please improve and Ill buy this again.

Like others have said, the cauliflower isn't chargrilled. I would have knocked off a star for that but I still found it very tasty and nutritious. I thought there was enough dressing and I felt full after eating this. Will start adding this to my weekly shop.

I enjoyed this, I like a good crunchy salad and the dressing was nice. The flavours seemed a bit muted though - eg. I could hardly taste the red onion but I could see it was in there. I jazzed it up with a few toasted nuts for extra texture but it was filling enough for a quick lunch. I bought this in the flash sale - Im not sure Id want to buy it at full price but I enjoyed it nevertheless.
So tasty, got this on a flash sale . I would pay full price and you have a re-usable container too
The dressing is lovely and mix of ingredients really enjoyable. A definite weekly purchase.

This salad was the least enjoyable way I have found so far of consuming 2 of my 5 a day.
Issues:
1) Raw cauliflower, one edge of one piece looked like it had encountered a blowtorch.
2) the kale - aka inedible thick hard purple frilly joy assassin.
3) the carrots: neither chargrilled or roasted, tasteless bricks of orange colour
4) 5) & 6) insufficient quantity of watery (non coating) overpowering flavoured dressing.
7) tasteless capers
8) 3 flakes of chopped parsley in the whole pot

Redeeming features? - I liked the chickpeas.
I am so disappointed. BOL - please make something more pleasant as a no chilli option for lunch. This falls far far below your lovely Japanese slaw

bought this for the first time in the sale and ordered now 3 per week, lovely stuff and full of healthy nutricients and it even tastes, only downside I would love to have a bit more of the dressing. My tip: put the dressing half an hour before eating in into the salat.

Like others have said, the cauliflower isn't chargrilled. I would have knocked off a star for that but I still found it very tasty and nutritious. I thought there was enough dressing and I felt full after eating this. Will start adding this to my weekly shop.

I enjoyed this, I like a good crunchy salad and the dressing was nice. The flavours seemed a bit muted though - eg. I could hardly taste the red onion but I could see it was in there. I jazzed it up with a few toasted nuts for extra texture but it was filling enough for a quick lunch. I bought this in the flash sale - Im not sure Id want to buy it at full price but I enjoyed it nevertheless.
So tasty, got this on a flash sale . I would pay full price and you have a re-usable container too
The dressing is lovely and mix of ingredients really enjoyable. A definite weekly purchase.

This salad was the least enjoyable way I have found so far of consuming 2 of my 5 a day.
Issues:
1) Raw cauliflower, one edge of one piece looked like it had encountered a blowtorch.
2) the kale - aka inedible thick hard purple frilly joy assassin.
3) the carrots: neither chargrilled or roasted, tasteless bricks of orange colour
4) 5) & 6) insufficient quantity of watery (non coating) overpowering flavoured dressing.
7) tasteless capers
8) 3 flakes of chopped parsley in the whole pot

Redeeming features? - I liked the chickpeas.
I am so disappointed. BOL - please make something more pleasant as a no chilli option for lunch. This falls far far below your lovely Japanese slaw

bought this for the first time in the sale and ordered now 3 per week, lovely stuff and full of healthy nutricients and it even tastes, only downside I would love to have a bit more of the dressing. My tip: put the dressing half an hour before eating in into the salat.

As per previous reviews - the cauliflower isnt chargrilled. Its not a real bother as salad still tastes lovely, but odd that it says so on the packaging but its really not how the product is presented.
The cauliflower was not really charred or grilled. If they got that right would be delicious.
Was pleasantly surprised by this salad.

I really thought i'd enjoy this but strange mix of ingredients that tasted really bland and a bit bizarre. Cauliflower was defo not chargrilled which i can now see in the other comments and it was also really hard and tasteless. I wouldn't buy again as there are so many better alternatives out there!
Fresh, crunchy light and yet very filling. The pot doesnt look that big but actually the quantity is just right and makes for a  satisfying meal. Will be buying again !

Agree with other reviewers that cauliflower did not seem chargrilled, however, for me that didn't detract from my enjoyment of the salad. Tasted fresh, wholesome and filling and is a regular(ish) purchase. Enough for me for a lunch, but have also taken on a picnic - which, with a few other items is more than enough for 2 on a day out. Love it, only wish the other Bol salads were gluten free.

Love the Bol range but don’t think this one is a god as the other salad jars. There was no hint of chargrilled taste, just al dente cauliflower & carrots, raw red onion, quinoa, chickpeas & a few capers, dressing is ok. Wouldn’t rush to buy it again but is ok.
Delicious salad pot, the dressing and pickled onions gave it a lovely flavour! Great to grab and go
Hadn't tried this salad jar before, think its new, but really quite impressed. For a quick lunch you can't go wrong.

I just had this for lunch and wow it was amazing. Definitely a modern take on a caesar salad, with quinoa, charred cauliflower and red kale instead of the usual lettuce, but wow that dressing is incredible! The whole salad feels super nourishing yet so naughty at the same time - it's creamy, tangy and packed full of all the flavours and textures you could want! Sooo more-ish - I can't wait for my next one!

Firstly, my cauliflower was not char-grilled, it had no colour at all and tasted like boiled or steamed cauliflower, disappointing.
Secondly, I did not detect any pickled red onions or capers, not a bit, nothing!
Thirdly, it seemed to be mostly Quinoa and chickpeas.
Not what I expected at all, but the dressing tasted okay.

....as I like all the ingredients. However, there wasn't one caper in the whole salad, the cauliflower wasn't cooked it seemed (let alone chargrilled), there was lots of raw onion and neither of us could taste the dressing. An expensive disappointment.
So tasty, can't believe it's plant based. I'm not vegan but like to try different stuff & amazed that this is 100% plant based, absolutely no compromise.
Brilliant salad jar, the capers were a great addition, perfect vegan Caesar. Didn't feel too heavy with the dressing like some Caesar salads can be. Would get again in a heartbeat.
Finally!! A great vegan Caesar salad, loved this for my lunch this week. The dressing was amazing, couldn't actually believe it was plant based!

Had a few of these now and find them generally balanced veg wise and the dressing is creamy and delicious but on occasion the veg is all disproportionate and the dressing is thin and vinegary, bit hit and miss tbh
Im not a fan of raw onion and it was impossible to pick it out of this salad, there was so much. I love raw cauliflower, but I think it does need to be cooked a little bit more to work in this salad.
Loved this salad, crunchy cauli was great and the dressing was soo good - i wish you could buy a whole bottle of the dressing on its own too. YUMM
Lovely dressing but the rest was so hard and undercooked, I had to throw it all away. Complete waste of money
My regular evening drink - it has great flavour and sets you up for a good nights sleep well

What an amazing tea! It helped me to sleep better, which I somewhat expected. But what came as a nice surprise, it did wonders to my digestion. It helped my guts better than anything else I tried in the last few months.
PS I generally dislike taste of fennel in my tea, but the overall effect of this mix was so good that Ill be drinking it every evening like some sort of magic potion.

Buy these to put them into a large jar with a selection of different tea bags. This batch dis not have the original bags with the Relax label. Yej bags were generic and you couldnt tell the taste from looking at the single package. Strange....!
This is the perfect end to a busy day. Since I started drinking this before bed I've been sleeping better and waking up feeling more refreshed than before.
Yes its a mild flavour (chamomile generally is) but its lovely!
Hidden amongst the ingredients are liquorice and ginger so this is actually quite a tasty brew.
This used to have some flavor and made me sleepy before. Now its almost flavorless and no longer makes me sleepy
I love this tasting tea, smooth flavours and very relaxing
best night time tea

nicest tea I have tried, even though I thought I did not like liquorice - turns out it makes it taste slightly sweet without the cloying aftertaste sugar brings. Drink it all day now, never been so hydrated!

I am in the habit of brewing a cup of this just before bedtime and leaving the bag in the cup for max strength and flavour. I find it relaxes me nicely and the liquorice gives a sweet note without overwhelming.

I'm a terrible sleeper and have tried several sleepy teas with mixed results. This one has been the most successful for me by far although, like all these teas, I find it gives me quite vivid dreams.
The taste is quite nice too though it is quite sweet.
Very nice tea and makes you want to sleep. I love pukka night tea and this one is very similar and has the same effect on me, if you have trouble sleeping-try this tea , pukka is the best
Pukka always seem to get it right! Not only is this relaxing but it's a great stomach soother too :-)
Needs a bit of salt but very tasty otherwise.
A satisfying mushroom stew. I would not describe this as stroganoff, smoked paprika was lost. It's OK, but not as good as others in the Soulful range.

Tried a few of these now and this one was good but not as nice as the Brazilian one. The mushroom bits in this were massive as were the carrots. Smelled lush from the microwave and tasted good, the giant mushroom bits just put me off.
When I first opened this I wasnt sure. But it was actually pretty tasty. Some of the mushroom pieces are a bit too big so a little chewy but otherwise good.
I thought the Brazillian one was devine ... but woah!
Glad I tried this Soulful lunch pot! I was really pleased with the taste texture and ingredients. Will def buy this again! and keep a couple in the freezer for a nice addition to an evening meal.
Thought I'd try something different and I'm glad I did!   This is delicious, creamy and tasty with nice big chunks of mushroom!
This is my favourite of all the Soulful pots - and they are delicious. Perfect amount of thick, juicy mushrooms, rich creamy flavour and only 239 calories per generous pot.  Love it.
A distant memory of a stroganoff
Very nice.  Bit of a small portion but good as a light lunch.
I'm not Vegan but I am totally won over by Soulful's range, and this one is no exception. As a member of a mushroom disliking family (!) this gives me my fix in a quick and very tasty pot.

Had this for my lunch at work and loved it. Very flavoursome with loads of mushrooms which I love. Quite salty but I didnt mind that. And perhaps its changed since previous reviews as the veg was soft and the consistency was firm, ie I ate it with a fork, like risotto.
this is a really tasty pot of goodness.

If you try this and dont like it, dont let it put you off of Soulful. I usually really like their pots, they are my go to convenience food however I wasnt a fan of this one. It had a really grainy consistency, and big lumps of veg in which remain quite hard and make it taste like a watery vegetable stew in places. It wasnt revolting, but I wont be buying this one again.
Absolutely tasteless and truly revolting vegetables in it. Very disappointed because I love all of the other recipes and options from this same brand.
I love Soulful meals in general and I tried the stroganoff for the first time this week. super creamy , nice comfort meal and perfect for a work lunch . will definitely buy again.
A big lump of hard something.
An unappetising looking mush, which was tasteless and too salty.

I was really looking forward to this. I love stroganoff. This tasted of carrots and celery while eating it and then left a horrible after taste for the rest of the afternoon. Should taste of mushrooms which arent meant to be the star of the show. Really disappointed and would not buy again.
I am very impressed with this. Truly delicious.
Delicious, creamy, restaurant quality meal!

Well done Ocado I have not found these anywhere else. I took a chance and expected it to be a bit hot and spicy, instead a warm, creamy taste. Packed with large slices of mushrooms, large chunks of chopped carrot and some delicious red rice.The alcohol was not obvious however probably added to the overall yummy flavour. 
Ive never had red rice before and not a rice fan but this added a nuttier flavour and I loved it. 
I hadnt realised these pots can be frozen so the sell by date being long in the fridge they went. Not for long!  A instantly easy meal was needed so out it came. Unlike many one person meals this was plenty enough for a solo diner. Chunky & satisfying & not swimming in watery sauce 
Would look good on a plate but I ate straight from the pot as i couldnt wait!
Gluten free and not high in calorics, low in fat and vegetarian. 
Not suitable for non dairy eaters as the double cream and milk is part of the creamy taste. 
A definite repeat on my shopping list
I am not a vegetarian but find this a tasty work lunch. It is much more filling that you would expect for around 250 calories.
The instant i heated this up I could smell the milk in it. I couldn't taste any other ingredient. I don't know if this was just a bad batch but it was disgusting. Won't be buying again.
This tastes lovely and is nice and filling. Perfect for lunch at work. I will definitely be buying this again
Fairly nice and filling but I found it was too salty.

Wow this was horrible. I got given it as a substitute for something else and rather than have no lunch thought I'd give it a go. It was quite the most revolting thing I've eaten in a long time. If you can imagine slimy boiled plastic with lumps of dishcloth you're someway to understanding my trauma.

I received this as a substitute for a real Waitrose beef stroganoff.

Unfortunately I found this product unappetising and completely at odds with what a real stoganoff should be, even without meat.  Poor flavour and odd texture.

I wouldnt purchase myself and should really have my money back for a wasted dinner.
Really enjoyed this, creamy with lots of mushroom.

Im loving these meals this is my favourite so far I buy cooked chicken pieces and break them into it for a low calorie dinner
Tastes like a creamy mushroom risotto its delish!

Gluten free, tasty, filling and no nasties! I would buy from the range but all the other meals have butternut squash in, or sweet potato , but this stroganoff, is wonderful. I ate it at 12 for lunch and was still full at 7pm!
I have tried many things in this range, and this is by far the worst product. A horrible texture, and odd taste, and unappetizing smell.
Didn't need to have anything else with it  - although I did have some of my favourite breadsticks, just because - generous portion, very easy and tasty, having it again next week!
Really rich and had the synthetic taste of a can of mushroom soup. Even with a base of spinach and pepper, too  bland and I didnt finish it.
I'm a lover of Soulful One Pots, but this is so tasteless.

Creamy stroganoff taste
Delicious and relatively health. 
Perfect office lunch option for me

Overall very tasty product, but I was very disappointed to find milk in this product. Why no use an alternative cream, such as oat or coconut?
I will not be buying again until the milk is removed.

Ive tried a few of the Soulful pots and this is one of my favourites. Nice big chunks of mushroom give this variety in texture (some of the others are quite sloppy) and it has a good strong flavour. Great for mushroom lovers.
Would recommend
Ive tried several Soulful pots. This is nice but its not a favourite. The vegetables have an odd too-crunchy texture and the whole thing doesnt quite gel. Its not awful, just not amazing either.

I added a base of fresh spinach, some tarragon, pink salt and black pepper. But this meal was so satisfying. Wish I had more. Will buy some and put them away. Perfect as I am just recovering from pregnancy and want something quick, tasty AND healthy.

Ive been looking for some healthier lunch foods and I have to say that Im super impressed with this. As a big fan of regular stroganoff I was concerned it would seem like a blander healthy version, but this was not the case at all. The textures from the rice, carrots and mushrooms are perfect and the sauce is rich and delicious. I do like a good size portion and Im pleased to report that I was happily full afterwards. Buying again!

Good chunks of mushrooms, but carrots and paprika don't belong in a Stroganoff, but often make an appearance, quite a good flavour though. It contains a low amber Dept of Health salt level and less than the West African pot and other non veggie ones in the range, it didn't taste particularly salty to me.
I found this a little bland, but very mushroomy.
Delicious. Flavourful and full of chunky pieces of mushroom.
An autumn hug in a pot. Really wholesome and filling - rich yet healthy. Truly delicious, my favourite of these Soulful Pots by far.
I like all of the Soulful range but have only just tried this one. Its full of flavour but not full of calories. Whats not to love?!
Only pot in the range I haven't been able to finish. Found it too rich / creamy. It does not taste like stroganoff and instead had a very strong pumpkin soup flavour.
The Soulful veggie choices are usually good, but this one is the weak link in the range. It's pretty bland, and seems to have far more carrot and celery in than it does mushrooms!

I really like some of the Soulfood pot meals but this one was a let down. The base flavour of the meal is actually fairly tasty, but it is so salty your mouth is just overwhelmed by salt.
I personally wouldn't buy this again unless they reduced the salt.

No to my taste I'm afraid.
My first Soulful purchase and probably my last. Incredibly salty and rather unpleasant.

Tried this for the first time and will definitely buy again. A really tasty, filling dish. If I were really hungry I think I would have rice with it too. Not the easiest meal to eat from the pot, as it is almost soup-like, so I can't recommend it as one to eat at your work desk as it can get messy! I started off with a fork and ended up using a spoon! Looking forward to trying more of this range now. Thank you Soulful for providing something different from the norm!
A really good, substantial meal for so few calories.

I generally enjoy the Soulful Vegetarian range but was very disappointed with this one.  For some time I've made a conscious effort to consume much less salt. This Chestnut  Mushroom Stroganoff with Red Rice was incredibly salty, whereas the other Soulful One Pots I buy do not have this problem.
Filling and tasty.
Three in the pack were mouldy.  However, with the other good reviews, I will give them another go for the price.
Really good but dont seem very fresh, go bad fast and sometimes one is moldy.
Yummy easy peelers at a good price
First couple of times we tried these we loved them but the last lot were dry
Almost always bruised, and rarely last until their expiry date - I've ordered these repeatedly, and have finally given up as they disappoint so often
I loved these. The flavour was intense and refreshing, and those that werent eaten lasted over a week in the fruit bowl, until they were eaten too.
Other companies now use biodegradable netting. Why not Ocado?
Had these now for a couple of weeks, but each time they have been dry and just about to turn.
Mouldy the next day after delivery. Not worth it unless you plan to eat the whole bag the day they are delivered

Like another recent commentator, when these arrived I thought theyd be going straight in the bin since they looked off-coloured, misshapen and strange textured. But much to my amazement, they are sweet, a bit tangy and delicious! Weve been really disappointed with clementines this year. Our usual go-to brands have been off, but these are great, and by far the cheapest.
Mostly rotten avoid.

When I saw these I thought they were candidates for the bin! They were small, rather wizened and dull. But when I tried one I found they are delicious, sweet but tangy. As we are in full citrus season I hope to be able to order them every week for quite a while.

I see there are mixed reviews for these so maybe I’ve been lucky but I’ve found these to be really sweet and tasty. I’ve had the odd one that’s been a little dry but the whole pack will never been the same. I now reorder these weekly.
I have bought different types of clementines and easy peelers and find these are by far the best of the bunch. They are lovely and sweet and very easy to peel. I would recommend.
Better than some more pricer oncs. Small but sweet and juicy
So surprised at how poor these were and how hit and miss they are for taste and quality.  They should have been juicy and refreshing.  I had to simply throw them away.

We get these a lot and they are almost always nice -juicy and sweet.  They also keep really well in the fridge, usually for a month or more.  Ocado produce can we hit or miss but this one is one of our regulars.
Probably the worst clementines I have ever tasted, whilst these are juicy they totally lack in flavour.
sweet and fresh
lovely clementines. Sweet and juicy. My family loves them.

Dry, tasteless,  some unpeelable.

Prior to this great value reasonable quality fruit.

Sad times!
Ordered 2 shops ago - first net was great. Second net I threw as the clementines were all soft. Wont buy again.
not good, half had mould after a couple of days
These have been good, but the last 2 deliveries are less tasty and only worthy of 'average'. Will probably continue to buy, but may experiment with some alternatives.

Clementines were completely not edible. Partially frozen like the product that touched back of the fridge.
I had to dispose the whole bag as the rest was already drying out and they had no taste to them.
I ordered 2 bags. Both contained mouldy fruit on delivery, and I binned 9 more a couple of days later. No way will I be buying these again.
Had to throw out a couple of these as they had deep black spots. A few others rest are a bit dry and old.
Around half of these were off the day they arrived. The rest were okay but tiny and not very tasty
Some were already mouldy and the others were inedible and went straight in the bin. And they were incredibly hard to peel so no idea why they are called easy peelers

These ‘easy peelers’ were dreadful... they had no taste whatsoever, plus they were going mouldy from the day of delivery.  I will never waste my money on this product again! You can do better than this, Ocado!
Wet inside after peeling, tasteless and thoroughly unpleasant. What waste of growing, transport, packaging and delivery.
These were just nasty! Discoloured, mouldy and rotten. And in a plastic net bag. Horrid.
They seem inexpensive until you realise that only half of them are edible.  The other half are squashed/mouldy/off and end up in the bin.
will avoid in future, quality very low atm, can't remember having problems in the past when ordering but last 2 orders have been awful!
One week good, next week mainly mouldy or dry and really hard to peel. Very frustrating. I am working my way through the various types of "easy" peelers in the hope of finding reliable ones.

I accepted these as a substitute for another brand of oranges but I wish I hadn't bothered.  Half of them were mouldy within a couple of days.  Good size for lunch boxes and not a bad flavour but not worth the money. I asked for a refund.
75% of these were mouldy, the remaining edible ones were hard and tasteless. Not impressed

This was clearly a problem with the entire batch, not just a case of one mouldy fruit spreading spores, as once one mouldy fruit was identified and thrown away, the remaining ones were carefully wiped and then  stored so that they didn't touch.
Weve had to bin these from our recent orders. This was a regular until now. Surprised these are accepted by quality control and delivered to customers.
These have been declining in quality for weeks now. Last week's lot - bar two - went in the bin. Arrived old and tired and turned mouldy VERY quickly. Ugh
Sort your suppliers out please. This is such a waste.

I buy this range already for years, every week, and it is a lotto.. the last weeks they were brilliant, but this weeks are the biggest disappointment ever, and I saw similarremarks fro other customers, so it is not onlt me.. impossible to eat..  Dry, very hard peelers,  tough to eat, no juice.   information for Ocado !!!! pleae note
origin Spain.. sixe 50/58mm, supplier E58114 Class I  (class I is a joke !!!!)
pleasen Ocado, avoid this supplier in the future.. It is a waste of money for your customers...  If ir happens again, I will buy omewhere else..
More than half were mouldy and oozing juice. Straight in the bin.
Half of them moldy
Very disappointing, they were very small and hard.  Also hard to peel but dried up inside.  Have thrown them all away.  Have requested refund.

These easy peelers looked lovely, ripe and plump.  Unfortunately they tasted of nothing at all, weren't juicy and could only be described as disappointing.

I ended up tasting two because I couldn't believe they'd all be that bad and throwing the rest away. 
NOT a mistake I'd make twice.
These are of the South African Nadorcott variety at present and are absolute top class!  Size, flavour, peel ability all of the highest quality. Highly recommend. Already added for next week's order.
Large and juicy. I received this as substitute and almost declined. I was very pleasantly surprised. I couldnt fault mine. A good batch maybe?
These went bad within 2 days and I had to throw them away. Won't order them again
Tasteless
Waist of money

I bought these in a flash half price sale. I probably wouldnt have noticed them otherwise as its years since I last bought clementines. Very glad I did as theyre great. Five in the bag which is perfect if only one household member likes them.
At the time of writing these are very easy to peel. Despite the name many varieties arent! A very good citrus flavour with plenty of juice.
These are delicious and very reasonably priced :)
I often find that clementines and tangerines dont stay juicy for long, but these are doing well so far. They are a decent size as well, and not too many of them (which is a common downside!)
Got these to review from Ocado, not super I'm afraid. bit tasteless

This fruit is as previous reviews poor quality, I bought them two or three weeks running thinking the first delivery was perhaps a one off poor batch.
Subsequently all the other deliveries were the same, some brown. some turning brown, dry to eat and ended up being thrown away as no one wanted to eat them.
I shan't buy these again.
For the last few weeks these have been arriving well past their best,  with 2-3 already spoiled.  Will not buy again
I was given these for a review from Ocado and they were sweet and juicy, perfect as a snack! The down side was the size, just a bit too small.
Weve had these on the past few orders and have had to have them refunded more than once. Fruit is either very dry/shrivelled or overripe
Provided for review purposes. Yes, easy peel, but quite stringy and a little tasteless.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I was a bit sceptical about these as they can often be hit or miss, bland, dried out, etc. We must have got lucky with these because they were all nice and sweet with a good flavour and juicy. The skins were a lot more gnarly than I've normally seen, but the fruit inside was perfect. I will definitely take another chance on these!

I'll start by saying I got these oranges for free to review from Ocado. My general feeling is you can't really go wrong for the price.  The taste across my batch were not specifically consistent, some being more sweet than others, and one went bad and moulded in the course of three days of having received them.  But, they really do peel easily and for the most part I'd buy them if I were in the mood for an orange.
Good product, one peeler was a bit poor condition, but in general peelers are sweet and tasty.
Good price; juicy and sweet
Yes easy to peel and juicy in the main but not all were of this standard hence the loss of one star.
I received this a trial. The ones that were not dried out were ok. Wont recommend
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. We found them to be tasty, juicy and easy to peel.
Tasted good, kids were able to peel on their own and they lasted in the fridge well. Good value price for packed lunches, picnics etc.
I was sent this to review by Ocado. Tasted delicious but not actually that easy to peel - slightly tough and covered in pith. That said they were then very tasty.
but not easy to peel!

I was given these in exchange for a review (though we have ordered these regularly). Nothing wrong with these. Occasionally a seed gets through and sometimes they come more ripe than other times but on the whole they're good quality and great for the kids.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  Loved these, really easy to peel and delicious taste.
These are good for kids as pretty small but some seemed a bit old when they arrived
Lunchbox staple in our house, was previously sending the kids to school with other types peeled in a bag but these are easy enough for them to do themselves, so they stay fresh and juicy.
Enjoyed these would buy again.
Some really lovely flavour, some rather plain. Didn't keep beyond two weeks but would buy again
Occasionally they're a little under par but most of the time they're very nice.
Perfect, petite lunch-box addition. Very easy to peel, juicy, and sweet enough to feel like a healthy dessert.
I was sent this by Ocado to review, these are very easy to peel and tasty... good price, will buy again...
Really enjoyed these, lovely sweet flavour and as it says in the name easy to peel.
Really enjoyed these lovely fresh and juicy and as the title suggests they peel easy as well,  I will be buying these again

I received these as a free sample to review. They are easy to peel and have not encountered any pips. They are deliciously sweet, but with a slightly sharp citrus edge - this is the perfect balance for me, but others may find them a little sharp.
These were unexpectedly sweet and juicy given the time of year. Full of flavour and easy to peel.
I was sent these to review and they were as stated easy to peel and lovely and sweet, have already bought them since
Weve found these to be consistently good. Sweet, juicy, nice texture.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Sweet and juicy. Easy to peel and didn't find any pips.
Nice and sweet not difficult to peel and no seeds! Pretty good. They dont last very well though

So easy to peel and very juicy.
This is one product Ocado asked me to review that I have really enjoyed. A tasty easy peeler. Glad I ordered two.
They peel easily, was no sign of pips and seem quite fresh. But the bag I had was quite a bitter taste
I was sent these to review. They have a good flavour and are a decent size.

Was sent these to review by Ocado and was pleasantly surprised as often these fruits are hit and miss with taste and texture. They lasted at least a week in the fruit bowl, so are fresh as well. A definite consideration if you want to order mini oranges.
Love these. Kids adore them. Easy to peel - obviously. Juicy. I buy these regularly.

I received this product from Ocado in exchange for an honest review.
Found the citrus to be easy to peel, nice sweetness and juicy.  Fruit was small to medium size.
Tasty product and would have again.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Perfectly decent easy peelers. Good price.
We were sent these to review. They are easy to peel for those with little fingers and are sweet and juicy.
Mine were easy to peel and tasted well. Nothing to complain.
I was sent these to review. Good price, easy to peel. Lovely and juicy, naturally sweet. Lovely.
I was sent these oranges free to review and was v impressed. Often supermarket bought oranges can be disappointing but these were sweet and juicy and easy to peel for an added bonus!
When these are on form, they are sweet & delicious, but equally you can receive a bag which are dried out and 'pithy'. Definitely easy to peel when the fruit are on the larger side..

We were sent these to review and I am so glad that we were! These are fantastic oranges for the whole family. A fabulous price but this doesnt mean the quality of the orange is compromised. They have a lovely thick skin and are genuinely easy to peel, and once youve opened it you find lovely chunky segments that are so sweet and juicy.
We all loved these so much that Ive already added a pack to my next order! Id wholeheartedly recommend to you!

Ocado does not show on the description of this product that the fruit is coated with 4 chemicals: the first is a fungicide considered to be harmful to health (https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2006/sep/25/health.foodanddrink), the second, E-904 is made from lice and therefore unsuitable for vegetarians, the third is a plastic, the fourth is another preservative.

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ I often find these can be hit and miss, with some of the fruit being too sour or dried out. However, all of these tasted good and were sweet and juicy. I will order them again.
These are definitely easy peel but some are sweeter and juicer than others. Real inconsistency

Given a coupon from Ocado to try these at no cost.  They are quite juicy and easy to peel so ideal for children. A bit pithy but fine for hand juicing, contain a few pips.  Tend to keep them in the fridge as citrus fruits seem to go mouldy quite quickly if kept in a warm kitchen.  Price very reasonable. Probably not as good as easy peelers from M&S.
These are still zingy & tasty even though it’s quite late in the season now but they did contain quite a lot of pips which put my 8 year old off.
I was sent these to review - I am so often disappointed by tangerines/clementines etc but these were actually good. I wld give an 8/10!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. As others have said, some are ok and taste nice, others are lacking in flavour and they seemed to go off/mouldy quite quickly.
Some were not too bad others lacking in flavour
Sometimes these are ok, most of the time dry and old.
Another poor quality Ocado own brand item.  Dry, sour, small fruit at an expensive price.
Half of the pack was inedible and went straight in the bin.  The rest were OK but not really nice.  I don't know how old the fruit is or if it has been stored badly

Too variable. Todays lot contained about a dozen tiny dried-out clementines, with an unpleasant taste. Had to bin them as not even suitable for juice. Previous lots have been more like the picture,  with about five large clementines per bag. They sometimes contained a few seeds,  but they were sweet and juicy.

I find easy peelers from all supermarkets can be hit and miss but the ones we received from Ocado yesterday were delicious. They were sweet, juicy and slightly tart. They won’t last long in our house!
Started off well but have deteriorated.
I love these easy peelers tasty

Sometimes these are fine and sometimes not. 
Todays delivery contained a very rotten orange and when I checked the remainder there were a couple more which looked past their best.
I received these as a substitute for M&S easy peelers and when I saw the reviews I was quite concerned. I neednt have been they were juicy, delicious and perfectly fresh.

Received these instead of the M&S seedless easy peelers, at first thought it was okay as the variety was the same as we had been getting (mandarin nadarcott) however these are a lot larger and so far almost every segment has contained at least 2 pips, and they have been on the sour side. I hate wasting fruit and will often juice it rather than throw away but Im not even sure its worth the effort unless I can find something to sweeten it with.
Nice flavour but they didn't last very long at all before they started going mushy.
Although I found 1 or 2 oranges a little bit sour, mostly they taste sweet and very juicy.
These easy peelers were soft and nearly due for the compost. They were very soft and mushy. Don't bother buying.
Have had these before but today,use by date tomorrow.Wrinkled and mouldy.Not good enough Ocado.
I’ve been buying these weekly for a while now. Some weeks they are delicious, some weeks they are inedible and go straight in the bin
Been ordering these regularly, they always last a week in the fridge and are a nice fresh flavour, not too sweet.

These used to be good. Maybe they have now been stored too long. Half the pack had brown, soft, rotten patches on the skin and the two edible ones were shrunk inside the skin and tasteless. Maybe a sign of Brexit and what is to come!
Unfortunately these clementines looked old, bruised and were tasteless.
Some were mushy, some rock hard and dry and tasteless.  Not good

Last two deliveries of these have gone onto the compost heap. Dry, weird tasting and yuck. Not sure what's happened but these are yuck despite looking ok when they're delivered. Will not buy any more for a few months.

I normally avoid Ocado fruit as it is generally quite poor quality for the money. I got these as substitutions and they lived up to my previous experiences. No flavour, tough skin, overall not great. Would not recommend this product or any of the ocado fresh fruit. You’re better off getting the M&S equivalent.
First batch were lovely.  Firm, flavourful and sweet. Last week's were squishy, tasteless and very pithy. Won't be buying again for a while.
Old and soft even though still in date on day of purchse. Went mouldy in days
When these are received in good condition they aren’t too bad. They are a good size for kids, easy to peel and the kids really like the taste. I just wish they were more consistent in quality.
It really is pot luck as to what arrives in the net! Some times the clementines are small and difficult to peel. Other times, like todays delivery, they are a great size and taste really good.
Ocado... best not to supply these out of season.
Unclear from the description that these were waxed, and therefore couldn't use them easily for their desired purpose of zesting.
Twice in a row these have done mouldy within a few days. Poor quality.
I order have ordered these on a regular basis for over a year and for the past couple of months they have been very poor. Skin is often tough and old looking and the fruits tasteless.
Normally like these, but the last delivery were covered in white mould within three days..
These turned out to be such nice clementines! Delicious and sweet, although very small sizewise ;-)
Wouldn't recommend.
Not as sweet as spanish ones but decent enough for kids to snack on
quality of the fruit inconsistent. of late, has been dry and difficult to peel. seasonal or source issue?
TOO DIFFICULT FOR ME TO PEEL, AND THEY HAVE BEEN RATHER DRY LATLEY

I love clementines and buy them weekly. These used to be very good, but unfortunately they've been bad for months now. Regularly at least one is off and needs to be thrown away when I receive these, and the remaining fruits are small, pale, pretty dry and sharp-tasting, rather than sweet and juicy like they should be. It would be less annoying if shops labelled clementines correctly (which, in their defence, these are) rather than lumping them with satsumas and mandarins under 'easy peelers', making it very hard to buy actual clementines anymore.
Annoying bought this product the past four weeks, two packs a week. Up to this week they were delicious and pipless. This batch is tasteless and has pips. Inconsistent!
The clementines in my last order were very nice. Much better than in previous orders.
Have had to throw away fruit from the fruit bowl after 2 consecutive deliveries.  Will be avoiding for a while.
These had started to go mouldy within 2 days of getting them
I've not had the same mould issues others experience, beyond one going soft because I'd left it in a damp place without thinking. Perhaps when I order them again I'll notice the fungus.
Tasty but rot too quickly. I've stopped buying them.
The fruit is fine, but this nylon netting gets little bits of red plastic in EVERYTHING when you cut it open.
Didnt try to eat them, skin was caving in on itself. Don't buy
Didnt even get a chance to eat these, they had gone mouldy the day after we received them!
Went mouldy within a day of delivery. Threw them away.

I was hesitant after reading the reviews. But I decided to give it a go anyway. OMG I just had one and it is absolutely DELICIOUS! So crisp, fresh and juicy. The right balance of sweetness. Going to add many packs to next week's trolley:)

I tried giving these another chance, even after reading a lot of bad reviews, but yes they were right  - had two different deliveries now and both times 80% of them were completely dry and inedible. Time to give them a miss ....

When they arrived the skin was still green so left them for a couple of days. When I tried them again three had gone soft and mouldy, the rest had dried out inside so the segments were completely juiceless
After 2 - 3 days they were quite dry, and not very tasty. I wouldn’t buy again.

We order these most weeks. They stay great if you put them in the fridge. I have seen a few posts about going moulds, i keep most fruit in the fridge which extends the life. This does make it harder to peel though but is a consequence of extending their goodness.
these are total waste of money.  don't bother they are half rotten on delivery.
Short shelf life, one was already completely mouldy a day after arriving (may have been mouldy on arrival, I’m not sure). The taste of the rest of the bunch wasn’t great either
Really disappointed by these.
all of the clementine was dry skinned and the taste turned very bad and they are most definitely at least few months old and dead; waste money and give me stomach ache
Ok what’s going on with all the oranges, are we getting fruit that the Spanish won’t buy?
Dry not juicy
The majority of the clementines were greenish in colour and every one tasted watery,  lacked flavour and sweetness. Certainly won’t be wasting my money on them again.
Didn’t look good and when peeled were dry inside and inedible. Very poor quality.
extremely dry and tasetless
Sweet, easy to peel, good flavour. My only complaint is that I can eat the whole bag at one sitting!
Kids love these. Cant get enough.
Looked great, tasted of nothing at all just tasted of water. One went moldy very quickly.
These were disappointing - quite small, thick hard skin for their size and not at all juicy. Didnt seem very fresh.
Only small but peel fine. Mine were juicy and tasty.
Can be subject to seasonal fluctuations but in Oct 2020 these are fantastic.
I don't know if it's the weather but all the citrus fruits at the moment are dry and unpleasant.
It might be the time of year, but these satsumas are very tasty, better than M&S dare I say!
Within a few days, these were dried up inside and inedible.
Dreadful quality, mouldy and very unappetising looking. Would not have even given this product 1 star. Better to spend a bit more and buy the M & S ones - I will in future
Very sweet and juicy not had a dry one.
These were really nice, dont know what is with the bad reviews?!
they are not great in taste.
The texture of the stuffing of your sofa. Dry and flavourless. Just ghastly!
Sometimes very nice, sometimes awful.  Very poor quality control.
Tasted ok but some were quite dry. Not as sweet as others we have had.
Tiny and not particularly juicy.

One of the poorer Ocado branded products. These are easy peelers for the wrong reason - the edible fruit is old and dry so it shrinks and pulls away from the peel it self. The sweetness is also lost. Quite disappointing.

When I unpacked my delivery I noticed that the clementines did not look very fresh and within a few days there were mouldy patches on some and others were turning black so I threw them all away.   Would not order again.
I usually get the boxes which are the best! But these are awful. Do not buy
Awful! Dry, tiny. Don’t waste your money.
Good value but pretty tasteless
Dry, tasteless and loads of pips, don't buy.
Fruit is all dried and shrivelled. Hope Ocado will refund as can’t asked for one via the app during lockdown
We used to love these.... completely changed now and are bruised and dry.  In fact awful.
Though stored appropriately several went mouldy in advance of best before date so those had to be thrown away. Aware of impact of food waste so this was disappointing.
Half of the pack were mouldy within 24 hrs of when they arrived!
5 arrived mouldy and went straight in the bin. Very disappointing

Strange how some are sweet and juicy and
others are dry and tasteless. Some last a week
and others go mouldy after a few days. A month
ago all were good. But will still buy whilst they are not overpriced.
Can’t fault these although a little pricey vs other supermarkets. They peel very easily, no pips and a decent if not outstanding taste
I imagine there can be variation week to week but our pack tasted very nice. They were small but I didn't mind. Good price.
Does not disappoint. Juicy and full of flavour.
Definitely worth trying at this price.  My teenager sent a video from camp just to say how delicious these are. I am ordering them again this week.
Easy to peel, juicy and extremely sweet.  What's not to like?
These are usually, but not always, very tasty. However they have just increased in price by 35%, I really cant see the justification for such an increase from one week to the next.
Looking at the reviews, I guess it's rather hit and miss. I didn't find there was much flavour in these clementines. Unlikely to get again. Shoved the last of them in to the turkey brine!

Ive only had 2 bags so far but they are really lovely & amazing value at £1 each bag.

I ate the whole bag in a day, great flavour and wonderful smell

Find this hit and miss had one good pack and last couple have been quite tasteless and have gone off very quickly. Am now trying other brands

Disappointingly tasteless and also they went mouldy very quickly - it says shelf life 3 days but really for clementines they ought to be able to last for a week or be so tasty that they get eaten very quickly!
did not enjoy these. quite large fruit but skins multi coloured and fruit not very sweet and quite tasteless.
Very pale clementines and sour....almost like they were picked when they were still greenish.
As others have said these are not easy to peel and tasteless. Will not buy again.
These always used to be lovely, but a completely different product arrived recently. Small, hard, bitter- could not eat. Looking at other reviews this seems to be a common theme.
Very pale fruit and absolutely tasteless. Not very juicy either.
Gave 3 chances, every bag I threw away as fruit sour.
Dry, pale and sharp, most inedible will not be buying again.

Bitter and inedible- too late to get a refund.
I like a wide range of clementines, sharp and sweet, however I have found this batch inedible, they taste more like grapefruit and Ive had to throw them out.

Not sweet at all, just extremely sharp and unpleasant. Will not be buying again.
A waste of packaging.
Bought these in October 2019 and found them to be inedible. Under ripe and incredibly sour. Why is so much of Ocados fruit so poor??
They look unripe, almost yellow in colour and lots of marks on the skin, gave them a go but do also taste as bad as they look. Asked for a refund, couldnt eat them

These were really bad. Regret buying them as they were very dry and had no taste. My 16month old daughter just spat them out
really good

Have bought these for years but the quality has gone downhill. Recently much of the fruit has been dry, tasteless and virtually inedible. Im being forced to go to the shops to get my orange fix which defeats the purpose of using a home delivery service.
Love the juicy sweet & tangy taste. Would buy again. I recommend.

I buy these to juice along with organic oranges.  Together they make a beautifully sweet OJ. I appreciate it takes a lot of clementines to make moderate amount of  juice but they really add something special to the usual OJ.  Worth the effort!
I had one on the day they were delivered and they were over ripe, wrinkly and dehydrated with no flavour.
last few bags have started to go off very quickly less than a week and had to go in the bin
Aside from the ease of peeling with no pips, they taste good.

I have tried other kinds and these are actually good value (not great value as they could be cheaper). Its rare to get a sour or rotten one.. so until then or a cheaper kind is made available well repeat the purchase.

I received these as a replacement for some clementines that I ordered. A few were already rotten the next day and almost half were leathery, dry, with no juicy flavour - all I could taste was the bitterness of the pith running throughout each segment, in spite of removing most of this. Will never buy these willingly and will return them if they are ever offered again as a substitute.

Flabby, dry and very little juice in segments
These used to be good but quality now is very poor
Most of the fruit was dry and the rest were very sharp and citric. Very poor quality - we won't be buying these again.

I have never once encountered an easy peeler that said it was an actual easy peeler UNTIL NOW. They are small and tasty, and i didnt get squirted in the eye when peeling them because amazingly, they are as described.
tasteless and dry, regularly buy these but not great this time..
these have been lovely and sweet, juicy, easy peelers as described.  very happy.
These are so fresh, sweet and tasty. 5 star product!
Might just be that it wasn’t the right season for this fruit but the ones I got were pretty tasteless and some positively soft on the outside and dry on the inside... a shame.
these are a regular in my basket always reliable.
mixed quality but ok, some were dried out

These clementines are easy to peel, tasty & juicy. 
I shall continue to buy them.
It is a mixed bag: some clémentines are juicy some are dry and hard. Also the citrus taste is quite faded. I had better.

No seeds. Easy to peel. Juicy.

Juicy, sweet , seedless perhaps a tad sour but perfectly acceptable
These are firm , fragrant , flavoursome and sweet clementines. Easy to peel and a good size. After trying many others, we will be adding these to a regular shop
Just bought these and they are delicious! Not too sour and actually have a taste.

Sweet, juicy and easy to peel.
quite dry
Sweet and not too pithy. Would buy again.
Okay, but I've had much better this season.These were slightly dried out.
very good size all ready to eat and was lovely and sweet tasting would definitely recommend

lovely and sweet, good size too

Tried these because easy peepers were too expensive and out of stock anyway. First bag was nice but second bag had several ones gone rotten before best by date. Ocado need to improve packing practices to put more care into not putting fragile items in the same bag as tins and bottles.
Disappointed when I opened these the day after delivery and had to throw at least 3 out because they were off. Hazards of online booking, I guess!
Nice, probably a seasonal thing
Most of them were either dry or inedible with pips inside. The couple we managed to salvage were ok, quite sweet but for the percentage that were good I won't bother with next time.
Easy enough to peel for the kids but the inside was hit and miss. Some were delicious and juicy and some were tasteless or sour. Would consider trying again as the kids seemed to enjoy them
1st time I've ordered these via online shopping and they were absolutely delicious. very juicy sweet and just lovely. Already have them in my basket for next week
These are quick to peel and the odd bit I have managed to try taste nice and juicy. The kids have hoovered them up so I take it they are a big hit with them!
Easy to peel but has not seen sunshine!

Really juicy and good taste.

terrible

Easy to peel but quite a mild flavour.

I really think it’s pretty bad show Ocado to sell your customers old fruit. Some were loose skinned and dried out, the rest rotten and mushy with green and white yuk. All were inedible.

These are the nicest clementines I've had for a while.  Easy to peel, very little pith, tasty and juicy.  Unfortunately easy peelers are notoriously unreliable and can vary from week to week.  This batch was a definite hit!
Given some to review and they lasted around a week. Tasted good and were easy to peel
Every fruit was on the verge of mould. I ordered two bags and both were ready for the bin. Disappointing and I guess what happens when you depend on a machine to pick and pack.
These were tasty little guys, easy to peel and very juicy, except a couple of them went off a bit quicker than expected.
Pretty nice - some a little sour but mostly good!
Tasted ok to me.
Given free to review, These were nice enough when you eventually peeled them, the peel came off in the tiniest pieces and we just ended up with sticky hands.

Sweet and Indeed easy to peel , however one or two were a bit soft and mouldy

I have been searching for a great easy peeling sweet seasonal tangerine/satsuma/clementine to try getting the kids to try but we all found these tough, not all easy to peel and not all that sweet! Great for popping in my carrot and apple juice in the juicer though!

tasty oranges and easy to peel.  A few were a bit tough but more good than bad.

Tasty, juicy, sweet & delicious and very easy to peel. 1st Class! and good value for money.

The ones i had this week really nice
Stick to the Waitrose ones, quality control on the Ocado clementines is obviously dreadful. Half were mouldy the day before the BBE date. The remaining ones were so bitter I threw them all out.

not bad good taste

Juicy and nice, as easy peelers go.
