these were a staple on my shop every week so much flavour small easy peelers now they are huge so dry no flavour and mouldy, never again i have tried 4 weeks and get the same rubbish.! dont waste your money.

I was given this product to review. I love citrus fruit however, I was disappointed with these ones with thick skin and the fruit itself was dry. Maybe it's due to the fact that it's off season. I'd stick to eating oranges, tangerines etc in the winter when they're naturally grown.

I'm surprised about the reviews saying these were dry and tasteless. Mine were juicy and had a lovely luscious sweetness. I struggle to get my 5 a day and this makes it easy. Also great for packed lunch boxes as they are easy to peel so no problems with pith getting stuck in fingernails!
I could taste a little sweetness in the background but overall it wasnt very nice to eat.

maybe since it says citrus on the label there are a bunch of different varieties supplied under the umbrella of easy peelers and we lucked out.  We kept ours in the fridge as soon as they arrived as per instructions and I'd say they are perfectly ripe - could imagine them going over especially in this heat if you were to stash them in the bowl. Either way fruit never lasts long in our house and these were no exception and were not mushy at all.
Dry, with thick nasty pith
I'm sorry to say everyone had turned to mush - fortunately they were given to me try so I didn't buy - they looked nice though

Found these very dry and tasteless. Ended up throwing them away. Also, although they peeled easily, there was a lot of pith left behind which took a while to get off as I like mine to be pith free before eating.
had to throw half of these, segments were dry and shrivelled.

I found that these had a nice flavour, sweet and juicy. However, although the peel came off relatively easily, it leaves an awful lot of pith which is then quite hard to get off, so I wouldn't paricularly describe them as 'easy-peelers'.

mouldy within 3 days
Lovely as a snack. sweet and juicy
Easy to peel, sweet and juicy, hardly any white stringy bits... everyone in the family loves them. Perfect for lunchboxes, tasty at any time of the day.

Sorry I didn't buy 2! I got 8 delicious fruits in a string bag delivered today for £1.25. Just eaten a couple after lunch, they arrive cool and tempting, and tasted sweet, juicy and refreshingly delicious, and I got my Vitamin C for the day! Perfect! Very easy to peel and no pips.
I thought these were good
Taste of these was fine, but they were tough to peel and not as good as satsumas, which don't seem to be available sadly.

I get these every week and usually theyre great but you do sometimes get a dodgy batch.

Thick skin making them easy to peel which is better when they are fresh. Tasty.

I bought these last week and I ended up throwing them in the bin they were dry and had no flavour, I would not recommend or order them again

Yet another Ocado product that varies so much in quality that you do not really know what you are going to receive.  I know that fresh produce varies throughout the seasons but surely it is Ocado's job to judge whether what they are selling is up to a good standard and not send out low quality stuff.  Their reputation as a company that delivers food unseen rests on this, I think.  I have had some excellent easy peelers recently but today the ones delivered are sour and not at all juicy with very hard pith inside.
Maybe not that easy to peel, but great taste and pretty juicy

Very disappointing, not one from the bag was edible. I'm sure they vary enormously from one batch to the next, but the bag I was sent the fruit were soft when squeezed and the skins already drying. Not the quality I would expect from Ocado.
Had 2 bags recently, they've both contained delicious fruit, looking forward to ordering some more
Labelled 'Citrus'. 8 small ones in the bag. Skins looked dry and felt hard though there was some juice in the tiny segments. More skin and pith than actual fruit.
2 out of 6 were rotten on delivery.

Very poor quality. Dried out despite being well within the best before date. I managed to suck some juice out of one but it did not taste of much. Some were damaged. All but one went in the compost bin.
Small, bitter and nasty. I hate throwing food away but these went straight in the bin. Yuk.
really enjoyed this an it makes a nice healthy on the go lunch!

This is a really lovely vitamin green veg packed soup.  It you want to feel a soup doing you good this is it.  You could easily add extra spinach or watercress if you wanted, or add poached chicken to it or pasta if you wanted to keep the base but make it more chunky.  I love this one and the turmeric lentil split pea.  One of my new favourites!
was nice.....people moaning below are probably the types that struggle to enjoy green veg, ignore them.

Wanted to like this but it honestly tasted horrible. The amount of oil they must have put in it is insane. Smells and tastes so incredibly oily, like slimy liquid. I never leave food but had to throw this away. Would not count on this being healthy either.

Nice flavour tastes like salty greens, which is exactly what it is. I would have preferred it to be blended until smooth. Especially given that it is marketed at the busy executive - with its microwaveable bottle - I could imagine this being a wider preference too. No matter how much water I drank after, I still had kale and spinach in my teeth. Which would be marginally embarrassing at a meeting. One star lost for that.
Thought I wouldn't like this but it's lovely! Great tasting considering no added sugar etc and a quick way to get your daily greens in!
I have this soup hot at least once a week, its so filling and really tastes like leek and potato soup to myself and my partner!
This was really horrible. Threw up after not even having half
Feels super healthy and tastes delicious, even better with a bit of cheese!!!
Maybe my expectations were too high. I won't be bothering with this one again.

Loved this soup and felt very virtuous having it as part of a healthy detox but suddenly realised that it was because it was so salty that I didn't feel the need to add anything extra to give it that extra flavour these "green" soups so often need. Other than that a nice consistency but maybe not as healthy as it initially looks

For me, awesome! Consistency was great, had it cold and on the go. Nice feel-good about what you just ate food. Personally I dont love turmeric - was worried this would carry a strong flavor of it that would linger - couldnt taste it at all! If youre looking for a turmeric flavor, I wouldnt recommend...but if youre after a light, vibrant feel-good soup packed with vitamins - give this a go!
Found this totally inedible

I expected this to be one of those watery insipid, good for you, types of soup.  However it is a delicious warming, clean, green blend with earthy flavours.  Very enjoyable and healthy clean ingredients.    Tastes homemade.
I'm sorry but it tastes like a stagnant swamp
Great product. Very flavoursome
Tastes beautifully homemade for an injection of green goodness
This is a lovely tasting soup. But not a huge amount of kale and spinach. Check ingredients out!
The latest Renourish soup we've tried.  This is even great cold.  My kids and I love it, especially for the health benefits. More flavours please.
I like the Carrot Re Nourish soup but wish was a bit thicker. Not a fan of this flavour but I'm not a kale eater so could be part of the problem but I love spinach. Edible but not enoyable for me!
Really enjoyed this soup...it's HardCore Healthy which I love. A staple in my basket!
Would recommend highly.
I love this soup. Tastes amazing! Perfect healthy lunch on the run!
This was poor in comparison to the pea flavour and carrot flavour soups. Personal opinion but wasnt very nice.
This soup is so tasty and filling. I ate it with one piece of gluten-free bread and am so full! It is full of flavour and packed with goodness.

I have just discovered Renourish soups after being recommended them by a friend. I’ve tried them all and they’ are the tastiest soup range going with a lovely home cooked quality.

My favourite is the Kale, Spinach and Turmeric. The flavours are wonderful.

Was given these to review by Ocado and its a nice way to have. A coffee in afternoon and not worry about too much caffeine in take .
Nice taste and compatible with my nespresso.

I received this from Ocado to review. I gave this to my coffee addict husband and didn't tell him it was half caffeine.  I just said it was a new coffee I was trying out for him.  He said it was very tasty and would have again.  He was surprised when I told him it was half caff as it was not noticeable.  I would buy this again.

I was sent a sample to review by Ocado. The flavour is good and you cannot tell that there is less caffeine. I don’t really see the point of this product. If you have a sensitivity to caffeine it would be better to stick to decaffeinated, It seemed to have the same effect as normal coffee.
Asked to try these. First one didnt work in machine but following ones ok and given a thumbs up for taste. Might buy again if required by visitors.

I was given these to review.I am not normally a fan of de caffeinated  coffee,preferring to drink tea instead in the evening.However I did enjoy the taste of these,not watery at all and still enough caffeine to feel like real coffee.I will definitely be replacing some of my cups of coffee with these,especially later in the day.
Great to have the choice of half caff and it is tasty too. Just a shame the capsules aren't compostable.
Really liked this coffee very smooth and full bodied

Am a fan of CRU Kafe in general as a good alternative to Nespresso. The taste of these half caf is quite nice and not too strong but with a nice kick. Will continue to buy these for post dinner coffee when I want a little kick but not too much to keep me up at night.

I was given this to review and I’m so happy to find this product. I limit my caffeine to 2 coffee a day but with this I can enjoy it more often. It tastes like a normal coffee and a good coffee. It’s smooth not bitter and perfect for me. I add quite a bit of milk because I don’t like strong coffee and it’s perfect.
I was sent these to review. Like the idea of a half caff but found the taste a bit bland.
This coffee is lovely, it tastes great like normal coffee but as it has half the caffeine I can drink it more often, which I love!!

I was given a free sample of these pods to try and then review. I made my usual afternoon latte using my coffee machine and the halfcaf pod and it was really nice. Tasted strong but not bitter and reminded me of Italian coffee. I loved it and will definitely buy again. Thank you Ocado!
I quite enjoyed this coffee. However I prefer Fully decaffeinated coffee which I think has a better flavour. So I don't really see the point in 'half caff'.

I was sent these to review and the taste is really nice.  I must admit I do like my coffee nice and strong - a good caffeine kick.  These were a revelation, did not realise that they are only half the caffeine.  Would I buy these yes nice to have an option like this.
I sent these to review and very glad that I was. Lovely coffee with the bonus of being half caff. Taste just like full caff will definitely buy in the future.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  These make a decent cup of coffee and most imprtantly I couldn’t tell they were half caff.
I was sent these to review. Taste good. And they are recyclable pods which is fantastic.
I was sent these to review. Great tasting coffee and recyclable pods are a plus. Good price too.

Was offered this in exchange for a review from Ocado. I wouldn’t usually consider half caff, but enjoyed the taste. Good price and pleased that these pods can be recycled unlike some other non Nespresso versions. Another plus for me is that they are ethically sourced, slight negative is they don’t produce as much crema when the coffee comes out of the machine.
I was sent this to review, nice coffee.
I was sent these free in exchange for a review.  I’m keen on this brand and enjoyed the flavour but can’t really see the need for a half caffeine product. Decaf of full bodied for me.

I was sent this product free to review. I drink a lot of coffee and often opt for a decaf, which doesn’t quite fit the bill, often charcoaly. So these are a good compromise. Good flavour. Hoping they will make in new pod vertuo as have upgraded nespresso machine

We were sent these in exchange for an honest review. We are regular pod drinkers. These are great when you want the coffee taste but not necessarily as much caffeine, and decaf just won’t do! Sometimes a full dose can make me feel a little nauseous but not with these! Had it black on an empty stomach and no issue. Perhaps a little bitter in taste, but with a little sugar, very nice!  I like them!

Ocado kindly gave me this to try and I’ll definitely buy more.  It’s not too strong, which I like very much, not at all bitter, but smooth too - overall a really good cup of coffee.  I drink it with frothy milk and it’s the best yet, thank you!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. It's great to have a half caff option.
Was sent these to review by Ocado. Nice tasting smooth coffee which I enjoyed. Went through my Nespresso machine well but a lot more of the coffee grounds were left in the machine.

Rich taste and well rounded with no bitterness. Nice to drink in the afternoon for a little hit, but not so much caffeine that it will keep us awake at night. Also good if you're trying to wean down off caffeine for health reasons.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I really like the taste of this coffee, it's easy drinking and not bitter. Strong enough, but not overpowering and if it's half the caffeine, that's a bonus!
As a caffeine reduced coffee this is really nice. It’s kept a lot of depths and flavour unlike other products on the market.

I was sent this product in exchange for an honest review.  The pods work perfectly with a Nespresso machine.  I like the idea of a milder blend and these fit the bill perfectly.  Smooth and mild flavour, ideal for a latte.

Sent these to review and I dont usually stray from Nespresso products 
Smooth and creamy a taste and the half caff works well, good on offer,all pods are quite expensive really

I can confirm that these work very well in a Nespresso machine and these were the first non-official Nespresso pods Ive ever bought so that was a good thing to know but also the coffee itself has a lovely smooth taste which was very enjoyable.

I was sent these free for review. I like a coffee in the afternoon, but don't want to be bouncing off the walls, so I usually go for a decaf. These are a good halfway house and still have a pleasant taste. They also work well in my machine.
These are great for later in the day when you need a bit of caffeine but a full coffee makes you not be able to sleep! Perfect compromise.
Good to have pods with less caffeine.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Nice coffee, not too strong and great that it has less caffeine. No need to worry about being up all night if you fancy one in the evening!
Really nice coffee and I like the idea it as less caffeine in it not bad at all
This coffee is lovely and I really like that it has less caffeine.
Only half the caffeine - so able to enjoy this in the evening.
I love the flavour of these capsules, great quality!
Best ginger drink weve tried, if you like your ginger beer spicy.

Really nice fizzy drink with no additives or E numbers, wouldn’t quite describe it as a typical ginger beer but it’s a lovely flavour and quite fiery, not too sweet and actually tastes of real ginger root. Quite strong, I usually add a dash of fizzy water. Has become a favourite drink of mine,
Absolutely awful, doesnt taste like Ginger Beer or anything that you would willingly drink. One tin opened then discarded, three in the bin.

Cawston Press products have become staples - they are delicious. This is a bit of a miss, though. Apple and Ginger, it's neither one nor the other. It's pleasant enough, but just not ginger beer. Not enough ginger, and the presence of apples is just...odd. I  suspect they would do a good Ginger Beer if only they could side-step the "pressed fruit" requirement....
Doesn't taste like Ginger Beer should probably because of the apples. My boys normally like Ginger beer but not this.
Very little ginger in this drink, better off going for something with a lot more fire in it.
Described as Ginger Beer, when in fact it is sparkling apple juice with a hint of ginger. Old Jamaica ginger beer disappeared to make way for M&S products, very disappointing!

Nit proper finger beer. Very sissapointing selection on Ocado now. It seems sugar free ir over priced 'designer' ginger beers are all that's available. Another thing to add to my list of things I'll have to buy elsewhere.
I love ginger beer but hate the fact it usually has too much sugar in it. This works so well and is super refreshing. Very happy and will definitely order again!

I love ginger beer and frequently used to drink Pret's until I tasted this. I love that there's no added sugar and the balance of apple and ginger is perfect. Cawston Press produce great quality drinks. Definitely recommend this and others in the range.

Nice to have a ginger beer on a fruit juice base rather than using added sugar or artificial sweeteners which taste confected. Ginger and apple is a tried and tested winning relationship and trust me it works in this drink. Utterly delicious with a wedge of lime on a hot day
Tried this for the first time, it's OK, refreshing and tasty.

Tried this for the first time today. Absolutely Wonderful. Ive been buying the Sanpellegrino Ginger Beer, but this is so much nicer, and No Sugar, so thats a bonus, l will continue with this one, and also try their other Flavours. Highly Recommended.
Lovely tasty warm ginger beer and I think they reduced the calories - only 27 / 100ml now, which is much more acceptable. Its up there with fevertree IMHO!

Nice drink with good ginger taste. Apple compliments the flavour well.
Refreshing and not overly fizzy
No artificial rubbish and tastes delicious. What's not to like. I've tried most ginger beers and this one is a winner, so not sure what other reviewers were tasting!?
Tasted like pond water. Not recommended.
Admittedly, not the tastiest ginger beer around, but worried about my husband's health I purchased this as a healthier alternative. He does enjoy it though.

I should have read the product description before buying - I thought this was ginger beer but it's actually pressed apple juice mixed with ginger flavourings.
Don't buy if you want fiery heat (or anything even approximating that), but okay as a refreshing beverage.
This is definitely my favourite ginger beer. It is partly made with apples so not as sickly as other brands. I buy it mainly when it is on offer as £4.99 for six cans is a bit pricey.

I always enjoy a refreshing cold non-alcoholic drink mid evening and this was certainly refreshing.   It had a very good ginger flavour but at the same time it wasn't too overpowering.   Unfortunately rather pricey.

As a ginger beer afficionado, and a devotee of Cawston Press Rhubarb & Appple drink I ordered this enthusiastically.  Sadly, I didn't stop to consider that Cawston is an apple brand, so I tried the first can with apprehension.  Yes, it is gingery, but the combination with apple doesn't work for me.  Sorry to disagree with earlier enthusiastic reviewer!

This. This here is the tastiest Ginger Beer on the planet. I am now forever cursed by this luxurious drink. It is pricey, but it's admittedly worth the cost. I don't know what makes this one so perfect, but all of the others I've tried are tasteless by comparison. Perhaps it's the addition of apple that makes this so good? I think it might be. And when it says "fiery" on this one, it actually means it! This leaves me with a gorgeous after-bite of spicy ginger. Words cannot describe. If only it came bottled - preferably 2L. Please!
It is a shame that there is High Fructose Corn Syrup.
A superb product,smooth,luxury tasting and the best i have had,Recommended to all.

Would leave 6 stars if I could! I'm so happy to be able to order there online! I am from Canada and miss Caesars! Perfect with tabasco sauce, celery salt, lemon wedge, worcestershire sauce and a celery stick!
During lockdown Ive been experimenting with my mixology and being a big Bloody Mary fan, Clamato definitely makes better fuller flavoured Bloody Marys.

A fave ingredient in Mexican cooking, just love and am happy to pay a premium for it! Don’t read the label expecting nutrition, but a little bit make very tasty Bloody Mary’s, Micheladas, Ceviches/Cockteles.
Bit of a treat but tastes lovely
very good taste sadly this time it was leaking but always a very tasty drink on a warm sunny morning
You can make the greatest cocktail in the world with this. Buy these, make Caesars and add mclures dill pickles.
Mmmmmm. Add vodka, Tabasco, Worcestershire sauce & lime. Perfection.

I'm sad to hear there is so little actual tomato juice ... But tomatoes are mostly water anyway! This is the key ingredient to the perfect Caesar. Not your daily tomato juice but mix it up and it will impress.

I thought Clamato was tomato juice with clam juice.  This stuff was mostly water, with lots of added sugar, salt, citric acid and an artificial food colouring called Allure Red that carried an EU warning message. 10% tomato juice.
Easy, convenient protein source, mine have always been good quality
Just awful, had Moy Park before and wasn't keen but everything else was out of stock so I tried again. Horrible, slimy, gristle ridden lumps... makes me shudder to think of. Avoid at all costs
First time I’ve bought Moy Park and will be my last the packet was full of small bits and only a few slices of chicken waste of money. Nothing like in the picture

As this BBQ chicken was on offer I decided to purchase two cartons of it, I assumed it would be like the Ocado and M&S brands but alas it was far from it. The quality is simply not these it was a packet of slimy. rubbery and salty chicken that turned me green looking at the rubbery BBQ gelatine like glaze they put on it.

Needless to say, I was not impressed and I will not be buying this chicken again I will stick to better quality in future.
These are cheaper because the meat is cheaper. You get what you pay for with chicken it seems. This was mostly gristle, robbery nastiness and I left half of it.
Value wise its ok when on offer. Chicken is ok, small and a little wet sometimes. But tastes ok and ideal for sandwiches
Tasted ok but a bit slimy and lots of small pieces. Only get if on offer
Terrible. A slimy agglomeration of small and larger chicken bits mixed with gelatinous brown lumps that really dont taste nice or feel right (what are they?) Really cant say anything good about it.
Not for me but my son loves it. It can be a bit wet sometimes which is why its 4 stars not 5.
These chicken pieces were quite nice but mainly consisted of bits and shreds rather than reasonable sized pieces of chicken.

What's not to like - good quality chicken breast pieces in a nice bbq marinade. A significant step up from meat slices for sandwiches. I feel it loses 1 star due to it being a little pricey - if it was offered at 2 for £5 with similar products, it would be great value.

I have ordered these two or three times, and they were delicious to start off with.   I don't know why, but the last lot I bought were very wet and unpleasant to eat, so I threw them away.   Before this last lot I would have given a good review but now I can see why they are on offer at a very good reduced price, but I still wouldn't buy them.
Not sure I would like this with a salad (unlike chargrilled chicken) but my daughter really likes the flavour of this in wraps or sandwiches for her packed lunches at secondary school.
Lots of flavour, not too wet or dry & filling too.
My husband loves this, with a salad or tossed with rice and vegetables
I thought I'd try this as it was on offer in a flash sale. I found it had very little bbq flavour (no smokiness) and seemed over sweet. The chicken was also wet which was very unpleasant.
Plenty of chicken here and nice big slices. Good flavour and ideal in wraps and salads.
I bought this for my boyfriends lunches, the chicken was moist, flavourful and tender. Would buy again, especially at half price.
Bought this at half price, good quality, nice barbecue flavour. Lovely with salad and cream cheese on a bagel
I usually buy Waitrose brand one, but I thought I give this a go. and it was good! not overly flavoured, very tender, and good amount for the price. definitely buy this again.
I used to get this on a Friday and the dates would be good for all the following weeks packed lunches. This weeks had Mondays date on so not great and had to freeze. Disappointing.
pleased with everything about this product
These were as expected and perfect in a salad
The BBQ chicken is sweet and tender and its great on pizza or in pasta yum!

I bought these on a flash sale for a great price. I have salad most days for lunch at work and the chicken is ideal to add to it. It has a really lovely bbq flavour to it and is so tasty. You could put it in sandwiches and warm it up in stir fries the possibilities are endless. A very handy snack pack and lovely. Already on order again.

Great value, really tasty, a perfect lunch as theyre low calorie and full of protein. A staple for me, I buy 6-8 packs per week. Please continue to bring the regular offers on these that make them such great value.

Bought to chuck in a stir fry and was nice enough, but in the packet it was a tad slimy and unappealing 
Would buy again on offer

Don't understand the negative reviews for this. I find it extremely tasty and I have it in salad twice a week. I am dieting and for the whole packet it is less than 250 calories and has 41 grams of protein.
I would say try it and make up your own mind.
It's okay but not particularly exciting. The quality of the meat and size of the slices is fine but to me there was little flavour to speak of.
No slices, not even tiny ones. Just all bits as if someone had scraped clean the slicing machine. Straight in the bin!! Won't allow me to give no stars.
not worth the calories
Bought on a flash sale and saw good reviews - massively disappointed. I eat everything and really hate food waste but this went in the bin

I buy this product almost every time I shop because it's so versatile and consistently good. Tasty chicken in a lovely marinade which keeps well. I use it on top of homemade pizzas, on cheesy nachos with jalapenos and just by itself.
Tried this when on offer but have purchased it each week since. Nice flavour and good sized pieces of chicken. Makes a tasty sandwich filling and also good on homemade pizzas.
I'm reviewing this as I got a free sample from Ocado. My children both really like this squash, so much so I have just purchased my second bottle. Tasty sugar free squash.

I was given a bottle for free to try, and to review. The taste was nice but too artificial for me. Might be worth trying to see for personal preferance.It has a nice refreshing taste a bit sweet but the artificial aftertaste was a but too much for me
a delicious taste of childhood!
My son's favourite
Best squash I ve tried , extremely sweet with a zesty orange flavor. Recommend for anyone with sweet-tooth. Plus is almost zero calories
Received this as a free gift and my son loves it, just bought a new bottle to keep us stocked up!
I was sent this to review. I really love the nice fresh fruity taste and it’s low sugar too.

I received this free from ocado.
Nice and fruity and good for children as n a s and multivitamins included.
Would recommend this product.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  This is just like the ready mixed capri sun drinks. Fairly fruity, and just the right sweetness. If you like capri suns, you should try it.

I was sent this prodct by Ocado to review. We don't really have fruit drinks in our household so this was a nice treat to try. Quite liked the taste and it's good that this product contains no added sugar as it's much healthier that way. I also like that it has no artificial colourings, flavourings or preservatives. If you are looking for a healthier choice of squashes on the market. This may be the product for you.

I am reviewing this product as I received a free sample from Ocado to try. I was not a fan, as it tasted artificial to me, however my husband loved it and went through the bottle very quickly. So it is a gamble if you will love it or not so much.

I got this free to try from ocado. Its was yummy! I personally always buy ribena and nothing else. However I will add this again our shopping.
Kids love it, although it's tastes nothing like their regular juice pouches. I actually think it's better than what you get in the pouches.

I am reviewing this product because I got sent a sample from Ocado. This squash tastes like the the ready made version of Capri Sun which comes in a pouch. I find it ok but slightly artificial tasting, like the flavour of an orange flavour ice lolly rather than a juicy orange piece of fruit. It tastes a bit like a juice made from powder. I like the added vitamins but I don't think I'd buy this again. Personally I prefer a hi-juice type cordial which tastes more juicy, more tangy, more refreshing and less artificial but I imagine that lots of kids would probably like this Capri Sun one.

I received as a free gift from Ocado. My son loved it as wasn't sour as other orange squashes. 
No added sugar is bonus. We would buy it again.
We loved this cordial, it was full of flavour and so different to other orange cordials. It's a must buy!!!
I am reviewing this as I received a free sample from Ocado to try.  The taste is familiar and I like that it has added multivitamins
super refreshing
Tastes like Capri Sun!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. So happy I was sent this to review. It has such a lovely refreshing original capri sun flavour, works really well with sparkling water as well as still. Added to my regulars.
Too sweet for my taste but my son loves it,so 4 stars
I was given this to review.  I enjoyed it and so did my grandson as its not too sweet.  It doesnt taste artificial and I like it so much Ive just reordered it.
Tastes like capri sun but needs quite a lot of the cordial. Glad to not have to mess about with fiddly straws!
Daughter likes this and weve got through the bottle quite quickly- noticeable that its not as concentrated as other brands.

We drink a lot of Robinsons squash here, this was a nice change from that, it has that familiar tangy Capri Sun flavour.
Its a shame that its not a double strength concentrate like many other squashes on the market for environmental reasons, but I havent marked it down for that.
Its pretty good!
I was given this by Ocado to review. I found it very fruity and refreshing. Quite sweet, but with no added sugar. I would definitely recommend.

I was given this by Ocado to review. I drink a lot of orange squash and like a lot of people, having found one I like I have tended to stick with it. However, this is lovely and is something I would buy again. It is exactly like the Capri Sun I used to buy years ago in the pouches but stopped as I didnt like the waste, I would love to see this in bigger bottles.
Exactly same as Capri Sun, bit pricey compared to Robinsons only down side but does taste better
Really nice flavour, just like Capri sun! Be careful using it in clear water bottles as the vitamin residue does stain light coloured plastic.
Lovely squash, all the family enjoyed it. It's slightly sweeter, more like tangerine, which is probably why the kids enjoyed it so much!
I got this free to review - a big hit with all the family. Would repurchase!

I was given this to try by Ocado. I’ll be honest this is bot something I would have even looked at by myself if not offered it however, we tried it instead of our usual drink and it is exceptional. My boys love it and has quickly become a firm favourite in our house. Highly recommended.
Received this as free gift. My teenagers love it and a quarter of it has gone on first day.
Received this free, it makes a very refreshing tasty drink, particularly nice mixed with sparkling water. I would not usually have chosen it, but having now tasted it, I would purchase again.
It really does! We received this as a sample and I wasnt sure if it would taste the same. It does and its a perfect thirst quencher after my morning run.
Love this. Its vegan and the only sulphite free squash that is sugar free! This flavour also doesnt contain acesulfame k ! Literally only squash we can drink, glad its now at Ocado
I was dubious as to whether this would actually taste like the originalbut Im pleased to say it does!!!!

I used to drink Capri-suns growing up but dont like all. The waste and storage of individual drink cartons. I love Capri-sun made squash. It tastes great and has lots of added vitamins. I have it with sparkling water so its a nice fizzy orange.
Got a free sample to try , will give them to my elderly mum who loves tea and if she is getting extra vitamin c at same time it’s a bonus
Great for a health boost and tasted good, no complaints.

I am reviewing this product, because I received a free sample from Ocado. I don’t think the added vitamin C makes any difference health-wise and taste-wise. I am not blown away by this product. Just rather standard tea.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Taste like normal black tea with the added benefit of having a health boost, great if you drink a lot of tea.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Good and healthy traditional tea, perfect with biscuits for an afternoon tasty break.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
First of all, I was pleased to find that the taste seemed exactly the same as standard PG Tips so for people who want or need the added health benefits with the familiar taste will love this.  For me, the added cost outweighs the benefits as I feel I could get the same benefits from a good quality multi vitamin and there is no way to tell whether it is having any impact on my health.  I love the fact that PG tips have made an effort to be environmentally sound by removing all plastics from the teabags and using plant based biodegradable packaging, I hope others will follow suit.  This only loses stars for me due to the price.

I am reviewing this product, having been sent a free sample from Ocado.

These tea pyramids are basically PG tips tea with added vitamin C. I am not in a position to compare the two types of PG tips tea because I do not drink this particular brand. I enjoy several mugs of black tea every day, but my tea is made from loose tea leaves and needs to stew for 5 minutes. There is no question that the PG tips tea is more convenient, because it is nice, dark and strong and ready to drink after less than half a minute. But I really cannot see the point of taking vitamin C with a cup of tea, when oranges or vitamin pills are available anywhere, and there are other products with added vitamin C.
This tasted different to my usual tea but I found it pleasant enough. I do find it quite expensive though. Would recommend overall!

This is part of a new range of health and welfare boosting teas recently launched by PG Tips. The range includes 'Immunity' - this one; 'Metabolism'; and 'Caffeine' plus. First off, they're very expensive, considering I can buy a box of over 250 PG Tips for just over £3. So these are aimed at a small niche, a very driven health conscious/high performance individual that needs to perhaps stay alert for longer, whilst maintaining peak mind, body and spirit performance, who also happen to love builders' tea ...above anything else. ...Like I said, a niche market. The box is small - a good size for the workplace. Apart from that not much more can be said, except that the flavour is no different to that of normal builders' tea. I was sent this to write my own honest opinion about the product. I don't mince my words. Hope you found it useful.

Was given this to review from Ocado.  It has a peculiar taste to me.  It's not my cup of tea as I can distinctly taste something that is not to my liking and doesn't taste well in the natural tea taste.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Very pleasant typical PG Tips tea flavour, with no discernible impact on taste from the added Vitamin C. This is what they claim, and would certainly seem to be the case.
To their credit, PG Tips tea bags are fully bio-degradable and do not contain plastic, unlike most of their competitors, and this is a significant fact which is now highlighted on the pack, and should certainly influence customers. Also the tea itself is certified as sustainably sourced, which looks like another plus.
All in all, a satisfying cuppa, with the reassurance of a more environmentally responsible product, and some potential health benefits from the added Vitamin C.
I’m reviewing this as I had a free sample from Ocado. Good flavour and strength but much more expensive than normal teabags. We will not be swapping in our house.
Received free from Ocado to review. Nice enough tea but tastes no different to normal tea and I would not pay the extra price.

I'm reviewing this product because I received a free sample from Ocado. But I really can't see who this is aimed at or who would want to pay 5x the price (vs Ocado prices for normal PGTips) for this product. Each cup/mug of tea contains as much VitC as approx a sixth to a third of an orange. So not would be regarded as a theraputic dose. Health junkies won't be keen as it doesn't tell us what form of VitC is used (the chemical composition can vary with varying benefits/downsides). So scepticism aside, I tried to drink this with an open mind. As others have said, the addition of the vitamin doesn't taint the tea in any way - it tastes like normal tea. For me, it's too bland, but certainly not unpleasant.

I'm reviewing this product because I received a free sample from Ocado. A nice cuppa and I may consider buying ordinary PG next time I buy teabags but not this product @ 5x price of non fortified tea.

Received from Ocado to try and review. Cannot tell the difference between these and regular PG tips? 
I noticed these were considerably more expensive than regular PG tips, but I wouldn’t pay extra for vitamin c in my tea bag.... I also prefer Twinings tea so I probably wouldn’t buy these anyway. 

The 3 stars here are actually for the bag itself. I’m Australian and our tea bags always have tags on them. I hate that that’s not the case here in the UK, so the fact that these have tags is a win!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  Don’t seem any different to normal PG Tips.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  To me, this just tastes like normal PG Tips.  However, with the added Vit C it's good for your immunity, and they are fully biodegradable.
Was sent this product by Ocado to review, didn't like the taste, but I am not a fan of any PG tea, I much prefer Yorkshire Gold, but if you like PG tea this might be your cup of tea!

I received this as a free sample to review. I was skeptical that the vitamin C might taint the tea, but it doesn't, you can't taste it. The tea has a nice strong flavour, really good and all the packaging is recyclable.
I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I love PG tips in general. These tea bags come with added Vitamin C. Quite a strong black tea and very refreshing. Would purchase.
I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Pretty good for PG Tips. Nice strong tea.
Once you try apple and ginger, you wont go back to boring old apple ok maybe the pink lady one.
Good balance of ginger and apple and love the thickness. Just have to tip upside down each time and shake well. Add water occ if want quick drink and extra ginger occ if want the extra punch.

Really enjoy the flavour of this juice - it is very refreshing and has just the right amount of ginger. My one issue with this product is even with regular shaking, I seem to end up with extremely thick sediment at the bottom of the carton. It does lead to wastage which is quite disappointing.
As the title says, neither the apple not the ginger tasted right.  So unpleasant we threw it away.
I was looking forward to this as I really like both flavours but it just didn't work for me. It tasted a bit weak and could have done with more of a ginger kick.
I love this although I could do with added extra ginger, it has a good kick - refreshing and always order this
This is very gingery and perfect when warmed....
a bit too much ginger for my taste, in danger of overpowering the apple

When I make the effort to get the juicer out, use it and clean it, I absolutely love melon and ginger - a whole melon plus a thumb of fresh ginger.  This apple and ginger juice tastes just like freshly made, with a real kick of fresh ginger.  

It's brilliant on its own, as a mixer with vodka, and really good in mulled cider.
Very ginger-y but I like it like that.
Not a patch on Waitrose version
Good value, decent everyday coffee. Partner drinks this during the week and fancier stuff at the weekend and says its nice enough for quick, weekday drinking from the one-cup dripper.
Very nice strong coffee is now a regular in my basket
My boyfriend was asking me what brand this was after trying it. Unfortunately for him he doesnt use Ocado. Has a great flavour when made with my aeropress.
I love this ground coffee, it has a deep, rich flavour and always hits the spot first thing in the morning.
Lovely coffee. Great taste. Not bitter. A great everytime, everyday drink
Nice taste for a budget coffee
I stopped drinking coffee years ago (it smells good whilst brewing though), however the family love this one, and complain if it is out of stock.
I like the coffee, the price is good, BUT... if only 30% of the coffee in the bag is rainforest alliance certified then why are they allowed to display the certified badge on the packaging???

On purchasing this coffee and reading the small print under the Rainforest Alliance badge, it became clean that Ocado are flaunting the RA logo on the packaging.
'Minimum 30% certified coffee'. Meaning that up to 70% had been farmed unethical. An typical example of this being where the rainforest and the wildlife within it has been burned to clear space for intensive unsustainable methods of farming.
Ordering the second time.
Thin and a little acidic. The French version has more taste.
Given this to review (Thanks Ocado!) Im more of a tea drinker but do like the occasional coffee and this was lovely. Reasonably priced too. Would recommend
Not as punchy or flavoursome as I hoped. If you're thinking of buying as an alternative to Waitrose Rich Italian Blend, don't bother -- you'll be disappointed... It's a bit thin and light.
We received this for free in exchange for a review. This coffee was really tasty, nice deep and smooth flavour. Nothing particularly special, but for the price its a great everyday coffee.
Really good Italian coffee at a fair price. Much prefer buying coffee this way. Rich, dark and smooth without being too strong.

This is a low-priced coffee and it tastes it. It has a nice enough aroma when brewing, but in the mouth it has the typical burnt taste of low-quality underripe beans that have been over-roasted to bring out what little flavour they have.
Nice enough coffee and quite good value but not particularly special
I was sent this for review and overall found it a pleasant tasting coffee. It's a mild coffee, but had a well rounded flavour. I would buy this again.
Tasty and very keenly priced, this is fine value for money.
Lovely smell and according to my husband excellent coffee!

Sent this to review.
Its a pretty good cafetière coffee for the price.
Good taste and strength.
Just made this blend up using my French press. Really good flavor not overly Smokey, but not weak. Very drinkable.
Was surprised by how yummy this was. It is great value and tasted gorgeous. Well worth a try!
Really lovely coffee - nice and strong but not too much. We normally buy a popular coffee but this was lovely. Really great value too. Would buy again.
i don't drink coffee often, so this was a fab weekend treat we enjoyed. For an own brand I was pleasantly surprised. Intense flavour so suits those who like a strong brew.

One of Ocados five varieties of filter coffee.
Found it full bodied with a rich  dark chocolate flavour. Probably stronger than my usual choice so  I used slightly less than the suggested amount.

Could you add a decaf to your current five varieties?
Good coffee at a good price. Better than some branded coffee. Fresh taste and lovely aroma. Not too strong. Not too thin.

I was sent this to review and found it to be a well flavoured coffee.  The taste is not as complex as the coffee I normally buy but there is no bitter aftertaste and it is well priced.  I would certainly buy it.

I don't drink Italian blend so I passed this to someone who does & several tried it at a coffee morning. They generally agreed it's worth buying.  There's no bitterness nor after- taste & it was enjoyed but they consider  it to be more a good all rounder  as opposed to the quality & depth of flavour of a 'vintage' Italian blend which of course is more expensive.
I usually buy expensive brands as per my experience they usually taste better, but thought Ill give this one a try. Was very surprised how flavoursome it is and will definitely buy again.
I had this for my first coffee this morning. Lovely aroma when I opened the packet. Tastes good too.
Average coffee, nondescript flavour.  Well priced against the competition but would rather pay a little more for something a little more distinctive.
Good all-round coffee. Good value, nice tasting everyday coffee for your morning caffeine hit!
I was pleasantly surprised by this coffee. Its very pleasant and not too bitter. In addition its competitively priced
Given the price of this coffee its surprisingly good.
Good everyday, reasonably priced coffee . Happy to order this regularly.
I was sent this to review, it has a nice aroma and the taste is rich enough, not bitter or too strong when brewed in our cafetière.  I would order this again.
Perfectly good ground coffee, decent flavour. Would re-purchase.
Slightly more bitter than the usual coffee I buy but less noticeable after a couple of mouthfuls. I would purchase again as reasonably priced.
Lovely tasty coffee and a good price, will buy again
Reasonable ground coffee at a reasonable price. It's fine, nothing exciting, but perfectly drinkable
Good coffee for drip filters, not too strong but good aromatics. Good choice if you like a medium strong blend, can be drunk easily without milk.
It made nice smooth and coffee perfect to kick off the morning. Keeping some in the freezer to keep it nice and fresh.
My husband enjoyed this as he likes a full flavoured coffee. It was rather bitter for my palette, but even so it had a rounded flavour. Good for making cappucino.

Was sent this to review and as husband is the true coffee lover in the family he was given the first cup for comments!   Great aroma on opening packet, dark but smooth flavour and not too strong for first early morning cup.  I think that is a thumbs up!

I use coffee bags and love a strong coffee without bitterness which is very had to find unless you pay a fortune. Well got this to try and was not so happy about getting the cafetiere out of  storage but it was worth it as the coffee prepared following instruction  was perfect strong no bitter burnt taste and a fabulous aroma. I even drank it cold which I have found can be a deal breaker for coffee with me and this coffee was still really good. Think I've just found my new summer blend
I bought this as my regular coffee was not available.  It is good and strong and makes an enjoyable cup of coffee. I will get it again.
Strong flavour which I like, but a slightly bitter aftertaste. Great value for money.
This was ok but it did have a slightly bitter aftertaste. Smelt great while it was brewing but whilst it is good value, it doesnt taste as nice as brands such as Lavazza.

Received this to review - usually I buy a medium blend so was interested to try something a little stronger. 
This has a lovely aroma with a strong dark taste. Using my coffee plunger I noticed a slightly bitter after taste however using the Gaggia it makes a delicious Latte and Cinnamon topped Cappuccino. Competitively priced this is a definite buy.
Smooth, full bodied coffee, made a nice cup of coffee

When I first opened the packet, the aroma coming out was promising. It brewed quickly and tasted as good as other brands. 

The coffee was nicely dark and strong.
I prefer this to my usual coffee and will buy again. Found it the prefect strength and flavour. Swapping to this one. Better value too! I did not find it too bitter.

Received this to review, and was interested to try it as I usually buy either French or Java coffee. The aroma was good and I enjoyed the coffee, although it wasnt as smooth as my usual brands - slightly bitter. But I would probably buy it again, and the price is very reasonable.
Great value, great taste, delicious coffee. Rich but not too rich.
Not a big coffee drinker. Tasted similar to the more expensive brands at lower price. Maybe serve to the non connoisseur?

The packaging isn't great and the sticky tape pointless after a few times.  It would be improved by the metal type fold over top.

The taste was pleasant though.

I normally buy the Ocado French blend for my husband, who is the ground-coffee  drinker in our house.
He found the Italian blend slightly bitter, so wouldnt choose it over the French.
However this whole range is great value for money.
Lovely aroma and perfect strength and flavour
This coffee is good value for the price but not as smooth as others which are a bit more expensive
I was sent this to review and had high hopes as it smelled really good. Once brewed, the result was somewhat disappointing as it was smooth but lacking depth of flavour. I wouldnt switch to it.
Smells and tastes lovely. Great all round, good value coffee.
Smells good, tastes good and price reasonable. What's not too like?
Tastes good, even flavour
Have been used to Lavazza and tried this as it was out of stock. Not great, rather bitter. Lavazza is smoother.
decent coffee, slightly bitter notes, good flavour
Good value, nice flavour.
Perfectly decent coffee, nothing special. I'm probably a philistine but I enjoyed dunking a biscuit in this.
Smooth flavour, good quality at a good price. Use in French press, was happy with results and would buy again.
Good coffee, great flavour and a very good price.
Received some of this to review.  Really enjoyed it and will probably buy it again at some point as it is cheaper than my usual brand.
Great everyday coffee. Fab price - as good as leading brands
Good enough but I still prefer bean to cup coffee.
I really enjoyed this Ocado coffee. It was rich and complex in it's flavours and intensity, but did not leave a lingering taste in your mouth. Smooth all the way through!
Good coffee. Good price.

It was OK. It won't make me switch from the brand I usually buy - which unfortunately isn't stocked by Ocado!
We are big coffee drinkers in this household and we like the really good stuff - holding with the opinion that it's worth paying more for a really nice cup of coffee and all the better when you can have one at home.
This was drinkable but was a bit like the stuff you'd by at a service station, rather than the kind with which you sit down at the breakfast table and say "mmmm"...so I guess it depends on what you want from your coffee really!

Sorry, Ocado, but I found this completely undrinkable. It may be a good value option, but I found it very bitter and lacking in any real taste. I usually buy fairtrade coffee and though this is apparently 'Rainforest Alliance Certified' it wouldn't convince me to buy it again.
This is great quality at a good price point. Space saving packaging also good. Would purchase again.
Makes a decent cup of coffee, easy to drink and quite dark and rich. Missing the depth of flavour found with more premium brands but good for an everyday affordable coffee.
Good flavour.  Not such a rich flavour as more premium brands but tastes good and very affordable price.
I'm not a coffee connoisseur, but this is nice. Hubby liked it as well. Nice mid morning cuppa. Not sure it would satisfy the espresso fan
yummy coffee at a great price.
Great price and has a good strong flavour which has been enjoyed by the family including a fussy coffee drinker.  Good package and worth the buy.
Lovely nice taste!
This is not as dark as some of the gourmet coffees that are twice the price, but it is a great everyday coffee, and perfect for breakfast drinks!

I was sent this as a free sample and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. I wasn't expecting to like it as much as my usual brand, and I didn't. However this is very nice coffee and almost half the price of my usual brand so for a perfect balance of quality and price it gets 5 stars

I was pleasantly surprised, I was expecting this coffee to taste worse than it actually does because of a low price.  It's not the best I had, but I did like it and I would buy it again.  
The only criticism I have, is that it's not grounded finely enough.
This coffee has a richness and character more akin to much more expensive products... without the price.

The coffee is quite roughly ground so it works well in my Areopress coffee maker.
The is a good value product  that tastes well
..you don't get the depth and aroma that you'd want from a coffee. it's not catastrophic, just rather thin andi uninspiring compared to a similar roast of Percol or CafeDirect
This is an espresso roast and blend yet it is not ground finely for use in an espresso machine. Once I  ground it more finely it was ok but results not a good as Ocado Beans.

Sorry, but this wasn't very nice. I had high hopes when I first saw it, but it has an unpleasant sour/acidy taste. For lovers of strong coffee, Lavazza Rossa and Zoega Forza is a much better choice, and only slightly more expensive.
Normally buy Waitrose ground coffee but tried this for a change and as it was cheaper. I would happily buy this again.

We'd got fed up Yorkshire Tea over the past year as the blend seemed to have changed and had a bitter aftertaste. With too much time in lockdown, we decided to blind taste some  different teas. This is one currently one of our favourites good strength and body, without a bitter aftertaste.
Try as we may these teabags are a waste of time. weak tasteless and an awful colour
Not sure why bad reviews. We love this tea!
I’ve tried making a dozen teas now from this box and each one has tea leaves floating all around, they do not stay in the tea bag. Horrible .
Not overly impressed with M&S products so far. These teabags are just bland and tasteless. Even with two to a cup the only flavour is bitterness. Shall be sticking with Twinings in future.
Saved me hours cooking from scratch. Its very pricey but the best in the business, definitely will buy again.

I was given this as a free sample and was a little unsure as what to do with it. In the end I made some soup which tasted amazing and it was definitely not down to my great soup making skills. The this broth is so delicious.

I was given this free of charge to review by Ocado. 
It was a nicely favoured stock used in a risotto but I wouldn't pay full price for it.
Tried this stock in my chicken curry and was very impressed! Greater depth of flavour, thicker sauce with a richer colour. Curry tasted so much better than normal.

I had high hopes for this given the price. Perhaps its because I usually make my own but I found this lacked the flavour of a homemade broth. It was also very thin and watery and not like a proper bone broth which should be gelatinous.
I buy this occasionally (usually when it's on offer) when I need really good chicken stock and I don't have any home-made in the freezer (e.g. for use in a simple risotto)
I received this as a free gift from Ocaco.  The depth of flavour was just lovely & beautifully balanced flavour, but at that price I could never justify buying it.
My regular buy but now I purchase elsewhere unless on offer. I can buy this 75p cheaper online, not sure how Ocado can justify this price.

I was lucky enough to receive this as a free gift. I chopped chicken breast fillets, 1 bag of soffritto mix, peeled and chopped a couple of potatoes, frozen peas and added the bone broth with water. Cooked slow and thickened at the end and it tasted absolutely lovely. The flavour was intense without being overpowering. Thank you Borough Broth and thank you Ocado
Used this in a chicken pie and it was delicious. Lovely flavour and it made a super sauce. Worth the money and will buy again.
I was given this to review.  It made a good stock, but I think there are equally good alternatives for significantly less money.

I got this stock as a freebie and used to make soup. It was delicious. The only downside is that the stock is really expensive, so although I would buy again it will only be to make a meal for a special occasion

This was sent as a freebie. 
Very tasty but very expensive - a real treat but not a regular purchase.
Got sent this as a freebie and added it to gravy. It made the best roast my family had ever had. So tasty. I will definitely buy this again as a treat as the price is a bit high to buy regularly.

This was a free product to review and we used it in risotto instead of our usual stock.  It made a definite difference and we really enjoyed it, unfortunately the price means that it is too pricey to buy regularly, although I would really like to
was given a freebie. used in a risotto, absolutely delicious. really lovely.

Free gift to review.  This is a quality product,  I can imagine it being a very comforting pick me up for anyone feeling a bit under the weather.  Best use would be as a booster stock.  The stumbling block for me is the price,  which I would be reluctant to pay, hence four stars.
Got this as a free gift, although very good it's too expensive.

Really tasty smooth stock - heated up as feeling unwell. Would say I definitely felt a little better for a little while after drinking this, but it's a bit too expensive to keep buying which is a shame.

This is delicious, and a great drink to have for a snack. However it's just too expensive for me to justify purchasing unfortunately (it's only one cupful!). Would definitely buy again if it was a but cheaper.

This stock is absolutely beautiful and tasty. I would love to have it again however .the price.
Hence this being four stars not five
Received this as a free gift from Ocado it is a game changer no more boiling chicken bones for me, Another one in my basket worth every penny.

I received this as a seemingly random free gift from Ocado. I used it with onion, chestnut mushrooms and milk, in place of stock, to make mushroom soup. The result was delicious and also felt very healthy.
Great flovour making a chicken risotto, easy and convenient, if you want quality then the price reflects the product
Had this with some small pasta and it was delicious. Perfect for when youre feeling under the weather. Only downside is that its very expensive.
Really good quality bone broth. Not very strong in flavour - so lost a point for me. But still very good, and Id buy again.

Expensive, but worth it. Absolutely delicious and so simple to heat up. From the fridge, the broth is somewhat gelatinous, but it quickly becomes a completely smooth clear golden liquid once heated. I put it in homemade soups, add to rice dishes and noodle bowls, or just drink it hot from a mug. Excellent nourishment, especially when you're unwell and can't eat much. I find that one pouch is enough for two people when used as a hot drink. You don't need a large serving to feel the benefits.
A little on the expensive side but it's quite nice does have a vinegary taste which is odd as I'm not sure why it's in it unless to preserve.

This is very tasty broth it has lots of flavour.  You can drink it straight up out of the packet or make it a base for home-made soup. I could taste the difference in my homemade soup using this, it was very tasty.  Can be frozen also gluten free.
Really impressed. I don't have to do my own now and I use it to cook my rice or Quinoa. I like the fact I don't have to make my own anymore.
Very vinegary.
Full of flavour, and much more substance than some other broths.  There's clearly a lot of bone in it - it comes out of the packet as a thick jelly.  A lunchtime treat for my work flask
This is perfect for me.. tastes great and good on keto. Bit pricy but there always seems to be offers on! So stock up!
Best bone broth out there - as a drink or as a base for all manner of things. Nuff said x

I have just started buying broths and. bought them all. This is the tastiest in my opinion, not too thick or thin. It is not a jelly at fridge temperature. 

Its not cheap in fact its expensive but is clearly a quality product
I use a lot of this chicken broth.  I would like it tobe more gelatinous but otherwise it is good.

I usually buy a chicken and make my own stock but didn’t have time recently so bought this the first time. The taste was okay. However, a small amount of stock with that price tag is hardly justified. That’s the price of a free range small chicken which can make good quality stock and have the meat too! Not again.

This is simply the best, I find, when making stews, the depth of flavour delicious.
Brilliant product

Amazing organic chicken bone broth, absolutely full of flavour! After using for the first time recently as part of a special gravy recipe to go with roast Duck at Christmas which went down a treat, we have since used in a chicken stew which was also super tasty.

I've been buying this broth for while and generally like it a lot. It had a lot of collagen and seemed to be made well. However, in the last few deliveries the broth appeared to be very watery and not like it was before, with no collagen in sight. This could be a dodgy batch - where is the quality control then, change of the recipe or a cost cutting measure. Whatever it is, if it continues I am not going to be buying this broth ever again. The broth is not cheap by any standards, but at this quality it is simply a blatant rip-off. I am going to review my comment in a few weeks time and if the quality not going to improve, then mark it accordingly.
Perfect base to build a lovely Thai broth around!

There was hardly any liquid left in the soup pouch when I unpacked the carrier bag. The rather smelly contents were all over the rest of the shopping, the hall carpet and the kitchen floor. Suggest that more robust packaging is needed as it appears  I'm not the first person to complain about this. An expensive mistake (unfortunately that has become a theme for Ocado of late)

...and emptied the entire pack of stock all over everything else in the same carrier bag, which is a shame as I was looking forward to using it in a Pho recipe, so now it will have to be a stock cube instead.  Wasn’t helped by whoever packed the groceries putting the stock package flat at the bottom of the carrier and dumping a whole load of heavy other stuff on top!!

Normally make my own Botha, but decided to try this as it was on offer. Total waste of money & had very little chicken flavour. For the price & previous reviews- was expecting something special. A knorr chicken pot has more flavour & so much cheaper.

I've used this in gravy and lentil soups. I find my best way to use it is to add to miso broth type noodle dishes for an extra health boost.  I use protein noodles, lots of garlic & ginger, lime juice, fresh mint & coriander, edamame, carrots and usually top with tofu or gyoza's.  It is a high price point so naturally prefer when it's on offer but you do get what you pay for.
Flavourful but a bit pricey so I tend to only buy when I don't feel like making my own broth.
I use this in all sorts of dishes...lentil soups, gravy, etc. Delicious.

I use the whole package to make soup for two. I heat it up adding about carton of water and a little salt. I then finely cut raw celery, dill and parsley which I do not cook but add straight into the bowl with cooked carrots and either vermicelli or pasta, occasionally add little of chicken meat as well. It makes a delicious meal.
This is gorgeous! I sauteed some mushrooms, added the broth and a huge portion of kale and simmered it down, served with spring onions and avocado. It was a great soup style dish and very filling

Hard to find a decent ready made broth out there, not anymore! As someone gently leaning closer to not eating meat this product has become quite dear to me. Chopped spring onions, coriander and some rice noodles if I want a bit of extra substance. Wonderfully easy and simple and fairly ascetic in comparison to my erstwhile gluttony ridden consumer lifestyle. Many thanks!

Its a pleasant and thin broth providing two cups per sachet although for the price (which I think is too high) it should be in a glass bottle! Very soothing to the gut lining. Provides around one gram collagen per cup. Makes good base for casseroles. It has no thickeners ie, refined flours such as corn/ starch derivatives.
Well seasoned, perhaps overpowering black pepper. More roast chicken flavour than bone broth. Doesn't taste bad, but preferred the taste of Ossa  or Truefoods- please stock these again!
Beautifully made. Wonderful flavour. Gorgeous viscosity. Perfect.  I highly recommend keeping a few pouches in the fridge for making slow cooked soups.
The broth is great to aid recovery after illness. Yes you can cook it yourself but if you dont have the energy then its a great option to have
Very good addition to any soup or sauce.  Delicious.

I use the whole carton to make soup for one person.  I heat it up alone adding about half the carton of water and a little salt. I then finely cut raw celery, dill and parsley which I do not cook but add straight into the bowl with cooked carrots and either vermicelli or rice. It makes a delicious meal.
This new version costs just as much, but it now in cheaper packaging you cannot reseal. Not a good change on Boroughs part.
I used this in a chicken noodle soup and It tasted delicious.
I preferred the beef broth, as it was nice and peppery. This is pleasant to drink but doubt I would buy again.
First time Ive tried bone both. Used in a butternut squash soup. Tasted and smelt odd - like a weird chlorine flavour. I like the idea but sadly not for me.

I tried this.
Loved it! 
Tried others but this is certainly the best.
Super tasty heated up and with a little extra salt.
As soon I warmed this bone broth I was taken back to my childhood and the smell of my grandmother cooking chicken soup for me. Delicious taste and silky texture. great stuff
I was feeling pretty terrible with flu and this broth - just heated up really make me feel 100% better. Its magic!!
The best shop bought chicken bone broth! Tasty enough to drink it plain
Adds so much flavour to soup and makes it super healthy. And its organic too. Im glad I have this option to buy as I find making my own stock a lot of hassle.
We have been trying out all the organic bone broths. This is the best. However almost worth making my own again at this price.
This bone broth is full of flavour and is really tasty drunk hot. I'm sure it would be a wonderful stock, but as we usually drink it, it's never lasted that long to try it out!
Of all the bone broth I have tried, this is by far my favourite. It tastes delicious and I actually drink it cold! I bet it would be good warmed up too

Full of flavour and tastes great. Ive tried a few others Ocado stock and found them to be tasteless, not this. Yes its expensive and thats my only gripe. Ive been thinking of using this instead of water the next time I cook rice, Im sure it will impart a lovely flavour to the rice.

A decent bone broth and a bit jellified after refrigeration which means its the real deal. But as with all bone broths it is an acquired taste (or smell)... my husband thought the drains had started to smell but it was my hot cup of broth.
Delicious clear broth! I love it!
Had to talk myself into trying this, but so glad that I did.  Simply delicious. Just wish that it was a little cheaper, but I understand that this quality comes at a price!

This is excellent bone broth. It is expensive, however. 10 hour simmered bone broth was recommended to me for health reasons. Sometimes I dont have time to make my own and was thrilled when I tried this product. It tastes great. Please keep it on.
Great tasting, nutritious and perfect base for sauces and soups.  Best broth I've tried.
far too pricey for a very small satchel.
I really want to like this as its organic and fresh. But theyve added sooo much pepper in it.
This makes a gorgeous stock for chicken korma or casserole. Love that its organic, free-range & 40% chicken bones. Lost one star because its too expensive. Only buy on sale.
Wonderful broth.   The best.  Would love a larger pack.
I put mine in a mug and it tasted delicious  - really impressed.

I've tried two others and 1 was nasty,the other was tolerable. This one actually tastes nice, and suffering from a heavy cold, I started to feel better a couple of hours after drinking this. Coincidence...? 
And the ingredients list is all good stuff. Keep up the good work!

I have been buying this product for about 2 years so I'm not sure if I received a bad batch or they've changed the formula. It was so salty I could not finish the pouch. Absolutely disgusting and inedible.

A friend of mine kindly recommended it when we were all fighting a nasty cold. Its so warming and delicious and genuinely made us feel better! A bit too peppery for the toddler but even she had a second helping!

Im impressed with this bone broth.  It is thick and jelly like and has loads of flavour.  I use it as stock and it really adds a lovely flavour to bolognese and soups.  Its expensive. But, the quality is superb.

I absolutely love these broths. You can use them as a stock in a dish but to be honest I just heat and drink them, maybe adding some ginger or miso. 
The real deal.
Real stock will purchase this on a regular basis
Lovely flavour.

I love this bone broth. I also buy the Beef Bone Broth as well. Its grass fed which is important for those watching what they ingest. Lots of collegen. Tiny amount of carb which is important on my ketogenic way of eating. This Chicken Bone Broth and the Beef Bone Broth from this company is my MAIN meal every single day.  Please keep this brand going!

This product is the real deal - at fridge temperature the whole thing is a jelly consistency which means its full of collagen, unlike a lot of other watery ones on the market. Yes its expensive but it is fresh, organic and well packaged.
But a fantastic base for slow cooked stews. I'll probably end up going back to my usual brand though as just cannot justify the price sadly, even when it's on special offer!
Great to use as a base for a potato and kale broth and included in a korma curry using TasteSmith korma curry kit. Fantastic

I have to say I was very disappointed with this product - My usual preference was out of stock so I thought I'd give this a go after reading the great reviews. It is very expensive for such a small bag & I personally found it to be very bland - To me, it barely tasted of chicken & more of a vegetable stock. I may have had a bad batch but sadly I won't be re-purchasing - was a waste of money.
This is certainly hearty. If you are looking for a broth to use as a base, Daylesford might be a better option.

I received this gratis to try before leaving a review.  It tasted great (I drank it straight as a tonic!) with a good, balanced flavour.  I would readily use again as a gravy base or stock for risotto, etc., but there are cheaper out there which taste just as good.  Didnt like the packaging as its not recyclable in my neck of the woods.  Overall, good, but would struggle to justify the premium cost.  You could, if youre so inclined, buy a whole chicken for the same price and have all the meat as a bonus!
Made soup noodles with this, added some veg and its delicious

Was given this to review, so a plus point there that I didn't have to pay more than a fiver for it. I tried a little on its own before adding to my recipe and it tasted slightly beefy and a bit salty. Used as a stock base for onion gravy with sausage and mash. Very good, but way too expensive. For a good chicken stock I prefer Waitrose own, although Tesco finest range is excellent.
very good taste. but too expensive for such small amount.
this is nice, a good flavour, and great if you're really counting calories. we liked it as part of a Thai curry, but as a simple broth, which is what it is, this really is quite overpriced.

I heated this up and drank it. It was honestly one of the most delicious drinks that has ever passed my lips. I savoured every sip and I am someone who likes everything to be very flavourful. Yummy and good for me. Brilliant.
Not rich in flavour, seems quite diluted and overpriced. 3 stars for organic ingredients but stingy due to dilution
Saved me during food poisoning, great taste and quality. I will keep buying it.
Great ingredients, tastes good - I drink it heated up and slightly diluted from a cup

So delicious. It has so much flavour. Definitely he best bone broth I have had and Ive tried loads (including homemade). Shame its so pricey, as I would buy much more of it if it was a tiny bit more reasonable.
I have tried all the bone broths stocked at Ocado I think and have not liked any of them for various reasons. Until now - this stuff is fabulous.
Delicious and healthy. Freezes well
Used to make my own but have drastically cut down on meat so dont have the bones any more. This is a great substitution.
Brilliant, convenient and full of flavour. Freezes well. Made a great organic chicken soup with it.
Weekly buy in our household. Always fresh and lovely orange yolk.
The chickens are ok but the farmer wants to add more grit to their diet . the shell's are very weak
Very nice and great size. Used for brownies! Came out marvellous
These were very nice eggs indeed!  Will be buying again.
really nice
I WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED WHEN I OPENED THE BOX. THE EGGS WERE NOT BIG AT ALL, THEY WERE MORE LIKE MEDIUM.
Good quality, tasty eggs. I usually buy Clarence Court, but they were out of stock. Pleased to have given these a try: they hold up very well to the pricier brands.
These eggs are very fragile. Even a slight knock and the shell breaks. Boiling them, the shells cracked and what was left was tasteless and watery. Won't buy again, back to my trusted brands.
I must admit I brought these expecting them to be just slightly smaller than an ostrich egg but sadly they're only slightly larger than a medium egg. Nice enough though.

I’ve ordered this product a few times.  Flavour is excellent but unfortunately, the egg shells seem to be getting weaker.  My last delivery had 4 broken eggs & I’ve noticed that, after cracking an egg to cook, the shell just disintegrates & ends up in the hot pan.  Not nice picking out shell before serving.  Even worse if you miss a bit & end up with shell in your mouth.  Yuk!
There was blood in 5 of the 6 eggs.  Could not eat.
would not buy again

Nothing special. Didnt find the lovely rich yolks others had and they were not big either. 
But watery. Shant buy again. Will go back to my normal brand.
First class eggs and good size too.
Love the fact that I can support local farmers whilst doing an online shop. I have no issues with these eggs.
there is spotted blood in many of eggs.
Pale yellow yolks, not big. Overpriced - save your money!!
These eggs are great. They're tasty and fresh, and every now and again the entire box is filled with double-yolkers. Really good!
Only eggs I have had double yolks! many times. Lovely orange yolks! forgot what eggs should taste like ? Thanks Wales
Watery, whites fell to bits when poached.  Will not be buying these again!
Bought this for baking, so can't comment on taste.  These are large eggs and great for baking.  Cakes came out well.
Very disappointed with these eggs.  Very thin shell and the eggs were watery.  Not sure what the hens are fed on, but I felt they were more like battery eggs quality.
Previously been okay although whites a little thin. This weeks were quite small, so not as advertised.  Think I'll stick to CC in future.
Very good, large eggs; good shelf-life.
Tasty old fashioned eggs
These are delicious eggs.  Good size for just about everything.  The quality is in the taste and they are so fresh.  Will be buying these from now on.
have been buying these for months - , find them delicious

Big rich eggs and seem very fresh. I order them every week but have had several broken ones.Ocado must be fed up with me asking for a refund.The box section is too small for the egg. Shopping packers seem to like to put the box at the bottom of the shopping bag!
Cheap eggs which are large and free range- great value!
Really happy with these eggs.. Good size and fresh
Lovely fresh eggs.....I switched to them a year ago....very happy!
Tasteless and pale
Having had really disappointing Blacktail free range lately, I tried these for a change. Plump, yellow and tasty. No complaints:)

Bought for the first time and the whites were very watery, they didn't have much flavour and to top it all one of them was rotten despite being well within the use-by date. Made the mistake of breaking it straight into the pan - believe me, the smell of cooked rotten egg is much worse.  Appreciate this might be a one-off but will not be buying them again.

Watery, and yolks almost always broke. Might be okay for baking, but no good at all for frying for my breakfast.
Really disappointed, as I'd like to support small Welsh farmers, but I've brought three boxes & they've all been no good.

Started buying these a while ago after becoming concerned at the ever increasing levels of filth on the Clarence Court eggs. These are just as tasty, have just as rich yokes, and are usually either quite or very large. We have had no pale yokes or watery whites like some others report, just consistently fresh delicious eggs.
Good-quality eggs and yes, they certainly are large - allow nearly six minutes for a soft-boiled egg.
being welsh I ordered these egg very disappointed very watery even with 2weeks to best sell by date

Lovely eggs, keep well and are tasty.  Great price too - I just wish Ocado could work out how to deliver 6 eggs unbroken as it hasn't happened yet with any brand.  If you can get them to deliver these eggs intact then they are very nice eggs.
Watery albumen and very pale yellow yolks. Meant to keep for 3 weeks, but will need to use in a few days. Very disappointing after reading the good reviews.
