Best eggs, especially for poaching.  No need for vinegar!

I have been buying these eggs for quite a few weeks now, and will not go back to my usual brand. These are superb eggs, agree totally with the other reviewer they are wonderful. If you have not tried these eggs please do so you will enjoy them as much as we do and they are Free Range.
Wonderful eggs
I have this with sparkling water, tap water or with rum. or with rum and freeze into a slushie. Wish it wasn't the most artificial fake green colour, but I can live with that.
I find this flavour delicious.  it's probably love or hate thing. Great diluted in water or tonic or in a Mojito.

Looks like dish soap, taste like dish soap

HORRIBLE
its far too minty with very little lime taste.
Unpleasant flavour
Smells like toothpaste, tastes like toothpaste, erm not quite what we had hoped for

Add this to Bacardi, soda water and ice and you have a decent mojito without the fuss. The only problem is it's very easy to add too much to the glass which will ruin the drink. Meaning you have to add more booze...

I use it in a Cocktail or Mocktail and everyone loves it!
Cocktail: Syrup, water, fresh mint, ice cubes & bacardi
Mocktail: Syrup, water, fresh mint, ice cubes

No as sweet as other similar product from other brands. But you must love mint and lime otherwise you will not like it. I have been giving it to drink to  many of 
my friends and they are always asking me what product I used, big hit!

If not served with a good lemonade and ice cold it can taste close to mouth wash. 
Schweppes and Ice and its great!

Disappointed with the mojito syrup. I was expecting it to be lemony and minty but the flavours are very weak, its just extremely sweet. 
Much happier with mint leaves and a couple of wedges of lemon in my water

If you want a non alcoholic drink thats not the standard Diet Coke or orange juice and lemonade, this with sparkling water, a wedge of lime and some fresh mint leaves does the job. If you do want alcohol, then a shot of Bacardi is perfect.
Just a small amount mixed with sparkling water over ice is the most refreshing drink ever! Has really helped me not reach for anything alcoholic as I enjoy drinking this so much.
A very nice and refreshing non alcoholic mojito its nice alone just mixed with water, found that if mixed with lemonade as recommended on other reviews it can be quite sweet

I cannot compare this to the alcoholic drink as I have never had alcohol.However this tastes like a nice lemonade combined with very strong mint.
I love love mint so was surprised in thinking maybe too much mint flavour.
At first tasted a bit like mouthwash.
Also flavours taste a little chemical.
Very sweet with potent mint,good value for money as only a tiny amount needed for a huge jug.
I am getting increasingly addicted to this drink.
I cautiously recommend.different.
Amazing with sparkling water.... can almost pretend its a mojito!

I think I remember trying this last year and enjoying the flavour, but haven't yet been able to get it again this year as it's constantly out of stock! Why are we able to add this to our baskets but when it comes to delivery day it is always missing and substituted with another flavour? Soon the season to enjoy this will be over.....
I've ordered this 3 times now, even delaying my last order to suit when this was "in stock" and have been massively disappointed when it is not delivered. Sort it out Ocado!

As I need to drive a lot, this is my favourite soft drink.
It has been out of stock for MONTHS! Please bring it back...
This has been out of stock for ages - just when weather is nice enough to enjoy a lovely ice cold glass.
please can this be brought back into stock.....
Love Love Love - can't rate it highly enough. So sad it's been out of stock for ages now. C'mon Ocado sort it out!!

Judging from the other reviews this seems a bit of a Marmite product.  Personally I find it refreshing, with the lime, mint and sweetness well balanced.  It's sharp and refreshing as a soft drink-- just add ice and water, stir it well and it really hits the spot.
faciliates in making a great mojito
Bought, tasted, straight into the bin...
Virgin or alcoholic Mojito, this is the best syrup I've tried! Add fresh mint, limes and sparkling water - perfect! Add rum for full on version. Best taste ever.

I bought this as the Five Valleys mint and lemon - preferable -  was no longer available. I tried this with just sparkling water but was too sweet - even diluting a small measure. So, I bought some fresh limes and that did the trick! Just squeeze a third of a lime into a small measure of cordial, top up with sparkling water and ice cubes and drop in the squeezed piece of lime and some crushed fresh mint.  An almost perfect mock mojito and a good sweet/sharp refreshing non-alcoholic kick if trying to cut down on wine! Would recommend to friend if they follow my method...!
I was really keen on trying this as I'm pregnant and have been craving my Friday Mojito very badly. Unfortunately this tastes awful. Like Listerine.
I love this diluted well with sparkling water in an evening. It's a delicious alternative to having an alcoholic drink. I would say I probably make it at half the recommended strength.
This is so unfortunate as I love the other varieties of this product. The taste is rather more minty then I was expecting and I can barely taste the lime. Such a shame.

Having enjoyed mojitos in the US recently I hoped the Teisseire mojito syrup might be a good non-alcoholic alternative.  But it tastes overpoweringly of minty toothpaste. Really disappointing.  I love some of their other syrups but not this one.

i love all of these syrups,except the low sugar ones which are a bit sickly, but this is the best yet. It's brilliant as a cool drink with water or lemonade and it makes a really good fake Mohito with Bacardi and some soda.

Add water or lemonade, ice and mint...(in a frozen glass of course!)and it's a great drink to pretend you are partaking in cocktails! 
Or freeze with lemonade for a refreshing ice lolly!
Great French syrup you can pour in water for a non alcoholic quenching thirst or in a natural yoghurt for extra flavour! Merci Ocado!
Lovely light sponge with lashings of fruit topping. A favourite here!

This is cheap, and our expectations were tempered accordingly. But it was surprisingly lovely. Soft steamed sponge with a richly fruity cherry sauce, this was yummy with some lovely posh custard on a freezing January evening.
Really soft fluffy sponge with the juiciest cherry and blueberry topping. This was superb with hot custard on a cold wintry night.
We absolutely loved these puddings.The sponge so soft and spongy and there was plenty of fruit on top .Not to big in size just enough .Also not to sweet .Loved them .Definitely recommend
So tasty - and lower calorie than similar puds!
Far too sweet than I expected.
The use by date on these is considerably less than other similar puddings. Beware it can be less than whats published on the page!

With the weather turning cold what could be a nicer treat than a warm sponge pudding. This surpassed our expectations. So fruity & much nicer than any of the others, topped with a spoonful of thick M&S creme fraiche. Delicious!
A lovely light sponge with a nice helping of a tasty fruit topping
Very nice, light sponge with loads of fruit. Sour cherries - yum....great with custard.
Bought in error, thought I had ordered Sticky Toffee Puddings. Good pudding with some icecream, just not the hubbies favourite
Palm oil should not be in this pudding
Bought these as they were on offer. I’m my God , they are absolutely gorgeous!! Lovely light sponge with plenty of tasty fruity topping. Well done M&S

Have been making steamed puddings for many, many
years but these are so good it really insn't worth all
the effort and cost to make them.  Highly recommended.
delicious tasting SP, quality ingredients ,best I have tested

Really pleased we tried these. Nice light sponge and plenty of fruity sauce. Also not too naughty for a treat dessert. We dont microwave, but these cook nicely in 20 minutes in the oven while mains is going down. Being able to cook from frozen is an added bonus.

Love these mini puds. Cook in a minute in the microwave and you have a lovely, as if just baked pudding. Lots of morello cherry and juice. Turned upside down and served on a plate look amazing. Great with icecream, custard or yoghurt
I was pleasantly surprised by this little dessert. It’s light and fluffy with a fantastic fruity compote, great with custard or cream. And all ready in seconds.
These were so quick to heat up and tasted lovely. Light sponge and real tasting fruit layer. Great with custard

I’m so pleased I bought these to try,.  Just 1 minute in the microwave and then ready to be turn into bowl and served with double cream.   I enjoyed it so much I was tempted to eat the other one.  The balance of fruit vs sponge is about right.   Really yummy
Good texture for sponge and fruit filling was delicious.
Finally got round to ordering these - and its a 10 from me.  Wow 50 secs in the microwave and they sure do hit the sweet spot when you need it - delicious!

These sponge puddings are light and covered with a rich fruity cherry and blueberry topping, so it ticks all of the boxes - indulgent comfort food that I can pretend is healthy  -D

Recommend
Not too sweet and yummy tartness from the fruit. Very moreish. So good with custard.
This was sweet & tangy but not too sweet. I loved it but hubby doesnt like blueberries or cherries - he wanted to eat the cake and leave the fruit :)
very nice with ice cream
These are one of M&S good offerings. Delicious with Ambrosia custard.
Fairly nice plain sponge. With bland tasteless fruit.

Lovely flavour. Great standby. I am the only one in my household who enjoys hot pudding and custard.
I had discovered the little snap pots of custard then these little beauties, as they are individual and can be frozen, they are ideal. Bonus both these and the custard pots are microwaveable meaning a delicious bowl of comfort is just minutes away whenever I want to indulge.
more Sause would be good but that's me being greedy!
Light sponge, succulent fruit, this is a taste sensation.
These little pots are delicious, not too sweet, light sponge and whole morello cherry and blueberry topping.  Great with custard, cream or for even more indulgence a touch of maple syrup!
These puddings are my favourite from the M&S range.  Nice light sponge and gorgeous cherry / blueberry topping, with a dollop of custard you can't go wrong!
Normally these little pudding pots are quite average, but this one I would definitely recommend for a little pudding snack.
Light sponge and nicely tart fruity top. Lovely treat.
so nice to write a good review....very poor in general m&s foods size and value

Wow these puddings are delicious I am not a fan of blueberries but it didn't matter with these.Lovely light golden sponge with a lovely morello cherry layer,only negative thing is they are addictive !
I bought this dessert and am buying it again. It tastes like homemade, absolutely delicious!!!
These are quite nice. Sweet sponge but some sourness from the cherry makes it really pleasant. I'll buy again. (and i'm not a fan of pre-made cakes in general)

Super soft and light sponge with gorgeous cherry compote with lovely cherries. the sponge practically metled in your mouth - delicious! had with a scoop of icecream and felt super indulgent, but not too naughty, to finish off a mid week dinner. Will be buying again.
Oh these are good!!
I'd rather buy plain tofu and season it myself.

I do buy tofu and usually the plain version. Some can be difficult to work with as they fall apart easily. This has a good firm texture. The smokiness of this version added depth to the flavour. 
Will defo buy again
Love the extra flavour that the smokiness adds brilliant in a Thai curry
It's firm and great to cook with

This isn't as good as some of the other marinated or smoked tofu I usually buy. Mild smoky smell, but not that much taste, you need to work hard to add some more flavour. Texture isn't as firm as I'd hoped either. I'll go back to my usual brand.
I love this. The smoky flavour adds something extra. This brand of tofu is a little different - its firmer and holds together without disintegrating.
I really love the taste and texture of this Smoked Tofu, it goes very well with a salad and if you sauce the Tofu up with flavour.
This is a great smoked tofu - the taste is so delicious, it is one of the tofus I can eat raw and enjoy. Great company with great products!
I am new to tofu and thought the reviews were good but I think it may be an acquired taste as I wasn't all that keen. The smoky taste was a bit too strong for me.
If you are not a fan of tofu, start here. The smoky flavour is spot on, ideal in sandwiches or as a sausage roll filler! Would hugely recommend this tofu!
This is delicious. Just adds so much flavour to dishes. Nice and firm too. The best of their range by far
This is the easiest tofu to cook with. The smoked flavour is delicious but does not over power other flavours you cook with. It's in my basket every week. Fab!
Its a really nice taste, esp when fried and mixed w couscous and veg
I used to think tofu was kind of grim but this is delicious

I was sent this product free to review.  The texture is very good straight from the packet and remained good after a stir fry.  I would repurchase but would go for the non smoked version as I wasn’t too keen on the smoked flavour even though I usually love smoked foods.

I'm reviewing this because I got a free sample from Ocado. I don't normally eat much tofu or smokey flavoured foods, but I enjoyed this very much. It's very convenient to have around – easy to use, suitable plain or in other dishes, cooked or cold. The smoky flavour is enough so that I liked it on its own, straight from the fridge. But it isn't overpowering, so it can still be used in other hot or cold dishes. If it was on sale, I'd try it again. If I ate tofu more, I'd make it a regular.
Theyre pretty expensive compared the normal pack but the smokey flavour makes it worth it
Loved this tofu, Really nice texture and a lovely flavour. Would definitely buy again :)

I received this smoked tofu from Ocado to review and I’m very happy to say it was delicious. It will be something I would definitely buy on a regular basis. I eat vegetarian and often eat tofu, but normally it’s the plain one. Then I add my own flavourings, generally Asian or some kind of curry, and sometimes liquidised to make a dip with flavourings. This smoked tofu from The Tofoo company is lovely - it’s a mild natural tasting smoked flavour, which is like you’ve smoked it yourself over a wood fire. I’ve sometimes had smoked flavour food that was so artificial tasting, I didn’t like it. So for this smoked tofu, I tried a small piece on its own and the texture and flavour is good enough for me to enjoy just like that in a sandwich maybe, or with salad. Then I fried some in slices, and that was great too. I would recommend this to anyone who likes healthy food and wants to cut down on meat, particularly cured meats and pork products. It’s very versatile and would be nice with olives, hummus and crackers or any Italian Mezze foods. I was very impressed because I love natural gentle flavours, but it may be too gentle for some.
Love the smokey flavour. Great to have spare tofu in the fridge for the end of the week. Easy to cook with and tasty.

Love this Tofu! It’s firm and has a lovely smoky flavour- just the right amount for me. Size can be a little inconsistent but I believe it’s hand cut so this probably explains it. They have some great recipes on their website too. Would be great if they could find a non-plastic vacuum pack.

Very tasty, I like smokey flavours and didn't find it too strong. Although cooking it seems to reduce the smokiness a little. Very versatile, a good option to try from other brands. I was sent this to review and will buy again.
Yummy when sliced thinly and baked on a baking tray then served on a Linda McCartney sausage sarnie with lashings of brown sauce!

Thanks Ocado for the chance to test this out. I love the smoked flavour and the fact you don't need to press or drain it. It makes great strips in fajitas and I'd love to try in a stir fry too. It's a bit more expensive so I' rather buy it on special or as a special treat but at least it is worthy of being a special treat.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample fromOcado. This is my favourite tofu, I buy it pretty much every week - it's pretty firm, and is great both stir-fried as it is, and baked with marinade. It has a nice bite to it as it's so firm straight from the pack, which is hard to find from most other tofu brands. Back in the day, we had to press tofu for hours in order to get it this firm! The naked one is great too, but I love the smoked one as it's so tasty, it makes dinner so much quicker being able to just cube it and cook it.
Used this in a stir fry with lots of flavour and this held its own very nicely. Great texture and appearance.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

We eat tofu regularly but hadnt tried this one before.

We first tried it cold and thinly sliced straight out of the pack and really didnt enjoy the smokey flavour and texture. However diced, tossed in a little oil and then a blend of cornflour and sweet smokey paprika and baked in the oven it was delicious.

Dragonfly marinated is my favourite Tofu, its less firm & more greasy than this (yep 11% & 7%). I was happy to have less oil. This is firmer, more chewy. That has cumin, this is smoked. Its all good. Get the Tofu you want, Tofu is brilliant, try them all.
I'm a big lover of tofu and have tried many brands, this by far is my favourite. It's not overly wet so doesn't need pressing, fries, bakes and freezes well or delicious just as it is.

I get through about two packets a week. Its great to slice & fry, crumbled in chilli or mixed with turmeric & seasoning to make tofu scramble. I also cube it to start a stir fry or a curry. 

Very firm, absolutely no slimeyness to it whatsoever. No need to pre press.
Smoked tofu, Its not for me. I thought it was horrible, overpowering smoked taste. Im glad I only bought one packet. Im not a tofu fan I guess.
Can be eatten straight out of the packet on its own. Low salt nice too.

Truly the most revolting tofu I've every tasted - the smokiness is SO strong - wonder if its been smoked incorrectly? Strange bitter, burnt taste. Virtually inedible, after 2 mouthfuls I couldn't eat the rest. Not just me, the rest of the family felt the same.
Cooked on a high heat, until its a bit crispy, this is lovely. Great fit stir fry, in Miso soup or even Chinese pancakes.
I love this so much. I put it in almost everything. Delicious.
Lovely smoky taste. Delicious with mushrooms. (And nicer than the teriyaki flavoured tofu - buy this instead!)
Smoked tofu, Its not for me. I thought it was horrible, overpowering smoked taste. Im glad I only bought one packet. Im not a tofu fan I guess.
Can be eatten straight out of the packet on its own. Low salt nice too.

Truly the most revolting tofu I've every tasted - the smokiness is SO strong - wonder if its been smoked incorrectly? Strange bitter, burnt taste. Virtually inedible, after 2 mouthfuls I couldn't eat the rest. Not just me, the rest of the family felt the same.
Cooked on a high heat, until its a bit crispy, this is lovely. Great fit stir fry, in Miso soup or even Chinese pancakes.
I love this so much. I put it in almost everything. Delicious.
Lovely smoky taste. Delicious with mushrooms. (And nicer than the teriyaki flavoured tofu - buy this instead!)
Really great versatile tofu with a distinctive smoky flavor. Works well with lots of foods but our favorite is on vege skewers with a satay dipping sauce.

I've been buying this weekly and it was always great before. However in about 3 weeks ago I started to notice it became less firmer, I thought it was that batch but similar ones came in last week as well. 

I think it's might be a way to cut cost (less firm means less beans used in per product).

Been using tofu for a while and usually love it.
This was so awful that it was inedible in the curry we made. It had a horrible rubbery aftertaste.  Will stick to our usual brand. Bought two boxes think will bin the one left.
Perfect on a sandwich with some houmous, leaves and sriracha- a staple sandwich filler for me now

This is the best tofu on the market but Ocado for some reason have decided that they no longer want to stock the excellent varieties that tofoo offer i.e the wholemeal chunkies and southern style bites!! BRING THESE BACK OCADO!!!!!!!
Really amazing when you cut it in cubes and put it in the air fryer!
This will convert tofu haters. Its delicious and the texture is smooth. I eat it by itself without cooking it

I’ve tried tofu so many times over the years in the hopes of liking it and always found the texture to be nasty and it to be very bland, until now! This stuff is great! The texture and flavour are lovely, my favourite is to at it to ramen with broth and loads of veg.

I love everything from the Tofoo Company! But this one is one of my favourites (I prefer tempeh, but for Tofu this is the best one). It's got a very strong smokey flavour, which I love as plain tofu can be a bit bland!

I love this - you can use it straight out of the packet, and with its smoky flavour it's delicious just diced straight into a salad. The texture is fantastic, and the flavour is great - not overpowered by the smoke.
This really is firm and a great texture. No pressing required.

I love Tofoo anyway, and when the plain one was out of stock I went for this. I remain unconvinced... it really is ever so smoky, and strong, so sort of drowned out the other flavours of my dish. 
I personally prefer the original but the actual Tofoo in any flavour is fab - it stays whole, goes nice and crispy and not mushy in the pan!
Amazing flavour and love that it's seasoned too, which most tofu isn't! Super firm and really versatile.

No squeezing or fuss,  simply slice up and use.  Slice thinly  and grill on toast, throw it into stirfrys  or cut into chunks and use it instead of chicken with black beans in a spicy black  bean  stew.  We've fed non-vegetarians and they all loved the stew, served on black rice, without realising there was  no chicken in it!
This is really the only Tofu that I enjoy cooking
Great flavour in comparison to bog standard tofu. Add this to Satay stir fries and such. Bit more interesting than the normal one you can buy. Firm texture, cuts easily, adds great flavour to a dish.
Really pleased with this tofu. I use a lot of plain tofu in cooking but don't enjoy eating it raw/cold. However this tofu is delicious straight from the packet, especially good on good crackers.
This is really nice and very usable in lots of ways.

First time buying this one and am very impressed. So easy to fry up and has a lovely smoked flavour - just right as not overly smoky but still with a good flavour. Keeps well after opening (it advises putting it in another container covered with water). Nice and firm too. Will happily buy this one again and try others from this brand.
had this last night with egg fried rice - good flavour but not overpowering and it stayed intact. highly recommend. also a fan of the other Tofoo Ocado sells
A good substitute for meat in stir-frys and other dishes.  Really like the smokey flavour and have used it as substitute for bacon in a  ragu recipe which works really well.

I usually buy regular, non-flavoured tofu and thought I would give this a try for a change.
Didn’t like it, but my 4 year old surprised me and loves it! I cut it into cubes and throw it into a stir fry noodle consisting of soy sauce, oyster sauce and hoisin sauce. Try it!
No need to season, I toasted these in the oven for 30 minutes & they turned out great. Bigger packs needed please.
Love the smoked flavour and texture is great too
Strong smoky flavour which I like but others have found slightly overpowering. Can't beat Tofoo for convenience though!

We do lots of Asian cuisine and use smoked firm tofu routinely. This is not the traditional one which would be firm, pleasantly smoked. This brand makes it spongy and watery, and the smokiness is actually unpleasant.. Makes the dish soggy. Will not buy again..
Good consistency and mice mild smoky taste.  Sometimes seems to turn just before use by date.
Very handy to have in the cupboard.
Best tofu hands down. Can easily eat it straight out of the box.
The best tofu at Ocado
Its lovely!
I love these raw and perfect for lettuce wraps!!

I liked the smokey flavour on this. The texture was alright. I crumbled and cooked this in a frying pan with a small amount of black salt - kind of like how you would cook scrambled egg. Although I wouldn't go out of my way to buy this again, I also wouldn't avoid it
This was absolutely delicious. New favourite!
I am afraid I did not like this at all. I found the taste and the texture unpleasant and regretfully binned the lot.
Nice and firm and has a slight smokey flavour. But don't expect too much as it is still a plain tofu. Great in stir frys
Best tofu Ive used. Great texture and flavour.
A great tofu product that is great in many dishes from curry and  stir fries to burgers and crispy fried tofu with chilli sauce

The texture was good but the smoke taste was too overpowering and strong.  As soon as the pack was opened there was an overwhelming smell of a delicatessen bacon counter, not appetising for those who don't eat meat.  Will be sticking to the unsmoked variety.

For someone whos from Asia and has had enormous amount tofu products, this one is really weird. I dont know whether its a bad batch or its just supposed to be like that, the one I had got an after taste thats a bit sour and felt like its gone bad. The smoky flavor also makes it difficult to match other ingredients if you cook it in stir fry or a stew.
I have this nearly every day, its a great texture and flavour. I like it crumbled and pan fried , on toast
It's a good one, plenty of texture and good flavour
I love the texture of this tofu. Firm and delicious nibbled straight from the packet, marinated or char-grilled. Always in my order.
Delicious tofu. Great straight out of the packet, or browned in a pan, or the oven. It's not very wet and doesn't need pressing.
Got a few without the smoky flavour
I’m not an expert on tofu since this is the first one I’ve ever tried but it was really good. I think it makes for a nice smoked salmon substitute.
Delicious.  Good in any stir fry. Lovely smoky flavour
Really enjoyed this - made a satay sauce and ate it with rice and a cucumber salad delicious.
This stuff makes a flippin awesome vegan fishless pie! I can't get enough of it!
Favourite tofu Ive had so far, but so hard to get hold of!
Delicious smoky flavour. Great in a stir fry. Would recommend.
I buy these often. Really nice and smoky (although occasionally the pack is less smoky than normal). Excellent texture. Holds its structure but not too dense.
Really great texture, doesnt break up when stir frying. Smoke quite subtle. Good stuff.

Usually, this is 6/5 stars, but my delivery today it is totally different, soft, grainy and crumbly an with barely a smokey flavour. Whatever you have changed please stop doing it and go back to what it was like before! :-(

We always prefer this smoked version to the plain as it has more flavour and compliments many sauces. Works well in a stir fry or as the protein element in a Buddha Bowl. Last time the tofu we received was really too firm and the dryness and density reduced some of the enjoyment from the meal but generally it isnt like this so well no doubt order again.
Even though this tofu doesn't taste as smoky as it once did, it's still tastes great - especially cold in sandwiches/wraps and cubed in salads.
It's really nice and I now prefer it to the taifun, which is the one I always used to swear by.  Not too wobbly and great flavour.
Great texture but so little flavour, merest waft of smoke. Very disappointing.
This is the best tofu we always buy at least two packs but seem to run out way too quickly!
This tofu cooks so well and has a lovely flavour and great texture. My husband never liked tofu but this he enjoys. Highly recommend!

Not too smokey-lovely flavour, nice and firm. A bit hit with a family of very picky eaters. 

This will be a regular purchase from now on.
It has a good tofu texture. However, it is tasteless and overly smokey, it made my soup taste like i'd put it over a bbq. Will stick to other organic tofu.
Really great. Nice fried to make it crispy.
Beats other products hands down. Lovely nutty taste

I use this every week to make a crispy tofu stir fry instead of using meat. It has a nice natural, smokey taste and smooth texture. Great price as this is a good amount of protein in one meal for two people.
Like it so much I can eat it uncooked. Even better than taifun tofu in my opinion, but just the smoked version.
Best smoked tofu on the market!
The best and firmest tofu on the market. Lovely smoky flavour, great in a stir fry or just oven baked with some seasoning
We really like this tofu, it stays firm and if you fry it in oil the edges go nice and chewy - in a good way. It isn't too smoky at all, in fact that side of it is pretty subtle.
Great to have in salads or makes a lovely vegan caprese salad used instead of mozzarella

Either this went bad days before the expiration date -
 stored unopened in the fridge - or it stinks!
Fake overly smokey tofu, ugh! I took one bite and had to chuck the lot! Will stick to Dragonfly tofu in future!

All of our family love this tofu and I served it to my daughter's teenage friends and they loved it too. It is a regular order for me as it has a shelf life of about 2 - 3 weeks in the fridge. We love to remove the fluid and then stir fry in coconut oil. It goes hard and crispy on the outside but soft and chewy inside. I serve with a bowl of fresh pasta and a fresh tomato sauce. I have to cook two packs for 3 of us otherwise there isn't enough to go around.

So yummy even my carnivorous husband likes it.
Really delicious
This tofu has so much more flavour than any other tofu I've tried and makes whatever you use it in, SO much tastier!

I was really surprised to like this - I think I like the smoked one more as it has more flavour, and goes a little better with any seasonings you put with it. Great that it's not a tofu that falls apart when you squeeze it, or thats like a massive sponge holding water. This will be on my regular shop from now on.
In Asian dishes, this is simply too smoky. Would need to be more subtle smoke for balance. Would not order again. Stick to plain, which I love!
Lovely texture and really nice smokey flavour. Even my tofu-skeptic partner thought it was really tasty. It is a bit too salty for my tastes, however.

This works very well in a stir fry , but I still personally prefer plain tofu. 
Was grateful to receive it free to review.
Good, firm texture and nice, subtle smokey flavour.
Much, much better and fresher tasting than the alternatives. This has no aftertaste and is not rubbery like some. Really great to add to a curry. Great product
Like the plain one, really good. Great texture and low in calories.
Nibbled whilst chopping. Smokey but not overpowering for me. Yum. Oops half gone before cooking!
I received this free in exchange for a review. It was quite nice but I'm not a fan of smoked products so  I wouldn't buy again on that basis.
Tasty with a nice texture
Great texture. Great in a salad without needing to be cooked

This has a strong proper smoke flavour, and cooks well in stir fries. It's a bit too soft to serve raw. 

I received this as a sample to review.
Seems good, enjoyed by guests.
For me the smoke flavour is just right. It's not strong and  fake like 'hickory smoke flavour', it's more like I remember kippers tasted before I went veggie a very long time ago.....

Ocado sent this to me to review and I'm so pleased they did.

I have spent years trying to fry tofu to restaurant style crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. I achieved that holy grail for the first time with Tofoo. 

I fried it first and then added it to a vegetarian gumbo and it was excellent. I'm not usually a fan of smoked things, but this was a delicate flavour that gave the tofu depth, without overpowering. I used it alongside my usual tofu from Cauldron, and the Tofoo was superior.

Obviously the downside is that the Tofoo is considerably more expensive. Is it that much better? I think so! But the price will always make me think twice.
Lovely flavour, nice texture, crisp on the outside when fried.
This tofu was just the right amount of smokiness for us. It was tasty in hot and cold dishes.
Nice and firm, fry's well but not very smoky.
We are ours with a salad and it was delicious. Kids liked it too, although a couple of us thought it was a touch slimey. We'd buy it again though!
Good firm tofu that holds it shape. Im mot the biggest fan of smoked tofu, but thus was ok

This was ok, but did not have a very smoky flavour and I didn't like the texture. I much prefer a different firmer smoked tofu that has more flavour and a less slimy texture. Even though I dried this first and fried it in toasted sesame oil and it appeared crisp, it still was a bit slimy.  Don't think I will but this one again.
Not usually a fan of tofu but pleasantly surprised by this. Really nice texture that didn't break up during cooking. Smoked flavour was slightly too strong for my but liked by the rest of the family
Really pleased with this tofu, found the taste to be perfect in a stir fry, and it was quite firm so didn't break down.
Not bad, texture a little too smooth for my taste, taste not very pronounced. Not my favorite, but not bad either.
Generally not keen on smoked tofu but this has a lovely flavour and is a very generous portion.
Enjoyed this tofu, delicate flavour, nice texture, one of thebest I have tried. Would definately buy again.
Great texture and flavour, great in noodle dishes.

I didn't like the smoked smell whilst cooking but it didn't transfer to the flavour.
It was nice and firm, barely nothing to squeeze and drain.
sent free to review and really enjoyed it! lovely texture, nice flavour that wasn't overpowering. will definitely buy again

I've tried nearly all of the tofu brands sold by supermarkets and this was one of the best.
Good flavour and nice and firm for salads and stir fries.
I will be buying it regularly from now on.
Given this to review I found it of excellent quality.
chopped it up n fried it. half used with noodles n the other half used in a tomato stew. both dishes tasted great !
My first time for Tofu, not for me, found it really bland,  reminded me of a thick omelette texture with no flavour.
Never tried tofu before so was dubious, it tasted OK, veggie daughter had with a salad, so tried a bit, was surprised, she enjoyed it.
Good flavour & texture.

As a vegan I find Tofu can be very bland unless marinated. However with this product the work is already done so you have a lovely, fresh, smoky flavour to tickle the taste buds. Fried lightly in a smidge of coconut oil, wilted spinach & houmous..yum!
The flavour is great and the texture is very satisfying. We really loved it. First time trying smoked todmfu as well!

tried many brands of tofu - and I only buy organic now. This is by far the best I have bought here or in Asia. Brilliant. Great when fried and actually tasted fine raw although I don't normally eat it that way but wanted to try. Top marks and will buy more

The texture and the taste of this tofu will be great for anyone new to the product. The roasted flavour actually gives the tofu a bit of taste rather than traditional tofu, making it easier for people who may not know how to marinate it. The one flag is that there is a bit of congealed water surrounding it. Typically with other tofu products it's just water, but this could be off putting for new customers.

It's been always difficult for me to eat more tofu as it seem very tasteless to me but after trying this, my problem it's finally gone! I love the smokey taste to it, for me personally, it did improve the whole experience of eating tofu dramatically.
Highly recommended!
Smokey and delicious
Good quality Tofu with a smoky flavour.

The texture of this stuff is amazing and it's absolutely delicious. Don't be put off by the gelatinous liquid upon opening, just rinse & pat dry. I used it in a curry instead of paneer and it was beautiful. If you've never liked tofu before try this and you'll be hooked!
I love the smoked taste of this tofu and the texture is perfect, firm but not too firm. I just eat it raw with some salad for a delicious and easy meal.

This tofu is the perfect texture, firm and moist, but not wet. It is smoked so has a bit more flavour and can be eaten without any preparation. Some smoked tofu can be quite salty and rubbery, but this is the first one I had that is just the right amount of flavour, not salty, and not rubbery in the slightest. Really glad this is available on Ocado!
Stir fries well and doesn't break up. Smoke flavour goes well with smoked paprika or sumac sauce. Versatile and tasty.
I was really looking forward to this but it disappointed.  It was quite sour / vinegary, and the cheese was just slightly odd.
Little bit vinegary but otherwise spot on - will buy again when in stock.
Its good but there is a hint of vinegar about it and the tanginess overpowers the haggis a bit.
Taste more like Mousakka !
Absolutely 100% first class starter, accompanied by a wee dram of your favourite malt whiskey.
I love this as a quick easy snack for work. The houmous tastes nice.

Didnt last more than a day worth went off before use by date carrots were full of water and wet tasted disgusting. Much cheaper to buy a bag of carrots and a run of hummus but was more handy to buy on the go same they dont last.
Healthy snack.  Satisfying.
OK for a healthy snack, better than a packet of crisps

My delivery came Sunday afternoon and this had to be used by the next day.  Not practical.

Not recommended, I wouldn't buy this with a one day lead in store as I want to take it to work every day.

I was given a sample to review. My children liked these, probably because they are sweet. Light cake sponge (not close to a traditional doughnut) that was pleasant but no strong flavours. I forgot what they tasted like soon after.
Given a pack to review from ocado. A small sweet treat and the kids loved them. They were surprisingly soft, I expected them to be hard and dense, especially considering the long shelf life.

I was Given this by Ocado to review. As many others had said these were quite sweet. However, I have a sweet tooth and so actually really liked them. I am on a diet and so they are perfect for portion control as I don’t have to finish the packet as they are individually wrapped. They taste a bit like American “twinkies” to me and have a similar consistency (without the filling).

Received these to review.
Theyre very sweet but have a beautifully soft texture and are really moist.
They come individually packaged so they are good for lunchboxes etc

Ocado sent me this to review. The kids loved them - St Michel products are normally something we only see when in France so it’s great that Ocado is a stocking them. Thanks Ocado.l … this is the perfect size for a treat!

I’m reviewing this because I got a free sample from Ocado. They are handily packed and they don’t last long in our house. My children love them. Really nice for something a bit different to go in lunchboxes.
I was given these to review.  we really liked these.  A soft and fluffy texture with good moisture.  they are relatively small but that's not a bad thing.  The kids really enjoyed these too
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. They are OK but not really adult taste, too sweet. Wouldn't rush back to buy
Really enjoyed these, soft sponge mixed plain an chocolate flavour, just the right texture they individually wrapped so stay fresh. Really lovely
Was given these to review by Ocado and my granddaughters loved them. Will definitely buy when they are back in stock.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I gave these to my parents to review.  My dad thought they were OK but my mum thought they were too dry and sweet and better suited to children.
i was sent these to review, individually wrapped so handy for lunchboxes, nice moist cake
These are tasty but a bit too sweet for my taste. My young nieces enjoyed them very much. Soft texture and quite moorish. Nice with yogurt as a snack.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. A tasty snack, light and pleasant. Come individually wrapped so great for a lunchbox or to slip in you bag to eat on the go.
I was sent these to review. They were delightful! The only down side is that they are individually wrapped but otherwise we’re great.
Was sent this for free from ocado to review , not doughnuts an average marble cake.

I was given these to review by Ocado. They are ok but had an artificial tang to them. Individually wrapped, they are handy to take out on a picnic or for a snack out, but I would rather they were not wrapped in plastic.
Cannot recommend as have tasted similar items that were far nicer items in the past.
I was sent this to review. They were very soft and delicious. Enjoyed by the family
Had these to review, bland and tasteless.

I was sent these to review for Ocado, of course they are sweet and the kids jumped on them straight away and were a big hit. Managed to try some myself and they were as expected; sweet, soft cakes, not too dry and very handy for the kids. Not sure I’d pay £1.80 for them though. Would I delay prefer something with a bit less sugar for the kids,  they then these are donuts!
Received these free to review and passed straight onto my father in-law who has a sweet tooth but is also a bit choosy! A surprisingly  big hit was the feedback, especially with clotted cream :)

I was kindly sent these in exchange for an honest review. These are not particularly virtuous but the kids really loved them! Good as an occasional snack box treat. I like that they’re individually wrapped so you don’t need to have the whole box in one go.
I got this free from Ocado to review. Definitely not a doughnut, but shaped like one! Its a delightful marble cake and I will be buying it again

I was sent these free to review by ocado. they are individually wrapped donut shaped sponges, vanilla and chocolate flavour. nice moist sponge and the kids enjoyed them. just sought expect a donut texture or flavour.
Worth a try, but I wont be buying more.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I wasnt keen but my kids loved it

I am writing this review as I received a free sample to try. First off it is not a doughnut it is a small cake with a hole through the middle. The texture and the flavour are very nice. Also like the fact that they are individually packaged so you dont have to eat the full box in one go.

I received for free to review. 

Each one of these donut cakes are individually wrapped, making them perfect for packed lunches and after school snacks. 

My children loved them, saying they are buttery and sweet. They enjoyed the flavours of the marble cake effect.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. My older son and daughter think these are really good.  Despite the non appealing packaging they both said they are flavourful vanilla and chocolate soft sponge cakes - possibly not quite ‘doughnuts’ but tasty all the same.  I tried one before they quickly disappeared and was pleasantly surprised as always a but dubious when , individually wrapped.

I was given a pack of these to review and very much appreciated them! There are positives and negatives to these. Negatives, they are not really donuts at all, I'd just call them cakes. They are super sweet and slightly artificial tasting. Positives, they're cakes! They last a very long time (hence why they taste a bit artificial). I can keep them in the cupboard for when I have that 'I must have a frikken donut right now' moment. I have those moments (way too often!). Good price, long life, sweet little cakes, I will buy again! Thank you for the free donuts, you made my day!
Tasty, but not doughnuts. Sort of slightly dry madeleines. They do taste good though!

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. The snacks are individually wrapped so quite useful to carry as an emergency snack for kids. They are very sweet and synthetic-tasting though and even the child was not fully convinced, though did ask for them again.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

My son thinks these are delicious. he said they taste are full of vanilla and chocolate flavour and a very soft sponge. I happen to agree. They are in handy small, indivually sealed pouches for freshness and easy to transport. They will be going in the lunchboxes as their treats. Not a bad price for 6 making them 30p each.
We were sent to review and my daughter enjoyed these little doughnuts. She thought they really good but slightly on the dry side. We'd buy again, she enjoyed them.
Went down as a very yummy lunchbox snack. Had to ration them or they'd be gone already! Reviewing as a Star Reviewer.
Nice little handy snack
Received to review, put in lunch bag, tasty for a change.

I was sent these for free to review. A definite thumbs up from the teen who has requested more of them. Nice sized little treats, fairly moist and not overly sweet. Doughnut shaped but more like little cakes. Individually wrapped making them easy to store and less wastage of the cake itself but then more packaging.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I enjoyed these little cakes when I tried them. Although doughnut-shaped, the texture is more like a dense sponge. They're moist without being greasy, and nicely sweet without being overly sickly or cloying. The chocolate taste is subtle but that didn't particularly put me off. I'm surprised by the comments by other reviewers about them leaving a chemical aftertaste - personally I didn't notice this at all. The only thing that's a bit of a shame is the fact that they're individually wrapped, adding to packaging waste. I'd buy these again in future.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Votes were stronglt divided. The reaction from our youngest grandaughter (who is the least picky 5 year old I know); was vehemently against these cakes and wouldn't eat it all. Adults agreed 'slight chemical after taste (maybe related to longlife) . But overall not a bad snack'..

Always have to stock some snacks for packed lunch. It seems nice size sweet snack without chocolate (dont like melting snacks!). I had no chance to taste this yet, but boys said YES to this. I trust French food.
Lovely individually wrapped cakes. Kids devour these and love them as a treat in their lunch box.
A standard but tasty little cake, individually wrapped so good for lunch boxes or a snack on outings. The fact that they dont contain palm oil is a bonus
So easy to heat up (1min 30 seconds in microwave) and yummy on nachos, with some jalapeños and salsa. Family favourite! Please keep stocking this Ocado! Yum!
was expecting more of a taste to this, wouldnt buy again

I didn’t think I like this at first.  We tried it warmed up with tortilla chips.  The flavours didn’t quite come through and the texture was quite runny.  After it had cooled, though, both the flavour and texture improved lots.  So, I think I personally prefer it at room temperature.  I definitely got some jalapeño spice and a good balanced flavour.  Not perfect, but nice.  I would buy again.
Best nacho cheese dip in the Uk

ate half of it and was great and thick, went to eat other half next day and it all turned to water, needs sorting as flavour was nice, that is how flavour is suppose to be spelt since the 13th century so do not underline it as a mistake
Tasty but I did find the texture a tiny bit strange. From the reviews, it sounds like it is better warm. I will buy again and try.

If you're looking for a mexican cheese dip called queso, this is it ... but I did add a little jalapeno sauce and coriander and spring onion and salsa to it, but it didn't really need it. I was making this from scratch with he seriously cheddar cheese spread, so am pleased this is premade and tastes almost as good. Always very happy it doesn't have onions, as I'm allergic.
Perfectly average cheese dip, I felt the cheese was very bland and the only flavour comes from the jalapeño.
Had this with a soft German style pretzel. What a combo! So Delicious! I think this would also be lovely with tortilla chips or other Mexican style food.
I was really surprised at how tasty this dip is. We had this warm, so cannot comment how tasty it is when eaten cold.

I was introduced to this by a friend at a house party, now I have it in my food delivery every week. 
Silky smooth cheese dip with hints of jalapeño!
Reminds me of runny American style or cinema nacho cheese. Unbelievable.
Delicious and moreish dip with just the right amount of chilli. Loved it!
This is so delicious, I normally find cheese dips to be bland but this has a lovely cheese flavour with a kick, you can warm it and its so good, too good to share!
These taste a bit like the cinema nacho sauce you can get, but so much better - cheesy, spicy (but not too spicy) and the perfect consistency.  A wonderful festive treat.

This tastes like proper cheese! I had it on a slice of wholewheat bread and it made a delicious and quick snack. I think it would be great as a dip for crudites, or probably even as a sauce for steamed veg (it can be warmed up, which I didn't try but I assume that would make it runny enough to pour over). Will definitely buy again. I wish they made a non-spicy version that would be suitablr for children as well.
My whole family loved this jalapeño nacho cheese. Would have bough even more if it wasnt out of stock!
This was heavenlycheesy and spicy!
I ordered this cheese dipping sauce, wow....so tasty with a hint of spiciness. Will be buying more.
Heated in the microwave then served with chilli nachos, sour cream and guacamole. Absolutely perfect and properly delish! Love it.
I use it as a pasta sauce and it is utterly delicious. Just a hint of spice along with a good, salty hit. I imagine it is equally delicious as a warm dip.
I was disappointed.

I wish Id bought two! I would have happily eaten this pack to myself but felt unfair for not sharing. Definitely better warm - if you have jalapeños to spare they are a fantastic addition. Like a better, spicier cinema nacho dip!
Very little taste. Neither cheese nor jalapenos. Great idea, poorly executed
Tasted great on my black bean tacos. Also good with extra hot doritos and lots of beer. Reminds me a little of the plastic cheese you get with cinema nachos if you are into that sort of thing.
We really loved this dip, tastes just like the one from our local Tex-Mex restaurant.  Perfect balance between heat and taste.
Reminds me of the cheap and cheerful queso blanco cheese dips we would get in Mexican restaurants in Texas. Perfect when hot with some warm cantina chips
Loved the one you used to sell but this has changed and it was horrible. Wont be buying again.

Were all into Mexican food in our house so we thought wed try this. It tasted lovely. My daughter thinks it tasted like the sauce you get from the taco chain of restaurants so she was really happy it being her favourite. It was really nice warmed up or cold. Good over nacho chips or just for dripping. This will now be a staple on my shopping.
Warmed in the microwave and served with tortilla chips. Loved by all!
i enjoyed it, mildly spicy and gooey
Its an ok dip.. lacking in cheese depth tbh, you do get a little ting when you stop eating it. Next time will add a load of grated cheese.

Oh wow, had a lovely session with this, some breadsticks, and some dry white wine and everyone came up smiling. Very tasty and moreish (and yes that does mean pleasantly salty - sorry). Will be purchasing again, stocks willing.
I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  This coffee is lovely and smooth with good strength.  The capsules work well in my machine and are good value.
I enjoyed these - not too strong but a good bit of punch and flavour
Received this to review. Good all round coffee. Value not bad compared to other brands
Im reviewing this product as I received a free sample from Ocado. The capsules worked well in my machine and produced a lovely smooth coffee, no bitter taste. Would def recommend and buy again!
I sent this copy to review and was pleasantly surprised. It made a really good flat white and was not too bitter. Equivalent to the gold coloured pods we used to get from Nespresso
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. The capsules worked well with our machine and produced a nice balanced coffee, that wasn’t bitter. Can definitely recommend!
I was sent this to review and enjoyed the taste. It wasn’t at all bitter, not quite as strong as some in the house prefer. Did find there was less crema than with Nespresso capsules.
Sent to review:  enjoyed this coffee very much.  I have with milk and there was no bitter taste, a good all rounder.
Perfect black coffee, lots of punch and no bitter aftertaste, the best cup of Joe we have had in ages.
I received this to review. It is compatible with our machine. The pods are relatively cheap and it does produce a nice flavoured coffee. A good alternative.
I was sent this by Ocado to review. I am addicted to coffee, but like it strong and so these were a bit weak for me. However, it was very pleasant to drink and the flavours came through well.
Really smooth and enjoyable coffee
I was given a free sample to try. I used in my Nespresso machine to make a cappuccino and it was so nice as the coffee is strong but not bitter. Loved it and would buy again.

This is a fairly mild coffee, which isn't to say weak or with a washed-out flavour. It has all the usual premium coffee notes, but doesn't have much punch. If you don't like bitter, heavily roasted coffee, then this one might be for you. I prefer something with a little more punch. No issues with the capsules. I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. The opinion is my own.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This coffee is ok. Nothing amazing but not bad for every day

Ok if you like weaker coffee.
Nice  smooth taste but I need stronger strengths coffee.

I received a free sample to review from Ocado. The capsules worked perfectly in the machine and the coffee produced was good. I'm not sure what I expected but I suppose when they're non-Nespresso capsules at pretty much the same price as the genuine thing, I assume they'll be particularly good.
I was sent this product to review.  The capsules worked smoothly in my Nespresso machine and the coffee was pleasant.
I am reviewing this product because it was a free product from Ocado. It’s a good coffee but not as good as the original. It works well in the Nespresso Machine.

I was given this by Ocado for free to review. 
It’s ok but nothing special. I would not buy it as there are better alternatives available.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. 
Very pleasant and not too intense. 
Well balanced and smooth. 
Good black of as a base for latte 
Aluminium pods good for recycling especially if you have a pod press. 
A little expensive but coffee prices are increasing.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  They are a reasonable capsule, and work ok in my Nespresso machine but they dont seem to have much depth of flavour and are quite weak.  Ok if you just want a quick coffee before dashing out but if you want to sip and savour your drink for its taste then you will be disappointed.  Cant say that I will be adding to my order but if you like a weaker blend that is quite smooth, then these are for you.

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado’ I reviewed this last week and gave it 3 stars as the coffee was weak, but since I have changed my mind, the coffee is smooth and easy drink not bitter, great coffee
I was sent these to review, the coffee if definitely on the weaker side but I don’t really like strong coffee so I really liked them. 1 star off as they are aluminium & not compostable.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I think its a nice general coffee but does not offer much of a punch. Not as distinctive as other brands I have had in the past.
I was kindly sent this item to review, not a decent cup of coffee. Very weak in strength and colour.
Excellent coffee

I was sent this product by Ocado in exchange for an honest review.
I used the product in a Krupps Nespresso machine and made a single shot of espresso.
Taste is fine, but I dont think this product is anything over and above a standard Nespresso capsule.
Happy to drink, but only average.
These coffee pods are compatible with Nespresso coffee machines but for me personally the coffee is too weak and watery.
I was sent these to review. They make a good enough cup of coffee but lack the sweetness of pure Arabica beans. The box doesn’t say if it’s pure  Arabica or a mix of Robusta. I would not buy them.

Sent to review. Disappointed by this coffee. It had no crema, was very watery and lacked body, which was a surprise was it was supposed to be strong. There are plenty of good compatible capsules on the market, these arent up to par.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I really enjoyed this coffee. The capsules are compatible with my Nespresso machine and are cheaper than my usual pods. Would like to try different strengths in the range next time.
Ocado kindly gave me this to try, and it was a perfectly fine cup of coffee, but a rather sharp taste and we found it a little too strong

I am reviewing this as Ocado sent me the product for free. 

Me and my husband have enjoyed these pods for our morning coffee. It is quite mild but still has a nice flavour - I imagine too mild if you drink espresso.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This is a typical mild coffee which is ok but not wow.
This coffee is okay, nice aroma. Bit acidic on the palate. Also I found it to be very mild in strength, more like a decaf
I was asked to review this. I was a little sceptical, but found myself pleasantly surprised.  A decent cup of coffee, with a slightly unusual, but not unpleasant, edge to it.

I received a pack of this product free of charge as a reviewer.  

Its not bad.  I was expecting it to taste weak as espressos in Japan tend to be (Im Japanese). However typically like coffees Ive tasted in non Western coffee chains in Japan the beans they use have a sour undertone which is probably popular in Japan.  I just dont think the taste is suitable for espressos but thats my personal opinion.  

But unfortunately these capsules are not compostable and I only buy compostable ones now so I will not buy them again.
I was given a free sample to review, it is great for me as I love my coffee very strong. Will buy again.
I got given this to review, and I really liked it. Great branding and coffee. Would I switch to it from my regular? If on offer, yes.
from Ocado Nice and smooth worth a try id buy it again

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
Pleasant enough but I prefer a lungo. Worth a try to see if it is your thing.

in my quest to find alternative caps to my previous go-tos I came across these. All sounded good, but on trying I found they had an odd edge to the taste. Hard to put my finger on, but definitely not a great drink.
Lovely smooth coffee ,pods work well in my nespresso machine great value specially when they are offer
Bought these on offer and they are great.
Beautiful aged taste, but softer than cheddar with amazing aroma when warm. Possibly one of the best cheeses I've ever had.
Beautiful mild and creamy cheese with subtle depths of flavour.
...but just as well as the flavour it does have is not good. Bit sour.
I love cheese and this is lovely. Will buy again.

Last time I tried this I was unsure as I normally prefer a stronger cheese, but as it was half price I decided to give it another go and now I am hooked. I left it at room temperature for and hour and then ate it on sourdough with fig relish. Absolutely delicious mild, but creamy and flavoursome. Plus I love the poem!
Thank god for a new and interesting bit of cheese for a change. Sell more interesting cheese, Ocado.

I love a great variety of cheeses & this one did not disappoint. Lovely and mellow with after notes similar to Brie but with a firmer texture. Ive just put this back in the fridge but Im think Im going to have to get it back out and eat some more!

Bought this on a flash sale and it was still far too expensive for what it was - a bland cheese where the texture was pleasant but the overriding flavour was simply milk and nothing more. Whilst it wasnt unpleasant, this cheese was less exciting than a cheap supermarket product.
Texture fine. Creamy in a disturbing way. No middle notes whatsoever. Aftertaste punishing and irrelevant.
Unique smooth and great artisan cheese.
I like all sorts of cheese but this one was not good at all.

Bought when on offer and now regretting I didn't buy more than one,
This could be a young crumbly white cheese but it's not; it could be a mature cheddar but it's not. It could be a combination of both and more. Be aware how easy this is to eat.
too expensive to justify the price, even competed to other organic cheese

I might just not be familiar with this type of cheese but I found that it looked like it would be fantastic in a perfect cheese and pickle sandwich. I was wrong, it was bland and a bit creamy in the wrong way. Not my favourite cheese for sarnie. It might be ok on a cheeseboard against something really strong.
Animal rennet..,read all about it! Not suitable for vegetarians, disgusting! Use vegetable rennet inside

I find this cheese very pleasant. Its a rind washed cheese and thats what it tastes like, with a little chalky undertone like Cheshire (but not a crumbly texture). If you experiment with  the weird cheese section of the supermarket, youll be used to stumbling on the type. 
Its a cheeseboard and crackers cheese to serve with other contrasting flavours. While I can understand if it isnt to everyones palate (I cant say that I like babybels) , the reviews seem over harsh on a class British cheese.

Three of us tried this and nobody thought it was nice. It wasn't very strong but we all found the flavour off-putting. The texture was nice and creamy and it looked good. Unfortunately not for us. If you like raclette you might enjoy it.
Loved the flavour and creamy - but not too soft - texture of this cheese. And great that it is organic and British, so better for the environment too.
Really pleased with this cheese. Although an English made cheese its ha great continental tones. It reminded both myself and my husband of Swiss cheeses - almost like a raclette cheese.

I love cheese and all types of it and really don’t mind the smell. But this one’s smell I found very unpleasant and taste wasn’t worth putting up with the smell. 
Nicely packed.

Huge hit with my family. We finished it within about 2 weeks. It lasted fine in the fridge as we kept it tightly wrapped in Press and Seal film (from america- 100 times better than flimsy cling film). Recommend!
Recent discovery. Delicious.  Well worth a try if you like english hard cheeses/
A bit like a Brie crossed with a Cheddar. Or like a a Bel Paese. Lovely any which way!
Lovely cheese
This is a really lovely cheese.
The last piece we had was not as good as before....no complexity of flavour...no better than a cheap cheese.

A delicious cheese, but ignore the use by on it. Mine has been stored in my fridge which keeps everything else fresh. Today is the 20th, and the use by date on the cheese is the 24th - and it's covered in green mould. If you buy this, plan on eating it on the same day.

How can a piece of cheese have such a short life.  Delivered on  Thursday and out of date by the Tuesday.  Opened on Sunday and mouldy by Monday!!!  This must have been a pretty old piece of cheese.  I have bought this before and it was lovely but this was old and bitter tasting.......

This cheese has a lovely mellow yet tangy flavour.  I am really into my cheese, but my partner can't do the strong stuff the smell of parmesan makes him feel ill and he won't go near goat's cheese, so I often just make do with mature cheddar and jarlsberg.   I have found that if I buy a 'special' cheese just for me, it's hard to finish it before it goes off.  But this one!  Oh my!  I could eat half a pack in one sitting.

Yes, I remember Adlestrop- The name because one afternoon Of heat the express-train drew up there Unwontedly. It was late June. The steam hissed, someone cleared his throat, No one left & no one came On the bare platform. What I saw Was Adlestrop - ony the name And willows, willow-herb & grass, And meadowsweet, & haycocks dry, No whit less still & lonely fair than the cloudlets in the sky. And for that minute a blackbird sang Close by, & round him, mistier, Farther & farther, all the birds of Oxfordshire & Gloucestershire.
Wonderful flavour and texture

I have bought this 2/3 times now and the first was just experimental however after that I decided it was a keeper.

Nice and fresh flavour with sweet hints which I believe comes from the beetroot. Has a wonderful crunch and after opening it doesnt go off straight away unlike some of the other salad bags! 

We are able to keep this in the fridge a few days before any signs of spoiling appear but then we keep them on air tight zip lock bags until next use. Still good and fresh even after the use by date which is always a plus!
Supposed to be washed, but was sandy the last two bags.
We do like this salad and the price is good. We are big fans of beetroot but there needs to be a bit less beetroot and more leaves.
Like others have said its just a bag of grated beetroot with a few leaves in it.
Order this weekly and really enjoy it. Always fresh and tasty.
We buy this every week, really nice as a side salad with whatever really. Pizza, chicken, or even inside a sandwich for a nice crunch, etc.
This is a disappointing bag of salad, the few leaves you get are yellowing and the beetroot is clearly old and has very black bits on the end which are unpalatable.
More beetroot than anything else. Hardly any leaves in the last few packets Ive had

I wonder if something in the way the weight is measured is messed up perhaps? I love beetroot but the amount we've been getting is excessive even for me. Over half the bag the last two times has been beetroot, and as such the bag has been also mostly empty - presumably as the beetroot weighs enough to trigger the bag being full swiftly while it would be expecting greater volume from the leaves? If this is fixed in the future I'll start getting it again, but right now it is really not worth it.
Too much beetroot for my personal taste, but the rest is fine.
I get this most weeks. Keeps quite well & really good inside prawn mayonnaise sandwiches.
I could have done with more leaves...but it does taste good!
This is great i have in the fridge to add to dishes. I lasts well when opened.

I sincerely miss the Waitrose beetroot salad, but this has been a good alternative. Unlike many bistro salads, the beetroot doesnt turn soggy. Instead, it lasts well and the salad is good value when on offer.
really nice

Unlike other bistro salad that I've tried, the beetroot strips were extremely dry and didn't taste fresh. The salad leaves were fine but the texture of the beetroot spoilt the salad for me. Won't be purchasing again.

I’ve bought these salad bad for a long time but recently I notice that they are gritty and not washed as they say they are. Really disappointing as they used to be so good. Initially I thought maybe a one off but it’s happened multiple times now so unfortunately won’t buy again.
Used to buy this regularly but several times recently there's been hardly any leaves and tons of beetroot. Moved on and found something better, bye.

I have had this several times, and it has always been a good, fresh mix of all the ingredients.
However, this latest pack is majority, very dry, beetroot, with only a few leaves in there, and it looks nothing like the image. Won't buy again
A tasty mix that seems to last a lot longer than most bagged salads
The last couple packs were disappointing as the beetroot was dry & the salad leaves were not fresh. Such a shame but its put me off ordering again.
Way too much beetroot and it was dried out.  Ruined the salad bag

I made a chicken salad with this as the base for my lunch, but the whole thing was ruined because I kept getting mouthfuls of grit.  The rest of the bag will go on the compost heap. Very disappointing.
Salad was fine, worked out cheaper than buying lettuce.  I just add cucumber, radish and tomatoes to it.  Lasts about the same time as a lettuce.
I will not buy this again. straight on compost heap!

disappointed with this ready salad, the beetroot was dried out, the leaves were huge and hard, there was an overwhelming odour of mould and the salad was unpleasant to eat even when masked with dressing.
I found the ingredients to be in good proportion to each other (contrary to other reviewers!), with flavours nicely complementary. - usually love the Florette range.
Hardy any leaves. All of the weight used on beetroot so bad value
Beetroot adds a sweetness to it. Not too much either - must have ended up in the other reviewers bags.
I've been buying this salad quite happily for a while but lately feel the proportion of beetroot has increased significantly to the point where it is putting me off buying it anymore.
Nothing wrong with this product per se but it should be accurately described as a bag of shredded beetroot. I counted exactly 5 leaves in between.

All the negative reviews! I may have got a good bag but both my husband & I really enjoyed this. We did mix it in with other odds & ends of peppers, cucumber & tomatoes we had left over but found it to be another flavour burst. I will definitely buy this again.
Mostly beetroot with very little leaf

I was not impressed with this salad. it was mainly chopped up bits of stalk with a tiny bit of leaf attached to them. I hardly ate any of the bag as I couldn't be bothered to fish out the good bits. 
When I tipped the bag out to go into thew recycling I actually found a root from the lettuce! Clearly some machinery had chopped off all the leaf parts & the stub of root had somehow made its way into the salad. 
Clearly no quality control here & the stalks/roots would weigh more than leaves so it must be easy to put less in each bag this way. 
Good job it was on offer when I bought it or I would have been really miffed!
A bag full of grated dried beetroot!
Agree with others, it’s a lot of shredded beetroot which is quite dried up even on arrival. Wouldn’t buy again
Been having this for some time now and have had to stop as it seems that the amount of shredded beetroot is becoming the main ingredient

This is the worst bag of salad I have ever seen.  Dried up black mouldy looking strings of beetroot! The lettuce was not great too with brown edges and the bits if lettuce that you would usually throw away. Do not buy!

I wouldn't buy this brand again purely due to the fact that it mainly consisted of dried stringy beetroot, with two pea shoot leaves and a few bits of brown frizzy lettuce.  It looked appealing in the picture, however you could never have served to guests and the fact that I went to put some in a salad for myself this morning but threw the whole bag in the bin speaks volumes!

I have always been a fan of bag salad pre washed. I would be far unhealthy without it. A few here are complaining about the beetroot being dry. Yes it probably is but its a trade off. Slice a fresh beetroot yourself or buy in a pre washed bag of salad. I know what I'd prefer. I think its fine.
Awful. 97% beetroot. Had to go to the supermarket to buy extra leaves.
bag 99% full of beetroot! not happy
Terrible, was about 80% beetroot shreds, hardly any salad leaves.
Have ordered this for some time and recently it has been more gated beetroot than lettuce which doesn't have much taste.Wont be ordering any more.
Beetroot stalks with a bit of salad that went slimy 3 days before the use by date...YUCK
Beetroot was literally as that this salad bag had to offer me! Very little salad leaves... Very disappointed!! :-(

I love this salad but the last few times I've bought it from ocado, it appears completely dry, even well before the best before date. In contrast when bought from external supermarkets it is a delicious salad.

This is a well-known brand so I thought I was safe in buying it. It was dreadful. There wasn't even a handful of green leaves and the rest of the bag was just full of beetroot strips. Now I like beetroot but if I'd only wanted beetroot, I'd've bought one. Shockingly poor standard. Will not be buying again.
Opened today 2 days before best before date and beetroot is all dry, will not be buying again

Unlike other reviews I didn't think there was too much beetroot, so it must vary from pack to pack. But the frisée was tough and full of stalks. Half of it ended in the bin sadly. I wouldn't buy it again.
This is a lovely tender salad with strips of crispy raw beetroot which really enhances it, had it with a dijon mustard, oil, cyder vinegar and honey dressing, delish!
As others have said, too much beetroot. It all seems to get left at the end of the bag so I through a good portion of the salad away
Please don't increase the price. This is a high quality and great value product. No rubbish tangy cabbage pieces filling it up. Just honest tasty leafy fresh salad.
And lasts a long time
Very fresh and a tasty selection of leaves . Good balance of beetroot to greenery .
Very nice quality and lasted well.
And we love the added beetroot! Gives a splash of colour and flavour. Very nice.

Just requested a refund on this bag full of beetroot strips. Having now looked at the reviews - which I obviously should have done prior to ordering - it seems this is a common problem. 
Suggest only purchase if you specifically want strips of dry beetroot!
Full of dried, tough beetroot.  Will not be buying again.
Not good at all
Tough, seemingly old frisée, not enough lamb's lettuce and too much beetroot. Not very nice.
3 tiny pieces of lettuce, rest all beetroot. This is not a salad it is a bag of dry beetroot

This salad used to be nice but lately the ratio of beetroot vs other ingredients has continued to rise until my last purchase was mostly beetroot with only a small handful of salad leaves.  Won't be buying again
Dry beet root and tough stalks.
Thin sticks of beetroot was dry. Lettuce was limp. Although guaranteed for 4 days, it was already turning by the 4th day. Not recommended and I wont buy again.

I love Waitroses own beetroot salad and thought I would give this a go, however most of the beetroot was dry.  Might have been a one-off but I'm not willing to take that chance again unless it's on special offer.

I bought this, not having fully read the ingredients. Personally, I don't find anything "tender" about frisee. I have no idea why it is even grown - does anyone actually like it? Shame - the combination of beetroot & lambs is lovely.
lovely salad

This bagged salad lasts a good couple of days after opening, never looks 'slushy' or brown in the bag - even a day or two after it's 'best before' date.  Compared with other bags of prepared salads that make false, IMHO, claims about staying fresh, this is best by far!  Sweet, delicious and perfect for sandwiches or a side salad.
This was nearly all cream, very disappointing. The crunchy bits on top were nice, the cake bit was very bland, the toffee sauce at the bottom was ok.
The only nice part of this is at the very bottom. The rest tastes unbearably synthetic. Threw most of it out.
Yes, a lot of this is whipped cream and toffee sauce. Not a lot of the other stuff. But those are my two favourite parts of this sundae so I was happy!
So delicious that you can never get enough of them - they disappear very fast! Sweet caramel crunchy pieces and cream. Yum!

Far too sweet yet insubstantial at the same time. The only bit I like were the crunchy bits on top, but not the piece of sponge cake, not the sickly toffee, rather watery foam below then more sickly toffee.  Maybe I should have paid more heed to the word 'toffee' in the description!

If you love huge amounts of whipped cream, go for it. This was basically just layers of differently colored whipped cream with some lovely caramel sauce at the bottom and equally nice and crunchy bits of toffee at the top. But there was only 1 small square of sponge on top for decoration, and the mousse was not mousse. It was not rich and creamy like I think of mousse, it was just more whipped cream. The picture is right on, so imagine that everything that is not brown is whipped cream and you get the idea.
Absolutely loved everything about these. The different layers and flavours all tasted delicious and the little chocolate toffee crunchy pieces sprinkled on the top add a lovely crunch.
Needs to be bigger
Smaller than expected. Tasted like Angel Delight with a few chucks of Daim and a tiny piece of sponge plonked on top. Topped up with cheap, underwhelming squirty cream! Will not be buying again!
If you’re a fan of sweet deserts like me, you’ll love this sundae. Delicious flavours and textures and fully recommended.
Lovely vanilla cream and swirls of caramel with Dime-like pieces. Tastes really premium and best of all no gelatine!
Got to have a sweet tooth as very sweet, I enjoyed.

It was ok.
Would been better without the sponge pieces and if had more toffee in.
Bought this as a treat to try.  It isn't cheap, dry bit of sponge on the top and it wasn't great.  Would not buy again.

I do not usually buy this sort of product, but thought I would treat my daughter. A lot smaller than expected, and my daughter said it was nothing to get excited about. Oh well, give it a miss in future I guess.
Spicy and warming cant survive winter with out it

Trying to find an alternative to the Buttermint flavour that has disappeared without a trace but Twinings this is a shocker. I love ginger in all its many varied forms or so I thought til I tried this for an evening wind down brew. Virtually undrinkable and I threw the rest out. Very strong and artificial flavouring, really unpleasant. On a positive note it is marginally better than the strawberry peppermint and black pepper variety which should never have been given the all clear on the production line!
Just what is needed for this time of year.
Nice ginger tea with a spicy aroma, just be aware that there's licorice in it in case you need to avoid it.
Every year I stock up, this saves me through winter at work. Spicy, fiery and so warming. Love it.
