Warming but not overpowering flavour - comforting and soothing drink
Warm and spicy... Love it

A nice spicy gingery flavour, which gives a slight tingle to the back of the throat.  I love liquorice so am very happy that it's included in the ingredients, but I can understand why someone who doesn't like liquorice wouldn't like this tea.  It's caffeine-free so ideal as a drink before bed, very warming and great for drinking as the autumn nights draw in!
the worst taste ever, into the bin, sour and bitter and horrid
Great product. Very comforting and warming, so it is perfect for this time of year.
The stench of liquorice : unbelievably stomach turning.  Should be called: Liquorice with ginger.
I don't normally like liquorice in tea so I wouldn't have bought it myself. Having been given it as a gift I gave it a try and I'm glad I did, its gorgeous!

Though this tea contains mostly ginger, for some strange reason 15 per cent of it is   liquorice, which I despise! I feel the name of the tea is misleading, it should should surely be Ginger and Liquorice tea, it is vile.
The liquorice aftertaste was so cloying that I had to eat something to clear my mouth. This is a love/hate product!

I bought this tea by mistake but it's so lovely so I am glad I did. It settles and warms and is lovely with a drop of honey in too. Definitely a perfect winter warmer and it's delicious with the cinnamon and liquorice.

I'm addicted, just wish they would do bigger boxes than 20's.  
It's the perfect winter infusion, warming and spicy.

I find this tea delicious. 

To my taste it is purely and wonderfully warm and gingery. I would never have noticed the liquorice from flavour alone. 

I love the pukka 3 ginger tea but this is fabulous value I'm comparison and compares very elegantly. 

Especially recommended for unsettled pregnant tummies!

I bought this wanting only ginger tea and was surprised by the other ingredients which makes the labelling a little misleading. However, the taste is delicious and the settling properties of the ginger are not adversely affected by the addition of the liquorice and cinnamon.. unless of course you really don't like liquorice or cinnamon! Anyway, I think it's lovely tea!

I didn't realise that there was liquorice  root in this tea until I read the reviews...but with cinnamon and cloves, these flavours combine with ginger - the predominant taste - to make a comforting, settling tea that tastes great. It deserves more stars than the two it had.  It's down to individual taste buds I suppose....I'll buy it again anyway.
The addition of cinnamon,cloves and liquorice make this more of a spicy tea than a gingery one and I found the combination most unpleasant. I love ginger tea but not this one. Would not buy again.
Best diet coke around.
Can't argue with the classics. I love purchasing the bigger set as you get better value for money and they last me ages

I actually love to shop in person so it may be odd that I return to Ocado on a semi regular basis. However I have no car and a definite love for cans of Diet Coke, hiking a 30 can pack home from the local supermarket isnt really practical, love love love when Ocado does an offer on Diet Coke - it always encourages me to do some of my food shopping online.

Really great offer price. My guilty pleasure. Somehow managed to order two but it keeps and if there’s a sudden shortage there’ll be just that be more enjoyable - I’m an optimist always a silver lining
We get through a fairly horrifying amount of diet coke in our household and these big packs are a convenient way of ensuring we're always stocked up. Not the cheapest, but often on offer.
Frequently buy these when on offer. A very big pack of my favourite drink.
Best diet coke around.
Can't argue with the classics. I love purchasing the bigger set as you get better value for money and they last me ages

I actually love to shop in person so it may be odd that I return to Ocado on a semi regular basis. However I have no car and a definite love for cans of Diet Coke, hiking a 30 can pack home from the local supermarket isnt really practical, love love love when Ocado does an offer on Diet Coke - it always encourages me to do some of my food shopping online.

Really great offer price. My guilty pleasure. Somehow managed to order two but it keeps and if there’s a sudden shortage there’ll be just that be more enjoyable - I’m an optimist always a silver lining
We get through a fairly horrifying amount of diet coke in our household and these big packs are a convenient way of ensuring we're always stocked up. Not the cheapest, but often on offer.
Frequently buy these when on offer. A very big pack of my favourite drink.
Its Diet Coke, its massively addictive! No issues at all with the stock from Ocado. The cans have always arrived perfect. Good value for money too.
Refreshing when chilled, also glad to be able to buy big multipacks.
Love this. So much nicer than regular coke.
Tastes just as good as the fully loaded version. And so much better than the Coca-Cola caffeine free version.
Trying to cut down on caffeine & this has helped but still with the same Pepsi Max flavour. We struggle to tell the difference
Always have this for the kids it tastes good with no sugar or caffeine.
This is the best diet/caffeine free soft drink out there taste a lot better then Coca Cola.

Much nicer tasting than Coke's caffeine free offering which tastes a bit watery and flat to me. This tastes very similar to Pepsi Max but with the added benefit of no caffeine. Such a shame that most shops, restaurants and bars don't stock a caffeine free option. Decaff coffee is now widely available so why not cola?
I thought I was buying crab not crab paste, pleasant enough but not what I expected, might as well buy salmon paste it tastes pretty much the same.
We have this crab meat with rice, soy sauce and Nori-seaweed. Very tasty.

Having had a really nasty experience with Ocado's other stocked brand of brown crab (vile quality, full of inedibles like gills and shell - yuk!!), I tried this and was very pleased.  Great flavour, generally good quality.  Found one teensy bit of shell, hence loses one star, but will def buy again.

Love this product like other reviewers but today's delivery was below par. The consistency was that of a thick soup which made eating the lunchtime sandwiches very messy, I suspect that increased water meant a lot less product was required to reach the weight on the tub. Will give it a miss for now.

Lovely crab meat which I ate on crackers. Next time I buy this I will make pate using the same quantity of cream cheese, a squeeze of lemon, some pepper, and maybe a sprinkling of smoked hot paprika. Delicious.
Really nice spread on toast or crackers.
I'm not sure if I got a bad pot, but it didn't taste very fresh. The flavour was not that good. Wouldn't buy again.
Best ready to eat crab there is. have to buy every week n eaten straight out of d pot! yummy!
Rich and creamy, dipped cucumber and pepper strips in it.
Love this item, but my last 2 purchases have been extremely watery - literally poured itself out of the container. Not sure if the recipe has changed or if it's a dodgy batch but it wasn't pleasant.
Sometimes it doesn't even get as far as the pasta dish, I can't resist eating it by the spoonful.
Excellent brown crab, fab on toast or with linguine. Fresh, flavoursome, nothing added. Fab.
Excellent marbled through some buttery mash pots served with crispy skinned sea bass, bream or white fish of your choice!
I love to eat this straight out of the pot.

Best ever !!  Great in crab cakes or even just as a spread on toast. Mouth wateringly delicious !! 

Pity it is not in stock any more. Please re-stock.

This is great. I mix two of these with one of the white meat, creme fraiche, garlic, parsley and cheese and bake for a fantatastic supper or starter - always popular in my house and very easy and totally yummy.
buy it and try it - fantatsice.
NA
I bought this as my usual brand (Alpro) was unavailable - never again! I am shocked at our watery and tasteless this is. I can't detect any flavour at all.

Yuck i thought I'd had this before and liked it but now i think I'd probably just had innocent and got mixed up as that was really nice. Either I've never had it or it's inconsistent as this was rather disgusting, really watery even after shaking loads and only palatable in porridge but probably might as well have just used water.

This is hands down one of the worst hazelnut milk options (innocent being the best, and alpro being a decent alternative). It's super watery for the first half of the carton, and then the second half starts coming out of the carton with brown sludgy lumps. I've tried shaking it aggressively before pouring but it doesn't help.
Thin, watery and barely any flavour. Innocent is far, far better

I received this as a substitute for my usual Innocent hazelnut milk and what a disappointment. It does not taste as good and additionally curled in my tea (which is mostly what I use hazelnut milk for). 

My husband describes it as bitter nut mud haha

I have been having this milk for weeks because it tastes absolutely gorgeous, BUT I only just noticed that it is UHT?? NOT clear on the labelling? Hidden in the Usage section...for people like me who don't usually have time to look further than the labels, I feel cheated! UHT is not for me! Such a shame.

I am using this in my latte as a low carb alternative. Other types of milk replacement are oat/cahew both of which has a lot of carbs and almond milk tastes bitter in lattes. I love my morning nutty flavoured coffee which feels tasty and lighter than semi-skimmed milk.

I love hazelnut milk, but Im glad this was on offer when I bought it as I wouldnt waste money on it! 
As weak as water with a slight nutty aftertaste, I totally regretted putting it on my cereal. There are at least two far better hazelnut milks that Ocado sell.

Ive been searching for the perfect milk replacement or a cup of tea and nothing has really been fitting the bill. Oat milk seems too creamy, cashew curdles, I dont want soya, so I thought Id try something new. This has a strong sweet and very hazelnut-y flavour, but for whatever reason, its just perfect in a strong cup of builders. (Your mileage may vary, must like hazelnuts!)

Love it, must shake the carton or the top is watery and the bottom lumpy makes the best Hot chocolate, my preferred is raw cacao and a tiny bit of maple syrup heated in the milk to remove cacao lumps - has become a daily treat. 
Would not bother using as a replacement for cows in tea/coffee, but works well heated in a chai.
I haven’t bought hazelnut milk before but wanted to try it for making healthy shakes in a nutribullet. It was great and will be ordering again.
Tried this because I had a coupon and am looking to have options others than organic milk. This is great! lovely nuttiness which goes well with cereal.
Needs a really good shake before opening. The flavour of hazelnut will overpower a lot of things, worth a try to see if you like it.

I have been looking for a replacement for Innocents hazelnut milk, now that it tastes bad after they added seaweed to it.

So, I thought Id give this hazelnut milk a try. It was ok - it tasted of hazelnut a lot, but I personally found it to be quite bitter. It also curdled in my coffee. 

My quest for a replacement for Innocents hazelnut milk continues, as I prefer something a bit sweeter than this one.
Probably my favourite out of all the excellent Plenish nut milks.  These are the cleanest and purest.  All the other brands are full of crap.
Taste's like water, with a hint of hazelnut.  At 4.5%, no wonder!

Other hazelnuts milks available here have more sugar and way less hazelnut. I much prefered the flavour of the nut as it is without the extra sweetness. And without all the extra ingredients to thicken and bolster it. Why do others need to add extras like locust bean gum and emulsifiers?
One of the worst plant milks, just tastes like very watery hazelnuts. The price-point does not justify considering it is just water salt and hazelnuts and not even fortified with anything.
Doesn’t taste great and there’s always solid residue at the end, no matter how much you shake.

I've been drinking my coffee with hazelnut and other plant-based milk for a while, this one is definitely not the best one out there. Really curdles when inside coffee unlike other hazelnut milk drinks such as Alpro.
I may as well have just poured straight water in to the cereal. There was no taste as well. Please get Alpro back in stock asap.

I wanted to like this due to its great ingredients but it was so unpalatable that I couldn't drink it. I tried it hot, cold with and without my preferred sweetener. I bought two because I was so sure it would be great. Disappointed.
Love this, especially in coffee.
Was very surprised at how nice this is - not sweet, but creamy and very fresh. Its more expensive than other mills but worth it for no additives and gunk

So happy to find a hazelnut milk that's actually made of hazelnuts, and not a mix of nuts and rice. This is delicious, a good low-carb milk alternative, and makes incredible iced lattes on hot days. Love it.

I normally buy the Rude Health hazelnut milk but thought I'd try this one as it was on special offer. I found the hazelnut taste not to be as rich as the Rude Health milk so I probably will not buy again.  I would, however, recommend it over the Alpro, which has too many additives.

By far the best hazelnut milk on sale here... no sugar or cheap carbs added, just hazelnuts water and salt, hence perfect for those on a low carb diet. The taste is not too empowering, so I find it works well in coffee and on its own. Will definitely buy again!

If you love hazlenuts this is for you!  I had never tried hazlenut milk before so thought I would give it a go.  I used this mainly for drinking and its lovely cold straight out of the fridge.  I did not find it watery at all, like the last review.  You have to give it a good shake, as with all nut milks.  It has a hazlenut flavour, not too strong, but you will taste it.  It comes out looking like chocolate milk, so be prepared for that.  It did leave a slightly bitter taste to my mouth, but I'm personally not bothered, its possibly down to not being sweetened which i prefer.  I enjoy this mixed with a little mixed spice, to remind me of El Salvadoran horcata, which I grew up with and it worked lovely!  I prefer coconut milk overall, but I would possibly buy this again if I need a good hazlenut hit!
It has clumps even after shaking
I used to buy Alpro, but then realised it had stabilisers and other things in. This stuff is great. Zero net carbs and works well in protein shakes.

The best milk on the market. Contains 5% nuts (much better than alpro), no stabilizers and no cheap carb fillers such as rice or even sugar. For those of you that say the Innocent nut milk tastes much better - of course it does, it contains a lot of carbs and sugar. It has 8+% of carbs, almost 3% sugar. This is not a massive amount, but significant, especially if you drink this every day. Of course sugary milk is going to taste better!
This nut m'lk is delicious. When I became a plant based vegan it took me years to find a nice milk alternative.  I can't stomach soy milk and almond leaves a strange taste. This is just perfect.

I think this is the best non-dairy sugar-free milk I've tried. It doesn't curdle in my coffee and has a clean, subtle, natural hazelnut flavour. I prefer this even to Plenish's almond milk, which I find has a cloying aftertaste. This is the one for me! I alternate it with the enriched Almond milk to get some vitamin D etc.
It gave my coffee the slightest taste of hazelnut without compromising the coffee taste. I absolutely loved this
Bad. So bad!
Taste is quite watery and cheap
Really nice in porridge which gives it a subtle hazelnut taste, but being a vegan i'm cautious of the fact it isn't fortified like other brands are.

On a mission to find the best plant based milks and this is not it!  My aim is to replace my first love. Milk.  Which I can no longer enjoy for health reasons.  For context let me assure everyone I love Hazelnuts.  I have an extra spoonful with my Muesli in the morning because they are so creamy and delectable with a not so overpowering nutty flavour.  This so called Hazelnut Milk is officially disgusting.  First it tastes of completely chemical hazelnuts, second its watery a rather nasty brown colour and does not make for a good latte.  Finally I could not recommend as a cold drink either - just about any other plant based milk I have tried, rice, coconut, plenish almond is better - needs a serious overhaul

One and only, tastes delicious, no nasties inside, dont make my stomach upset. Of course more expensive than products with longer ingredients list, but unfortunately healthy stuff is usually more expensive- it is sad but not plenish fault )
Creamy and hazelnutty! Absolutely gorgeous on cereals, in my chicory coffee substitute and straight out of the carton at midnight!!

No added sugar, no emulsifiers, no gums, just organic hazelnuts and water and a little bit of salt. This is as good as plant milk gets. One little added bonus is that the caps on these cartons are easier to open than most. Top tip . . . . shake very vigorously before serves as some nut solids will settle at the bottom of the carton. To get them all add a little water of your own once the carton is near empty and shake that like crazy. You will get all the nuttiness and it makes the carton more ready for recycling!

Been buying their almond milk for ages but this last order I decided to try this and the oat one and I have given a resouding 5stars to both. This nut one is truly delicious and I will def be buying regularly.

This hazelnut milk is not the one for me. I wanted to like it because of its simple ingredients but it was too watery for me. It did not froth in my coffee machine. Same as a previous reviewer, I prefer the sweetness of the innocent one, which is blended with rice.

I tried it on its own at room temp before I mixed it with raw cacao to make hot chocolate. Both tasted great and it did not curdle when heated. I love that the ingredients are simple and there are no extra additives - great if one wants to use it to make rice pudding whilst I can still enjoy a light, delicious and nutritious drink.
Tasty hazelnut milk with a good neutral taste that works well in everything... I have this with my porridge every morning for breakfast and is perfectly creamy

If you think this is a bit pricey compared to your usual brand then check out the ingredients.  No nasties and a decent amount of nuts!  Does need a good shake.  Nice in smoothies and I imagine on cereal / in porrige too.
Maybe if Id tried this one before the innocent one Id have rated it higher but in comparison to that one this one is watery brown liquid that doesnt taste of anything much...sorry
Makes the best hot chocolate. Also very tasty with cereals. It has the most amount of Hazelnut and no junk. Love it!!
I really like this milk. Unsweetened, nice hazelnut flavour and no added weird thighs.
tasted rancid and never blended well with coffee or anything hot

I didn't want to like this because of the price.  I bought it on offer and it tastes really good. You shake it up like you do with most nut milks and the colour is similar to chocolate when you pour it out.  This is great in cereal and porridge. I enjoyed it in my hot drinks as well. It adds a really nice slightly nutty flavour to things but it is not overpowering. Delicious.
Didnt really taste of much. A faint hazelnut flavour, horrible colour and cant compare with the same brand almond milk...
Add some dark chocolate and warm in the microwave and you have a healthy hot nutelley chocolate drink. Also love it in a glass cold from the fridge. Divine treat when on a low sugar diet. Thank you!

Great to use as a milk substitute as it doesn't have a lot of other unnecessary ingredients in. It is though very expensive so unless using very sparsely not always a great alternative when it comes to shopping bill.
Love the taste of this, our new favourite milk!
Very disappointed with this drink. Doesn’t smell or taste of hazelnuts or anything really and when I add it to my coffee it separates. I’m going to stick to Alpro which is delicious!

The taste is pleasant enough but it doesnt have the sweet touch you expect from hazelnut milk. The main problem for me is that it curdles when poured in coffee or tea. You have to wait until drink has cooled before adding the milk. Really annoying. Alpo is far superior.

Love this, it's organic so no unnecessary additives and has a lovely flavour BUT you have to shake it before each use as otherwise yes like everyone says, it will be watery and you'll find at the bottom a huge lump of ground hazelnuts gathered if you don't shake it properly before each use!

This is DELICIOUS!!! It contains no additives and is organic. It is creamy, tastes divine, is perfect on cereals and porridge with organic maple syrup, and heavenly as a drink on its own. Good in tea and it tastes gorgeous in coffee and does not curdle nearly as much as other brands - just give it a good stir...rather this than artificial emulsifiers. I alternate it with Plenish Almond Milk and Plenish Cashew Nut Milk, plus Provamel Organic Soya milk and Koko Coconut milk containing Calcium, Vitamin D and Vitamin B12. I imagine this and the other Plenish Nut Milks would make yummy vegan rice pudding with Biona Organic Pudding Rice and organic maple syrup.
Has the consistency of water and tastes like water.  Never again.

My partner loves it in the coffee, smells so nice !!!
But expensive....
I found this to be more of a hazelnut drink than a milk but nice on cereal. Quite a strong flavour though which I found overpowering in tea and coffee.
The flavour of this is great, not too sweet like the other brands, but it's too watery. If it was less watery it would be perfect.
Tastes as a hazelnut milk should be - nutty and smooth. However it was somewhat inflammatory and was giving me huge skin problems. Just don't drink too much in one go perhaps.

I mostly use milk to add to my tea/coffee so the fact that this curdles and makes the drink incredibly unpleasant to consume defeats the point for me. I'm sure it works well in cereal or as part of recipes but the convenience of pouring it into my coffee is not there. It also tastes very bland compared to alpro hazelnut milk (which I love), although it is healthier than the alpro alternative.

This is the best thing since plant based milks began. A really rich taste of hazelnut, totally natural and organic. Makes breakfast cereal super tasty, and the most indulgent hot chocolate. Five stars.

Will not be buying this again. Bought 2 cartons whilst on offer instead of regular brand. Made a coffee and it curdled, thought it had perhaps gone off despite having 11mths on expiry date so remade with 2nd carton and same thing happened. Both have been chucked, complete waste of money.

I'm a fan of nut milk usually, and had high hopes for this one, but couldn't stomach it after smelling it. I know it's not got nasty chemicals in it, but it totally smells like it does.  I had a bit to drink, but most of it went down the drain, leaving some brown sludge at the bottom... so if you buy, be sure to shake REALLY well!
This is so tasty! All natural, not oily or too thick. Just a lovely, light, hazelnutty Malik alternative. Move over almond milk.

I'm so happy to find a plant milk with pure and simple ingredients unlike so many of the household brands that stick all kinds of rubbish in their products - such as carageenan, a know carcinogen. Good on you Plenish for providing the market with a wholesome product. Yes, it's expensive, but i really believe that you can't put a price on health and i am happy to sacrifice other items from my basket to prioritise this in my weekly shop.
This is creamy, nutty and utterly delicious. Obviously it is a tad more bitter than other nut milks as hazelnuts are... but it's divine and lovely in my morning latte. Highly recommended.
Goes beautiful in my Rude Health Sprouted Porridge . It's divine!
Nice taste, not too strong. Separates in hot coffee but works fine in porridge. Not sweet.
Definitely would not buy at the regular price, but lovely hazlenut taste made my porridge that little bit more special.

We normally have the rude health hazelnut milk, but thought to give this a try as it contained 5% hazelnuts instead of their 2% 
However using this in coffee is disastrous. It splits, does not compliment the taste, just find it to be overpowering.
Plenish gets it right again! Lovely hazelnut taste...makes porridge and chia seed pudding taste so much better!!!
Really high quality nut milk that actually tastes of hazelnuts.  No nasty additives, just a great clean product.

I found this Hezelnut Milk great! Made my chocolate and coconut porridge with it and it tasted amazing! I don't think that the review below has any experience with nut milks and I find the comment is totally bizarre....
Couldn't tell the difference from tap water
Great with porridge and in coffee
If you like hazelnuts, you will like this! A regular on my shopping list.
Really delicious nutty taste.  Makes my cereal taste gorgeous. 5 stars!

WOW. I bought this as I've never seen a hazelnut nut milk before without sweetness and additives. This is just pure organic hazelnuts and water. I had mine with a cacao granola. Was nutella heaven. Another winner from Plenish!

Im Vegetarian, not Vegan. This is very delicious either way!! 
I ate it all for lunch at work over 3 days on Hovis wholemeal crackers, now the jar is empty and Im ordering more. 
There was one spoonful that tasted salty, I guess it may just need a bit of mixing. 
Texture is like a tapenade. Yummy!
Very pleased with this discovery, Ocado. This is by far the most intriguing taste. I use it on a slice of sourdough with freshly cut dill.

As mentioned by others the dominant taste of the cashew paste is tomato paste. Nut based pates are very popular in Australia where the Mediterranean lifestyle lends itself to grazing platters. I was very much hoping this would be a lovely addition to simple summer meals. I was disappointed.
delicious, thick, and what is the most important organic
the beetroot variety is def my fav. This is too subtle for me but I still would recommend. no plastic and good ingredients
Nice enough but nothing special. Great company though and I could eat a jar a say of the beetroot and horseradish one
Great added to pasta and sauces. Also good on warm pitta breads with roasted vegetables. Great to have in the cupboard very versatile.
I really love this spread, it’s lovely with the bonsan wild garlic cream which Ocado disappointingly stopped stocking.
Get some Kallo corn/lentil cakes and spread this on them. Simply divine. We have it with humous or cheese or ham or....well anything as you cant go wrong.
This spread is amazing on toast! It tastes like pizza. Not artificial at all and super fresh. Bought so many now - addicted!

This red pepper and cashew pate is dominated by the taste of tomato, an ingredient only mentioned in the small print. The consistency could be firmer and it would be nice to detect the cashews. Very disappointing.

This used to be a wonderful spread, tasty, dense and a little grainy as you could feel the blended cashews texture. The last 2 pots have been mushy and bland and I have stopped buying it. I hope the old texture comes back!
... You can get similar quality products elsewhere for a lot cheaper. Would buy if on offer, but not my favourite from this range

lovely, taste of red pointy peppers. more akin to a thick humous than a pate or pesto so disagree with some reviews. it is v exspensive. i might try make my own version if i have time. would re buy as a treat. bought to avoid meat and cannot tolerate coconut vegan alternatives with my ibs
Unappealing smell on opening the jar, and an equally unappealingly bland taste. Had to throw it away- they've missed the mark with this one for me.
Quite impressed with this, all the right flavours and delicious on toast
Best vegan pate I ever tried.  Not too sweet and tasted lovely on toast and on crackers. Highly recommend.
This is really nice but not sure if I would buy this if not on offer
a really nice flavour, the pepper is clear with a hint of cashew. it's amazing in a gluten free bagel - yum!
A nice idea as a pate alternative, but didnt think the flavours quite worked and the texture was a bit grainy

The texture isn't anywhere near dense enough to consider it a pate, it's a very nice spread though. Tastes like a cross between red pesto and tomato soup - not as weird as that sounds though, just what it reminds me of! You don't get very much so I would only consider getting this again on sale. If you're still on the lookout for a vegan pate, Granovita do some great ones.

I've just wolfed this down for lunch with some crackers and enjoyed every bite. The taste reminded me of Ajvar, as the pepper flavour was lovely and strong. My only gripe was that it is very expensive for such a small jar.
I was sent this to review and was really pleased with it. I had it in sandwiches with vegan ham and thought the flavors went really well with it. Would recommend.

Convenient size jar and took on a camping trip as didn't require refrigerating before eating. All went on bread and oatcakes. Good strong flavour and with the cashew included protein too. Would definitely repurchase.
Ok, but it left a strange, slightly bitter taste in my mouth.  I was sent a free sample to review but this one won't make it on the regular shopping list.
We tried it on toasted sourdough bread. We liked it but found it a bit raw and bland. I prefer the tomato Bonsan pate to this.
tasty spread
This vegan pate is tasty. It goes really well on toast or in sandwiches. Tastes similar to a red pepper pesto.

Im not a pate type person so was a bit reluctant to try this. (Was given to trial) I was presently surprised. Nice consistency, great flavour. Tried on toast and crackers for lunch, perfect! Really yummy and makes a nice change.

it's a bit unusual having a red pepper paste on crackers but it was pretty tasty nevertheless! 
Vegan options are always welcome in our house as I'm bored with putting the same marmite. fake cheese or peanut butter on crackers. We do have a nut allergy in our house so this had to be eaten carefully in one go and then a major clean up afterwards and container in the recycling,  so not sure its worth me buying again but other people without nut allergies should give it a whirl!
I find this works best as a pasta sauce rather than a pate but it is delicious I like the others flavours in the same range too.

I'm not really a pate person, do maybe I'm not the best judge. I got sent this to review and I'm always keen to try new vegan products, but I couldn't get on with this, the flavour was very strong and raw tasting.
This is nice as a dip, added to a sandwich or just spread on oatcakes as a snack. Good flavour that manages to taste fresh without a salty/oily or preservative twang that some jarred sauces have
Creamy and fresh tasting spread. Great on toast and also with something else to offset the richness. Good with crackers too.
Bought this at the weekend and just had some on crackerbread for my lunch...wow! This stuff is really tasty and flavoursome. This will be a regular in my shopping basket going forward.

I dont know if youre supposed to eat the whole jar in one sitting but my toddler & I couldnt stop ourselves. Really yummy on oatcakes - & like others say, it was more of a spread than a pate. Will be buying it again for sure!

I liked this better than their tomato one. 
Very nice on toast with a side salad for lunch. Will buy again.
I spread this on some crackers or a sandwich. nice taste.
Great to see such a wide range of vegan options here now. This one is delicious in a sandwich or some crusty bread, not quite the right texture for pate but tasty none the less.
Nice flavours. We love red peppers and cashews so a winner. Definitely wouldn't call this a pate though.
Texture wise this sits between pate and pesto. A nice blend of flavours. It is reminiscent of red pesto but not at all oily. I would buy this again.
This is a really nice pate. Its quite sweet, but goes down a treat. Its tangy too and tasted lovely on some toast and on some crackers.
Tasty and great with crackers or as a sandwich filler with salad. I would definitely buy this again.
I liked this spread a lot, but the taste and texture are more red pepper than cashew by far. Fortunately I love both!

I received this to review and its really delicious. Its not a pate, but it makes a very lovely spread on sourdough or even toasted fruit bread. Eating plant-based I am always interested to find new ideas and this will definitely be added to my orders.
Although I think it's more like a spread than a pate. It has good ingredients and depth of flavour. It is  delicious on toast or a bagel. Spread on a wrap with mayo and salad is also very good.

This has a raw taste which reminded me of a pesto or a pizza base sauce.
I don't think that naming it as a pate is accurate.  I tried some on crackers but I'll use the left overs in a pasta dish or pizza base. I can imagine this tastes better cooked. I'm still glad that I tried it.
Lovely, refreshing change to normal tonic
Nice Brazil nuts .Organic a plus .Rather expensive for the amount you get . Don’t eat to many so they last for a while.
The best brazil nuts I've bought! Lovely taste and not old tasting like some brazil nuts.

Should have the previous reviews.

Unbelievably stale and so expensive.

Was expecting the best from Daylesford.
I chop these and mix with seeds and other chopped nuts. Do a large kilo batch divided and freeze for freshness. Add to my muesli for verve.

I always get these ones. I find other brands had lots of sour tasting nuts and these are consistently tasty. I eat a small amount every day. I sometimes get one bad nut but it is quite rare and that can happen in any brand.
Several of the nuts had a very strong petrol flavour and aroma. Had to bin them as they were inedible. Very poor.
Really good - crisp to bite into and quite large compared to others we've tried.  Recommend.
Compared to the Duchy brand organic brazil nuts these ones taste bland to me and sort of faded and stale.
I was a bit disappointed actually. Had the odd rogue that didn't taste very good... Just ok in my opinion.
Way tastier than crazy jack's ones
very fresh and tasty

After the Christmas and New Years excesses I knew I would need something to help keep me away from the drinks cabinet that would feel like a grown up treat but also needed to be healthy and tasty. This Orange DC is all that and the flavour is so delicious. Its also not overly fizzy which I really dont like with other brands of carbonated drinks. This is much more of a delicate fizz and so it doesnt repeat on me afterwards! 
I only wish more pubs and restaurants would stock this brand as I would drink it all the time.

I love a fizzy drink , but they are not normally very healthy.  This is low in calories and it  is a very tasty and refreshing drink, with lots of health benefits, being packed full of vitamins! It is a handy size to fit in your bag for picnics, or on the move, or at home straight from the fridge ! I preferred mine chilled.

I enjoy haddock, but this seems to be pieces of haddock pressed together rather than a single fillet, and for me the crumb is too thick for the amount of fish. Not a patch on the lightly dusted haddock or, even better, lemon sole.
A bit of a childhood dinner - fish like this with beans and mash - what's not to like? Brought back some memories, and tasty enough to buy again. Crisped up nicely in the oven.
good quality but too expensive
Excellent
Very tasty. Excellent quality. Bought in sale but worth paying the full price too. It would have been bonus if they were organic too

Taste fine, but I hadn't spotted that they are not pitted, so you have to remove the stones, which I find rather fiddly and sticky. I notice they are "by appointment", so I assume HM (unlike moi) has her own prune de-stoning person (looks good on CV, I imagine!).
Got these on a flash sale. So good I'm going to have to bite the bullet and pay full price next time

Although these arent pitted, they are sweet, tasty, moist and as you would hope for the price they charge. We wanted to up our fibre intake and have managed that easily with these. As mentioned, not the cheapest but worth it we think.
I really did think perhaps these were just expensive because they're Natoora and they're Agen.  But they genuinely are that good.
Great taste and juicy
Luscious and tasty.  Definitely recommend!
Succulent, sweet and delicious.
I knew dried pruned were really good for us but I never really liked the taste of them...until I tried these! These are a class apart.
They are very soft and I initially thought they would be good, but they leave an acidic taste in the mouth.
These are plump and delicious. I buy a punnet a week for snacks and the ones Ive had have always had the stone in maybe as they come from small-scale growers this may occasionally vary.
Mine had pits in them and were plump and delicious. Pricey for the amount but the quality makes this a worthwhile product.

This is no longer the same product. It used to have  the stone in, which was preserving the full flavour, but now the stone is no longer in and the flavour is not the same. It used to be fantastic but now I am not satisfied any longer.
These used to be fantastic - stone in, soft, juicy, perfectly balanced between sweet and sharp. They now have the stone removed and are dry and nowhere near as tasty. So disappointed.

These are so yummy, like eating a fine soft moist liquorice, only without the liquorice taste. They have a wonderfully balanced sweetness like Date Nectar has.
I highly recommend.
These were brilliant in the classic pork and prune dish found in Elizabeth David. The quality of the prunes made the dish.
These are soft and have excellent flavour. I am really happy about the plastic-free packaging too. Just watch out for the stones!

These are nice prunes, but I cant say that I would rave about them as much as the other reviewers here. I only bought them because the ones I usually buy from M&S were out of stock. I was surprised to see that these Natoora prunes were not pitted, and as such they are even more expensive if you look at the price/weight ratio. The  packaging is great in that it is plastic free. Other than that they are normal nice prunes and I would certainly not choose them over my usual brand.
From the best growing prune area of France.  These are lovely even to those who don’t care for prunes.
Easy to eat too many, they're delightful
Side, juicy and flavourful.... worth every penny!
Amazing prunes

Love em. Compared to semi-dried prunes in sealed packets they are not at all sticky or gooey. The offer a fresher bite. You can handle these with fingers without having sticky prune residue to clean off. Packaging seems praiseworthy too. The recyclable cardboard carton is functional and the outer film a good barrier
They're prunes.  They do have a nice flavour.  They're also really expensive and one or two dry hard fruits.

Great flavour but sometimes these have stones and sometimes they don’t.  Having just had two packs in a row without stones I nearly broke my teeth on my current pack!  I don’t mind the stones but the product should be consistent.
Really tasty in my home made muesli. Texture and flavour is great, unlike many other brands which are either soggy or really dry and leathery.
These are by far the best prunes we have tried. Soft, plump, moist and flavoursome. Absolutely delicious for a healthy snack.
I suspect the plums were dried up by industrial methods, not by natural process. I will not purchase them again.

First off I must admit to being a prune lover. Not for their digestive benefits - I just love the taste and texture (just not those pre-softened ones that  feel like theyve sat in someone elses mouth for a while).

Now these Natura prunes are a step beyond any other prune Ive had. I ate these as a treat. I ate them as dessert. I wanted to eat them instead of dinner but felt that may be going slightly too far.

Needless to say Id wished I had bought two packages.
Added bonus - the packaging is plastic free.

Love these...that is when I can wrestle them out of husbands hands!  Treat on their own. Recently added to pheasant stew with onion and sprouts. Simply roasted the bird in a one cook pot! Wow. (3 hours on low heat)
soft, moist, flavoursome
Delicious, Ive never tasted such beautiful prunes. I would highly recommend this product.
Juicy and delicious
There are the best. Even my partner who doesnt like prunes liked these ones.
These prunes are really sweet & juicy with no additives. Knocked off one star because the box is not fully sealed which I found a bit unhygienic
Very juicy and very tasty. Well worth it.
OMG. Never have I tasted prunes like this. They are just heavenly. How can a prune be so perfect? Mmmm.
I cant claim to be a prune expert, but these are definitely the best Ive had. Flavour and texture are both superb.
A taste like nothing else, probably due to stone being left inside. GORGEOUS, we ate them as snacks.
Best prunes ,very expensive but worth saving up for ,shame packaging container didnt re close .delicious prunes ,would highly recommend.
These are nothing like the prunes I have bought previously. They are juicy, flavoursome and totally addictive, however due to the high price I have to ration them as an occasional treat.

Bought to sweeten and add fibre to kids porridge. Ive never been a fan of prunes as have found them very musty, heavy and a little bitter. I always try everything I feed my children first. WOW! These are amazing light and fresh tasting. A completely different product to the tinned and standard prunes Ive been buying from other brands. Only problem is I keep dipping into the pantry for just one more.
Lovely prunes, succulent and full of flavour. Do they warrant the price, compared to dried prunes? Not sure.

Bought these when half price, and just eaten 4 for an afternoon snack, soooo yummy! Wonderful flavour, soft and silky, they're like dark gems sitting in the box. Back in the fridge for tomorrow, but a nutritious, healthy snack, so don't feel guilty, just couldn't afford to buy at the full price, so will enjoy the luxury while I can. :)

Bought on Flash sale. Amazing taste, too good for baking and all eaten very quickly by the family. Packaging needs to be improved and not sure I could justify paying full price for them. However if you see them on sale definitely worth a try.

These taste somehow luxurious. I love a good prune. I read somewhere they are extremely healthy - prune the ultimate super-food - your heard it here first! 
A perfect snack to keep in the fridge.

Flash sale bargain. But even if I was Elton John (or another multi millionaire of your choice) I wouldnt pay £5 for them. They are lush though. So fruity. So flavoursome- but you need to have written  Candle in the Wind to afford them regularly.
Delicious prunes , but the packaging needs improvement . Flash sale bargain
So nice that even my children will eat them!

I don't normally write reviews but these prunes really are the best I have tried. Prunes can sometimes be quite dry but these are lovely and moist and so yummy eaten on their own or cooked with porridge like I have them. They are expensive but better to pay more and eat something really nice.

On arrival I couldnt resist, they were amazing. But, theres a but, the packaging isnt good, and the following day they were drier and today slightly drier than yesterday. They are so delicious, please upgrade the packaging!
Just delicious. A real treat.
My husband loves Agen prunes, and was delighted that I'd got these. I didn't tell him how much they cost!
Not a prune connoisseur, but these made an impression. Clear plum taste. Expensive though!
it was alright but not really that keen on it. still prefer iceberg but it goes off so fast
Really love this salad but the bag is very small. It's only really enough for one person.
Bit pricey compared to other decent bags with similar contents. Steve's do tend to last longer. Beet leaves are touch bitter when had alone, but mix nicely.
Perfect for lunch, wish it was organic
I love this salad. Its fresh and tasty and you can add so many things to it. I tend to like to eat it with plum tomatoes, avocado, beetroot and grilled halloumi cheese.
Kept really well even after opening. Crunchy strips of beetroot didn't dry out.
Really fresh and delicious, beetroot just right
A little expensive as only 70g but very fresh and tasty. Lovely tiny very thin strips of beetroot to make it more interesting,
Lovely fresh, tasty salad. The beetroot is lovely and sweet!
NA
saw this in the flash sale and the reviews were good. The package looked good, when opened it looked good and whe tasted it was good. it doesn't come better than this.
Lovely and creamy very nice with fresh berries granola and honey
Another one of my favourite items. Have been buying this for 2 years. No other Greek yoghurt can be compared with this one. Creamy, tasty and goes with anything
Without a doubt this is the nicest Greek yogurt you can buy. Thick, gorgeous and creamy- perfect with fruit and a handful of granola/seeds/nuts for texture. Well worth the price!!
The best Greek yogurt youll get at a supermarket. Its so creamy, the flavour is delicious. Worth the price for sure.

Be careful! There's a difference between "Greek Style" and "Greek" yoghurts.This is from Greece and its "Greek" and 10%..This is the proper stuff.Creamy ecstasy.Why bother with anything else.Our favourite with fresh fruit.
This is a weekly staple in our shop good value and "proper" greek yoghurt
Balanced flavour , perfect

Ive just had to throw away 3 cartons of this. I have been buying for my husband for some time, and now the taste has become wierd, almost sour, even though well within their use by dates.  Maybe a change of supplier, who knows, but I wont be buying any more. Such a waste of money.
Lovely thick yogurt, not too sour but Waitrose Greek yogurt is slightly better in both taste and texture.

Lovely yogurt. Greek yogurt that isnt low fat is  scarce, so I was pleased to find this large pot. Delicious, my favourite way is with fresh or frozen fruit, chopped nuts and dark chocolate chips. The pot is good with a well fitting lid, which I will reuse. Would recommend.
Very delicious Greek yogurt, thick and creamy and not too tangy.

Nowhere on the actual packaging does it say it contains live cultures.  Here, on the product's page, they claim it contains "live cultures", don't we: the consumers, have a right to know exactly what cultures it contains?  If any??!  Otherwise we are consuming nothing but sterilised milk protein minus the good-for-you probiotics, which have been postulated as having positive effects on immune, cardiovascular or metabolic health.
Lovely thick and creamy, as it should be!

Lovely with a spoon of raw Greek honey & some chopped blood orange, or stirred in to a hot curry or soup. 
5* for taste & texture, but only 4* overall as it's not organic.

I had been having Tim's Greek yog (which is fantastic) but that wasn't in stock one week, so I ordered this instead. It is thick, creamy & delicious. I have with passion fruit & honey. Will order every week now.
This is so rich and creamy I had to check it was low-fat; please don't ever change it.
Great tasting yoghurt
Best Greek yoghurt I have tried outside of Greece!
So pleased to have 10% fat yoghurt available. Great value and mild tasting.
Another here who was disappointed not to be able to find traditional greek yoghurt, after the change over.  Thank you!
How is it possible, with everything we know and read about that yogurt can be put in this thick indestructible pot! YOU CANNOT KEEP PUTTING PRODUCTS IN PLASTIC,
I so rarely eat dairy, that when I do I like choosing the yummiest. This yoghurt is absolutely delicious! The best Greek yoghurt on Ocado.
Very satisfying. A little goes a long way. Worth all the good reviews. Great with honey and walnuts

Following the switch over, I was disappointed to have no real replacement for the Waitrose version. However, then this appeared, and it's great! Creamy, thick, great flavour and (in a rare victory for M&S) the packaging is way better than the Waitrose version which was virtually impossible to get into. Lovely, please continue to stock.

This is an excellent strained Greek yoghurt, it actually tastes like a good yoghurt you would have in Greece!  It is always difficult to get a good yoghurt and I am so happy I can get this one now.  Please do not discontinue it.
This is the real deal. Very thick and creamy. Worth every penny
Creamy, delicious Greek yogurt - and excellent value!
This is a lovely creamy Greek yoghurt. I only dropped a star because I prefer the Waitrose version, but this is very good too. Recommended.
We were worried that we might miss the Waitrose equivalent of this. But this is rich, thick and creamy and as good as the Waitrose one.
I'm so happy that this is finally stocked on Ocado as it's the best supermarket Greek yoghurt I can find.  The others don't compare.  Please don't stop stocking this.
So pleased Ocado stock this- tastes like double cream! Absolutely delicious with fruit, as a dip, or just on it's own.  A regular purchase each week.

So happy Ocado have started stocking this - regularly bought this from M&S and my mum and I were so disappointed when it wasn't on Ocado when M&S came onboard, but it's finally here and we feel over the moon!!! It's the best greek yoghurt in the UK!! Have tried others but none compare (sorry)!! Very happy - reminds me of holidays in greece!

...and save on plastic for crying out loud. So I took a star off for that. Dunno why such a key staple food stuff comes in a diddy tub. Only Fahyeh seems to sell 1kg. So this is excellent anyway, as Id expect from a true Greek yoghurt. No Greek-style yoghurt for me. Now that we waited so long for it, M&S and Ocado can you do your best to keep it in stock?
My favourite yoghurt.

Smooth, creamy and delicious. This is the best of ALL the supermarket authentic Greek yogurts. Yes better than Waitrose. I have it with fruit and granola or drizzled in honey. But it is amazing simply on its own.
Hardly any lean meat, just white fat, wouldnt buy again

I got this and was very unhappy about the amount of fat in it. It was more like pancetta. I wasn't going to waste it so used it to cover a guinea. fowl. It was very tasty! 
I'm not sure I would buy it again,

This used to be a staple but its now completely inedible its that bad it should be banned from being sold. It's like the process has altered & it doesn't resemble the same product it used to be. Have kept going for a couple of weeks but time to move on.........
I'm VERY particular with my bacon...crispy but not cremated, not too think but still got some bite. the Jolly Hog streaky bacon delivers every single time. I love it!
Great bacon, love their products especially their sausages
This is Ok bacon but it is sliced so thinly that its almost transparent and actually hard to cook without burning. Disappointing
Nothing special.
In the pack I had the bacon had hardly any streaks of lean meat. I wanted to like it but it just wasn't good.

this product was a substitute for Ocado's own smoked streaky bacon. Expensive at almost twice the price, my expectations were high but sadly unfulfilled. It was chewy and tough, very thinly sliced and lacking in flavour. Seeing the overall review level, I am not suprised it was being used as a substitute. The sooner Ocado allows optional substiutes the better - they are always a disappointment. As I said, I thought this might be the exception but it really wasn't, and I still have two more packs to find a use for.

Ive been eating this for a few months. 
Its been quite good. 
However (sadly theres a however) the last few packets have had really thin slices and a lot of water in both the bacon and package.
This bacon was excessively fatty.  I had not realised quite how fatty it was until I ordered my preferred brand (as were not eating this one) and compared them.  I will not buy this again

Even for streaky bacon this was excessively fatty but it did crisp up nicely eventually.  First couple of bites were nice enough but then turned into a strange cinnamon like aftertaste. Not my thing at all.
I know streaky bacon can be a bit fatty but this was insane, would be surprised if there was even 20% meat on these strips of fat. Lousy quality control. Will be buying a different brand in future.
75% fat, very little meat. Won’t buy again
I found the farmyard taste rather off putting. Just like some cheeses have, not for me.
All white fat with little meat. Really disappointing. We couldn't eat this.
Nothing like on the picture, more like cut up pieces of pork fat and no meat. Had to bin this product, very disappointing
This is lovely bacon to add to recipes or in a sandwich
I know streaky bacon can be a bit fatty but this was insane, would be surprised if there was even 20% meat on these strips of fat. Lousy quality control. Will be buying a different brand in future.
75% fat, very little meat. Won’t buy again
I found the farmyard taste rather off putting. Just like some cheeses have, not for me.
All white fat with little meat. Really disappointing. We couldn't eat this.
Nothing like on the picture, more like cut up pieces of pork fat and no meat. Had to bin this product, very disappointing
This is lovely bacon to add to recipes or in a sandwich
This is the nearest to a coffee shop coffee I have had out of my cafetiere. It’s brilliant in this Covid shutdown. Full of flavour.
ocado asked me to review this coffee. i found it very mild and left a strange after taste. it is expensive and I prefer the cheaper brands so its not for me
was fine - quite mild - average coffee with fairly fancy packaging which is probably what bumps the price up - which these days is wholly unnecessary
The is a rich coffee with a slight nutty undertone. The packet feels thick and luxurious and it has a strong reseal on it. Would buy again
I enjoyed the mild flavour of this coffee, but not sure I would buy again because of the cost. Quality coffee.

I was sent a pack of this to review. We buy ground coffee regularly so enjoyed trying a different brand. A good strength and not too bitter. Made the coffee in a cafetière and that worked well....grounds not too fine. Quite expensive but lovely packaging so would be good to give as a gift.

This is a mild sweet tasting coffee but still with a good flavour and the family enjoyed it with the toast and marmalade. I would choose a stronger blend for after dinner.
I was sent this to try and would comment that it is fairly expensive for 200g compared to our usual purchase at almost half the price for 227g.
Very good quality.
I agree with the other comments, this is a bit bitter for me and also expensive. For me, I will go back to my usual cheaper brand.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I found it a bit bitter with my first cup but adjusted and quite enjoyed it on subsequent drinks. The resealable packaging is good in terms of keeping it fresh (I usually put packets in the freezer) however must use more plastic. I don't think for the price I would buy it again unless on offer.
Mixed feelings in our house but it’s not bad to drink
This is my sort of coffee, has an amazing aroma and is mello and full of flavour without being bitter or harsh.  I think it's expensive compared to many other brands hence have only given it 4 stars.
I was sent these to review, nice mild flavoured coffee but not sure I would buy this over my normal cheaper brand as personally I dont find this any better.
I like mild coffee so I enjoyed this one

I got this as a sample from Ocado to review - it smells a bit chocolate like and therefore smells better than it tastes, which to me is rather bitter.  Also it seems over packaged with an additional cardboard cover and a ziploc sealer.  Most of us have coffee jars Id guess.  Wouldnt buy again - Lavazzo red does me fine
It smells amazing when brewing but unfortunately it wasn't for me. It's has quite a mild but distinctive flavour that I didn't really enjoy.

I received this to review. It's a very mild coffee with a lovely flavor but I found that I need double the amount of coffee than usual. I usually buy fair trade coffee, but there's no information about whether coffee growers receive a fair share.
Although not to my taste, this has been enjoyed by friends who enjoy a milder coffee.  On the expensive side, but a quality product.

I had great hopes that this was going to be the perfect coffee for me, however it was a disappointment.
I didn't like the flavour and it seemed to lack any strength.

I am writing this review as I received a free sample from Ocado.  As I prefer a milder more mellow coffee ,  I found this blend exactly to my liking. Leaves what I would call a spicy Christmassy aroma around the house when I have made some. Thoroughly enjoying it, would recommend  and will be buying some in the future.
I prefer a mild coffee and this fits the bill for me. Not the cheapest but you pay for what you get and this is good quality.
great product
The packaging of this product is lovely. The keep fresh seal is really useful as well. I found that I needed to scoop more coffee in to make the richer coffee, but I enjoyed the flavour.

The coffee is very well presented  and  the seal is very good keeping the coffee fresh but it is difficult to get a full scoop out as it is flattened when coming out of the opening. Although the flavour is not bitter it is too mild for my taste but would suit someone who doesn't like strong coffee.
This is a mild coffee but even the mild coffee can still taste good, this one has some sour notes that I don't like.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  It was ok, but its quite mild.  Need to use more to make a stronger coffee.  No after taste, which is quite nice.

I enjoy the flavours in this coffee, but it's not quite strong enough for my taste.  The packet looks great, but it's not practical or useable in my view.....I can't get a coffee scoop/spoon out of the pack without spilling coffee all over my kitchen top....not great when the product is expensive like this one!, had to empty it in to a container.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Not a strong coffee but still tasty and no bitter aftertaste. It’s packaged well and can easily be re-sealed.

I was given this from Ocado to review. I mostly drink tea or Italian espresso as I was raised in italy and I dont normally like Long coffee but this was pleasant, I am not a coffee expert but I would recommend to a friend to taste it

I was given this coffee to review. Beautiful packaging, decent coffee but too mild for me. I do like strong coffee though so it may suit others. Will try making it again and add more coffee in the filter.
My usual brand was out of stock so I thought I couldn't go wrong with this. Weak, watery, needs a solid 5 minutes of steeping to get any flavour out of it.

Tried this after recommendations. 
Our usual brew is Twinings Assam, a habit which requires you to remortgage your house when not on offer. 
This one was a solid replacement.
Can't go wrong with Yorkshire Tea!
Had rave reviews from all relatives when making milk tea. Full bodied flavour, not too much residue and didn't have to double up on tea bags either. Would strongly recommend for Asian milk teas
Great price when on offer and lovely taste

There’s not much more to add. 
Except milk of course.
Just delicious!

We always used the ordinary (red box) Yorkshire Tea before but tried this when on holiday. It makes a very nice cuppa. We decided that it is nicer than the red-box version. 

In the mornings I drink my tea black and the Yorkshire Gold definitely makes a nicer cup of milk-less tea than the red. It has a smoother taste than the red, which has a very slightly bitter taste to it when drunk without milk. 

We are going to switch to Yorkshire Gold from now on.
Yorkshire Tea is the best tea but Yorkshire Gold is even better, makes a great cup of tea. Have been buying it for years and will continue.
Rich golden flavoursome brew. Bye eck.
Probably the best mass market tea bag Ive
Not overly tannic but perfect flavour. Makes the best brew
We love the strength of these teabags, especially when they are on offer!
Strong and full of flavour. The perfect cuppa.
Tried so many other types of tea, always come back to this.  Yes it's more expensive but if you like your cuppa, it's worth every penny.
We love this tea, both tea bags and loose variety - tastes great, is strong and flavourful. Keen to see them with a biodegradable bag... then will be perfect.
Always the best. The bigger box size would be appreciated
I once thought that this and the M&S gold were the same tea. They may have been once but there is no comparison anymore. Please carry the 160 count box again please.

Like the tea but wont be buying their tea bags whilst they contain plastic - please make them biodegradable!

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/stories-54078009
Perfect tea, well it is from Yorkshire!
For some time now Ocado haven’t stocked the bigger, more economical box of teabags. Why not?
Wouldnt buy any other type of tea. If you like good flavour & a strong cuppa, these tea bags will give you this.

Unnecessarily using plastic in the tea bags. Is no excuse.
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/stories-54078009

Not sure what's happened to YT. It's a bit hit and miss these days and I wonder if it's in their batches? Never had a taste problem with the larger packs (which we can't get now since covid) but sometimes we get the odd 80 box that tastes really off. We know our tea so where's the quality control??
Nothing beats Yorkshire Gold, it's so flavoursome. Perfection in a cup!
We drink a lot of tea, and prefer the taste of Assam.  These tea bags are the best yet, full of flavour and do not leave dust.  A regular item on my shopping list.
It’s tasty but lacking malty body like clipper gold or the Sainsbury own brand
I don't think you can go wrong with Yorkshire Tea and this one makes a gorgeous golden cuppa that's strong and full of flavour.

Very good tea with lovely taste and colour. 
Definitely I can recommend.
I drink my tea black with no sugar so I can really taste the tea and would describe myself as very fussy when it comes to good tea... but these tea bags are delicious. Full of flavour!
Excellent tea, gorgeous colour; usually cheaper anywhere but Ocado though
Fairly strong but can easily adjust by changing brewing time.

I stopped drinking tea for years and went off the taste completely. Then I recently tried Yorkshire Gold whilst visiting a friend and I am now back to drinking tea again, This tea is very flavoursome but not with a tannin taste. It looks as if it will have a strong flavour but it is subtly tasteful and all you get is the taste of a nice cup of tea.

I only drink tea, never coffee and I am one of those discerning/fussy (depending on your viewpoint) tea drinkers who have to have it just so.  Although all tea comes from the same plant, it is all in the prep. Filtered water heated to the correct temperature depending on the leaf (white 70, green 80-85, Oolong, Pu ehr 90) and black tea should always be 100 straight onto the bag, left to sit undisturbed for at least 5 minutes and then whole or semi-skimmed milk. Get the temperature wrong and the tea is either dull and flavourless or scalded and bitter. IMO there are only four good mainstream teas (affordable and not silly money per bag) and Yorkshire Tea is one one of them. I travel a lot and take my tea with me. As a result there are many Yorkshire Tea converts in the most unlikely and inaccessible places! I have even been known to take my tea to a local cafe and ask them if they would use my Yorkshire Gold teabags and ended up with everyone wanting some and loving it!
Good flavoured tea,

I prefer this to the standard Yorkshire Tea, mainly because it tastes great but also these bags are biodegradable with no plastic fibres. Its so much better than the rest, and its made in Yorkshire, like all the best things!
Used to buy tea from a certain posh shop in Piccadilly until a good friend told us about this tea! Its as good as if not better!
After years of searching I have found the perfect brew. Proper tea
Great strong flavour tea for those who like it.
A bit disappointed with this; the hard water bags have more flavour, we think.
Not as strong as expected but still had a bitter taste. Back to Twinings!
I like these teabags...good robust flavour but with no bitter aftertaste. Will buy again.
I like my tea string enough to stand a spoon up in it. This is the only British tea I don't feel the need to use 2 teabags for. Is always on standby for when I run out of my Irish teabags.
This is the best tea I've ever had. It is full of flavour and character. Try it and you'll be hooked.
This really did make a difference to my mornings, once I started drinking Yorkshire Gold, I couldn't go back.

Whenever I want a smooth cup of tea, I always go for Yorkshire Gold Tea. It's always full of flavour yet so smooth and easy to drink. I actually find I use less teabags with this compared with the other "usual" brands!
absolutely delicious and refreshing.
There is a hint of pineapple but the soda taste overpowers it. Not drinkable to me on its own, it's ok as a mixer though.
Pineapple is my favourite fruit and I was really looking forward to this. Shouldn't have bothered. It was just a nasty fizzy chemical taste. Revolting.
taste great - a nice healthy alternative that has flavour :)
I was really looking forward to this drink, I thought it would be a lovely fruity refreshing drink for the summer.  However I was so wrong.

This is great. A low calorie drink that doesnt have any artificial sweeteners!! Tastes great too and is fab as a mixer if you fancy on a cocktail. Cant recommend enough (though its not like most pineapple drinks full of sugar - less sweet and much lighter and fresher). Thank you guys for making a great sugar free drink.

I love this! It only has an infusion of pineapple flavour so not too overpowering and great for quenching your thirst. If youre looking for a strong pineapple taste, this isnt for you. Its more like sparking water infused with fresh pineapple. Its does say on the bottle that its an infusion.
A tasty soft drink, but has a slight aftertaste and loses fizz quickly. Received free to review.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I was looking forward to trying this because I love pineapple but it had none of the natural sweetness of the fruit which was really disappointing. Also because of the lack of sweetness the bitterness of the carbonation came through as quite a strong aftertaste. I expect the fact that it is sugar free AND artifical sweetner free is what's causing this, so it depends of what you are happy to compromise on I suppose.
Received a sample of this to review and really didn't like it. It's like carbonated water with a hint of pineapple. Doesn't work at all
I was sent this free by Ocado to review. It has hardly any flavour and as others have said it had a bitter aftertaste.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I don't like it and my partner thinks it's ok at best - it tastes mostly of carbonated water. It's quite bitter at first, but then it tastes kind of fresh, but not really tasty. It's a bit like when you don't realise your ice cubes have all melted in your drink - there's a hint of a taste there, but not much. There's hardly anything in it, which might be good if you're trying to cut down on sugar and really want something fizzy. But if I wanted to drink a fizzy drink, which I would only have as a treat anyway, I think I'd rather forgo sugar elsewhere during the day than have this.
Was sent this to review by Ocado but very disappointing had a strange taste and an ever stranger aftertaste certainly wouldnt recommend to anyone

The taste of this is like lightly flavoured sparkling water. I’d buy it over some other fizzy drinks just because of the natural ingredients but wish there was more flavour. This was sent by Ocado to review.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.    This product didn't impress me at all.    There is no pineapple taste to speak of and just felt like fizzy soda water, with an unpleasant after-taste.    I won't be buying this for myself at all.
Light & fizzy by itself so I used my sample product as a mixer. I got it for pure pineapple juice but preferred it mixed with apple juice & lemon cordial for refreshing carbonated juice.

Received this from Ocado to try and review.
I grew up in Australia and pineapple soft drink was a normal thing. I loved the stuff, couldn’t get enough of it! 
I saw that this had ‘Australian innovation’ on the label and opened it within 1 minute of unpacking the delivery. 
It tasted like soda water.
Sweet, yellow, fizzy water. There’s no pineapple flavour at all.
I was so disappointed. 

Wouldn’t recommend and won’t be buying in future :(
I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This drink tastes sweet, but does not taste very pineapple'y... Still gets points for being free of sugar & artificial stuff though.

I was a big fan of the perrier pineapple and mango fusions that were light (a little bit of juice in sparkling water) but tangy. this has less zing, despite the colour is mainly just sweet tasting. I'm sure that some with love that but wasn't what I was looking for and didn't finish it.
the first ever fruit tea i actually like! very fruity and smells nice too!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I have made a nice iced tea with this and would use it for this purpose in the future too. A nice summer option.

These are really nice. The smell is amazing, you can really smell the fruit. I also like having the teabag with a piece of string - so much easier to remove! Or you can do the trick of sticking the string to the cup and pouring in wine to look like you’re drinking tea when working at home 😉

I was sent these to review. I have started drinking fruit tea at work as no-one can make a decent cuppa! These are a very nice alternative, just brew for a long as you want depending how strong you want the flavour.

I’ve stopped drinking milk in my tea and have started trying fruit teas as an alternative. This one was quite nice but I found it needed brewing for a little longer so that you could get the true flavour

I'm reviewing this product as I received a free sample from Ocado. I really want to like fruit teas, so I keep trying them, but I haven't found one yet I really enjoy. Good strawberry flavour, but couldn't really taste the elderflower.
Nice flavour when you want a break from traditional tea.
I was given this product to review. We had this tea hot and cold and both were nice, but we liked it cold more.
We were sent these to review and thought they made a lovely fruit tea. We found them more flavoursome than some other fruit teas we had tried, would recommend and would buy again.
I like this as a hot drink but it is equally lovely cooled down had served with ice, mint and a slice of cucumber. Quite refreshing.
I was sent these to review by Ocado. They make a very pleasant, fruity tea, I enjoyed it!

I really like these fruit teas. I tried chilling this tea with a little honey but wasnt keen,  the taste of the paper bags felt strong (perhaps I shouldnt leave the teabag in for so long). I much prefer these drinks hot.
I think its a bit too weak despite brewing for a whole. Tastes like warm squash so not particularly pleasant. My kids didnt like it either.

We received this product for review from Ocado.  While not a huge fruit tea fan, this was nice for a change.  The strawberry flavour was discernible but didn't pick up the elderflower so much.  Certainly nothing wrong with it but probably wouldn't purchase again.
We had these hot and cold. The children enjoyed them cold instead of squash. I probably wouldnt buy, but a nice change.
Never been keen on fruit teas, but these are so nice when very cold.
Received these as part of a review. Has a nice flavour compared to other fruit teas. Couldnt say it was strawberry or elderflower but the overall flavour was refreshing
Really nice and mild fruit tea, more strawberry than elderflower but summery regardless!
This is quite light and fruity.  I couldn't taste the juniper or elderflower but it didn't matter.  Wasn't too sour either which is good.

I received these free to review.  I hadn’t had a really fruity tea for a while but have really enjoyed these.  They have a good level of flavour, I let them brew for a little longer than the 3 mins suggested.  I can’t identify the elderflower or juniper individually but the overall effect is good.  My ten year old enjoys them chilled.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

I have started to drink infused tea to better hydrate in the afternoon rather than coffee or black tea. I have tried many types and find this to be as tasty as any other. It's got a nice fruity taste and is very drinkable. I will buy these again.
I really like the taste of this tea. Lovely fruity flavour.

I was given a pack to review and enjoyed it very much. A nice change to a regular cuppa on a warm summers day. Its flavour reminded me of a strawberry trifle...only hot, and liquidy...so trifle tea then. Like I said, it surprised me how much I liked it!
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. These had a lovely flavour, just the right strength.

I was sent this tea to rate for Ocado. Im not a huge fan of strawberry flavoured things but I have to say I did like this tea. It wasnt as sweet tasting as is expected from the smell. Couldnt taste juniper or elderflower just strawberries. Nice change for summer.

I was kindly given this fruit tea to review by Ocado.  It tasted perfectly pleasant and I tried it both hot and cold, but I have to say it tasted pretty much like any other typical fruit tea and I could not detect any elderflower nor juniper flavour.  Nice enough though, but probably wouldn't buy it again.
I was sent this product to review, lovely taste nice smell, pleasant surprise as Im not usually a fruity tea fan!
Lovely fruity flavours. One bag made a couple of pots of tea, retaining a good flavour. Pretty little teabags AND they're biodegradable. Would love them to be organic...
Really good flavour, tastes like it smells (often but the case with fruit teas). Definitely enjoyed.
I was sent these to review. The tea tasted good, pleasantly sweet, I would recommend.
I am not a huge flavour of fruity tea but this was really nice.  I have tried hot & cold & have to say I personally prefer this cold with ice.  A refreshing change from cordial with a subtle flavour
Love this! Nice hot and cold, a great refreshing flavour! Ive been drinking it cold and its a great alternative use of the bags

I love the new style teabags. The presentation is excellent.
I wish I could be complimentary about the taste. It simply does not  taste anything like how it smell. To me there is no taste.

I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I normally have a coffee first thing in the morning but decided to try this tea today. I wasn't disappointed. It's very refreshing and the flavour is very nice, not too sweet. Will definitely buy more of this.
Not too strong just a hint of flavour a refreshing change on a hot day
Asked to review I was dubious as not really into flavoured tea but I was surprised to really enjoy this. It was very refreshing on a very hot day.

This fruit tea can be drunk both hot or iced, and it’s equally delicious! The strawberry taste really comes through, and is natural rather than sickly sweet. It’s great whilst on offer, and doesn’t disappoint. It’s refreshing on a hot summers day!
Really fresh, add a nice zing to the meal. We go through a lot of chillies so the pack size is perfect for 1.5ish weeks.
Arrive fresh and keep well.  Nice and spicy and add a nice kick to dishes.

I am a complete chilli head so my chillies have to be hot! I had given up buying Ocado green chillies as they were so mild and lifeless. Decided to give them another chance and hey presto the fire has returned! Hurrah!
Heat in the chillies almost undetectable
A good portion for the price, unlike some other supermarket offerings for finger chillies
These were always hot, but the past few months not hot at all. Is it the season? Different supplier?  Ocado do you ever read reviews?
Absolutely love these. Perfect flavour and heat level that are great to make fiery cauliflower rice.

I started eating these when I travelled to India and they sprinkled them raw on everything. I love the fresh, green flavour and the heat is a good kick but never becomes a real burn. I just wish they did a smaller bag as they sometimes go mouldy because there are SO many in the bag. If you like cooking spicy food, these are a staple.
Love these chillies. They stay fresh for weeks. Got a good kick to them and great value for money.
I buy a pack of these with every order - about once a fortnight - and they always keep well throughout the two weeks and are brilliant as a basic spice for all kinds of food. Cheap, too.
these are by far the best you can get from Ocado. The bag is plentiful and the chillies pack a good amount of heat
Lovely Chillies and keep fresh for some time.
Fantastic chillies, good heat without being over the top hot. They freeze well either wholes or chopped.
Great chillies, stay fresh for a long time and have some kick.
Excellent chillies with strong but not excessive heat. Delicious both raw and cooked. They last for ages in the fridge.
Consistently good and great heat.  Tasty, couldn't live without.
and good value
Great value, arrived fresh and adds just a little heat and extra flavour to a dish!
These are fab! Please don’t change from the current list of suppliers you have. Always fresh and lasts a while!
these are always popular at home, not too hot. Just the right mount of spice for that fresh chilli hit
Nice and fresh

Sliced green chillies go in so many dishes and i get through a lot. These camn be good vzalue, but the lats batch were tiny and yellow/orange rather than long and green, OK for sauces but useless for slicing. Ocado, sort out your QC please!
I love these chillies. They go with everything
Love these- they are spicy and long. That fresh smell is amazing
Red Birdseye ones are not as hot and have way too many seeds! This is superior and a bigger packet too!
Just right really - enough heat and flavour so you know they are there yet, unlike the heavy stuff, won't give you a sore bum in the morning.
I've always been impressed by how fresh these are- much better than at rival supermarkets, and they taste great.
All I use for curries, dals etc

I like these. Always a tasty fresh chilli. Take the seeds out of they are too hot. Good value especially when on offer. 
I have abandoned going to the Indian supermarket for these.
