Good quality firm fresh chillies with no blackened seeds (always a good sign).  More of a mild heat level, not for serious heat seekers looking for a good kick.

Chillies taste best fresh so to keep that freshness going I chop them up, bag them and pop them in the freezer for when they are required. Much better than using dried or factory processed products. They really keep their flavour this way.
Fresh and plum - really good quality
Nice and fresh and good quantity at a great price.
Id highly recommend these chillis they taste hot & go lovely with a curry, omelettes or chicken wraps. They last a week or two if you keep them stored in the refrigerator.
don't keep as well as others, usually just dry if kept dry and aerated. 20% of these went moldy from inside out.
These are the only chillies on here which have any heat. They come really fresh too.

I order these chillies every week and they are brilliant! 
These have a nice kick and can find myself adding 2... or sometimes three to a meal for that extra POW!
These are proper chillies, especially suitable for Indian dishes. Use them very sparingly for a little warmth, and less so for anything up to an eye-watering inferno.
My doctor has told me stop eating these as I have acid reflux. I can't. I put them in everything. They last for ages too.
Superb value add a nice kick to meals, Use how many you want and pop the rest in the freezer and take out 10 mins before cooking

I have bought these several times and except for once, the rest has been a disappointment. I am a chilli aficionado (yes, sadly) and these are too large to be finger chillies. They also lack the scent and taste of chillies meant to be eaten raw with food. These are a cooking variety without much scent or taste.

Used a couple fresh (fab, hot. Wont bother scraping out the seeds next time ) but then put a clip on the rest of the bag, just froze them as they are. No need to defrost, just use when needed. Eg - i made chilli omelette yesterday, got frozen chilli out of freezer, managed to chop it still - whacked it in the pan with the onion and garlic (it was an anti-cold omelette!!) and it was lovely. Buy them. You wont regret.

I bought these on offer but even at full price they are good value. 32 chillies in my pack (yes I counted them). Good size with a fair amount of heat (but not ferocious).  

Don't worry about getting through them all.  Just give them a quick wash and pat dry then put in the freezer.  Pull them out as needed and chop or better still grate straight into whatever you are cooking up (this produces a lovely chillie 'dust' seasoning).  If you are adventurous try popping one in a breakfast smoothie!

Having previously been very variable, these disappeared from our local Ocado for a year or so but, since they reappeared, they have been excellent - always fresh, great aroma, great texture, great chilli kick and, if they get the chance, they will keep in the fridge for two to three weeks.

Fiery little powerhouses of chilli heat...one tiny exemplar goes a long way!  I used a mere half in a spicy pesto (with two bunches of basil) and the heat still came through.  I have also used just one in a homemade Thai paste...also a success.  As the pack is generous, it is well worth allowing some to air-dry (waste not), they turn red and will continue to create the spice-heat in many a dish.
Health benefits of chilli are well known. We cut (Do this with scissors ) over everything (Savory!). Husband would put on his Rice Krispies if allowed!
These are a great chilli for having finely chopped and raw if you can take a decent amount of heat.
nice and spicy
I buy these every time I order, always great quality.
Really happy these are back in stock. They are so handy to keep in the freezer. And pack some decent amount of heat and flavour
Little chillis that pack a punch! I love using these ones in curry where you want a hit!

I was disappointed after reading all the good reviews. These had no flavor at all. Yes, they are pretty hot, but that's it. I tried several of them. A good chilli should have flavor as well as spicy heat.
I use a load of them to make Thai green curry paste. Leave the rest out in a sunny place in the kitchen to ripen and change to red, and leave whatever left after that to dry completely.

My favourite chillies. Hot yet fragrant with a delicate flavour. They taste quite like good quality Thai green finger chillies to me. I slice them into almost everything I eat (curries, chilli, burgers etc). Highly recommended.
These are HOT! Perfect if you like your food spicy.
Never in stock.
My favourite chilli.
Love these and I put them in absolutely everything from stir frys and currys to bolognese and even have them in my scrambled eggs for breakie!
loads in a pack and I only use one per dish and lovely and hot (with seeds). I've frozen them and just get one out to use immediately.
These are lovely - hot and fresh. Much more flavour than the larger mild green chillies

These are wonderfully fresh, tasty and spicy. only current issue is that they haven't been available for absolutely ages. Ocado is actually getting very much worse with its stock. Anyone else noticed?
Sometimes i am fond of eating some hot food.this is a good choice for me,but why it is always out of stock

I'm so sorry it's taken me so long to write this review.  Thank you Ocado for stocking these large packs of green chillis. As mentioned in previous reviews I also freeze mine after cutting off the top of the plastic bag.  Rinse before using then chop or snip with a kitchen scissors which is better if you have dexterity problems such as Joint Hypermobility. If the pepper is large you can cut it in half and leave the other half in the freezer.  Great in scrambled eggs.
I buy these regularly, cut stalks off, freeze in an old deli pot then just use them direct. However, last batch were way hotter than previous to extent I was taking yogurt with my curry

These have got a great heat to them and are really fresh. I keep them in a lock & lock in the fridge and they stay fresh and firm for around a month before the first ones show any sign of going soft. At this point I put them in the freezer and use from frozen. A few even turned colour to orange they were in the fridge so long!
These are great little chilli peppers and deliver a fiery, dry heat to dishes. Delicious!
Whichever buyer happened upon these flavoursome infernos should be promoted to CEO without delay!

These are a regular on my list, i wash them cut off the stalk and freeze them, they keep for wks, these chilli`s are used in Asian cooking they add heat and taste, they are hot but  not too hot i find them just perfect.
In a very good way though. These reminded me of those I used to pick in the fields in Mauritius: chillies as they should be - fresh, spicy & keep rather well in the fridge salad drawer. 5 *****
Amazingly hot. Finally! It is so difficult to find spicy chillies in the UK, this is a god-send.
Brilliant value. Very Tasty, nice level of spice and they keep for ages in the fridge I use them in everything.
I purchase these chillies very often and they are fresh all the time
I'm indian- love hit food. Sometimes nibble on fresh chilli on the side of indian food...BUT added a couple of these expecting warmth- was so hot! Very good quality and LOVE THEM !
Fantastic Chillies, I use them for curries, Pizza toppings, in salads and just on their own with a lump of cheese. If you like chillies with a bit of a bite these are for you
Thumbs up to the reviewer below that mentioned freezing them, they freeze really well and taste just as fresh after defrosting, love them!
As a chilli addict, I love these chillies. They seem to stay fresh for longer. These chillies go on everything we eat from cheese on toast to scrambled eggs: )
These are the best chillies available. And a very generous quantity too!
Great little chillies if you want to add a proper kick to anything.

I cant believe I am writing a review on chillies.  But these have to be the best chillies I have ever brought. They stay fresh for ages , I freeze mine and they are as strong when defrosted as before.  Good size pack as well.
Delicious and keeps well in the fridge
Hot, great for chilli and curry. Lovely.
A good all round chilli. Is as it should be.

Fantastic chillies. You only need a couple for an intense flavour and they last a very long time in the fridge -making them a very economical fresh product at 90p. I have even frozen a few and they fair pretty well. Well done Ocado.
Don't faff with bigger chillies. These are great. Chopped and add to the pan with seeds and all. One for a kick, two if you like it spicy.
These chillies are fab. They have lots of flavour, they're lovely and hot and they are great value.

I bought these over a month ago and some are only starting to go bad now... I am quite a chilli eater so I'm surprised these have lasted so long but they pack quite a bit of heat. Will have to try freezing some so they'll really go the distance. Hot hot - sort of pain hot.
Hot but bearable... perfect for cooking and eating with food... yum yum
these have more heat than any other i've found in london, and i commend ocado for stocking them.
Lot of quite hot little chillies very cheaply, great value
There are a nice lot of chillis in the bag and they last up to two weeks in the fridge and freeze well too.  They have a lovely hot flavour
Really like these finger chillies. They are pretty hot, and last well in the fridge for a couple of weeks.
It is difficult to find chillies with any flavour and heat nowadays. However, these are fab and I am ordering them again and again.

Your description says the plastic iS fully recyclable, please return to Ocado. BUT NO PLASTIC IS FULLY RECYCLABLE. Plastic can be reprocessed 2 or 3 times only before it becomes landfill. It's not truly recyclable in the way glass, metal, paper and other natural products are. For the sake of the planet, please stop luring people into thinking recycling plastic is okay. It's not.
Always buy these and havent yet received a bad one. Always fresh and tasty and last well. Will keep purchasing.

I would describe these as small marrows not courgettes. I received two, each about 10"/26cms long and weighing about 13 ozs/375 gms with large pips. They were tasteless but with bitter skins. I grow my own but they won't be ready to pick until June so I'd rather wait a month or so than buy these.
I had these as a alternative when my shop was delivered. They are good quality, but not good enough to justify the price tag
Wrapped in a sealed plastic bag... mould growing on the skin.  Not what you expect for an organic product.
Nice fresh Spanish courgettes. Heavily overpriced. I Spain you get it usually for 2EUR per kg. I would go for organic option, but with different brand

These are absolutely gorgeous! They have a delicious deep, full earthy sweet flavour and a lovely firm texture which they retain throughout cooking - the depth of flavour and texture is exquisite. Also very fresh with a lovely deep green colour. Plus they are organic – perfect! Another winner from Daylesford!
Very good indeed.  Fresh and tasty.
They stayed fresh in the fridge for several weeks.
Fresh, completely undamaged. Will buy again.
Big, tasty, firm courgettes that stayed fresh for a good time in the fridge!

This week my two courgettes weighed 853grms which is really  a bit much for two courgettes if you are not cooking for a family.
While the flavour is excellent the size is a problem, so will think twice before ordering again.
Far too expensive and average/poor quality
Cracking veg.
Delicious, nothing else to add.

I never buy fresh produce online as I prefer to be able to see and select in person to make sure they are not damaged, fresh looking and have a decent use-by date. I made an exception now and tried these and they were fantastic. They arrived looking fresh and tasty, and they actually tasted much better than the ones I usually buy at the supermarket.

I have bought almost all the different brands of courgettes and these, though pricey, are hands down the best - big, large and tasting as if I had picked them from my garden. I will buy these again despite the higher price.
Tastes of turmeric and very fresh. Great quality
This was very nice but I would not have bought it if I had known that I could get it cheaper some where else
My wife likes this, but not at £7!  Cheaper elsewhere and we usually only buy it when 1/3 off.
Great product - cheaper at Sainsburys at 94p/100ml whereas here it's £1.40/100ml!
£7 for something which is more than 80% apple juice is just ridiculous. You could literally make this at home for a fraction of the price. It's daylight robbery.
Love this turmeric shot, it isn't bitter at all! I love a shot post workout
I dose myself up on this post workout. Flavour is delicious, refreshing and well worth it.
I am an active individual and the turmeric shot is great addition to my arsenal to help me recover from the exercise I take part in.
Its quite expensive but I enjoy it.
Tastes amazing, especially after a run. Works wonders for my joints! Take one every day
I used to buy the little shots which liven up anyones morning, but i hated the large amount of throw away plastic this created. So chuffed to find a big bottle of this fabulous stuff.
Great way to get some daily health in the system, love having it alongside my breakfast.

Tastes great and know that its doing me some good. I prefer to take this than tablets and having contacted the company to ask about additional nutritional contact I know thats its the right product if you want to add turmeric to your diet.
Really enjoy this and it tastes so good. I drink it neat and look forward to it.

Daily shot , I love this stuff , I do take the tablets too, sadly do be  aware that it can dye your white fillings.
I have two mustard coloured lower front teeth which are now going to cost me a considerable amount to replace the  fillings in.
Very happy with those little shots, we love the Tumeric and Ginger. Taste great and is healthy.
Really good product along with other Moju shots,

Strange how it says consume within 5 days of opening but the bottle lasts 8+ shots. It then says take one shot per day. I don’t really understand as this means I have to take an out of date shot or waste half the bottle..
I drink this neat and it's delicious. If it wasn't so expensive I would have this every single day of my life. It's just fabulous. Is it doing me any good, well that remains to be seen.
All the family enjoys having a shot of this every morning to try and keep illness and bay. Very tasty and keeps well in the fridge.

I have arthritis and have been taking a shot of this and the ginger dosing bottle everyday for 6 months and it seems to help with my joint inflammation.  The dose is higher than with tablets. I’d recommend it.
It might seem crazy but I swear that a daily dose of this is doing me good. Turmeric is known to be an anti-inflammatory and I feel a lot better on this.
We found the black pepper too strong on these. Couldnt taste anything else

I love olives but not these Im afraid.
I accepted as a substitute and wished I hadnt.
There was no nice herby rosemary flavouring just a wooden bark inclusion and they were bitter.
Disappointing.

Not a fan of these despite the raving reviews. The green olives are so so bitter with zero delicious flavour as seen with other types of olives I have bought from Ocado previously. Will not be buying again.
I found the flavour of the herbs a bit overwhelming, making them a bit bitter, and the pack a bit oily.

Really surprised by any negative reviews of these! SO yummy, lovely flavour, quite mild and easy to eat. Perfect on their own or with something like meat or a salad. We only buy these as a treat as the price tag is a little steep, but then you do get a decent amount of olives.
These were enjoyed by all the family. Delicious taste of rosemary perfectly complemented by the black pepper. Buying again.
Love these olives for a snack - also go very well with a G&T or glass of wine! For me, the only thing is that I prefer green so would love if there was a green-only version of these.

These are really nice but Ive had over 7-8 hard bits of stone in each time Ive got these. And thats around 4-5 times and each one has nearly cracked my teeth. I think Ill give another product a go now. Sorry
Nice olives.
Olives tough and chewy, lacking flavour - like the cheap ones from the supermarket shelf.

I have had these for over a year. Love the taste of good oil pepper and rosemary . No stones so straight in with cheese and grapes, in pasta, in Spanish slow cooks and on flatbread with tomatoes cheese and choritzo. use the oil. It is great.
Sadly I couldnt taste any Rosemary or black pepper, only salt. In fact no olive flavour came through. Disappointing Unearthed, will continue to buy from Aldi at half the price.

I like the taste of these and have bought several. But I'm never buying them again because for about the sixth time I've nearly damaged a tooth on a bit of broken olive stone. At first I gave them the benefit of the doubt that this might be an occasional fault, but no, it isn't.
Flavour was good, but found the olives quite small and some were broken from pitting
Tastes like Germolene sadly.
These are so nice! Love the black pepper and rosemary. The olives are big and juicy and very tasty.
Not nearly enough to justify that price. Avoid!

I've tried a few of the olives from the deli range and these are by far my favourite. On their own they are packed with flavour and the Rosemary just takes them to another level. Only possible negative is they are rather salty but I don't mind that!
The last three pots of unearthed olives have had part stones left in. Cracked my tooth and cut my gum. I love olives and have never had issues like this. I will never buy unearthed products again.
Perfectly seasoned, great accompaniment to drinks and nibbles on a summers day.

The rosemary, pepper, and salt added greatly to the earthly flavour these olives bring to your table.  Wonderful combination to taste.  I will absolutely buy these again, as soon as Ocado restocks them, that is!
Lots of rosemary, pepper but also the salt too. What happened to the chili/manchego cheese pack?
Heavily brined to almost inedible standards and with hardly a hint of the rosemary and black pepper - though in fairness with all that salt you are unlikely to be able to taste anything else!
NA
More often than not this basil arrives wilted and sweaty. I will no longer buy it.
Havent had a good batch yet. Always rotten/mouldy before sell by date.
Arrived rotten as the bag was not sealed, have brought this a couple of times before and wasnt fresh and arrived wilted and smelly
I buy this basil regularly. Its always very good and lasts about a week usually. Good value.

These usually last a few days but have turned up in my fridge bag - keep them in the cupboard instead, they will last longer that way. Sometimes a few leaves come rotten but overall most leaves are useable
Arrived mostly black in the middle of the bunch. The bits we could salvage where very bitter. We do miss Waitrose and find the M&S offering very poor quality.
The best basil I've had, big leaves, fresh and full of flavour
Arrived looking great and smelt lovely. Lasted over a week before I got round to making pesto with it. Really tasty!

Rotten on delivery and squashed as flat as a pancake by the person who put it in the bottom of a carrier bag then loaded heavy items on top, it's from Kenya so no wonder its rotten by the time it gets here. why aren't we growing this here?!? it's INSANITY!
First time buying but sorry no it was sweaty and starting to mould. Not to say its always like that I wouldnt know

Have bought the fresh mint and now the basil in this range. You get absolutely loads for your money and  the quality and taste are outstanding. I usually have a surplus and freeze to use at a later date. When I chop this up I can smell it just everywhere in the house. It is just so good.
Ordered 3 of these packets to make pesto.  Each bag was completely blackened and unusable.
Perfect for a roast tomato and basil soup. Good quality and great flavour

Not a patch on the Waitrose basil, which was consistently of a better quality, packaged better and lasted longer. The last 2 deliveries have been quite bitter and not what it should taste like if picked at the correct time.

This was provided as a substitution for Ocado 31g pack of basil.
Firstly, it was not bunched in the packet. On arrival the leaves were very battered and already blackening. Every stalk was in this condition and straight out of the bag I had to bin 1/3 because it was unusable. I then trimmed the remaining stems and placed them in water in the hope they would perk up, which is usually the case. Not on this occasion, by the next morning I had to bin the rest of the basil - wilted, battered, blackened and unusable.
this often arrives with slightly blackened leaves and goes off very quickly

It seems I was lucky. It was very fresh, no black, and kept well (I do decant into a box with kitchen roll).  The bad reviews are probably to do with in transit storage, I generally avoid bagged salads online because of this.
A lot of the leaves were black and wilted. It doesn't have that fresh sweet basil smell. Is this even basil? It didn't get used.
Out of a big bunch, think I took 5 leaves off. Horrendous quality, black, white and generally nasty.
A large leafed, soft, fragrant, dark green basil. Have bought this over 20 times from Ocado and it is superb as well as being fantastic value.
There is a problem with some batches where the basil has not kept when it is delivered and is slimy.  Mostly tho this is a good buy

I used to love the big bags of basil. Recently though I've received a bag that was obviously slimy and black, then three bags a few weeks later where the sprigs were going mouldy and slimy from the centre of the bunch progressing outward. Not good value for money. A shame, as they used to be great.
Have brought this basil a couple of times, both times using for homemade basil.  Even though I did not use the basil straight away it stayed fresh and made great tasting pesto
Wilted and dying on arrival. Putting the stems in water didn't even help.

this basil is usually fresh and stays fresh for days.  I've been really pleased with it, (well my rabbits have). Therefore I decided to order a couple more packets. This evenings delivery, 2 of the packets were already brown and unusable, had to go straight in the bin. Not sure what's going wrong with the storage of this product.
I used this in homemade pesto and it was absolutely delicious and fresh! Really lovely definitive taste and as fresh as just picked! I followed Jamies recipe, so quick and easy!
Have never had fresh basil last as long as this packet did.  It was still good 1 week after I bought it and didn't throw any away.  Would definitely recommend.
Havent had the issues other reviewers have. Unlike most fresh basil this says you can store it in the fridge. I wonder if this is why some people have had problems?

This is a hit and miss purchase! 
Often it has been stored by Ocado far too cold n the leaves go black.
On other occasions its packed with heavier items and is bruised and subsequently goes black n mouldy.
You get a large amount fir your money but this is no good if it is unuseable.

I opened the bag as soon as delivered to find white mould on the stems and wilting wet leaves.  Worst I have ever encountered.  Sounds like this product is hit and miss judging by other reviews.
Because Ocado refund on poor products, I would order again.
Surprised to read the reviews, mine have been good so far.
I've read the other reviews and I've not had a problem with this, maybe I've been lucky?  Used to make Pesto Sauce and was lovely.
the freshest option I could find
The Waitrose basil was always perfect! Ive bought the M&S one three times now and the leaves have been brown mulch way before use by date, even on the day of arrival.
Wilted and grey spots. The eat by date was obviously out as they were not fit even on opening.  Would not buy again.
As many other people are found the best before dates are wildly wrong on this. It barely lasts 2 days before rotting.

Very disappointed with this. Initially I was pleased as it was a huge bunch of vibrant basil that tasted good but we must have received it at its peak. 2 days later, despite careful storage, it was dead. And it still had another 2 days until the best before date.
Shame as this isn't that different from what other supermarkets offer. It was brown and slightly smelly before the BB date.
1 out of two went bad real quick, but was fine the other time.

I used to buy the same product from Waitrose. The quality of M&S's is much lower. Not much taste, and the leaves turn brown very quickly. It would be nice to have an alternative - the only alternative so far are the small bunches from Ocado, but you need 3 to make a bunch as large as this.

I bought this large basil to make pesto- I read the reviews beforehand and ordered a couple of packs of the Ocado basil as well, just in case. Im glad I did, as this basil was already black and wilted when it arrived! I could only use about a quarter of the leaves, meanwhile the Ocado basil was still 100% fresh and I used all of it. Waste of money!

Wilted on arrival.  I could only salvage a quarter to save waste but I prefer to use fresh.    The rest was brown and slimy.  Do M&S read these reviews?   M&S products are, since going on line, in the main, just not up to scratch

This actually arrived rotten, although I didn't notice it fully when I was putting the pack away. I discovered it the next day, with 4 days still on the 'use by' date. The leaves where blackened and the stalks mostly brown. The stench was appalling. I don't know what M&S's suppliers do with this herb but they need to improve their processes.
Went brown really quickly...
Rotted really quickly

arrived black and slimy yuk would give zero stars if I could 
Come back Waitrose !

Contrary to some of the previous reviews this basil arrived fresh, (never keep basil in the fridge, by the way; Keeping basil in the fridge makes it go black), but it had no fragrance, and the pesto I made with it lacked basil-flavour and tasted strangely bitter. On reflection, I don't suppose basil is in season in October and I imagine this basil has been created by horticultural wizardry in some kind of agricultural factory, so maybe I shouldn't expect it to taste of summer.
Ordered this assuming other reviewers had just been unlucky but sure enough, the whole pack was unfit to eat within three days of delivery and two days before use-by date. Very poor.

Majority of this bag of basil was going black. It was in date, had been in my fridge for a couple of days. Not the quality I would expect from M&S. There wasnt enough good quality leaves to make a single serving of pesto.
Others have had bad experiences with this product, so maybe Ocado or M&S have taken note, because I received this basil in very good condition and just right for making excellent pesto
The basil is almost always delivered having been chilled. This makes the leaves turn black. Please store basil separately Ocado and this would become a fairly good value product.
Bought this twice as used to be a big fan of the Waitrose one. Both times it has been unusable, black, slittery, rotten! Not impressed.
Wilted & rotten when I took it out of the delivery bag. It had to be binned straight away.

I buy a lot of herbs for my rabbits and they need to be of great quality, fresh and therefore last a good few days in the fridge. Waitrose basil was great, so was the corriander and the mint. I wondered how (more expensive) M&S would compete with them. The answer is not very well at all. This was truly shocking. And so were the corriander and mint. All five packets I ordered went straight in the bin but the basil was the squashed slimy and unusable worst. Not happy at all. One star, because you have to leave at least one star when writing reviews, is tremendously over generous. Not fit for sale. Appalled.

This is my second review of this product. In my first review I was put out that only 41g of the 100g was usable. I mentioned that it had been kept for a day in the fridge and another reviewer remarked that this should not be done. OK. We all live and learn. So today's order has just arrived and I immediately opened my pack to check it, and perhaps stand the stems in water so I can use it tomorrow. This batch was no better than the last - I've had to pick out a number of  brown leaves, and the whole bunch is wilted, with no freshness to it at all. Maybe it's being stored incorrectly before it reaches the customer, because both times I've received a product that's got to be binned.

Horrid. Nothing like the old waitrose basil and notice that ocado are no longer doing the large 100g ocado bags. 3/4 went straight in bin which meant not enough to make pesto (which I what I bought it for!). Has happened two weeks in a row so clearly ongoing quality control issue. Avoid.

It’s a small size,but packs a punch.
It’s less sweet than other goods,which suits me fine.
It’s my go to boost drink.
Contains maca and cinnamon,as well as other goodies
I bought this on offer and was blown away by how nice the drink tasted. All of the individual ingredients blended together to create an intense chocolatey flavour that I appreciated.

this used to be the tastiest chocolate milk on here. the cinnamon kick was just perfect and it is kind of healthy. I would buy as a treat on a weekly basis. however, they must have changed the recipe or something. over the last few months, it would either go bad (a bottle even exploded in my fridge?) or taste just foul. I could not get enough of it before but now can barely have a sip and it is so watery too... a pity they changed it.
I have purchased this product many times but unfortunately it expires well before the expiry date printed on the bottle!

I ordered by mistake as usually have the lemon, kale and pear ones. However this is a real treat. A bit like a cold iced coffee. Chocolatey back-kick. Tried to reorder 5 more but were sold out. Ahhhhh
but so expensive, it's mostly water.

I discovered this product in the early stages of pregnancy when I couldnt stomach solid foods but was desperate to maintain a healthy intake of vitamins etc. I love them so much and when they have been out of stock recently, missed them bad! Now nearly the final trimester carrying twins and going off my food again, these are a lifeline and great pick me up. You do have to pay for organic raw products but at this point in time, I cannot put a price of my healthy and the litter Im carrying. Thank you Plenish!

Ordered this thinking it would make an amazing pick me up when I missed breakfast - still well in date and chilled when I opened it and one mouthful was all it took - rancid and fizzy utterly vile and of course far too late to request a refund - at £4.95 I would seriously consider this potential before purchase - will not buy again.

Now, I dont care how organic and raw this drink is, the price is absolutely insane. I bought one when on offer, because I was too curious how it taste like otherwise I would never pay almost a fiver for this tiny bottle. The drink itself is pleasant, but unfortunately its way too expensive.

I ordered two of these as they were on offer. The taste of the first one was good, what I expected, however, the second one had gone off by the sell by date. It was fizzing and very unpleasant. I threw it away. Disappointing.

I think the recipe for this has changed and its such a shame. I have ordered vast amounts of this drink for over a year now, despite its hefty price tag, I considered it well worth it. However this week, the drink looked a bit darker and when I tasted it, it was completely different. Not horrible, just not the same, a very overwhelming taste of cinnamon and it seemed sweeter than before? Anyway Im not going to carry on ordering this so my bank balance at least should improve :(
I can't believe people pay this much for the smallest drink! I wish I would have looked at the ml in this drink before purchase !
Dont bother, gritty texture with no discernible cocoa taste, just tasted of old leaves with mud mixed in. Poor value for money
I only drank it because it was horribly expensive

I have had this drink directly from Plenish before and enjoyed it. However, I have since ordered this drink 4x from Ocado and 3 of these arrived having gone off well before the expiry date. If I had not had this drink before I might not have realised something was wrong and become sick from drinking the curdled product! Ocado need to improve their storage and transport of this product to make sure it arrives drinkable!
So good, I want more! A bit pricy but worth it.
I have to have one a day. So delicious and no nasties. Not always in stock though. Just shake it well and enjoy!
This product is regularly curdled and off before i'ts date.

Bought this for the first time in a while and perhaps it's been reformulated as it used to be addictively delicious and now tastes bland with none of the cocoa smell. Disappointing - and even discounted it's hardly cheap.
Yes, it's expensive for the size, but its really lovely.
Pricey, but my favourite healthy treat.
So good. Worth the price!
this product is far too expensive want to a see it much cheaper
You can throw the ingredients into a blender and make twice the amount for much less cost. A few sips and this drink is gone.. way too expensive!

You can literally make this for a quarter of the price.
Take some cashew milk and a teaspoon of cacoa and
there you have it...Don't be ripped off!!

This is terrible value for money. I was expecting something really good but it was plain and powdery. It's a tiny amount for the price. Healthier, more simple ingredients shouldn't have to be this expensive
really lovely treat but so expensive
Why are there no ingredients it's suspicious Full of sugar no doubt
Bought this as am 33 weeks pregnant and fancied a chocolate milkshake, but this was just a healthy version. Really tasty! Wish I'd ordered lots more for the week!
I've given up dairy so tried this with low expectations. And WOW. So good - but have to ration it due to the calorie content!
Back at it with the good stuff again.
So delicious!
Wow is this delicious AND good for you!  So happy to have found a drink that tastes amazing and has some protein in it to help me through the day.
After trying one of these bottles, I realised the recipe was in the Plenish juice book I already have. It was very easy to make, cheaper and delicious.

As another poster said I didn't check the size of this bottle so when I received it I actually laughed out loud. It is very small but still lovely tasting. I am going  to try and make my own as I have all of the ingredients and it will be much more economical!
I buy this regularly, it's definitely an acquired taste, not overly chocolately. But shake well or it will taste chalky. It's expensive for what you get, would like to see more special offers on it.
A saviour on a juice diet as so yummy!
Originally thought the bottle would be bigger for the price (didn't check- silly me). But so tasty I keep coming back for more!!
Delicious and much better for you than other products. Just wish I could afford to have 1 per day!
I don't even like chocolate milk but I am utterly hooked on this. Id rather have this than any other chocolate which says a lot. Please sell it in larger bottles
So delicious. Shake well before use to mix up ingredients and avoid "chalky" experience mentioned below
We purchased this when it was on offer - almost 6 quid is a lot for 250ml! It is really good though, so maybe a first week of the month purchase :-)
I could only drink a quarter of it and had to throw the rest away. Tastes like chalk water, only more sickly.
Much better than sweet potato pie
The best part of the day if trying to do a juice diet. Mmm...
Amazing product. Just wish I could have it more often. Tastes delicious and indulgent
My work colleagues and I are a bit obsessed with this stuff. It's replaced our morning coffee and we feel better for it!
I could become seriously addicted to these if it wasn't for the price!
I am a huge fan of the regular cashew milk but this one is perfect for any sweet craving and tastes divine. Really, really yummy!
Amazing! The most delicious of the Plenish range.
This is so ridiculously delicious. Im a total chocoholic, and this is a really great healthy alternative to a sweet. YUM x 5
Shouldnt be more expensive than Colin mini cakes. Very cute and yummy though. Is this a pink tax?

Always buy a few packs of these as well as the large cake and the mini Collins for birthdays! Thick chocolate, soft sponge, always delicious. A real crowd pleaser. Accept no other imitations ! Has to be the real deal.
These are great as stay fresher than buying a big Colin & dividing it up and everyone gets a chocolate face. Slightly different decoration to mini colins

Bought these on a flash sale.
The cake itself was quite dry. I wasn’t a fan. 
Decorations were cute, and the chocolate face was delicious.
Aimed at kids and kids wouldn’t mind the dry cake, but it’s not for me
Connie is very yummy, as is Colin...just depends what topping you want.
These are just delightful
Great to see Connie. Its all about the girl power!
My kids love these little treats and they actually do taste really yummy!! Family favourite in our house!!
I read the reviews about the odd smell but thought odd smelling rosemary would be just about ok however it is quite off putting and not a great incentive to clean the loo.
Works very efficiently, smells lovely and clean and completely removes any lingering unpleasant odours from the lavatory.

I must admit, it took a little while to get used of the scent of this cleaner as it is not your usual toilet cleaner smell! Now that I am, I am very pleased with the product itself, it is fantastic. Cleans beautifully without harsh chemicals.
Like that this avoids having so many nasty chemicals in the house. I agree that the rosemary scent is hard to find - I've just topped it up in mine. Lid could be amended to be more directional though

My toilet is new so I cannot comment on this product's  efficiency - however I find the smell unpleasant - I can recognise it as Rosemary but it is too clinical a smell for a toilet in the home. 
I think also that some thought should be given to having a better nozzle that directs the spray under the rim.

At first the smell was odd but it makes the toilet smell very fresh when scrubbed and flushed. Also very thick so it goes a long way. The only down side is the nozzle which means you can't direct it very well under the rim.

Really disappointed.  The smell is an overpowering acidic stench, which actually made my eyes smart!  (Maybe I got old stock because nothing pleasant about it to me). Also difficult to dispense under rim and no childproof lock.  I suggest you smell it before you buy.  And not recommended if you have small children in the house.  Definitely would not have bought if I had had chance to look at it in store so goes down as an online mistake and so wasted my money.
A bit more expensive but lasts longer. True good value.

Lovely smell, much better than artificial smells or bleach.  Smell is a personal preference, as a guide I find the smell of Method toilet cleaner awful.
Cleans well, although I am in a very soft water area so can't comment on effectiveness against limescale.

Super-thick and very concentrated, so little goes a really long way. I like the smell, it's definitely rosemary in there! Works very well, and I've tried lots of different eco-friendly cleaners. Also a great price.

Excellent for an Eco friendly product - works really well.  Have to admit that the smell is not that great .... but I also hate those fake fresh smells of many cleaners.  Smell is at least clean, and is not made to last and pollute you air for long - and is not harming the environment.
Yes. It smells of vinegar but that is because it is super concentrated and everyone wants to use too much!  Cleans well and lasts 5x longer than any other cleaner.

Was looking forward to my bathroom smelling of natural  rosemary etc so used it as soon as it was unpacked.  Whilst unpacking my other shopping I kept smelling vinegar.  I initially thought that something in my shopping had leaked.  Then I realised that the vinegar smell was coming from the downstairs loo - the new toilet cleaner - even my husband could smell it in the lounge and he has an awful sense of smell!!  Dont buy.  Sounds lovely - smells awful!

Well I tried, and I think this cleaner possibly works better than other eco cleaners I've used, but the smell of vinegar is overpowering and awful!  It made the whole room smell nasty.  I could barely detect the rosemary.   Back to Method, which probably doesn't work as well, but I can bear to be in the room afterwards!
Avoid this like the plague unless you like nasty smelling bathroom products.

I found these pods a lot stronger and slightly more bitter in flavour than the other dolce gusto pods. Thats not necessarily a bad thing but personally I found them a little too harsh. Also you only receive 12 per box and not 16, like to other dolce gusto pods. 
I would recommend to anyone who likes really strong coffee but they werent to my taste

I have noticed for the last couple of years the same Ocado customers get plenty of freebie for review. This product was send to certain customers for free!  B
Which is fine if Ocado would rotate free products for review among all its customers but that isn’t what is happening. If you click on the name against any review,you can see all their reviews. I have come across customers who have left 30 times reviews in the last year claiming the received a free product for Review which means the same customer is given free products while excluding rest of Ocado customers. & this is not a rare situation. It is the same customers that again & again receive free products! Are these perhaps family/ friends of Ocado staff perhaps? Not acceptable! All customers should be treated equally!
We were sent these to review, and enjoyed them, they made a good cup coffee, we would buy again.
Tasty
Im reviewing this as I received a free sample from Ocado. Id not bought these before but will purchase again. Nice flavour.
Im reviewing this product because I was given a free sample from Ocado. A lovely aromatic coffee with a rich flavour. Worked really well as a latte. Perfect start to the day.

I was sent this to review.  I hadnt tried these before and they gave a delicious nutty and strong flavour.  I drink my coffee black and there seems to be a slightly liquorice taste which I loved.  Will definitely buy them again.  They are an 8/10 in strength so plenty caffeine in each pod for the day.
I really enjoyed this blend, although I prefer milk based coffees. It was very nice.

I had this with milk as a latte and it was delicious. I always love smelling the coffee while it is coming out of the machine and this gave a very nice aroma! It is not bitter and has a really nice coffee taste
I got this free from Ocado to review and its very tasty
Good coffee, organic !
Was sent this to review. Absolutely delicious coffee with a rich frothy crema. Nutty strong flavour and can get the liquorice coming through. Will buy again!
Sent these to review good coffee nice flavour
I was sent this to review. It makes a good strong coffee at a decent price. I would probably buy again
Rich, smooth, strong but not a bitter taste.  Smells absolutely delicious too.

Has a strong, and slightly bitter, flavour but we enjoy our morning coffee that way.  Received this as a sample but would consider buying this as an alternative to my Nespresso pods on certain occasions.

Very happy to review this free sample for Ocado
We are great coffee lovers in this family and this doesn’t disappoint.
The taste is smooth and the smell is worth getting up for in the morning.
Not an expensive buy.
But it wasnt the right fit for my machine so we only had it in a cafetière. I had no idea what dolce gusto is so I suppose it must be a different machine to one that takes regular pods.
For an espresso I like the intensity level but find this coffee too burnt tasting. I prefer the barista ristretto pods
These Peru pods make a great Americano. Strong, with a smooth flavour. Will buy again.
This hits the spot when I want a hot chocolate without sugar.
100% Cocoa powder with Vegan emblem on packaging that also says may contain milk, so a potential problem for some.
Don't go on £
when used with a sweetener and boiling water/cream this is great low carb hot chocolate.
Lovely rich taste
Great taste, my favourite!

I bought this to make chia balls and this was the star turn of all the ingredients. Wow, this has an intense, dark, fruity chocolate flavour, without one hint of bitterness. Super value too, as very little is needed to get the full chocolate hit. Highly recommended.
Mmmmm. But only as a treat given the price tag.
Lovely to see more non dairy options.  This does taste nice.  Would recommend.
Lovely tasting thick coconut yogurt. Great for anyone not just those avoiding dairy

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
Quite tasty. Have to admit.

I was sent this free to review. I dont need to use dairy substitutes but Id be happy with this if I did. I like the coconut flavour with a slight tang and hint of vanilla. Great with granola and berries. Its just quite expensive for yogurt!
‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ Really nice a creamy better than  dairy yogurt. Goes very well with raspberries.
Yuuuuum…
I love Cocos yoghurts. I notice other outlets are selling their strawberry yoghurt. Will Ocado be stocking this flavour soon?

We were sent this to review, and as with most dairy substitutes you need to adjust your expectations.  The coconut was to my palate more dominant that the vanilla, and whilst creamy and smooth just not pleasant enough to swap over to, certainly not for the price.

I am reviewing this product as I was sent a free sample by Ocado. We really liked the creamy consistency and lovely rich flavour. Good enough to eat buy itself as well as with fruit/cereal. Just too expensive for us as we don't have any dietary reason to avoid milk. Also tend to prefer to pick yoghurts that are lower in fat content/calories.
I was sent this to review by Ocado. It was tasty enough and nice that it’s coconut yoghurt, although not a necessity for me. Seems fairly pricey, but great for dairy free.
Very creamy texture. Tasted like vanilla but not coconut.
Given free to review. My lactose intolerant daughter gave it 3 out of 5 as she felt it lacked flavour

I was sent this to review by Ocado. My dalliances with lactose are always a borderline game of Russian roulette, so a thick, creamy, and morish alternative with a slight coconut aftertaste makes up for the lack of dairy and sure cures the milk FOMO!

I like yoghurt to be refreshing and palate cleansing and this is very heavy and rich (20% fat).  Thanks to Ocado for sending it to me for reviewing but it’s not really one for me.  But if you are looking for a dairy alternative and don’t mind putting your hand deep into your pocket, it might work for you
I was sent this free to review and it was an enjoyable yoghurt if you are looking for a dairy free alternative, pleasant taste and nice and creamy.
I was sent this to review by Ocado. This was tasty - nice and creamy. I wouldn’t buy at full price though.
I am reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Good product credentials, but a bit underwhelming in coconut or vanilla flavour. Too pricey for me to buy again.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really tasty dairy alternative. A bit pricey, but even so am likely to buy again.
Thick, creamy, rich, slight aftertaste of coconut. Lovely.

I was sent this yoghurt to review. I have bought this brand before but different flavours so I knew to expect a delicious, creamy yoghurt. I enjoyed the vanilla flavour and used it as part of a dessert. Very tasty. It is expensive and thus more of a treat rather than an everyday yoghurt. I would buy it again.
Very thick, with a slight coconut flavour, odd aftertaste

I was sent this product to review and hooray, I am so delighted that I did! This is without doubt the creamiest, most delicious yoghurt I have ever tasted and every alternative yoghurt is, in my opinion, inferior by comparison. I loved it!

I received this from Ocado to review. Wonderful flavour, not too overpowering. Goes well with fruits and cereals, but equally lovely on its own! It is a bit pricey at £5.00, so not something I would buy all the time
I received this from Ocado to review. It had a pleasant taste and texture, making it a good dairy free alternative.
I got this to review and although it was nice sb a good alternative but I wouldn’t personally purchase it again.
I got this free to review. Glad I did. Great dairy free alternative. I used it to cook a dessert and I was impressed by the taste.

Nice nice texture, thicker and more cream like than a yogurt  Very subtle flavours. Wouldnt buy at full price.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.
Smooth, white, tasty coconut flavour with a hint of vanilla. Was lucky enough to receive this free for review from Ocado.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really good rice coconut yoghurt and the vanilla comes through. The quality is excellent but it's too expensive.
I am reviewing this because I received a free sample from Ocado . Nice tasting coconut with a good hint of vanilla. Rich texture. Just too expensive to buy.
This yoghurt tasted great with a really creamy texture. My family screwed their nose up at this but once they tried it the finished the pot!!
This is delicious, I was sent it in exchange for a review.  I was going to add to my trolley again this week but £5 for 400g is just ridiculous.

I am reviewing this product as I recieved a free sample from Ocado. This is a nice tasting yoghurt. It's not sweet and it doesn't have any nasty artificial sweetners in. I would buy it again on taste.....but have just seen the price!!! It's a nice yoghurt but not worth £5 a pot!!
But expensive!
Luxury creamy taste with good coconut flavour

‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’  I do enjoy coconut based yogurts and I often buy them.  This one was rich and thick with a nice vanilla flavour.    I would buy this again.

I was sent this to review. My daughter loved it and wolfed down most of the pot, as my son and I were less keen. I like coconut and vanilla but this felt cloying, so rich and stodgy. If you like coconut milk products in general it seemed good quality but it’s not something I would buy again.
It is testy, not too sweet. But I don't understand why such expensive and organic yogurt is packed in such a bad quality plastic PET, which usually contains biosfenol A.

Sent by Ocado to review. I eat dairy and enjoy milk based yogurts, but found this to be a nice alternative. It helps that I like coconut, and this had a nice vanilla taste and the typical slightly bitter taste you get from coconut water.

we received a pot to review. I loved it but I am a fan of all things coconut. My husband who isn't such a fan said he'd eat it on his granola but prefers other brands / flavours. 
It's quite high in fat so would be a treat rather than a regular purchase.

I am reviewing this product as I was sent a free sample. We loved this! Ive tried coconut yoghurt before so I knew I would like it and it didnt disappoint. Rich and creamy and gorgeous! Bit expensive for a frequent purchase though so Ive knocked a star off for that. Recommend though! Great if you are wanting to try more dairy free options.

This was sent to me to review. Good vanilla flavour and lovely thick, creamy texture. Unfortunately I find coconut-based dairy alternatives very rich and this was no different - after a couple of spoonfuls I feel a bit sick. But if you don't have that problem this is a very good option.

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This yoghurt is absolutely delicious. I'm wary of coconut based alternatives because the flavour of coconut can be overpowering, but not in this, it's a subtle coconut with vanilla and really very delicious. The yoghurt is a thick consistency so perfect for my granola! The only issue is the price is quite heavy, however, no nasties, alternative to dairy - you do get what you pay for!
Im reviewing this as I got a free sample from Ocado. This is delicious, thick, creamy and perfect with granola. Ill definitely be buying again.

I was given this to review by Ocado. I like the taste - not too sweet, just cool, refreshing and rich. However, this is really, really high in saturated fat, for anyone like me that needs to avoid that, so for health reasons I would only buy this as a very rare treat. For me its more like two or three stars but for most people Id give it four.
I was sent this by Ocado to review. Seems a bit like pudding - went down very well, but a wee bit too vanilla-y,

’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This yoghurt is so delicious and so thick with a lovely vanilla and very subtle coconut flavour. My daughter also loved this and she is very particular about her breakfast yoghurt. It (literally) does stand up to granola or is delicious on it's own.
I would recommend but gave 4 stars as too expensive and would only buy on offer.
A bit expensive but absolutely delicious.

I was given this to review… I probably served it maybe different to what was intended but it went down a storm in our house… I used it as a topping for a veg/ bean chilli instead of soured cream…. was absolutely deliscious… added the creaminess to the dish and not overpowering… I’d definitely use this again as a soured cream substitute for vegetarian to vegan dishes.
Had oykos vegan yoghurt coconut based and the coconut in that is barely noticeable.  Shame was excited about this,  even if it was cheaper wouldn't get this one,  but that's my taste buds

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

This yoghurt is absolutely delicious, it’s smooth and creamy and doesn’t leave an after taste like many.  The vanilla is also a nice little touch…. My only negative point is the price.

I was sent this to review. Its rich and creamy with a good vanilla and coconut flavour. It is expensive and also much higher in fat than the yoghurts I normally buy ( Rachels or Yeo Valley), so I dont think I will be buying again. However, its a good choice if you want/need to be dairy free.
Delicious & I liked the addition of the vanilla bean paste but too expensive to buy regularly. This was given to review.

We had a pot to review. This is thick, rich with vanilla and coconut flavour as well as organic. All good things. We used it to replace thick cream with a rhubarb crumble and on top of breakfast bowls. All delicious. Unfortunately, Im not sure that I can afford the price of this product.

I was sent this to review. I used it to add to my smoothie. The taste was yummy and I really enjoyed the coconut flavour. It’s great that’s it’s organic! Probably not something I will buy all the time but it was a good addition to my breakfast drink
So so good. Does not contain any potato starch like other brands. I love the thickness, taste, sweetness, everything about it really, I can't fault it really, except for the price!!

Nice, but so high in price. Very rich, I can't eat this the same way I would eat yeo valley natural (dairy) yoghurt for example, or how I would eat Nush or Alpro plant based yoghurt. It's more like clotted cream or some kind of pastry cream. Goes nicely in small amounts with desserts and granola breakfasts. Nice in savoury dishes too, but honestly it's cheaper to buy tinned coconut milk (anywhere but Ocado). To answer the annoying question reciew: F.Y.I. this is basically the same taste and recipe to CoYo and both Cocos and CoYo were always dairy free. CoYo was blamed by a chain restraurant when a customer at the chain had an allergy reaction to a meal at the restaurant. CoYo was owned by the same people as Nush. Who owns Cocos Organic is not announced on their website.
The nicest yogurt alternative I have had to date but far too expensive. The only reason I bought it was because it was on a flash sale while I was checking out.

Lovely taste, VERY thick consistency so can thin with water or milk to make it go further!
Very expensive so would only buy when on offer. 
Great for allergen sufferers and bonus of no added sugars.
Is this the brand that’s taken over COYO yogurt? Haven’t tried this, I want to but I’m dairy free for my baby. Is it totally dairy free this time?
You can taste the sweet richness of the port, which for me and my friends made for a deliciously decadent experience! We had on crusty bread and it was very good indeed.

I was so disappointed in this. I bought it in a flash sale, saw the name of the product and quickly added it to my order.  Nowhere on the name or description does it say Chicken Liver and Port Parfait although that is what is on the packaging. All I could taste was the port. Very disappointing.

Ordered Liver pate but received Liver & PORT pate which was horrendous. Overpowering port taste and thus impossible to eat. I really hate food waste but sadly the Liver & Port pate went to the bin. Such a shame
I really enjoyed this pate, however very rich, may not be to everyones taste, spread reasonably thinly on a bit of sourdough toast with a few pickles, hit the spot for me.

We had this spread on toast and found it really nice, I didnt look at the other reviews before I bought it so I wasnt influenced by them. I got it in the flash sales so not so expensive. It is quite expensive full price but I will get it again.
Had to throw away 2 pots and they arrived very oxidized and when opened they had mold on the top.  Expensive waste of money.  Not recommended.
Too crumbly.  Nothing like enough butter in it, and under seasoned.  Heston Blumenthal's is 10 times better

It was darker and wetter that most liver pates, more intense in flavour but not in a good way. It wasn't smooth or buttery. We didn't want to finish it, gave a bit to out cat to try, he wouldn't touch it, although he usually loves liver. Would not be buying it again.
Yes, tasted of port but that was a perfect addition.  Slightly crumbly, but soon spread out over our toast.  We thoroughly enjoyed it.
This wasn’t to my taste at all.  It was very bitter and strong.  It  had a very strange texture, very crumbly and dry.  I wauldn’t buy it again.

I really couldn’t get on with this. I bought it as a treat, I’ve had it once and I can’t see me going back for more to be honest. There’s little butter on top and it tastes slightly earthy. Wasn’t for me.
Slightly grainy, alcohol /chicken liver ratio not quite right. Nice enough but not for the price. Much prefer the F. brand of Chicken liver pate
Quality product,beautifully packaged and tastes divine

I have recommended this product ,in the past as it was really yummy, however my last purchase was very strange, it tasted very strong to the point that it came through in my urine and did so for days, a synthetic brandy substitute taste to it, rather off putting.

In a fab Kilner style jar,  I saw this on flash offer and considered it but as I hate the taste of alcohol  (apart from very special occasions) I wasn't going to buy it, so glad I did as i will now be a regular purchaser of this product.  It has a lovely strong taste of Port which is ok with me as it goes beautifully with the fatty meaty chicken liver.  Served with a glass of fizzy raspberry and crusty bread.

Admittedly, I wouldnt buy this pâté at full price but I purchased it in a flash sale and thought it was wonderful. Really dense, full of flavour, and the addition of port gives it a hearty kick. And the little clip-lock glass jar is re-usable - five stars arent enough!
Lovely smooth pate. Expensive but worth it for the quality ingredients and great taste.
As it seems you have to read ingredients, was great taste by other family member but I didn't expected to be tasty mostly port. So be aware of the choice if you don't like the taste.
Bought this in a flash sale and it was lovely. Good texture and plenty in the jar for four lunches with toast and salad.
bought this as lowest carb pate I could find but the taste of alcohol was way too strong - then I checked and has 24% port!
and though it comes in a beautiful jar the pate is whipped so there is far less than it looks
Boozy, but not too much. Really good
This was rich and tasted beautiful initially, however the taste of alcohol became overpowering the more we ate

This is absolutely delicious. Really smooth and tasty. Yes it's got a sweet hint but not over powering. I got this on a flash sale but would pay full price for it. It's very rich so don't need loads so will last a while, plus the jar is reusable. Will definitely buy again.

Yes you can taste the port but I found this made the whole experience rich and smooth. Not sure why the other reviews are bad. Reason for losing a star is that its very expensive - perhaps without the port they could knock the price down abit!!

Reason for only a few stars is the expense and the fact it is such a huge pot.  The use by date is always within a few days of delivery and I am the only one to eat it in the house. Given the calorific and fat content I cannot get through it in time. For this reason I have started buying smaller pots from Coombe Farm which I can take out of the freezer and use when I like. Will keep this Daylesford option for Xmas only when we have enough visitors to ensure it will get eaten within the time.
We were really looking forward to this but were disappointed. It would have been a nice texture but was ruined by a taste of cheap alcohol. We had to throw it away, what a shame.

I was so excited about this but unfortunately found the port way too overpowering! Needs toning down, quite a bit. A chutney or cheese may of taken that sharp edge off but not sure that's the point - should taste good alone. Presented lovely though.

This has an extraordinary strong sweet gassy taste.  Perhaps too much port but you cannot taste anything else.  Not recognisable as chicken liver pate, but more importantly, none of 4 people could have more than one bite so went into the bin.  Daylesford need to taste this again!

We received this as a replacement for Heston's pate (our favourite, now hardly ever in stock!). It looked promising, however the flavour of port is overwhelmingly strong and left a bitter and unpleasant aftertaste.
absolutely love this!
Whackey

Thankfully I tried this before my Boxing Day guests did. Its not to my taste at all as its very bitter and leaves an after taste on your pallet. It probably needs something like cranberry jam added to it just to take that sharp edge off. Beautifully presented but disappointing in taste.
I loved this pate. So different in terms of flavour, which is rich. The pate is smooth and one of my favourites in
Nasty, doesn't remotely taste of chicken liver pate. It does taste like a fizzy drink gone bad

I thoroughly enjoy chicken liver pate but I found this one to be inedible. I was very disappointed to realise that the dominant flavour was alcohol. Either the quantity of port added was too high, or the alcohol was not evaporated during the cooking process. I had to throw it away. I would love the supplier to work on this as organic pate is hard to come by.

Very bitter - could barely taste chicken livers. Also, melted butter layer on top was left to set at an angle so half the pate surface was uncovered, which meant it didn't keep as long as it should have. If you're making premium pates or terrines you really need to get basics like that correct

Expensive! The combination of consistency, alcohol and chicken liver flavour was perfect for me.
I served on a shared platter with charcuterie and crusty bread for lunch. I will buy again but only when on offer.

Really enjoyed this. Not too much port for me - chicken livers can be too intense on their own! Rather expensive for the quantity, especially if like me you have no use for the Kilner jar. Definitely delicious though, and I will buy whenever I see it on offer.

It expiring date was only five days.

The butter that should seal the pate was in the bottom of the jar, thus unpleasant brown color.

Overpowering alcoholic taste was the only flavor.

Lack of seasoning.
Tastes bitter and just seriously unpleasant

I love everything about this pate (except perhaps the price!) Absolutely delicious on toast or crackers. Its a high quality product and the seal of organic butter over the top is also tasty- you can of course spread that on the toast as well. Great depth of flavours. I also think the kilner-type jar is really useful. Mine have been recycled to keep numerous things fresh: sugar, teabags, herbs, seeds from the garden (with a sachet of silica gel crystals included), honey, etc...  Im not suggesting other people to try this at home but Ive found that unopened jars last far longer than the suggested Use by date.  As they should, if properly sealed in the first place.
What a pity, too much Port! I think it would test much better with just a little splash of Port.

This is 24% port. t's really quite overpowering and unpleasant and ruins what I imagine would have otherwise been a really delicious, high quality pate. I will definitely not be buying this again, and in fact can't even finish this one.

When it arrived the pate was discoloured and had a very short 'use by' date. This doesn't taste like any chicken liver pate I've ever had before. a very nasty, almost bitter and sour  taste. Horrible.

This pate is delicious.  Some things in life are worth paying for, and this is one of them. I buy a pot most weeks and love it. I just wish Daylesford would use peel easy stickers. The lid sticker will not come off. Even after a long soak, there is still a sticky residue. The jars could be reusable with this small change.

Opened the jar on day it arrived and it had 'gone off'
the next day.
Also, could be much cheaper if in a less expensive
packaging.

This pate is really nice and my family enjoyed it so I will buy it again but.....£6.99 is expensive for 160g of pate.  I'm sure the cost could be reduced by packaging it in something other than a glass preserving jar.  Even a regular glass jar would be cheaper,
Love this stuff when I cant be bothered to make my own. Light and fluffy and sweet. Perfect
Rich & indulgent; a real treat. Plus Organic free range; what's not to love!
Super strong taste and not in a good way.
The best I've tasted!! Bought it on offer as quite expensive so will definitely buy it again when it becomes on offer again x
Such a shame! We love Daylesford and we love pate but this isn't good.
Have bought this many times and it is consistently good. Lovely smooth texture and yes you can taste the port but it's delicious! Would happily serve this at a dinner party it's so good.
An airy mousse, rather than a pate, that tastes of sweet port and not much else.
Horrible strange taste, not at all what I expected and far too sweet.

I tend to ignore most bad reviews of Daylesford products. We bought our first pot of this from their Kingham shop last weekend. It tastes just like the pate I remember from Providores deli in Auckland in the 70s. Perfect.

This is a very run-of-the-mill chicken liver pate. It is under-seasoned, which doesn't help. Heston's chicken liver parfait is so superior to this, that I wouldn't bother to buy the Daylesford pate again.

This doesn't taste like any chicken liver pate I've ever had before. The only good thing about it was the smoothness, a very nice melt in the mouth texture, but the flavour was so not right I couldn't get past that to appreciate the texture. First a very nasty, almost bitter taste (like pigs or lambs liver tastes if it's over cooked, school dinner style. Then overpowering sweetness of the port and no other perceptible seasoning to balance it. when I looked at the ingredients, it's 24% port, unless my eyes really are that bad! No wonder it doesn't taste like chicken liver pate. It tastes of port. All wrong. Glad I didn't pay full price, but half price was a lot to pay for a Kilner jar. I hate to throw away food, but the short shelf life and vile taste gave me little option.

When it arrived the pate was discoloured and had a very short 'use by' date. We did not try as it didnt smell good and decided not to chance it. Will stick to Hestons pate as it tastes delicious and keeps a few weeks unopened in the fridge.

I have witnessed four different reactions to this product.
My husband found the product good but slightly too sweet
Myself I would have preferred to die at a young age and have avoided this experience.
My daughter was so grossed out she had a small fit.
As for my son, I quote "UHHHHGHHH"
lovely smooth pate, really enjoyed
Just love this pate, very good flavour and very smooth and creamy. And I felt a handy size kilner jar to use for my pickles and chutneys when it's finished!
Best pate I have had in a long time. Lovely taste and very smooth. Would buy again and again!
I like the taste of this pate but it's just too dry. It needs more cream to bind it properly. I definitely wouldn't pay full price for it.
NA

I don't know if I got part of a bad batch, or whether they got shaken up too much in transit, or if this is just how they are. Either way, the "mousse" was watery and flat. since the mousse is green, it was possibly the least appetising looking thing I've ever eaten. Despite having to fight my urge to gag or throw it away, it tasted alright. Not great, but if it at least looked edible I might eat it again.
really nice... please bring them back
These are so nice. I like how the top layer is bubbly and the bottom is like standard Alpro chocolate dessert. Its a nice combination.
The first lot I had were lovely, I don’t know what happened to the second lot but they were a slimy mess. Disappointing.
Very insipid artificial with no real taste of pistachio or coconut. A tiny layer of chocolate is hidden beneath a froth of mousse- a real let down and not worth the high fat and sugar content. Avoid!
Doesn't taste of much. Very expensive for a small pot of thin, not-very-flavourful mousse with a bit of chocolate at the bottom.
very light and fluffy but no taste at all of pistachio or anything else.
The texture is like a gummy that went in the microwave, the taste of pistachio is none existent, they went in the bin. Soo disappointed.
I was very looking forward to this but unfortunately there wasnt any pistachio flavour in it. Its not inedible but therere better chocolate mousse alternatives in my opinion.
What an awful product. No taste, no nuts, no dairy, just vegan goo.

As others have said, I cannot decide if I like this or not.
It is quite small, but enough for me. However, there is no discernible taste of pistachio though the mousse has a pleasant texture.
At first I wasnt sure if I liked this or not but now I cant seem to stop buying it so I must think its good!
I really like these after a meal, they have all qualifications  of a light and tasty dessert.  I like both this one and the almond one.
Chocolate one is 10 times better. No taste of pistachio at all

I quite enjoyed the mousse, it's lovely and light and refreshing, pleasant taste.  The only slight annoyance is that the pistachio flavour is very mild, could do with boosting a lot.  It's very subtle, but then pistachio is a subtle flavouring without using artificial boosts, many pistachio ice creams have almond as a major added flavouring and I guess most people don't know that and hence the negative reviews occur.  For what it is, not too fatty, light and pleasing dessert, it was welcome.

Im confused by this mousse - I dont actually know if I like it or not!? Its very light and fluffy but theres no pistachio flavour at all, 
I could taste a very mild coconut/cocoa but thats it  meh
Nice texture but it didn't actually taste of anything
not worth it.
I am usually not a fan of mouse but this one has a really nice texture and is super tasty. Will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth, however the pistachio flavour is not very prominent
It has all the possibilities to be a healthy alternative but unfortunately very high on sugar content :(
Lovely dairy free dessert, thankfully soya-free unlike most of Alpros products. Not particularly strong on flavour, but its pleasant enough and makes a nice treat for my lactoe-intolerant husband.
I really do not know how this product has any good reviews. Its tasteless.
This mousse has a really nice texture and it's not too sweet, but it doesn't really taste like pistachio. The chocolate at the bottom is nice

Now Ive tasted this I cant live without it . Super light and fluffy pistachio mousse with a rich chocolate thicker mousse layer on the bottom . Delicious, luxurious, More-ish and vegan. This is going to be a regular purchase. Recyclable pots too.
I am on a dairy free diet and tried this to get my sweet fix. They are so nice! Really did hit the spot
I didnt expect much, but must say its really delish. Nice, smooth, creamy, light texture
lower fat than pure butter but addition of vegetable oil doesn't spoil flavour and easily spreadable as soon as take out of fridge without being sloppy.
Slips off the knife making it difficult to spread, doesnt have any real taste either, would not buy again
If you like Lurpak, this is the tops!
This has a delicious flavour, no salt and spreads straight from the fridge what more could you ask for!
Less fat, less salt. I use it for baking with excellent results, and it's delicious on toast or croissants.

What a wonderful surprise, an unsalted light spread which tastes delicious and creamy, akin to eating double cream.  Unlike other low fat spreads there is no horrid aftertaste.  Only for foodies who appreciate taste without a salt attack.
will not buy again, has no flavour!
this butter spreads straight from the fridge, which is great.
I'm always shocked when other people don't like this. in a sandwich it's the tops.. nothing else has as good a flavour or texture. it's the OG fake bacon, and i LOVE it!
Much better alternatives around. This tasted weird and had that dodgy meat substitute texture. Bottom of the pile for me.
Im glad I didnt pay full price, this isnt the greatest vegetarian bacon, I think Ill stick to turkey rashers. Theres no health quality in these either
I tried this today for the first and last time ,  i thought it was horrible.
synthetic and highly processed - not environmentally friendly. low in nutrients

Many years ago this was better and acceptable as a vegetarian bacon (there wasn't many other options!). Now it's absolutely disgusting, with a really horrible flavour and smell. The texture isn't great either but the flavour is the biggest problem! Never again

I have given this vegan bacon 4 stars because it can go a bit like cardboard if over-cooked. Gentle frying in a little oil makes it great for sandwiches or adding to carbonara. I have not noticed an overly chemical smell or taste like some reviewers have mentioned.

This used to be great. It was relatively thick and would crisp up nicely when fried. Over time though the recipe has changed and the slices have just become thinner and thinner, to the point where I cant even flip them properly in the pan without them tearing apart.

Used to love this fried crispy in a bacon sandwich but I had to throw the last one away- the bacon tasted and smelled like chemicals and was so strong it made me gag when I bit into the sandwich.  Its like my body was rejecting it. 

I checked the pack and it didnt seem different but when I checked the bacon it caused the same reaction.  Ive deleted it from my future shops as the terrible smell and taste was so wrong that it reminds me of the dead hedgehog that took a year to decompose outside Spar in 1986.  A smell Ill never forget.

This veggie bacon has a chemical back taste and was utterly disgusting. It was not out of date. I wrote to the company to let them know. Apparently, they checked the batch and said it was fine - which means THAT IS HOW IT ACTUALLY TASTES. Don't understand the good reviews on this - there is a really good veggie bacon called THIS. Delicious. I would not recommend this one.
This is my favourite vegan bacon - abd I have tried lots! Just remember to fry in a bit of oil otherwise its too dry.

I bought this bacon as an ingredient for carbonara, having decided to drastically cut down on buying meat out of concern for animal welfare. It definitely doesnt look like bacon out of the packet, but gave the carbonara a good flavour, albeit more like the flavour of Smokey Bacon crisps than real bacon.
Nice taste but then it kept repeating on me. Not something Ive experienced with other foods. Very unpleasant.
Fried till crispy. best I have had so far and will buy again.
I prefer just a little bit over 'This isn't Bacon'. Alone a bit meh, but goes well with mapple syrup, egg, or fry up mushrooms &tomatoes

Appearance - looks like a cartoon drawing of bacon.  It browns and sizzles pleasantly in a pan.
Smell - none
Taste - none, but a very pleasant texture.  

This is ok with vegan bacon flavoured mayo.  

Its pretty tasteless, I wouldnt bother buying it again.

OK so I am not vegan (or veggie) but I am always on the look out for decent vegan bacon. I like to reduce and control my meat consumption and if a decent option is there why not?
I really like this. It is smoky but not overpowering and goes very crispy. Of course it is highly processed so I don't think it is super healthy but it is a nice alternative and I prefer it to quorn 'bacon' (which I know if not vegan).

These came out in 1996, back when I had just gone vegan at 14 years old. I was so excited  (had been veggie since 93). I still love them to this day, as do many other vegans, vegideli (was redwood) were one of the first big vegan only meat substitute companies along with Lynda Mcartney's (mostly veggie) and quorn that wasn't vegan at all at the time. 

They work well fried up or chopped up small as a bacon flavour like in Bolognese or breakfast scramble. Make great BLTs and other sandwiches. And a little bit of vegan history.

Not much taste but texture was quite good. I do wish these slices did not come looking like bacon. Why dont companys manufacture them as square. I don't eat meat and do not wish to be reminded of bacon
This doesn't taste remotely like bacon, and has an unpleasant after taste.
i used it in a fry up and it tasted of nothing- it went straight to the bin.
The only thing in its favour is its lower price in comparison to other brands. It's still a waste of money though, inedible slices that won't crisp no matter how long you cook them.

Why oh Why can't anyone make a decent veggie bacon? 
Ok, so I admit I haven't eaten bacon for about 31 years but I am sure it actually used to taste of something. This was so bland it was pointless to eat it.  It also had a weird smell when cooking - a little sweet maybe? but I couldn't put my finger on it.
