If you are trying to go meat free then good on you! But this is nothing like bacon and has a really odd smell, i couldnt eat it but my husband said the taste kept repeating on him all morning. Texture is ok but i think thinly sliced tofu and a sprinke of salt fried crispy is a better option..  two stars just because its not animal.
This will be a regular for me.
Its not good cold. Eat it hot: Fry up with some oil, about 5 mins per side, with frequent turning. Ideal as a side or sandwich filling for vegetarians who miss crispy bacon!

Easy to prepare - either sling in a pan and fry for a couple of minutes - or works inside a folded flatbread and shoved in the toaster to heat through. Often need two or three slices to really fill up a sandwich or as part of a plated cooked breakfast.

Vegan bacon is vegan bacon at the end of the day. It is no pig haha. So it looks friggen adorable for a start! And it tastes just like the veggie bacon quorn used to do? Its cute its yummy, not overpowering and will definately buy again. It has no odd taste or texture either. I fried in loads of oil for about 1 minute if that and turned twice. Tastes good to me!
I love these so much, favourite veggie bacon. Not ‘realistic’ but tasty and fantastic protein content!
My son just tried this. He said if you gave me this and a piece of rubber, I wouldnt be able to taste the difference.
this was so trash I can't believe it's being sold ha
Nice crispy texture when fried but dont taste of anything.
Disappointed to learn these have Palm Oil unlike Tesco's version.

My son had this as an alternative to the Quorn Deli Bacon Rashers and he preferred it. He just had it in rolls for lunch thought it was much more like bacon (which was really the only meat he used to eat) than the Quorn.

It obviously doesn't taste exactly like the real thing, but as an alternative I think it does a really good job. Love having it in BLTs for lunch. Another advantage of this is that you don't get any of the grease or fat that comes with real bacon.
We did not like this at all. Won’t try again.

It's easy to overcook. You can just microwave it if you don't want to risk it burning. 7 rashers is an annoying pack size, but other than that, this is a great product I've been buying all the time for years.
Dont bother
I liked the texture of this, It didnt turn into cardboard like others but I found it very bland, no hint at all of bacon. There are definitely better bacon substitutes out there

Its ok- looks like bacon. Tastes ok not too bad on a bacon sandwich with sauce. Really easy to overcook literally just needs a quick fry- if you try to make it crispy it just goes hard. I would maybe buy again but not on my weekly shop
I was going to buy this but then saw that it had palm oil in it. I will look for a palm oil free alternative.
Was expecting better to be honest. Very dry and not a lot of taste. THIS isnt bacon is my favourite
Great substitute if you can't have the quorn version but is best with bread and sauce as it does go dry and you must be careful not to overcook!
Genuinely upsetting.

We have been a meat free house for about a year now and have been trying to get the best bacon alternative - and this is definitely our favourite (better than the others weve tried). Great in a bagel with some sliced toms and brown sauce!

I'm not a 100% vegan but am moving more towards that way of life. This bacon make it easier. A really good alternative providing good texture and flavour
Just dont overcook it

We used to eat bacon at least weekly and stopped for health reasons (nitrates). Recently came across this and it fills the gap nicely. Yes the texture is different but in a bap with fried mushrooms, and brown sauce, it's delicious.
My son seems to like it more than meat bacon.
This is the only one I have tried so can't compare it with other brands. It is now a weekly purchase.
Couldn't do without this meat free bacon.  Excellent bacon taste and great replacement.
I prefer quorn fake bacon. Flavour is good but texture is soft and crumbly
Fried in olive oil, smells and tastes delicious and was very crispy. Yum

Received this as a substitution. It looks incredibly unappetising with a dirty beige strip which is meant to look like bacon fat. Awful texture and dry and crumbly when cooked. I would never buy this.

This adds a nice crunchy dimension to a facon blt. It needs careful handling to not fall apart and had to be fried for much longer than the 1.5 mins advised to get nice and crunchy like real streaky bacon, but it tasted pretty good once done

I bought this to use in a lentil and bacon soup, hoping it would give a nice salty, smoky tang. Tried to fry it off with onion but it promptly disintegrated and melded itself to the entire pan, burning on until I added boiling stock and some thorough elbow grease with a scraper. After all that, it didn't add any discernible flavour to my soup.

For bonus points, the ingredients list says it's coloured with iron oxide which I strongly suspect has wrecked my favourite cookware.

This used to be great and was a staple addition to the weekly order. Weve recently tried other brands but came back to this as its easy to order. However - something has obviously changed. Less slices in the pack is one thing, but to change the texture and taste? Not good. This now falls apart before its added to the pan. The only remaining member of the family who still hoovers it up with gusto is Eamonn. The cat.

I cook this with a little bit of oil on a high heat on both sides.

Then rest for a few minutes, add back to the pan and watch it crisp up! And its perfect everytime.

Its versatile and even works on pizza and cut up into strips in eggs.
It used to be good, but now taste is horrible, went straight to bin.

These used to taste really nice but now they taste like dog food. They used to hold really well together but now it just crumbles when you hear it in pan. Also they used to have 7 in a pack but now there are 6. Less bacon that tastes rank
Was looking forward to this as it was described as tasty! When I opened the pack it smelled like dog food and tasted like dog food waist of money wont be buying it again sorry

I loved the texture of these, I have been veggie for about 8 years but they definitely tasted the same as I remember bacon to taste. The Quorn bacon tasted too fake to me. These crisp up nicely, perfect in a sandwich!
It smells like dog treats and tastes worst.

Expected this to taste just like the Quorn Veggie bacon, but this had about 10% of the flavour. It was also tough and chewy, may aswell have chewed on some cardboard, so disappointed because I wanted to like it.

Awfully disappointing. A friend recommended it so I thought Id try it as part of a mock BLT. Tough shoe leather texture, tasteless. Next time Ill just enjoy the lettuce, tomato and mayo sandwich gave the rest of the packet to my friend! Yuk!!
I am trying to be vegan and like alot of vegetarians and the like..I miss my bacon.  This is loverleeee.

Ive never had real bacon, but always enjoyed the smoky taste of frazzles crisps and fake bacon. Since changing from vegetarian to vegan nearly two years ago and finding I couldnt have the own brand or Quorn because they have milk or egg in, Ive been buying this instead (mainly when it is on offer because otherwise I think it is a bit pricey!). Vegideli also do a maple flavour version which is nice. I put it in pasta but mainly use for a quick butty. The only reason I havent given 5 stars is because sometimes there are bits of the slices missing, there are only 7 pieces (why not 8?!) and they sometimes fall apart when you separate. But tasty!

We always found the Tesco frozen veggie bacon the best, but since going strict vegan, we can't have it as it contains egg. This is a good 2nd choice if you want a "naughty" something with your cooked brekkie. Great with mushrooms, tomatoes and brown sauce.
Love this. Perfect in a bacon sarnie.

Note to self: Remember that fake meats are usually a bit rubbish.

This though, is absolutely terrible!

Smells like dog treat ...never liked bacon before so maybe thats why Im not a fan...possible nice cooking with some other flavours and maple syrup....not likely to buy again sadly but for people that loved bacon you would probably like this...hold your nose though

Ive tried Quorn bacon and its not quite right. This cheatin bacon which I cooked slightly longer then recommended time was above and beyond best alternative Ive ever tried in 20+ years of vegatrianisim! I WILL be buying it again!! (Ps.off to make a second sarnie now!! Lol!)
I was really sceptical about these with how they look but on a BLT they are really nice, will defiantly buy again.
I fried and put them in a pasta. They were nice enough mixed with lots of other tasty ingredients and with the vegan soya cream. I will try on their own in  a sandwich next time. Bit smelly!!
My husband says no flavour and like eating thin cardboard. So wont be buying these again.
These are the worst fake bacon I have tried. Stick to Quorn or Tesco own brand which have much more flavour and a nicer texture.

Its much nicer than the quorn one. I had a bad batch recently though, typically when it was on offer 3 for £6, and they all fell to bits and were impossible to separate the rashers. I usually fry it for a cooked breakfast.

This is the best veggie/vegan bacon weve found so far, really crisps up nice and tastes lovely in a bacon sandwich. Ive also used it to top a veggie pizza base, with the vegan crispy duck, it makes a great veggie meat feast pizza, even my carnivore hubby likes it.
The worst thing Ive ever put in my mouth didnt even warrant a chew I bit this and spat it out so disgusting! Smelt like dog food!
These smelt like chemicals. Looked synthetic. I started frying them but the smell was too much. They went straight in the bin. Not one for our household.
I cannot stress enough how disgusting these rashers are. I'd rather eat cardboard. Even the dog hated them.
I didn't like these at all. Really disappointed.

This used to be the best fake bacon on the market, but like so many Vbites products since a certain person bought the company, the recipe has changed for the worse. It now has an overpowering taste of cloves and cinnamon which ruins it!
Best "fake bacon" I've tasted, will definitely be buying again. Only downside is they're a little hard, but doesn't put me off.
Me and my daughter just love these.
Didn't like it at all, won't be buying this again
palm oil again! Nope not buying this. i like Orangutans

Too many veggie products try to taste overpoweringly like pork but these don't. It's difficult to cook them just right m and they can get cold quickly but brushing with oil again at the end tends to help.
Yuck.
lovely in wraps and pastas or a lovely morning facon sandwich x

These don't taste exactly like bacon, I think that flavour and texture is almost impossible to recreate, but these are very tasty.
Fry them for more than the recommended 1.5 minutes, to make the edges crispy and give you memories of a bacon sarnie from the local greasy spoon. Low in calories and fat, too.
Perfect for the veggie or vegan who loves the taste of meat, but hates the process behind it.

These vegan bacon rashes are simply  delicious. They have all the taste of bacon but without the fat. I like them on a wholemeal slice of bread with some mustard, accompanied by a vegetable and pasta salad and some cherry tomatoes. Makes a delicious, light and healthy meal.
Delicious. Simples!

Having tried and enjoyed VBite's chicken style pieces, and being a bacon addict, I thought I'd try these. They say that you take the first bite with your eye's, and my eyes were asking me whether we'd bough rolled PlayDo bacon. It didn't get much better having eaten some of this 'facon'. It has the artificial flavour of 'bacon' flavoured crisps and the moth-feel of one those shoe freshener inserts. This is certainly not a good substitute for bacon; but if you want to cut down on your meat consumption or spice up your vegan diet, and you don't mind bacon crisps, these will do. Just don't fool yourself into thinking you'll sate any bacon cravings with these.

I eat a lot of vegan products (was vegan for a few months last year and trying to go back to it) and had high hopes for these as other Vegideli products have been good and based on the good reviews. Firstly they looked terrible but that's OK, a lot of vegan meat replacements don't look that great before cooking. Then I started to fry them and the smell was awful, like I was frying something inedible. Still, I thought they might taste good anyway. No, awful, the worst vegan food I have ever eaten, the second bite was the end for me, I can't even describe the awful taste. Maybe the other reviewers are doing something different but I will never buy these again.
As a vegan, I love these streaky style rashers which are a staple breakfast for me
I love these! Better than real bacon for me as they go super crispy if you leave them to cook a little longer! Yummy!

Really nice vegan bacon. Perfect for sandwiches and breakfasts. Nice but not perfect in pasta dishes. 

Be careful when frying to crisp, they can become like shrapnel quickly and will take chunks out of your gum.
Recently purchased these and boy have they changed. The slices seem thinner than before and break up in to pieces during frying.
I've tried them all - this is the nearest thing to what I remember from my carnivore days!
Oh wow I have missed a decent vegan bacon since morninstar disappeared. I was not disappointed. fried and then in a bagel with mayo, Mrs Balls Peach Chutney and salad .........
Best Vegan Bacon Ever!
Great vegan product
made even better by being vegan.

If you keep your eyes shut tight and think about nothing but bacon while eating, they actually quite nice. Would have been 5 stars, but the shock I got when I first laid eyes on them deems it a 4 star product.

Its great when you fancy a bacon roll. 

Dont let the look put you off. Give them a try!
I wish Ocado stocked moe Redwood products as they are outstanding and contain no animal products making them suitable for vegans and those with an egg allergy unlike many vegetarian products

wont please a meat eater but if like me you are long time veggy it solves those cravings when you fancy a bacon sarnie but cant . Better than frozen stuff , which is impossible to make into rashers and I much prefer the taste of this to quorn .
Texture is not like bacon but that's true of all the veggie bacons I've tried. Flavour is good though. I just wish they would put an even number of slices in the pack.

I love this 'facon' so much, it makes a great bagel filling for breakfast or lunch.  Even my bacon loving friends have tried it and were surprised how good it really is.  Vegan, ethical, and delicious!  What more can you ask for?

Veggie bacon is a very individual thing - what some love others will hate. We like this vegan product - in addition to liking the taste,  it is not as tricky to get right in the cooking as some and not being frozen, no problems separating the rashers.

Tasteless and have a strange texture.

Plenty more vegan alternatives out there that are edible at least.

Avoid.
odd for a vegetarian to eat "bacon" but if cooked gently they taste good, just dont over cook. I have a vegan friend who brings these to BBQs!
This is a great veggie alternative to bacon-fab in sandwiches, try with avacado and mayonaise. Not as salty/thirst inducing as some other veggie bacons.
I gave it to my dog.  the only decent "fake" bacon is made by Pepperidge Farms which is only made in USA.
not overly smokey, and nicer texture than others
great for vegans or veggies, in salads in sandiwches, with a full english veggie grill up....superb. tnx for stocking it...us vegans get rather ignored by the big supermarkets.

I felt sure this would be like all other veggie meats - bland and so unlike meat, however, I was very surprised. As someone who does eat meat but only organic/free range I do like veggie options but obviously have taste buds atuned to meat. It does not look very tasty but is very tasty and great for "bacon" sandwiches!

Not that our local organic deli won't get our custom any more (they do sell fabulous bread) but it's useful for this to be available from Ocado so thanks.
Only quibble is - why do the manufacturers call it 'streaky-style' when there ain't no streaks! Surely more like back bacon? Although to be fair it's only an approximation of real bacon - but it's the best veggie alternative.
I've placed so many product requests for this and other redwoods foods. This has just made my food shopping so much easier!

Thank you for stocking this bacon. My daughter's a vegan, and Redwoods is the only make she can have, as Quorn and Tivall products have egg in. This bacon's not just for vegans though - it's delicious and everyone in the family eats it - even my husband who scoffs at vegan food. Please stock more Redwoods products.
Went down well with the kids!
recommend these
My daughter loves these, she has one every day in her packed lunch.  They are good value too.
These disappear as soon as they are delivered! My kids love these

We purchase these every week. They are really reasonably priced and they always have great offers on them too. They are perfect for lunch boxes and are firm favourites in our house. The best before date is always good too
best frozen as ice lolly. contains added sugar but is source of calcium. portion size adequate.
These work really well if you freeze them, they can be eaten like ice pops but with extra calcium!
My son love banana flavour  you should  do whole pack of banana yogurt

It always annoys me that in Europe they get quite alot of banana flavours yogurts... I love them.
So great to find some banana yoghurt.. Now all I need is a set banana yoghurt and I'd be in heaven...
Daughter doesnt usually like banana flavour things but these were a winner. Not massive so good to have with some fruit instead of one or the other.
Nice taste but with more sugar and fat than the tubes I was expecting something more luscious but instead they're watered down, thinner, less luscious.

Kids love it, no mess or faffing with a spoon. They go perfect in their lunchboxes I pop them in frozen in the morning and it keeps everything cool and is back to yogurt by lunchtime. They also love the characters on them, Minions, Angry birds etc. Oh and they taste nice - I may or may not have tried them multiple times just to 'check' they're okay!
I love cold brew, and this one is good, refresh and nice cucumber favour
I like the flavour and it is strong enough to get a good taste of it, as their other cold infusions are a bit weak tasting. Perhaps add some mint to the flavour too?

I like this tea but have to use twice as many sachets compared to the other 2 flavours which are also lovely. Thumbs up for plastic-free packaging - the main reason I'd never buy from Twinings and Tetley again.

I was really excited about trying this despite the other rather negative reviews. It appears they were pretty spot on. I found the water to mildly taste of anything at all and that was after leaving it overnight in my water bottle. Maybe it's designed for smaller water bottles, not sure. Most likely going to pass on this in the future.
They were not bad but they were not good either, definitely lacking in flavour and abusively overpriced. No thank you.
I absolutely love plain water more than any other drink and thus could not persuade me any different. Not for me but for those who do like cordial or flavoured waters then worth a try.
Very refreshing and a nice change to plain water. However the pricepoint is expensive therefore I am not sure I would purchase again unless on offer.
Lovely flavour to add to my water. My young grandson liked the taste also, I was happy to give it to him as it's caffeine free!
This makes a refreshing drink, nice alternative to water whilst still adding to your daily recommended water intake. A little on the expensive side however.

I received these free to review.

On opening the box you can really smell the apple and cucumber flavour, its lovely.  The tea on brewing is a delicate flavour and for me I thought this was a good alternative to flavouring water. I was glad to see no caffeine !!

Would I buy them - possibly only as a treat as they are expensive for my shopping tastes just as a water flavourer

Sent to review. Firstly, I enjoy drinking water so I wouldn't be looking for something to flavour it with to encourage me to drink more. I tried it in a pint glass of water and I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed the flavour. It is a mild flavour, but I don't like fruit teas usually, so I probably wouldn't have enjoyed a stronger taste. So overall I liked the flavour and will use the rest of the box, it but I wouldn't buy it again as plain water is fine by me!
I tried this on my cold water bottle ....refreshing drink especially during the hot weather. However, we tried it with hot water and this is much preferable for us.
this tea was ok . not the best. wouldn't purchase again
I was sent these to review and really didn't enjoy them at all - extremely expensive way to flavour water and didn't like the flavour anyway
Ok for something a bit different the flavour is quite mild, only gave 3 stars as I think they are overpriced

I received this for review.  I could smell the apple before I even opened the box.  You can smell the cucumber in the background.  I found the overall smell so unpleasant I didn't even use it, I gave the box away.  Even if I liked it I think it's way overpriced for what it is and wouldn't buy it.
Very light, refreshing flavour.  I would think you could drink a lot of this if you needed to.  I prefer hot brewed herb or fruit bags left to cool.  Very expensive.  Would not buy again

I was sent these to review. The taste was overwhelmingly apple, not unpleasant, and the bags are useful for travellers. However, they are expensive and if at home I would add fresh fruit to a jug of water instead.
Was sent this for free to try it. Quite nice if you follow the instructions to the letter. Wouldn’t buy again.
Very expensive for 10 bags. Im happy to pay for teapigs tea bags, but Id rather put fresh mint and apple in a jug and drink that.

I usually enjoy my tea hot so assumed this would be like a watered down juice, really surprised as the flavours come through nicely and being cold means its quite refreshing, not personally to my taste but the family enjoyed. Was sent the product to review

Good environmental credentials but expensive for just ten bags. We tried it in a 500ml jug of cold water for the recommended time but it just made the water slightly flavoured.
Husband said it tasted like drinking water out of a glass that had had something in before. The smell seemed artificial even though it says natural flavourings. You are better off putting slices of apple and cucumber in the jug. I can see if you are travelling they could be handy.

Received these free for review. Really quite like them although I wouldnt say that the flavour is overtly apple & cucumber. Quite expensive for the number of bags in a pack although I think you could use them to infuse more water than it states. Works well with still or sparkling water. Would probably try the alternative flavours if they were on offer.
Not normally a fan of this kind of thing, but pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it!
Got these to review. Quite nice on a hot day like today. Not sure Id pay full price for them though, hence the 4 stars
This cold tea has a fresh, crisp flavour, not sweet at all, and it grew on me. A pleasant tea for a hot day, especially.
Creamy and not too sweet.  It reminds me of being on holiday in Madeira!
I love them. Perfect size and taste good
Not as nice as the strawberry version, but good balance between yoghurt and compote.

Despite there being no labels online and the yoghurt is not tagged, these yoghurts in fact are "may contain gluten, egg and nuts". Do not order if you have an allergy to any of these or coeliac disease. I have made a complaint and hope that the labelling is changed.

Nice thick creamy yoghurt, the fruity peach layer is just the right amount.
Thankfully they now replaced the white pots with clear ones.
We always get these every week. Perfect size and great taste!
Rich, creamy tasty yoghurt. Lovely little sweet treat

Gave this a try and LOVE it!  I like the fruit part separate and this is lovely creamy yoghurt with decent thickness with a decent amount of fruit at the bottom not overly sweet.  Ordering some more so definitely recommend this!
Lovely fruity peach flavour and creamt yogurt. Regular purchase

Definitely will buy again
Smooth! Tasty!
Thick and lovely and great peach flavour.
Thick, fruity and unctuous - a real treat and great when on offer!
One of our favourite yogurts in this household! Not too sickly sweet but nice enough if you fancy a treat.
This must  be one of the best yoghurts I've had. Amazing to get it at half price - I've ordered more this week while the offer's on.

Im not the biggest fan of yoghurt normally but its easy at your desk, these are really nice though!The fruit at the bottom is lovely and generous, the yoghurt is a good creamy texture too. Will be buying again.
Really creamy and delicious, with a good amount of fruit at the bottom. Yum.
absolutely georgous My favourite now Love the thickness and very creamy Can't help myself but have 2 in one go!
favourite yoghurt.  the top yoghurt is so thick and creamy.  I have to have 2 for my desert.
Its deliciously think and creamy. A family favourite!
Not great but not bad. I really like peach/apricot flavoured yoghurts but this lacked a definite flavour. It could have been any fruit pulp. Not unpleasant though it just didn't set me alight.

Carageenan and modified.
Hate that I ever bought these for my family.
Sticking to decent organic yoghurt in future!
Big fan. Love the thickness and the fruit tastes good too.
Nice yogurt but the fruit tasted like eating canned peaches.
Have tried many Greek style yoghurts but this is in a class of it's own. Gorgeous creamy and thick yoghurt with just the right amount of fruit.
barebells is, in my opinion, one of the best quality protein snacks out there. Tasty, no nasty aftertaste, and best of all, it doesn't upset my stomach like other protein brands.

This tasted like melted vanilla ice cream. I have trouble meeting my protein requirement and also have a sweet tooth so these are perfect
.

Im fairly new to this protein malarkey but I can honestly say these shakes are a GAMECHANGER for me. They are delicious, not at all grainy and with none of the tang of all the other premium shakes Ive tried. It feels like a treat to be downing one of these after exercise, I couldnt recommend these enough.
Best protein shake Ive ever had! 10/10
Really nice taste and perfect consistency If you are not watching calories and prefer a thicker drink...its even nicer blended with ice cream.
This shaw is really yummy and makes a nice healthy after-gym drink

Dinky little bottle of unrecycled but recyclable plastic with cool Americana-style design in lovely shades of cream and blue. Tastes not too strongly of vanilla nor sickly sweet and is a good creamy milk texture, like dilute custard, rather than a thick Frijj-style drink. Interestingly made in Austria.
This shake didn't taste like a typical protein shake as it was flavoursome and smooth. Bit too expensive for a regular purchase though.
Pleasant tasting protein shake, handy when a meal replacement is required when travelling.
Lovely smell and an even better taste .. a lovely milkshake!
how good can a vanilla milkshake be? very good is the answer! so creamy and delicious, can't even notice it's a protein shake! a must must try!
A lovely tasting protein shake - really enjoyed it and will buy this again
This tasted surprisingly good,  pleasant experience would recommend

I really like this protein shake, much nicer than the powdered variety that you make up yourself. Vanilla taste is just right without being too sweet. Great meal replacement on the run or as a post workout protein fix. I would definitely consider buying this (received it free to review) once in a while, and would love to try a chocolate flavour if there is one!
Received as a trial, much nicer than expected! Pleasant vanilla flavour and not too sweet, thumbs up from me

Smooth texture and nice to drink chilled. Handy that it can be stored at room temperature unopened. I wasn't convinced that the protein you get from the product was worth all the sweeteners it seems to contain, as I found it much too sweet. Kids tried it too and loved it, however! I received this product for free to review, but would be unlikely to buy again, especially at full price.
I liked this shake. It is quite sweet and tastes mainly of vanilla.

I was sent this gratis to review. I simply used it as a meal replacement as I am not fit for the gym at the mo. It tastes much better than protein powders I have used before. And convenient in that it is ready-mixed (more plastic though). I will definitely explore this range when I get back into a regular routine at the gym.
As a high protein shake, I was expecting this to taste a little funky, but actually, its really tasty! Not overly sweet, with a pleasant vanilla tang.
Surprisingly tasty, nice vanilla flavour, not too thick.  No weird protein flavour.
The taste is so yummy ! Like the one I was drinking when I was little kid !
Nice strong, but not overpowering vanilla flavour and not too sweet.  Very nice.

I absolutely love these brioche - due to my disability, I can often struggle with breakfast foods as they are too taxing on my jaw. These brioche have become my new go to as they are super soft and taste delicious (I like mine with Nutella). They definitely pass the I cant believe its gluten free test

I have bought this previously as both my daughter and I are intolerant to gluten. But when I tasted one from the pack that came with today's delivery, it had an overpowering chemical smell and taste, which made me spit it right out again.The taste lingered for a long time, despite brushing my teeth. We definitely won't purchase this product in the future.
We like these..make cheat iced buns..sometimes go mouldy before date..buy on offer..

Like these very much, over time , I’ve bought several packs. They store well for ages and come in 2 handy packs of 2 joined together which can easily be cut apart. After opening, I store them in the fridge. They are a bit too sweet for me. But  I’ll keep them in mind for enjoining a strawberry & cream tea.

This is such a good substitute for gluten containing sweet brioche. I’d highly recommend this to anybody, it far exceeded my expectations. I’m also dairy intolerant and team this with Jim jams vegan chocolate hazelnut spread. It’s a match made in heaven!
I find that these rolls are really good with half a hot dog...if only they were big enough for the full hot dog.

I was sceptical to try these as they have very mixed reviews, but I decided to give it a try. I used these to make hotdogs with and I am happy I gave them a try. 

The buns are soft and sweet, reminds me of a brioche bun. Looking forward to making ice buns next.
I have these for a quick breakfast sometimes adding Sweet Freedom chocolate spread or Scarlett & Mustard rhubarb & vanilla curd. Anything slightly sweet works better.
Really didnt enjoy this brioche, it tastes very synthetic for some reason and way too sweet when being baked. Also their size for the price you are paying is ridiculous.
delicious
What a shame that food for celiacs is more expensive but often made with second rate and unethical ingredients.
I used to buy These every week but the past few times theyve been undercooked. Ick!

I opened the pack intending to have one with cheese spread....well that went out of the window! I scoffed the lot. Lovely, soft, sweet brioche, not too buttery or greasy, a nice, quality product with the advantage of long shelf life
So glad to have found a gluten free bread product my friends can happily eat when they stay. According to them, it's like normal brioche with a lovely texture.

I often find wheat and gluten free products are a compromise for the real products but these brioche rolls are not a compromise. Nice soft texture, easy to spread topping on and delicious to eat with filling or even alone!

These rolls are delicious and I only reason I shop with Ocado. 

They havent been in stock for ages ....whats the story Ocado?
Lovely as a treat. Dip in hot chocolate!
These were delicious. I lightly toasted mine and spread them with a dairy free spread and marmalade. Could do with being twice as big and half the price though.

First choice with both my children and one isn't on a gluten free diet and is a very fussy eater so that's saying something. Slightly sweet, small rolls adored by the kids for breakfast or packed lunches or for tea!
Great taste!
Very like a sweet brioche. Can't stop eating them!

I loved the texture and taste of these rolls but unfortunately, for me, they were too sweet for savoury fillings.

I will continue to use DS Ciabatta rolls for savoury sandwiches and use these sweet rolls for breakfast with marmalade, jam or peanut butter on.
My 2 1/2 yr old coeliac daughter really likes these rolls, they are soft and slightly sweet. Ideal for little hands. Nice texture for GF bread and make a change from sliced bread.
These rolls are soft and sweet but small and work with most fillings including hot bacon. They also somehow manage not to be gritty which most gluten free breads are.

I can't get these in my local waitrose anymore, but my gluten-free son won't eat anything else in his school lunches. Simply the best bread product out - goes well with both sweet and savory fillings. Soft and delicious.
Lovely flavour, great colour and not too fizzy so suits being a mixer or drink as it is. Refreshing
Stevia may be a natural sweetener but it still tastes revolting. I used to love San Palagreno but I won't be buying any again.
This tastes very little of fruit and overwhelmingly of artificial sweeteners. Buy the "Original Taste" version if you want something that actually tastes of orange and has fewer laxative effects...

I used to love this. Then the food police decided to ruin it with the horribly artificial tasting natural sweetener stevia. This is not a cheap soft drink and is marketed as a adult premium soft drink. We adults should be allowed to decide if we want to pay more for real sugar.
Love this flavour can really taste the orange and quenched the thirst
used to be amazing, now just tastes of sweetners with a hint of orange. would pay extra to have a full sugar version
I liked the taste of this to start with but after a while it was a little too sweet
they taste very nice and dont have much sugar
Bought as part of a promotion. Very nice
Bought this product as part of a promotion.  But I enjoyed this drink and will buy again.
Nice zinny drink, it was refreshing and I loved the flavour. I would buy again. Bought as part of a promotion.

They ruined this and all the other san pellegrino sodas by using artificial sweetener. After this change of formula the sodas all taste like any other artificially sweetened drink. Why not give consumers a choice by offering this alongside of the classic version? Artificial sweeteners don't taste nice at all. For those of us who are cutting back on sugar, simply enjoy beverages like these less often rather than ruin them
Mixed reviews in our household. One loved but I wasn’t so keen (a bit bitter for my taste)
Love the flavour and the brand, not too sweet, enjoyed by the whole family!
A nice change to find a fizzy drink that isn’t cola like. Has a nice blood orange taste.
I don't normally like drinks that aren't sugary but I loved these. Fab flavour and can hardly tell it's not sugar.
This is my favourite of the San pellagrino flavours. It’s refreshing especially on a hot day.
Very refreshing. Great flavour, for me the best in San Pellegrino range. I bought it as part of a promotion.
The citrus makes this a wonderful refreshing drink over ice or mixed with your favourite gin. Wonderful.
We all enjoyed this flavour. Great for a relaxing summer day. We always buy the lemon flavour but we will add this one next time. I bought it as part of a promotion

This was a lovely refreshing fizzy drink. It has a pleasant citrus peel taste to it. I just drank it over ice.
This product was bought as part of a promotion.

First time trying this drink. Never tried blood orange before but I personally prefer normal orange flavour.  Good full size cans of fizzy blood orange pop. If you like blood oranges you will probably like this. This product was brought as part of a promotion.
I like that it isn't sweet and it is really nice over some ice
They are so refreshing after a long days work and to enjoy in the sun, they are packed full of flavour and have a authentic taste

I usually only drink sugar free drinks, but this was a nice alternative. Subtle orange flavour and a nice amount of fizz. Great to enjoy ice cold sat in the sunshine and not diluted by melting ice cubes.
Loved these cans of juice. Really refreshing, nice taste and quite low calorie. Bought as part of a promotion.
I got this on offer but have been buying it for years as I love the flavour!
Bought it for the first time and really enjoyed it during hot days. The drink comes refreshing, tangy and fizzy enough just like expecting from Sanpellegrino.
We had these with orange gin, tasted lovely.
we quite enjoyed this, its a richer flavour compared to orangeade or similar brands. All in all we would have again, maybe wasn't too keen on it having sweetener is the only minus.
This drink quenched my thirst, perfect in this hot weather.  Enjoyed the flavour but would only buy if this was on offer.  Bought as part of a promotion.

Being a big fan of the San Pellegrino drink brand I gave these a try when on offer.  The blood orange taste is perfectly balanced (for my taste buds) and gives an extra zing to the usual orange flavour.  A firm favourite with me.

This sparkling orange drink is very refreshing and the flavour is more pleasant than that of standard orangeade drinks. It would make a good mixer for spirits but is also nice on its own. 
Bought as part of a promotion.
Good when on promotion. Thirst quenching during summer months. Would buy again!

Whilst I am a big fan of San Pellegrino (particularly the lemon flavour) I was a bit underwhelmed by the flavour of this and felt it lacked the punchiness of fruit that I’d normally expect from a San Pellegrino drink. It’s by no means unpleasant but it isn’t something I would necessarily buy again.
Quick easy and amazing for my kids highly recommend.
I really enjoyed this drink - summery and really refreshing.
Hubby really enjoyed these. Pleasant orange flavour without too much sugar
THIS IS ORANGE WITH A HINT OF BLOOD ORANGE. IT USED TO BE A FAVOURITE OF MINE BUT IT'S LOST ALL IT'S FLAVOUR.

Nice flavour and a great taste. Would recommend.

This product was bought as part of a promotion.
So fruity and refreshing on hot days. My favourite of the San Pellegrino sparkling drinks
Couldnt agree more with all the nagative reviews. Completely disgusting fake sugar taste, waste of money

I didnt think to check ingredients when ordering as very busy Xmas order but just opened a can, was really looking forward to alternative to alcohol but the new taste is utterly vile.  I would rather pay the sugar tax for the rare times I  drink this.  Will not buy again.
This is really good - happily recommended
I was very disappointed to find that the recipe has changed.   Stevia tastes as artificial as the artificial sugars and it leaves a lingering nasty after taste.

I have always been a fan of Aranciata Rossa and can’t get enough of these. Great blood orange flavour and just enough fizz, they are such a refreshing alternative to other soft drinks. Always in our fridge!

I ordered this two separate times thinking Ocado had sent me the diet version instead of the regular version. Turns out the formula/recipe has changed and its no longer made with only sugar- it has steviol and sweeteners which change the taste. Too bad as I used to order this all the time and make blood orange martinis! The product description should be updated to say this is a tastefully light product so as not to confuse those of us who prefer the original.
Now have sweeteners and taste awful. They should make it clear on the packaging and on this website too.
Foul aftertaste with a hint of blood orange. Throwing five and half cans away after first sip.
You can taste fruit not just sugar. A favourite in our house.
Just found out this is part of Nestle.  Won't be buying again.

I thought I would weigh in as well, maybe someone will take notice. This was my favourite drink before they switched to new formula. If we went out to Pizza Express Etc, this would be my drink, I loved it, a sugary posh treat instead of a Diet Coke, because the flavour was sweet, unique and refreshing. Sugary yes, but sooo nice. Now it is ruined. the first one I ordered after the change, I knew instantly. it was bad. I had hoped Id accidentally been given a diet version, but no, the new formula has stevia in it, which I actively avoid in all drinks and food. I have a stomach issue in which if I eat a sweetener ending in ol, like xylitol, steviol, etc, I get quite severe IBS, and now it is sneaking into everything. I have to read every food label, even ones previously thought safe. This drink is no longer refreshing, its bitter and artificial and saccharin, leaving a horrible aftertaste in your mouth. It used to be beautiful. I no longer buy these. Unless you want a posh Lilt, avoid.
And then they put artificial sweeteners in it. Grim. I would pay extra to have the sugar back!
Put the sugar back in it! Tastes awful, will not buy again

This used to be a treat for me, now the flavour has been ruined by replacing sugar with artificial sweeteners just to avoid the sugar tax. I would have paid a little extra to keep the old recipe. Not buying it anymore.
We still love it. Hadn't even noticed the change
I completely agree with previous reviewers - what was the best soft drink available has been completely spoilt. Will certainly not buy again unless they revert to the original formula.
Absolutely agree with the majority of comments here.  Used to be a fantastic drink, now ruined.  Still expensive but now now worth it save your  money.
Love the taste

I absolutely loved this drink, it was my go to choice of fizzy beverage. The last time I bought it I couldnt finish it and couldnt figure out why.
Have since discovered that to get around the sugar tax they have started using artificial sweetener. It really has changed the taste. 
I will not be buying this anymore unless they change the recipe back. Such a shame as it was the best! I hope they listen to their customer feedback. I wouldnt even mind a small price increase to go back to the original version.

awful cheap tasting nestle drink
don't buy nestle
All the family love these drinks, we each have a different favourite though and this one is mine

As others have said, this used to be a once a week treat as it was so delicious pre-Sweetener days. It has now been ruined and I wont buy it any more. Same goes for all the San Pellegrino drinks. They all have a horrible bitter aftertaste.

This was a huge family favourite, so delicious and refreshing. I'd buy it over cider, what a lovely treat. I was wholly aware it contained loads of sugar, and wasn't bothered by it. Would pay the sugar tax as it's a premium soft drink and I liked it just as it was. The new version with steviol has awful after taste, a bit like it's spiked with aspirin. I'll never buy this version again.

I thought other reviewers were being too precious but no, this has been ruined.
We did not drink this because it was healthy, we drank it as a treat because it was amazing. I am all for a sugar free version but we should be able to choose. As someone who doesnt drink alcohol, this was one of lifes little pleasures but it has sadly gone

I now have ten cans of this I can't drink because some Nestle employee has completely convinced themselves there's no difference between sugar and other sweeteners.  What has happened is the equivalent of diet coke suddenly being sold in red tins  as regular coke, with no choice give.  A simple pleasure removed, because we're being treated like children.
Following the recipe change its gone from delicious to really unpleasant - artificial, metallic tasting. What a shame, a great drink ruined. I won't buy this again.

Sadly spoiled by sweeteners, used to be fantastic. Agree with all the recent reviewers.
Particularly affects the blood orange version, less noticeable with the lemon one due the the extra sharpness masking it somewhat.

This is supposed to be an all-natural, premium product; I used to love this and regularly bought the whole range - now it's ruined with artificial sweeteners. I don't care if Steviol is "natural" it tastes awful and just as bad as cheap own-brand pop. Will never buy again.
Wont be purchasing drinks with artificial sweeteners - bring back the recipe with sugar
Yet another drink ruined by the recipe change to sweetners.

Bought as a treat for a long road trip recently and everyone noticed it tasted different.  Yep, the buggers have gone and put sweeteners in it. Yuck.  We had to throw most of the unfinished cans away and we normally LOVE the stuff.  A complete disappointment, the kids felt really cheated.  Six less customers in one fell swoop.  D'oh for you San Pellegrino.

The original was sparkling blood orange this new one is ORANGE & sparkling blood orange, if youve ever tried San pans orange its so bitter and thats why the new one is so bitter and terrible tasting! I buy from else where now because the original is still available to buy but I have now learnt my lesson and read the label properly because to they do look identical.

its the only fizzy drink we ever have!  it was our little sugar treat once in a while - we don't have any other fizzy drinks in the house!  Now it is ruined...  Steviol Glycosides might be "from natural" sources but it is a terrible formulation and tastes like crap. i just googled and the CEO said - "it tastes every bit as good as the one it is replacing".... lies! its horrendous and they didn't even have the decency to tell us - or say there is a new formula.  had to find out as i spat it out of my mouth.

Used to really like this product. New recipe is disgusting and an insult that they say this product has been tested to ensure no change to taste. Well done to avoid paying some tax you’ve lost loyal customers. Won’t be buying again
The new recipe uses artificial sweeteners and has a sticky chemical aftertaste. Great if you like artificial sweeteners. Awful if you want a refreshing fruit drink. Wont buy again.
Bought this for years, won't ever buy again! Agree with other customer reviews. Such a shame.
Oh dear, used to be a lovely drink that stood out from other brands. Once again sweeteners have destroyed a classic.

Sanpellegrino was one of the few fizzy drink treats that my children have for special occasions because the ingredients were not too bad and we do not consume artificial sweeteners. 
I will not be buying anymore because of this.

Yet another drink that has been completely ruined by the addition of artificial sweeteners, in this case Steviol. Seriously, the last of the truly iconic premium soft-drinks now tastes as disgusting as a cheap low-end supermarket own brand.
Now tastes disgusting
Its so fake and synthetic. None of its original gusto and flavour. Plus its full of dangerous sweetness. A bit of sugar once in a while is ok.
The recipe was simple and lovely before now though the stevia /steviol glycosides addition means that my mouth itches like a bad case of the pox . Thanks for ruining yet another drink for me
Tastes horrible yet another drink ruined thanks to the nanny state!

Won't be buying any of them again. I have to avoid sweeteners. I don't drink much fizzy stuff but enjoyed these now and again as a treat. So sad. I would rather pay extra for something and have it less often. I am an adult and capable of making my own choices thanks.
Big Brother. Sugar Tax. Now it's now gross. Don't bother.

Loved this when it arrived, but now it has been ruined by the addition of Stevia. Although not as bad tasting as the more common sweeteners, it has changed the taste totally. Considering the target market, which would gladly accept a price increase of a few pence, the Stevia addition has not been done to lower the new UK sugar tax, but has most probably been done to increase the profit throughout Europe for this Italian made soft drink, as all sweeteners except xylitol cost a fraction of sugar. What a pity!

Just got a new six pack of what used to be my favourite drink. Thought it tasted unpleasantly different, checked the ingredients and found that it now has natural sweeteners. There goes another item that I used to love!
I get this as a treat and it's such a lovely refreshing drink on a hot day.
Be warned! Unfortunately San Pellegrino have joined those removing choice from the consumer, post sugar tax, and this now contains steviol
Quality. Not cheap but worth it. I love all the San Pellegrino drinks but this blood orange drink never gets boring.

We dont mind paying a premium for a premium drink but whats happened to the flavour?  We all noticed that the grapefruit one was definitely not the same.  Id have changed my previous 5 star rating on the grapefruit one but unfortunately you cant change your review or add a new one.
My absolute fav!
What! Only 3% Blood Orange,but it still taste great.
do not substitute it to orange flavour during checkout due to ocado's calorie warning, you won't regret. it's the best flavour of San Pellegrino
Great cocktail mixer if a little calorific
Perfect for summer!
This is really gorgeous, as are the other San Pellegrino flavours. I don't normally like fizzy soft drinks are they are too sweet and lack flavour. But these are fruity and fresh.
This is lovely, it is beautiful ice cold straight from the fridge with a slice of blood orange fruit in it and ice.
A drink that has packaging suggesting it is full of fruit instead is just full of sugar!
One can contains half your day's sugar allowance

This is our favourite flavour in the range.  It is sweet and fizzy with a delicious fruity taste.  We have been buying San Pelligrino flavoured fizzy drinks for over a year now, both cans and bottles and anytime we buy a different make of fizzy drink, they taste really artificial in comparison.
Very sweet as others have said but then it is a fizzy drink! If you are that way inclined I imagine it would be a pretty good mixer.

We love all of these San Pellegrino drinks. They are full of flavour, feel fresh and thirst quenching. I also really like the addition of the foil cover to the top of each tin to protect the ring pull. We'd never drink straight from the can but many people do and this keeps the top of the can clean.

I never thought I would go back to buying fizzy drinks again, but I will definitely keep buying this range! it is refreshing, tastes like oranges and not overly sweet an synthetic and the ingredients list is pretty reassuring. yes it has sugar but any traditional lemonade/orangeade does
Very refreshing and not too acidic. Will buy again.
very pricy so not something I would purchase every weekly shop but now and again. very refreshing and tastes good.
So nice to have a drink that doesn't leave a fake sugary taste in your mouth
Contains a lot of sugar. Tastes very nice and refreshing. Also is a bit expensive.
Oh how I love this. Not too sweet, but no nasty chemical sweeteners.

This range of San Pellegrino drinks is really lovely and the blood orange flavour is my favourite. The kids like them too unfortunately so I have to hide them otherwise there would never be any for me.
The only downside is that each can contains 38g of sugar which is very high - so you need to watch out for the calories!
The recent heatwave has converted me to fizzy drinks, a great pick me up on a hot day. The flavour is wonderful, so refreshing, excellent!
don't need to say any more really.  Will try the grapefruit ones next!
Love love love this! We'd be fighting over these if I didn't keep restocking. Unanimous thumbs up from all visitors too. So delicious.
Absolutely scrummy.  Bit expensive though.  Would prefer a large bottle.
Refreshing and not too sweet. We are constantly fighting over them. Great idea to put foil lids on cans
Absolutely delicious!
Delicious.
great if you need to alkalize any part of your body, like i do, but i won´t go into details lol. just to say it does improve urine pH (say no more) without resorting to pills.
So refreshing and perfect for during and after a work out
So pleased to see a multipack as have been buying the single bottles for a while and this offers great value. Great tasting product with a high pH.

I decided to buy some Alkaline water to check for myself if it was worth the  hype - I had my doubts. within days of drinking only this water I started feeling overly nauseous. I stopped immediately and the nausea has been subsiding. my partner started them a couple of days after me and now he is feeling nauseous. other than that nothing has changed - I know it takes weeks for supposed benefits to kick in, but I won't wait to find out.

Just wonderful little cheeses and so
Pleased I can get same ones in blocks too. Great. Very very tasty.

I was really sad not to find my usual cathedral city selection being sold anymore (included the vintage, mild and mature in minis) this came up under search and thought Ill give it a go to replace my usual. So glad I did  if the cathedral one was still available I would not of tried the m&s ones. The cheeses are gorgeous ALL the varieties. BETTER THAN CATHEDRAL CITY. These minis are full of flavour and fabulously creamy taste super tasty ( and the tear line to open individual cheeses are far easier to open than the cathedral city ones were) Already on my order for next time. Ten out of ten!!!
These are handy to keep in Fridge i enjoy mine  with a Apple for a healthy snack these are very moorish  just having one is difficult
Full flavour cheese, portion controlled, who could want more
Really tasty...I like the individual size as they make good neck treats..can't fault these,..yummy.
Lovely flavoured little cheeses!
I'm sure they've changed this? I've had it in the past & loved it but after trying it again recently we all agreed it was quite sharp & sour & not as I remember it.
This juice used to be good, the last bottle we just had went into the sink. Extremely sour and aftertaste of burnt sugar. Expensive mistake!
tasted awfull and sour not nice at all. expected more for the price tag.
Excellent taste and a good texture , really feeling Im drinking apricots. Love it!

I often buy the bilberry juice from the same range and it is beautiful. This however, was not the same. I didnt like the last or texture and something about it just really wasnt nice. I would not recommend anyone buy this and feel its a bit of a joke for the price
Absolutely scrumptious, just perfect... not too sweet either.

I love this. Properly sharp as well as sweet, as fresh apricots are, instead of an over-sugared gloop. We'll buy some to make Bellinis with for Easter, but it's been a lovely treat for me when recovering from illness, just as it is. Shame it's expensive, but good food generally is, and I appreciate the glass bottles, too.

The 1st Time I Bought This, I was Wowed, by Its Authentic Apricot Taste, and Thick and Velvety Texture! The 2nd Time, I Purchased 2 Large Bottles. Then, My Friend Said How AmaZing My Hair Looked! It Did! Very Glossy, with More of a Bounce to It!! I Told Her that the Only Thing that I had Changed, in My Diet, was that I had Started Drinking This Lush Organic Apricot Juice! "Would That Make A Difference?" I Asked Her. "Yes," She Said, "Apricots Are Really Good For The Hair." She is a Special Diets Chef, a Teacher at the Vegetarian Cookery School, in Bath, and the Co - Author of a Cookery Book!! So She Knows Her Onions!! I Have Upped My Order, for This Fortnight, to 4 Big Bottles, of This Nectar of the Gods and Goddesses, that has Made My Tresses Look So Good!!
This is just delicious. Great diluted with prosecco but even better on its own. I want to add this to every shop!
Absolutely lovely, not as sweet as others I've tried but sadly very expensive in comparison, will have to stock up next time its on offer.
This is a nice juice with a natural taste. It's a bit sour for me, although I'm used to drinking tea and coffee without sugar. Fruits chosen for this juice could have been sweeter and more ripe.
Drank the whole bottle in one day, hoping to improve immune system, wandering if one could live on it !

If you are craving the taste of sun ripened apricots, look no further. Expensive, but I found a nice summery answer to make it go further and it also transports you on a sunny day to Provence! mix it 50/50 with prosecco. The half and half mixing ensures you don't loose the quality of the flavour of this nectar I found.

Their Apple and bilberry juice was really good. It is 100 percent fruit juice.
I bought this in good faith, expecting another organic treat. But on first taste my thought was, where's all the flavour?

It was like half the taste had been pasteurised out or something. I went straight to the label to see what it could be. Nothing about heat treatment, but..
Ingredients Apricot puree 50 percent, water, sugar..
Sugar??

You could have at least warned us, instead of  misnaming it Organic Apricot Nectar.
I trusted your name so much that I didn't even read the ingredients at the time of ordering. i was sure it would be 100 percent fruit.
Sorry Dalesford, I expected better from you. 
At £4.20 a bottle, 50 percent missing taste, and sugar only disclosed in the small print, this is worthy of only one star.

It's expensive,  but so lush!  It actually works out because it's rather thick and half a glass is satisfactory in the morning with breakfast,   spreads the bottle that bit more...  It's a new weekly must.  Nice bottle to keep too :-)
This is wonderful stuff, thick and delicious.

I was lured by the money off offer spur on the moment... probably wouldn't have tried it at full price... unfortunately for my food bill, liked it so much that I fear it's going to have to become a regular buy, full price or not! Lovely velvety texture almost smoothie-like, tangy real apricot taste, just delicious. I drink it with a load of crushed ice in a nice wine glass, that way I savour it more and not so tempted to gulp it down like budget OJ!

Nice cake bursting with sultanas but hardly any cherries.  I bought the cake on the assumption there  would be equal amounts of fruit, but disappointingly just a few cherries.  Will not buy again.  Its more of a sultana cake.
great for price , moist because of fruit - great for price
Dont know if I got one from a bad batch but this was horrible. Very stodgy and not cake like at all. It also had a greasy look to it.  Tasted quite oily and not very pleasant, sadly went in the bin.

Maybe I got a bad one but this was vile. It was pure clag. It did have a lot of fruit but the cake part was just oily and sticky and had a horrid mouth feel. So sticky it felt like eating putty. Yuck. Went in the bin.
out of stock last 3 orders!
Full of sultanas and plump cherries, really lovely taste and very moist, a regular buy.
a light but well fruited with sultanas and glacé cherries cake. an afternoon tea time treat.
Lovely fruit cake, plenty of fruit. Thats what may cause some people to have an issue with cutting - lots of sultanas and cherries.  Cut in to blocks, not thin slices. Delicious!
Impossible to cut into slices without it crumbling into bits. And it's not the knife as I've tried with a number of different ones, all sharp, with the same result.
Simply Delicious, moist, plenty of cherries. tastes like homemade.  Can't recommend highly enough
Absolutely lovely cake, very tasty, soft, juicy and fruity. Buy it every week.
Very well balanced cake which remains moist after several days and with good taste.     Very popular in our house for afternoon tea.
Nice cake but so crumbly
Felt a bit like eating a kitchen sponge with bits of dried fruit in it. 1 slice and no more.
This cake is extremely sweet without much flavour and the cherries have no texture at all, so lose all their meaning, show be firm and make a contrast. very disappointing.
An excellent  moist fruit cake.
Lots of fruit, nice moist cake, cuts well. Good value

Why do I say variable? The first one we got was pleasant enough, but the cherries were scarce, making it a worthy 3/5 cake. The second one was dry, but with more cherries. The third and most recent cake was beautifully moist with lots of cherries.... Bit of the luck of the draw what you are going to get.
One of my mums favourite rich fruit cake slices along with the even fruitier all butter marks cake.
Disappointing. Shop tasting cake, not up to M&S standard.
First tried this in a hamper I was sent. It's absolutely delicious, so many cherries
My favourite cake ever. I buy this every week when Im passing marks. Its not dry and theres a generous amount of cherries and sultanas.
This cheese is so delicious - such a great flavour, tangy and creamy. Wonderful on its own with a glass of red or melted in a toastie - yummy
One of the most tangy cheddars Ive tasted but still quite well balanced and not too sharp. Very tasty.

Absolutely delicious! Noticed comments on graininess,the more mature a cheddar is ,the grainier & sometimes crumblier it will be. It is a sign that it is good quality vintage cheddar! This is an exellent cheddar
Found this cheese slightly grainy, tasty but off putting with the added texture.

As per title. It’s seriously good! Did not disappoint at all. Tangy strong cheddar with a nice crunch...For this price and from a chain supermarket I’ve not tried a better mature cheddar than this. Will be repurchasing.

Lovely, creamy and strong, full of flavour, I can't get enough of it!!
You must try and see what your missing!! It's going to be on top of my shopping list!!

Lovely cheddar cheese with great depth of flavour but a bit too crumbly so makes it hard to grate properly or slice properly for sandwiches etc. 
It does sweat quite a bit but we usually wrap our cheese in some kitchen paper before placing it in a resealable bag and this will help keep the mold at bay.
Loved this cheddar. Perfect for crackers, a little crumbly for sandwiches but made it work. Great crystallisation and all in all perhaps one of the best I've had.
Tangy and crumbly. Worth the extra but would be too expensive using for general cooking. Keep it for snacks and sandwiches.
Tangy, crumbly and delicious but tiny!! And for the price was hoping there would be more.
It pains me to say it, but I think this might be even tastier than the old Waitrose equivalent.

This is such a lovely cheddar!  Crumbly & you get that wonderful crystallization on the sides.  We have now been ordering this instead of Cathedral City for the past 4 months & dont think we will ever go back. 

Yes its more expensive, but theres no comparison in taste.  

The only downside, is I wish they made the blocks thicker - its only around 1cm thick which makes slicing for sandwiches a laborious affair.
This is a lovely rich flavour - great to add to sauces, eat on its own or in a sandwich
Not too sharp - very tasty and relatively good value

I normally buy the standard Cornish Cove mature cheddar but it was out of stock last week and this one was recommend instead. It is a bit more expensive but it was really delicious, strong but not overpowering, and will probably become a regular for me now so a happy accident!
This has a lovely flavour and no harsh aftertaste
Delicious, crunchy but creamy, mature cheddar. So different to the usual brands and not a bad price for such a good cheese. Enjoyed eating this and cooking with it.
Taste and crumbles great
Tried this as my regular was unavailable.  So glad I did.  Just disappears too quickly 😋
This cheddar is nutty and delicious. Our new favourite.
A good compromise between crumbliness and depth of flavour. This is now my staple cheddar.
This Davidstow Farm cheese is, arguably the finest to come out of this creamery and, at a very reasonable £11.67 per kg, is the finest tasting and textured cheese currently available via Ocado.
Tasty!

Not as strong as I was expecting, didn't really pack too much of a punch. But my bigger issue was the shape. It is quite thin, so if you want to make a sandwich with it, you have to cut loads of tiny slices. Not the end of the world, but not brilliant.
Lovely tangy and punchy.
Lovely strong cheddar

Worth trying.  Nice enough but not anything special to me.  Reasonably firm texture, moderate level of flavour but not much bite.  I prefer what I was buying from here by Waitrose.  Not bad by any stretch but lacking in depth of flavour and bite for me.  I'd buy again but not as the sole cheddar that I buy and will probably buy more of the Welsh one they do here.
best tasting cheddar I have ever had, and I should know , Im a private chef !

I wouldn't say that we are big eaters, so I'm surprised that we both felt that the portion size was on the small size. The balance between fish and mash was good. And we had some decent chunks of salmon and Cod. The sauce was also tasty with a smoked fish flavour. But there just wasn't enough of it. Personally, I'd rather pay a bit more, and have more pie.
Delicious pie we wish if it was tiny bit bigger.
Im a regular buyer of this for an easy quick meal. Its as good as I could make at home. Would be 5 stars with a bit more fish / or lower price point as its quite saucy!

This fish pie always tastes fresh, the quality is consistently good and the fact that there's no garlic included is a big plus for me.   The only downside is often I receive these upside down.  The packaging must not be sealed properly as the cardboard sleeve is wet and stinking of fish.  It's not always possible to rearrange the remaining contents back into a suitable dish without it being all mashed up.   Please ocado try to deliver right way up, although I do blame poor packaging for contents seeping out.
A good amount of fish and good taste too, slowly working my way through the Charlie Bigham range!

Not enough fish. Way too much sauce. Not enough for two people. Taste good but needed extra seasoning. Way too expensive for what you got. I'm disappointed as it looked fab. On the plus side its easy to cook. Sorry Charlie Bighams but I've had much better.
Substantial fish pie, plenty of decent fish. A good winter meal
Always enjoy this - tastes as good as a home-made pie and makes an easy dinner with some vegetables on the side.
Very tasty fish pie with lovely chunks of fish and a smooth potato topping.
Cooked thoroughly, gave horrendous sickness and diarrhoea following day
I have bought this for maybe 4 years and it's still the same, YUMMY
we buy this regularly. think with other reviews there may have been a fishless batch as we've not had any complaints. our 2 year olds love it too
Delicious, but not enough for 2

I received this as a substitute for the M&S Fish Pie, but won't accept it again.  There's nothing actually wrong with it, and it did contain some fish (hence the two stars instead of one), but it was tasteless, and overpriced.  It seems we're paying extra for a fancy wooden (unrecyclable) box, but the quality of the meal certainly doesn't live up to the price.
95% mash and 5% unseasoned fish
I received this as a substitution for the M&S fish pie and I now I wish I'd given it back. Literally a couple of pieces of fish in some mash.

What has happen to this favourite of mine. I couldnt believe how little fish was in this pie. Mainly all potatoes and hardly any sauce. I was extremely disappointed and will not be ordering this again 
Charlie Bingham you really need to sort this because other brands are so much better

When unpacking the delivery, found lots of liquid from the fish pie had leaked out onto other products in the bag. Had to wash off the leaked fish pie liquid from the other products in that bag and discarded most of the packaging from that bag as it was soaked in fish pie liquid.
Had this with Steves Leaves+ garden peas.. yummy

Love this pie. Ive bought it a couple of times on a flash deal. Its delicious. Great flavour and texture. The sauce is tasty, the fish plentiful and the mash on the top is deliciously creamy inside and crispy crunchy on the top.  Easy to eat a pie for two in be sitting
Nothing like what it used to be.  Two pieces of salmon and one piece of white fish in two servings is not good enough. Will never buy again.
This was a really good fish pie! we had it for lunch. Lovely and warming.
We enjoyed this for our tea tonight, enough for 2 people. Fish was off good quality and much tastier than other fish pies Ive had previously. Will definitely be purchasing again!

I must say I rarely eat ready meals as I’m a stickler for cooking fresh 
However due to an extra hectic current lifestyle I have had a few ready meals out of this range and these are by far the best I’ve ever tasted 

This fish pie is delicious! Yes there could be a bit more fish, but the taste was beautiful, good portion size, very pleased indeed!!
I am not a fan of this brand and although this was ok it wasnt the best.

I accepted this as a sustitute for the M&S fish pie, which is very good and one of my regular buys, I decided to accept this pie, what a mistake !!! I thought it would get binned if I returned it, quite a lot smaller than the M&S pie, same price however. I had one small bit of white fish and a slither of salmon, my partners half was the same,I give it 1 star as the mash,90% of the pie ! was nice. I could never recommend this, buy the M%S  which is far superior.

I try to be fair in my reviews and gave this 4 stars because I’m trying to assess it for the British taste ; having lived in Spain for 30 years I used to fish dishes with much more spice, herbs, sea food etc so personally I found it a bit bland, but I know that’s not everyone’s taste. There was a decent amount of cod and salmon but they’re both very bland - haddock and hake are far more tasty in y opinion. I couldn’t taste any smoked haddock, though it’s listed in the ingredients and the mashed potato was a good consistency. I’m always surprised when people say Charlie’s B’s dishes are expensive.. do they know how much real food costs and paying staff etc? Having run my own restaurant for several years, I think his prices are very reasonable. I’ve tried the cottage pies and some curries when I’ve no time to cook, and found them all excellent value when I compare it to the time I’d be standing in the kitchen prepping and cooking such a meal, not to mention doing the shopping for ingredients and the eco packaging.

Bought this in a flash sale.  Wasn't in the mood myself but heated this through for The Hubs.  After all the reviews, he decided to ferret through, find the fish pieces, and weigh them.  665g pie .... With 65g of actual fish.  We couldn't work out how they had managed to get the nutritional breakdown as around 25% .... Unless they are flavouring the pie using fish "mousse" made from pieces that were too tiny to actually out in.  Hubs said .... "Never again".  I usually buy frozen M&S fish pie mix.  You could then buy M&S frozen mash.  And again, M&S provide a chilled sauce.  Put it together .... Five minutes.  About the same price but a great portion of "full of fish" pie for FOUR.
We've only ever had good pies.  There's a variety of fish, the sauce is well flavoured and there is just the right amount of potato.  Well worth the money.

Without a doubt this is a tasty dish but a couple of things disappointed us. Firstly, not much fish and would of been even better with some seafood which is traditional in a fish pie, secondly, its far too mushy/saucy. It was very difficult to serve, and ended up looking like slop on a plate. I dont believe its worth the price tag and in my opinion, taste the difference fish pie is far superior and considerably cheaper.
This is a tasty fish pie. Knocked off one star as personally I'd prefer a bit more variety of fish it was a bit salmon heavy.
Use to have lots of seafood!! now rubbish!!! NOT BUYING AGAIN!!!!
Tasty, but hardly any pieces of fish inside. I used to like this product, but it is mostly mashed potatoes now. Where is the fish in this fish pie??
This was a nice pie but didnt contain much fish, we found some bones too. Definitely not worth the price tag
Could be slightly bigger as its for two but very tasty.
Really tasty fish pie. One star removed, because as others have also said it could do with having a little more fish in it, especially for the steep price.
Very disappointed with this purchase - lots of white sauce and mash. V little fish. Luckily we had some prawns to add to the sauce to turn it into something resembling a main meal.
I seldom buy these types of ready made meal but I regretted it. It was so salty for us and we couldn't taste anything really.
I think this is the best fish pie available to buy - luxurious and delicious. Great eco container too.  We have at least one a week!

We normally cook meals from scratch, but have found ourselves struggling with working long hours and home schooling over lockdown. 

We decided we needed to have some easy diners. Charlie Binghams has been a great time saver, and the quality is really good. 

We tried this a few years ago and found it salty, runny and lacking in fish. However the couple weve had this month have been perfect.

The mash is decadent and the sauce is delicious but as other reviewers have pointed out, there is very little fish. Also, there really is not enough for two portions unless feeding two small children. On the whole, this was a disappointing buy and not worth the price even as part of the promotional offer.

I buy this as a standby my husband calls it no fish pie as compared to homemade there is not a lot of fish,  however I do buy it when I know that I will need a quick meal its tasty and only takes 30 mins to cook in the oven I have frozen them but they are much better fresh.
not enough for 2

This has the same great taste and flavour combination with just the right amount of mash. My only gripe is that the paper used to wrap the food when cooking can easily snag and tear when dishing up and it can get a bit messy sorting it out. Hence the loss of a star. However good value for two if you want a higher end product.

This is the best supermarket fish pie I've had, have been buying for ages. But have recently had to throw a couple away - even though they were within use by date - they had gone off. It may the milk or cream being used. So... if fresh they're great, but don't trust the use by date.
I agree with previous comments that the Charlie Bigham fish pie has very little fish in it. I won't be buying it again.
This has hardly any fish anymore.  Used to be much better.
we used to love this fish pie, but it has become all potato and very little fish! nothing like it used to be!

On the first few bites I thought wow this is lovely, salmon pieces and also white fish with a crumbly topping, but I had the meal for two - for one person this time and as the meal wore on I realised just how salty it was.  If the salt was toned down the other flavourings would be perfect.
Deliciously creamy fish pie with tasty chunks of fish in every mouthful, definitely buying again, the husband insists.
Very tasty fish pie but could be a little bigger for two.
A lovely fish pie but could do with a tad more fish and slightly larger for 2.
I enjoyed this pie with some green vegetables however it only has a disappointing 25% fish. With such a quality pie you would expect more for your money
This was disappointing. There was lots of mash but very little fish, a couple of prawns and hardly any sauce. Nice flavour was its only redeeming feature. Wont be buying again.
This was a very tasty fish pie....plenty of sauce and enough for two people with some veg. Delicious!

'Fraid I agree with 4th August 2020 review.....  My last purchase was a real disappointment, the fish was 'fishy' and grey-ish and very sparce and the spinach hard to find at all.....  this fish pie used to be wonderful and the best ready meal I have ever found but sadly not on the last purchase. ....  I used to add some more good cheddar, some roasted cherry toms and pass it off as.....  but not on the last effort.... Come on Mr Bigham, turn back the clock, you can really do better than this!  Just kindly do stick with the fish only and 'no prawns' added please!  I live in hope and will try once more.....
Regular for us instead of takeaways as cutting down on plastic, will have a run for its money with the M&S fish pie as that is also a favourite. Very tasty just add veg

Love love love this. Good amount for two people if you add your own veg. I love how the cheesy top goes a bit crispy. Combined with the generous dose of fish chunks and the smooth creamy sauce, this is delicious!
I love these. Full of flavour and ample fish. A very satisfying meal for two, which I always serve with home cooked vegetables. In my opinion, the best Charlie Bigham product.

Had this for the first time last week as it was in a flash sale. It was nice but the portions sizes are small. With all CB dishes I carefully remove them from the wooden tray and place in a 2lb loaf tin to cook ,it has the paper lining so not to messy,  I find with a gas oven the wood catches fire. I will purchase again.

First tried this fish pie approx 3 years ago, and have been buying from Waitrose/Ocado since.  It used to be the best ready made fish pies out there, an 8.5 out of 10 dish; better than Waitrose or Marks & Sparks.
However, in the last 3 years the fish content has gradually decreased, the spinach is now added more like caviar (i.e. miniscule amounts) and the potato and sauce increased steadily until it's now mainly a mashed potato dish rather than balanced with reasonable / good amount of protein.  Still tastes better than many cheaper alternatives, but is now 6.5 out of 10.  Whilst technically not a fish, the addition of a few prawns would add something to the dish

By far the best fish pie I've had from a supermarket and better than 70% of takeaway and pub level food from restourants in London. And I'm a fussy eater. Also good ingredients, nothing too nasty in here. I cook a lot and dislike ready made meals, still I buy this regularly.

The fish pie itself is lovely, although quite small for the price. However the wooden dish is comes in makes our whole house smell like a bonfire, it's too overwhelming and unpleasant, the corner of the wooden dish has actually caught fire once! Wouldn't repurchase for this reason

.....we used to order this weekly and it was one of our favourite ready meals however recently, while retaining its lovely flavour, there has been very little fish compared to previously. We initially thought this an exception however the reduced fish seems to have continued - cost cutting ruining a product?
One of my favourite meals. I gave up making my own fish pies because this one is so good.
