Had a right nightmare with this. Only went and used a wet tea towel to get the baking tray out the oven didn't I, which resulted in me dropping the entire contents back into the oven. As luck would have it I cleaned my oven properly the previous day/night so all was not lost despite my worry about finding a rogue crunchy bit. A million times better than the Waitrose fish pie which is occasionally substituted.
Love this fish pie. I like it has no prawns and it includes nice big pieces of fish.

For us, this has enough fish and enough flavour to be the one fish pie we keep buying. The texture is gorgeous and it cooks so beautifully. Would happily be served this in a restaurant, which goes some way to justifying the price!
Agree there's not a lot of fish in this, but there was plenty for the two of us.  We always serve at least 3 portions of vegetables each at dinner so this was fine and we enjoyed it.
Very disappointed hardly any fish and very small portion for 2
So far I haven't had a successful delivery. Both times I have tried to order this, the packaging has been split.

Weve been a fan of this fish pie for a long time as it is really tasty for the price. However, we were extremely disappointed and worried to find half a dozen pieces of plastic embedded in the pie and only identifiable once cooked and served. Hopefully a one off issue on the production line and not an indication of reducing quality.
near ready meal fish pie available- plenty of fish and sauce and the right amount of potato
Lots of fish in this but little cheese or cream and no white wine. Not enough seasoning. I understand that they are trying to cut down on calaries per portion, but it tastes bland.

I love this fish pie. It's rich, creamy mash that goes nicely crispy in the over, with a smooth tasty white sauce and large chunks of fish as you would expect from a premium brand. Plus it's sturdy enough to survive being jostled during delivery (unlike their paella).
I'd eat this 5 days a week if the wife would let me.

This is the best ready-made fish pie I have ever tasted. The mash is mashed potato not pureed mashed potato!
M&S used to do a good one too, but I think this beats it for flavour.

Absolutely delicious. Creamy and flavourful. Plus, in the way that it's packaged, you get lovely burnt corners that are slightly caramelised after cooking. The balance of ingredients is very good. I'd suggest heating on a non-fan oven setting... otherwise it tends to dry out.
Very tasty decent amount of fish
We have this once a week and it's always packed with tender pieces of salmon. The sauce is creamy and we love the melted cheese on top of the mash.

The first one was absolutely wonderful, but since then we have had three really bad ones..... all potato with very little fish. 
Last one ordered had three pieces of cod and four of salmon for two people.  I won't be buying again.
Every Bigham we've tried has been delicious.
Plenty of fish, tasty and enough for 2 we thought
There was just sauce and potato. Hardly any fish at all.
Not cheap but v tasty.

As really tasty fish pie...nice sauce with a hint of lemon....there just seemed to be next to no fish! We’ve had this before with no problems....just couldn’t risk it again if there is no consistent way of CB ensuring fish was evenly shared out between all their pies!!
Lots of fish lovely sauce nice quick meal

I'm yet to find a Charlie Bigham that's let me down. Again, this is as good if not better than homemade. Creamy and rich sauce, buttery mash with little crunchy breadcrumbs on top... Yum yum yum. They're not cheap, but this comfortably fed 2 with a side salad and when you look at how much a ready meal for 1 can cost these become good value. On flash sale they're exceptional value!

This is lovely.
A really enjoyable fish pie.
I am hospital visiting at the moment and I wouldnt normally buy a shed load of ready meals but these are tasty and nutritious.
This now has a topping consisting of lumps of potato and not smooth mash. Maybe I got a rogue pie though. The fish is mainly salmon too. Not as nice as it used to be.
Hardly any fish in this pie - just cheese, cream and potato. For £7.50, pretty poor value
One of best ever had including homemade ones

I've read a lot of complaints about this fish pie not having enough fish.  Rubbish!  And even if you do think there isn't enough ... there is more than enough totally yummy mashed potato with cheese to make up for it!   I wouldn't buy a fish pie from anyone else.
Where has all the fish gone? Flavour good but basically mashed potato with a scant amount of salmon.
I would like to give this 5 stars as I'm sure it used to have much more actual fish pieces in it.  The flavour is all there..It's delicious. It just seriously  lacks in actual meatiness
Best fish pie I have had in some time. It did freeze well
Another winner from Charlie, Ive been enjoying all the range! It was very tasty. There wasnt a massive amount of fish but it was still filling and delicious so Id definitely buy it again.
A few very small pieces of salmon..I think... and maybe a bit of cod..I think.. distributed far and wide in the sauce.
As good as homemade!
I quite enjoyed this. I'd planned to eat half and a salad, leaving the other half for tomorrow but then I guzzled the lot. Yummy but too much for one medium sized, somewhat sedentary woman!
We really like this fish pie and now get one every week. Its perfect for Scouts night when we dont get a chance to cook. Lovely with carrots and peas.

My partner doesn't eat prawns, so it's great to find a fish pie that doesn't contain them! Don't think they're really necessary in a fish pie anyway. I agree with comments that it could contain more fish, also ensure that there is some on each side as we divide this between two and sometimes one half has more fish than the other! It is expensive as a small meal for 2, and it has gone up in price since I first started buying these. Would be good if they could bring it back to under £6....

Well done to Charlie Bighams' for producing a superior fish pie without having to add alcohol. 
Due to religious reasons it has been difficult finding a decent fish pie on the market after Waitrose annoyingly started adding wine to their excellent fish pie and remarking it as 'The One' range.  Sadly Waitrose's offering is no longer 'The One' for us. We love this one...hopefully more brands will follow suit.

No fish! Even the children said, "Where is the fish?". 
Overly creamy. The sauce and potato would be nicer if joined by a decent amount of fish.

The pie itself was delicious, but after finding 4 bones in my meal I spent the whole time worrying that the kids would choke on a bone that I couldn't enjoy it. I expect no bones, especially for the price.
When time is too tight to make my own- this is the best alternative we have found! Really tasty.

This started well, it was tasty and we agreed on eating it that it was a good standby product.  However, I then had a massive mouthful of fish skeleton and bones which was most unpleasant.  Shame - it is quite expensive and would one expect better quality control
The quality has gone down hill. There's very little fish, mainly runny sauce and a thick layer of mashed potatoes.

This is the best fish pie from a supermarket that I have ever bought. It is the only one that doesn't have mash that tastes artificial. It is delightfully creamy, and has plenty of fish in it for my taste, and I don't understand why so many reviewers are complaining about this. M&S' Gastropub fish pie, by comparison, is full of chewy prawns, and the mash tastes like Smash.
Been a favourite for years, but now has very little fish, especially for the price!  A shame as the flavour is nice.
We usually love Charlie Bingham meals for their quality, but the recipe of the fish pie has changed and it contained very little fish. Disappointing as it was just sauce and mash

This used to be our favourite fish pie, usually buying one every week.  However the last one contained very little fish and was extremely salty.  Having read other recent reviews other people are of the same opinion.  Therefore I wont be buying another one until I receive assurance that it has reverted to its previous quality and taste.
This contains over 2g of salt per portion which is absolutely unnecessary and unhealthy.
The fish content is too small and you are left with too much potatoe and sauce. Very disappointing. Will not purchase again.

My fish pie had just under an acceptable amount of white fish and salmon. The sauce, which was otherwise pleasantly cheesy, and the potato were both far too salty and contain over 2 grams per portion. Should there have been less salt and more fish would be worth the premium price.

The review posted by Heff could have been written by myself as I was going to point out exactly the same problems. Very runny, no white fish but one cube of salmon swimming in as mass of sauce and sloshy mashed potatoes. It actually tastes delicious but room for improvement of content and texture.

First of all, I am not a massive fan of fish pie. It's the texture of the fish in the sauce. Having said that, I gave this one a go as I have good experience with Charlie Bingham's products and truth be told, I really liked it. The fish, the mash and the sauce work; everything is well seasoned. I served it on a bed of spinach and shared with hubby. They are not massive portions, so you will need a starter or a dessert!

I am generally a big fan of Bighams products but this pie was the exception. Surely fish pie should contain fish? What a disappointment to find the pies were nothing but mash and a sloppy white sauce. My husband eventually found a tiny cube of salmon but no trace of cod or haddock that feature in the write up. The whole thing was fairly tasteless and very expensive for so little. The portion size was definitely on the mean side too and a hearty eater would want the whole pack to themselves. As it was so bland and unexciting, we were more than happy to share! I wouldnt buy again.

This fish pie is the best ready meal fish pie out there. It has plenty of delicious parsley flavoured sauce so it doesn't ever taste dry. I have repurchased many times particularly when on a flash sale.
We like Charlie's food, have been eating fish pie for a long time. However recently we have to play the game spy the fish. it's really very disappointing and will not buy again.

Purchased in a flash sale and used for a mid week meal with fresh veg. It was delicious .. .lots of chinky fish pieces and a good mash to sauce ratio.....not at all too sloppy! 
At the regular price its a one off treat but glad we tried it!

Bought this on a whim as a Flash Sale, and I'm so glad I did! It doesn't taste like a convenience dish it tastes luxurious and homemade. Creamy sauce and potato, plenty of fish and plenty of flavour. And no prawns, which suits me fine. Maybe not quite enough for two people with a big appetite but it gave me two ample servings for my needs. I added extra cheese on top and had it with green veg and a squeeze of lemon. Absolutely beautiful!
generous amount of fish, very lovely taste and texture. could cut down on the salt slightly. also not quite enough for two very hungry people, even with loads of veg.
Well worth the money best ready meal I have bought
Usually love this, but the last one had masses of bones in.
There was something about the sauce that made it too rich, and I usually like fish pie. Certainly not inedible, just a bit claggy.
I liked this a lot. Only got it due to special offer. So glad I did!
Very good and balanced - absolutely recommend it
If you dont have the time or inclination to make your own then these make a tasty substitute
Have bought this several times now. Each time its been lovely - plenty of fish and beautifully flavoured creamy sauce topped with just the right amount of potato.
Didnt find much in the way of fish in this pie, it comprised mainly of potato. However the sauce was tasty, not tasty enough to overcome the lack of fish unfortunately and will not be ordering again.
My foodie husband loved it!
Don't see how his can be called fish pie. It was 99% potatoes and 1% fish. Extremely disappointing. Will not order again.
Lovely chunks of fish in the tastiest, cheesiest, yummiest sauce!! Would buy more if not so pricy though
very testy - better if cooked for 10 mins longer to make the top nice and crusty. Serve with lots of peas

This was gorgeous. So nice to find a fish pie without seafood. Lovely flavour and plenty of fish. Really tasty and to be honest so good it's just not worth standing there yourself after a long day. I would say not really enough for two, my husband could have eaten more so unless Charlie increases the size of the pie, you do need to add sides.
Would add more greens but that's just me. It's defo enough for 2.
Finally a fish pie without prawns which I cannot eat.  Lots of fish and salmon very tasty.  Bit expensive but worth the cost

If Charlie Bigham read the reviews, please, a suggestion, do an alternative fish pie without salmon!  Maybe with smoked haddock instead?  I buy this because it is good for me and my only problem with it is that I hate salmon!  I know there are a lot of people who feel likewise, so please, Charlie Bigham, do a fish pie with something different in it!

Was Very Tasty had to cook mine bit longer as didnt seem that hot.  Fish inside was from what i could see mainly Salmon, which was excellent.  Would be nice to have larger pieces of the other fish, mine must have jumped ship.  Would buy again though, try it.
This one is my favourite- it's not enough for two unless you have sides (based on a large appetite).
Chucky pieces of quality fish, topped in buttery mash potato.  This is an excellent fish pie in my opinion.

A little bit on the skimpy side. It was hard to serve two without being hungry afterwards. I got it on a flash sale and I'm not sure I would pay over A£5.50 for it. The flavours were nice enough but the potato tasted like smash and it was a bit over sauced for my liking.

According to my husband (not me as I don't like fish) this pie was deliciously tasty. He ate the whole lot (well he has a big appetite) and enjoyed every mouthful. He wants more of it so I will be buying it again.

This fish pie is really scrummy, ok so we should be making everything ourselves but this is so yummy that you're glad you didn't bother!  Charlie Bighams fish pie should be everyone's favourite fall back
We love this, tastes homemade with big chunks of fish.  And as I don't like prawns it's sometimes hard to find a fish pie without them.
This tastes as good as homemade without the hassle to do it yourself. Perfect. Buying it again!

I've been buying this fish pie for a few years now and the quantity of fish has most definitely declined over time. I think my OH and I got just one bit of salmon each last time. I'm not a huge fan of cream so will probably stop buying this which is a shame. It used to be lovely.
This seems to be a misleading item, how can this be a fish pie when there's more spinach than fish!
Tried for the first time. Delicious, though we'd have loved a bit more!

I have been a fan of the Fish Pie for a few years but like other reviewers I have noticed a lack of pieces of fish. Still flavoursome so I guess I must just be unlucky, again and again. Shame though as Charlie Bigham is usually a premium brand.
love this fish pie and always have it in for emergencies but recently seems to have had less fish and more potato.  Still tastes good though.
Great quick evening meal option.  Right amount of fish and potatoes.  Would recommend.
Too much mash topping and sauce, very little fish in this. The Waitrose version is much better by comparison.

I usually make my own fish pie - but thought I'd give this a go and it is smashing. When you have no time to spend preparing, cooking and so on this is perfect,  can taste all the fish and does not taste synthetic at all as do some prepared foods,
 it is creamy and interesting
I didn't have a problem with this fish pie, plenty of fish, nice amount of mash, great flavour. Always cook in the mid to lower section of the oven to prevent the wooden box from burning
Far too much potato, hardly any fish and a 1.5 inch fish bone!

I was very disappointed as having tried various other Charlie Bigham products, I was very surprised at the high quality but this was nowhere near as good. The mash topping had a very odd artificial taste and there was hardly any fish.

We are regulars to CBs fish pie but lately the product has gone down the hill. We hardly find any fish in the pie. Not as promised on the packet with salmon, cod and haddock. We feel cheated by CBs especially with the higher price range in comparison to other fish pie products.

Have you ever tried to make fish pie? My wife has on a number of occasions and comments that compared to CB's she can't make it as thick. Also I would say in response to other feedback about where is the fish, try to fill a tray this big with just 25% fish and it would take well over A£5? So, for what it is I think they're great and very affordable. I like this with Waitrose Petit Pois peas!
Delicious pie but only enough for 1.5 people - a hungry person could easily polish off on own! Why not just make it enough for 2 proper portions??
Iv tried alot of fish pies n this is the best ready made one, beats M&S for sure

My husband and I  have recently started to discuss which of us have the fish in our helping of pie. It seems we're both digging about in the white sauce and potato for something fishy but to no avail . Time to remove from the weekly shop. Come on Charlie...sort it out.
I really like this and have bought several times. I agree with other reviewers in that it's not exactly loaded with fish but it tastes home-made and authentic. And I love the crunch potato topping.

Why not just call it "Salmon and potato pie"!  because there was a fingernail size of white fish and nothing else. No prawns, no scallops.  It was just horribly gloopy.
Very disappointing, it used to be quite good but I certainly won't be buying Charlie Bingham's again if that's the new standard at an increased price.
Really good. Ensured I have tried other products in this range, though none have matched up yet!
Very nice, could do with a bit more fish but I'm already a repeat buyer. Good standby.

Disappointing especially as the price has increased. I struggled to find any fish and when I did find some, it was in small flakes, not the large chunks that this fish pie used to contain. Will only consider buying on offer in future. I have given an average score only because the quality of other fish pies in Ocado is so poor.

Unlike other reviewers I found a fair bit of fish but overall a very dull, almost floury taste to the fish and sauce, and very lacklustre potato topping.  Appreciate the idea behind the brand but it is nothing like homemade and actually much less enjoyable than a cheaper microwave meal from almost anywhere else. Will not buy again.
I'm a big fan of this range but I wouldn't buy the fish pie again. The fish tasted great -the two tiny, random pieces that I found in all the potato!

Lots of fish, not sure what happened to previous reviewers. But, if you don't like smoked fish avoid at all costs as it is Very heavily smoked haddock and so the other fish is totally over powered. I enjoyed it but I added extra cheese and also lots of Worcester sauce!
Not quite sure why this is called a fish pie.  There was very little fish in it.  Maybe I was unlucky, but I will not be buying it again.
Was really enjoying this fish pie but was put off by the huge bone I found. And that wasn't the only one! Appreciate it does pre warn about bones but won't be buying again
I don't like fish pies with prawns because the prawns become tough with the cooking.  This is tasty and to my mind ideal.
A very superior fish pie! The sauce is utterly yummy, the mash creamy and smooth and crispy on top, the fish pieces tasty.

The description of the contents of this pie is mashed potato flavoured with a fishy sauce.The only fish content that we could find were a few flakes of salmon and the crunchy cheese topping was absent too!For £7 it is a disgrace.This is the first review I have ever posted,,I shall avoid this maker in future.

Bought this fish pie on a buy 3 for 2 offer last week - when I put it in the oven the tray looked a bit empty but when we sat down to eat it and compared what we had on our plates with the picture and description on the box realised it was missing its top layer of "crunchy cheddar topping" which might be why it tasted so ordinary.  Am used to getting prawns in my fish pies so missed these and also had to blast it in the microwave as it was still not hot in the middle after 30 mins cooking.  Not a great success then ...
I bought this to have an easy option after a tiring day at work. It was rancid and had gone off 2 days before its sell by date leaving me to cook something from scratch at 8.30pm.
Bought as a treat, was delicious, best fish pie we have ever had! worth every penny. High fish content and not swamped with too much potato. Would recommend.
delicious and just enough for two. with veg. could be home made.
Looking at the other comparable fish pies, the fish content is v low. This is the "fishiest" and just so delicious. My children love it so much (they are v fussy) and so do we.
Impressed with this fish pie which was very tasty
This smelled so awful that we threw it away after one bite. Smelled and tasted like smelly socks.

Very good fish pie - not all mash and sauce like some. Although the packet says it serves 2 my husband ate it all by himself, so it may not be enough for two hearty appetites. He usually hates non homemade fish pie, but said this was great!
I served this with courgettes and cauliflower. The smoked haddock added just the right amount of zing. Delicious and nourishing meal.
Huge chunks of great quality fish, soft and succulent as if caught a few hours ago. Lovely creamy sauce and crispy topping finishes off a delightful meal.

I had to review this after reading the review that said it was disgusting, because both my husband and I think that this fish pie is delicious! Good texture, wonderful taste and not at all mushy. I am delighted to find it

This+was+just+horrible!+the+paper+lining+went+soft+with+bits+of+paper+added+to+the+dish.+It+tasted+and+smelt+so+fishy+it+was+offputting.+The+mash+was+like+eating+wall+paper+paste,+it+even+had+the+same+consistency.+I+know+its+a+Fish+Pie+but+its+grim.

With a good balance of fish, sauce and potato topping. Really delicious and doesn't feel too fatting. I'd say better a big meal for one than for two and eating straight from environmentally concious little oven container, just plated underneath is best!
Really rather delicious, almost as good as mums!

While the taste of this fish pie is fine (4 stars), the paper lining inside the wooden packaging you cook it in disintegrated when serving. The meal was totally spoiled by bits of paper in every other mouthful. Such a shame. If you buy, take great care when dishing up or put in another container to cook.
Really good. My children said it was better than my own!  Lots of fish in it

This was delicious.  Some fish pies are short on the fish & big up on the potato topping but this one they have got just right.  Definitely enough for 2 persons as well.  Will certainly purchase again

Amazingly good fish pie - decent chunks of fish, creamy tasty sauce, light cheesy mash. Perhaps a little on the salty side but I like salty so not a problem for me.  Could not have made it better. Delicious!
All I can say is delicious. I highly recommend it.

Packed with lots of fish. Flavours are just awesome.
Have bought this several times now.
Just as good as I can make, fishy, moist and delicious.

Really delicious, and that comes from someone who's not a big fish pie fan.  I agree with the other reviewer that the packaging is poor - the contents do  tend to slip to one end of the pack, but then you're not going to hang it on the wall and look at it! Yum Yum Yum.

I'm not a fan of ready made meals but having been struck down with illness I ordered this...and it may well become a staple on our shopping list.  I thought it was delicious...a lovely creamy sauce and enough for two.  If i had a complaint it would be that some of the topping tasted a little funny - i think it was the cheese - but other than that, I'd really recommend.
We usually make our own, but this is a very good alternative if you don't have the time and by far the best ready made fish pie we've tasted. Perfect for two.

Fish pie is my favourite winter warmer.. this was the best I've found in ready-made options, the sauce tastes home-made, mash nice and fluffy on top, nice meal for two although a little on the small side.

We love this fish pie and have started having it each week. We have great big chunks of fish  and the taste and texture are lovely and creamy.

My only gripe is that the packaging is terrible. We have our shopping delivered every week and often the pie is escaping the packaging. 

I will still keep buying it though as its delicious despite the pacaging issues.
A pleasant alternative - tasty, and really does taste homemade
enjoyed this the first time and happy to buy it again.  goes straight into the oven and ready to serve - I have no problem with the packaging

I am very fussy with fish and don't eat enough of it, so to have this fish pie, packed with lovely tasty fish, was so nice for me.  It is full of flavour, not too salty, and just delicious, can't fault it.  Not sure what some of the other reviewers are talking about when they complain about the packaging, its mimilistic, which saves waste, whats the problem with that??
Delicious fish pie, but their packaging is appalling if it isn't packed absolutely flat the packaging moves and it then leaks when you cook it

Bit confused by the other reviews here I thought this pie was amazing, there was plenty of fish, it's very meaty and the sauce is delicious. I especially love the crispy topping.

All the Charlie Bigham meals I have tried are amazing, I have recommended them to everyone I know. Worth every penny!

We have bought the fish pie twice now and both times the pie had a good amount of fish. Once cooked it had a wonderful creamy sauce and the topping turned lovely and crunchy. I would like to see it come in a bigger size if possible.
This is tasty, more fish than the waitrose equivalent and better value

Was shared between partner and 17 year old son and they both enjoyed it - son was particularly pleased which is rare! packaging was not ideal - made it difficult to serve easily, cardboard box... But overall tasty and will buy again this week - except I think its out of stock - oh dear.

I got this in the flash sales. I usually buy normal flapjack but infrequently. I sometimes try these vegan alternatives as I am lactose intolerant but find that they arent very nice to eat and not worth the calories.

This on the other hand is quite good. Once you mentally get passed not smelling the sweet buttery smell of a normal flapjack and treat this as a snack in its own right it is quite good. I genuinely enjoyed it.

The only reason for it not being a 5-star review is the price. On sale it is worth getting though.

I though we give a go to taste t this coffee pod.I normally buy carte d'or or starbust and to be honest i found thois coffee flavour very bad could be the type of the coffee bean but did taste and smell like cigarette. may have to give away the coffe can't drink this
Really smooth Italian coffee and works really well I'm my Nespresso machine

I thought I would try this as an interim to my regular nespresso capsules which I buy from Starbucks, as I had run out. I was hoping for a nice strong coffee with a great flavour but unfortunately this really let me down. It is quite weak and i didn't like the flavour as it tasted quite burnt. I hope Ocado start stocking Starbucks nespresso pods soon so I can add them to my weekly shop!
Nice tasting coffee
Would buy if cannot get Nespresso but not the same quality.

We have had a nespresso machine for the past 8 years.. We generally only use the nespresso pods as any alternative we have tried to use seem to get stuck and tend to mess the machine up. This one is the only one that works fine and gets ejected without getting stuck. WE use it in the nespresso cappuccino cups and it is just a perfect everyday strength. It is probably an equivalent to a 5 strength nespresso pod. I would definitely buy it again  as on offer it is cheaper then the nespresso ones.
These capusules worked in our Nespresso machine which was a bonus as not all do. However, although I love strong coffee flavours normally, these did come out really quite bitter.
soft, not too bitter, easy to drink, lacks a bit of a punch
Not too bad but would not buy again/
This is an ok alternative to Nespresso capsules, but wouldn't purchase at the full asking price as is nothing special.

I like my coffee but never been an expresso lover.  This was definitely better as a shot than the long.  I found it bitter for my taste.  Was ok with toast and marmalade but would not serve after dinner.
It was a little on the thin side and slightly too bitter for my tastes.

Good coffee for your Nespresso machine. At least the capsule did not get stuck in my machine, like other brands do. The coffee is not too strong. Shame it does not say the strength on the pack like the Nespresso capsules, though.
For those moments when you want a smooth, easy to drink, not bitter, not too sweet flavorsome iced coffee. My only complaint would be that it's so good, you end up drinking it too quickly. Delicious.
Lovely to have as a treat, tastes exactly like their ice cream !
I don't even drink coffee and it tastes amazing!
Creamy, smooth and a mild sweet coffee taste. Delicious! Dont shake the can though- it likes to splash out everywhere if you do!

This was a nice treat - 4 stars as it’s expensive when not on offer. Smooth and creamy drink with a lovely coffee flavour that’s not too sweet or overpowering. Enjoyed straight from the can but it would be even nicer poured over a large glass of ice.
My new favourite cold coffee. Just the right balance of coffee for me. Sweet but not not overly so.
This is delicious. It reminds me of an iced coffee I used to buy when I was in Australia. I have never found one over here as nice until this one. I'm very happy!
served ice cold it's a nice quick drink on a hot day, better than other brands I have tasted
Spoilt by far too much added sugar -
Poured over plenty of ice this is a great afternoon treat in this hot weather
yummy cold coffee.

250 ml of cold coffee,best served iced or from the fridge. 
sweet,milky,strong,full flavoured.very nice.this was a delicious thirst quenching cold coffee.high quality ingredients blended to near perfection.2 sugars are in it which is perfect for me.i rec omens.
Thought this tasted quite nice for an iced milky coffee but branding it a milkshake is weird when it's water thin.  Don't buy if you like strong coffee or want a thick beverage.
My favourite is Starbucks double shot but this still hits the spot. A good balanced flavour and not too sweet
Love the quality of Jude's products. This is often on offer making it great value for money.
Lovely flavour, creamy and not sickly sweet! I like to order these as a little treat after putting all my ocado order away.

Hooray for an iced coffee that actually tastes of decent coffee. A treat on a hot summer's day. I do find it slightly too sweet but not off-puttingly so. I also like that it doesn't have to be stored in the fridge.
far too sweet for me,would like an unsweetened version.
This was too sweet for me but another family member enjoyed it. It's all down to taste.
Is it weird to drink cold coffee with breakfast in summer? It seems wrong but these taste so good!  Plastic free packaging too.

I love the appeal of a quick cold coffee so Ive tried most brands and this one is at the top of my list. Its not too sweet and feels like its a good coffee hit. They are quite expensive though so think Id only purchase on a deal
I have a few of these on my weekly shop as they're quick to have while working from home during lockdown. Tasty treat!
Way too sweet
Nice cool and flavoured coffee drink. Not too sweet. On offer at the moment and as good as others on the market. This was like a flat white from a barista
too sweet and sickly for me. I was tempted by flash sales.
I love these iced coffees they are refreshing and full of flavour. A real treat
These are delicious, and remind me of the Starbuck glass Frappuccino bottles, but are much cheaper. So good, I always drink it too fast.
Just how I like an iced coffee! - and with the convenience of it being in my fridge for just when I fancy it.
Nice to have a canned coffee that's not just sugary milk. This one has a good strong coffee flavour and isn't too sweet.

Ive got a sweeter tooth than this. Most people will love it as its strong, good flavoured coffee but I prefer the sweeter ones. Its good quality coffee though, you can tell. Maybe over ice with some nut milk?
I liked this coffee however I expected it to be a little sweeter, I prefer my coffee sweet but thats just my preference however it was still an enjoyable drink and Id buy again.
This is the best coffee in a can - not too sweet,creamy but strong.An absolute winner
I've tried each of the cold coffees available and this is by far my favourite. I wish they did a version with no sugar - but it seems all cold coffees have sugar in them.
I love this product. Had to drive many miles to the one supermarket that was stocking it until now, so this is a very welcome addition by Ocado

I love Purition. You need to blend, rather than shake. I love the strawberry one with oat milk and strawberries. Delicious! I don't find them particularly filling though, so I typically  have this after a workout rather than as a meal.
Awful taste and very grainy, doesn't mix up well at all. It doesn't contain B12 which is very strange for a vegan nutrition product.
artificial and grainy, not suitable for mixing into smoothies
Natural tasting without that artificial horrid flavour!
NA
Compared to other similar soft drinks, these cans  are great value for money. A favourite in my house
Maybe it`s just me but I could swear these cans are less carbonated than a usual ones...Although it`s still Dr Pepper so...
Stocking up on Dr Pepper as an alternative to coke and Pepsi which tends to increase in price over summer. £5.50 for 18 cans, great price and great taste
Great flavour, a bit sweet but is a great addition to a natural fruit smoothie.
Sucralose.

no sugar but artificial Sucralose
Some of the most commonly reported adverse effects include:
Blood sugar increases and weight gain.
Gastrointestinal problems.
Seizures, dizziness, and migraines.
Blurred vision.
Allergic reactions.
We’ve been drinking benecol since it started & this is by far our favourite & it’s no added sugar, really love it & it’s doing you good, win win!
What a fantastic new addition to the range. Great taste and will be a weekly addition to my family shopping each week.
Not sure why they need to make it so sweet. Found them undrinkable.

We have been looking for an organic tea that tastes good and smells inviting as it brews - sadly we have not yet found one.
The tea is packaged in a card outer, with a plastic inner bag - no longer a tin, as mentioned by an earlier review!
Absolutely the best English Breakfast Tea I’ve had. (A bold statement, I know.) Full, strong and delicious, yet somehow doesn’t get overbrewed, meaning no tannin headaches for me.

Delicious and so glad to see an organic, loose leaf tea. Its difficult to come by.

It would be helpful to read more or watch a video on their site about their organic certification, what the tea is dried and stored in before packaging. 

I am becoming more interested nowadays in how food/drink products are processed. We must ask questions to look after our health!

And please for the love of all things holy, I dont want to see the quality of this decline if this becomes more popular because it tastes wonderfully fresh and invigorating. 
Thank you.
As with other reviewers, I enjoy this tea, but wish it was packaged in a paper bag.  It is possible for loose leaf tea to be packaged in a safe, environmentally pack - Storm Tea please note.
Brewed for 3 minutes this makes a a strong, but not bitter morning tea. I'll be buying this again
Really like this tea, really rich distinguished coconut but trying to cut back on waste and the caddy each time is ridiculous. Can you please put in cardboard or something more ethical. Thx!

Weve tried a few organic teas but it is hard to find a breakfast blend - this is delicious! Only issues are 1) the cost! 2) the tea itself comes in a plastic bag inside the tin which is a bit annoying as we are trying to cut down our plastic waste.

As a New Yorker who loves everything bagels, these were well done! They didnt have the salt, but not a big deal. Everything bagels are meant to be eaten toasted and slathered with any type of cream cheese and I imagine if you eat them not toasted, they might be dry. If you eat them with only butter, they will taste okay but not great. They need that cream cheese.
I thought these were great everything bagels and almost tasted like ones Id buy back home! Will buy again!
these smell funny in the toaster and do not taste nice.

After reading reviews, I was expecting more. Much more. 

I had my bagel plain with salted butter. There was no authentic "chew", it was crumbly bread in the shape of a bagel, although not dry as other reviewers found (6 days to BB date). I very much doubt these have been anywhere near water. Not the right texture at all. I did enjoy the flavour of the toppings but that was it. I won't be reordering and cannot recommend. Very disappointing.
Keep an eye on them in the toaster as they burn really quickly!
Maybe I got a bad batch but these were tasteless and very dry

Finally! Everything bagels!! They come with poppy seed, onion, sesame seeds and garlic. No salt, but thats ok. Mine were fresh so am thinking the others had an older batch. They have been on sale. Wonderful for the UK to finally get up to speed with the breadth of bagel flavors!
I thought these were great -loved the toppings and perfect with butter and marmite for a weekend breakfast.
Very dry even though I froze them immediately after purchase and eaten when defrosted, so they weren't hanging about. Wouldn't buy again. Might be OK toasted.
These were stale from delivery and completely useless the next day unless they were toasted.

Bit of a cheek for charging more with less in the pack than other varieties.
Tastes a bit better toasted with butter. Definitely won't buy these again.. the red onion and chive option is much tastier.
By the use-by date they were inedible as they were already mouldy, shame.
I love the loaded top!
Saturday mornings aren't complete without one of these bagels lightly toasted, with capers, salmon and cream cheese. Perfect way to start the weekend, always soft and delicious.
I absolutely loved these, toasted on their own or with a filling. Shame there is only 4 in a pack rather than the usual 5. But will buy again.

These are so delicious. Definitely recommend! they have a great consistency compared to other NY bagels and the flavours are very tasty. Goes great with scrambled eggs and avocado and equally good with cream cheese. I cant remember what American everything bagels taste like now but these are great in their own right. Oh and huge size, fluffy but firm and easy to cut!

I LOVE everything bagels from back home, and these are not really very good.  Too flat, not enough flavour.  These are the kind of bagel you’d eat because there isn’t anything else about for breakfast.  Stick to the normal sesame ones.  Haven’t tried the other deli flavours, but probably won’t based on these.
Love these bagels, toast them and fill with mayo, lettuce and cheddar cheese then eat while hot! Scrummy!
We had these toasted with scrambled egg in the morning. I think the flavour balances perfectly to be honest and don't find them at all tough, just the right about of chewy for a bagel.

The bagels are very good but the mixture seems to cancel itself out and not be as nice as you think it will be. Worth a try on offer and I will probably buy again occasionally but will stick to the individual variety

Mine arrived yesterday and so far I have only had one, and I was really impressed. I am quite surprised about the negative reviews. I thought the bagel was quite large and filling. I just had it split and toasted with butter melting in. I loved the variety in the flavour, and the texture was lovely and chewy. It wasn't dry at all.  Maybe I was lucky, or maybe it is just because my pack was very fresh still. I'll edit this review if the rest of the pack proves disappointing. But at this stage I really love these!
These bagels have a lovely flavour but were incredibly dry and as tough as old boots when toasted.  They were smaller and flatter than previously, so it felt like they were under proved.

These were really tasty and lovely lightly toasted with a cheese salad inside. My only niggle is they are dry - when we orignally toasted them they were very dry but the following time we toasted them less and they were much better.
Lovely bagels really flavoursome! Had with chicken and salad for lunch lovely
Really tasty, and not bothered they go dry quite quickly.....just means they're not full of preservatives and nothing that a toaster or a quick refresh in the oven wont sort.
Dry and crumbly. The worst bagel Ive ever tried.

I bought exactly the same product a few weeks ago and the bagels were so much bigger and tastier. I saw what was delivered just now and was stunned. Isn’t it a bit too obvious a change? I know what I am definitely removing from next week’s shopping basket.
What on earth has happened to these bagels. They are so thin now they are hard to split in two. Disappointing.
Was really looking forward to these but felt a little let down. They were quite dry. Smelt good out of the packet but that didn’t come through on taste. Wouldn’t buy again
Lovely

Everything bagels were always my favourite bagels to buy in the States, so I was super happy to see them for sale in the UK, but boy: what a disappointment. Dry and hardly any garlic flavour. Will stick to the onion ones.
These are the driest bagels Ive ever known in my life. Toasting them helps but I cant imagine eating them as they are. Shame because the everything seasoning is nice.
These are delicious. However 20p more expensive than other varieties and only 4 not 5 in the pack

These are really nice but arrived on Sunday with a use by of Tuesday. I failed to check the life guarantee before purchasing but can see that it is indeed 2 days. Even with my voracious appetite for carbs, 4 bagels in two days is pushing it hence a star must be dropped.
NA
Would have preferred something much stronger to make it palatable, maybe coffee

At reduced price these are good value.  Quite thick
and filling, but doubt they will make a lot of difference
to skin!

Since this has been on offer Ive been drinking 4 a week for the last month, my skin is starting to feel less dried out and slightly firmer!  Ive had a couple of compliments this week that my skin is looking good so I feel its working for me!  While its on offer Ill keep drinking it!
Well it's my cup of tea and doing a month on this so let's see if it works.
Recently June - August 2020 the flavour drastically changed, has an unpleasant taste in the back of the throat now, something sulfuric.
-and where is strawberry in the ingredients...?
Read the ingredients, basically collagen, vitamins (notoriously of no certain effect in artificial form) colourings and flavourings. No evidence at all this works

Tastes like liquid bubble gum. Fine as a one off but couldn't drink it regularly.  Also expensive for a little bottle. 
No change in skin after one purchase but didn't expect otherwise!!
I will never know if works or not because is so horrible I cant drink another one!
Dont know about making your skin look younger but tastes great! Bought on offer as £2 is ridiculous for 200 ml, would buy again if on offer
I only tried this because it was on offer but after 3 weeks my skin is definitely much better and despite what everyone says it tastes good
This tastes ok, with a slightly weird earthy aftertaste. It is a small bottle and not amazing. It is ok when on offer.

Got this free to try. 

Initially had a strange after taste, a bit chemical, but otherwise a fairly ordinary milkshake.

Maybe I just don't believe the hype and would rather wear face cream than drink it.
Am I the only one to experience lumps? Yuk!! Literally felt like I was drinking fat and the bottle said smooth!!
Oh why oh why would you make it taste like a drink your child would ask for but  you wouldn't let them have!!! Synthetic bubble gum flavour, does not taste remotely healthy!!! Yuk

Tastes yummy, must be refrigerated before drinking. A did a couple weeks once a day to try this out.  
it was only when I stopped drinking it that I realised it did help my skin. 
I get dry patches on my face and the odd hormonal spot but whilst drinking this it did clear up! I had no skin problems or no spots. After my trial I stopped drinking them, within 3days my dry patches came back and a couple spots. Though it didn't feel like a dramatic change it did actually improve my skins appearance. So for me I will be going back to having this in my daily routine.
Absolutely disgusting, it tastes like the cheapest bubble gum which makes me very skeptical about it being a healthy drink.
Very good source of vitamins, try to have one every day. I reckon if one has this long enough, you may be able to see the difference in your skin etc.

If drinking this is what it takes to be beautiful, I'll stay ugly. 

Repellent.

This tastes great and the nutritional profile isnt bad either. It's only 112 calories per bottle which makes it the ideal drink/ meal if you get peckish and want to avoid the biscuit tin. I usually drink one at breakfast time and one after a gym session, but there are no rules. 
With the 5000mg of hydrolysed collagen which is benefical for skin, tendons and joints I think its working as my skin is much softer all over, and my creaky knee isn't so creaky....love this stuff!
Not too sweet, can tell it isn't from concentrate. Good quality
this tasted too acidic as if the orange peel was put in the juicer as well, disappointed given the high price and that the pink lady apple juice is delicious
I find this is a very fresh tasting orange juice, maybe a little sharper than some, but very refreshing.
From the name I thought it was a freshly squeezed juice. But it definitely is not. It tastes like a cheap OJ that you would be offered in a two star all-inclusive-resort in Spain. Stay away.
Usually happy with added vitamins but noticed this also includes vit D. Not necessary to supplement and depletes your potassium and blocks absorption of vitamin A!!
Not sure if we got a bad batch but it is very sharp and acidic. Wont be buying again.

Everything tastes better from glass or at least a cardboard carton a d at this price why a cheap plastic bottle.

Lovely juice but minus a point for the plastic carton.

Love the flavour of this orange juice, much better than other brands. reasonable price and my 14 year old daughter loves it as it had 'no bits'. my daughter diagnosed with anemia so she takes a little of this with her iron prescription to help absorption. would recommend

I ordered it after seeing it was on offer with 20% off and thought we’d try this orange juice for a change. What a great surprise! Absolutely LOVE IT. I will add it to our “regulars”. It tastes so fresh, not sweet but not tangy either, and no bits. Best product discovery this month!!!
Tried this for the first time. Really lovely, freshly squeezed flavour. Will certainly order again.
This has a lovely flavour and you need to remember to give it a good shake before use as it does settle out. Cant fault it
3 bottles on repeat order every week, cant have enough of the stuff. Deeeeeelicious! This from a lifelong coffee addict now weaning off it and trying OJ.
My family have been working their way through different brands of Orange juice and theyve said this has the best flavour. It reminds us of freshly squeezed oranges weve had on a summer holiday!!

..Tasted quite ordinary to me like happy shopper juice &  the title/packaging therefore misleading (Unless it was a bad batch but I think I made this mistake once before buying this product) .. I don’t like waste so was pleased when used it up. Tropicana with juicy bits was good but haven’t tried it for awhile so I don’t know how it is now .. some products do go downhill (&or diluted) I’ve noticed

My husband and I really enjoy it.  
One of the nicest orange juice. Highly recommend it :)
Got this as a replacement and it didnt taste fresh at all
Best tasting orange juice out of the many i have tried.
Was not bad but def not the best. Freshly squeezed M&S much tastier than this one plus this is more expensive
Love this orange juice, particularly when it's on offer. The normal price is a little expensive. It really does taste almost freshly squeezed.
Delicious, clean taste, expensive but much nicer than the other brands
This juice is full of flavour and a clean orange flavour with no bitterness or sharpness. It's very smooth and much better than most brands out there.

I love a glass of orange juice as a weekend treat with the papers and a pastry! 

This is half the price of some of the higher end brands on here. And Id say probably half the quality.

Sharper for sure but a reasonable offering.
Bought this with a coupon. Nice OJ but not sure I would pick this at full price over other brands. Lovely and refreshing ice cold but nowt overly special
Not over impressed given the price point
Not too sweet a taste. Highly recommended.
Had it with a coupon, would order again. Its smooth rather than with pulp which I marginally prefer.
4 stars for the price but got this on offer....Lovely juice with good flavour.
Without question the nicest and most comparable to just squeezed, wonderfully sweet

I normally only ever drink freshly prepared juice. While freshly prepared juice served immediately is still better, the Coldpress range of juices are the nicest pre packaged orange and apple juices I have ever tried in the UK. It is also nice that they use single variety apples and oranges as well rather that the term "orange". They taste very nice and I would reccomend them to everybody. The one thing I would have changed if I was Coldpress was to use glass bottles.
This orange juice is so tasty, thick, with a lovely texture. It's hard not to want to drink it all at once.
Quite nice but I prefer the not from concentrate Waitrose  juices. However I will look up the virtues of cold pressing and see if it is worth the extra cost  when not on offer.
Nice orange juice
I really like this orange juice, lovely flavour, refreshing and naturally sweet.

I buy this as it's the only cold pressed juice available here that I know of and other juices are heat treated so trying to avoid. This is almost as good in taste to my favourite of the heat pasteurised juices which is Innocent with bits and this does have bits too so I'm pretty happy with it

I grew up in Florida where we always had fresh juice, fresh as in made from oranges, not out of a container. As someone else mentioned, to me, this juice tasted like Tropicana packaged juice. I tried it and poured the rest down the drain. Even Waitrose fresh juice to go is better than this.
Really good juice, as near to freshly squeezed as I've tasted Recommended!

Not sure what freshly squeezed orange juice the other reviewers have had but in my opinion tastes nowhere near as good as the real thing. As others have said, on par with tropicana (but doesn't have bits) but nothing special especially at a premium price.
This juice tastes like 100%  freshly squeezed oranges, very natural and pure. We won't be going back to other premium brands such as Innocent or Tropicana. Worth every penny.
as good as tropicana, better than innocent
Great juice, best i've tasted for a long time, so much nicer than innocent. Highly recommend.
One of the nicest fresh OJ's, do highly recommend, has a freshly squeezed taste, just delish!
Awful

The only good thing that can be said about this gravy is that the smell is so revolting at least you know it'll be inedible before you pour it all over your dinner. Truly appalling. I can only assume that whoever approved this for sale had Covid at the time because they can't have been in possession of working tastebuds. I smelled it, thought "well it can't taste as bad as it smells, surely", tried some and was proven wrong, because it's worse.
We really enjoyed the gravy. We dont know why there are such negative reviews but we found the gravy inoffensive and went well with our organic free range chicken and mash potatoes !
absolutely revolting. Thankfully I tasted this before using. Straight down the sink. yuk

A very unpleasant taste . Also it was dangerous as you have to stir half way through and pot flimsy, What on earth is happening to M.&  S their quality is really 
slipping.
Nice gravy and not too salty.
Awful

The only good thing that can be said about this gravy is that the smell is so revolting at least you know it'll be inedible before you pour it all over your dinner. Truly appalling. I can only assume that whoever approved this for sale had Covid at the time because they can't have been in possession of working tastebuds. I smelled it, thought "well it can't taste as bad as it smells, surely", tried some and was proven wrong, because it's worse.
We really enjoyed the gravy. We dont know why there are such negative reviews but we found the gravy inoffensive and went well with our organic free range chicken and mash potatoes !
absolutely revolting. Thankfully I tasted this before using. Straight down the sink. yuk

A very unpleasant taste . Also it was dangerous as you have to stir half way through and pot flimsy, What on earth is happening to M.&  S their quality is really 
slipping.
Nice gravy and not too salty.
Lovely sweet flavour. Very refreshing and nice reminder of Summer especially when some of these fruits are not in season.
I like this, liked the strawberry and the fact it's much thinner than a usual smoothie which I find too gloopy. I don't like it enough to pay the full price though.

I was given this to review and let my daughter try it first.  She's a strawberry lover and I find strawberry smoothies too sweet generally.  She liked it and didn't mind that the consistency was somewhere between a juice and a smoothie.  I was persuaded to try it as she said it is less sweet than usual and she was right.  I liked the slightly acidic finish the lime gives it - and the less gloupy consistency.  I'm not sure I would pay full price for it, but if were on offer I would consider it.
Slightly thinner than the average smoothie, which does make it easier to drink. The lime does add a nice zing to it.

I was sent this to review.  I like the taste at the beginning - mainly berry-like.  However, the taste of lime comes through at the end, which I don't really like.  I think it would be a lot nicer without the lime.
I am reviewing this product as I was sent a free sample. Loved the combination of tastes and nice consistency.
Most certainly has a ZING! taste. But can become a little sickly when not in moderation.

I was sent this product to review by Ocado.  It has a lovely smooth texture and the lime gives it just the right amount of zing.  I usually find smoothies too thick but this was just right and was not overpowered by a banana taste like most other brands.  My 6 year old granddaughter loved it.  Drank about half the bottle to herself. Would definitely recommend and buy again.  Going to try others in this range too.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. This was quite watery for a smoothie, but the flavours still came through and the hit of lime was especially nice. I'd probably purchase this as a treat occasionally.

I got this product free to review from Ocado.  My first impression was, ok not too bad.  Then, it's a lot like apple juice.  Then I look on the label - 66% apple juice and 16% apple water.  Huh.  Well, if you like your apple juice taking on the taste of the banana it was next to in the lunch box, this product is for you.

I’m leaving this review as I had a free sample from Ocado. 
I found this a little too watery for a smoothie, but it tasted ok and my kids loved it.
Really good.
Nice consistency, not gloopy. Refreshing.
I was sent this free from ocado to review.  It has a nice consistency,  not too thick.  I enjoyed the taste and would buy it again, but only if it's on offer.
Unlike other smoothies, this was easy to drink. More like a juice rather than a shake.
Given this to review. Good consistency - not too thick. A bit sweet for me because of banana but quite fresh tasting.

I was sent this from Ocado free to review
It has a good thick consistency with a good mix of flavours. I like the lime flavour in it. Very refreshing and filling

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. 
The predominant flavour and even the smell is of apple, not surprisingly as that is what it mostly consists of. 
It also has a rather thin texture for a smoothie. 
However, it does have a pleasant flavour & a fairly low sugar content for this kind of drink. Probably because they have not added any sugar, which is great. 
There was a hint of strawberry & lime, but it was just a bit watery & wishy washy in flavour for the very high price tag.

I WAS GIVEN THIS TO REVIEW. IT IS PERFECT FOR ME AS I DON'T LIKE THE TEXTURE OF THICK SMOOTHIES. THIS IS LIKE A SUPER FRUIT JUICE WITH AN ADDED ZEST, WHICH I LIKE.  I LEFT OFF ONE STAR AS ONCE AGAIN IT IS MOSTLY APPLE JUICE., ALTHOUGH THE FLAVOUR IS A GOOD BALANCE.

I was given this to review and if I didn’t like it very much, my husband thought it was very good. To be fair, I don’t enjoy kiwi or lime in smoothies in general as find them overpowering but he very much enjoyed it.
I had this sent to me to review - it had a nice taste.
Very good, smooth but feels bubbly. Good balance of sweetness and sweet fruits. Good for kids to get them used to the taste of eating fruits
I quite like the added lime, but it's very expensive unless it's on offer.

I was given this to review, I don't normally have smoothies so wasn't sure what to expect. It was ok but did taste odd as I did expect it to taste predominantly of strawberries. Also quite expensive so not for us.
Got this free to review. It's nice to have a smoothie that isn't dominated by banana even though it is high in the ingredient list. Lots of lime. Not gloopy or slimy. A clean drink.

I received a free sample to review. I would prefer it without the lime which seems to overwhelm everything else. However, someone else in the household loved the lime zing so it must depend on how much of a lime fan you are!
Nice flavour, can taste all the different fruits, even though the lime flavour stands out, which suppose gives the zing to it.

Four of us tried it: 2 grandparents, 2 kids. 
The kids adored it (their words) adding: “best smoothie ever”, but “maybe a bit too much lime”. I guess the lime gives it the “Zing”. 
We grandparents liked the taste very much, and thought we could clearly identify all the different fruits, so we were surprised to read that so much of it is apple juice. 
It’s high in (naturally occurring) sugars: the 65 grams in the bottle is over 70% of the daily recommended maximum and a whole bottle might all go down rather too easily. 
Maybe it tastes a bit too good to keep regularly in the house - it could be too tempting. 
But at the full price of £3.98 it’s a bit of a luxury item, so we wouldn’t be buying it very often anyway.

I am reviewing this product because I received a free sample from Ocado. I usually make my own, so wanted to see what a take home one was like. As a family we found it to be very confusing in flavour.  Definitely was not strawberry or banana per say. Perhaps the zingy lime and radish was the problem?  Certainly not for us or for that price either.  Won’t be on our shopping list I’m afraid.
Delicious for my husband and myself. Too much of a 'zing' for my son to drink it, though.
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Im not usually a smoothie person but I found this quite pleasant to drink and I enjoyed the fresh zing!
Got sent this for review. Nice refreshing drink and we enjoyed it. Does feel too sweet
Really smooth and very refreshing as the lime cuts through the strawberry flavour perfectly. Not five stars from me as it seems so expensive when not on offer!

I was given this by Ocado free in return for a review, and I would probably not have bought it.  I have had better smoothies, but it might be that I would have preferred another flavour in this line.  I found it had a strange savoury flavour and see from the ingredients that it contains radish, so that could be what disturbed me.
Given item to review.  I usually buy innocent and this was rather watery in comparison.  Also was a little sharp in flavour.  Not something I’d buy again as will keep to innocent.
Not sure why so many middling reviews. Naked do amazing smoothies and this is another corker.
This is very nice but I'm not certain it's much better than what I can make in my smoothie machine.
I was sent this product to review, it is not a flavour I would normally have opted for but my daughter loved it even though I was more undecided. So probably won’t buy again unless on an offer price.

I was sent a free sample by Ocado to review. Rather watery for a (well-shaken) smoothie. I wasn't keen on the taste at first but it grew on me. The lime taste certainly comes through. Bafflingly expensive at full price.
I liked the flavour though it’s pricey for a juice. Nice to have occasionally

I was sent this to review, and I didn't really like it. The smoothie was really strongly flavoured with something, and it just didn't taste like a smoothie. I appreciated the bottle being made of recycled plastic but the drink itself was a bit unpleasant.

We often buy cheese at Aldi..their finest range is excellent..these were about same quality..would have been expensive at twenty pounds but got a Christmas bargain, at half price..have bought again, since then and been pleased..long dates and nice quality..

Not all of the cheese in the pack is suitable for vegetarians and there is nothing stating this on the cheese packs, it is just on the outer box. So be careful if you are vegetarian - the cheeses are also subject to availability and can be swapped with others before arrival.

We are enjoying trying these very good British cheeses.  A mix of soft and hard cheeses, including an excellent goats cheese,  and red leicester which we wouldn't normally buy.  Feels like an exploration while we're in lockdown.
Looked, smelt and tasted like dog food. Beef was questionable, tasted more like liver.
I don't know what M&S have done but there is a really unpleasant taste. I love all of the ingredients so I don't know how the could be combined to make something inedible.  I won't be buying again.
Very little meat and cabbage. Mostly sweet potato. Sauce has a very unusual taste. Will not be buying again.
Reading the other reviews I think the quality of this meal must be inconsistent. The one I received had small lumps of meat in a thin sauce. There was an odd taste of dried herbs somewhere.
The beef was meltingly tender, good amount of beef & sauce. Needed some extra veg to make a meal though. Bit expensive.

This is probably my favourite M&S ready meal - really flavoursome and yet not calorie heavy - yes!  I cook it with some extra broccoli and love it - my main meal of the day. It reminds me of the erstwhile beef and red wine meal in the M&S balanced for you range. What about bringing out a version of the hake dish from the balanced for you range - I loved that. More like this please! My only suggestion would be to have a visible "British Beef" label on the front, rather than hidden in the text at the back, To know it's British beef is important to me.
This was really nice and had lots of flavour, but it could have done with more cabbage. More low carbs meals like this please.

I love stews and casseroles so saw this in the flash sale and ordered. Overpowering flavour of herbs and two large chunks of cabbage stalk were the greenery and the beef was gristly. After a few mouthfuls threw the rest away and I really hate to waste food.
Not a bad taste but the texture isn't great, more like mince, and the cabbage completely disappeared.
looks lovely but big disappointment. Beef tough with jelly bits, no way slow cooked. Sweet potato hard and cabbage non existent. Only thing nice was gravy :(
A good portion size, very very nice

We really enjoyed this and thought the meat tender and the gravy rich and full of flavour. It was easy to add extra vegetables for those more hungry than others . I bought some for my elderly parents who found it a very easy meal for them to heat in the microwave for themselves
It wasn’t like real meat, very disappointing
Good amount of beef and hearty sauce.
I dont regularly buy ready meals but gave this a try and it is tasteless and bland

This is primarily a low cal meal, I love food but have become disabled and dont have energy to cook so trying ready made options, the overall taste is okay, the gravy is flavourful with red wine reduction and you have a beefy taste but not much meat, a spoonful of cabbage thats okay, its veg that comes with the £4 meal so its positive. The sweet potato or carrots had no desirable flavour and hard, I had to add half a tub of mash because its to small for me and I felt it was missing something to satisfy me, so that puts the price up by another £1.25 at m&s prices so overall £5.25 for a quick probably nutritious meal. I would not buy again as it wasnt very enjoyable experience for the overall price, but everyone is different so its worth giving it a try if like me you rely on premade products or you are on a diet.
Why would you want half a duck breast? So weird. Meat was decent but check the weight before you buy - its small

I bought it regardless of the reviews because I don't have a huge appetite. absolutely terrible butchery, only half of the membrane was removed and there was more fat surface area than meat so it looks bigger in the packet than it actually is. I reckon I will need both 'portions' for one dinner. It certainly isn't enough for 2 people.

Ambiguous description. Is it a portion of a breast (yes)  or an individual portion of a duck (whole breast is normal)?  Should be clarified: very small and cut in a way that does not resemble duck breast as normally presented.
Consistently great! I have ordered these for years and never been disappointed.
There are 2 perfect portions (not 2 full breasts). Make a super easy dinner. The meat is always tasty and fresh.

apparently 2 "duck breast portions" is a duck breast cut lengthwise down the middle.... this is not only slightly misleading given the image looks like 2 breasts, but it's poorly done and makes for a terrible cooking experience.

To cook duck breast properly you need to start it in a cold pan skin side down and gradually bring it up to medium-high heat in order to render the fat in the skin and crisp it up before finishing in the oven to cook to medium. This is not possible to do with these  "portions" because they are not balanced in the same way as a whole breast.... they do not stand properly on their skin side because of the way they've been cut meaning they fall over. so you have to tend to them constantly to make sure they stay upright and don't fall over which will overcook the meat. that prevents you from cooking anything else at the same time.  

I would rather they provide one whole duck breast and state it feeds 2 people. At £5 per breast it's extortionately expensive compared to the Gressingham brand  when you get 2 whole breasts for £9 RRP, but normally about £7 as it's frequently on offer. That's a whole 10-40% more expensive per breast for something that's been quite literally butchered to a point beyond use. 

Definitely won't be buying this again.
Used these for a lunch with friends and they said it was some of the best duck they had ever had. Served with an avocado salad.
Skin side down on a hot griddle for 5 minutes then in the oven at 180for about 15 minutes, let it rest for 10 minutes. Crispy skin and tender meat, perfect.

Bought as part of the stir fry offer but had them with mashed potatoes in a port jus. Pan fried in a cold pan to render the fat and then roasted in the oven for 8 mins they were beautifully tender. Really good.
The duck is good and easy to cook but be aware these are small portions. I get them when on offer or part of a stir fry meal deal.

Bought these as part of the stir fry deal. Never cooked duck before so was looking forward to trying these! Followed prep and cooking instructions and they were really tasty, meat nice prior to adding the stir fry sauce. Pieces really differed in size which isnt idea if you were serving whole
These were a good buy not so much fat as others that I have bought. I will definitely make these a regular buy.
We got this with the stir fry meal deal and it was a lovely bit of duck. We rendered it down and rested before serving.
I took the skin off and marinated thin strips in a teriyaki sauceleft for a day in the fridge, then made a stir fry with veg and chilli noodles. Was delicious and great value for money.
Loved these. Great value when in the stir fry meal deal. They need cooking properly though, so best to follow a reliable recipe.
I wasnt very impressed. Lots of trimming needed and they leeched a lot of water.

Not sure about the cooking instructions on the packet, I thought oven cooking breasts would make them turn out tough. Instead, scored the fat and cooked skin-side down on lowish heat in frying pan for 10 mins to render it, then heat up to crisp the skin, turn over 3 minutes and rest 5 mins.  Turned out juicy and delicious, perfect touch of pink, good flavour.  Will buy again, it’s very versatile to use in stir frys, served with a veg dinner, or sliced in a salad.
Maybe it was me and how I cooked them but I found these duck breasts really chewy, the meat didnt sear well and I found the flavour bland. Wouldnt but again.

Bought these for a stir fry and they were delicious.
Really tasty and great value for money.
Will definitely be buying again.
We really like these. The quality, quantity and the price are super.

Got these in for a change to chicken in our stirfry and Im so glad we did. They were delightful, cooked as per the packet instructions which resulted in crispy skin & moist / pink meat! A real hit calved on top of our sweet and spicy stirfry. Will buy again.
I cooked these as per instructions and they were fantastic served with stir fry. Beautifully tender.

Having read the reviews I was very surprised when these two large duck breasts arrived. Enough for 4 people when making a salad. However, I cooked off the fat and discarded it then sliced and fried the meat but a lot of water content was released when frying the meat, hence 4 stars.

These are the perfect size. Hadnt cooked duck before or even eaten much of it but wanted something different to add to our meals. An absolute hit and have these fortnightly as a treat. Absolutely delicious.
These were a bit small and uneven in size, but they tasted great. For the price these are great
the portions are small but delicious, would buy again
Bought these as a special treat, although small they were delicious and far superior to other duck breasts I have bought from Ocado.

I bought this product with the intention of making an at home "date night" meal. I was really looking forward to it until I opened the packet and found two very small duck breast "portions" which did not even amount to an entire duck breast in total.  One of the pieces was 75% fat. I cooked the meal and being the much smaller person served myself the smaller piece which amounted to about four bites of duck (I don't eat the fat!).  It was very disappointing and didn't taste great either.  Don't make the same mistake as me, just buy the Gressingham product with two whole duck breast portions if you're making a nice duck meal.
Absolutely lovely. A little in the small side but so so tender. Will buy every week
Much smaller than expected, it doesn't say in the title these are portions and not whole breasts.
Two pieces very unevenly trimmed from one duck breast.  Tasteless and a little tough.  No good for pan frying.  Not enough for two hungry people.  Would not buy again.
Not enough duck for 4 portions

Bought these to try out some new duck seasoning and they were delicious. Nice portion sizes. Cooked as per the packet and the skin went crispy with the meat soft and tender. Would definitely buy these again.

These packs seem to contain one breast cut into two "portions" - not very evenly either. It was fine for us because we gave the smaller pieces to the kids. However, there were not 2 adult size portions in each pack.
Trimmed to about half the size of a complete duck breast. Also, 2 very different sized pieces.
Shards of bone running through one of the breasts - not expecting this so possible choking hazard. Definitely not recommended

I seasoned these and fried 5 mins skin down, 2 mins skin up and then brushed with five spice, honey and red vinegar marinade and transferred for 10 mins to be finished in the oven. Very tasty and flavoursome. Pink in the middle. Served with pak choi and noodles
You do not get two even sized or even decent size portion size.  Would not buy again
Very tasty duck breasts. Used these to make the Marco Polo pasta with duck in plum sauce, mushrooms and spring onions. Tender and delicious. Well priced. Will be buying again!
Roasted with Chinese 5 spice for use in a duck salad using leaves, blue cheese, nuts and pears.  Enough for two when thinly sliced.  Very tender.
Although small, it still seems to be just enough for 2 people. The duck is well bred and extremely tasty. Cooking instructions on previous reviews are spot on.

Though these are quite small. That is smaller than your average Gressingham, they were very tasty. Happy they have a good welfare standard. After cooking... Fry on skin in dry pan til fat rendered, then oven for 5 to 6 minutes.... They looked very small, but we're fine for 2 of us in a duck salad. Will buy again.

Really delicious tender duck breasts. Cooked using a BBC Good Food recipe Roasted duck breast with plum sauce. Opted for 8 minutes at the oven stage, which resulted in perfect pink meat. Definitely recommend.
This is just ok. Perfectly fine for a recipe but if you are drizzling over something then spend a little more and get a better product.
Especially my kids like it, on toast or with porridge. Good price too.
Its nice as a sweetener but I didnt think it particularly tasted of honey. The M&S one is the same price but much more flavour.

This is reasonably priced and not unpleasant, no doubt about that. I just find that it solidifies too quickly and you end up having to plan way ahead so you have time to heat it up for a long time before you can use it. It's just too much of a pain for me!!
Good value simple honey which kids use on their cereal / porridge however it does crystallise quite quickly
Good runny honey however does tend to crystalize then requires gentle heat to get it out of the bottle. otherwise would have given 5 stars for price and and taste.
a staple in cupboard of course, plus love to see OCADO in my kitchen every single day ;)
Great for adding to tea and porridge. Light flavour so doesn't overtake
I put on Greshingham Duck Confit (Waitrose) and it is delicious. A must have in the cupboard.
And a good price.
We love this honey. Like the bottle, good quantity and good price. We have it at the weekends with waffles or pancakes.
Good price, good taste.
The children have this on their breakfast. They prefer this to the others they have tried. Good price.
So glad I found this. A delicious and moreish honey which I've started using instead of sugar - especially for sweetening stewed fruit. Wonderful!
Handy squeeze bottle of nice honey, used for our homemade granola delicious on the kids cereal, easy for them to squirt for themselves. The right consistency for every day use.
Good every day honey, I purchase regularly to add to hot drinks. Good price.
Good value compared to other brands. It sometimes crystallises but I warm it up in the microwave & let it cool down & it’s back to how it should be
and good price
Really convenient to use in a squeezable bottle, perfect for baking or for sweetening my cup of tea.
As above as it adds more flavour than sugar, but not sure the flavour is robust enough for toast or porridge. As I bake a lot this is bound to become a staple
Pleasant tasting, Easy for the kids to squeeze on their cereal or porridge without any mess.  Great all round, every day product at a great price.
Lovely mild honey. Excellent price.
Two of my children love honey and this on porridge is a real winner! Great price and very little wastage as its so runny. Cant go wrong!
Great price
This is great as an everyday honey - good value and really useful for flapjack recipes.
I think this honey is brilliant for the price would definitely buy again
I mainly use it for cooking, for yogurt I prefer better quality honey.
Handy for putting on yoghurt for a dessert. Great price.
For the price, this honey is fabulous. Have used it in cooking and also on breakfast cereal. Its fine.
Excellent honey and love the packaging its so easy and clean. Beautiful delicate taste.

This honey is simple in flavour and easily added to things like cakes and herbal teas. It's a good all rounder, although I have another more complex honey that I put on toast when I want to actually have a more distinct flavour.
I would recommend.
This was sent to review. It has the same texture as other leading brands. I poured this over my porridge and found it much sweeter than my normal brand so you need much less.
A good quality staple in my cupboard!
This has a lovely mild flavour and is really easy to squeeze out from the bottle without making a mess.
Good value for money

This honey is sweet and sticky but has no real flavour.  It is competitively priced, however, and would be useful to use in cooking or as a sweetener but, if you want delicious honey to spread on your toast, a more expensive brand might be better.

Nice enough honey, Im the only one in my family who eats honey, apart from using it in cooking i.e on roasted vegetables or on cooked ham. I like it in porridge and yogurt which this is nice in but on toast I prefer a honey with more of a flowery taste. I, like others I am pleased to say who are reviewing on Ocado, try to buy glass instead of plastic so would probably not buy again more for this reason than the quality of the product.
This is a useful addition to my store cupboard.  We use it to roast vegetables, in baking, to sweeten coffee and on toast.  Lovely flavour!
Good value tastes good
