This honey was a great taste not too sweet. I use honey to do roasted carrots and this was the perfect consistent. Good price too and a great staple for the cupboard. Would definitely purchase again.
Although it is quite high in sugar surprisingly not that sweet.
Good value runny honey nice delicate flavour. I found it easy to measure for cooking as it is quite runny and good on porridge
Love this honey Ive been buying it for a while now. Lovely flavour and super convenient in the squeeze bottle.
I was sent this honey to review. Its good value with a mild taste useful for cooking and baking. However I prefer to avoid plastic bottles so this wont be a product I will be buying.
When I first tasted this I thought it was lacking flavour but on a second try its actually got quite a nice, delicate flavour. I prefer to buy British honey where possible but this is pretty good.
For an everyday honey it's well worth the money  My husband put it in his coffee and said that it was fine but was too runny to use on toast
really lovely flavour and good value too, perfect drizzled over fruit and yogurt.
Not top quality but great for every day use
A pleasant taste but would probably stick to my normal honey.

We were sent this to review.
My son is the only one who eats honey in our house he said it is easy to use in the squeezey bottle  and tasty on toast - nothing earth shattering but a good priced basic product.
This is a good entry level honey, sweet but mild flavour.
Versatile runny honey- good for porridge, cooking etc Nice taste

We got this for review. It's a good honey, and it runs smoothly, so easy to pour. 
It's a good size bottle as well.
Love this honey, mild tasting but delicious, and good value. A staple.
Does not taste like honey, more like melted down sugar.  Not impressed with the plastic bottle either.
This is a blend of honeys from various sources. Tastes flowery and runny. Good value for the price. Perfect for adding to drinks (tea) and cooking or drizzling on toast. Will buy again.

this is ideal for squirting on things rather than using a spoon.
Tastes nice too
Nothing fancy, just good tasting normal honey.
Mild honey which is quite runny- a little too runny to have on buttered toast but perfect to put on cereal or for cooking. Good price.
I wouldnt use this on toast as its too runny but Im cooking and baking it was nice. Good flavour for inexpensive honey.
This is a very decent hunny for a reasonable price.
Good quality Runny Honey that stays runny. Good price.
says it all!
I use this as breakfast honey and tbh its fine, my only criticism would be plastic packaging. Can u suggest offering a refill pod to fill the container with once its empty?
Love the price of this honey. Still quality product, why pay more? Very useful to have at cupboard.

This is a lovely, very versatile mild honey.  Has multiple uses in the kitchen and is a great price.  Sadly I cannot give it five stars when there is so much media attention around the over use of plastic. Yes it may be convenient, but I would prefer some more effort to be made to protect our planet rather than saving us two seconds by being able to squeeze it out of a plastic bottle.
I prefer a mild honey so this works well for me. Good all rounder at a good price.
Good decent honey. Great for cooking anything to achieve a sweet sticky glaze.

This honey is brilliant for the price. Obviously you cant beat local or the really expensive stuff but this is great on a budget. We add to fruit and yoghurt and cant really tell it apart from other squeezable honeys
Tried this on toast and yoghurt. It's a winner. Great bottle to avoid mess too.

Received free in return for an honest review. We use this honey as our everyday honey, instead of refined sugar. Great in cooking, sweetening cocoa, marinades etc. This honey is a good basic honey at a good price point. However, we use a more intensely flavoured honey, for say honey on toast.
ok as a cheap alternative,tried it on bread for our foxes that visit the garden-they loved it.Prefer our locally produced honey so would not change.
Perhaps a bit light and mild but sometimes thats what you want. Fairly priced too, would use generally.
good value honey, not as flavoursome as some of the Rowse varieties you get but for the price it's good
Good value, nice taste
Not good

This is great for use in baking, or we get through it drinking hot lemon and honey now the coughs and colds are here. For honey on toast, or Greek yogurt and honey, I'd want something a bit deeper and more complex. But this is fine if you don't need the honey to be the star of the show.
Use rarely in baking. Hasnt crystallised.
Taste good
Use this for herbal teas or cereal as a sweetener and it is good for that i can say. Acceptable on the pocket too.
Its like some kind of a sugary syrup rather than honey I guess you get what you pay for. Will never buy again.
It didn't go hard till very last time. Much longer runny sizzle compare with other leading brand. Also really good price!
taste and quality is poorest i ever tried
Doesn't spill, easy to store and tastes lovely.
Great value. Hasnt crystallised quickly like other cheaper options. Very happy xD
Delicious and just as good as a honey at twice the price. I use it for all purposes and the family love it.

My usual honey was out of stock so I risked ordering g this as an alternative. No surprise, it's much better! And cheaper than other brands. It's not overly sweet, comes in a handy squeeze bottle and tastes lovely on toast and Greek yoghurt.

A good basic honey - great for cooking and drizzling over yoghurt.  I have tried honey in this price bracket before that I wouldn't buy again because of the very bland sweet flavour.  This isn't one of them!
Not for honey officanados, but s lovely mild honey.  Lovely on toast and porridge.  Not cloying.
This is a mild honey which hubby likes on his weetabix! Handy for cooking as well, easy to squeeze.

Add this to unsweetened cereals to made them a bit more palatable! Good for the price and when it crystallises towards the end of the bottle just pop it in the microwave for 10secs and find I can get every drop out that way
We go through a lot of honey in our house in porridge, natural yoghurt, etc and find that for the price this is perfect

If you are are looking for a special honey to savour as a treat then this is probably not for you, but if you just want a squirt on your porridge etc then this is perfectly adequate! Its an average honey flavour, nothing exceptional. We get through it relatively quickly, but I've not noticed any problems with it crystallising, though as another reviewer says, all honey crystallises!

For the price it was fine - Although, personally I'd prefer to spend a little money for more of a 'honey' flavour, as opposed to just cheap bland sweet stuff! I also think it was false economy, due to it being so bland, i used more of it!
Really like this honey :)
I have a little of this every day and use it in cooking too.  It seems to taste as good as any other so I'm very happy with this one and saving money at the same time.
You can pop it in the microwave but it's a pain! I'll pay more and try something else.
Hello people? All honey will crystallise. Hello?

The honey tastes OK, nothing special. The problem is indeed that it crystallized much faster than any honey I have ever used, and of course then you can't get it out of the bottle. Repeatedly tried the warm water trick, made no difference. Will never buy again.
This honey set rock solid within about 4-6 weeks.  It was impossible to get out of the container.  It is cheap, but if you can't use it, it is a false economy.  Not happy.
For the price, this honey is fantastic and delicious! I'm now a huge fan on honey on toast!
Cannot comment on the crystalising of the honey as we don't have it in the cupboard long enough! Perfect and lovely tasting for porridge, greek yoghurt, chicken etc

As others have said, it crystallises unusually fast. I've had to chuck the last few bottles away, so now I've changed to Asda own brand, which is great. Not sure what the problem is but Ocado certainly need to look into why this is happening.
As per other reviews it crystallises really quickly. Bought it to be runny. It's not. Warm/hot water doesn't help but I guess it's not the end of the world...
The last 3 bottles have all crystallized this year very quickly. Won't be buying again as most is wasted.
I agree that the last few times it has crystallised extremely quickly and then v difficult to get out of bottle. Why?!
This honey is just fine to use in cooking for coating chicken with spices etc. I'm not a tea and honey person so cant comment on that but for the price, personally I think its a winner.
I have this in tea to replace sugar with no issues. Very happy.
Strange tasting honey, even in porridge or tea. Would buy another variety next time, but it is cheap.
Really good value for tea/ pouring

I love the taste (and cost) of this honey. Yeah, it does crystallise eventually but I live alone so I expect it to after a couple of weeks. I transfer it into an empty jam jar so when it crystallises I just sit it in some boiling water in a pan until it's runny again, give it a good shake and then leave to cool.

We get through these reasonably fast as I have a honey-mad child, but it can certainly crystallise halfway down a pot for no reason. It can happen overnight. I've tried standing it in hot water as suggested but to no effect. To be honest this happens with other brands too, so if it's going to happen this is a more cost-effective one to buy! Good taste and consistency when this doesn't happen, though.

I've bought this for several years but over the last few months a problem has started with it solidifying shortly after opening. It then becomes impossible to get out of the bottle and therefore unusable. I've reported it to Ocado and it appears from the reviews that others have had the same problem. Come on Ocado! Wake up and change suppliers.

I've bought this a few times and it's fine. It's very runny, watery even, right up to the moment it solidifies, which I've found to be after about a few weeks. I've put it in boiling water to melt it but it doesn't seem to melt properly either.  I think it's to do with the glucose/fructose balance of the honey. Anyway, if you use a bottle a week I'm sure this will be fine but I'm going to buzz off to another brand as we take a month or so.

Although this has a good taste, the honey crystallizes after a few weeks. I've bought several jars and the same happens every time. My current bottle is rock solid and I have to get it out with a knife! Not ideal.
A great honey for the price. We get through a bottle a week as the whole family enjoy it.
I have bought this honey several times before with no problems but the last two purchases have both Crystalised very quickly. Something has changed in the manufacture or storage process.
Disappointed with this product as it crystallised within 2 weeks, I know you can put it in hot water but it's sold as runny honey so should last longer than this
Does crystallise in less than a week
As above
I have bought this great value honey a handful of times now and always found it to be great and easy to squeeze out of a great designed bottle that never gets sticky or leaks
This honey is brilliant value. I have it on cereal, porridge and toast. It has a well rounded flavour and no acidic sharpness of some honey brands. Very pleased.

I've bought this honey for some time and have never had it crystallise until the last bottle I bought. It's been tricky trying to get the honey out of the container now and I can't really use it as I want - runny! I have a new bottle, unopened, so will give this another try as it's usually great.
Really nice honey for cooking and spreading - not too strong!
Hasn't crystallised, lovely flavour, perfect on toast or in poridge. Best honey I've bought in ages.
Went hard and crystallised within a short time - never had any trouble with other brands doing this when stored under same conditions.

Having bought this on more than one occasion, the same thing happens - it crystalises very quickly after opening, even though stored correctly, cool and dark - in a cupboard/lader.  Rendering the contents not squeezable! Ended up throwing the last two in the bin.  Waste of Money!  Come on Ocado!  You have to do better than this.
My little girl is a honey monster, so this is ideal to use for her.  Its not the best tasting, but for her its great.  Its lasted a good while, so no major issues with it crystalising

Perhaps we were just unfortunate with the bottle we had, but I found the smell and taste of this honey really quite unpleasant. I have subsequently bought a different brand and that tasted much much nicer. I even got my partner to blind taste the two and he instantly knew which was which.

My son loves honey sandwiches and this is ideal, a quick squirt and youre done!  HAve has no problem with the honey crystalising as other reviewers have.  We must have ordered at least a dozenof these so far and they last anywhere between 2 weeks and 2 months and have been used unitl there is not a drop left.  A basic honey for a basic price.

great for cooking, porridge etc.

not a strong taste
Basic simple honey at a great price
This honey wouldn't run within two weeks. It was then stuck in the pot and we had to cut it open and it was a mess with honey everywhere.

It's not a specialty honey, there isn't anything really special about it. It's just plain honey, and the cheapest one at that. in Ocado. The squeeze bottle comes in handier than jars - saves the need to use something like a spoon to get the honey out. As for previous reviewers saying that the honey crystallizes, well... I've tried many other honeys and in my experience, all honeys crystallize at some point after they've been opened. That's just how it is. Either use it soon after opening preferably within a month or two or so or stand the bottle/jar of honey in warm water and that should get it running soon.
Delicious, does-what-it-says-on-the-bottle, but could have a little more depth of flavour. Great for cooking though, or drizzled on peanut butter on toast!

This honey was really nice and good value. the bottle makes it great for squeezing into porridge onto toast or into cooking.
Mine crystalised a bit but all honey does that and you just need to put it in warm water or in the microwave for 30 seconds.

I mainly use honey in cooking and this is a good product at a cheap price. My honey did not crystalise as other peoples did but I have had other honey before that has and all you do is stand the bottle in a bowl of hot water and it clears and thins out.
The depth of flavour is very good. I use it in all my healthy baked goods.
We really like this cacao. We use it in smoothies and for bliss balls. A lovely natural chocolate flavour.
I found this cacao dry and when I blended it with water, it didn't mix smoothly and little lumps remained. Will stick with Food Thoughts brand.
Well worth the money. Tastes rich and healthier and pure. Fantastic added to hot milk or to make cakes.

Like devonrocks do not understand the bad reviews as we have found this product to be excellent in both baking and for hot chocolate. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great taste and a healthier alternative.

I usually buy bonpom cacao from the health food store, but tried this instead. I actually like it and don't understand the bad reviews. I mainly use it to make smoothies, only adding a nut milk & banana to it, and it tastes amazing.
I love this cacao powder - it's the perfect addition to smoothies and full of goodness. Get that chocolate taste without the fat and sugar.

This is very low grade cacao powder. Very weak taste resulting in having to use a lot more than other cacao powders. It should also be noted that it appeared another "fresher" label was stuck on top as some peeled back revealing a more faded older label...any idea what's happened here Creative Nature & Ocado? I feel as though it was on offer to try and shift old produce which was covered up with a new label. This is probably the reason why it does not taste very good! I will avoid this brand in the future.
This cacao is the best I've tried. Rich in nutrients as well as delicious tasting. I use it for baking and it's the best Ive tried. I wouldn't buy another!
Have tried all of this range from moy park and these are definitely the best. Nice crunchy coating with a good level of spice too. Wouldnt pay full price but they are usually on some kind of offer
They’re deliciously spicy and quick to cook. Careful on the cooking time as they’re already precooked. Like a more zingyer burger at home, son loves them.
Quite bland and so very average.
Cheap chicken and breadcrumbs were far too stodgy.
Each one was thick and huge. It tasty so nice with a good kick.
I know I should’t love them but these delicious & just about enough for 2 with a big tasty salad!
The flavour is lovely and a perfect snack but they're a little too dry
A decent spicy kick but too dry for my liking.  Will stick to thighs or wings in future
Tasted like cheap chicken was not keen and would not buy again
These are NOT hot & spicy!

Cooked in the air fryer and they crisped up perfectly with a moist chicken centre.  Great spicy coating served in buns with shredded lettuce and a spicy chipotle Mayo 

Will buy again just like a zinger at home and great value enough for 2

Tasty and crunchy. I don't dare check the nutritional information, but they're fantastic for my "treat myself" mental health.
I dock them a star for two small reasons: inconsistency in size, and they always come in five pieces which is annoying when it's a meal for two.
Very tasty but quick lunch. These strips have a little kick and taste great in a wrap. Only downside is the strips are sometimes very uneven in size.
When cooked the right way, they end up nice and crunchy and not far from freshly made fried chicken. They're not particularly hot or spicy, rather they have a pleasant spice to them.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. Really enjoyed these fillets, quick and easy and has a nice kick!
These made a quick and enjoyable meal, with salad and a few chips, Just the right amount of spice.  I bought them at half price, but I think at the full price they are a little expensive.
Received to review. Wouldn’t usually buy this type of processed fillets. That said, they were tasty twist to a chicken fillet and better chicken then most chicken nuggets.

I was given this item free for a review. I was a bit sceptical to try these as the chicken content is not very high. I always buy fillets with the most chicken in. But i wasn't disappointed in these though. They had a nice crunch, a little kick of chilli and overall tasted ok. won't buy them again though. I think they are over priced. The ones with more chicken are better value. Ok at half price.
I liked the spice level and nice and crunchy texture.  I was pleasantly surprised by them and would buy again
Sent these to review enjoyed by all, nice chicken with a nice zing of spice
We were asked to review and we were not disappointed. They are very tasty, with a kick so probably not recommended for young children but we enjoyed them on wraps. I would have these again.
we received these as a free sample - the grown ups liked them but the juniors didn't.  too spicy was the verdict!
not too spicy lovely crunch

I was sent these for free to review by Ocado. I found these really tasty, there is a good balance between the chicken inside and the coating, and the coating has a lovely amount of spice. Very yum, much preferred them to nuggets!

We were sent these to review by Ocado.  While the spice level was pleasant and not overly spicy for us, there seemed to be a distinct lack of use of salt.  The chicken strip were moist and tender and the coating crunchy though.
Tasty and fairly hot, had them in a wrap and looking forward to getting more to just dip in some aioli

I was sent these for free by Ocado to review.  The chicken was tender but the coating was too spicy.  I prefer more of a Cajun spice where you get flavour & heat.  These just seemed to be hot so are not something I would buy again.
I was sent these mini fillets by Ocado to review.  Very impressed.  Lovely crunchy and spicy coating, good quality chicken and ready after just 17 minutes in the oven.  Great for a lunchtime snack!
Sent these to review found the chicken nice and tender and plenty for 2 people, we had them in a sandwich but I'm not a fan of too spicy food and these were just a little too spicy in ky opinion
Spicy chicken ideal with salad or with a dip.  Would buy again
I was sent these to review by Ocado. Lovely spicy chicken snack. Add to salad, in a roll, on their own. Very tasty and will be buying again.
Im reviewing this product because I got free sample from ocado.had5good size fillets.thevchicken was tender and the spicy coating was nice.would buy again.

I was offered a free sample of this from Ocado in return for a review. I don't often eat breaded chicken type products thinking they are often poor quality and not the best nutrition. Usually quite yummy though! So this was a nice surprise, the chicken was very moist and the coating not at all greasy and almost powdered rather than crumbs or batter. The heat was manageable and the flavour I would say subtle but nice.  There was plenty there for two adults and I would think it's a good size pack for an adult and two children. It coming in various small illets makes sharing so much easier. Having tried them I would now buy these.

I was sent this to review by Ocado. We had these with salad and thoroughly enjoyed them. The chicken is succulent and the coating is nice and crunchy. Easy to cook and can be frozen so handy to have in for a quick meal or snack. They are spicy but I didn’t find it too overpowering- complemented the chicken nicely. Would also be nice with a dip.
I was sent these to review....Whilst spicy these were lovely and made a great snack at lunchtime... my fussy daughter loved them and wants me to buy again!

I am reviewing as I received from Ocado in exchange for a review. We had 6 decent sized pieces in our packet, plenty for my daughter and I. I found the coating quite spicy, although my daughter did not. The meat was nice and tender and the fillets were a good size so would potentially buy again
‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ The chicken was moist but not very spicy and lacked flavour. Breadcrumb coating was crispy.
Nice and tender not too spicy. Loved the crunchy coating
But still a really tasty meal. We had in a wrap.
A nice family meal, juicy chicken and the spices are not too hot
I love the spicy seasoning. Tasty chicken

We had 4 large pieces and a load of crumbs which just burnt quickly in the oven.  Not really enough for 2 adults. We sliced it up with salad for tortillas. Tasty enough.  Convenient that it can be cooked from frozen - useful standby.
Had these in a sandwich which was delicious. They aren’t fancy but they are pretty tasty and a bit different.

Received this to review. Five mostly tender pieces of chicken but sadly a couple had stringy sinews which was off putting. A little too much coating in my opinion & not that spicy but more peppery in flavour. That said they made a nice quick meal for two so would try again but only when on offer.
I received this product to review. Taste and texture was good. Spicy but not too spicy. Made a fab sandwich with soft bread, crispy lettuce and creamy mayo. Yum.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I've been buying Moy Park chicken for a while now but have sadly only discovered these hot and spicy fillets now. They are super tender, the coating is very generous and has a lovely balance between spice and heat. Will definitely be buying them again!

I am reviewing these as I got them free from Ocado. They are not the sort of thing I usually buy. I served them with chips and a large salad and made some spicy mayonnaise and we thoroughly enjoyed this quick and easy meal after having our grandchildren for the weekend. The crunchy coating was tasty and a pleasant texture with a good level of spice and the chicken of good quality, moist and tasty. A good buy when included in 3 for £10 offer.
Got this free for review. It's pleasantly spicy and the meat is tender. Will buy another pack again.
Nice but too spicy for my 15 year old

@Free for review @ Im glad these were sent to me for review because I would have never tried them otherwise.  This made the best chicken sandwich.  They are spicy but not overwhelming.  I think they were raw chicken because the strips were bendy when I picked them up and put in the oven tray.  They cooked up crispy on outside and tender and juicy on the inside. This is NOT the typical dried out precooked chicken tender that I expected it to be. Will be making this a usual. Yum.

Received this free to review. I wasn’t expecting much, but am pleasantly surprised. The chicken was very tasty and the flavours were well balanced. The reason I have taken a star off is because it was slightly drier than what I would have liked and expensive for the quantity when not on offer.

A little spicy (wouldn't describe as Hot and Spicy, maybe Medium!) and the breading has a nice flavour, the chicken is as you'd expect really for this kind of product. The breading is quite dense so can be a little dry. A dip, a dressing or used in a stir fry (once oven cooked) alleviates those issues.
Tasteless and dry bits of chewy chicken
Eat with a dip or you'll find they're too dry on their own

We love the Moy Park Kievs and I thought we would try these.  You don't get as much for your money and although the spicy flavour was pleasant I thought there was too much coating rendering the whole thing a little dry.  I won't buy again.
these are really yummy, lovey spicy crispy coating and good chicken. you only get 5 in a pack but will get them again on offer. they can be frozen and cooked from frozen too which is handy
Bought these for the first time and I love them! Crispy, crunchy coating and good quality chicken. They have a kick, but they wont knock you out. Two peppers for the spice level

Got these in the flash sale. Got 6 fillets, cooked quickly and the chicken had a nice texture. The breading was quite spicy which was nice, but did not have much flavour. It was just heat. Would be nice if it had a few more spices.

Nice moist chocolate treats.
Very expensive at almost £1 per cake though.

Nice little cupcakes. Moist and light sponge with plenty of buttercream. Perfect with a cup of tea or coffee. A little too sweet in my opinion but my daughter really enjoyed them. Good quality product.
These are absolutely delicious chocolates cakes for any chocoholics who want a chocolate fix. Nice and moist sponge, plenty of topping and little chocolate chunks on the top are a bonus
These are quite good for getting your chocolate fix but expensive for just 4 cupcakes.
These were moist with a nice Cadbury chocolate taste, but far too sweet and tasted rather artificial, so as expected really.
These are great for a treat but could only eat half in one go as they're quite sweet and buttercream a bit sickly. However they were lovely and moist and went down a treat with kids
I home bake, so my family found these too artificial. One is still sat in the box going out of date. Moist with right amount of cream and fun decoration, but not for us.
I found these nice and moist but a bit too sweet.

Tempted by these on the weekly shop and promised myself I'd only have one this week to be 'good'. However, I got home and completely demolished these with my (very happy) husband as they are an absolute delight!
Very sweet, delicious chocolate cupcakes which taste really good, but as expected.

I don’t usually choose to eat chocolate cakes, but I enjoyed these; the frosting on top was moist and I loved the chunks of chocolate. I might not buy again as I find chocolate too rich, but would recommend.
Good decent sized cupcakes - good soft sponge through the whole cake and had a decent amount of chocolate  topping and chocolate pieces

The sponge is light and fluffy for these and plenty of buttercream-almost too much. Chocolate chunks on top were very nice. Tiny bit too dark chocolate flavoured than milk chocolate but very nice overall
Bit small, bite size but good for a kids lunch box i suppose. Tastes alright
Really moist cakes and the topping isn’t too sweet. Very chocolatey as you’d expect!
These Cadbury's cupcakes are delicious, lovely light sponge. A perfect treat.
OMG!  These are divine. Ate the whole 4 pack in 1 go. Indulgent and decadent but who cares. You only live once. Yummy!
These cupcakes are top notch. Soft chocolate sponge topped with chocolate buttercream icing, topped with chocolate chunks. Triplechoc delight.
Lovely cupcakes, very sweet and chocolaty taste. Perfect with cup of coffee.
Lovely soft light sponge and nice texture. Lots of tasty cream and good chocolate flavour. Could be bigger!
It’s a really soft, light sponge that has just the right amount of sugar. The right amount of icing that tastes exactly like Diary Milk chocolate and is really smooth.
Really nice spongey cake and very generous with the icing. Great for a snack with a cup of tea. Not sure they are worth the price tag but yummy nonetheless!
I found this has too much icing
Quite sweet but really nice with a cup of tea.
Was so disappointed with these given the rating. The butter cream had a very chemical smell and taste. Definitely never again
We enjoyed these, yes there is a lot of icing but we liked it :) the cakes were a little small but very tasty.
These could be great, but unfortunately there is more icing than cake and this makes it very sweet and sickly. Such a shame since the cake is very nice and moist.
Really good, could do with this in a larger packet please ocado!
Thick slices, firm and not too sweet. Easy packaging. Already reordered.
I expect to be disappointed by smoked salmon. However, I found this to be extremely good indeed. It wasn’t sweaty, flabby or grainy like so many products are. Highly recommend.
Tasty, good texture and perfect on Blinis for Christmas Day. Will definitely buy again

Added sprinkling of Dulce adds gentle kick to the mellow, beautifully balanced smokiness, of the salmon. Not oily. Without doubt our favourite and friends remarked on the flavour - served as canapé on rounds of light cream cheese on pumpernickel.
So happy with this new addition on ocado. The salmon is very good quality, and an interesting flavour (in a good way!)
I don't eat smoked salmon. I bought this for the rest of the family and they said it was really good. So i guess I'll be buying it again.
Absolutely divine! Worth the purchase. Tastes amazing, sweet, salty, beautiful quality.

Got on flash sale and I am delighted I did. 
This was delicious. The dulce gave a nice dimension.
I absolutely love this salmon, I can easily do the whole pack but I have to stop myself! With Sourdough crackers and cream Cheese its delicious!
I just found this way too salty and and slightly too thick.  Had too drink gallons after!  Apart from that it was good.  But the Duchy smoked salmon in Waitrose still reigns supreme for me.

Nice lean salmon, no nasty fatty bits. Only thing against it, its been previously frozen & I never like to freeze fish that says its been returned to chill temperature. They say its OK, but I was brought up to never re-freeze things!

Best smoked salmon Ive had for a long time. Nice sized slices delicate flavour and top quality salmon - none of those fatty slimy bits you get with other smoked salmon. Will make this a regular purchase - absolutely delicious

I bought this on a flash sale offer, but I will definitely be buying it again! 

It was an absolute hit with everybody. Tasty tender seasoned strips of smoked salmon. Perfect.
Love this salmon really tasty. Nice slices of salmon. we had this with poached eggs on english muffins.
A pleasant, distinctive flavour.

We enjoy the actual tea, but the manufacturing is a disappointment.  The way the string is wound around each individual bag features a small spot of glue, and when unwinding the string to brew a mug of tea, the string often rips the bag (a small tear) and then loose tea floats around in your mug.  A separate problem is that the string often simply disconnects from the bag entirely, leaving the bag floating in the water.
very nice
I enjoyed this fruit tee. It has more flavour than many others and does taste tropical as advertised.
Im not a big fan of fruit teas but this is relatively good. Pleasant perfume and delicate, light taste of the fruit. Refreshing if in the right mood.
Was sent this to review. Have enjoyed this tea. Its a pleasant flavour and makes a refreshing drink
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. We enjoyed these teas.

I was given these teabags to review.  I think they are a luxury rather than for everyday drinking as they are expensive at 22 pence a teabag.  However they are eco friendly teabags.  The fruity smell of the teabags is evident when you open the box and both the aroma and taste are predominantly of passion fruit.  You have a quite a wait for your cup of tea as it is suggested to brew between 5- 10 minutes or longer.  I dont think I would purchase them again as I am not a fan of the taste but maybe one of their other fruity flavours would suit me better
Really nice fruity tea bags. A little expensive for the for me.

Received these to review and as someone who doesnt drink fruit teas did so with an open mind. The aroma was very strong when opening the packet but it was a nice smell. It tasted of the passion fruit and was a pleasant change. Personally I prefer my traditional teas but it was nice to experiment and will be offering to my friends at our next get together.
Smells delicious when you open the box. Im generally not much into fruit herbals but this one was pleasantly flavoured and refreshing

This smells very strongly of passion fruit, and the nice little bags are biodegradable which earns it points. However taste wise, it's a fairly generic fruit tea taste, with none of the strong passion fruit flavour that it smells of. the taste is more orangey and fairly mild although it develops more the longer you leave it. Nothing to write home about for me.

I was given these in exchange for an honest review.  They smell wonderful and have plenty of flavour.  I really like that the bags are biodegradable. The are good enough that I will finish the pack but will probably not buy any due to the underlying taste common to most tissanes.  I always think of it as a dry leaf taste that, to my mind, detracts  from the otherwise very pleasant flavour.
Very tasty, smells lovely! Great that its eco friendly too!
great taste and compostable teabags whats not to like te

The not yet brewed tea bags smells intensely fruity, and once brewed the herbal tea takes a pinkish colour, thanks to the Rosehip.   The packet comes with 15 pyramid shaped transparent bags, and you can easily see all the ingredients there in pieces, instead of them being almost pulverised. This herbal tea to me tastes of the mixture of all the included ingredients which are several, it does not distinctively taste of orange and passion fruit only. The fact that you can also include the used teabags in the food recycling caddy, is definitely a plus.
These have a real premium feel to them. The flavour is very good and makes a very easy, good for you, tasty hot drink. Recommended.
‘I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.’ Nice taste has a definite passion fruit flavour. Nice and refreshing but quite pricey.
really enjoyed this product full of flavour almost very fresh taste

The taste good but not super good.
They said no plastic...
But in the plastic bag??
Nice refreshing fruit tea. Not too sweet. The eco packaging is a bonus.

I'm reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  A lovely, fruity tea with plastic-free packaging.  Pleasant taste of rose hip peels, apples, papaya, oranges and passionfruit. Nice big chunks of apple in each bag and a really sweet, fruity smell. Would make a nice little gift, perhaps with a mug, for a herbal tea lover.
really refreshing and nice flavour.
Really happy about the packaging which is plastic free and this was a massive selling point.  Nice than most other fruit teas
Taste is really lovely. Worth saying the bags are plastic free, which is a bit selling point for me, after the revelation that those 'silk' bags are actually made of plastic.

I was sent these to review. Great that they come in recyclable/compostable packaging and bio degradable/plastic free bags. The smell of the tea is amazing when you open the pack and its whole leaf tea, but I think theres just not enough tea in each bag and so the flavour just isnt strong enough - even when only adding a small amount if water and leaving for longer to brew, it tastes too much of boiling water and couldnt really taste the passionfruit.

Im not usually a fan of fruit teas but I didnt find this unpleasant at all. However my relative who likes Pukka teas says this is too overpowering, and almost false in flavour he didnt like it at all. So there you go!

Ocado sent a free sample of this tea for review.  I drink herbal tea everyday and was not expecting much.  This has a surprisingly pleasant and natural orange and passion fruit flavour, without being overwhelming.    I leave the teabag in and it doesn't spoil or taste stewed.  I would buy it as my experience of orange flavoured teas is that they are disappointing so this exceeded my expectation. A cautionary note on it being gluten-free.  I don't know of any tea containing gluten so this labeling may be seen as nonsense.

I love the smell of fruity teabags!
But the taste rarely matches the smell.
These teabags brewed up to give a nice deep colour and a decent fruity taste. 
Definitely worth trying.
Was unsure about this as thought it might taste like hot Ribena as some fruity teas do, but it doesn't and I love it.  No plastic in the tea bags either so even better.

I'm not the biggest fan of fruit teas:  I rarely find them sweet enough and I never have sugar or sweeteners of any kind, so I need one to be naturally sweet.  I thought I'd give these a go:  passionfruit is a naturally sweet fruit.  I think it's one of the best fruit teas I've tried.  I think it would probably be better as an iced tea:  as it cooled down, I found the flavour came out more than when it was steaming hot.  But, at the end of the day, I'm really a coffee girl, through and through.  I'm glad I tried this, but I'm not converted!
Everything in this packet is either recyclable or compostable - brilliant.  I have only given 4 stars because this flavour was not to my personal taste.
A great fruit tea, lovely balance of flavours and very refreshing.

Delicious fruit tea with small whole pieces of fruit encased in a triangular gauze bag. Gave a deep cherry colour with an apple and mixed fruit flavoured tea. Made a lovely warming drink on a chilly autumn afternoon.
It is rare to find a fruit tea that I like. this is great! fruity, refreshing, very pleasing, no strange after taste. real fruit in luxury bags and no plastic. received foc to review.
This makes the most delicious iced tea!
These are delicious and fruity - I can highly recommend them!
I love the blackcurrant Ribena with no added sugar, and this is a great alternative to have around.
Ended up buying this from our favourites by mistake as it was rebranded to a no added sugar one without renaming so only noticed when it arrived with different colour lid.
I prefer this over the black currant drink. Its so refreshing and a lovely fruity flavour. All the negative reviews are about the sugar content, not the taste. Its squash, whatever.
I know there are some negative reviews but to be fair, we all have different tastes dont we! I love this drink I really do. Full of flavour and really refreshing!
Had 2 bottles as my usual high juice apple and mango was sold out. I struggled part way threw one bottle and got rid on the other bottle
My favourite squash! Great that its sugar free but tastes great
my favourite squash at the moment a taste of the tropics... do wish they did a double strength version as it goes quickly!
tastes wonderful if you use on the day
I use this on the day of purchase for freshness. It is a very convenient option for quick soups. I enjoyed it and it tasted great. Extremely quick and easy.
It made a lovely base for my minestrone soup
This does go off quickly, likely because its chopped up really small. But this is a wonderful base for a stew. Much better tasting than the frozen one.
Used this while making homemade soup and found it ideal.
Horrible and mushy. Seems to go off before the use by date. The frozen one is a lot better.
Arrived mushed and water logged. Inedible and would not buy again.

Frozen version is much better. Last time I used this, it had an odd smell and taste and my soup tasted different from normal (same recipe).Also, much larger ratio of celery that was barely chopped so huge chunks of it. Won't repurchase.
This arrived squashed in the bottom of carrier bag  with bottles of soda water.  Will not buy again.

I would suggest only buy these for darker coloured sauces/ stews. As another reviewer has said as a basis for soups, no matter what other ingredients you use, you end up with brown soup. Tastes ok but doesnt look great. Im a trained chef & I cannot explain it.

I have never had any problems with this soffritto, although it is best to use it quickly. Better than the Waitrose version, imo, partly because of the red onion. Doesn't have the slightly chemically preservative smell of its predecessor.

I think this is a really useful inexpensive product. I wouldnt keep it longer than a day before using it though. It stored well in Tupperware when turned into a Bolognese for a few more days. It cooked well, the vegetables are a good mix and size, and it tasted fresh. Highly recommend.

Very useful as a standby. Saves lots of chopping.  Makes a good base for sauces and soups. However, if not completely fresh can have a strong taste of vinegar and be a little slimy. If completely fresh though, it’s lovely.
...which isn't really a major issue for Bolognese but I did heed the advice of other reviewers with respect to carrot:other ingredients and added more onion to taste.

When I opened the bag I wasn't sure it had a very strange sweet smell that didn't seem right. Then I thought oh it's way in date it will be fine. I ended up with sludgy brown soup and it tasted not right. Lucky I was just using it for a small portion. It definitely wasn't the stock or the veg I added. Wouldn't buy again.

so versatile 
makes a fantastic curry for thr family to enjoy
Always handy to have on standby.
Far too much carrot in proportion.  Not enough of this is onion.  Missed opportunity.
The mix was mainly carrots, but was evenly diced and worked OK

This is a great product for convenience and great for Bolognaise, chilli etc if you dont want to get all the ingredients in and cram the veg in without kids noticing. 
The veg is really tasty.
Sometimes it is finely chopped; other times great lumps.  Bag is often swimming in liquid, which tends to leak everywhere and smells unpleasant.  And as for the red onions...!
I have used this a few times. It is a cost effective and easy solution for making bulk stews,etc for freezing. The veg have always seemed fresh and are cut into even pieces.

Ive used these twice in my own big soup recipe (leftover roast, stock, soffrito, barley and potato).  Both times I have ended up with a dark brown gravy looking soup not the usual pale chicken stock. I can only assume its the red onions. I will have to try the frozen version or pop to Waitrose for the old version.
I use this in my slow cooker, it adds lots of  flavour to a casserole. I actually like the red onion as it gives the dish a nice deep colour.
Disappointed in this one. The pieces are large and uneven which means they are only really good for slow cooking. The frozen one is much better.
Disgusting mushy mess even though they had a good date on. It's either poor quality veg or they are being stored incorrectly in the warehouse.

Not great. Wet and slimy in the bag on delivery (dripping vegetable juice over the fridge) and full of red onions which do not belong in a sofritto and are no good as a base for bolognaise etc. The quality control is also poor- massive chunks of celery that I had to chop up myself (carrot pieces also not chopped finely enough) and also a fair amount of tough red onion skin. Bought as a time-saver but totally pointless

The vegetables are unevenly chopped - huge pieces of celery
There are stray new potatoes that have slipped in 
The pack is full of water
Not up to the standard of the Waitrose equivalent.
Very useful, my only gripe is it's 20% smaller than the Waitrose one.
This is a brilliant product for when you want to make a quick meal. Saves lots of peeling and chopping! I make the Bolognese recipe on the back and it’s quick to prepare and is always a popular meal.

Great tasting base for bolegnese and chilli. Cooks down really well and fantastic for bulking out a dish. All the veggies were cut to an even size which was great as Im not always a fan when the celery is too big.

Would definitely buy again.

With an added sweetness due to the red onions which I haven't seen before in a soffritto mix, well done M n S! I didn't notice there was more red onions than anything else, just v pleased to find a soup pack for ease of cooking soups, stews and stewps on Ocado-there aren't that many!

I have ordered soffritto mix many times before so I got this one as the one I used to get is no longer available... It is bad, poor quality, bad smell and full of red onions, which in my opinion do not belong in a soffritto. I hadn't noticed these in the list of ingredients, as I just ordered it quickly thinking not much can go wrong with a soffritto mix. It actually ruined my dish.
Easily spreadable and tastes great.

I love the taste and it really does spread straight from the fridge. Works well in the frying pan for omelettes and scrambled eggs too. So much nicer than oil based spreads. The one kilo size is good value too.
HAs a higher butterfat content so seems to actually stay on the knife when trying to spread, unlike some spreadable butters. Not to salty and great for baking. Have made some very nice cakes with it.
love this for years since very beginning

Didn't realise I'd accidentally picked the larger tub, but not regretting it! Absolutely huge, arrived well sealed, and should keep the household afloat for butter for a good few months. Love that it comes in a 1kg tub now, and Lurpak is still my favourite brand for butter.
Super spreadable, just like the original

I used to buy this kind of butter but never will again after seeing an utterly butterly lid mouldering in a huge heap of dumped recycling in Malaysia in the war on plastic documentary. Just get a butter dish & keep normal butter out of the fridge. Theres no need for all these plastic tubs to exist.
Its so useful to have this large size in the fridge. The butter is delicious and even though my fridge is set very cold, it never fails to spread easily.
I ordered this size by mistake. Now I get it every time. So handy and we never run out.

Once you go lurpak you never go back. 
Good size. Lasts well. Delicious taste.
Brilliant size and love lurpak.
Too good....spreads lovely...tastes lovely...we all love it...wouldn't buy anything else.
Best butter I've ever bought.
This is really the best butter ever
Great flavour, spreads beautifully wouldn't use anything else other than blocks of Lurpak.
I love lurpak spreadable. Greta to have the big family tub too, however I keep an eye on the 500g sizes as they are frequently yon offer and work out cheaper
Not overly impressed with this, brought as on offer, but found a little bland &did not melt well
Got given this as a substitute and I ways rather skeptical as I always order butter, however I was pleasantly surprised, and now a fridge staple.
lovely butter have always used it, but will now have to consider because of the price.
Why has this become so expensive, used to be under £6!!!
Best butter ever.
Spreads well and reduced salt  recipe is spot on. I have found we are not a large enough family to buy this large size as it starts to go off before it is finished so I buy the small one now.
Cannot go wrong with this butter, best I've tried and have stuck with it!

gift from a friend, I personally tried some Harvey Nichols tea in past year, and this one have the great same good quality, both good package outside and tea bag inside. the favour is also good, overall decent tea
Seem to be paying a lot for packaging instead of content.
I was sent these to review I mean lets get this straight, Id never buy these they are extremely expensive, however, they are rather nice. I was sceptical but they do make a very good cup of tea.
Very refreshing flavour

Sent to review - I didnt enjoy the flavour. 
I guess youre just paying for the name & silly packaging. 
I wonder how long it takes those sturdy bags to actually biodegrade? 
I wont be buying again.

I like my tea really weak, with milk, and these teabags produced it just right, in fact surprisingly weak, even left to brew for more than my usual time.  The bags look similar to ones we have had problems composting in the past, and they are expensive, hence not the full 5 stars.

Don't think I'd ever buy these personally as the price compared to other branded t bags is extortionate but I can't knock the flavour. They make a good cup of tea if you follow the instructions and make a great pressie or nice if you have guests over for a lovely cuppa.

I was sent these to review. The packaging is upmarket and contemporary. The tea bags themselves are those posh cloth-like triangles, much more impressive at afternoon tea than your regular builders tea bags. They taste very mild and light, and don't have a lot of flavour. If you like a robust cuppa then these are not for you so I took a star off for lack of flavour and another off because they are very pricey for a weak tea.  They would however make a posh-looking gift for someone.

These made a nice cup of tea, but to be honest we couldn’t tell much difference from the Clipper tea bags which we normally buy. Since these Harvey Nichols ones work out at about 40p a tea bag, I wouldn’t recommend on a basis of poor value for money. It seems that you are paying for a name with this item.
Lovely posh cuppa

These are top notch tea bags, and my family loved them.  The strength of the tea depends on your preference, but the flavour is always delicious and smooth; without the bitter aftertaste that is common with other brands. Also, these bags are biodegradable   I was asked to review this product and I would definitely recommend it.  I would say that the price reflects the quality.

I am very picky when I make tea insisting that it is made in a tea pot and all that and these teabags are lovely. With a mild flavour they make the perfect cuppa however at almost 40p a teabag they are a little expensive.
I received these tea bags to review.  I became a fan after tasting the first cup. Mild yet full of flavour.  Will buy when on offer,
The box is lovely .You could give someone this  tea as a little gift if they  are a tea connoisseur .Very mild and subtle in taste and refreshing .
Mild and soft. Not for people who like a fuller flavour.

I have recently invested in a teapot with infuser so that I can revert back to tea with tea leaves just like my gran used to make. 

I thought that nothing would match that perfect cuppa tea saved especially for Sunday best. Well these tea bags do match it. The flavour is exquisite and tastes how tea should taste. 

Sadly these tea bags are too expensive for my tastes, so I will be saving them for special occasions.

Was sent these to review. Followed the instructions on the box, and enjoyed a delicious cuppa. As other reviewers have said, they are rather expensive, so will only be using as a treat: a daily treat, that is. Would I buy again, especially if on offer? Oh yes.
I only occasionally have tea so this is a lovely treat.
Having tried this tea it's not quite strong enough for me. The bag it's self is like a silk material and there's instructions on the side of the box. It's a nice cup of tea but far too pricey for me.

This was a great treat. Such a lovely tasting tea. As stated on the box left it to brew for 3 minutes. I found the tea bags were actually good to use for another cup of tea as well. So got 2 uses out of one bag. 
I'd get this tea for a nice treat or as a present for someone as it comes in a lovely box. But too expensive for everyday use

SENT BY OCADO TO REVIEW. 
I love a good cuppa but dont think I can justify the price of these teabags. 
I am a teapot user & I use 2 of my usual tea bags (mashed for 4 minutes) for 3 large mugs of tea. I tried 2 of these bags & ended up with a wishy washy brew. Next time I made tea in a mug following the instructions and not squeezing out the bag. The tea tasted good, refreshing & strong but I couldnt justify the price. I will stick to my usual unbleached brand.
Rich black tea for both morning and afternoon consumption. You can't leave it in for too long or it will be too overpowering. I enjoyed it but would probably not buy again given its relative price.

This tea is nice enough but I can not recommend it because of the price. There are other teas that do the job for a fraction of the price. There is nothing about this tea that justifies the price tag.
So great you could definitely give it as a gift. Very high quality tea.

When I took this item from out of my soon to be returned carrier bag I was so impressed. It felt special, unique and appealing. The anticipation increased as I opened the packaging, read the instructions and prepared my first pot of tea. It was delicious and I savored every drop. The only downside - the price - it's so expensive. It certainly is a treat if you can afford it.

I was sent these to review. I make my tea in a pot and so it did need the 3 minutes brew time as on the instructions to get the right strength for my liking. The flavour is lovely with no aftertaste. These are too expensive for everyday use but I will buy them as a gift to take to a party host.

Really lovely taste (almost worth the price) with satisfying packaging but far too expensive for everyday use! It would make a really lovely gift for someone who loves tea. 

The tea bags are HUGE - possibly designed for a tea pot? We re-used our bags three times in a cup before the taste ran out (the third cup was rather weak but still quite tasty).
Loved the packaging these came in. Felt good quality as well as looking. The tea bags make a good cuppa!! Very pleased with these.
I was sent this free to review. Nice tea but I do think a bit expensive. I would buy again if on offer but probably not at full price
Really lovely refreshing cuppa.The flavour was great and I felt I was sitting in the tea rooms. Unfortunately at this price not going to be a regular buy for me.
This is a very nice tea but too expensive for every day use.The packaging can't be recycled so would not purchase.
I was sent this product to review. It is a lovely tasting tea presented in a nice box. Quite expensive for your every day cuppa!

Nice tasting tea but for the price I was expecting a bit more. It comes in a cardboard box with a foiled label but wasn't quite as fancy as I was expecting. Before receiving I was thinking this could be good for a gift, but seeing it now it's not quite special enough for this.
There is no doubt for me that this is a nice tasting and flavoursome tea, however for regular use, it is expensive.

Beautifully packaged in a very nice box which looks great on the kitchen worktop.  The tea, although very nice, is no more special than the far cheaper tea we normally buy.  It is good that the teabags are biodegradable. Unfortunately could only give 3 stars due to the high price.

Working out at nearly 40p per cup, these bags are singularly not that expensive and would make a lovely gift as the packaging is beautiful.  As an every day tea they are pricey but for a treat I would recommend.  Not too strong tasting, they made a perfect cup of tea.
My wife loves the taste and in comparison to her usual brand she notes the taste is superior. However I had to review as 4 star as the price is on the steep side.

A very good cup of tea but way to expensive
Maybe if price would be lower would definitely recommend
Tried as a sample, OK but taste like Darjeeling Tea. Very expensive too.
These tea bags are very nice - lovely flavour but way too pricey for every day use.  Maybe for a special occasion afternoon tea or a present. Nice packaging.
Great taste , a little strong for me, but a very good cup of tea , i feel it dersevers a china teacup , to drink from, It is expensive but a nice treat ,

I was asked to review these tea bags, they come  in a nice box but there are only 20 tea bags inside,  The tea is very nice, great taste and blend
which makes a lovely cup of tea but the price is far too high for me, I would buy them if they were on offer.

Nice cup of tea in a nice posh tea bag
will stick to my regular brand though due to price
at £7.95 for 20 bags this is very expensive. A nice brew but nothing out of the ordinary.
I was sent these to review.  It's not bad, but I prefer a stronger maltier assam.  At £7.95 for 20 teabags I don't feel I can recommend.

Was asked to review this. Good looking packaging, and posh tea bags. Instructions were leave for 3 mins at least. I removed mine after 1 and it was too strong for me. ( I do not like strong tea)  It was ok, but will keep to my own favourite brand. Not good enough for the price. 7/10.

I was given this to review but unfortunately my coffee machine broke at the same time. So I gave it to my Dad. He enjoyed it and said it tasted fine. Not sure if it was good enough to replace my usual brand.
I received this to review. We thought it was a little ‘thin’ and lacked some depth and body. Not as good as our usual Sainsburys Columbian.
Costa and Taylor Lazy Sunday are my staples but after trying this, this will be added to the list. Tasty and easy drinking. Very, very nice.
I was very pleasantly surprised with this coffee.  It has a lovely smooth taste and makes a perfect latte.  Good value for money especially when on offer.

I received it from Ocado to review. I normally drink 3, roast, so was wondering if it may be too strong, but was nicely surprised. Its very smooth, nice flavour, good for everyday. I love that its organic too. Thank you.
I was a bit surprised at how much we enjoyed this coffee. Nice blend & great in a cafetière.

I was given this to review but unfortunately my coffee machine broke at the same time. So I gave it to my Dad. He enjoyed it and said it tasted fine. Not sure if it was good enough to replace my usual brand.
I received this to review. We thought it was a little ‘thin’ and lacked some depth and body. Not as good as our usual Sainsburys Columbian.
Costa and Taylor Lazy Sunday are my staples but after trying this, this will be added to the list. Tasty and easy drinking. Very, very nice.
I was very pleasantly surprised with this coffee.  It has a lovely smooth taste and makes a perfect latte.  Good value for money especially when on offer.

I received it from Ocado to review. I normally drink 3, roast, so was wondering if it may be too strong, but was nicely surprised. Its very smooth, nice flavour, good for everyday. I love that its organic too. Thank you.
I was a bit surprised at how much we enjoyed this coffee. Nice blend & great in a cafetière.
Nice smooth taste with none of the bitterness you sometimes get. I make in a cafetière.
I am writing this review after receiving a free sample.  Makes a decent cup of coffee without bitterness.
I was sent a sample of this coffee by Ocado.  It is a really good coffee for a cafetière when you are in a hurry.

I was sent this as a tester from Ocado and have enjoyed the coffee. I was expecting it to be a strong coffee as it is labelled as 4 in strength, but this was quite mellow. There is nothing complicated here, no intense flavour or strength, just a decent cup of coffee.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  I have purchased this before and it has a nice strong flavour.  Bonus being organic which I prefer.  Would buy again.
I was sent this for free to review. This both smells and tastes lovely. I've only made it in a cafetière so far, but also have an aeropress I'll try it out with.
unsurprisingly tastes just like the coffee in the Pret cafes which is great as we've moved to an area with no Pret near by!
Got a sample to review, and I am enjoying it. Its not outstanding coffee but its quite good and I have no complaints.
Nice smooth flavour

I am reviewing this product as given a free sample by Ocado . The coffee ground smell was wonderful, and filled the kitchen. The taste , even when adding more coffee tasted weak / bland. Tried this with friends and parents. This is Medium , if you like weak coffee , then do try it.
The flavour is lovely and smooth, however, it's not quite strong enough to be rated 4. I'll definitely buy again to use as an after dinner coffee
I was given this to review. As I normally go for a coffee equivalent of builders tea, I found this too bland. Nothing really wrong with it, just not to my taste
This is a really nice smooth coffee with almost a buttery quality. Not at all harsh. Nice.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I use it in a cafetiere and I am really enjoying it. I've been drinking good quality instant coffee recently (I prefer quite strong, dark roast) but this has reminded me why its worth going to the minor extra effort of drinking ground coffee!
I received this for free from ocada for a review and it did not disappoint very nice and smooth.
Good coffee for a cafetière - a bit course and very clearly tastes like the Pret product, so you know what you are getting! Was sent this to review.

I received this from Ocado to review. I gave it to son to try as I use nespresso machine. He quite liked it but thought it a little bland, but he does like quite a strong brew. Nice that it is organic with recyclable packaging.

I was given this to review. Firstly I am pleased that you can recycle the packaging (it says with shopping bags, so I assume I can give it back with my Ocado bags?). I also like that it is organic, and that Pret support sustainable coffee growing practises. Coffee is also very tasty, so that's a bonus :)
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.   The coffee is very smooth and delicious .  Definitely buy this again !
If you buy a coffee and/or a sandwich in a Pret a Manger cafe, its normally good quality.  But this, carrying the Pret label, is dreadful.  Bitter, sharp and with a spot of soap in the taste.
I actually love that its course, as its perfect for my cafetière. Taste lovely as youd expect from PRÊT.
My biggest disappointment so far,I was expecting a really good coffee but this was so poor I think it was an end of processing, lots of large coffee grains, very little flavour.

I miss my morning commute Pret coffee and was looking forward to trying this. It did not disappoint. Made in a cafetière, it is a lovely medium strength blend that tastes exactly like the  Pret coffee shop coffee.
Both flavours are lovely. Sweet? Yes, but not overly. Having these weekday mornings for convenience. Gets me through to lunch. Will be a regular purchase from now on.
very tasty and ripe

This is the best Brie I have had in years. Gooey, especially when served at room temperature, which it ought to be for maximum enjoyment. It practically spreads on bread and crackers, and while pungent, is full of nuance and flavour. This Brie is top drawer cheese, and I keep coming back for more.
A lovely tasty Brie, as other reviewers I leave out for about 15 mins before using, nice and gooey on crackers or warmed french stick.

It seems some reviewers don't understand what Brie is meant to smell like. This was perfectly ripe two days after delivery. I left it to get to room temperature before having some. Wonderful and runny with a good Brie smell and taste. (Like most similar soft cheeses you do need to keep it in an airtight box in the fridge if you don't want everything in the fridge to taste of the cheese!)

I bought this on a flash sale so I guess it was near the date (haven’t looked!) but that makes Brie of this type even better. I left it out for a couple of hours and ate some with Peter’s Yard sourdough crackers and sweet cherry tomatoes! Delicious! Will buy it again and leave it as long as possible to ripen before eating.
This smelt so bad I couldn't even try it and had to throw it straight away!
When I opened it there was a strong garlicky smell ! Then while searching the wrapper for ingredients I read it was not recommended for vegetarians. So straight in the bin.
Took me by surprise, this is remarkably good. Robust taste, perfectly ready to ripen further or enjoy immediately. Good value, without paying  a fortune
This is a lovely Brie with celery, but a little confused on the box shape around it. Great taste but little in the small side
.... wouldnt get from a normal supermarket. Its 5* for Ocado. If people want to compare it to artisanal Brie or hop on the ferry to France then this is the wrong forum.
Not as good as the Rouzaire Brie de Meaux we used to get from Waitrose, but not as bad as I'd feared it might be! Shame there isn't another unpasteurised brie on Ocado now.
I’ve tried this with many bottles of different guns and it never disappoints.
Perfect Gin mixer love the aromatics

I love this with the fruity gins. Ive tried it with Ophir and It did spoil the taste. Ive just had my covid shot and dont want to take alcohol for two weeks advice period and Ive had this pretending its got gin in it and Im a happy bunny

I thought I would try this based on the reviews but cannot understand how it has had such good reviews unless we had a faulty bottle. It was sickly, sweet and unplesant and tasted like really cheap lemonade. We used Bombay Sapphire gin and it completely ruined it, we threw the last amount away. Will not be buying again.
Great flavour. I’ve only ever had it on it’s own. I’m sure it would be delicious with gin or vodka
Had with some rhubarb gin, it tasted like some sort of wonderful cocktail, certainly not your average G&T!
Love this tonic water in my gin.  No need to mix with expensive gins as this tastes great with any gin.
The best tasting tonic if you like a bitter taste
I realise this tonic just isnt to my taste and not everyone will agree but its the only fever tree tonic I havent liked so far.  Just too bitter for me.  It ruins the taste of the gin.

Tried this for first time over Christmas with my sampler bottles of Gin. I loved it with Rhubarb and Ginger Liverpool Gin as seemed to heighten t he taste in my view although no expert.
I also tried it with no alcohol and it was refreshing and very tasty.
Just ordered some more, highly recommend
Just yum!
.....with Whitley Neill Rhubarb & Ginger Gin, it's amazing. It's even drinkable on its own, it's that good.
.....to me anyway. I find the 'plain' tonic overrated and likewise for the Mediterranean but this one does have something better than average about it which makes it worth the price.
Will be buying again!

I tried this recently with Bathtub Gin and a slice of pink grapefruit. It complements the slightly orangey nature of the Bathtub gin really well and before I knew it the bottle of tonic was gone. It went down far too well. I've also tried it with Langleys and it doesn't work nearly as well - I'd suggest using this with the more exotic flavoured gins and leave the very clean-tasting gins to the elderflower or regular tonic water.
Tried this for something different. Quite a unique taste but gave a different twist to a G&T

Really gorgeous drink - with or without Gin -  
who am I kidding? Adds a really lovely bitter note to a G&T
really nice addition to the fever-tree tonics. especially like the touch of bitters.

I love fever tree tonic but not this one! Rather an odd flavour in my opinion but it's all down to personal taste. Give it a go if you fancy something different but I much prefer the elderflower or Mediterranean
Tried this with Tarquins gin in a bar in Devon and it was delicious - complimenting the gin brilliantly
Lovely tonic water even on its own!
Tried this pink Fever Tree tonic in a G&T - really tasty and not overwhelming.  Looked pretty too. Would definitely recommend.
Stringy and quite unpleasant

Nice mix of mushrooms, and you don't often find girolles and trompettes as well as porcini. Unfortunately even after lengthy soaking and long slow cooking, many of them were still like leather. I know dried mushrooms never regain the same texture as fresh, but that is usually offset by the more intense flavour.  But reluctantly I can't recommend them.
The flavour overall is good but we found that there's far too much almost ground mushrooms that turn unpleasant when added to a pasta for example. Won't be buying again.
Reasonably tasty but not well cleaned as had lots of sandy grains between my teeth. Found that annoying.
Used these to make a mushroom gravy, really nice flavour and they appeared to be cleaned too. A little bit goes a long way so even though they are expensive Id buy again.

These have a fair chilli kick. Tried them both alcohol free and with tequila and absolutely brilliant either way. Not too sweet for me and tasted natural. Cucumber and chilli are distinctive so might not be to everyones taste but for me it gave it a wonderfully Mexican feel.
I found this tasting too sickly sweet with a chemical cucumber flavour.

I received this as a free gift to review. I was a little sceptical but this was very refreshing. I mixed it with a dry london gin and it made a lovely change from tonic. It wasn't massively sweet either.
I enjoyed this much more than expected its as close as you can get to making a margarita from scratch at home and I will definitely be purchasing it again.  The chilli kick is great.

If you’re after a quick and easy drinkie then these are for you. Personally I like the fun of making a cocktail - it’s part of the occasion - but if you’re in a rush this works just fine. Nice on its own too straight from the fridge.
Recieved this as a free sample to review.  Tried it without alcohol and found it too weak, added some lime cordial to give it some zip.  Tried it again with alcohol but again too bland for me.

I was sent this to review by Ocado. At first I wasnt sure what to make of this flavour combination. The cucumber is quite prominent but the chilli is subtle. It was ok on its own but when used as a mixer it definitely improved and made a great margarita that was tasty and refreshing.

Im reviewing this product as I received a free sample from Ocado. Unfortunately this wasnt to our tastes, and not certain I would pay the full price for this product. Although it was quite refreshing during the recent heatwave.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I tried this both by itself and with some (non alcoholic) spirits and both were really nice and refreshing. The chilli and cucumber is a nice profile and a bit different to other pre-made mixers you can get.

Complementary item received to review. Drinking it right now, ice cold, from a tumbler at midnight in the humidity. Dry, cucumbery, with an undercurrent of chilli, so it does taste of what it claims to be. Enjoying drinking it straight, but imagine it works well with alcohol too.
Was given this to try, was not sure to begin with, but they are refreshing, serve very cold.  Can be drunk on their own or as a mixer.

We were given these to review by Ocado and I was pleasantly surprised. Great alternative to tonic as a non alcoholic grown up drink with plenty of flavour, and also good as a mixer. Would certainly buy these again.
Got these to review so we all had a taste.  Wasn’t sure at first but the more you drink the nicer it got, really freshing. Liked them
I was given this product to review by Ocado. I am not a big fan of cucumber in drinks but thought I would give it a go, but the cucumber flavour was too strong for me

Received this to review for Ocado. I didn’t have any tequila so mixed with gin (Hendricks) and compliments it well. Nice and refreshing on its own with no unpleasant aftertaste and no strong chilli bite.

Got these to review.  Not  fan of cucumber flavoured drinks but thought I would give them a go.  If you like cucumber then you will love this but it's  not for me and I will stick to the other flavours in this brand which I purchase regularly.

I was given these for free by Ocado to review. I attended a family bbq for my dads birthday recently and we find the alcohol tends to flow a bit too freely, a bit too quickly so started on some non alcoholic drinks which included these. Served over ice this was incredibly enjoyable and refreshing and I’m sure would be lovely as a mixer with spirits. I’ve marked them down a star simply for the price as they are a bit on the expensive side but make a delicious grown up soft drink.
I received a free sample to review and whilst it was a nice refreshing drink it isnt something I would buy. I couldnt taste the chilli, it was just cucumber.
Lovely taste either with or without alcohol. Really refreshing and no nasty aftertaste. I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado
I am reviewing this product because I received a free sample. I didn’t have any tequila to add to this had it without. Not for me.   Quite refreshing but I won’t be buying any.
I WAS SENT THIS TO REVIEW. I TRIED IT WITH BACARDI AND ON IT'S OWN. IT WAS VERY REFRESHING BOTH WAYS. THE CHILLI IS NOT TOO PROMINENT.
Loved these - so refreshing ice cold from the fridge. Didn't have any tequila so mixed with gin which made a nice change from the usual G&T
Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.  A lovely cucumber flavour and not too sweet.  The chilli was not overpowering.
This is very nice for summer!! Refreshing
Received these from Ocado to review, nice flavour to add as a mixer.  Can also drink on own - very tasty.
I was given these by Ocado to review. Perfect mixer for gin - light and refreshing

I received these as a free sample, and I must say I loved them. Soooooo refreshing, you can't taste the chilli but it's just in the background somewhere. The flavour of cucumber is light but it is there.Somehow it works perfectly. Love it.

Im reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I tried this drink both on its own and with a spirit and found it pleasant both ways. The flavours were easily discernible and would be perfect on a sunny day!
It is a super mixer with gin, very refreshing and hard to believe that there is not a slice of cucumber in your drink.
Given this free to review. Sounded good and tastes great. Not seen a flavour like this before and would definitely buy again.

I received this item for free from Ocado in order to write a review. Quite a pleasant and refreshing soft drink, also tried with a shot of tequila, mmm. I am a fan of Margaritas, and I would say this is a good version.
I would buy for a special occasion or get together/ bbq or something.

I was sent this to review. I really enjoyed the flavour, often soft drinks are overly sweet but this has a pleasant spicy flavour which makes it good to sip slowly. Having said that a slug of tequila would make a good addition!
Sent by Ocado to review, not a bad taste, I added to Tequila and it made a pleasant enough mixer.

I was sent these to review! I do not drink alcohol so I drank these straight haha! They are very pleasant - taste very summery and you can taste the chilli! I imagine they would be excellent for there intended purpose.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado.

I regularly buy the Double Dutch ginger mixers, but I hadn't tried this one before.  It tasted pleasantly of cucumber and was refreshing on a hot day.  It went very well with a drop of tequila.  The chilli was exceptionally mild (almost non-existent) and only came through as a gentle glow a few moments after tasting.

I was sent a free sample from Ocado to review. I really disliked it. I like chilli but this is a bizarre concoction that hits the back of your throat so you lose your breath a little. Not pleasant to smell either. Shant be buying.

Free from Ocado for evaluation. 
Has a surprisingly strong cucumber taste
Particularly enjoyable if served cold from the fridge. Could not taste the chili.

I received these free to review from Ocado. The main taste from these is cucumber. Theres a mild hint of chilli enhanced with alcohol. These are nice and I look forward to trying with different alcohol. Annoying couldnt find my tequila bottlemaybe a new bottle beckons.

I was sent these to review for Ocado. This tastes really good for a drink low in calories. I could definitely taste the cucumber but not the chilli as much, it was really good with tequila, perfect for enjoying in the garden on a hot day.

So if you enjoy that kind of chilli gas where you can breathe, you know, the kind of choking aroma when you fry them too high? Well congratulations to this company whove managed to make that in an actual drink. 
Fake cucumbery, spicy and not pleasant. But thats just my opinion.
I was sent this to review. You could taste the cucumber more than the chilli, If there was more chilli I would buy again.
Got this as a trial sample. Slightly sweet, nice cucumber flavour, although not much chilli. Rather fizzy for me but a nice refreshing non alcoholic drink.

I'm reviewing this product as I got a free sample from Ocado. 

I really like this! Tastes nice on its own, and I've also managed to have it with a shot or tequila and a lime wedge- honestly if I were served this at a bar, I wouldn't think it came from a glass as pre-mixed margarita. Will definitely repurchase.
Tried this as part of a promotion. This is a mixer for tequila but could be added to any spirit. It is actually refreshing as a drink on its own. The chilli is really mild but adds a little heat.
Got this as a freebie to review. Quite refreshing but didn't like the flavour. To be fair I didn't make a cocktail with it, just had it as a soft drink.
I was sent these to review and Im sorry to say that I find them tasteless - no hint of chilli of cucumber. I must definitely wouldnt pay for them. Sorry
These are very close to a favourite cocktail of mine, Picante. The subtle heat of the chilli is great. These make a quick and tasty cocktail. I hope they expand more of the range!
I love margaritas so gave this a try. Its very refreshing with a subtle hint of chilli. I would use as a soft drink rather than adding to tequila as it is sparkling.
