my favorite cocktail is a jalapeno margarita, I got so excited when I saw this tonic on Ocado and had to try it, it does not disappoint, It's really nice to drink without any alcohol but it's not for the feint hearted as it has a very strong smell of chilli and you can definitely taste it too - I absolutely love it - I will try some later with a splash of tequila and a wedge of lime - I've added more to my next order whilst it's on offer!

Proper cold brew coffee on ocado! This tastes great and isn't packed full of sugar and rubbish like your usual iced coffee in a can. Particularly good on the go in the morning. Confused about other reviews on the flavour. It's very smooth and strong, not bitter at all.  A clean caffeine hit without the shakes.
Not great, has that unpleasant bitter taste that fresh coffee gets once it has been left out too long. Wouldn't recommend.

I was sent this to review and I really didnt like it. I love strong coffee but I found this too strong but also watery tasting at the same time. Just very odd. I also had bad stomach cramps after drinking only half the can so its a no from me

Great can size, price point but not strong enough for my liking.  I used  the remainder of the can to make espresso martinis. Worked very well with kahlua and vodka less the froth of freshly brewed coffee.

Was sent this in exchange for a review. On its own is very strong and bitter which was disappointing as I quite enjoy a cold brew. I did make it more palatable by adding a dash of kahlua, kind of an espresso martini.
I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I drink iced/cold coffee fairly often but I think it should be balanced and mellow. This was strong and bitter ;/

I was given this to review for free from Ocado. it is too strong and bitter for me (I do not take sugar in coffees, so would not add any) and also feel it is expensive compared to others on the market.  Not something I would repurchase based on these 2 factors.

Too bitter for me I'm afraid, even with a small amount of sweetening  added. Also I think it is rather expensive. Three of my friends who tried it with me passed the same comments. Doubt I will be buying it anytime soon. Sorry  !!
Maybe it was the chicory but I really didnt like this. I found it quite bitter. It was sent to me for review and I was very surprised at how expensive it was.
Wow! Absolutely loved this! Perfect straight from the fridge or over ice. Smooth taste and bold flavour. Have stocked up now so plenty for warm days!
I was sent this free to review. I’ve never had cold coffee before but enjoyed it, especially on a hot day when you fancy a caffeine hit but not a hot drink.  Nice flavour..

Sent this for review. I drink cold coffees of a morning so was looking forward to giving this a go, its was ok. Stronger than Id normally have and wouldnt replace my daily coffee with it but overall did the trick.

Was sent to review but as I dont like strong coffee, my husband tried instead. He really liked it but said it was a tad too strong.
Definitely one for the strong coffee lovers but really nice flavour!
Sent to review by Ocado, never tried cold coffee before but thought I would give it a try, I found it much too strong and a little on the bitter side.
Very nice to drink on a hot day, contains chicory so maybe avoid if you don't like that taste

I was given this product free to review from Ocado. I have never drunk cold coffee but unfortunately it was not for me. It had a strong flavour and would probably suit if you like cold coffee. I gave it two stars as the packaging looked good.

Got it for free in exchange for a review. 

It is very very nice taste, but please be aware it is not sweetened (pure coffee).

I was sent this by Ocado to review.  I chilled it down as suggested and it just tasted like weakish black coffee with a slightly odd bitter aftertaste which may have been the chicory.  I ended up adding oat milk which improved it slightly but still didn't bother finishing it.  Doesn't do it for me I'm afraid.

I was given this to review and it tastes ok but I personally think it is a bit pricy. It is quite convenient to grab them in the morning and have it on the way to work but I'd rather woke up 5 mins early to make a cheaper coffee myself.
I found it had a nice taste that wasn’t too sweet. Poured over ice, it  was lovely and refreshing.
I am reviewing this as a free product. I used to be a black coffee drinker and like an espress. I found this quite week. Husband who still a black coffee drinker, felt exactly the same.
Love, love, love
Received as a sample. Most cold coffee products are sweet and syrupy so nice to have a straight up good quality black coffee thats not trying to hide behind the sweetness.

I am reviewing this product as I had a free sample from Ocado. Cold brew are a real game changer for coffee aficionado’s
I find them less acidic and they make the most amazing iced coffee’s. I really enjoyed this product, it made a great espresso martini.

I am reviewing this because I received a free sample from ocado. Hmmm it looked like coffee but the taste did not match up. I tried this with ice, it might be a little tastier with a drop of milk. Not for me.
I received this for free in return for a review.  This smelt and tasted lovely.  It’s like espresso, no milk or sweetener.  I would recommend.
I am reviewing this because I received a free sample from Ocado.  This is a nice smooth cold brew.  Refreshing.

I’m reviewing this product because I got a free sample from Ocado. I normally drink coffee with just milk so I did the same with this and did feel like it could have used a bit of sugar. Good for an easy afternoon pick me up but I probably would not buy myself.

A chilly black Bottleshot is just the thing for an afternoon pick me up!  The oat milk version was great with our late breakfast  too.  Can't wait til our next delivery today so we can "keep going".  Love it.
Not normally a black coffee drinker, but I’ll make an exception for Bottleshot! Delicious and healthy treat for a summer’s day!
Such a huge fan of Bottleshot - tastes so much better than any other coffees out there, has a great caffeine kick, and love to see it's now on Ocado - so convenient!!

So happy that Ocado is now selling this brand!
The cold brew is so tasty and flavourful, very refreshing and gives you the perfect kick to start your day.

Nice bread but almost every bite had a stone. 
Wont be buying again .
really lovely but way to many little stones!...

This is a lovely bread and the taste is great however each time I eat it it feels like I am chewing on stones. I have bought this twice as I like the taste but I am afraid I wont buy it again as I almost damaged a tooth this morning. Not sure the bread will be worth my dentist bill. :( Would warn anyone with weak teeth - do not eat this!

I have bought this many times with the occasional mould problem well before BBE in sealed pack. Recently last few loves have grit?? others have mentioned stones. I am slightly put off buying more for a while.
This was the best bread I had with all the goodness of seeds and oats but recently I had small stones I cracked my teeth on! Untill this is resolved I wont buy anymore, shame!
It is a great bread but recently it started having tiny stones. You don't see them and you can break your teeth with those stones.

We've been enjoying this lovely bread for years now, but as of late, there are tiny seedlike stones in the bread. Something must be going wrong in production. If this problem persists I'll stop buying this bread and won't be recommending it.
Best toast ever for a healthy bread. Keeps you regular!

To the person who complained about rapeseed oil. Why?
Rapeseed is a light oil loaded with good fats but far less than olive oil. And rapeseed is one of the largest crops in England. I know this bread is from Poland but my point here is about rapeseed oil. Something has to be used in place of butter and rapeseed is high in omega 3&6.
Why is it a shame to support farmers who grow rapeseed rather than greek or spanish olive oil? Sunflower oil does not work well in baking because it is too runny and has a very high smoke point which means the heat from the oven makes the oil get absorbed into the bread or cake changing the flavour and causing a greasy texture. Trust a baker to know what they are doing especially if the baked item is good. BTW. In general it isnt very usual in Polish culture to toast a hearty grain bread. Have it with a good cheese and an apple or with soup or stew.
Despite great ingredients and flavour, I found this bread is just too chewy. Mouthful of seeds, too dense.
Fab as a substitute for rye bread, but actually very tasty in its own right. Best bread "alternative" I've tried, but if course it isn't going to taste like white wheat.

As someone on a gluten free diet what's normally on offer is some fluffy unsatisfying mock-bread substitute with no gluten but little nutrition, or endless rice cakes indistinguishable from cardboard. Not this. Its not bread in the traditional sense, its way denser and crammed with seeds and bits.  It does toast but not to the crunch that you may be used to. The loaf is small but I find I don't need a lot of it to make a satisfying snack or breakfast, preferably under a layer of peanut butter. It stores well. This will be a repeat purchase.

I tried several seeded breads and none come even close to this one. Its perfect and yes, its full of seeds. Much healthier than other options. It may not be suitable for sandwiches because its crumbly but it can be sliced pretty thin.

Bought on a flash sale- otherwise quite pricey. However I was very impressed with the flavour of this small but dense loaf.  In the toaster it smells of marmite weirdly while heating through- wouldn't want it cold as I think it would be too dense. Lovely with a bit of hummus on and the texture is gorgeous- so seedy and crunchy- really healthy tasting!
Great taste and texture when toasted, plus it's healthy and obviates the need for All Bran!
outstanding rich texture and flavours
far too seedy and very heavy took ages to toast, bought it because it's low carb but it's not for me.
Probably one of the healthiest breads out there...comes second only to Seedful Living as I prefer it presliced. Full of goodness!

This is *so* good toasted with butter and jam or honey and it's great if you have problems digesting most supermarket bread. Also all- natural, really high in fibre, has a long shelf life and lasts well in the fridge once opened... though it probably won't be around long enough to notice!

I'm so sorry I found this bread because I can't stop eating it, it's delicious.  I'm sure it's got wonderful health benefits too, I just love it for the seedy crumbly texture and flavour.  I don't think it would work in a sandwich - pretty small slices - but with soup or some spread and honey, bliss.  my new bad habit.
If you need to take care about your sugar intake, choose this bread. Also gluten free and amazing taste.
And so healthy! Please never stop stocking this bread.
Great bread to have with a bowl of soup!

Delicious, low GI, full of fibre. Could you please try to find an alternative for the rapeseed oil? Otherwise it would be perfect. Given the rapeseed oil, I will not be purchasing this regularly and need to keep looking. Shame.
Thank you for stockings this. I’m avoiding gluten, sugar and yeast. This bread is tasty.

Excellent bread.  I have read other reviews complaining of the price, which has prompted me to write this review.  Discussion of price misses the point.  Proper food has to be more expensive than junk.  One needs to eat less of it to provide nutrition and satisfaction.   Highly recommend this bread.
It's not bread as you know it but if you embrace everything healthy about it, pop it in the toaster, its pretty good

Read reviews, thought I would give it a try, was I disappointed,  all I kept eating was a mouthful of seeds.
gave it to the birds and squirrels, they did not rush, in fact it was in the garden most of the day. Do like bread with seeds/grain, but this was just too much.

We are very conscious about not eating much refined flour or carbohydrate. This bread passes Dr Gregers fibre to carb ratio (must be less than 5) , has a lot of actual whole grain in it , including many seeds , in other words it is not ground up fine and denatured. It also toasts well and is delicious, it is a bit pricey but not nearly as much as the direct comparison of eg Sukrin bread, which we also buy lots of.

I'm not sure that I'd describe this as "Bread", at all. 
It looks very appetising, but when one bites into a slice, the sensation is of a mouthful of chewy seeds, rather than bread.

I'm German and very picky about bread, I love this bread. The only packaged bread that works for me! Incredible how it is moist and chewy without added sugar, absolutely delicious!!! I eat this as a sweet or savoury sandwich and without topping as a snack. Love it!
I love this bread, somehow my gut and overall digestion works better when I eat this bread, unlike any other commercial bread.

This is no doubt a very healthy alternative to bread, plenty of good seeds and fats which create a robust and heavy textured bread. I found it a little crumbly so I imagine works best as open sandwich - quite tricky to slice thin. It worked well with scrambled eggs which softened it and tasted best with salted butter. It had a mild rye flavour and nutty too. If you were celiac this would be perfect, for those health conscious or gluten sensitive this will be perfect. Its expensive for the size of loaf so I might just stick to a normal rye bread and save this for special guests.
This was just a heavy lump of unpalatable seeds and grains.Tried toasting to see if was even passable.It is being thrown out to the birds tomorrow.
Rye grains too big and chunky, flavour ok, felt like a brick, too chewy, heavy, dry and hard work to eat,

...but I do eat this (when it's on offer).  A bit pricey but good nutrient profile and tasty (very dense and seedy).  For info this isn't sliced.  I tend to slice thinly then freeze and use as needed.

I had it with a bowl of soup, it’s ok, but I don’t think it’s anything special. I will definitely try it toasted though. There’s  a review further down, and the person thinks it’s not good that we’re getting this from Poland, in fact we’re not, it’s made by a Polish family who live here.
Could do this at home for cheap not that amazing

This bread really does have a lovely texture and delicious flavor. I have only had it toasted with avacado or almond butter, but toasting brings out the crunchyness and flavor of the seeds. It is a small loaf as it is do dense, but such high fiber content!  A nice guilt free way to get your carb fix!
I usually buy Vogel bread because it has a denser texture and i love the seeds. This bread is infinitely better and toasted  it is heavenly. This is now my go  to loaf of choice. Delicious 10/10
Yummy healthy love it toasted too
Love this bread, nutty, tasty and healthy.  I eat it with Agur blue cheese spread, hummus etc.  Lovely and good life span. YUMMY.

This bread is at the opposite end of the scale to the white pappy ultra processed sliced bread. It is dense and nutty and not sweet. Definitely not dry. It took some toasting because of the moisture levels. It is possible to slice it very thinly because it is dense and I found that made the best toast. Delicious toasted with butter and Greek honey. Also good with cream cheese. I cant imagine trying to make sandwiches with it. My only issue with it is the fact that it is made so far away. It doesnt seem right to be importing bread from such a distance.
I really don't understand all the gushing reviews of this product.  It's too heavy, has an unpleasant texture and no flavour.

I'm a convert! Just tried this toasted - one slice with normal butter and the other with almond butter - and it was delicious. It's great to find a genuinely tasty, moist and digestible bread without all the refined carbs and additives (including iron - for some of us, added iron is really bad for our health).
Surprisingly delicious. A very dense and wholesome bread but once toasted becomes deliciously chewy! Very satisfying. No added yeast or sugar also a bonus.
Love it ! Tasty and healthy :) thank you !!
This is for me the best bread on Ocado, both in terms of ingredients and taste. Unfortunately its out of stock most of the time. Please stock more!

So disappointed as Id bought this bread previously around Christmas and wed really enjoyed it.  The picker must surely have noticed the mould but selected it anyway.  More care please Ocado! 
Id buy this again but direct from the shop so I can check it over.
Very pleasantly surprised by this bread - enjoy it at any meal especially with cheese and pate.  Really tasty

Wow. My expectations were blown away by this bread. I love that the seeds have been soaked and are soft when chewing. The taste is also delicious. Some sprouted breads taste disgusting but this is really the best! Highly recommend for health conscious folks.

Oh I have tried so many different breads, the upshot being I thought I was home and dry with gluten free. No way, my symptoms were worse!And then I happened on this little delight! Yes it is quite heavy and dense, but it is so good for you!  I've yet to try it toasted. It has a good date on it and keeps well after slicing. As another reviewer noted, it also keeps you feeling fuller for longer. Just one gripe - it's out of stock! Please get it back in Ocado!
I found this heavy, very dense and dry.  Much prefer Gail's.  Won't be buying again.
Worth every penny. It tastes great toasted, is full of goodness and we have found it keeps us feeling full and not needing mid morning snacks! Freezes very well too.

Ive made bread similar to this in the past but I really do not have the time to make my own any more so Im so pleased that Ocado are stocking this now. Its got a wonderfully chewy texture and its delicious toasted and spread with crystal sea salt butter and Helt honey with cinnamon.
Best I've tried.  It tastes good, is filling and full of good things and  fibre and no sugar!  Now always on my shopping list.
This is like discovering the Holy Grail! Great texture, very bread-like taste and thoroughly wholesome!
love this bread. filling, delicious and healthy.
Great healthy bread for those avoiding artificial ingredients.  Especially good toasted.  Two slices really fill you up for a long time.

Beware, this bread is addictive. Found it first in my local Waitrose, who sadly seem to have stopped stocking it. I was therefore delighted to find it in Ocado. 
Not your usual bread consistency, basically it is completely packed with seeds, fruit and good stuff. You only need a little bit to fill you up all day. 
My husband is now addicted to it too!

Im glad this has come back, so lovely with a cup of tea. I stumbled upon this when looking for a decent fruit cake and although I wasnt looking for sultana cake, was pleasantly surprised by how delicious this cake was. Rich and crumbly and yes, it can be a bit difficult to slice but when it tastes this good, who cares!
The best sultana cake Ive tasted,juicy and moist and plentiful of sultanas. Fabulous with a lovely cup of tea.

We usually buy the sultana and cherry cake and it is amazing, as it was out of stock we tried this. It is ok but as other reviewers have said it is absolutely impossible to slice, also there are just too many sultanas in it for me and not enough cake!

Well this has become one of my favourite cakes , it is always super fresh and fully laden with lovely juicy fruit which produces a lovely overall texture and taste. 
It is a absolutely superb cake which I would not have any hesitation in recommending.

I don't understand the neg reviews for this cake, it's in my top ten of M&S food. It scores highly with me on quality, taste and price. Lovely texture and packed with fruit, I don't think they could cram any more in! I love slab cakes as you can serve cute little slices to your guests (if you  haven't eaten it all yourself!) and what is better than fruit cake with a nice cup of tea? The slices can be cut to your desired thickness and, as regards cutting, I use a small sharp knife using a slow zig-zag action and get perfect slices every time, no crumbling whatsoever. Perfect! This is a regular in my trolley and I thoroughly recommend it :)
difficult to cut, very stodgy and though the vision of the cake displayed indicates something wonderful , wrong ! it was awful.

What ever type of knife I used I was unable to cut a whole slice in one piece , it crumbled and completely fell to pieces. I finished up with 4 slices and a plate of crumbs - shame for the cake is full of fruit and extremely tasty
Disappointing. Shop tasting cake, not up to M&S standard. Check your supplier, M&S - not up to your standard.
Although this cake was quite nice, it was way too sweet.
Don't like the ginger flavour, but at least not too many unnecessary ingredients.

Tried a few of the Remedy Kombuchas and each has the same artifical taste / flavour, not like other kombuchas. Will steer clear of them in future unless they produce one without the flavour Enhancer and Sweetner.
I absolutely love this Kombucha, it is the best one around by far! The ginger flavour is my favourite but they are all great. Love having a healthy fizzy drink alternative.

I absolutely love Remedy kombucha- the best pick me up when you crave a fizzy drink whilst also being good for the gut! The range of flavour is excellent, our fridge is full of it! couldn't recommend it highly enough
Love this! Good for the gut, no sugar, great taste. What more do you want from a NoLo drink?
I’ve tried a lot of different brands of kombucha and this is by far the best. Low sugar but not at the expense of flavour with a really tasty range of flavours, wish Ocado stocked more varieties!
A firm favourite in our house - great flavour.
So pleased Ocado now stock this! This is my favourite kombucha, it tastes the best out of all the brands I have tried. Super refreshing and no sugar!
If you are new to kombucha and want to give it a try, this is a great one to give a go.
My fav kombucha and I think I’ve tried them all. Tastes delicious and has no sugar.

I could never go back to ordinary houmous after this. Almost as good as the houmous I had in Israel, very similar smooth texture and none of the strange sourness of the own-brand you find in all the supermarkets
I received this as a substitution for my usual brand, and its delicious. Its much smoother than our usual one, and it tastes really good. This is now our new regular brand.
Lovely creamy authentic houmous!
Lovely creamy light consistency. Tastes good without the overpowering garlic you get in many - makes it great for lunch in my opinion, but this every week and use loads.
This is as good as Sabra, very creamy & smooth - perfect for dipping carrots/crisps/pittas!!
If you like the chunkier ones this is not for you but I love this. Really smooth and creamy
This is Middle Eastern style and smoother. We love it!
Worth the premium, it’s more authentic than the cheaper pots, highly recommend but buy two!! Seems smaller than the standard pots
I like this the best from all store bought Houmous' that I tried. It's smooth and tasty, not grainy like others.
This is like the Houmous my Palestinian flatmate used to make. Gorgoeus flavour and silkly textured
My partner has tried pretty much all the different houmous options available from Ocado and has proclaimed this to be the best and his favourite! Very smooth and keeps well.
This is the best hummus you can get in common supermarkets. It has converted two of my friends who thought they hated hummus, to hummus fiends.
I am so glad I tried this, it is now a regular on our shopping ist.
Title says it all.
Really nice smooth texture. Great with toasted pita
This is the most authentic houmous - sauce like consistency, often used as part of breakfast in the Middle East.  Love it!

I was sent this as a substitute for Yarden Aubergine Dip. Our family eat a lot of houmous & aren’t usually that fussy but this really was unpleasant. Very thin consistency (as someone else mentioned, like baby food) & also tasted very chemically. No one in the family liked it so this went to the foxes.
The best pre-made houmous I've tried.  Delicious!
It may be my taste buds that are at fault going by the rave reviews here but I found the texture of this houmous unpalatable. It's overly smooth and quite liquid.
This is the exact same one that I used to have in Israel. Tastes amazing with Challah and has a lovely smooth texture and flavour.
There is no doubt more than one way to make houmous, and this is one way, but we found it unpalatable.  Oily, yet wet and wobbly like a blancmange and with a woody undertone.

I usually like to make houmous at home and tried to replicate this once by shelling chickpeas for 40 minutes to try and make it smoother once processed in the food processor.  I just couldn't get it to go as creamy as the Yarden houmous.  Alas I've given up and now just buy the real deal.

For me, this is the gold standard of houmous.
Some on here don’t seem to like the very smooth texture but I like it so much more than the grainy texture. Great houmous
The best hummus. Smooth and flavourful.
Silky, smooth, deep flavour, you can taste the ingredients. Not the sour taste of other brands. Its good. But very different to other store own brands of houmous.

Its the best tasting one you can get from a supermarket compared with authentic middle-eastern hummus, but agree with other reviews, texture is too smooth and pasty which is a shame. Home-made beats this hands down, but if I cant be bothered, this is a nice-tasting alternative.

The consistency of this houmous is not great - Its mashed up like baby food and has a very over smooth and shiny  consistency. Looks very over processed. Around 10  people over yesterday and I think most people gave it a miss because of the way it looks. Very unappetising. The taste was so so. Have used this brand before,  so surprised about this was a big letdown.
Thick, smooth, creamy and tasty. Absolutely delicious. Wont buy any other now.

have never looked back. Wonderful, smooth, great taste and keeps well in the fridge. Big lover of humous, every tried a houmous sandwich? You don't know what you're missing! Throughly recommend this product.
Did not like this. Too smooth I prefer mine thicker. It was too watery

I've only had smooth, silky houmous like this in a Lebanese restaurant in Bristol and am always craving it. Now I don't need to travel to Bristol! Next to Daylesford smoked houmous, this is my favourite on Ocado.
But its changed and seems funnier and way way too salty now. Such a shame.
Tried this as it was on offer. Very different to the normal humous Ive bought. It is delicious! Lovely smooth texture.
Not to my taste. It was very smooth and runny, almost a syrup consistency.

I hope one day the supermarket chains are brought before some kind of tribunal for their role in convincing the British that hummus should have the texture of damp sand. This is so much closer to the real thing. That said, it does have a bitter note.
Love hummus but this one had a Weird texture very runny no one who tried it at home liked it either
Found this Israeli houmous to be very tasty, like the proper Israeli stuff and very cheap!
One of the best you can get in this country :)

I eat a lot of hummous. Have tried so many different brands & have had authentic home made Hummous by my Israeli friend. This is not Hummous as I know it. Very salty, Gloopy like something artificial was added to extend the shelf life of the product. I maybe wrong about this but it definitely tastes a bit synthetic, salty and Gloopy. Sadly had to throw away!

This was the substitute for my normal hummus.
Very pleased, smooth and tasty, gone in two sittings.
Would order again, not checked the pricing.

My oh my. I love this, creamy and luxurious tasting.
My children are dipping away and making satisfied sounds. Far better than the lumpy dry sort, but expect the difference and make sure you are aware it is the lebonese kind!
can't believe I didn't try it earlier.
It's smooth. Really smooth. Too smooth.

I tried most of the houmous out there: M&S, Waitrose, Sainsburys, etc. This is by far the best houmous. Its texture is perfect and it tastes divine. If you go to a good Lebanese restaurant, this is what you will get.

i was hesitant in buying this product based on other reviews. I needn't have bothered listening to the bad reviews. if you like the chunky dry Waitrose houmous then you will not like this one. this is what houmous made in Israel tastes like. It's smooth and creamy and I can't stop eating it!!
Thought wed try after seeing the positive reviews but it smelt and tasted yuk

Perhaps we've become accustomed to less highbrow tastes; we usually have Waitrose or Marks and Spencer hummus.  

Thought we'd have a treat and try something different, which may be the problem.  We found this to be much smoother to the point of appearing sloppy in comparison.  The flavour wasn't hugely appealing either.  

Always worth trying new things, but this didn't work out for us due to both taste and consistency.
Cannot get enough.
I've tried many brands, and this is the best houmous so far
Perfect for those who do not like the heavy tasting houmous. This was light and creamy and I think it contained a fair bit of water in it which is why it is not 5 star.
Velvety and very tasty. The best humus I've had
Really smooth, great sesame hit, not overly salty like supermarket-brand hummus. Shame about the additives, but the taste is good.
Unfortunately this just wasn't very nice - the texture was suspiciously smooth and the taste was rather oily.
i thought this would be closer to a Mediterranean Hummos but the waitrose hummus has a better taste.
not sure if this is how houmous is supposed to really taste. Texture is unbelievably smooth, but just a bit too bitter for my taste
Love this stuff
very smooth and creamy. Doesn't have a nasty 'zingy' taste that some brands of do. It is just slightly milder in taste but you can still get the garlic flavour through. very nice
Love this hummus, it's so creamy.
very moreish
Lovely taste but really smooth and the texture was just wrong.  Personally I prefer the Waitrose essential, it's all down to preference I guess.
This hummus is one of the best pre-made ones I have tried. Highly recommended!
This is my favourite houmous. It's smooth & delicious.
I always get Waitrose brand hummus, but thought I would try something new. This is delicious! Really creamy and tahini-y! Definitely recommend.
This houmous  is lovely and creamy , the best by far.
The best humous I have tried other than the family homemade variety. Need to make bigger pots as it doesn't last long haha
This is a lovely hummus.  Very smooth and thick. Don't bother with the other brands!
was not impressed with this humous at all
This is one of the families favourite products.  A lovely tasting houmous with a smooth texture.
Our favourite by far. Lovely smooth texture and is a hit with all the kids we have over
not the humous I expected , its a bland paste and a dubious texture . Not for us
This could do with more garlic or lemon and less tahini. It's not dissimilar to smooth peanut butter. It's not unpleasant but lacks pazazz.

Bought this as my usual organic houmous was out of stock. It has a strange gluey-smooth texture and a bitter aftertaste. Nothing like homemade. My kids love houmous but neither would eat it! Ended up in the bin.
We've tried lots of different makes and flavours and always come back to this one as the one we like the best!
I decided to try this based on the existing reviews. So glad I did as its best I have ever tasted (shop bought!).
We loved this hummus. It's very similar to those we've tried in middle eastern restaurants. It's smooth and delicious.
Good, thick texture that tastes lovely on crackers or toast.
well we like it! buy it most weeks it's very smooth and unlike any other we have tried.

We love this stuff because of it's smooth texture. However, guests have either loved or hated it. All of the Yarden houmous range are favourites in this house. It's the only thing of theirs we like. The guacomole is vile. Greasy and nasty.
Did not enjoy the smooth, gloopy texture. Not much of a flavour. Will not buy again.
Brought this for a change as a family of vegetarians and vegans go through hummous at an astonishing rate.  Nice large pot, very smooth and creamy would definitely buy again.
this is the best houmous I have ever had normally the texture of most houmous put me off but this is so creamy and smooth i love it

The best packed houmous we have found so far. Nice creamy texture with a nutty flavour and just the right amount of zingy taste. Much better than a lot of the more expensive varieties which tend to be too coarse. Our kids love it too.
Best hummus you can buy at a grocery store - great texture and flavour!

Tastes OK, but is smoother than I like - fine if you like it that way, but I prefer essential Waitrose houmous, which tastes the same but has some texture  Or Yarden deluxe, which is something else....
This has become a staple in our household. It is much smoother than ordinary humous and tastes delicious! Worth spending a little more and getting this over the basic stuff

Very mediocre ,bland , no sparkle ...  and did not enjoy the texture !
was a substituted product .Certainly would not buy.

Bought this a while ago and loved it but have struggled to buy it since due to it being out of stock. Very creamy and smooth and reminds me of what I ate in middle east therefore feels quite authentic and a lovely taste
Much creamier than the 'standard' hummus. Tastes more like what you would get in the Middle East.

Didn't like the consistency, too smooth.
Rather tasteless.
Not the usual houmous texture, I would describe it as smooth and stodgy, it just doesn't feel right. The only plus side is the extra tahini flavour but still not enough to make me buy it again.
smooth, delicious. Way better than any other commercially available houmous.
I love these but cant justify the price. £5 for 4 small sausages!

Can’t understand the 5 stars given as I couldn’t eat these. The flavour was very strange, like nothing I’ve ever tasted before and the texture was also strange. I’m afraid they went in the bin. Very expensive for inedible sausage. Ruined my meal.
Bought on flash sale, only 4 sausages.  Personally didnt like the texture or the taste.  OH thought they were ok but not great. Each to their own, certainly wouldnt have paid full price.
I love the texture and taste, they cook very quickly in a pan (oven dried them out) shame they are quite expensive so they've become a monthly treat

In my humble opinion, these are the best veggie sausages available on Ocado, and they dont include methylcellulose, which is odious junk that should be avoided. Downside is that they dont really brown up, they stay a bit pallid looking. Work well for hot dogs. Recommended.

They're the cleanest vegan sausages that I've found so far and I have tried sooo many! They are mildly spiced and taste less strong in flavour than others but I am in love with them. I only wish they were at a lower price! If you're looking for the cleanest ingredients because you care for your health a lot or are healing from something, like me, this is it my friend! This por making it yourself, which I also recommend!

We love these in our house. Beautiful, natural flavours and so versatile. Weve had them in sandwiches, grilled with mash, chopped into pastas and in stir fries. Really lovely, but the price puts us off ordering them weekly. More than a pound a sausage is a bit much for most people, even just out of principal.

We love these, and they're one of the few veg sausages that aren't made of highly processed soya (which can cause digestive problems for some).  Vegetarians may also appreciate the sausage-like taste without the meaty texture of the highly-processed types.
Probably one of the vest vegan sausages in the market: gluten free, tasty and with no nasties
If only these were a little cheaper. They are really nice but too expensive to feed a large family! Love the taste and texture.
I'll be much better off to add my own sauce to organic tofu and save a bundle.
Been a favourite in my household for years.  Try simmering these in water.  They really plump up!  Great with onions and ketchup in a bun.
Tasty but the price is ridiculous for the amount!
Fave vegan sausages.

Best sausage I have ever tried. I've never actually tried pan frying and I don't usually grill either I usually put them in the oven for around 20-30 minutes. People may not be keen as they have to be cooked properly until they become very firm otherwise they will not be the same at all. Absolutely love these with a roast dinner and gravy, in some spicy tomato sauce or with a fry up - Just with I could afford to only buy this brand! Definitely recommend :)

These have a nice taste and the texture is one of the better of the various brands I've tried. They are still quite soft inside, reminds me of a chicken sausage, not firm like a pork sausage. If you can accept that, these are a good meat substitute. Have repurchased several times already.
grill it and enjoy it
Hit these as a substitute for the Tofurkey Italian sausages. They’re no substitute. Smothered mine in Reggae Reggae sauce but they were still bland. Please don’t send them again as a substitute.

Taifun products are usually great, but this fails on every account, it's flabby, bland and chemical with a coarse texture.
Not worth 79p, let alone nearly £5 - Avoid at all costs
I like these, but the herb ones are amazing!!! Why doesn't Ocado sell them? :(
Seriously why eat Pigs Anus when you can eat these vegan delicious sausages 😍 our family favourite
Vegans and vegetarians and a meat eater in our house and we all love these. Admittedly they are quite expensive but worth it.
I love Taifuns smoked tofu so thought Id give these a try. They are very bland and have a very spongy and soft texture. Not keen at all and I wont be buying again.
Nice, organic, nothing nasty in them like Linda McCartney sausages! Easy weeknight dinner!

Look, it's made of tofu and trying to be a sausage so it's not going to be perfect. I fried these off before putting them in a casserole. Even after frying and getting the outside crispy, the inside was bouncy like drained tofu. However the flavour was nice! Chucking them into a casserole dish and pouring fluid on didn't help as they soaked it up as it cooked in the oven but it was just the texture of tofu which wasn't horrendous. The dish came out lovely with mash!
This is ok, bland with a texture that is a bit odd. I did not love it but it is an acceptable meat alternative but the flavour is lacking.
Weve been buying these from Ocado for years now. They are the best vegan sausage! Absolutely perfect!!
Best organic tofu sausages, but expensive - hence four stars only.
I liked the texture of these sausages but they are very salty so I wont be buying again. The saltiness overpowered any other flavour in the dish.
think these are overpriced for what they are? you can get a block of tofu for a lot less...
Works perfectly for a grill party!
Great texture, nicest when halved and browned in a pan.
It was like I was eating foam! Upset tummy afterwards. Yuk. Don't buy.
Our local independent health shops all sell these for maximum £3.99 so why is Ocado charging more?
These are great tofu based sausages. They have almost doubled in price though! Shame. 5 stars for taste and nutrition, 2 stars off for greedy pricing.
Very tasty with no nasty ingredients.

I love Taifun Feto Fermented tofu and Taifun plain tofu so I tried these. They are delicious, with a lovely spicy aromatic flavour. I enjoy them with Biona Organic Vegan Worcester Sauce, Biona Organic Tomato Ketchup and Daylesford Organic Wholegrain Mustard.
I grilled these and had them cold in a salad. Personally I found them too salty for my taste and wouldn't buy again
My kids love these.  I like that they're tofu based - they seem healthier than other brands that use soy protein isolate. My kids love them with just mustard.

Purchased these sausages by accident (was after the frankfurters) but was pleasantly surprised by how tasty they were. Opinion differed from all who had a taste - some said they were great, some said they were a bit too spicy and some just didn't like the texture, hence getting 4*s and not 5. I personally thought they were delicious, worth a try!
Best vegan sausages so far

I found that they didn't taste like sausages at all to me,
I really noticed that the texture seemed much more like tofu which I don't really like,
i really like this brands vegan frankfurters though! yum!
The whole family enjoy these. I lightly fry them, they're well seasoned and nice texture.
I like to grill them and use wholegrain mustard as  a relish.
Great organic sausages! With Hummus they're delicious.
I'm all for a meat-free sausage, but these were not nice to eat at all, no flavour of their own and even with tasty accompaniments the texture detracted from an otherwise nice meal!

Tofu is a favourite in our house, but unfortunately there is both a strange texture and taste to these sausages. The skin is very dry and separated from the rest of the sausage so that the result was a cardboardy skin on a soft, chemical tasting mess underneath.
Simple to cook, tasty and healthy. I buy them regularly and love them.

Filling, tasty, versatile, healthy. A great product. As a celiac, with lactose intolerance and a long term vegetarian there are limited ready made foods that I can buy, so imagine my joy when I found these! Even without dietary limitations these would be great.

Had these on the BBQ last night. I liked the way they stayed springy but they are light and insubstantial, like a frankfurter, or like very cheap meat based sausages that are mainly rusk. I liked the flavour but I'll be trying some other brands too.
I actually eat these cold. They are lovely chopped up in a salad. They are a bit pricey but nice.
Nothing special. Won't be buying them again.

Have used these chopped up in stews, salads, risotto etc as well as as sausages. Have also made sausage rolls with them (and had them eaten by a particularly pernickety meat eater). They are quite unlike other veggie sausages. Tasty  deliciousness.
I love these sausages and eat them fairly regularly. They are also very filling.
My favourite tofu sausages

These basically taste like tofu and have the texture of tofu, so it is cheaper to buy plain tofu than this product. They also fall apart easily and don't look appetising. I don't understand why people are saying this tastes like meat, I can only surmise that those reviewers haven't eaten meat in a long time!
Bought these on the strength of others reviews. To be fair, they are quite tasty but I'm not sure that they will be a regular purchase.

These are my favourite sausages and are suitable for Vegans being tofu based great protein source, the kids love them with sausage mash and veggies and onion gravy. I love them in a bagette with fried onions and salad. Quite expensive but they are fairly big sausages.

It literally did. I had two sausages each time in two separate occasions. Both times I felt ill in the tummy and had to drink lots of peppermint tea to ease the discomfort. I'm a vegan and have been eating tofu all my life so I'm not sure what's in these sausages that make me sick. Certainly won't  try them again.
As a veggie, these are a healthy and very tasty regular thing for me. My other half is a meat eater and loves then, too.

We love tofu and had never tried or even heard about tofu sausages - so we ordered these and they were great. We love them! and will be adding them to our next shop too.
Yes they are a tad pricey for 4 sausages, but 1 is usually enough for each of us, so can get 2 meals out of a pack.

Though a little on the peppery side these are very good sausages. I only resorted to them after the greasiness of another brand disturbed me. They are very pale looking, but it's food, it's for eating not admiring. I found frying in a bit of water works best, don't dry fry unless you are very attentive or enjoy scrubbing pans.

I really enjoy these 'sausages', i fry in a pan with a smidge of oil so outer skin is nice and crispy, then either have in a wrap with salad or with salad.  I have yet to try on my meat-eating husband but i can highly recommend for a tasty lunch.

after seeing all the great reviews, we tried, and weren't disappointed. If you are not a mace fan, you may not enjoy, tho' saying that my partner is a mace worrier who actually loved them!  Nice on a salad, in a sandwich, or cooked and eaten cold. really nice alternative, and not at all 'meaty' - being a long term veggie who is not keen on anything meaty flavoured, these were just the ticket for me.
I found these quite awful. A cardboard casing and strange tasteless filling.
These are probably the best tasting vegan sausages that I've tried, worth the expense I'll definitely buy them again

Do not let the pale colour put you off, these are really great sausages, give them a go.  They do not have any nasties in them either which is great for wheat/ gluten intolerance and coeliacs.  Great quality item, better than another branded vegetarian sausage that's for sure.
I'm not a fan of most vegan meat-replacement products, but these sausages were very good. I fried them in a pan with some mushrooms and tomatoes for my evening meal - absolutely delicious.
I agree, these were really nice. I am a new Vegan so thought i would start with things that were rated highly, and simple to cook. 9.5 out of 10 for me, just wish they had lower fat content.
Great veggie sausage.. lovely flavour... my daughter won't eat meat sausages.. thankfully.. but loves these! so we're both happy
The slightly odd colour of the raw product completely belies the beautiful golden-brown finish after cooking and the wonderful taste. Great product.

I agree with another reviewer that the flavour is not like pork, however it is sausage like.

The sausages also have a "skin" on them which makes the texture as good as the flavour. Can't wait to try them on the BBQ.
Was a bit strange but nevertheless tasty

So pleased Waitrose are now stocking more vegan/taifun products. These are lovely sausages. 
A very light and fluffy consistency and not like any other veggie or vegan sausages on the market. The only downside for me is that I did find them quite salty in taste. And that is saying something as I do like a bit of salt! However, If the salt content could be modified a bit they would be perfect!
They cook well and taste great.
It has a very artificial taste to it, sweet and just a bit odd, I couldnt eat it. Also the pot under a cardboard looking exterior is plastic. So dont be fooled.
I got this free to review.  I found it a decent tomato soup-added some chilli flakes and a squeeze of lemon and found it a really good lunch.
A premium product that tasted better than other soups
I'm not saying this is packed with flavour but perfectly fine with some nice crusty bread or homemade croutons.
I was asked to review this product by Ocado. Very bland and lacking flavour and seasoning.
Received to review. On the sweet side for me but my partner found it tasteless. Adding salt didn't help. An unpleasant gel like texture.
why is it so difficult to make a good soup?
Really unpleasant taste. After a few spoonfuls I gave up.
Real easy sipper for me, my fave out of the selection. Best chilled.

the only issue I have with this is the cans are ridiculously thin! I accidentally tapped one with the scissors whilst cutting the excessive plastic packaging away! 
Come on now! less plastic! keep up!!
I loved the taste of the cherry, but I found the sweetness a bit overwhelming, so I could only drink about half a can.
Nice refreshing drink. Full of flavour
Had high hopes for this but it isn't sour and the level of sweetness is very high.  It also has a strange after taste.  Needs to be better balanced.

I enjoyed this drink a lot. Agree with other reviews, it didnt taste particularly sour to me either, just cherry. It is quite sweet, although I didnt think it tasted of sweeteners. All in all, I liked it and would buy again, especially if its on offer as it is pricier than other canned drinks.
The best fizzy cherry drink. Not  sure why thay say sour, it's not.

I’m really surprised by the nice reviews on this product. I couldn’t even drink one can and my other half who usually drinks all fizzy drinks didn’t like this either. It’s got a kind of musty flavour and has artificial cherry taste to me. I love cherries but I couldn’t drink this at all.
I love this drink, and the orange one they have. Not keen on the cola though !
Lovely drink that is different to the usual flavours out there. A slight hint of the sourness, but the taste is lovely.

These are too expensive for me to buy but they came up in my coupons so decided to give them a try. I’m reckless like that lol. I adore the flavour, I love cherries and sour things so this was perfect. I’ll only buy them again if on offer though.

Remember that sour cherry gum we had as kids? This isnt it. Its good and juicy but lacking in the sour department. I still like it though. 
Seems to come from the Middle East according to the packaging which surprised me a bit given the product info.
totally misnamed - why call it "sour" when it is exceedingly sweet. its a bit too sweet for me although it has a nice taste - not sure why it needs to much sweetness.
The sour cherry flavour here is much nicer than the more sickly cherry flavours of the big brands.  This is much nicer than Green's basic cola.  The sour balances the bitterness of stevia well.
I love it. And I prefer stevia. Its refreshing  to drink

Tried this when I had a voucher, but it was not good and Im so glad I didnt pay full price. It has a strong, artificial sweetener taste, and the cherry flavour leaves a weird aftertaste. I didnt finish the first can, and gave up on the second after a few sips.
I usually get cherry 7-up but this is my new favourite. It's sour without being too tart, just a bit zingy.
I thought I'd never taste love. Well everything changed when I poured this magical feels-like-god-made substance into my mouth.
I now order this every week, so good to have a fizzy drink which isn’t either full of sugar, or has a nasty aftertaste of sweeteners. However, I wasn’t so keen on the sudden price rise this week...
Great taste and low calories... Not overly sweet and a good cherry flavour! Great as a mixer with Gin too...

Can only describe this as fizzy liquid form of a haribo cherry sweet, its fantastic, and doesnt make you feel as full as normal cola. Will be buying more, maybe steer clear of you dont have a sweet tooth!

I tried this one from an introductory offer. The whole family love it. Really low sugar and calories and what a great flavour! This is particularly good with a straw or in a glass over ice. Good mixer too
Sooooo good for so little sugar! Game changing. Love them. Well done Ocado on finishing these!

I do like this.  It has a fairly intense cherry taste which reminds me of that cherry flavour you would get from a Black Forest gateaux but without the associated dessert sweetness. I do not get any sourness from this and while it is not a sweet drink there is some sweetness there that may be negating the sourness.
If you like cherry drinks I think this is well worth a sip.
Sorry, I couldn't even finish a can. My daughter also thought it was horrendous.
Over ice with cocktail cherry this is fantastic. Please don't stop selling it Ocado! Very sour. Please consider making your colas caffeine free - it would make it a staple in our house.
This has kept me away from cola. The only thing Id asked to improve is the carbonation. The fizz is a bit soft.

I am so glad I found this. I no not drink a lot of fizzy drinks but this I enjoy. Straight from the fridge when I am feeling thirsty. Love the cherry tastes, reminds me a little of those little cherry sweets

Very good taste! and without the guilt of either sugar or sweeteners. It's made of stevia and despite some products, or even stevia itself might taste a bit strange, this drink is actually very tasty and pleasant. Recommended

I DIDN'T get the sour cherry taste. I did get the taste of stevia though. I was going through a phase of having a nice cold can of pop in the fridge to quench my thirst and this ruined it. It doesn't do it for me like a coke does.
Lovely fruity flavour - though I would prefer a bit more sourness - and very low in calories.  I recommend it and will be trying others in the range.
Tasty and not too sweet
Had a £1 off voucher and really liked the taste. Like another review it’s not quite sour cherry but still good.

Had a £1 voucher against these recently so thought I'd give them a try - very disappointed really - sickly sweet with an aftertaste that didn't agree with me. Have drunk one, the other five will go down the sink. I do like sweet things - but this just didn't taste right. There are other brands of cherry drinks that are much tastier (available on Ocado).
We loved this drink! It tastes exactly like the sour cherry sweets, so if that’s your thing go for it!
This is not sour and barely tastes of cherry, just sickly sweet general fruity taste. Yuck.

My gosh this is so so overly sweetened, it tastes like cherryade but it's just so sweet I can't stand it and I have no idea where they got the sour part in the name from, I love all things sour, sour sweets, sour beers etc. this is in no way sour. If you like cherryade and have a very sweet tooth perhaps you will like it, but not for me.
Theres a reason this is out of stock- delicious! Lovely cherry flavour
This is just like original cherryade. A great trip down memory lane for me. Not sure the rest of the family were so taken with it though. Great offer too!

No where does this company claim this is cherry cola. It is not. It is cherryade.
If you are seeking a healthier alternative for cherryade and indeed like cherryade.. try this! It's awesome! There's a reason it's out of stock!! But equally sad.. as we love the taste of this.

This is so sickly sweet and tastes really strongly of sweeteners. Masked any sort of cherry flavour. Could only manage a few sips before leaving it. Was hoping to discover a tasty new drink as an alternative to Diet Coke, expensive mistake.
I liked the flavour but found aftertaste not so nice, however my daughter loved it hence the 4 stars I would have said 3

My gosh this is so so overly sweetened, it tastes like cherryade but it's just so sweet I can't stand it and I have no idea where they got the sour part in the name from, I love all things sour, sour sweets, sour beers etc. this is in no way sour. If you like cherryade and have a very sweet tooth perhaps you will like it, but not for me.
Theres a reason this is out of stock- delicious! Lovely cherry flavour
This is just like original cherryade. A great trip down memory lane for me. Not sure the rest of the family were so taken with it though. Great offer too!

No where does this company claim this is cherry cola. It is not. It is cherryade.
If you are seeking a healthier alternative for cherryade and indeed like cherryade.. try this! It's awesome! There's a reason it's out of stock!! But equally sad.. as we love the taste of this.

This is so sickly sweet and tastes really strongly of sweeteners. Masked any sort of cherry flavour. Could only manage a few sips before leaving it. Was hoping to discover a tasty new drink as an alternative to Diet Coke, expensive mistake.
I liked the flavour but found aftertaste not so nice, however my daughter loved it hence the 4 stars I would have said 3
so nice to be able to get it in the UK. Lovely tart taste
I didn't like it. its so sweet, I thought it was a healthier coke and wanted to try.
Delicious on its own or as a mixer with rum.
Best cherry pop since Corona. Hope they never stop selling it. Replaced my diet coke addiction.
Delicious sour charry flavour without being mouth puckering! Not too sweet.  Love it!

Bought this because we like the Green cola and wanted to try the rest of the range. This is great, distinctive sour cherry flavour and no aspartame. I only removed a star because ideally I would like the flavour to be stronger but will continue to buy this nonetheless.

Tangy lemon squidgy sponges.
Good texture
Freezable is they last long enough!

Delicious little cakes with a tangy lemon flavour. Perfect afternoon snack, also good for lunchboxes. Individually wrapped, which is great because they stay fresh that way. Good quality product, would recommend.
Lovely icing on the top, light sponge and zesty citrus flavour and come in easy packs for work lunches
Soft, tangy and sweet these are so delicious and light. I have to eat the whole pack.
Nice lemon taste, if a bit too sweet. Individually wrapped for freshness. Went well with a cup of tea.
I really like lemon flavour in cakes and these didn't disappoint, they have a lovely zingy lemony taste and sponge is nice and moist
These are a firm favourite in a great snack packet size.
I put these out for a family finger food afternoon tea and they went down a storm!
Really nice lemon cakes with icing and a lemon centre which helps with the sponge not being dry.

I love lemon cake, but prefer the lemon flavour to be a bit sharper. This was a bit too sweet but I know lots of people who prefer it like that. Lemon layer in the middle keeps the slice moist, I enjoyed trying these

Strong lemon flavour full of yummyness 
Like how they are packaged individually as it keeps each cake fresh and can eat as many as you want

This has a nice light and fluffy sponge with a tangy lemon curd centre. Has nice lemon icing on top and the zestiness counteracts the sweetness so is not sickly. Nice that they are all in individual lunch size packs so you can just take one cake slice to work for lunch
Lovely zingy lemon taste. I really like this especially with a coffee
Light sponge and a really refreshing lemon flavour. Over packaged with plastic is the only let down.
A lovely soft, light texture. Tasty lemon flavour. Great packaging for lunch boxes or on the go.
Packed into separate packs these single serving lemon slices are a delight. Soft sponge, lemon icing. What more can you ask?
My favourite lemon slices, taste delicious. Single packed makes them very convenient. Perfect for lunch box.
Very light soft texture and delicious lemon flavour. A perfect combination. Just wish they used less plastic in the packaging.
This product is absolutely amazing. It tastes superb and they’re very moreish. I could eat the whole box.
Really lovely refreshing lemon flavour and great they are in individual packets for lunchboxes or on the go
Great tasting,  in separate packets
I am a big fan of lemon cakes and loved these slices. Convenient as comes in perfect portion sizes.
Not sure why this contains palm oil. It is also very sweet so a bit sickly.
handy separate packages - useful for in lunch boxes. We like straight from the freezer in summer & with hot custard in winter.
Not for me. It tasted of what I imagine lemon scented washing up liquid would taste like.
We love these and get them regularly. Nice and refreshing, really good after a curry!  Not too big - good for a bit of sweetness at the end of a meal, without feeling too guilty about the calories.
Dry cake and I've had more lemon and lemon taste in a G&T

Tastes as good as the original packs. It's soft, sweet and lemony. 

I love that these come in separate packets as it's good to pop into a bag for a picnic or day out without taking the whole box. It is difficult to separate but can do it easily with a pair of scissors.

Ever since they introduced this new 8-pack - for the same price as the previous 9-pack, oddly - detaching a slice has been a nightmare.  The airtight seal on both sides of the perforation always bursts and the pack splits wide open.
These were very tasty kebabs and a nice change. Easy to prepare but I did deduct 1 star as they melted off the kebab stick when grilling - still delicious though.
Really delicious and easy to cook. Pesto and halloumi are both quite salty-flavoured things so some may find the flavour too strong, but I think they are really nice.

Pesto and halloumi is a brilliant combination. The instructions on these say grill for 7-11 min I just popped them in a hot oven for 8min and they were great. VERY chunky and filling, best for sharing.
These were very easy to cook, straight under the grill and tasted nice. I have tried the chilli ones too, both are nice.
Tasty and easy to cook.
Served with a nice salad and was perfect for lunch. Definitely recommended
Fabulous halloumi kebabs! The chilli ones were great and these even better. I didnt think theyd be sooooo goooooood! The extra cheese topping made them crispy on the  outside and gooey on the inside.

Really tasty soft halloumi! My family likes halloumi or any cheese really.. It usually quite hard or dry, but this is almost like a mozzarella! I did oven baked, served as a side of steak. Lovely green paste gives moist to the cheese. So my family prefers this than sirloin!
Bought these in a flash sale. Really tasty. They were a surprising hit with my children too. Would buy again.
Love these. Sometimes salt and pepper flavour is too much but M&S have the combination just right in this product. Now a regular on the shopping.
A little faffy in that the sticks fell out during cooking but my son loves them!!!

These are a huge hit with my children. 
As you’d expect with Halloumi, they are a tad salty.. but paired with a fresh crunchy salad they are really delicious.
The pesto in this was lovely! A good purchase in addition to a big salad a bag of M&S grain mix and flag breads. It wont be a regular purchase but it was nice.
Bought these in a flash sale, was very pleased with them. Thought they were very tasty. Would order them again
half a pack isn't exactly filling but contains about three-quarters of a man's maximum daily recommended saturated fat intake.
These are lovely.

I actually cook these in the oven rather than grill them (because often Im cooking something else and dont want the grill on) - makes an easy option for me when Im cooking meat for other family members : once cooked intake off the skewers. Great with salad and new potatoes or pasta and veg for dinner. Also nice in a pitta with salad for lunch. Versatile , easy to cook and lovely flavour
Yummy easy supper with salad and vegetables.
Did them in the oven along side fish fingers for a change. Really tasty and a nice treat.
Really like these and the chilli version! Serve with a salad and jacket potato and an easy mid week meal.
These were great to have at a barbecue, but were a little bit lacking in flavour compared to the chilli ones.

I spread these out on foil and bake them in the oven for about 20 mins (keeping an eye on how they are doing), and when brown turn them to do the other side.  Just as tasty this way as under the grill and easier to turn than in the tray.

lovely alternative for all the family.
don't think haloumi needs added flavour like the pesto, but was still enjoyable. all gobbled up.
I didn't think these tasted of much, the pesto was sadly lacking in punch. More importantly, when I went to pick these up by the stick, it just pulled right up leaving the cheese behind - useless!
I'm loving grilled halloumi at the moment. These were so nice. I'm going to try the chilli ones too.
Great convenient idea but found it too salty and oily. Won't be buying again
Love these as an accompaniment to dinner or a barbeque. Great with a salad. Dont fall off the skewer when cooking too.
Really tasty and when grilled they have a lovely crispy outside.  Definitely worth buying if you like both ingredients!
Just works.  Halloumi just right amount of salt, good texture and pesto dressing sets it off well.
We really enjoyed these, a lovely easy meal which is full of flavour.
Delicious!  Great with some salmon fillets or on their own as a veggie option with flat breads and salad.
These are really tasty. Quick & easy to cook, serve with a Greek salad, Lovely.

I got these on flash sale and served with couscous and roasted veg. Very tasty but salty and has left me reaching for drinks of water. It looks like there is no added salt so purely a function of how much salty cheese in each serving.
Not normally a fan of soft cheese,  but this stuff is simply delicious.  On sandwiches, melted jacket potatoes.  Goes down a treat

Opened a Boursin tonight, tastes slightly soapy and smells strange.  I get and eat this regularly, so disappointed, it is in date, but is obviously off.  Nothing funny in my fridge that may have tainted it either.
Love this cheese so creamy and delicious. An absolute favourite in our house. Perfect size as a little goes a long way.

It's that good. Love it, but the black pepper sku is frequently unavailable - Ocado should try to let customers know this before the inevitable substitution w the standard herb one. Boursin is magical and this product is legendary on a strong wheat cracker. Does not last long in our fridge.
We use this to stuff chicken breaststroke and then wrap in Parmalat ham. Keeps the chicken moist and tastes awesome.

We love this Boursin cheese as a treat. Difficult to stop us devouring the whole pack in one go with either crackers or bread. Yummy if you love black pepper - I find the garlic and herb variety too overwhelming and unsociable if you are meeting up with others the next day. So glad that I can get this through Ocado as it can be difficult to source reliably.
Love this cheese. I prefer this one to the garlic and herb. The pepper hit is just right and great with a thin slice of tomato on top too. Yum!
I get this if I want a change from the garlic one. It's not quite as good, but still great.
Creamy and luxurious. A little goes a long way. Nice and peppery. Great choice for those of us who don't like garlic.
So great. If you haven't tried this flavour, you need to try it! It's brilliant.
Lovely, peppery cheese, great in toast.
It's really nice and peppery with biscuits or used when cooking. Shame there is not more this type of cheese with different flavours.
Absolutely delicious
I love the whole boursin range. This one is great for when you want a boursin hit but can't be stinking of garlic that day or night....
Thanks Ocado for stocking it! Its not easy to find it in the street
I was disappointed with this: it was difficult to handle, the flavour seemed to be missing and there was not remotely enough black pepper to meet my expectations.  Perhaps I'll try cooking it.
This is so creamy and so peppery. I love it!  Great to make into a sauce for steak.
Not many places stock this flavour so thank you Ocado !

Ocado seems to be the only place that I can buy the pepper Boursin and I'm so very glad you do! this is by far the best soft cheese around with just enough pepper to make it perfect. I love it melted in jacket potato with extra black pepper ground on top. delicious.

Really over the top; there's a lot of heat in this cheese. I bought it to have with good quality smoked salmon and bagels. The pepper overwhelmed everything, spoilt the bagels really. Wouldn't buy again - I'll stick to the garlic and herb from now on.
I like to add this to my scrambled eggs and sough dough toast.
My son loves this cheese. However, as it's a big block it goes off quickly. Please Ocado can you restock the mini cubes like you did previously for a short time!
Addicted. With smoked salmon on a bagel - yum.
I like to keep at least one of these in the fridge. Great for an instant savoury snack with crackers. Lovely creamy texture with a nice bite of black pepper
Boursin is good, period. But this one is too peppery for me, I prefer the garlic flavor.
I was disappointed with this cream cheese. There is one that sold on this site  which is infinitely better, a French cheese, so natural  and  delicious.

Bought this last week in a flash sale and it's absolutely delicious!  I've been trying to stop myself from eating it straight from the pack!  There's none of the over-powering garlic taste that you get with some of the boursin cheeses - not that I mind that too much - but you do get a bit of heat from the black pepper.
Great taste,  the slightly crumbly texture is good, but can make it hard to spread

Absolutely scrummy and moreish... Delish with fresh Crusty bread or Carrs Table Water biscuits..

Had a party and this was almost gone with the exception of the wrapper!

Wonderfully creamy and peppery.Great as is with warmed bread but is also a fab ingredient for cooking with.I use it for many things,from a quick pasta sauce to one of my favourites which is combining with chopped mushrooms and stuffing a chicken breast,thats then wrapped in Parma Ham....Yummy
As you would expect tastes strongly of black pepper. I f you don't like black pepper avoid. I love it,

All apples are not perfectly spherical, and nor are all tomatoes. The perfectly spherical ones are the least tasty. Sometimes well aged beef can look to the eye unappetising.  

There is a lot of pepper in this product and yes, it affects the colour.

And the taste is simply out of this world!

Yes its grey and grey food can never look appetising. The pepper gives it  the grey colour. We put this cheese on to crackers as an after dinner course and although the taste was ok the appearance did the product a disservice. We ended up throwing it away. I would say the other flavours are much better.
We love this as a pasta sauce for 2, just melt half the pack into fried chopped bacon and mushrooms with a splash of milk to thin.  Super quick and really tasty treat.
Lovely on it's on or as a base to a sandwich filling. Love it!
We like the fresh taste that clears the palate.
Nice taste, and we like the bits of fruit.
Save 71p at Lidl - Ocado should start price matching with all supermarkets and not just Tesco 🙄
Love this yoghurt for breakfast, always has a nice amount of peach pieces too which makes it more interesting to eat!
We tried this recently as we like others in the range (especially the cherry!). This was insipid flavour with very little fruit.

Although good as a sugar free yogurt however has a strange taste which overpowers the peach fragrance.
Please improve recipe as its such a lovely product otherwise.
Creamy and do taste peachy but a little artificial
Acesulfame K.... an approved sweetener, but whose safety is questionable. No thank you.

I used to like the previous version of this yogurt which contained sugar and sweetener. I hate the taste and smell of most of the sweeteners usually but I didn't feel them from the previous one. The new version has only sweetener, no sugar. It might be better for some points but I'm not completely happy with the new taste now.
Nice flavor. It’s decent long life milk.

I bought this milk for the first time and made the mistake of purchasing 6, in my opinion it lacks flavour than that I've had from other stores, my biggest gripe is the capped lid, it's a nightmare to open, really difficult, if your elderly you've got a battle on your hands just to try and open it!! And the price as well does not reflect the quality of product, try Aldi's one its half the price, has a 2/3 month use by date and its not difficult to open!! As you can probably guess, I won't be putting this on my shopping list again!!

Why this price cost to much dont taste
Better than any sold in UK
nice and good value
Good quality long life milk, nice creamy flavour...I actually prefer this to fresh.

I never liked long life milk before but recently, the expiration date was always shorter and shorter and it was not manageable. We switched to this milk for cooking, coffee and tea and absolutely love it. It makes the drinks creamier than usual and has the same test as our former fresh milk.

My normal go to is the Cravendale semi-skimmed and I’m not a big fan of long shelf-life milk.... but i was happy with this one! No strange sweetness that I often taste in UHT milk. Even my little man who is rather picky with milk has liked it.
I like to pair it with the M&S truffle cream sauce!
Not impressed by the texture of the pasta and the filling. Also flavour of mushroom and truffle does not come through.
Taste and consistency was nice. Will buy again.

This pasta was such a treat. The flavours were well balanced with lovely depth from the porcini and truffle. Cooked for 4 minutes, the pasta was silky and al dente. Simply drizzled with olive oil and some parmesan, it was absolutely delicious.
these are great, we just had it on bed of salad. not powerful truffle, amazing mushroom flavour
These are excellent. With a little Parmigiano grated over them and a big salad with homemade sourdough on the side, they make a nice lunch for two.

These triangoli have a distinct mushroom and truffle taste, nicely filled and absolutely delicious. They are a bit pricey so we get them more as a treat or when on offer. Definitely worth the splurge!

I was hoping for more of the mushroom flavour to come through but the filling is actually quite cheesy and tastes a bit too sweet for what I was expecting. Would be 5 stars if it had a more earthy taste to it. Other than that it cooks really well, doesnt split, and the cream sauce I made adhered well to the pasta.

As others have said, this ravioli is the best I have bought from a supermarket by far.
It is tasty, plenty of filling and doesn't split open whilst in the pan.

I have tried a lot of stuffed pasta over the years and always ended up disappointed.  These they are amazingly mushroomy and so delicious.  A game changer.  Please try them.  I have now ordered one of each of the other fillings.

I got 2 of these in half price sale. We all really enjoyed them with some fresh basil on truffle oil. Full of flavour, I will be getting these again, hopefully in half price sale, but would pay full price too.

I really enjoyed this pasta, it was lovely for a meal for 2. I added butter after cooking as suggested. The truffle flavour was great, but subtle and I think it would have been overpowered with any other sauce. I will definitely be buying this again.
Loved everything about this fresh, well balanced pasta.  I added it to a pan of truffle butter and lightly fried it and topped with mixed fresh herbs.  Will definitely buy it again
As a truffle lover, this triangoli have very mild truffle, while its quite salty with heavy cheese inside.

This pasta is lovely, doesn’t split and fill with water, stays firm but silky lushness.  I fry some garlic in a pan with some baby spinach, add The Pasta Evangelists carbonara sauce and stir all together and then sprinkle with toasted pine nuts and freshly grated Parmesan on top.  Perfect for two hungry adults.  I had some asparagus that needed using up tonight so had that on the side too….. just my favourite thing to eat at the moment….. try it, you won’t regret it
Mild truffle, tasty, good portion

As a truffle and pasta lover I was truly disappointed. Pasta yes it was cooked al dente but far from a great truffle taste plus salt content is high and certainly not enough for 2 people. Wont buy again

These looked great and the reviews were good so I ordered thinking they would make a good quick meal. Unfortunately it didn't occur to me that mushroom pasta might not be veggie and I failed to check carefully. The 'hard cheese' in it is Grana Padana, which like Parmesan is made with animal rennet so sadly I can't eat it.
A very flavorful pasta we lovingly topped with melted butter and truffle oil topped with parmesan. A lovely treat.
These are absolutely amazing! Taste heavenly! So delicious. Extremely authentic. If youre having as a main meal, need to serve 1 pack per person
So many of them split, which is a pet peeve with filled pasta. But the flavour is gorgeous. Would I buy again? Yes. But they wont get a 5 star rating until they seal the parcels properly
The texture of a rubber glove, and the taste of burnt rubber.
This meal is amazing but it contains too much for one person and not enough for two. Please sort it out.
I love anything truffled and this didn't disappoint. I cooked it and then just coated in some melted butter, plenty of cracked black pepper and a grating of parmesan, simple but delicious!
tasty but that's because it has twice the salt of other fresh (filled) pastas...
Nice full flavour and firm filling. Best of all they didn't open up during cooking and spill their contents. Only bought because on special offer. Would not pay £4.49.
Great flavour - nothing to add really!
Really enjoyed these. Lovely texture pasta with a good filling. I just tossed in butter and drizzled a tiny bit of truffle Hunter truffle oil over the top. Delicious!
Lovely tossed in butter with a few sprigs of sage!

This is a lovely mushroom pasta, with a generous hint of truffle. 
Such a quick and easy meal, it boiled in the 4-5 minutes to a lovely al dente pasta texture. The filling is generous and flavoursome. 
Tossed through with wilted spinach and ricotta it was really tasty. 
Good generous portion for 2 people. I will try the other varieties whilst on introductory offer.
We had this with a tin of mutti chopped tomatoes, just for a little sauce.  Mushroomy heaven in soft pasta parcels!
These were really tasty and had strong truffle flavour
I tossed in olive oil with garlic and chilli and was really delicious
I was impressed.... I tried different truffle pastas and they were far as good as this one!!! I added Parmesan cheese and a b butter as they suggested in the instruction. Spot on really!!!
Really tasty and great value
